pthe workes geffray chaucer newlye printed wyth dyuers workes whych neuer print table playnly doth appere cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum pprinted wyllyam bonham dwellynge sygne kynges armes paul churchyarde page duplicate page duplicate pto kynges hyghnesse moost gratious soueraigne lorde henry eyght grace god kynge englande fraunce irelande defendour fayth erth supreme heed church englande irelande amonges excellency moste gratious soueraigne lorde wher almyghty god hathe endowed mankynde aboue resydue erthly creature outward declaration reason reasonablenesse wherin consysteth symilitude man vnto angel dyfference betwene brute beestes veryly suppose speche langage reputed amonges smallest inferiours therby expressed conceyte one another open playne sentence whych resydue lyuely creature lacketh shewed amonges certayn couert derke sygnes sewe thynges hauynge course operacion onely nature thys speche langage confusyon tonges sente goddes punyshment pryde arrogance people hath bene certayne instyncte dysposytion naturall dyuysed inuented sondry partes worlde felowshyppes copanyenges folkes one wyth another chaunced moche outward expressynge thynge worde sounde accordynge wherof meanynge sygnificacyon processe tyme dilygence policy people dyuers fourmes fygures impressyons metal barkes tree mater vsed memorie knowlege thinges present passed sondry letter carectes first amonges phenices dyuysed founde wyth suche knyttynges ioynynges one another marueylous subtilte crafte counterueyled equiuaualent langages conceyte mannes mynde whyche begynnynge vsed declared mouthe onely came suche poynt sensybly vyuely expressed wrytynge hervpon ensewed great occasyon corage vnto shulde wryte compone adorne rudenesse barbariete speche forme eloquent ordynate perfection vnto many many greate poetes oratours haue hyghly employed theyr studyes corages leauynge therby notable renoume selues exsample perpetuel theyr posterite amonges grekes kyndes science semed preuayle ornate theyr tonge yet ryght noble langages perfytelye ymitated folowed latyns exsample grekes haue gotten wonne small glorie fourmynge order vttrynge tonge whyche two yf well serched saye greke latin though corruption speche shulde seme moche otherwyse haue bene deryued ye resydue langages wrytten wyth letter carectes eyther bothe speches whyche moost approche latinite italian spaynyshe tonges whome one corruption gothes longobardes hadde begynnynge latyn spoken straungers barbare vnderstondyng beinge also latyn vandales gothes moore saracenes many tymes blemyshed maruayle se nowe vnto perfection two formed latyn barbare speches reduced next vnto similitude latyn french tonge whyche diligence people fewe yeares passed amended well pronunciation wrytynge englyshe man smale tyme exercysed tonge hath lacked grounde make grammer rule ordynarye therof though trouth whyche shall scarselye beleue germayns haue fourmed order theyr langage moch plentie nere concordauce phrase latyn frenche tonge hath verely lyke rest haue ben thus vigilant studious meliorate amende theyr langages hath lacked amonges v englyshe men whych haue ryghte well notablye endeuoured emploied selues beautifyenge betterynge thenglyshe tonge amonges whome moost excellent prince redoubted gracious soueraigne lorde moost humble vassall subiecte seruaunt willyam thynne chefe clerke kechyn moued certayne inclinacion zele whych haue heare anye thynge soundynge laude honoure thys noble realme haue taken great delectation tymes laysers myght sustre rede heare bokes noble famous clerke geffray chaucer whose workes manyfest comprobacion hys excellent lernynge kyndes doctrine science suche frutefulnesse wordes well accordynge mater purpose swete pleasaunt sentence perfection metre composition adapted freshnesse inuention compendiousnesse narration suche sensyble nd open style lackynge neyther maiesty ne mediocrite couenable dysposition suche sharpnesse quycknesse conclusyon moch maruayled howe hys tyme doutlesse al good letter layde slepe throughoute worlde thynge whyche eyther dysposition influence bodyes aboue ordinaunce god semed lyke daunger haue vtterly peryshed suche excellent poete tonge shuld nature repugnyng sprynge aryse thoughe ben demosthenes homerus tymes whe al learnyng excellency science floryshed amonges grekes ye season cicero prince eloquence amonges latyns lyued yet ben thynge ryght rare straunge worthye perpetuall laude clerke lernynge wytte coulde haue framed tonge rude imperfyte swete ornature composition lykely yf lyued dayes beynge good letter restored reuyued yf empeched enuye suche maye tollerate nothynge whyche vnderstande theyr capacite doth extede haue brought vnto full fynall perfection wherfore gracious soueraygne lord taking suche delyte pleasure workes thys noble clerke afore mencioned haue longe season moche vsed rede vysite bokes dyuers impryntes came vnto handes easely great studye myght haue deprehended many errours falsyties deprauations whych euidently appered contrarietees alteracions founde collacion one wyth wherby moued styred make diliget serch myght fynde recouer trewe copy exeplaries sayd bokes whervnto processe tyme wythout coste payne attayned onely vnto suche seme trewe copyes workes geffray chaucer whyche bene put print also dyuers neuer tyll nowe imprinted remaynynge almoste vnknowen obliuion whervpon lamentynge wyth selfe negligence people haue bene thys realme doutlesse verye remysse settynge forthe auauncemet eyther hystories therof great hynderauce ye renoume suche noble prynces valyaunt conquerours capitayns haue ben also workes memorye famous excellente clerkes kyndes science haue floryshed therin whyche bothe sortes hath pleased god hyghly nobilitate thys yle region christendome thought maner appertenaut vnto dewtye honesty loue countrey ought lesse put helpyng hande restauracion bryngynge agayne lyght sayd workes trewe copyes exemplaryes aforefayde deuysynge wyth selfe moost worthye whome thynge excellent notable shulde dedicate whych conceyte semeth admiration noueltye strangenesse myghte reputed tyme authour comparison pure fyne tryed precyous polyced iewell rude indigest masse mater none coulde thinkynge occurre syns tyme chaucer suffycient maieste royall whyche discrecyon iugement moost absolute wysedome kyndes doctryne coulde hys innate clemence goodnesse wolde adde gyue authorite vnto cause excellent vertues prestant prince humbly prostrate kynglye estate lowly supply beseche woll vouchsafe take good parte poore study desyrous mynde reducyng vnto light precious necessary ornament tonge thys youre realme ouer pytous haue ben anye poynt lost falsifyed neglected vnder shylde youre royall protectyon defence may go forthe publyke preuayle ouer wolde blemyshe deface manye thynges clerely abolyshe lande renoume glorie hertofore compared meritoriously adquired dyuers prynces thys sayd noble yle whervnto nat onelye straungers vnder pretexte hyghe lernyng knowlege theyr malycyous peruers mindes also owne subiectes blynded folye ignorance wyth great study contende gracious victorious god moste electe worthy prynce dradde soueraygne lord merite dewtie successyon renewed gloryous tytell defensor christen faythe whyche noble progenytour great constantyne somtyme kyng realme emperour rome nexte god hys apostels chefely maynteyned corroborate defended almyghty iesu sende hyghnesse contynuall euerlastyng habundauce hys infynite grace amen pthus endeth preface table name workes contayned thys volume pthe preface caunterbury tale cclxi pexplicit boetius de consolatione pall workes folowynge workes selfe dreme chaucher f cclxvij assemble foules f cclxxiij flour curtesy f cclxxviij howe pyte deed beryed gentyll herte fol cclxxix la belle dame sans mercy fol cclxxx annelyda false arcyte fol cclxxxvi assemble ladyes fol eodem coclusion thastrolaby fol ccxci coplaynt blacke knight fol ccc preyse woman fol ccciiij pthe house fame scogan vnto yonge lordes gentylmen kynges house fol ccclxix dyuers balades chaucer c pthus endeth table workes peyght goodly question theyr aunsweres somtyme grece noble region eightclerkes grete science philosopher notable discretion asked proue theyr prudence eyght question derke intellygence whiche answered theyr entent dothe appere playne euydent pthe fyrst questyon erthly thyng best god moost commendable first clerke answered without tarying mannes soule euer ferme stable ryght trouthe nat varyable nowe ala full sore may wepe couetyse hath brought trouthe slepe pthe seconde thing moost odious double man sayd philosophre wyth virgyn face tayle venomous wyth fayre vieu false profre corrupte caryen golden tree monster nature lynage one man haue double vysage pthe thyrde best dower maye wyfe appropriate clene lyfe cleckes aunswer wythout synne chast inuyolate disceytes speches inoruate countenaunce whyche shall dispyse fyre make smoke woll aryse pthe fourth questyon mayde may called clene chastyte fourth clerke answerd whiche alway euery creature shamed lye euery man reporteth gret honeste good maydens kepe chastyte forthe remebre good name gold worth pwho poore man euer full wo couetouse man whyche nygon herte neuer saye ho good lesse distributyon richer worse condityon men cost clepen nygarde sir guy bribour hys stewarde pwhiche ryche man withouten fraude hys good suffyse soeuer hath yeueth god lande kepeth hym clene couetyse desyreth nothyng vngoodly wyse body hys mynde aboue ryche man god dothe hym loue pwho foole seuenth demaunde wolde hurte hath powere myght mykell moche wolde comaude malyce great myght nought thretteth full faste full lytell may dere thynketh nat howe men haue sayd beforne god sendeth shrewde cowe shorte horne pwho wyse man eyght question myght noye dothe noyauce myght punyshe leaueth punyssyon man mercyfull without vengeaunce wyse man putteth remembraunce sayeng venged myne harme cloke nat furred halfe warme pexplicit pto kynges noble grace lordes knyghtes garter wele honour worthynesse christen kyng heire successour vnto iustinians deuout tendernesse faythe iesu redemptour lordes garter floure cheualry men clepe cal lorde vertue grace authour graunt frute rose neuer appal liege lorde haue eke lykenesse constantyne thensample myrrour prince humble buxumnesse holy churche veray sustaynour pyller fayth werryour agayne heresyes bytter galle forthe forthe contynue socour holde vp christes baner lette nat falle yle ben hethnesse nad fayth force vigour yet day fendes crabbydnesse weueth fully catche tyme hour haue v liege sharpe shoure hys seruytude v knytte thralle aye trust protectour constaunce awayten alle comaundeth wight haue hardinesse worthy kyng christen emperour fayth dispute lesse openly amonge people errour spryngeth day engendreth rumour maketh lawe ought may befal obserue wele ye dettour doth god glorye shall stall ye lordes eke shynyng noble fame whiche appropred mayntenaunce christes cause honour hys name shoue put foe vttraunce god wolde wolde eke legiaunce tho two prycketh duite nat kepeth double obseruaunce meryte honour naked style sayth ye foe shame nowe kyth fayth perseueraunce whiche hepe v halte lame christen kyng englande frauce ye lordes wyth alyaunce faythfull people trust god shal quench al noysauce lande sette hyghe prosperite conquest hyghe prowesse tame wylde woodnesse myscreaunce ryght rote repe ye slepe nat goddes plesaunce hys mother sygnifyaunce ye ben saynt george lyuere doth hym seruyce knyghtly obeysaunce christes cause hys well knowen ye stiffe stand ye shal greue grame foe peace norice distaunce nowe ernest tourne game nowe kythe beleue constaunce lorde liege lordes haue remembraunce lorde blysfull trinyte whose vertue mighty habundaunce herte strength faythfull vnyte pexplicit whan faythe fayleth preestes sawes lordes hestes holden lawes robbery holden purchace lechery holden solace shall londe albyon brought great confusyon falleth euery gentylman saye best mannes absence sothe hys presence cometh kynde gentyll blood caste away heuynesse gader togyder wordes good werke wysedome beareth wytnesse finis pthe caunterbury tale prologue apryll wyth hys shoures sote drought marche perced rote bathed euery vayne suche lycoure whych vertue engendred floure zephirus eke wyth hys sote breth enspyred hath euery holte heth tendre croppes yong sonne hath ram halfe hys course yronne smale foules maken melodye slepen al nyght open eye prycketh hem nature courage longen folke go pylgrymage palmer seken straunge strondes serue halowes couth sondry londes specially fro euery shyres ende englonde caunterbury wende holy blysfull martyr seke hem hath holpen seke befell season day southwarke taberde lay redy go pylgrymage caunterbury deuoute courage nyght come hostelry well nyne twenty company sondry folke auenture yfall felyshyp pylgrymes towarde caunterbury wolde ryde chambres stable wyde well eased best shortly whan sonne rest spoken hem euerychone felyshyp anone made forwarde early ryse take way deuyse netheles whyle haue tyme space ferther tale pace thynke accordaunt reason tell condycyon eche hem semed whyche degre eke araye knyght wyll fyrst begyn pthe knyght knyght worthy man fro tyme fyrst began ryden loued cheualrye trouth honoure fredom curtesye full worthy hys lordes warre therto rydden man farre well christendome hethynesse euer honoure hys worthynesse alysaundre full ofte tyme dourde begon abouen nation pruce lettowe rydden luce christen man ofte hys degre garnade syege algezer rydden belmarye leyes also satalye wonne great see many noble armye mortall battaylles bene fyftene foughten fayth tramyssene lystes thries aye slayne hys fo thys ylke worthy knyght ben also somtyme wyth lorde palathye ayenst another hethen turkye euermore souerayne pryse though worthy wyse hys porte meke mayde neuer yet vylanye ne sayde hys lyfe vnto maner wyght perfyte gentyll knyght tell hys aray hys horse good nothynge gay fustyan wered gyppon besmottred wyth hys haubergion late come fro hys vyage wente done hys pylgrimage pthe squyer ij wyth sonne yogesquyre louer lusty bachelere locke crul layd presse twenty yere age gesse hys stature euen length wonderly delyuer great strength somtyme chyuauchye flaundres artoys pycardye borne hym well lytell space hope stande hys ladyes grace enbrouded mede full freshe floures whyte rede syngynge floytynge daye freshe moneth maye short hys gowne wt sleues longe wyde well coude sytte horse fayne ryde coude songes make well endyte iuste eke daunce portray well wryte hote loued nyghter tale slept nomore doth nyghtyngale curteys lowly seruysable kerft hys father table pthe squyers yoman iij yoman seruauntes mo tyme hym lyst ryde clad cote hode grene shefe pecocke arowes bryght sheue vnder hys belt barelfull thryftely well coude dresse hys tackle yomanly hys arowes drouped wyth fethers lowe hys hande bare myghtye bowe heed wyth browne vysage wodde crafte well couth vsage vpon hys arme bare gaye bracer hys syde swearde bokeler syde gay dagger harueysed well sharpe poynte spere christofer hys brest syluer shene horne bare baudrycke grene foster sothly gesse pthe prioresse iiij also nonne prioresse smylynge symple coye greatest othe saynt loye called dame eglentyne full well songe seruyce deuyne entewned voycefull semely frenche spake full fetously schole stratforde bowe frenche parys vnknowe meate well ytaught wythall let morsell fro lyppes fall ne wete fyngers sauce depe well couth cary morsell well kepe drop ne fell vpon brest curtesye set full moche lest ouerlyp wyped clene cup ferthynge sene grece dronken draught full semely meate taught sykerly great dysporte full pleasaunt amyable porte payned counterfete chere courte statelythe manere bene holden dygne reuerence speake conscience charitable pytous wolde wepe yf sawe mous caught trappe yf deed bledde smale houndes fedde wyth roste fleshe mylke wastell breed sore wepte yf hem deed yf men smote hem wyth yarde smerte conscience tender herte full semely wymple pynched nose tretes eyen gray glas mouth smale therto softe reed sekerly fayre forheed almost spanbroede trowe hardely vnder growe full fetyse cloke ware smale corall arme bare payre hedes gauded wyth grene theron honge broche golde full shene whych ther fyrst wrytten crowned amor vineit omnia another nonne wyth hath chapeleyn preestes thre pthe monke v monke fayre maystry ryder loued venery manly man bene abbot able full many deynte horse stable rode men myght hys brydle gyngelynge whystlynge wynde clere eke loude doth chapell bell thys lorde way keper cell rule saynt maure saynt benet olde somdele streyt thys ylke monke let olde thynges pace helde newe worlde space yaue texte pulled henne sayeth hunter holy men ne monke rechelesse lykened fyshe waterlesse thys saye monke hys cloystre thys ylke texte helde worth oystre saye hys opinion good wherto shulde study make selfe wood vpon boke alwaye cloystre powre swynke wyth hys handes labowre austyn byd shulde worlde serued let austyne haue hys swynke hym reserued therfore prycksoure ryght greyhoudes swyft foule flyght pryckynge huntynge hare hys lust cost wolde spare sawe hys sleues pursled hande wyth grice fynest lande fast hys hoode vnder chynne golde wrought curious pynne loue knot greater ende hys heed balde shone glas eke hys face bene anoynte lorde full fatte good poynte hys eyen slepe rollynge hys heed stemed furneys leed hys bootes sowple hys horse great estate nowe certaynly fayre prelate pale forpyned ghost fatte swane loued best rost hys palfray browne pthe frere vi frere wanton mery lymytour full solempne man ordres foure none moche daliaunce fayre langage made full many mariage yonge woman hys owne cost vntyll hys order noble post full welbyloued famylyer wyth frankeleyns ouer hys countre wyth worthy woman toun power confessyoun sayd hymselfe curate hys ordre lycenciate full swetely herde confessyon pleasaunt hys absolucyon easye man pyue penaunce wyst haue good pytaunce vnto poore ordre gyue sygne man well yshryue yf gaue durst make auaunt wyst man repentaunt many man harde herte maye wepe though hym smerte therfore stede wepynge prayres men mote gyue syluer poore freres hys typpet aye fassed full knyues pynnes gyue fayre wyues certaynly mery note well coude synge playen rote yeddynge bare vtterly pryce hys necke whyte floure delyce therto stronge champioun knewe tauernes well euery toun euery hosteler tapster bet lazer begger vnto suche worthye man accordeth nought hys faculte haue wyth lazers suche acquayntaunce honest maye auaunce deale wyth suche porayle wyth ryche seller vytayle ouer profyte shulde aryse curteys lowly seruyse man vertuous best begger hys hous gaue certayne ferme graunte none hys brother came hys haunte though wydowe shoo pleasaunt hys principio yet wolde haue ferthynge er wente hys purchace better hys rente rage couth whelpe loue dayes coude mykell helpe lyke cloystrere wyth threde bare cope poore frere lyke mayster pope double worstede hys semy cope rounded bell presse somwhat lysped hys wantonnesse make hys englyshe swete vpon hys tonge harpynge songe hys eyen twynkeled hys heed aryght done starres frosty nyght thys worthye frere called huberd pthe marchaunt vij marchaunt wyth longe berde motley hygh hys horse sat vpon hys heade flaundres beuer hat hys botes clasped fayre ferously hys reason spake full solempnely shewynge alway encrease wynnyng wolde see kepte thynge betwyxe myddelborough orewell well coude eschaunge sell thys worthy man full well hys wyt byset wyst wyght det stately hys gouernaunce wyth hys bargayns wyth hys cheuysauce forsoth worthy man wythall sothly sayne men hym call pthe clerke oxenforde viij clerke oxenforde also vnto logyke longe ygo leane hys horse rake nothynge fatte vndertake loked holowe therto soberly full thredebar hys ouercourtpy yet getten hym benefyce ne nought worthy haue none offyce hym leuer haue hys beddes heed twenty bookes cladde wyth blacke reed aristotle hys philosophie robe ryche fyddell gaye sa ry phylosophre yet lytle golde cofre myght hys frendes hente bookes learnynge spente besely gan soules praye hem helpen hym scholaye studye toke moste cure hede worde spake nede sayd fourme reuerence shorte quycke hye sentence sownyng morall vertue hys speche gladly wolde lerne gladly teche pthe sergiaunte lawe ix sergiaunt lawe ware wyse often bene peruyst also full ryche excellence dyscrete great reuerence semed suche hys wordes wyse iustyce full often assyse patent playne commyssyoun hys science hys hye renoun fee robe many one great purchasour none fee symple hym effecte hys purchasynge myght hym suspecte nowhere besy man na yet semed besyer termes case dome fro tyme kynge wylliam fall therto could endyte maken thynge coude wyght pynche hys wrytynge euery statute coude playne rote rode homely medley cote gyrte wyth seynt syl barres smale hys arraye tell lenger tale pthe frankeleyn x frankeleyn hys companye whyte hys berde deysye hys complexion sanguyne well loued morowe soppe wyne lyuen delyte euer hys wonne epycures owne sonne helde opinion playne delyte felicitye perfyte housholder great saynt iulian hys countre hys breed hys ale alwaye one better byended man none wythout bake meate neuer hys house fyshe fleshe plenteous shewed hys house meate drynke deyntes men coude thynke sondrye season yere chaunged hys meate hys suppere full many afa e par ryche mewe many dreme many l e stewe wo hys coke hys uce poynante sharpe redy hys gere hys table dor naunt hys hall alwaye stode redy couered longe daye cession lorde syre full ofte tyme knyght shyre anelace gepsere sylke hynge hys gyrdell whyte morowe mylke shyryfe bene countour nowhere suche worthy vauesour pthe haberdassher xi haberdassher carpenter webbe dyer tapyser yclothed lyuere solempne great fraternyte full fresshe newe geare ipyked knyues ychaped nere wyth bra syluer wrought ful clene wele gyrdels pouch euerydele wel semed eueryche hem fayre burgeys sytten yelde hal hye deys eueryche wysdome shape lyche ben alderman catayle ryght ynough rent eke wyues wolde well assent el certayne blame full fayre ben yeleped madame gon vigylles al haue mantel royall yche ybore pthe coke xii coke wyth hem none boyle chykens mary bone pouder merchaunt tarte galyngale well coude knowe draught london ale couthe rosthe sethe boy e frye make mor reys wel bake pye great harme thought hys shynne mormal blynke manger made wyth beste pthe shypman xiij shipman ther wonnyng fer west aught wete detchemouthe rode vpon rowney couthe gowne faldyng kne dagger hangyng lace aboute hys necke vnder hys arme downe hote sommer made hew browne certayne good felawe full many draught wyne drawe burdeux ward while ye chapman slepe nyce conscience toke kepe faught hygher honde water sent hem home euery londe hys crafte recken wel hys tydes hys streames daungers hym besydes hys herbrough hys moone hys lodemanage none suche hul cartage hardy wyse vndertake wyth many tempest hys berde shake knewe hauens fro scotlande cape de fenestere euery creke britayne spayne hys barge called maudelayne pde doctour phisyke xiiij wyth v doctour phisyke thys worlde ne none hym lyke speke phisyke surgerye grounded astronomye kepte hys pacyent full great del houres hys magyke naturel wel couthe fortune assendent hys ymage hys pacyent knewe cause euery maladye colde hete moyste drie wherof engendred humour perfyte practysour cause yknowe hys harme rote none gaue sycke man bote full redy hys apotecaries sende hym dregges hys lectuaries eche hem made wynne frendshyp newe begynne wel knewe olde esculapius dioscorides eke ruffus olde hippocrates haly eke gallen serapion rasis also auicen auerroys damasceue constantyn bernarde gatisden gylbertyn hys dyete meserable superfluyte great nourysshynge digestyble hys study lytel byble sangwyne perce clad al lyned wyth taffata wyth sendal yet easy dispence kepte wanne tyme pestylence golde physyke cordyal therfore loued golde specyal pthe wyfe bathe xv good wyfe besyde bathe somdel dese scathe page duplicate page duplicate clothe makynge suche haunte passed hem ipre gaunte parysshe wyfe ne none offrynge shulde gone yf dyd certayn ryght wrothe al charite kerchers ful fyne grounde durst swere wayden ten pounde sonday vpon heed hosen fyne scarlet reed full strayte ystrayned shoesful newe bolde face reed hewe worthy woman al lyue husbandes churche dore fyue withouten company youthe therof nedeth speke nouthe thryse ben hierusalem passed many stronge streme rome ben boloyne galys saynt iames coloyne couth moche wandrynge waye gat tothed sothely saye vpon ambler easely sat ywympled well heed hat brode bokeler targe foot mantel aboute hyppes large fete payre spurres sharpe felyshyp well couth laughe carpe remedyes loue coude perchaunce couth arte olde daunce pthe person xvi good man relygyoun poore person toun riche holye thought werke also lerned man clerke christes gospel truely wolde preche hys parissheus deuoutly wolde teche benygne wonder dilygent aduersyte full pacyent suche proued ofte sythes ful lothe hym curst tythes rather wolde yeuen doute vnto hys poore paryssheus aboute hys offrynge hys substaunce couth lytel thynge haue suffysaunce wide hys parisshe house ferre sondre ne lefte neyther rayn ne thondre syckenesse ne myschefe vysyte ferrest hys parysshe moche lyte vpon hys fete hys hande staf thys noble ensample hys shepe yaf fyrst wrought afterwarde taught gospel wordes caught thys fygure radde eke therto yf golde ruste shulde yron yf preest foule trust wonder leude man rust shame yf preest take kepe se shytten shepherde clene shepe wel ought preest ensample yeue hys clennesse howe hys shepe shulde lyue sette hys benefyce hyre lette hys shepe acombre myre renne london saynt poules seken hym chauntry soules brotherhede holde dwelte home kept wel hys folde wolfe ne made hem miscarye shepeherde mercenarye though holy vertuous synfull men dispytous ne hys speche daungerous ne digne hys techyng discrete benigne drawen folke heuen wyth fayrnesse good ensample thys hys besynesse yf person obstynate whether hye lowe estate hym wolde shybbe sharply nonis better preest trowe none wawed pompe ne reuerence ne maked hym spyced conscience christes lore hys apostels twelue taught fyrst folowed hym selue pthe plowman xvii plowma brother yladde donge many sother trewe swynker good lyuynge peace parsyte charyte god loued best al hys herte tymes thoughe hym gamed smerte hys neyghbours ryght hym selfe wolde thresshe therto dyke delfe christes sake euery poore wyght withouten hyre yf lay hys myght hys tythes payde full fayre well bothe hys propre swynke hys catel tabarde rode vpon mare also reue myllare sompnour pardoner also mansyple selfe mo pthe myller xviii myller stoute earle ye none full bygge brawne eke bone proued wel ouer al cam wrastlyng wolde haue away ram shorte sholdred thicke gnarre ther na dore wold heue bar breke rennyng wyth hys heed hys berde sowe fore reed therto brode spade vpon coppe ryght hys nose hade werte theron stode tufte heeres reed bristels sowes eeres hys nostrels blacke wyde swerde bokelet bare hys syde hys mouthe great furneys iangler golyerdeys moste synne harletryse well couthe steale corne tolde thryse yet tombe golde parde whyte cote blewe hoode weared bagge pype wel couthe blowe sowne therwith al brought v towne pthe manciple xix gentle manciple temple whiche al catours myght taken ensemple ben wyse byeng vitayle whether payde toke tayle algate wayted hys asshate aye good estate nowe god full fayre grace suche leude man wyt shall pace wysedome heape lerned men maysters mo thryse ten lawe experte curyouse whyche doseyn house worthy ben stewardes rente lande lorde englande maken hym lyue hys propre good honour detlesse yf woode lyue scarssy hym lyste desyre able helpen al shyre ease might fallen happe yet manciple set cappe pthe reue xx reue sclender colerike man hys berde shaue nye euer hys heere eeres rounde yshorne hys toppe docked lyke preest byforne full longe legges full lene lyke staffe calfe ysene wel couth kepe garner bynne non auditour coude hym wyn wel wyst drought rayne yeldynge seed grayne lordes shepe hys neet deyrie swyne hors store pultrie hooly reuys gouernynge couenaunt yaue rekenynge sithe hys lorde twenty yere age coude man brynge hym rerage na baylly heerd ne none hyne ne knewe hys sleyght couyne drad hym dethe hys dwellynge full fayre vpon hethe grene tree shadowed place couthe better hys lorde purchace full riche astored pryuely lorde coude wel please subtylly yeue leue hym hys owne good haue thanke yet cote hode youthe lerned good mystere well good wryght carpentere reue sat vpon ryght good slot al pomel grey hyght scot longe surcote perce vpon hade hys syde bare rusty blade norfolke reue tel besyde towne men clepen baldeswel tucked frere aboute euer rode hynderest route pthe sompnour xxi sompnour wyth v yt place fyre redde cherubyns face sausfleme eyen narowe al hote lecherous sparowe skaled browes blacke pylled berde hys vysage chyldren sore aferde na quicksyluer lytarge ne brymstone borace ceruse ne oyle tarter none ne oyntement wolde clense byte hym myght helpe hys whelkes white ne knobbes syttynge hys chekes wel loued garlyke onyons eke lekes drynke stronge wyne reed blood wold speke crye wood whan wel ydronke wyne wolde speke worde latyne fewe termes two thre lerned degre wonder herde al daye ye knowen wel eke howe iaye clepe wel pope couthe thyng hym grope spent al hys philosophye questio quid iuris wolde crye gentle harlot kynde better felawe shulde man nat fynde wolde suffre quarte wyne good felawe haue hys concubyne twelue monthe excuse hym ful ful priuely eke synche couthe pul yf fonde good felawe wolde teche hym haue none awe suche case archedekyns curse yf man soule hys purse hys purse shulde ypunyshed purse archedekeus hel sayd wel wote lyed ryght dede cursyng ought eche synful man drede cursyng wol slee ryght assoylyng saueth also ware hym significauit daunger hys owne gyfe yonge gyrles diocyse knew counsayle reed garlonde set vpon hys heed great alestake buckeler maked hym cake pthe pardoner xxii wyth hym rode gentle pardonere rounceual hys frende hys compere streight come fro court rome ful loude songe come hyther loue tome thys sompnour bare hym styffe bourdoun neuer trompe halfe great soun pardoner heere yelowe smothe hynge doth stryke flexe ounce hynge hys locke therwith sholders ouersprad thynne lay culpons one one hode iolyte weared none trussed vp hys walet hym thought rode al newe iet dissheuylde saue cappe rode al bare suche glaryng eyen hare vernacle sowed vpon hys cappe hys wallet beforne hym hys lappe brette ful pardone come rome al hote voyce smale hath gote berde ne neuer shulde haue smoth newe shaue trowe geldyng mare hys crafte fro berwyke vnto ware ne suche another pardonere hys male pyllowe whyche sayd ladyes veyle sayd gobbet seyle saynt peter whan went vpon see tyl iesu chryst hym hent crosse laten ful stone glasse pygges bone relykes whan fonde poore person dwellyng vplonde vpon day gate hym money person gate monthes twey thus wyth fayned flateryng ape made person people hys ape trewly tellen laste churche noble ecclesyast wel couthe rede lesson storie alderbest sange oftytorie wel wyst whan songe songe muste preche wel afyle hys tonge wynne syluer wel coude therfore songe meryly loude nowe haue tolde sothly clause state aray eche nobre eke cause assembled company suthwerke thys gentyl hostelry hyght tabarde fast belle nowe tyme telle howe baren v ylke nyght whan hostry lyght wol tel vyage al remenaunt pylgrymage fyrste praye curtely ye ne arette nat folly thouhg playnly speke matere tellen wordes eke chere ne though speke wordes properly thys ye knowen wel shal tellen tale manne mote reherce nye euer canne euerych worde yf hys charge al speke neuer rudely ne large el mote tellen hys tale vntrewe feyne thyng fynde wordes newe may nat spare altho hys brother mote wel saye worde another chryst spake hym selfe full brode holy writte wel wotte vyllayne itte eke plato sayth hym rede wordes mote ben cosyn dede also pray yeue haue nat sette folke degree thys tale shulde stande wytte shorte ye may wel vnderstande great chere made host v euerychon supper sette v anon serued v wyth vitayle best strong wyne wel drynke v lest semely man host wyth ben marshal lordes hall large man eyen stepe fayrer burgeys none chepe bolde hys speche wyse wel ytaught manhode hym lacked ryght naught eke therto right mery man supper playen began spake myrthe among thynges whan made rekenynges sayd thus nowe lordynges trewly ye ben welcome ryght hertely trouthe yf shuld nat lye sawe nat thys yere mery company atones herborowe nowe fayne wolde myrth wyst howe myrthe ryght nowe bethought done ease shall coste nought ye gone canterbury god mote spede blysful martyr quyte mede wel wote ye gone way ye shapen talken play trewly comforte ne myrthe none ryden waye dombe stone therfore wolde maken disporte sayd erst done comforte yf lyke al one assent stonden iugement worchen shall say morowe whan ryden way nowe father soule deed ye mery wol gyue myne heed holde vp handes without speche counsayle nat longe seche v thought nat worth make wyse graunted hym without auyse badde hym say hys verdit hym lest lordinges nowe herkene best take nat praye disdayne thys poynt speke platte playne eche shorte others way vyage shall tel tale tway canterbery warde meane homwardes shal tel tale two auentures whilom han befal whiche beareth hym best al sayne tellen thys case tale best sentence solace shall haue supper alder cost thys place syttyng thys post whan commen ayen canterbery make mery wol seluen goodly ryde ryght myne owne coste gyde wol iugement withsay shall paye al spende way yf ye vouchsafe telle anon wythout wordes mo woll early shape therfore thys thyng graunted othes swore wyth full gladde herte prayden hym also wolde vouchsafe wolde ben gouernour tale iuge reportour sette supper certayne prise wollen ben demed hys deuyse hye lowe thus one assent ben accorded iugement ther vpon wyne fette anone dronken rest wente ylke one withouten lenger taryeng morowe whan gan spryng vp rose host alder cocke gadered v al flocke forthe ryden lytel paas vnto wateryng saynt thomas host began hys horse arest sayd lordes herkene yf lest ye wote forwarde recorde euesonge morowe songe acorde lette se nowe shall tell fyrst tale euer mote drynke wyne ale rebel iugement shall paye way spent nowe draweth cutte ye farther twyn whiche hath shortest shal begyn sir knyght maister lorde nowe draweth cutte myne acorde cometh nere lady prioresse ye sir clerke lette shamefastnesse ne studyeth nat lay hande therto euery man anone drawe euery wyght began shortely tellen auenture shorter caas sothe thys cutte fyll knyght ful blyth glad euery wyght tellen must hys tale reason forwarde composytion ye han herde nedeth wordes mo whan thys good man sawe yt wyse obedyent kepen hys forwarde hys free assent sayd sithen shall begyn game welcome cutte goddeshame nowe let v ryde herkeneth say worde ryden forth way began wyth ryght mery chere hys tale anone ryght ye shal pthus ende prologue caunterbury tale foloweth knyghtes tale phere begynneth knyghtes tale whylom olde story tellen v duke hyght theseus athene lorde gouernour hys tyme suche conquerour greater non vnder son full many riche countrey wysedom cheualry conquered reigne feminy whylom icleped cythea wedded quene ipolyta brought home wt contre wyth mykell glory solempnyte eke yonge suster emely thus victory melody let thys worthy duke athene ryde hys host armes hym syde certes yf nere longe wolde haue tolde fully manere howe wonnen reygne feminy theseus cheualry great batayle none betwene athene amasones howe beseged ipolyta yonge hardy quene cythea feest yt weddynge tempest home comyng al yt thyng mote nowe forbere haue god wotte large felde ere weked ben ox plowe remenaunt tale long ynowe wyll nat letten eke non thys rout let euery felowe tell hys tale let se nowe shall supper wyn lefte wyll agayne begyn thys duke make mencyoune whan come almost towne hys wele hys pride ware cast hys eye asyde kneled hyghe wey company lady twey twey eche cladde clothes blake crye wo make thys worlde ny creature lyuinge euer herde suche waymentynge thys crye nolde neuer stynten tyll reynes hys bridell henten folke ye yt myn home comyng perturben feest cryeng quod theseus haue ye great enuy myne honour thus coplayne cry hath mysbode offended nowe telleth yf may amended ye clothed thus blake oldest lady spake whan swowned adeedly chere ruthe se sayd lorde fortune hath yeue vyctory conquerour lyue nought greueth v glory honour beseke mercy socour haue mercy wo distresse drope pyte thy getylnesse vpon v wretched wymen let thou fall certes lorde ny none v ne hath duchesse quene nowe caytyses well isene thanked fortune false whele non estate assureth wele certes lorde abyde presence temple goddesse clemece haue waytyng fourtenyght helpe v lorde sythe lyeth thy myght wretche wepe wayle thus whylom wyfe kyng campaneus starfe thebe cursed ye day ben thys aray maken thys lamentacyon losten husbondes town whyle syege aboute laye yet olde creon wel awaye lorde nowe thebe cyte fulfilled yre iniquite dispyte hys tyranny done deed bodyes vyllanye lordes whiche ben slawe hath bodyes heape ydrawe wyll nat suffre hem none assent neyther buryed ne brent maketh houndes eate hem dyspyte wt worde wythout respyte fallen grosly cryen pytously haue v wretched wymen mercy let sorowe synke thyn hert gentle duke fro hors stert wyth hert pytous wha herde hem speke hym thought hys herte wolde breke whan sawe hem pytous mate whylom great astate hys armes hem vp hent hem comforted full good entent swore hys othe true knyght wolde ferforthly hys myght vpon tyrante creon hem wreake al people grece shulde speake howe creon theseus yserued dethe full well deserued ryght anon wythouten abode baner displayed forthe rode thebe warde hys hoost besyde nere athene nolde go ne ryde ne take hys ease fully halfe day onward hys way nyght lay sent anone ipolita quene emely yonge syster shene vnto towne athene dwell forth rydeth ther ny tell red statu mar wt spere targe shyneth hys whyte baner large feldes glyttren vp doun hys baner borne hys penon golde ful rych ybete mynotaure wan c rte thus rydeth duke conquerour hoste chyualry flour tyl came thebe alyght fayre felde ther thought fyght shortly speken thys thyng creon whiche thebe kyng faught slewe hym manly knyght playne batayle put hys folke flyght saute wan cyte rente adowne wall sparre rafter ladyes restored agayn bodyes husbandes yt slayn done obsequies tho gyse al longe deuyse great clamour weymentyng ladyes made brennyng bodyes great honour theseus noble conquerour doth ye lady whan went shortly tellen myne entent whan yt worthy duke theseus hath creon slayne wan thebe thus styl felde toke al nyght hys rest dyd al countre hym lest ransake taas bodyes dede hem strype harneys wede pyllours dyd busynesse cure batayle discomfyture befell taas founde gyrt wt many greuous wounde two yonge knyghtes lyeng bothe armes wrought full richely whiche two arcyte hyght one hyght palamon fully quycke ne fully deed cote armour gere haraudes knewe hem best specyall bloode ryall thebe systren two yborne taas yt pyllours hath hem torne han hem caryed softe tent theseus ful sone hem sent athene dwellen prison perpetuall nolde hem raunson whan thys worthy duke thus idon toke hoost home gothe anon laurer crowned conquerour lyueth ioye honour terme lyfe nedeth wordes mo towne anguysse wo dwelleth palamon hys felowe arcyte euermore ther may gold hem quyte thus passeth yere yere day day til fel one morowe may emely yt fayrer sene lylly vpon stalke grene fresher may floures newe rose colour strofe hewe whiche fayrer hem two er day arysen redy dyght may wol haue slogardy nyght season pricketh euery gentell herte maketh slepe sterte saythe atyse may obseruaunce thys maketh emely haue remebrauce horrour may ryse clothed fresshe deuyse yelowe heare broyded trese behynde backe yerde longe gase gardyn sonne vpryst walketh vp downe herryst gadreth floures party whyt reed make subtell garlande heed angell heuenly songe great tour thicke stronge whiche castell ye chefe dungeon wherin knyghtes pry whiche tolde tell shall euyn ioynaunt garden wall thys emely playeng bright son clere mornynge palamon thys wofull prisoner hys leaue hys gayler rysen romed chambre hyghe whiche noble cyte syghe eke gardyn full braunches grene thys fresshe emely shene walke romed vp doun sorowfull prisoner palamon gothe hys chambre romyng fro hym selfe complaynyng hys wo borne full ofte sayd ala befell auenture caas thrugh window thick many bar yren gret square spar caste hys eyen vpon emelia therwith blent cryed ha though slongen herte crye arcite anon vp sterte sayd cosyn myne eyleth arte pale deedly se cryest thou hath offence goddes loue take pacience prison may none fortune hath yenen v thys aduersyte wycked aspect disposycion saturne constellacion hath yeuen v altho sworn stode heuen whan yt born mote endure thys short playn palamon answerde sayd agayn cosyn forsoth thys opinyon thou hast vayne ymagynacyon thys prison caused nat crye hurt right thrugh myne ey myne herte woll bane fayrnesse lady se yonde gardyn comyng fro cause cryeng wo wher woman goddesse venus sothly gesse therwyth knee fyl sayd venus yf thy wyl thys gardyn thus transfigure beforne sorowfull wretched creature thys prison helpe may scape yf desteny ishape eterne worde dyen pryson lynage haue compassion lowe ybrought tyranny wyth worde arcyte gan espy lady romed fro wyth syght bewte hurt hym yf palamon wounded sore arcyte hurt moche syghe sayd pitously fresshe beutie sleeth sodenly rometh yonder place haue mercy grace may seen leste way nam deed ni say palamo wha wordes herd dispytously loked answerd whether sayest thou ernest play nay quod arcite ernest fay god helpe lyst full yuell pley palamo gan knyt browes twey great honour false ne traytour thy cosen thy brother sworne full depe eche v neuer dyen payne tyll dethe departe v twayne neyther v loue hyndre ne none case leue brother thou shuldest truly euery case shulde thyn othe myn also certayn wote well thou darst withsayn thus arte thou counsell doute nowe thou woldest falsly ben aboute loue lady loue serue euer shall tyll myn herte sterue nowe certes false arcite thou shalt loued fyrst tolde wo counsell brother sworne haue tolde beforne whiche thou art thounden knyght helpen yf lye thy might el arte thou false dare well sayne arcite full proudly spake agayne thou shalt rather fals thou arte false tell vtterly paramour loued fyrst thou wilt thou sayn thou wist nat whether woman goddesse thyne affection holynesse myne loue creature whiche tolde myne auenture cosyn brother sworne suppose thou louest byforne wost thou well olde clerkes sawe shall gyue louer lawe loue gretter lawe pan maybe yeuen erthly man therfore posityfe lawe suche decre broken day loue eche degre man nedes loue maugre hys herd may nat fleen though shulde deed mayde wydowe wyfe eke lykely thy lyfe stonden grace nomore shall well thou wodst thy selfe verely thou dampned prison perpetuall v gayneth raunson stryuen houndes ye bone faughte al day yet part non ther cam cur yt wer wroth bare away bone hein bothe therfore kynges court brother eche man hym selfe non loue thou lyst loue ay shall sothly lefe brother thys thys prison endure eueryche v taken hys auenture gret strife betwix hem twey leyser fry theffect happed day tell shortly may worthy duke hyght perithous felowe duke theseus syth thylke day yt chyldren lyte come athene hys felow visyte play wonte worlde loued man loued hym tenderly agayne well loued olde bokes sayne whe one deed sothly tell felow went sought hym downe hell story lyst write duke perithous loued well arcite hym know thebe yere yere fynally request prayere peithous withouten raunson duke theseus let hym pryson frely whither hym lyst ouer suche agyfe tellen shall thys forewarde playnly endyte betwyx duke theseus hym arcite yf arcite yfounde euer hys lyfe daye nyght stounde countre thys duke theseus caught accorded thus wyth swerde shulde lese hys heed na none remedy ne reed taketh hys leaue homward hym sped let hym beware hys necke lyeth wedde howe great sorowe suffreth nowe arcite death feleth hys herte smyte wepeth wayleth cryeth pyteously sleen hym selfe wayteth priuely sayd ala daye borne nowe preson worse beforne nowe shappen eternally dwell purgatory hell ala euer knewe perithous el dwelt wyth theseus fetered hys prison euer mo blysse wo onely syght serue though neuer grace maye deserue wolde haue suffysed ryght ynough dere cosyn palamon quod thyne victory thys auenture full blysfull prison mayst thou endure prison nay certes paradyse well hath fortune tourned dyse hast syght thabsence possible sythnes thou hast presence arte knyght worthy man able case syn fortune chaungeable thou mayst tyme thy desyre attayne exiled barayne grace great dyspeyre ther ny water erth fyre ne eyre ne creature hem maked maye heale done comforte thys well ought sterue wanhope dystresse farwell lyfe lust gladnesse ala playnen men comune purueyaunce god fortune yeueth hem full ofte many gyse well bette hem selfe deuyse man desyreth haue rychesse cause murdre sycknesse man wolde hys prison fayne hys house hys meyne slayne infinite harmes bene thys matere wote thynge prayen faren dronke mouse dronken man wote well hath house wote nat whych ryght waye thyder dronken man waye slyder certes thys worlde faren seken fast felicite go wronge ful ofte truly thus may saye al namely wenden great opinion yf myght scape fro prison th bene ioye parfyte hele nowe exiled fro wele syth maye sene emely nam deed ny remedy pvpon syde palamon wyst arcite gone sorowe maketh great tour resowned hys yellynge clamour pure fetter hys shynnes grete hys bytter salte teares wete ala arcite cosyn myne stryfe god wote frute thyne thou walkest nowe thebe large wo thou yeuest lytle charge thou mayst syth thou hast wisedome mahed assemble al folke kynred make warre sharpe thys countre auenture treate thou mayst haue lady wyfe must nedes lese lyfe waye possibilite syth thou arte thy large prison fre arte lorde great thyne auauntage myne sterue cage maye wepe wayle whyles yt lyue wyth wo prison maye yeue eke wyth payne loue yeueth also doubleth al tourment wo therwyth fyre ielousy vp stert wythin hys brest hent hym hert woodly lykely beholde boxe tree ashen deed colde sayd cruell goddes gouerne thys worlde wyth worde eterne wrytten table athamant parliament eterne graunt mankynde vnto yholde shepe rouketh folde slayne man ryght another beest dwelleth eke prison arrest hath sycknesse great aduersite ofte tyme gyltlesse parde gouernaunce thys prescience gyltlesse turmenteth innocence encreaseth thus penaunce man bounden hys obseruaunce goddes sake letten hys wyll beest maye hys lustes fulfyll beest deed hath payne hys death mote wepe playne though thys worlde haue care wo wythout doute maye standen answere thys lete diuines well wote thys worlde great pyne ala se serpent thefe many true man hath myschefe gone hys large hym lyst may turne mote bene prison saturne eke iuno ielous eke wood hath stroyed well nye blood thebe wyth hys wast walles wyde venus sleeth syde ielousye feare hym arcite nowe wyll slynte palamon lyte let hym hys pryson styll dwell arcite forth woll tell sommer passeth nyghtes longe encreaseth double wyse paynes stronge louer prisoner whych hath wofuller myster shortly saye thys palamon perpetuall dampned prison haynes feters deed arcite exiled hys heed euermore countre neuer shall hys lady se louers aske thys question hath wo se arcite palamon one maye se hys lady daye daye prison mote dwell alwaye hym lyst maye ryde go sene hys lady shall neuer mo nowe demeth ye lyst ye woll tell forth tale began pwhen arcite thebe comen full ofte daye swelte sayd ala sene hys lady shall neuer mo shortly conclude hys wo mykell sorowe made neuer creature shalbe whyle worlde maye dure hys slepe hys meate hys drynke hym byraft leane wareth drye shaft hys eyen holowe grysly beholde hys hewe pale falowe asshen colde solitary euer alone waylynge nyght makynge mone yf herde songe instrument wolde wepe myght stent feble hys spirites lowe chauged yt man coude hym knowe hys speche ne hys voyce though men herde hys gyre worlde ferde nought comly lyke louers maladye hereos rather lyke manye engendred humour melancolyke beforne hys fell fantastyke shortly turned vp doun habyte dysposicion hym thys wofull louer arcyte shulde daye hys wo endyte endured yere two thys cruell torment thys payne wo thebe hys countre sayd vpon nyght slepe hym layde hym thought howe wynged mercury beforne hym stode bad hym mery hys slepy yerde hande bare vpryght harte wered vpon hys heares bryght arayed thys god toke kepe argus toke hys slepe said thus athene shalt thou wend shapen thy wo end wyth worde arcite awoke stert nowe truly howe sore smert quoth athene ryght nowe wyll fare ne drede death shall spare se lady loue serue presence recke sterue word caught great myrrour sawe changed al hys colour sawe hys vysage another kynde ryght anone ran hym hys mynde syth hys face dysfygured maladye whych endured myght well yf bare hym lowe lyue athene euermore vnknowe sene hys ladye well nyghe daye daye ryght anone chaunged hys araye clad hym poore labourer alone saue squyer knewe hys priuitie hys caas whych dysgysed poorely athene gone nexte waye courte wente vpon daye gate profered hys seruyce druge drawe men wold deuyse shortely thys mater sayne fell offyce chamberlayne whiche dwellyng emelye wyse sone couth espye euery seruaunt whiche serued well couthe hewen wodde water bere yong myghty none therto strong bygge bone done wyght deuyse yere two thys seruyse page chambre emely bright phylostrate sayd hyght halfe well beloued man ne none court hys degre gentyll condicyon court hys renoun sayd charyte theseus wolde enhauncen hys degre put hym worshyp full seruyse myght hys vertue exercyse thus wtin whyle hys name spronge bothe hys dedes hys good tonge theseus taken hym nere hys chambre made hym squyere yafe hym golde maynteyn hys degre eke men brought hym hys coutre fro yere yere full priuely hys rent honestly slyly spent man wondred howe thre yere thys wyse hys lyfe ladde bare hym peace eke werre ther man theseus hath der thys blysse lette nowe ar yte speke woll palamon lyte derknesse horryble stronge prison thys seuen yere hath sytten thys palamon forpyned wo distresse feleth double sore heuynesse palamon loue distrayneth wode hys wit gothe wo eke therto prisonere perpetuall onely yere coude ryme englysshe properly hys martyrdom forsoth nat therfore passe lyghtly may befell seuenth yere may thyrde nyght olde bokes sayne thys story tellen playne auenture destayne whan thyng shapen shall soon mydnight palamon helpyng frende brake hys prison fleethe cyte fast may go yeue hys gayler drynke clarrey made certen wyne wyth narcotise opye thebe fyne al yt night thogh wolde hym shake gayler slept mught nat awake thus fleeth fast may nyght short fast day nedes cost mote hym selfe hyde groue faste besyde dredfull foote stalketh palamon shortly thys hys opinyon yt groue wolde hym hyde al day nyght wold take way thebe warde hys rendes prey theseus helpe hym warrey shortly eyther wolde lese hys lyfe wynne emelye vnto hys wyfe thys theffecte hys entent playne pnowe woll torne arcite agayne lytell wyst howe nye hys care tyl yt fortune brought hym share mery larke messanger day saleweth songe morowe gray firy phebus aryseth vp bright oriso laugheth syght hys streames drieth greues syluer dropes hangyng leues arcite courte ryall theseus hys squier principall rysen loketh mery day hys obseruaunces may remembryng poynt hys desyre hys courser startlyng fyre rydden feldes hym play court myle twey groue whyche tolde auenture hys way gan holde maken hym garlonde greues wodbynde hauthorn leues loude songe ayenst sonne shene may wyth thy floures thy grene welcom thou fayre fresshe may hope grene get may hys courser wyth lusty herte groue full hastely sterte pathe romed vp doun auenture thys palamon busshe man myght hym se sore aferde hys dethe nothyng ne knewe arcite god wote wolde haue trowed full lyte sothe sayd go sythen many yeres felde hath eyen wodde hath eres full fayre man beare hym euyn al day men mete vnset steuyn full lytell wote arcyte hys felawe nyghe herken hys sawe busshe sytteth nowe full styll whan arcyte romed hys fyll songen roundell lustely study fell sodenly louers theyr quyent gyre croppe ye brires nowe vp nowe downe boket well ryght friday sothly tell nowe rayneth nowe shyneth fast ryght gan gery venus ouer cast hertes folke ryght day geryfull ryght chaungeth aray selde friday weke tlyke whan ye arcite songe gan syke set hym downe wythouten ala day bore howe longe iuno thy cruelte wylt thou warren thebe cyte ala ybrought confusyon blode ryall cadmus amphyon cadmus whiche fyrst man thebe buylt fyrst town began cyte fyrst crowned kyng hys lynage hys ofspring lyne stocke ryall nowe caytise thrall mortal enemy serue hym hys squire poorly yet dothe iuno well shame dare knowe myne owne name wont hyght arcyte hyght philostrat nat worth myte ala thou fell mar ala thou iuno thus hath yre lynage saue wretched palamon theseus martreth pryson ouer thys sleen vtterly loue hath hys firy darte bremyngly stycked true carefull herte shapen deth erst sherte ye sleen wyth youre eyen emelye ye ben cause wherfore dye remenaunt myne care ne set nat mountaunce tare yt coude ought plesaunce yt worde fell traunce longe tyme afterwarde vp stort palamon thought ye thrugh hert felte colde sworde sodenly glyde yre quoke lenger wolde abyde whan herde arcites tale wood face deed pale sterte hym vp busshes thycke sayd arcyte false traytour wycke nowe art thou hent louest lady haue th payne wo art bloode counsell sworn haue full ofte tolde beforn hast taped duke theseus falsly hast chaunged thy name thus wyll deed el thou shalt dye thou shalt nat loue lady emelye woll loue onely mo palamon thy mortall though yt haue weapen thys place pryson assert grace drede eyther thou shalt dye thou ne shalt louen emelye thou wilt ye shalt assert arcite full dispytous hert whan hym knewe hys tale herde sters lyon pulled swerde sayd god sytteth aboue ne yt thou art syck wood loue eke yt thou wepen hast thys place thou shuldest neuer groue pace thou ne shuldest dyen myne honde defye etie bonde whiche yt thou sayst yt haue made fole thynke wel loue fre wyl loue maugre thy myght moche thou arte knyght wylnest darrayne batayle haue trouth morow wyll nat fayle without wetyng wyght well founden knyght bryngen harneys ryght ynough chese best leaue worst meate drynke night wyl bring inough clothes thy beddyng yf thou lady wyn slee thys wodde ther thou mayst wel haue thy lady palamon answerde graunt thus ben departed tyll morowe wha ech hem laid faith borowe po cupyde charyte regne yt woldest haue felowe ful soth sayd loue ne lordshyp woll hys thankes haue felyshyp fynde arcite palamon arcite ryden anone toun morowe daye lyght ful priuely two harneys hath dyght sufficient mete darreygne batayle ye felde betwyre hem tweine hys horse alone borne caryeth hys harneys hym beforne groue tyme place yset thys arcite thys palamon bene mette chaungen gan colour face ryght hunter ye regne trace andeth gappe wyth speare unted lyon beare hereth hym rushynge leaues breaketh bowes greaues thiketh cometh mortal enemy wythout fayle must deed eyther slee hym gappe slee yf myshappe ferden chaungynge hewe farre euerych knewe na good daye ne saluyng streyght wythout worde rehersyng eueryche hem helpeth arme frendly hys owne brother wyth sharpe speares stronge foynen eche wonder longe thou myghtest wene thys palamon hys fyghtynge wood lyon cruel tygre arcyte wylde bore gan fyght smyte frothen whyte yre woode p ancle foughten bloode thys wyse let hem fyghtyng dwell forth wol theseus tel destenye minister general executeth worlde ouer al purueyauce god hath sayd beforne stroge yt though ye world sworn contrary thynge yea naye yet somtyme shall fall daye fell neuer yet thousande yere certaynly appetytes warre peace hate loue al ruled syght aboue thys meane nowe myghty theseus hunt desyrous namely great harte may hys bed daweth hym day ny clad redy ryde wyth hunt horne houdes hym besyde hys huntyng hath delyte hys ioye appetyte bene hym selfe great hertes bane mar serueth nowe dyane clere day haue told theseus wyth al ioye blys wyth hys ipolita fayre quene emely yclothen grene huntynge ben rydden ryally groue stode fast ther herte told duke theseus streyght waye hath hold lande rydeth hym ful ryght thider ye hert wot haue flight ouer broke forth hys way duke wol houe cours twey houdes hym lyst comaunde ye duke comen ye launde vnder sonne loked anon ware arcyte palamon foughte breme bulles two bryght swordes wenten fro hydously wyth leste stroke semed wolde haue fellen oke nothynge ne wote duke wt sporres courser smote sterte bytwyxt hem two pulled hys sworde cryed ho nomore payne lesyng heed myghty mar shall anone deed smyteth stroke maye sene telleth myster men ye bene ben hardy fyghten wythout iudge offycere though lystes rially thys palamon answered hastely sayd syr nedeth wordes mo haue death deserued two two wofull wretch ben caytyues ben encombred owne lyues thou arte ryghfull lorde iuge ne yeue v neyther mercy ne refuge slee fyrst saynt charite slee felowe wel slee hi fyrst though thou know lite thy mortal foe thys arcite fro thy lande banyshed hys heed whych hath deserued deed thys came vnto thy yate sayd hyght philostrate thus hath iaped full many yere thou hast made hym thy chefe squire thys loueth emely sythe day come shall dye make playnly confessyon thylke woful palamon hath thy prison broke wyckedly thy mortall foe loueth hotte emelye bright wol dye present syght wherfore aske dethe iewyse slee felowe wyse bothe haue deserued slayn worthy duke answerde anon agayn sayd shorte conclusyon owne mouthe confessyon hath dampned woll recorde nedeth pyne wyth corde ye shall deed myghty mar reed quene anone woman heed gan wepe dyd emelye ladyes companye great pyte thought hem euer suche chaunce shulde befall gentylmen great estate nothyng loue thys debate sawe blody woundes wyde sore cryden bothe lesse haue mercy lorde vpon v wymen bare knee downe fall wolde haue kyst fete stode tyl last slaked hys mode pyte renueth sone gentle herte though fyrst yre quoke sterte hath consydred shorthly clause trespas hem bothe eke cause al though hys yre gylt accused yet hys reason hem bothe excused thus thought well euery man woll helpe hym selfe loue al eke delyuer hym selfe pryson eke hys herte compassyon wymen wepen euery one hys gentle heyte thought anone softe vnto hym selfe sayd fy vpon lorde woll haue mercy lyon bothe worde dede hem ben repentaunce drede well proude dispytous man wyll mayntayne fyrst began lorde hath lytell discretyon suche case diffynition wayeth pride humblesse one shortly whan hys yre thus agone gan loken vp eyen lyght spake wordes al hyght god loue ah benedicite howe myghty howe great lorde agayn hys myght ther gayneth obstacle may cleaped god hys miracle maken hys owne gyse euerych hert hym lyst deuyse lo thys arcyte thys palamon quitely prison gon myght haue lyued thebe ryally knowen mortall enemy dethe power also yet hath loue maugre eyen two brought hem hyther bothe dye nowe loketh great folye may fole yf loue beholde goddes sake sytteth aboue se howe blede nat wel arayde thus hath lord ye god loue hem payd wage fee seruyse yet wenen full wyse serue loue aught may fall yet best g haue thys iolyte hem therfore moche thanke wotte nomore hote face god wotte cokowe hare mote ben assayed hote colde man mote ben foole yong olde wote selfe full yore agone tyme seruaunte one therfore syth knowe loues payne wote howe sore man distrayne ofte hath caught laas foryeue hooly trespaas request quene ye kneleth eke emely syster dere ye shall bothe anon anto swere ye shal neuer countre dere ne make warre vpon nyght ne day ben frendes ye may yene thys trespas euery dele hym swace asking fair wele lordshyp mercy prayde hem graunted grace thus sayde speake worthy lynage rychesse though ye quene princesse ilke bothe worthy doutles wedde whan tyme netheles speake syster emely ye haue thys stryfe ielowsy ye wote selfe maye wedde two one though ye fyghten euer mo one hym loth lefe mote go pype yue lefe thys saye maye haue ne ben ye neuer ielous ne wroth therfore put thys degre eche shall haue hys destyne hym shape herken wyse lo ende shall deuyse wyll thys plat conclusion wythout replicacion yf lyketh taketh best euerych shall go lyst frely wythout raunsome daungere thys daye fyftye wekes ferre ne nere euerych shall brynge c knyghtes armed lystes vp ryghtes al redy darreyne batayle thys behote wythouten fayle vpon trouth true knyght whether hath myght saye whether thou may wyth hudred spake slee hys contrary lystes dryue hym shall yene emely wyue yt fortune yeueth fayre grace lystes shall maken thys place god wysely soule rewe shal euyn iudge trewe ye shall none ende wyth make one shalbe deed take yf ye thynken thys wel ysayd sayeth aduyse holde wel apayd thys ende conclusion loketh lyghtly palamon spryngeth vp ioye arcite coude tel coude endyte ioye made thys place theseus done fayre grace doun knee wet euery maner wight thanked wyth al hert myght namely theban many sythe thus wyth good hope herte blythe take leue howard gan ryde thebe warde wyth olde walles wyde trowe men wolde deme negligence yf foryetten tell dyspence theseus goeth busely maken vp lystes royally suche noble theatre dare well saye thys worlde ther na circute myle walled wyth stone dyched al roude shape maner compas full degree heygth fyrty paas man set one degre letted hys felowe estward stode gate marble whyte westward ryght suche another thopposite shortly conclude suche place none erth lytle space lande na craftes man gemetry arsmetyke ne portriture ne caruer ymages theseus ne gaue hym mete wage theatre make deuyse hys ryte sacrifyce estwarde hath vpon yate aboue worshyp venus goddes loue make auter oratory westsyde memory mar hath maked another cost golde largely fother northwarde turret wal alabastre whyte redde coral oratorye ryche se worshyp diane goddes chastite hath theseus wrought noble wyse yet foryetten deuyse noble caruynges portratures shap countenaunce fygures oratory thre fyrst teple venus thou mayst se wrought wal ful pytously beholde broken slepes syghes colde sault teares waymentyng fyre stroke desyryng loues seruauntes thys lyfe enduren othes couenauntes assuren plesaunce hope desyre foole hardynesse beauty youth baudry rychesse charmes sorcery leasynges flatery dyspence busynesse ielousy weared yelowe goldes garlande cokowe syttynge honde feestes instrumentes carolles daunces iustes araye al circumstaunces loue whych reken reken shal ordre paynted wal mo make mencion sothly mounte cytheron venus hath principal dwellyng shewed wall portreyng wyth ioye lustynesse nought foryete portresse ydelnesse ne narcissus fayre yore agon ne yet folye kynge salomon ne yet great strength hercules thenchauntement medea circe ne turnus wyth hardy fyers corage ryche cresus caytyfe seruage thus may ye sene wisdome ne richesse beaute ne sleyght strength ne hardynesse ne may wyth venus holde champartye lyst worlde maye gye lo al folke caught laas tyll wo full ofte sayd ala suffyseth one ensample two though coude reken thousande mo statue venus glorious se maked fletynge large see fro nauyll downe al couered wyth wawes grene bryght glas cytriole ryght hande heed ful semely se rose garlande freshe wel smellynge aboue heed doues flytterynge beforne stode sonne cupido vpon hys shoulder wynges two blynde ofte sene bowe arowes bright kene shulde wel tellen al purgatory therabout ouer al within temple myghty mar rede al paynted wal length brede lyke estris grysly place hyght ye gret teple mar trace thylke colde frosty regyon ther mar hath hys souerayne mancion fyrst wall paynted forest whych ther wonneth nother ne beest wyth knotty knarry tree olde stubbes sharpe hydous beholde whych ther romble showe though storme shuld breke euery bowe downward vnder hyl vnder bent ther stode temple mar armipotent wrought burnt stele whych thentre longe streyght gastly se ther came suche rage vyse made gate ryse northren lyght dores shone wyndowe wall none thrugh might lyght discerne dores al athamant eterne yclensed ouerthwarte endlonge wyth yren toughe maken stronge euery pyller temple sustene tonne great yren bright shene pthere sawe fyrst derke ymagynyng felony eke compassyng cruel yre redde glede pyckpurse eke pale drede smyler wyth knyfe vnder cloke shepen brennynge wyth ye blacke smoke treason murdrynge bede open warre woundes blede coteke blody knyues sharpe manace full chyrkyng sory place fleer hym selfe yet saw herte blood hath bathed nayle ydriuen shode hyght colde deth wt mouth gapyng vpright amyddes temple sate myschaunce discomfort sory countenaunce yet saw wodnesse laughyng rage armed complaynte theft fyers courage carrayne bushe wt throte ycorne thousande slayne nat qualme ystorne tyraunt pray force yraft town distroyed ther nothing ylaft yet sawe brent shyppes hoppesteres hunter ystrangled ye wylde beares sowe frettyng chylde cradyll coke yscaulded al longe ladyll naught foreten yt fortune marte carter ouer rydden owne carte vnder whele full lowe laye also martes diuysyon barbour boucher smyth forgeth sharpe swordes styth aboue depaynted toure sawe coquest syttyng great honoure sharpe sworde ouer heed hangyng subtyl twyned threde depaynted ther ye slaughter iulius great nero anthonius al thylke tyme vnborne yet death depaynted beforne manacynge mar ryght fygure shewed portreture depaynted certres aboue shalbe deed el slayne loue suffyseth one ensample storyes olde may reken al though wolde statue marce vpon carte stode armed loked grym wode ouer hys heed ther shynen two fygures sterres ben cleped scryptures one puella hyght yt rubeus thys god armes arayed thus wolfe stode beforne hym hys fete wyth eyen reed man ete wyth subtyl pensyl paynted thys storie redoutynge marce hys glorye nowe temple dyane chaste shortly wol haste tel al dyscriptyoun depaynted ben walles vp doun huntyng shamfast chastyte sawe howe woful calistope dyane greued wyth turned fro woman bere afterwarde made ye lode sterre thus paynted saye ferre ne eke sterre men may se sawe dane turned vnto tre meane goddesse dyane venus doughter ye hight dane sawe atheon herte ymaked vengeauce yt sawe dyane al naked sawe yt houdes haue hym caught freten knewe hym naught yet ypaynted lytel ferthermore howe athalant hunted wylde bore meliager many mo whych dyane wrought hym care wo sawe many another wonder storye whych lyst drawe memorye goddesse ful wel vp harte sete wyth smale houndes al aboute fete vnderneth fete moone waryng shulde wane soone gaudy grene statue clothed wyth bowe hande arowes caas eyen cast ful lowe adoun pluto hath hys darke regioun woman trauelynge chylde longe vnbore ful pytously lucyna gan cal sayd helpe thou mayst best al wel coude paynte lyuelye wrought wyth many floreyn hewes bought lystes made theseus hys great cost hath arayed thus temple theatre euerydel done lyked woder wel stynte wol theseus lyte speke palamon arcyte daye approcheth returnynge euerych shulde c knyghtes brynge batayle darreyne tolde athene couenautes holde hath euerich hem brought c knightes wel armed warre al ryghtes sykerly trowed many man neuer sythnes worlde began speake knyghthode honde farre god hath made see londe na fewe noble company euery wyght loued chyualry wolde hys thakes haue passing name hath prayed myght game wel therto chosen yf fel morowe caas ye knowe wel euery lusty knyght loueth paramour hath hys myght englande el wolde fayne wyllen fyght lady ah benedicite lusty syght se ryght farde wyth palamon wyth hym went knyghtes many wolde ben armed habergeon brest plate wyth lyght gyppion wold haue payre plate large wold haue pruce sheld targe wolde armed hys legges wele haue axe mace stele na none newe gyse na olde armed haue tolde euerych hys opinion pther mayst yu se comyng wyth palamon lygurge hym selfe great kinge trace blacke berde maly face sercles hys eyen hys heed glouden betwyxte yelowe reed lyke lyon loked aboute wyth kemped heeres browes stoute lymmes great hys brawnes stronge shoulder brode armes roude loge gyse hys countre ful hye vpon chare golde stode wyth foure whyte bulles tray stede cote armure ouer hys harnays wyth nayles yelowe bryght golde hath beares skyn cole blacke olde loge heare kempt behynd backe rauens fether shone blacke wreth gold arme great huge weight vpon heed set ful stone bryght fyne rubyes dyamandes hys chare ther wente whyt allaundes twenty mo great stere hunten lyon wilde bere folowed hym wyth mosel fast ybounde colers golde orrettes yfyled rounde hundred lordes hys route armed ful wel hertes sterne stoute wyth arcite storyes men fynde great emetrius kynge ynde vpon stede bay trapped stele couered wyth cloth golde diapred wele came rydyng lyke god armes marce hys cote armure cloth trace couched wyth perle whyte rounde gret sadel brent golde newe ybet mantel vpon hys shoulder hangyng bret full rubyes reed fyre sparklyng hys cryspe heere lyke rynges yronne yt yelowe gletering ye sonne hys nose hye hys eyen bryght cytryn hys lyppes ruddy hys colour sanguyn fewe frekles hys face yspreynte betwexte yelowe somdele blacke ymeynte lyon hys eyen ceste fyue twenty yere hys age geste hys berde wel begonne sprynge hys voyce trompet sownynge vpon hys heed weared laurer grene garlande freshe lusty sene vpon hys hande bare hys delyte egle tame lylly whyte hundred lordes wyth hym al armed saue heedes gere ful rychely al maner thynges trusteth wel erles duke kynges gathered thys noble companye loue encreace chyualrye kinge ran euery parte ful many tame lyon lyberte thys wyse lordes al ben sonday cytie come prime towne alyght pthis duke worthy kniyt brought hem hys cyte inned hem euerych hys degre feesteth hem doth great laboure easen hem done hem al honoure yet men wenen man wyt none estate coude amende mynstralcye seruyce feest great gyftes moste leest rich array throughout theseus paleys ne sat fyrst ne last vpon deys ladyes fayrest ben best daucyng whych hem best daunce syng ne moste felyngly speketh loue ne haukes sytten perchen aboue ne houndes lyggen ye floure adoun al thys make mencion al effecte thynketh best cometh ye point herkeneth yf lest sonday night day bega spryng palamon larke herde syng although day houres two yet songe larke palamon ryght tho holy herte hye corage rose vp towenden pylgrimage vnto blysful cytherea benygne meane venus honorable dygne hour walketh forthe paas vnto lystes temple downe kneleth humble chere herte sore sayd ye shal pfayrest fayre lady myne venus doughter ioue spouse vulcanus thou glader mount cytheron thylke loue thou haddest adon haue pyte bytter teares smerte take humble prayer thyne herte ala ne haue langage tel effecte ne turment myne hel myne hert may myne harmes bewraye confused saye mercy lady bryght wost wele thought seest harmes yt fele consyder al thys rue vpon sore wysly shal euermore emforth myght thy true seruaunt holde warre alwaye wyth chastite make myne auowe ye helpe kepe armes yelpe ne ne aske morowe haue victory ne renome thys case ne vayne glory pryse armes blowen vp doun wolde haue fulle possessyoun emely dye seruyce finde thou yt maner wyse retche may better haue victory hem haue lady myn armes though mar god armes vertue great heuen aboue yf lyst shall wel haue loue thy temple shal worshyp euer mo thyn auter ryde go wol sacrifyce fyres bete yf ye wol lady swete pray morowe spere arcyte herte bere recke whan haue lost lyfe thoughe arcyte wynne wyfe thys effecte ende prayere yeue lady thou blysful lady dere whan orison done palamon sacrifyce dyd anon ful pytously al cyrcumstaunces al tel nat nowe hys obseruaunces laste statue venus shoke made sygne wherby toke hys prayere accepted day though sygne shewed delay yet wist wel graunted bone wt glad hert went hom ful sone thyrde houre equal palamon began venus temple gon tp rose sonne vp rose emelye vnto temple dyane gan hye maydens whiche thyder lad ful redely hem fyre ensence clothes remenaunt al sacrifyce longen shall horne ful meethe gyse lacked nought sacrifyce smokyng temple ful clothes fayre emely herte debonayre body wyshe water wel dyd ryght dare nat tel thyng generall yet game meaneth wel charge good man large bright heare vnkept vntressed crowne grene oke vnseryall vpon heed set ful fayre mete two fyres aulter gan bete dyd thynges men may beholde stace thebe bookes olde whan kenled fyre wt pitous chere vnto dyane spake ye may po chaste goddesse woddes grene heuen erthe see sene quene reygne pluto derke lowe goddesse maydes yt myn hert hath know ful many yere woste desyre kepe fro vengeaunce thyn yre acteon abought cruelly chaste goddesse wel woste thou desyre ben mayde al lyfe ne neuer wol loue ne wyfe thou woste wel thy company mayde loue huntyng venery walken woddes wylde ben wyfe ben chylde nought wyl knowe companye man nowe helpe lady sythe ye may tho thre formes thou haste palamon hath suche loue eke arcyte loueth sore grace pray withouten sende loue peace bytwyxt hem two fro turne away hertes al hotte loue desyre al busy turment al fyre queynt turned place thou wolte grace yf desteny shapen shal nedes haue one hem two sende hym moste desyreth beholde goddesse clene chastyte bytter teares chekes fal syn thou arte mayde keper v maydenhede thou kepe wel coserue whyle lyue mayden wol yt serue pthe fyres brenne vpon auter clere whyle emely thus prayere sodenly sawe thyng queynte ryght anon one fyres queynte quycked agayn anon fyre queynte al agon queynte made whystlyng wete brondes brennyng brondes ende ran anone bloddy droppes many one whiche sore agaste emelye wel nye madde gan crye ne wyste sygnyfyed onely feare thus cryed wepte pyte therwithal dyane gan apere bowe honde right hunteresse sayd doughter stynte thyn heuynesse amonge goddes hye affyrmed eterne worde wrytten confyrmed thou shalt wedded one tho haue much care wo vnto whych hem may tel farewel may lenger dwel fyres whych myne auter brenne shal declaren er thou gon henne thys auenture loue thys case ye worde arowes case goddes clatteren fast rynge forth went made vaneshynge whych thys emely astonyed sayd mounteth thys ala put vnder thy protection dyane vnder thy dysposycion home goth next waye effect nomore saye nexte houre mar folowyng arcite vnto temple walked fyers mar done hys sacrifyse wyth al myght hys paynem wyse wyth pytous herte hye deuocion ryght thus mar sayd hys orison po stronge god reygnes colde trace honoured arte lorde yholde hast euery reygne euery lande armes al brydle thyne hande hem fortunest thy lyst deuyse accepte pytous sacrifyce yf thought may deserue might worthy serue thy godhede maye ben one thyne praye thou rue pyne thylke payne thylke hotte fyre whech thou brentest whylom desyre thou vsedest fayre beaute fayre yonge freshe venus fre haddest thyne armes thy wyll al though thou one tyme myssyll vulcanus caught hys laas founde thy lyggynge hys wyfe ala thylke sorowe thyne herte haue ruth wel paynes smerte yonge vnconning thou wost trowe wyth loue offended euer lyues creature doth al thys wo endure ne retcheth neuer synke flete wel wote mercy hete mote wyth strength wyn place wel wote wythout helpe grace ne may strength auayle helpe lorde morow batayle thylke fyre whylom brent well fyre nowe brenneth morowe haue vyctorye myn trauayle thyn glorye thy souerayne teple wol moste honouren place alwaye labouren thy pleasaunce thy raftes stroge thy temple wol baner honge al armes companye euermore vntyl daye dye eterne fyre wol beforne fynde eke thys auowe wyl bynde berd heare yt hongeth lowe adoun neuer yet felte offensioun rasour ne shere wol yeue bene thy true seruaunt whyle lyue lorde haue ruth vpon sorowes sore yeue victory aske nomore pthe prayer stynte arcite stronge rynges temple dore ronge eke dores clatren ful faste whych arcite somwhat agast fyres brennen vpon auter bryght gan al temple lyght swete smel anone grounde vp yase arcite anone hys honde vp hase ensence fyre caste wyth rytes mo laste statue mar bega hauberk ryng soude herde murmuryng ful lowe dym sayd thus victory yaue mar honour glory thus wyth ioye hope wel fare arcite anone hys ynne fare fayne foule bryght sonne ryght anone stryfe begonne thylke grauntynge heuen aboue bytwyrt venus goddes loue mar sterne god armypotent iupiter busy stynte tyl pale saturnus colde knewe many auentures olde founde hys experience arte ful sone hath pleased euery parte soth sayd elde hath great auauntage elde wysedome vsage men maye olde ren rede saturne anone stynte stryfe drede al agayne hys kynde al thys stryffe remedy fynde dere doughter venus saturne course hath wyde turne hath power wote man myn drenchynge see wan myne prison derke cote myn ye straglyng ye hagyng ye throte murmure churles rebellyng groynyng priuy enpoysonyng vengeauce playne correction whyle dwell sygne lyon myne ruyne hye halle fallyng toures walles vpon mynor vpon carpenter slewe sampson shakyng pyllers myne ben maladyes colde derke treason castels olde lokynge father pestilence nowe wepe nomore shal diligence palamon thyne owne knyght shal haue hys lady thou hym behyght thogh mar shal helpe kniyt natheles betwixt mote somtyme pee albe ye one complection causeth al daye deuision thyne ayle redy thy wyl wepe nomore wol thy lust fulfyl pnow wol stynte goddes aboue mar venus goddes loue playnly wol tellen great effecte whych began great ye feest athene day eke lusty season may made euery wyght ben pleasauce al day iusten daunce spenten venus hye seruyce bycause shulden aryse erly se great syght vnto rest went nyght morowe day gan sprynge horse harneys noyse claterynge hostelryes al aboute palays rode many route lordes vpon stedes palfrey mayst thou se deuysyng harneys vncouth rych wrought wele goldsmethry braudry stele sheldes bryght tester trapper gold hewe helmes hauberkes cot armers lordes paramentes courser knyghtes retenue eke squyers naylynge speares helmes bokeling gyggyng sheldes layners lacynge nede nothynge ydel fominge stedes golden brydel gnawyng fast armurers also wyth fyle hammer rydyng fro yemen fote comunes many one wyth shorte staues thycke may gone pypes trompes nakoners clarion batayle blowen blody sowns palays ful people vp doun thre ten holdynge question deuinyng theban knyghtes two sayd thus sayd shulde helde wyth hym ye blacke berde wt balled wt thick herde sayd loked grym wold fyght hath sparth twenty poude weight thus hal ful deuinynge longe sonne gan sprynge great theseus hys slepe gan wake wyth mynstralsye noyse make helde yet chambre hys palays ryche tyl theban knyghtes yliche honoured place yfette pduke theseus wyndowe sette arayed ryght god trone people preased thyderwarde ful sone hym sene done hym hye reuerece eke hys hest hys sentence heraude scaffolde made oo tyl al noyse people ydo sawe people noyse styl thus shewed myghty duke wyl pthe lorde hath hys hye dyscrecion consydred dystruccion gentle bloode fyghten thys gyse mortal batayle thys empryse wherfore shapen shal dye wol hys fyrst purpose modefye man therfore vp payne losse lyfe maner shorte polaxe ne shorte knyfe lystes sende thytherbrynge ne short sword stycke point bytynge man ne drawe ne beare hys syde ne man shal hys felow ryde one course wyth sharp grouden spere foyne yf hym lyst fote hym selfe myschefe shalbe take slayne brought stake shall bene ordeyned eyther syde thyther shal force abyde yf fal chieftayne take eyther syde el sleene hys make lenger shal turnament laste god spede goeth layeth faste swordes loge ma fyghte fyl goth waye lordes wyl pthe voyce people touched heuen loude cryed wyth mery steuen god saue suche lorde good wylleth
