destruction blood vp goeth trompes melodye lystes rydeth companye ordynaunce throughout cytie large hoged wyth cloth golde wyth sarge ful lyke lorde thys noble duke gan ryde two theban euery syde rode quene emelye companye one degre thus passen throughout cytie lystes comen tyme na daye yet fully pryme set theseus full ryche hye ipolita quene emelye ladyes degree aboute vnto seates preaseth al route westward thrugh ye yates vnder marte arcite eke hundred hys parte wyth baner reed entred ryght anon selue momet entred palamon vnder venus estwarde place wyth baner whyte hardy chere face al worlde seken vp doun euen wythout variacion na companyes twey na none wyse coude sey auauntage worthynesse ne estate ne age euen chose gesse renges fayre hem dresse name red euerychone nombre gyle none tho gate shyt cryed loude deuer yonge knightes proude pthe heraudes left prycking vp doun ryngen trompes loude clarioun nomore saye este weste goth sharpe speres sadly arrest goth sharpe spurres syde se men iust ryde shyueren shaftes vpon sheldes thycke feleth herte spoune pryck vp springeth ye sper twenty fote hyght goth swordes syluer bryght helmes heawe shrede burst ye blood wyth sterne stremes rede wyth myghty mace bone breke ye thyckest ye throge gan threke ther stomblen stedes stroge gon al rolled vnder foote dothe bal foyneth hys fete wyth tronchoun hurleth wyth hys horse adoun body hurte syth ytake maugre hys heed brought vnto stake forward ryght must abyde ladde syde somtyme doth hem theseus reste hem refeshe drynke yf hem leste full ofte day haue theban two togyther met done eche wo vnhorsed hath eche hem twey ther tygre vale galaphey whelpe stole lyte cruel hunte arcite ielous herte vpon thys palamon ne belmary fel lyon hunted hys honger woode ne hys prey desyreth bloode palamon slee hys foe arcite ielouse stroke helmes byte renneth ye bloode sydes rede somtyme ende euery dede er sunne vnto rest wente stronge kynge emetrius gon hente thys palamon fought wt arcite made hys sworde depe hys flesh byte force twenty take vn yolden drawen stake rescous thys palamon stronge kynge lygurge borne adoun kynge emetrius al hys strength borne hys sadle swordes length hurte hym palamon take al nought brought ye stake hys hardy herte myght hym helpe naught must abyde caught force eke composycion soroweth woful palamon gon agayne fyght pand theseus sene ye syght cryed hoe ne none shal lenger hys felowe gon wol true iuge partye arcite thebe shal haue emelye hys fortune hath fayre ywonne anon noyse people bygonne ioye thys loude hye withall semed lystes shulde fall nowe fayre venus done aboue sayth doth ye quene loue wepeth watyng wil tyl teares lystes fyll sayd shamed doutles saturne sayd doughter holde thy pee mar hath al wil kniyt hath bone myn heed thou shalt eased sone pthe trompes loude mynstralcye heraudes loude yel crye ben wele loue dan arcyte harkeneth stynteth noyse lyte whyche myracle byfell anon fyers arcyte hys helme ydon courser shewe hys face pricketh endlonge large place lokyng vpwarde vpon emelye ayen hym caste frendly eye woman speke comune folowen al fauour fortune hys chere hys herte grounde fyre infernal sterte pluto sent request saturne whiche horse feare gan turne lepe syde foundred lepe er arcyte may taken kepe pyght hym pomell hys heed place lay deed hys brest brosten wyth sadel bowe blacke lay cole crowe bloode yronne face anon brought place wyth herte sore theseus paleys tho coruen hys harneys bedde ybrought ful fayre blyue yet memorye lyue alway cryeng emelye pduke theseus al hys companye comen home athene hys cyte al blysse great solempnyte al auenture fall wolde discomforte hem men sayd eke arcyte shulde dye shulde ben yhealed hys maladye thyng fayne hem al none slayne al sore hurte namely one wt aspere thronled hys brest bone two woundes two broken armes salues charmes fermaces herbes eke saue dronken wold lyeues haue whiche noble duke wel comforteth honoureth euery man made reuel al longe nyght vnto straunge lordes ryght ne na holde discomfortyng iustes tourneyng sothly na discomfyture fallyng holde auenture ne ladde force vnto stake vnyolden twenty knyghtes take one person lone withouten mo haryed forth arme foote eke hys stede driuen forthe staues footemen bothe yemen knaues ar tted hym vilanye may man cleape cowardye whiche anon duke theseus dyd crye stynten al rancour enuye grete wel one syde eyther syde ylyke others brother yaue hym ryghtes degre fully helde feest dayes thre coueyed knyghtes worthyly hys towne dayes iourney largely home went euery man ryght way ther farwel haue good day batayle wol endyte speke palamon arcyte swelleth brest arcyte sore encreaseth herte clotered bloode leche crafte corrumped hys body lafte neyther veynbloode ne ventousyng ne drynke herbes may helpyng vertue expulsed anymall thylke vertue cleaped naturall ne may venym voyde ne expell pypes hys longes began swell euery lacerte hys brest adown shent wyth venym corruption hym gayneth neyther get hys lyfe vomyte vpwarde ne downwarde laxatyfe bruste thylke regyon nature hath domynacyon certainly ther nature w l nat wirche farwel phisyke go beare corse chirche thys al arcyte muste dye whiche sendeth emelye palamon hys cosyn dere sayd thus ye shall pnought may woful spyrit herte declare poynte al sorowes smerte lady loue moste bequethe seruyce goste abouen creature syn lyfe may lenger dure ala wo ala paynes stronge haue suffred longe ala dethe ala myn emely ala partyng company ala myn hertes quene ala lyues wyfe myn hertes lady ender lyfe worlde asken haue nowe loue colde graue alone withouten company farwel swete foe myn emely softe take armes twey loue god herkeneth sey pi haue cosyn palamon stryfe rancour many day agon loue ielousye iupiter wyssely soule gye speken seruaunt properly cyrcumstaunces al trewly say trouth honour knyghthede wysedom humblesse estate hye kynrede fredom longeth arte iupiter haue soule parte worlde ryght knowe non worthy loued palamon serueth woll hys lyfe yf ye shall euer ben wyfe yet palamon gentyll man worde speche fayle bega hys fete vnto hys brest come colde dethe hym nome yet ouer hys armes two vytal strength loste al ago saue onely intellecte without dwelled herte sycke sore gan faylen whan herte felte dethe dusked hys eyen two fayled brethe hys lady yet caste hys eye hys laste worde mercy emelye hys spyrit chaunged went whytherwarde tel ne therfore stynte diuynystre soules fynde regystre ne lyst thylke opinyon tell hem though writen wher dwel arcyte colde mar hys soule gye nowe woll speke forthe emelye pshright emely howlen palamon theseus suster vp toke anon swounyng bare fro hys corse away helpeth tarry forthe day tellen wept bothe eue morowe suche case woman haue suche sorowe whan husbandes ben fro hem go parte sorowen el fallen suche maladye laste certaynly dye infinyte ben sorowes teres olde folke folke tender yeres al towne dethe theban hym wepeth bothe chylde great wepyng certayne whan hector brought al freshe islayn troy ala pyte cratchyng chekes rentyng eke woldest thou deed thus woman crye haddest golde ynoughe emelye man myght glade theseus sauyng hys olde father egeus knewe thys worldes transmutacion sene bothe vp doun ioye wo wo gladnesse shewed hym ensamples lyknesse ryght dyed neuer man ne lyued erthe degre ryght lyued neuer man sayde al thys world somtyme ne deyde thys world thorowfare full wo ben pylgrymes passyng fro deth ende euery worldes sore ouer al thys yet sayd moch thys effecte ful wysely exhorte people shulde hem recomfort duke theseus al hys busy cure casteth nowe sepulture good arcyte shall best ymaked eke moste honorable degre laste toke conclusyon arcyte palamon loue batayle hem bytwene selue groue swete grene amerous desyres hys complaynte loue hys hotte fyres wolde make fyre whiche offys funeral myght hem al accomplys hath anon comaunded hacke hewe okes olde lay hem al arewe culpons wel arayed brenne offycers swyfte foote renne ryght anon hys commaundement theseus hath ysente beere ouer spradde wyth clothe golde rychest sute clothed arcyte vpon hys handes hys gloues whyte eke hys heed crowne laurer grene hande sworde ful bright kene loyde hym bare visage bere therwith wepte pyte people shulde sene hym whan day brought hym ye hall roreth cry sorowes soun tho gan woful theban palamon glytering berde ruddy shynyng here clothes blacke dropped al wyth teres passyng wepyng emely rufullest company moche seruyce shulde noble ryche hys degre duke theseus let forthe stedes bryng trapped stele gleteryng couered armes dan arcyte vpon stedes great whyte ther saten folke one bare sheld another hys speare hys hande helde thyrde bare bowe turkes brent golde case eke harnes ryden forthe pace sory chere towarde groue ye shal pthe noblest grekes vpon shuldres caryed bere slacke pace eyen reed wete throughout cyte mayster strete sprad al wt blak woder hye ryght strete ywrye vpon ryght hande wente egeus syde duke theseus vessel hande golde full fyne al ful hony mylke bloode wyne eke palamon full great company came wofull emely fyre hande yt tyme gyse offyce funeral seruyse hye labour ful great apparaylyng seruyce fyre makyng grene toppe heue raught twenty fadome brede armes straught sayn bowes brode strawe first ther layde many lode fyre maked vp height eke name howe tree heyght oke firre beche aspe elder elme popelere wyllo holm plane boxe chesteyn laulere maple thorne beche ewe hasel whipultre felde shal nat tolde ne howe goddes ronne vp doun disheryted abytacioun whiche wonned rest pee nymphes fauny amadriades ne howe beeste ne byrdes fledden feare whan tree fall ne grounde agast lyght nat wonte se sonne bryght ne fyre couched first stre drye styckes clouen thre grene wodde spicery clothe golde perry garlondes hagyng many floure myrre ensence swete odoure ne howe arcyte lay amonge al ne rychesse aboute hys body ne howe emely gyse put fyre funeral seruyse ne swouned wha maked ye fyre ne spake ne desyre ne iewelles men fyre caste whan fyre great brent faste ne cast sheld spere vestementes whiche yt cuppes full wyne mylke bloode fyre brent woode ne howe grekes huge route thryse rydden fyre aboute vpo lefte hande loude showtyng thryse speares clateryng thryse howe ladyes gan crye ne ladde homwarde emelye ne howe arcite brent asshen colde ne howe lyche wake holde nyght ne howe grekes play wake playes kepe nat say wrestled best naked wyth oyle anoynt ne bare hym best euery poynt woll tellen howe gone athene whan play done shortly poynt woll wende make longe tale ende processe length yeres stynten mornyng teres grekes one generall assent semed parlement athene vpon certayne poynt caas amonge whiche poyntes yspoken haue certayne countres alyaunce haue theban fully obeysaunce whiche thys noble theseus anon let sende thys gentyl palamon vnwyste ye cause blacke clothes sorowfully came hys commaundement hye tho sent theseus emelye whan set hushte yt place theseus abydden hath space worde came wyse brest hys eyen sette hym lest suche sadde vysage syked styll right thus sayd hys wyll pthe fyrst mouer cause aboue whan first made fayre chayne loue great theffecte hye hys entente wel wyste therof mente fayre chayne loue bonde fyre eyre water londe certayne bondes may nat fle prince mouer hath stablisshed wretched world ado certen dayes duracion al engendred thys place ouer whiche day may pace al mowe yet dayes abredge nedeth none auctorite ledge proued experyence lyst declaren sentence may men thys ordre discerne thylke mouer stable eterne wel may men knowe fole euery party deryued hys hole nature hath taken hys begynnyng one parte cantell thyng thyng perfyte stable discendyng tyl corrumpable therfore hys wyse purueyaunce hath wel byset hys ordynaunce space thynges progressyons shullen endure successyons eterne wythout lye thus mayst thou vnderstande se eye lo oke hath longe norishyng fro tyme beginneth first spring hath longe lyfe ye may se yet last wasted tre consydreth eke howe harde stone vnder fete whiche reeade gone yet wasteth lyeth wey brode ryuer somtyme wexeth drey great townes se waue wende ye se al thys thyng hath ende man waman se shal also nedeth one termes two sayne youthe orels age mote deed kyng wel page bedde depe see large felde ye may se helpeth al gothe ylke wey may ye se al thyng mote dey maketh iupiter kyng prince cause al thyng conuertyng al hys propre wyl whiche deryued sothe tel agayne creature lyue degre auayleth stryue wysedome thynketh make vertue necessyte take wel may eschewe namely v al dewe grutcheth aught dothe folye rebel hym al may gye certaynly man hath moste honour dyen hys excellence flour whan syker hys good name tha hath frendes ne sham gladder ought frendes deth whan honour yolde vp breth whan name apalled age al foryeten hys vassellage best worthy dyen whan best name contrarye al thys wylfulnesse grutchen haue heuynesse good arcite cheualry floure departed dutye honoure foule prison thys lyfe grutchen cosyn hys wyfe welfare loueth hym wele hem thake nay god wot neuer dele bothe soule eke hem offende yet mowe lustes amende pwhat may conclude thys longe story sorowe rede v mery thanke iupiter al grace er departen thys place rede maken sorowes two one perfyte ioye lastyng euer mo loke nowe sorowe heryn wol fyrst amende begyn suster quod thys ful assent wyth al people parlement gentle palamon owne knyght serueth wyl herte myght euer hath done sythe ye fyrst hym knew ye shal grace vpon hym rewe take hym husbonde lorde lene honde thys accorde let se nowe womanly pyte kynges brother sonne parde though poore bachelere syn hath serued many yere great aduersyte muste ben consydred leueth gentle mercy ought passen ryght sayd thus palamon ye knight trowe chere nede lytel sarmonyng make assenten thys thyng cometh nere taketh lady ye honde bytwyxt hem maked anon bonde hyght matrimony maryage counsayle baronage thus al blysse melodye hath palamon ywedded emelye pand god al world hath wrought sende loue yt hath dere bought nowe palamon al wele lyuyng blysse richesse hele emelye hym loueth tenderly serueth gentelly neuer ther worde bytwene ielousye tene thus endeth palamon emelye god saue al thys fayre companye phere endeth knyghtes tale foloweth myllers prologue whan knight thus hys tale ytolde al companye na ther yong ne olde ne sayd noble story worthy drawen memory namely gentyls euerychone hoste lough sware mote gone gothe right vnbokled male let se nowe shal tel another tale truely game wel begonne nowe telleth syr monke yf ye donne somwhat quyte knyghtes tale pthe myller dronken al pale vnnethes vpon hys horse satte ne nolde auale neyther hoode ne hatte ne abyde man hys curtesye pylates voyce began crye swore armes bloode bone noble tale none wol nowe quyte ye knight tale pour hoste sawe dronke ale sayd abyde robyn leue brother better man shal tel v fyrst abyde let v wirche thriftely pby goddes soule wol wol speke el go way hoste answerde tel dyuelway thou arte foole thy wytte ouercome nowe herkeneth quod yu myller al fyrst make protestacion dronke knowe soun therfore yf mispeke say wyte ale sothwarke pray wol tel legende lyfe bothe carpenter hys wyfe howe clerke set wrightes cappe pthe reue answerde said stynte thy clap let thy lende dronken harlottry synne eke great folye apayren man hym defame eke bryng wyues suche blame thou mayst ynouge thynges sayn thys dronke myller spake ful sone agayn sayd leue brother oswolde hath wyfe cokolde say therfore thou arte one ben ful good wyues many one arte thou angry tale haue wyfe parde wel thou yet nolde al ox plough take vpon ynough demen selfe one wol beleue none husbonde shulde ben inquisytyse goddes priuete ne hys wyfe fynde goddes foyson remenaunt nedeth nat enquere shulde say myllere nolde wordes man forbere tolde chorles tale manere forthynketh shal reherce therfore euery gentle wight pray demeth goddes loue say yuel entent mote reherce tale al ben better werse el fa en matere therfore lyst turne ouer lefe chose another tale ye shal fynde ynowe great smale hystorial thyng toucheth gentilnesse eke moralite holynesse blame yf ye chose amys myller chorle ye knowe wel reue eke mo harlotry tolde eke bothe two auyse put blame eke men shuld make ernest game phere endeth myllers prologue foloweth hys tale whylom ther dwellyng oxenforde ryche gnoffe yt gestes helde borde craft carpenter wyth hym dwelling poore scoler ylerned arte al fantasye turned lerne astrologye coude certayne conclusyons demen interogacions men asked hym certayne houres whan yt men shulde haue drought shoures yf men asked hym shulde befall euery thyng may reken al thys clerke cleped hende nycholas derne loue coude solas therto slye ryght priue ylyke mayden meke se chambre hostelry alone withouten company ful fetously dight herbes sote hym selfe swete rote lycores sytuwale almagiste bokes great smale lagour longyng hys arte augrym stone lyeng fayre parte shelues couched beddes heed hys presse ycouered foldyng reed al aboue lay gay sautrye whiche made nyghtes melodye swetely al chambre ronge angelus ad virginem songe songe kynges note ful ofte blessed hys mery throte thus swete clerke hys tyme spente hys frendes fyndynge hys rente pthys carpenter wedded new wyfe whych loued hys lyfe eyghtene yere age ielous kepte strayte cage wyld yonge olde demed hym selfe ben cokewolde knewe cato hys wytte rude bad men wedde similitude men shulde wedde astate youth elde often debate syth fallen snare must enduren folke hys care fayre yoge wyfe therwithal wysele body gentle smale seynte weared barred al wyth sylke barme clothe whyte morowe mylke vpon lendes ful many gore whyt smock embrouded al byfore eke behynde colere aboute cole blacke sylke within eke without tape whyte volypere sute colere fylet brode sylke set ful hye sykerly lykerous eye ful smale ypulled browes two tho bent black slo moche blysful se newe perienet tre softer wol wether gyrdel honge purse lether tassed wyth sylke perled wyth latoun al thys worlde seken vp doun ny man wyse yt couth thenche gay popelote gay wenche ful bryghter shynyng hewe towre noble forged newe songe loude erne swalowe syttynge berne therto couth skyppe make game kydde calfe folowyng hys dame mouth swete braket ye methe horde apple lyeng hey hethe wynsynge ioly colte longe maste vpryght bolte broche bare lowe collere brode bosse bokelere shoe lased legges hye primrole pyggeskye lorde lyggen hys bedde yet good yoman wedde pnowe sir efte sire byfel caas day thys hende nycholas fel thys yonge wyfe rage pley whyle husbonde oseney clerkes ben ful sotel queynte priuely caught queynte sayd wy haue wyll derne loue lemman spyll helde faste haunche bone sayd lemman loue wel one wol dyen also god saue spronge colte traue heed wrieth fast away sayd wol kesse say let quod let nycholas wol crye harrowe ala way handes curtesye thys nycholas gan mercy crye spake fayre profered hym faste loue graunted hym laste swore oth thomas kent wolde bene hys comaundement may leyser wel aspye husbonde ful ielousye ye wayte wel priue wotte ryght wel nam deed ye mote ben ful derne thys caas nay therof care ye quod nycholas clerke lytherly byset hys whyle yf couth carpenter begyle thus accorded ysworne awayten tyme haue sayd byforne whe nicholas thus euery dele thacked aboute lendes wele kyssed swete taketh hys sautry playeth faste maketh melody fel thus ye parysh cherche christes owne workes werche thys good wyfe wente vpon holydaye forheed shone bryght daye washe let werke pnow ther ye chirch parysh clerke whych cleaped absolon croulle hys heare golde shon strouted fanne large brode ful streyght euen lay hys ioly shode hys rode redde hys eyen gray goo poules wyndowes corue shoos hosen redde wente fetously gyrde ful smale properly al kyrtel lyght waget ful fayre thycke ben poyntes set therupon gay surplyse whyte blosome ryse mery chylde god saue wel coude let bloode clyppe shaue make chartre lande quytaunce twenty maner coude tryp daunce skole oxenforde tho wyth hys legges casten fro play songes smale rybyble therto songe somtyme loude quinyble wel couth playe geterne al towne na brewhouse ne tauerne ne vysyted wyth hys solas gay tapstere soth say somwhat squaimous fartynge speche daungerous pthys absolon ioly gaye goth wyth censer sondaye cencyng wyues paryshe faste many louely loke hem caste namely thys carpenter wyfe loke hym thought mery lyfe propre swete lycorous dare wel ayne yf ben mous catte wold haue hente anon thys paryshe clerke thys ioly absolon hath hys herte loue longynge wyse toke none offerynge curtesye sayd wolde none moone whe night bryght shone absolon hys geterne hath ytake paramour thought wake forth goeth ielous amerous tyl came carpenter hous lytle cockes ycrowe dressed hym shot wyndowe vpon carpenter wall syngeth hys voyce gentle small nowe dere lady yf thy wyl pray ye wol rewe ful wel accordyng hys geternynge pthys carpenter awoke herde synge spake vnto hys wyfe anon alyson here thou absolon chauteth thus vnder boures wal aunswerd husbande ther withal yes god wot hym euery dele passeth forth wil ye bet wele fro day day thys ioly absolon woeth hym wo bygon waketh al nyght al day kebeth hys locke brode made gay woeth meanes brocage swore wolde ben owne page syngeth brokkyng nyghtyngale sent pyment meth spyced ale wafres pypynge hotte glede toun profred mede folke wol wonne rychesse stroke getlenesse somtyme shew lyghtnes mastrye playeth heraudes skaffolde hye auayleth hym thys caas loueth thys hende nicholas absolon may blowe buckes horne ne hys laboure askorne thus maketh absolon ape al hys request turneth iape forsoth thys prouerbe lye men say thus alway nye slye maketh ferre loue loth though ye absolon woode wroth bycause ferre syght thus nye nycholas stode hys lyght beare well hende nycholas absolon may wayle synge ala byfel saterbay thys carpenter gone osnay hende nicholas alyson accorded thys conclusion nycholas shulde shapen hem wyle thys sely ielous carpenter begyle yf game went aryght shulde slepe hys armes al nyght thys hys desyre also ryght anone wythout wordes mo thys nycholas lenger wolde tarye doth ful softe vnto hys chambre carye meate drynke day twey husbande bade sey yf asked nycholas shulde saye nyst al daye sawe hym cyte trowed maladye crye mayde coude cal nolde answere naught yt might befal pthus passeth forth al ylke saterday nycholas styl hys chambre lay ete dranke slept dyd lyste tyl sonday sunne goeth reste pthys sely carpenter hath great maruayle nicolas thinge might eyle sayd drad saynte thomas stondeth aryght nycholas god shylde dyed sodaynly worlde nowe ful tykel sekerly sawe day corse borne cherche moday last saw werche go vp quod vnto hys knaue anone cleape dore knocke fast stone loke howe tel boldely pthis knaue wente vp ful sturdely chambre dore whyle stode cryed knocked woode howe ye mayster nicholay howe may ye slepe al longe day al naught herde aworde hole founde ful lowe vpon borde catte wonte crepe hole loked ful depe laste hym syght pthys nicholas sate euer gapyng vpright keyked newe mone gothe tolde mayster sone aray sawe thys ylke man pthis carpenter blyssen hym began sayd nowe helpe v seynt frideswyde man wot lytel shal hym betyde man fallen hys astronomye woodnesse agonye thought aye wel howe shulde men shulden knowe goddes priuete ye blessed alway leude man naught onely byleue right ferde another clerke wt astronomy walked feldes pry vpon sterres wete shulde befal tyl marlpyt yfal sawe yet saynte thomas reweth sore hende nicholas shal arated hys studyeng may iesus heuen kyng get staffe may vnderspore whyle thou robyn heuest vp dore shal hys studyeng gesse chambre dore gan hym dresse hys knaue stronge carle none haspe bare vp dore one store dore fel anone pthis nicholas sate styl stone euer gaped vpwarde eyre carpenter wende dispeyre hente hym shulders myghtyly shoke hym harde cryed spytously nicholas loke adowne awake thynke christes passyon crouche yt elues fro wicked wightes therwith nightspel said anonrightes foure halues house aboute thresholde dore without iesu chryst saynt benedyght blysse house euery wycked wight fro nyghtes mare wyte pater noster wonnest thou saynt peter suster pand laste thys hende nicholas gan syke sore sayd ala shal al worlde loste estsones nowe carpeter answerde sayst thou thinke god men yt swynke nicholas answerde fetch drinke wol speke priuete certayne thynges toucheth wol tellen none man certayne carpeter goth cometh agayn brought myghty ale large quarte whan eche hem dronke hys parte nicholas dore faste shette downe carpenter hem sette sayd iohn hoste myne lefe dere thou shalte vpon thy trouthe swere wight thou shalt cousel wrey christes counsayle say yf thou tel man thou arte forlore vengeauce thou shalte haue therfore yf thou wray thou shalt woode pnay christ forbyd hys holy bloode quod tho sely man blabbe ne though say lefe gabbe say thou wolte shal neuer tel childe ne wyfe harowed hel nowe iohn nicholas wol nat lye haue yfounden myn astrologye haue loked moone bright monday next quarter night shal fal rayne wylde woode halfe great neuer no floode world said lesse houre shal al dreynte hydous shoure thus shal mankynde drenche lese lyfe carpeter answerd said ala wife shal drenche ala myn alyson sorowe fel almoste adoun said remedye thys caas yes yes ful good quod hende nicholas thou wolt werche lore rede thou maist werche thyn hede thus sayeth salomon yt ful trewe worke al cousayle thou shalt rewe yf thou wylt werken good counsayle vndertake wythout mast sayle yet shal saue hast thou herde howe saued noe yt lorde warned hym byforne al ye worlde water shuld lorne yes quod carpenter ful yore ago phast thou herde quod nicholas also sorowe noe wyth hys feloshyp myght gete hys wyfe shyppe hym leuer dare wel vndertake thylke tyme al hys wether blake shyp herselfe alone therfor wost thou best done thys asketh haste hasty thynge men may preche ne make taryenge anone go get v fast thys inne knedyng trowe el kemelyn eche v loke ben large mowe swymme barge haue therin vytayles sufficiante day fye remenante water shal aslake gon awaye aboute prime vpon nexte daye robyn may wete thys thy knaue ne eke thy mayde gylle may saue aske though thou aske wol tel goddes priuete suffyseth yf thy wyttes madde haue great grace noe hadde thy wyfe shal wel saue doute go nowe thy way spede aboute thou hast ygetten v knedynge tubbes thre shalt thou hange hem ye rofe ful hye man purueyaunce espye yu hast done thus haue sayde hast vytayle fayre hem ylayde eke axe smyte corde two yt water cometh may go breake hole hye vpon gable vnto garden warde ouer stable may frely passen forth waye great shoure gone awaye shalt yu swym mery vndertake doth ye whyt ducke drake wol clepe howe alyson iohn mery floode wol passe anon thou wolt sayn hayle master nicholay good morowe se wel day shul lordes al lyfe al worlde noe wyfe one thynge warne ful ryght wel auysed ylke nyght entred shyppes borde none v ne speake worde ne clepe ne crye ben hys prayer goddes owne heste dere pthy wife thou mot hage farre twinne betwyxte shalbe synne lokynge shal dede thys ordinaunce sayd go god spede morowe nyght whe men al aslepe knedynge tubbes wol crepe sytten abydynge goddes grace go thy waye haue lenger space make thys lenger sermonyng men sayne thus send ye wyse say nothyng thou art wyse nedeth teche go saue lyues beseche pthys sely capenter goeth forth waye ful ofte sayd ala welawaye hys wyfe tolde hys priuete ware knewe bet al thys queynt cast sey natheles ferde wolde dry sayd ala go forth thy way anone helpe v skape deed echone thy trewe wedded wyfe go dere spouse helpe saue lyfe lo whych great thynge affection men may dye ymagynacion depe may impression take thys sely carpenter begynneth quake hym thynketh verely may se no stoode come waltrynge see drenchen alyson hys hony dere wepeth waileth maketh sory cher syketh wyth many sory thought gothe getteth hym knedyng trough tubbe kemelyn priuely sent hem hys hynge hem rofe ful priuely hys owne honde made hym ladder thre clymben ronges stalkes tubbes hongyng balkes hem vitayled trough tubbe wyth breed chese good ale tubbe suffysyng ryght ynowe daye er made al thys arraye sent hys knaue eke hys wenche also vpon hys nede london go ye monday drowe nyght shette dore without candel lyght dressed al thyng shulde shortly clomben vp al thre sytten styl fully furlonge way pater noster clum sayd nicolay clum iohan cluom sayd alison thys carpenter sayd hys deuocion styl syt byddeth hys prayere awaytynge rayne yf pthe deed slepe wery besynesse fel thys carpenter ryght gesse aboute curfewe tyme lytel trauayle hys gost groneth sore efte routeth hys heed myslay ye ladder stalketh nicolay alyson ful softe spedde wythout wordes mo went bedde carpenter woned lye reuel melodye thus lyeth alyson nycholas busynesse myrth solas tyl bel laudes gan rynge freres chaunsel gon synge pthys parysh clerke thys amerous absolo loue alway wo bygon vpon monday osenay wyth company hym dysporte play asked vpon case cloysterere ful priuely iohn carpentere drewe parte chyrche said saw wyrche syth saturday trowe went tymbre abbot hath hym sent wont tymbre go dwellen grange day two el hys house certayne sothly sayne thys absolon ful ioly lyght thouyt time walk alnight sekerly sawe hym sterynge hys dore syth day began sprynge mote thriue shal cockes crowe ful priuely knocke hys wyndowe stant ful lowe vpon hys boures wal alyson wol nowe tellen al loue longynge yet shal mysse leest way shal kysse maner comforte shal haue parfaye mouth hath ytched al thys longe daye sygne kyssynge leest alnyght mette eke feest therfore wol go slepe houre twey al nyght wol walke pley pwhen yt fyrst cocke hath crowe anon vp ryst thys ioly louer absolon hym arayeth gay queynt deuyce fyrst cheweth greyns lycoryce smellen sote kempt hys vnder hys tonge trueloue bere therby wende ben graciouse rometh carpenter house styll stante vnder shotwyndowe vnto hys brest raught lowe softe knocked wyth semely soun ye honycombe swete alysoun fayre byrde swete synamome awaketh lemman myne speaketh ful lytel thynken ye vpon wo loue swelt go wonder though swelte swete morne dothe lambe tete wy lemman haue suche loue longyng lyke turtle trewe mornyng may eaten may mayde go fro wyndowe iacke foole sayde helpe god swete saynt iame loue another el blame wel bet iesu absolon go forth thy waye wol caste ston let slepe twenty dyuelway palas quoth absolon welaway trewe loue euer yuel bysette kysse syn may bette iesus loue loue wylt yu go thy waye therwith pye certes lemman quoth thys absolon make redy come anon vnto nycholas sayd styl nowe peace thou shalt laugh thy fyl absolon set vpo knee sayd lorde al degree thys hope cometh lemman thy grace swete byrde thy nore wyndowe vndoth haste haue spede faste let neyghbours aspye absolo gan wype mouth ful drye derke nyght pytche cole ye wyndow put er hole absolon felte neyther bet ne wers mouth kyst bare er ful sauerly ware thys backe sterte thought amys wel wyste woman hath berde felte thyng al rowe longe herde sayd fye ala haue pte quod clapte wyndowe absolon gothe forthe sory paas berde berde sayd hende nycholas goddes corpus gothe fayre wele sely absolon herde euery dele hys lyppe gan angre byte selue sayd shal quyte rubbeth froteth lip dust wt sonde strawe chyps absolon saythe ful often ala soule betake sathanas leuer tha al town quod dispyte auenged palas quod ala yt ne ybleynt hotte loue colde al yqueynt fro tyme kyste er paramour set kers healed hys maladye ful ofte paramoures gan defye wepe dothe chylde ybete softe pace wente ouer strete vnto smythe men callen dan gerueys hys forge smyteth plowe harneys sharpeth share culters besyly absolon knocketh al easily said vndo gerneys anon pwhat arte thou absolon absolon christes swete tre ryse ye rathe ey benedicite eyleth gay gyrle god wote hath brought thus berytote saynte note ye wote wel mene pthis absolon ne raught bene al play worde agayne gasse hath towe hys distaffe geruays knewe sayd frende dere hote cultre chymeney lene haue therwith done wyl bryng agayne ful sone pgerueys answerde certes golde poke noble al vntolde thou shuldest haue trewe smyth eye cristes fote wol ye therwith therof quod absolon may shal wel tellen morowe day caught culter colde stele ful softe dore gan stele went vnto carpenter wal coughed fyrst knocked ther withal vpon wyndowe right dyd ere pthis alyson answerde knocketh warate thefe nay god wot swete lefe thyn absolon thyn owne derlyng golde haue ye brought ryng mother yaue god saue ful fyne therto wel ygraue wol yeue yf thou kysse nycholas ryssen pysse thought wolde amenden iape shulde kysse er er skape vp wyndowe dyd hastely er put ful priuely ouer buttockt haunche boon therwith spake clerke absolon speke swete byrde thou arte pthis nycholas anon let fleen farte great ben thunder dent stroke welny yblent redy hys yron hote nycholas arse smote gothe skyn hondbrede hotte cultor brende hys toute smerte wende dye woode gan crye helpe water water goddes herte carpenter hys slomber sterte herde one crye water wood thought ala cometh no flood sette hym vp without wordes mo axe smote corde two downe gothe al foude neyther sel breed ne ale downe shortly fel vpon flore swowne lay pvp sterte alyson hende nycholay cryed harrowe strete neyghbours smal grete ronne gauren thys man swoune lay palyshe wan fal brosten hath arme stonden muste vnto hys owne harme whan spake yborne adoun wyth hende nycholas alysoun told euery man woode agaste no floode throughe fantasye hys vanyte hath getten hym knedyng tubbes thre hath hem honged rofe aboue prayed hem goddes loue sytten roofe par companye folke gan laughen fantasye roofe kyken gape turned al hys ernest iape carpenter answerde naught man reason herde othes great ysworne adowne eueryche clerke anon helde said ye wood leue brother euery wyght gan laughen strife pthus swyued carpenter wyfe al hys kepyng hys ielousye absolon hath kyst neyther eye nycholas skalded toute thys tale done god saue al route phere endeth myllers tale foloweth reues prologue whan folke laughed thys nyce caas absolon hende nycolas dyuers folke dyuersly sayde parte loughe playde ne thys tale sawe man hym greue onely oswolde reue bycause carpenter crafte lytel yre hys herte ylafte gan grutchen blamen lyte sothly quod ful wel couthe ye quyte wyth bleryng proude myllers eye lyst speke rybaudrye eke olde lust play age grasse tyme done fodder forage whyte toppe writeth myne olde yeres sotyme yolow white myn here yet fare doth open er ylke frute euer lenger wers tyl otten molloke stre olde men dreden fare tyl rotten rype hoppe alway world wol pype wyl styketh euer nayle haue hore heed grene tayle hath leke though ourmight gone wyl desyreth folye euer one wha may tha wol speke yet asshen olde fyre yreken pfour gledes han whiche shal deuyse auauntyng lyeng angre couetyse four sparkle longen elde olde lymmes mowe wel ben vnwelde wyl ne shal fayle sothe yet haue alway coltes tothe many yere passed henne syn tappe lyfe began renne sikerly whan borne anone dethe drowe tappe lyfe let gone euer syns hath tappe yronne tyl almost al empty tonne streme life droppeth ye chimb sely tonge may wel ringe clymb wretchednesse passed ful yore olde folke saue dotage pwhan yt host herde sermoning gan speke lordly kyng sayd amounteth al thys wytte shal speke al day holy wrytte dyuel made reue preche souter shypman leche say forthe thy tale tary nat tyme lo depforde halfe way pryme lo grenewyche many shrewe tyme thy tale begyn pnowe sir quod oswolde reue pray al ye greue answere somdele set hys house leful force force shoufe dronken myller hath ytolde v howe begyled carpentere parauenture skorne one leaue shal hym quyte anone ryght churles termes wol speke pray god hys necke mote breke wel myne eye sene stalke owne sene balke phere endeth reues prologue phere begynneth reues tale trompynton far fro cambridge ther gothe broke ouer bridge vpon whyche broke ther stant mell sothe tel myller dwellyng many day pecocke proude gay pypen couthe fysshen nettes bete turne cuppes wel wrastle shere aye hys belte bare longe pauade sworde ful trenchaunt ye blade ioly popere bare hys pouche ther peryl durst hym touche shefelde thwytel bare hys hose roude face camysed nose pylled ape hys skull market beater full durst wyght honde ledge ne swore shulde abedge sothe corne mele slye vsaunt stele name hoten deynous symkyn wyfe comen noble kyn parson towne father yafe ful many panne bra symkym shulde bloode alye yfostred nonnerye symken wolde wyfe sayde wel ynourisshed mayde sauen hys astate yomanrye proude perte pye ful fayre syght vpon hem two holy dayes byforne wolde go hys typet wounden aboute heed came gyte reed symken hosen durst wyght clepen dame none hardy wente way one durst rage play yf wolde slayne symkyn pauade knyfe bodkyn ielous folkes ben perillous euermo algates wolde wyues wende eke somdele smoterlyche dygne water dyche ful hoker besmare thoughe lady shulde spare kyndred nortelrye lerned nonnerye pa doughter bytwyxt hem two twenty yere withouten mo sauyng chylde yt halfe yere age cradell lay propre page wenche thicke wel ygrowen wyth camysed nose eyen gray glas buttockes brode brestes rounde hye right fayre heare wol lie parson ye town fayre purpose maken hys heyre bothe hys catell hys mesuage straunge made maryage hys purpose stowen hye worthy blode auncetry holy church good mote ben dispended oh holy church blode discended therfore wolde hys holy blode honour though holy churche shulde deuour pgreat soken hath myller dout whete malte londe namely ther great college men clepen solere hall cambrege ther whete eke malt igroude day happed stounde sicke lay manciple malady men wenden wisely shulde dye myller stale whete corn hundred tyme besorn stale curteysly nowe thefe outrageously wiche warden chydde made fare therof sette myller nat tare craked bosted swore na nat tha yonge poore scholers two dwelten hall whiche say testife lusty play onely myrthe reuelrye vpon warden bestly crye yeue hem leaue lytel stounde gon sene corne ygrounde hardely durst lay necke myller shuld steale hem half pecke corne sleyght ne force hem reue last warden yaue hem leue iohan hight one aleyn hight ye town yt hight strother farre northe tel aleyn maketh al redy gere horse sacke caste anon forthe goth aleyn clerke also iohn good sworde bockeler syde iohn knewe way hym nedeth gyde myl dore sacke layth paleyn spake first al hayle symke fayth howe fare thy fayre doughter thy wyfe aleyn welcom quod symken lyfe iohn also ye god simod iohn nede pere behoueth serue selfe yt swain el fole clerkes sayne manciple hope wyl deed swa werkes aye wanges heed therfore come eke alayne grynde corne cary home agayne pray spede v heme ye may shalbe quod symkyn fay wol ye hande god ryght hopper wol stande quoth iohn sen gate ye corne goth yet sawe neuer father kyn howe hopper wagges fra alayne answerd iohan wylte thou sa wol byneth crowne se howe mele falles adowne troughe shalbe disporte quoth iohan fay may ben one sorte ill myllere ye myller smyleth nycite thought al ny done wyle w ne man may hem begyle thryfte yet shal blere eye al sleyght philosofye queynte clerkes make wol steale whan take stede floure yet wol gyue hem brene greatest clerkes ben wysest men whilom wolfe spake mare al arte counte tare pout dore gothe ful priuely whan sawe tyme subtelly loked vp downe tyl yfounde clerkes horse stode ybounde behynde mylle vnder lessel horse gothe fayre wel strypeth bridel ryght anon wha ye horse loce gan gon towarde fen wylde mare rynne forth wt wehe thicke thynne myller gothe agayne worde saide doth note wt clerkes playde tyl yt corne fayre wel ygrounde whan meale sacked ybounde iohn goth fonde hors away gan crye harowe welaway horse loste aleyne goddes bane steppe thy fete come forth al atanes ala wardeyn hys palfray lorne pthis aleyn al forgate bothe mele corne al mynde hys husbondrye whylke way gon gan crye wyfe came leapyng inwarde rene sayd ala gothe fenne wylde mare faste may go vnthake come hys honde yt bonde yt better shulde haue knyt reyne ala iohn aleyn christes peyne lay downe thy swerde shal myn alswa ful swyfte god wafe raa goddes sale shal skape v bathe ne haddest thou put capel ye lathe il heyle aleyn god thou fonne pthese sely clerkes han ful faste yronne towarde fenne aleyn eke iohn whan myller sawe yt ago halfe busshel floure hath take bade hys wyfe knede kake sayd trowe clerkes ferde yet myller make clerkes berde al arte yet let hem gon way lo gon let chyldren play get lightly crowne sely clerkes rennen vp downe kepe kepe iossa wartherere ga whystle thou sal kepe hym shortly tyl nyght couth though al might caple catche ran away faste tyl dyche caught hym laste p ery wete beestes rayne cometh sely iohn wt hym cometh alayn ala quod iohn day borne nowe dryuen hethe skorne corne stole men wol v fooles cal bothe warden felowes al namely myller waylaway thus playneth iohn gothe yt way towarde myll bayarde honde myller syttyng fyre fonde night ferther might nought loue god hym besought herbrough ease peny pthe myller said ayen ben suche yet shal ye haue part house strayte ye haue lerned art ye argument make place myle brode twenty foote space let se nowe yf thys place may suffyse make romer wt speche gyse symod said iohn saint cutberde aye thou mery fayre answerde haue herd sai shuld take twa thiges swylk fyndes swilke bringes specially pray hoste dere get v meate drinke make v chere wyl pay trewly ful empty honde men may haukes tul lo syluer redy spende myller ye towne doughter sende ale breed rosted hem goo bounde hors shulde go loo chambre made bedde shetes chalons fayre yspredde owne bedde ten fote twelue hys doughter bedde al selue right chambre myght bette cause ther rowmer herbrowe yt place soupen speken myrth solace dronken euer stronge ale beste aboute mydnight went reste pwel hath myller vernyshed heed ful pale dronken nothyng reed galpeth speketh nose quacke pose bedde gothe wyfe iay lyght iolyfe ioly whystel wel ywette cradell beddes fete sette rocken yeue chylde souke whan yt dronken al crouke bedde went daughter ryght anon bedde gothe aleyn eke iohn na hem neded dwale myller hath wisely bybbed ale horse snorteth hys slepe ne hys tayle behynde toke kepe wyfe bare hym bordon wel strong men might hem route forlonge wenche routeth eke par company paleyn clerke herde melody poked iohn saide slepest thou herdest thou euer swylke sange er nowe lo nuylke couplyng ytwyxt hem wylde fyre bodyes fal herde euer swylke ferly thyng ye shal haue floure yuel endyng al lange nyght tydes reste yet naforce al shal beste iohan sayd euer mote thriue may yon wenche wol swyue esement hath lawe shapen v iohn lawe saythe thus yf man one poynte ben greued shal releued corne stolne sothly nay haue yuel fyt day syn shal haue none amendement agayne losse wyl haue myn esement goddes sale shal none pthys iohan answerde aleyn auyse myller peryllous man sayde yf slepe abrayde myght v bathe vilonye aleyn answerd cout worth fly vp ryste wenche crept wenche lay vpright faste slept tyl nye er myght aspye ben late crye shortly sayne play aleyn wol speke iohn iohn lay styl forlonge way two hym selfe maketh routh wo ala wycked iape nowe may say ape yet hath felowe somwhat harme hath myllers doughter hys arme auntreth hym hath hys nede yspedde lye draffe sacke bedde whan iape tolde nother dey shal holde daffe cokeney wol aryse auntre fay vnhardy vnsely thus men say vp cose softely wente vnto cradel arme hent bare softely beddes fete sone wyfe routyng lete gan awake went pysse came agayn gan cradell mysse groped foude none ala almoste mysgone almost gone clerkes bedde eye benedycite foule yspedde forthe gothe tyl cradel fonde gropeth alway honde founde ye bedde thought nat good bycause cradel stode nyste derke fayre wel crepte clerke lyeth ful stil wold haue caught slepe within iohn clerke vp lepe good wyfe layde ful sore mery fyt nought ful yore pricked harde depe madde ioly lyfe haue two clerkes ladde tyl thyrde cocke began syng paleyn waxe wery dawnyng swonken al longe nyght sayd farwel malyn swete wyght day comen may lenger byde euermo go ryde thyn owne clerke haue hele nowe dere lemman go farwele thou go one thyng wol tell wha thou wendest homwarde mell ryght entre dore behynde thou shalt cake halfe busshel fynde ymaked thyn owne mele whiche helpe syre stele good lemman god saue kepe yt worde gan almoste wepe paleyn vprist thought er dawe wolde go crepen felawe founde cradel honde anon god thought al wronge haue gon heed totty swynke nyght maketh go aryght wot wel ye cradel haue mysse go lyeth myller hys wyfe also forthe gothe twenty dyuel way vnto bedde myller lay wende haue cropen felowe iohn myller crepte anon caught hym necke soft spake sayd iohan thou swynesheed awake christes soule noble game lorde called saynt iame haue thrise shorte nyght swyued myllers doughter bolt vpright whyles thou haste cowarde ben agaste ye false harlot quod myller haste false traytour false clerke quod thou shalte deed goddes dignyte durste bolde disparage doughter come suche lynage throte bolle caught alayn hent dispytously agayne nose smote fest downe ran blode streme vpon brest flore wyth mouthe nose ybroke walowen dothe pygges poke vp gon downe ayen anone tyl myller spurnde stone downe fyl backwarde vpon wyfe wyste nothyng nyce stryfe fal slepe lytel wyght iohn clerke yt waked alnyght fal slepe brayde helpe holy crosse bromholme sayde manus tuas lorde cal awake symonde fende fal herte broken helpe deed lieth one wombe heed helpe symkyn false clerkes fyght iohn stert vp fast euer might graspeth walles fro fynde staffe stert vp also knewe e tres bet tha dyd iohn wal founde staffe anon sawe lytel shemeryng light hole shone moone bright lyght sawe hem bothe two sykerly nyste sey whyte thyng eye whan gan whyte thyng aspye wende clerke weared voluper wt staffe drowe alway ner ner wende haue hyt aleyn ful smote myller pylled skul gothe cryed harowe dye clerkes bete hym wel let hym lye arayeth hem toke horse anon eke meale way gon mylle dore toke cake halfe bushel floure wel ybake thus proude myller wel ybete hath ylost gryndyng whete payde supper euery dele aleyn iohan bete hym wele hys wyfe swyued doughter al lo suche myller fals therfore prouerbe ful sothe hym dare wel wene yuel dothe gylour shal hym selfe begyled god sytte hye maieste saue al company great smale thus haue quyt myller tale phere endeth reues tale foloweth coke prologue coke london whyle reue spake ioye hym thought claude hym bake ha christes passyon myller hath sharpe conclusyon vpon argument herby gage wel sayd salomon hys langage ne bryng euery man thyn hous herbrowyng nyght perelous wel ought man auysed brought hys pryuete pray god yeue sorowe care euer sythen hyght hodge ware herde myller bette ysette awerke iape malyce derke god forbyd stynten therfore yf ye vouche safe tale poore man wol tel wel lytel iape fel cyte pour host sayd syr graunte nowe tel rodger loke good many pasty haste thou letten blood many iacke douer hast thou solde hath twyse hotte twyse colde many pilgrym hast thou christes curse thy parsse yet fare worse haue eaten wyth thy stobel goo thy shoppe manye slye loo nowe tel gentle rogere thy name yet pray wrothe game man may say ful sothe game play pthou sayst ful sothe roger say soth play quade play ye sleming saith therfore henry baylly thy fayth thou wrothe departen though tale ben hostelere nathelesse wol tellen yet er parte ywys thou shalte quyt therwithal lough made chere sayd tale ye shullen phere endeth coke prologue foloweth hys tale aprentise whilom dwelte cyte crafte vitaylers galiard goldfynch shawe browne bery proper shorte felawe locke blake kempt ful fetously daunce couthe ful wel ioltly called perkyn reuelour ful loue paramout hyue ful hony swete wel wenche wyth hym might mete euery bridal wolde syng hoppe loued bette tauernes shoppe whan ridyng chepe shoppe thider wolde lepe tyl al syght iseyn daunced wel wolde come ageyn gather hym meyny hys sorte hop syng make suche disporte setten steuyn mete playen dise suche strete cyte na prentise fayrer couthe casten payre dise perken couthe therto fre dispence place priuyte founde maister wele chafare oftymes founde bore ful bare sikerly prentise reuelour haunteth dise riotte paramour maister shal hys shoppe abye al haue parte mynstralcy thefte riotte ben conuertible al play gettron ribible reuel trouthe lowe degre ben ful wrothe al day men may se ioly prentise mayster abode tyl nye prentishode al snybbed bothe early late somtyme ledde reuel newgate last maister thought vpon day whan hys paper sought prouerbe saith worde welbette rotten apple horde rote al remenaunt fareth riottous seruaunt moche lesse harme let passe shende al seruautes place therfore maister gaue hym quitaunce badde go wt sorowe myschaunce thus ioly prentise leue nowe lette hym riot al nyght leue thefe without louke helpeth hym waste souke bribe borowe may anon sent hys bedde hys array vnto compere hys owne sorte loued dice reuel disporte wyfe helde countenaunce shoppe swyued sustenaunce phere endeth coke tale foloweth man lawes prologue ovr hoste saw wel bright sonne arke hys artifyciall daye hath ronne fourthe parte halfe hour though depe expert lore wyste eyghtene day apryl messanger may sawe wel shadowe euery tre lengthe quantyte body erecte caused therfore shadowe roke wit phebus whiche yt shone clere bright degree fourty clomben hyght daye latitude ten clocke gan conclude sodaynly plight hys horse aboute plordynges warne al ye route fourthe parte thys day gon loue god saynt iohn leseth tyme ferforth ye may lordinges tyme wasteth night day stealeth v priuely slepyng negligece wakyng doth ye streme turneth neuer agayn discendynge fro moutayne ye playn wel seneke many phylysofre waylen tyme golde cofre losse catel may recouered losse tyme shendeth v wol come ayen withouten drede wol malkyns maydenhede whan hath loste wantonnesse let v mowlen thus ydelnesse syr man lawe haue blys tel v tale anon forwarde ye ben submytted fre assent stonden case iugement aquyteth beheste haue ye done deuer leste phoste de pardeuxied assent breke forwarde myn entent byheste dette wol holde fayne al behest better sayne law yeueth wight shulde hym selue vsen ryght thus wol text natheles certayne right thrifty tale sayne chaucer though leudly metre rymyng craftely hath sayd hem suche englysshe olde tyme knoweth many man yf haue sayd hem leue brother one boke hath sayd hem another hath tolde louers vp doun mo ouyde made mencioun epystels ben ful olde shuld telle hem sythen ben tolde youthe made syxe al lone sythen hath spoken euerychone noble wyues louers eke wol hys large volume seke cleped sayntes lyues cupyde may se large woundes wyde lucresse babylon thisbe swerde dydo false enee tre phillis demophoon playnte deianire hermyon artadna hysiphilee ba ayne yle stondyng see dreynte lyandre hero teares heleyn eke wo brisets laodomia crueltie quene medium lytel chyldren hongyng hals iason loue fals hypermistra penelope alceste wyfehode comendeth beste certaynly worde ne writeth thylke wycked ensample canace loued owne brother synfully suche cursed story say fy el tyro appolloneus howe cursed kyng antyocus byrafte doughter maydenhede horrible tale rede whan drewe vpon pament therfore ful auisement nolde neuer write uon hys sermon suche vnkynde abhominations ne ne wol non reherce yef may tale howe shal thys day lothe lykened doutles mus men clepeth piryades methamorphoseos wotte mene natheles reche bene though come hym haubake speke prose let hym rymes make worde sobre chere began hys tale ye shullen phere endeth man lawes prologue foloweth hys tale hateful harme condycio pouert thurst colde hugre cofouded asken helpe shameth thyn hert thou non aske wt nede thou art wounded nede vnwrapeth al thy woudes hid maugry thyn heed thou must indygence stele begge borowe thy dispence thou blamest christ sayest ful bytterly misdeparteth rychesse temporall thy neyghbour thou wytest synfully sayest tyou haste lytel hath parfay sayst thou somtyme reken shall whan tayle shal brenne glede nought helpeth nedeful nede herken sentence wyse better dyen haue indygence thyne selfe neygbour wol dispyse thou poore farwel thy reuerence yet wyse man take thys sentence al dayes poore men ben wycke beware therfore thou come pricke thou poore thy brother hateth al thy frendes fleeth fro ala ryche marchauntes ful wele ye noble prudent folke caas bagges ben fylde ambes aa wt cyse synke yt renneth chauce christenmasse mery may ye daunce ye seken loude see wynnynges wyse folke ye knowen al state reignes ye ben father tidynges tale bothe peace debate right nowe tale desolate nere marchant gone many yere taught tale whiche ye shullen surrey whilo dwelte company chapman rych therto sad trewe wyde senten spicery clothes golde satten ryche hewe chafare thryfty newe euery wight hath deyntie chafare wyth hem eke sellen hem ware nowe fel maisters sorte han shapen hem rome wende chapmanhode disporte messangere wold thyder sende come hem selfe rome thys ye ende suche place thought auauntage entent taken herbygage soiourned ha marchautes ye town certayne tyme fel pleasaunce byfel excellent renowne emperours doughter dame custauce reported euery cyrcumstaunce vnto surreyn marchautes wise fro day day shal deuyse comen voyce euery man emperour rome god hym se doughter hath yt sythen worlde began reke wel goodnesse beaute na neuer suche nother pray god honour sustene wolde al europe quene hye beautie without pride youthe without grenhede folye al werkes vertu gyde humblesse hath slayne al tyrannye myrrour al curtesye herte chambre holynesse honde mynistre fredom almesse al voyce soth god trew purpose let v turne agayn marchates han fret ship new wha han blisful mayden seyn home surrey ben went ageyn done nedes han done yore lyuen welth say fel yt marchates stode grace hym soudon surrye wha yt came fro straunge place wolde hys benygne curtesye maken hem good chere besyly aspye tydynges sondry realmes lere wonder might seen amonge thynges specially marchantes haue hym tolde dame custaunce gret noblesse ernest ceryously soudo hath cauyt great plesace han fygure hys remembraunce al luste al hys besy cure loue whyle lyfe may dure parauenture ylke large boke cleped heue twritten sterres whan byrthe toke loue shulde han dethe ala sterres clerer glas written god wot coude rede dethe euery man withouten drede sterres many wynter byfore written deth hector achilles pompey iulius bore stryfe thebe hercules sampson turnus socrates dethe men wyttes ben dull wyght wel rede full soudo priue counsayle sene shortly thys mater pace hath hem declared al hys entent said certain yf might haue grace haue custauce withyn lytel space na deed charged hem hye shapen lyfe remedye diuers men diuersly sayden argument casten vp doun many subtell reason forthe layden speken magike abusyoun finally conclusyoun seen non auauntage ne non way saue maryage sawe therin suche difficulte way reason speke al playne bycause suche diuersyte bitwene bothe lawes sayne trow yt christen prince wolde fayne wedden hys chylde vnder lawes swete v taught mahounde prophete answerde rather lese custaunce wol christen doutels mote ben may non chese pray holde argumentes pee saueth lyfe recheles getten hath lyfe cure thys wo may long endure nedeth greater delatatyon say treatie ambassadrye pope meditation al chirche al cheualry distruction maumetry encrease christes lawe dere ben accorded ye shal howe soudon baronage al hys liege shulde ichristned shal han custaunce mariage certayne golde quantite fynde sufficient surete accord sworne eyther syde fayre custauce almyghty god ye gyde nowe wolde som men waiten gesse shulde tellen al purueyaunce emperour hys noblesse hath shapen hys daughter dame custace wel may men knowe gret ordynace may man tellen lytell clause arayde hyghe cause bishoppes ben shape wede lordes lady knightes renown folke ynowe ende notifyed throughout town euery wight great deuotioun shulde pray chryst mariage receyue gree spede voyage day come departyng say woful day natural come may lengre tarieng forwarde hem dresse al custaunce sorowe al ouercome ful pale arist dressheth wende wel sey non ende ala wondre though wept shal sent straunge nation fro frendes tenderly kept bounden vnder subiectyon one knoweth condityon husbondes ben al good han ben yore knowen wyues dare say father said thy wretched child custace thy yonge daughter fostred vp softe ye mother soueraigne pleasance ouer al thyng take christ lofte custaunce child comaundeth ofte vnto grace shal surrye ne shal neuer se eye ala vnto barbary nation must anon sithen wyl christ starfe redemption yeue grace hestes fulfyl wretched woma force though spyll woman borne thraldom penauce ben vnder mannes gouernaunce trow troy wha thurus brake ye wal ilyon ne whan brente thebe cite ne rome harme hanybal romayns hath inequeshed tymes thre na herde suche tendre wepyng pyte chambre departyng forth mote wheder wepe syng fyrst mouyng cruel firmament wyth thy diurnal swegh croudest aye hurtleste al fro eft occident naturally wolde holde another way thy croudyng set heuen suche array begynnyng feirs voyage cruel mar hath slayne maryage infortunate assendent tortuous whiche lorde helpelesse fal ala hys angle derkest house mar occiser thys caas feble moue vnhappy ben thy paas thou knittest yt thou nart receyued ther thou wel fro thece art yu wayued imprudent emperour rome ala philosofer thy towne tyme bette suche ca voiage none electiowne namely folke hye conditioun nat whan rote byrthe iknowe ala ben leude slowe ship brought woful faire mayd solempnely euery cyrcumstaunce nowe iesu christ al sayd ther ny fare wel fair custace payneth make good countenauce forthe let sayle manere tourne wol agayne matere pexplicit prima par et sequitur par secunda mother soudon wel vice aspyed hathe sonnes playne entent howe lete hys olde sacrifyces right anon counsayle sent ben comen know ment whan assembled thys folke fere sette sayd ye shal lordes quod ye knowen euerichone howe sonne poynt lete holy lawes alkaron yeuen goddes messangere machomete one auowe grete god hete lyfe shal rather body stert machomettes lawe go hert shulde v tyden thys newe lawe thraldome body penaunce afterwarde hel ben drawe reneyed mahounde creaunce lordes wol ye make assuraunce shal say assentyng lore shal make v safe euermore sworen assenten euery man lyue dye stonde eueriche best wise strengthen shal frendes fonde hath emprise take honde whiche ye shal shal deuise hem al spake thys wyse shul v fyrst fayne christendom take colde water shal greue v lyte shal suche reuel feest make trowe shal soudon quyte tho wife christened neuer white shal haue nede washe away rede though fonte ful water wt lede soudonnesse rote iniquite virago thou symyram secounde serpent vnder femenynete lyke serpent depe hell ybounde fayned woman al may counfounde vertu innocence throug thy malyce bredde nest euery vyce sathan enuyous syn thylke day thou chased herytage wel knewest thou woman olde way thou madest eue bryng v seruage thou wolte fordone christen maryage thyne instrument welaway whyle makest thou wome wha thou woltbegile soudonesse blame wery let priuely counsayle gon way shulde tale lenger tarye rydeth soudon day sayd hym wolde renye lay christendom prestes hondes fonge repentyng hethen longe besechyng hym done honour might haue ye christe folke feste plesen hem wol labour soudo saythe wol heste knelyng thanketh requeste glad nyst say kist sonne home goth way aryued ben christen folke londe surre great solempne route hastely soudon sent sonde fyrst mother al reygne aboute sayd hys wyfe comen doute prayde hem ryden ayenst ye quene honoure hys reygne sustene great prese ryche raye surreyens romayns ymette yfere mother soudon ryche gay receyueth al glad chere mother myght doughter dere vnto next cyte besyde softe paas solempnely ryde nought trowe triumphe iulyus whiche lucan maketh suche bost royaller curious thassemblyng blisful host scorpyon wycked gost sodonnesse al flatteryng cast vnder al thys ful mortally styng soudon cometh himselfe sone ryally wonder tel welcometh wyth moche ioye blys thus myrthe ioye let hem dwel fruyte euery tale tel tyme come thought best reuel stynte men gone rest tyme come olde soudonesse ordened hath ye ferst whych tolde feest christen folke hem dresse general yonge olde may men feest ryalte beholde deyntes mo deuyse al dere boughten ryse soudon wo yt euer thou art successour worldly blisse springed bytternesse ende ioye worldly laboure wo occupyeth ende gladnesse herken thys counsayle thy sekernesse vpon thy glad day haue thou mynde vnware wo harm yt cometh behynde shortly tellen worde soudon christen euerychone ben al hewe stycked borde onely dame custaunce alone thys olde soudonnesse curled crone hath wyth fredes done thys cursed dede selfe wolde al countre lede ne surreyn none yt couerted cousayle soudon wot na al heawe er asterted custauce han taken anone fotehot shyppe al sternelesse god wot han set bydden lerne sayle surrey ayenwarde itayle certayne tresour thyder ladde soth sayne vytayle great plente han yeuen clothes eke sorth sayled salte se custaunce ful benignite emperours yonge doughter dere lorde fortune thy stere blesseth wt ful pytous voyce vnto crosse christ tho sayd clere welful aulter holy croice reed lambes blode ful pyte washe ye worlde fro ye olde iniquite fro fende fro hys clawe kepe daye shal drenchen depe victorious tree protection trewe onely worthy bere kynge heue hys woudes newe whyte lambe hurt wt spere flemere fendes hym whych thy lymmes faythfully extenden kepe yeue myght lyfe amede yeares dayes fleteth thys creature thrughout ye see grece vnto strayte marocke auenture many sory mele may bayte death ful ofte may wayte wylde waues wolde dryue vnto place shulde aryue men mighte aske slayne eke feest myght body saue answere demaunde agayne saued daniel horrible caue ther euery wyght master er knaue wyth lyon frette asterte wyght god bare herte god lyst shewe wonderful myracle shuld sene mighty werkes christ euery harme tryacle certayne meanes often knowe clerkes doth thinge certayne ende yt ful derke man wytte ignoraunce ne knowe hys prudent purueyauce syth yt ye feest yslawe kepeth fro drenchyng see kept ionas fyshes mawe tyl spouted neniue wel may knowe wight kept ye people ebrake drenchyng wyth drye fete see passyng hath foure spirites ye tempeste power anoye lande see north south also west este anoyeth nether see ne lande ne tre sothly comaunder therof fro ye tempest aye thys woman kepte wel woke slepte wher might woma mete drynke haue thre yere lasteth vitayle fedde egipcyan marye caue deserte none christ sans fayle fyue thousand folk gret maruaile loues fyue fysshes two fede god sent toyson great nede driueth forthe occian throughout wylde see tyl laste vnder holde nempne ne fer northumberlode waue caste sande shyppe stycked faste thence nolde al tyde wyl christ yt shuld ther byde constable castel downe fare seen wrecke al shyp sought fonde wery woman ful care founde also tresoure brought langage mercy besought lyfe body twyn delyuer wo mauer latyn corrupte speche algates therby vnderstonde constable wha hym lyst lenger seche thys woful woman brought londe kneleth downe thaketh goddes sonde wolde man sey soule ne fayre though shulde dey sayd mased see foryate mynde trouthe constable hath great pyte eke wyfe wepen routh dyligent withouten slouthe serue plese eueryche place al louen loken face costable dame hermegilde wyfe paynems cotre euery hermegylde loued ryght lyfe custaunce hath long soiourned orison many bytter tere tyl iesu hath conuerted grace dame hermegylde costablesse place al londe durst christen route al christen folke ben fledde coutre paynems conquered al plage north londe see wale fledde christianyte olde breton dwellyng ile refuge meane whyle yet na ther neuer christe breto exiled na priuete honoured christe heathen folke begyled nye castel suche dwellen thre one hym blynde might se thylke eyen mynde whiche men seen ben blynde bright sonne somers day whiche constable wyfe also custaunce han taken ryght way towarde see furlong waye two playen roman fro walke thre blynde men met croked olde eyen faste yshette ye name christ cryed blind breto dame hermegylde yeue syght agayne lady ware frayde soun leste husbonde shortly sayne wold iesus christes lore haue slayne til custace made bolde bad werch wyl christ doughter cherch costable wore abashed syght sayd amounteth al thys fare custance answerde syr christes might helpeth folke fendes snare soferforth gan lawe declare constable er eue couerted hath christ made hym bileue costable nothing lord place speke ther custaunce fonde kept strongly many wynter space vnder alla kyng northumberlonde ful wyse worthy hys honde agayne scottes men may wel tourne wol agayne matere sathan euer v wayteth begyle sawe custaunce al perfectioun cast anon might quyte wyle made yong knight yt dwelt toun loue hotte foule affectioun verily hym thought yt shulde spyll one might haue wyll woeth aueyled nought wolde synne wey dispyte compassed thought maken shamfull dethe dey wayteth whan constable awey priuely nyght crepte hermegildes chambre whyle slept wery forwaked orison slepeth custaunce hermegylde also knight sathans teptacions al softely bedde ygo cut throte hermegylde two layde ye blody knyfe dame custauce went waye ther god yeue myschaunce sone cometh ye costable home agayne eke alla kynge lande sawe hys wyfe dyspytously yslayne whych wepte wronge hande bedde blody knyfe fonde dame custace ala myght say wo wytte al away kynge alla tolde al myschauce eke tyme wyse shyppe fouden custauce ye han herde deuyse kynges herte pyte gan aryse sawe benygne creature fal dysease mysaduenture ye labe towarde hys death brought stante innocent beforne kyng fals knight yt hath treso wrought bereth yt hath thing nathelesse great mornyng amonge people sayd gesse done great wyckednesse han sene euer vertuouse louyng hermegylde right lyfe bare witnesse eueryche house saue hermegyld slow wt hys knyfe getle kyng hath caught great motyfe wytnes thought wold enquere deper thys case trouth lere ala custaunce thou hast champion ne fyght canst thou welaway starft redempcion bonde sathan yet lyth laye thy stronge champion thys daye yf christ myracle kyth without gylt thou shalt slayne aswyth set doune knee thus sayde immortal god sauedest susanne fro false blame thou mercyful mayde marye meane doughter saynt anne byforne whose chylde angel synge osanne yf gyltlesse thys felonye socoure el shal dye haue ye sene somtyme pale face amonge prees hym hath ben lad toward deth wher get grace colour face hath might know face yt bystad amonges al face route standeth custaunce loketh aboute quenes lyuynge prosperite duchess ye ladyes euerychone haue routh aduersite emperours doughter stante alone hath wiyt make hermone bloode royal stondeth drede farre ben thy frendes thy great nede thys alla kyng hath compassioun gentle herte ful pyte hys eyen ran water doun nowe hastely fette boke quod yf thys knyght wol swere thys woman llowe yet wol v auyse wol shal ben iustyse breton boke wrytten wyth euangeles fette theron swore anone gylty meane whyles hande hym smote necke bone downe fyl atones stone hys eyen brast hys face syght euery body place voyce herde generall audience sayd thou hast dysclandred gyltles doughter holy chyrch hye presence thus hast thou done yet holde pee maruayle agast al prees dysmayde folke stoden euerychone drede wreche saue custaunce alone great ye drede eke repentauce hem hadden wrought suspection vpon thys sely innocent custaunce thys myracle conclusion custaunces mediation kynge many another place conuerted thanked goddes grace false knight slayn vntroth iudgement alla hastely yet custauce death gret roth iesus hys mercy made alla wedden ful solempnely thys holy mayde bryght shene thus hath christ made custauce quene woful yf shulde lye thys weddyng donogelde mo kynges mother full tyranny thought cursed hert brast two wolde sonne thought despyte shulde take straunge creature vnto hys make lyst chaffe ne stree make longe tale corne shulde tel royalte ye mariage whych course goth besorne bloweth trompe horne frute euery tale saye eaten drynken daunce playe gon bedde skyl ryght though ye wyues ben ful holy thynges must take pacience anyght maner necessary ben pleasynges folke han wedded hem rynges lay lytel holynesse asyde tyme may none betyde gatte man chylde anone byshoppe hys constable eke toke hys wyfe kepe gone scotlandwarde hys fo men seke fayre custace yt humble meke longe gone wyth chylde tyl styl halte chabre abyding christes wyl tyme come man chylde bare mauricius fontstone hym calle constable doth forth come messanger wrote hys kynge yt cleped alle howe thys blysful tydynge byfal tydynges nedeful say taketh letter forth goth way thys messanger done hys anauntage vnto kynges mother rydeth swythe salueth ful fayre hys langage madame quod ye maye glad blythe thanketh god hudred thousand sythe lady quene hath chylde wythoute doute ioye blysse thys reygne aboute lo letter sealed thys thynge mote beare al hast may yf ye wol ought vnto sonne kynge seruaunt nyght day donegylde answerde thys tyme nay wol al nyght thou take thy reste morowe wol say leste messager droke sadly ale wyne stolen hys letter priuely hys bore whyle slepte swyne counterfeted ful subtelly another letter wrought ful synfully vnto kynge dyrecte thys matere fro hys constable ye shal letter sp ke quene delyuered horrible fendlyche creature castel none hardy whyle durst therin endure mother else auenture come charmes sorcery euery wyght hateth company wo kyng whe yt letter seyn wyght tolde hys sorowes sore wyth hys owne honde wrote ageyn welcome sonde christ euermore newe lerned hys lore lorde welcome thy lust thy pleasaunce iust put al thyne ordynaunce kepeth childe al foule fayre eke wyfe vnto myne home comyng christ lyst may sende heyre agreable thys lykynge thys letter sealeth priuely wepynge whych messangere taken sone forth goth ther ny done messanger fulfylled dronkennesse stroge thy breth thy lymmes faltre aye thou bewrayest al secretnesse thy mynde lorne thou ianglyst iaye thy face turned newe araye dronkennesse reyneth route ny cousayle hyd wythoute doute donegild ne haue englysh digne vnto thy malyce thy tyrannye therfore fende resygne let hym endyte thy traytrye fye mannyshe fye nay god lye fye fendyshe spirit dare wel tel though thou walke thy spirit hel messager cometh fro ye kynge agayne kynges mother house lyght thys messanger ful fayne pleased hym al euer myght dronke wel hys gyrdel vnder pyght slepeth snorteth hys gyse al nyght tyl sonne gan aryse efte hys letter stolen euerychon counterfeted letter thys wyse kynge comaundeth hys constable anon vp payne hongyng hye iewyse ne shulde sustren wyse custaunce wythin hys realme abyde thre dayes quarter tyde shyppe fonde yonge sonne al gere shulde croude put fro londe charge neue eft come custaunce wel may thy goste haue fere slepynge thy dreame ben penauce donegylde cast al thys ordynaunce messager ye morow woke vnto castel halte nexte way constable letter toke thys pytous letter sey ful ofte sayd ala welaway lord christ may world endure ful synne many creature myghty god yf thy wyl syn thou art ryghtful iuge may thou wylt suffer innocence spyl wycked folke raygne prosperite good custaunce ala wo mote thy tourmetour el dey shame death ther ny none wey wepen yonge olde place kynge thys cursed letter sent custaunce wyth deadly pale face fourth day towarde shyp went nathelesse taketh good entent wyl christ knelyng stronde sayd lorde aye welcome thy sonde kepte fro false blame whyles lande amonge kepe fro harme eke fro shame salte see al though se howe stronge euer nowe hym truste hys mother dere sayle eke stere lytel chylde lay wepynge arme knelynge pytously hym sayde peace lytel sonne wol none harme wyth kercher heed brayde ouer hys lytel eyen layde arme lulleth ful faste heuen eyen vp caste mother quod mayde bright mary soth woman eggement mankinde lorne dampned aye dye whych thy chylde crosse yrent thy blysful eyen sawe al hys turment comparison bytwene thy wo wo man may sustene thou se thy chylde yslayne byfore thyn eyen yet lyueth lytel chylde parsaye nowe lady bryght al woful cryen thou glory womanheed thou fayre may thou hauen refute bryght sterre day rewe chylde thy gentylnesse rewest euery ruful dystresse lytel chelde ala thy gylte neuer wroughtest synne yet parde wol thyne hard father haue spylte mercy dere constable quod let lytel chylde dwel wyth yf thou darst sauen hym fro blame kysse hym one hys father name therwyth loketh backward ye lode sayd farewel husbande routhlesse vp ryst walked downe stronde toward shyp foloweth al prees euer prayeth child holde pee taketh leue holy entent blesseth ye shyppe went vitayled shippe drede habundantly sor full long space necessary shulde nede inowe heried goddes grace wynde weder almighty god purchace bringe home better say see driueth forthe way alla kyng cometh home sone vnto hys castel whyche tolde asketh wyfe hys chylde constable gan aboute hys herte colde playnly al maner hym tolde ye han herde tel better sheweth king seale letter sayd lorde ye commaunded vp payne dethe haue done certayne messanger turmented tyl must beknowen tel plat playne fro night night place lain thus wytte subtel enqueryng ymagened harm ga spring honde knowe yt letter wrote al venym cursed dede wyse certaynly note effecte alla drede mother slow may men playnly rede traytoure alegaunce thus endeth old douegild mischauce sorowe alla nyght day maketh hys childe hys wyfe also tonge tel may nowe wol custaunce go fleteth see payne wo fyue yere lyked christes sonde shyppe aproched vnto londe vnder hethen castel laste whiche name text fynde custaunce eke chylde set vp caste almighty god saueth al mankynde haue custace chyld mynde fallen hethen honde efte sone poynte spyl shal tel sone downe fro castel cometh ther many wight gauren shyppe custaunce shortly fro castel nyght lordes stewarde god yeue mischau ce thefe renyed ceaunce came shyp alone sayd sholde lemman whether wolde nolde wo wretched woman tho bygo chylde cryed cryed pitously blysful marye holpe anon stroglyng wel mightyly thefe ouer borde al sodaynly see drenched vengaunce thus hath christ vnwemed kept custace soule luste luxure lo thyn ende nat onely thou fayntest man mynde verily thou wolt body shende ende thy werke thy lustes blynd coplayning many one may fynd werke somtyme thetent synne ben eyther slayne shent may weke woma haue yt stregth defende agaynst renegate golyas vnmesurable length howe might dauid make mate yonge armure desolate howe durst loke thy dredful face wel may men goddes grace yaue iudith courage hardynesse sleen hym holofernes hys tente delyuer wretchydnesse people god say entent ryght god spyrite vygore sente hem saued hem mischaunce sent might vigore custaunce forth goth ship thorow ye narow mouth subalter septe fletyng aye somtyme weste somtyme northe south somtyme este ful many wery daye tyl christes mother yblessed aye hath shapen endlesse goodnesse make ende al heuynesse pexplicit secunda par et sequitur par tertia let v stynte custance throwe speke romayne emperoure surrey hath letter knowe slaughter christen folke dishonour done hys doughter false traytour meane cursed wycked soudonnesse feest let sleen bothe lesse whiche emperour hath sent anon hys senatour royal ordinaunce lordes god wote many one surreyns done hye vengeaunce brenne sleen bringe hem mischace ful many day shortly ende homward rome shape hem wede senatour repayreth victorye rome warde saylyng ful royally met shyp dryuyng sayth story whiche custaunce sate ful pitously nothyng knewe ne suche array ne nolde sey estate thoug shulde dey bryngeth rome wyfe yaue yonge sonne also senatour ladde lyfe thus lady bryng wo woful custaunce many another mo longe tyme dwelled place holy werkes euer grace senatours wyfe aunte al knewe neuer wol lenger tarye thys caas kyng alla ye whiche spake yore hys wyfe wepeth syketh sore wol retourne let wyl custaunce vnder senatours gouernaunce pkyng alla yt mother slayne vpon day fel suche repentaunce yf shortly tellen al shal playne rome cometh receyue hys penauce putten church ordinaunce hye lowe iesu christ besought foryeue hys wycked werkes yt wrought fame anon rome town born howe alla kyng shal come pilgrymage herbegers wenten hym byforne whiche senatour vsage rode hym agayne many hys lynage wel shewen hys hye magnifycence done kyng reuerence pgreat chere dothe thys noble senatour kyng alla hym also eueryche hem dothe great honour byfel day two senatour kyng alla go feest shortly yf shal lye custaunces sonne went hys companye som wold sayne ye request custance senatour ladde thys childe feest may tellen euery circumstaunce may leste sothe right hys mother heste byforn alla duryng meate space chylde stode lokyng kynges face alla kyng hath thys chyld great wonder senatour sayd anon whose ye fayre chyld stondeth yonder quod god saynt iohn mother hath father hath non wote shortly stounde tolde alla howe childe founde god wote quod senatour also vertuous lyuer lyfe ne sawe neuer ne herde mo wordly woman mayden ne wyfe dare wel say leuer knyfe brest ben woma wycke couthe bryng yu pricke nowe chylde lyke custaunce possyble creature alla hath face remembraunce dame custaunce theron mused yeue childes mother aught wyfe priuely syght spedde hym fro table myght parfay thought ye fantome myn heed ought deme skylful iugement salte see wyfe deed afterwarde made hys argument wot yf christ hath hyther sent wyfe see wel sente countrey fro then yt wente anone home wyth senatour goeth alla se thys wonder chaunce thys senatour doth alla great honour hastely sente custaunce trusteth wel lust daunce wyst wherfore sonde vnneth vpon fete myght stonde whe alla saw wife fayre gret wept rough se fyrst loke set knewe wel verely sorowe dombe stante tre herte shet dystresse remembreth hys vnkyndnesse twyse sowned owne syght wepeth hym excuseth pytously nowe god hys hallowes bryght wylly soule haue mercy harme gyltlesse maurice sonne lyke face el fende fetch thys place longe ye sobbyng bytter payne woful herte myght cese great pyte hem complayne thrugh plaintes gan wo encrese pray al laboure relese may tel wo tyl morowe wery speake sorowe fynally ye soth wyste alla gyltlesse wo trowe hundred tymes ben kyste blysse bytwyxt hem two saue ioye lasteth euermo lyke creature hath seyen shal whyle ye world may dure tho prayed husbande mekely relesynge pytous payne wolde praye father specially hys maiesty wolde enclyne vouchsafe somdaye wyth hym dyne prayed hym eke shulde waye vnto father worde saye wold say yt chyld maurice doth thys message vntyl thys emperour gesse alla nyse hym soueraygne honour christen folke flour sent chylde bette deme went hym selfe may wel seme thys emperour graunted gentelly come dyner hym bysought al redy loked besely vpon chyld doughter thought alla goeth hys ynne hym ought arrayde thys feest euery wyse farforth hys connynge may suffyce morow came alla gan hym dresse eke wyfe emperour mete forth ryde ioye gladnesse sawe father strete lyght downe falleth hym fete father yonge chylde custaunce nowe ful clene remembrauce doughter custaunce whylom ye han sent surrye father salte see put alone dampned dye nowe good father mercy crye sende hethennesse thanken lorde hys kyndnesse pytous ioye tellen al bytwyxt hem three syn thus ymette tale make ende shal day goth fast wol longer lette thys glad folke dyner ben sette ioye blysse meate let hem dwell thousande folde welmore tel chyld mauris sythin emperour made pope lyued christenly christes churche dyd great honour let al thys story passen custaunce tale specially olde romayne iestes men may fynde maurys lyfe beare mynde kynge alla hys tyme sey wyth thys custauce holy wyfe swete englande ben come ryght wey lyue ioye quyete lytel whyle lasteth hete ioye worlde tyme wol abyde fro daye nyght chaungeth tyde
