lyued euer delyte daye ne meued eyther conscience yre tallent kyn affraye enuye pryde passion offence ne saye thys ende thys sentence lytel whyle ioye pleasaunce lasteth blysse alla wyth custaunce deth yt taketh hye lowe rente passed yere euen gesse thys worlde kynge alla hente custauce hath ful gret heuynesse nowe let v prayen god hys soule blesse dame custaunce fynally say towarde ye towne rome goeth way rome come thys holy creature fyndeth father hole sounde nowe skaped al auenture father hath yfounde downe knee goeth grounde wepynge tendernesse herte blythe heryeth god hudred thousand sythe vertue holy almesdede lyuen al neuer sonder wende tyl death departen hem thys lyfe lede fareth nowe wel tale ende iesu christ yt myght may sende ioye wo gouerne v hys grace kepe v al ben thys place pthus endeth man lawes tale foloweth squyers prologue ovr hoost hys styroppes stode anone sayd good men herkeneth euerychone thys thryfty tale none syr parysh preest goddes bone tel v tale thy forwarde yore se wel ye lerned men lore moche good goddes dignite parson hym answerde benedicite cyleth man synfully swere pour host answerd ienkyn ye good host herkeneth smel loller wynde abydeth goddes dygne passion shall haue predication thys loller wol prechen v somwhat pnay father soule shal nat sayd squyer shal preche shal gospel glose ne teche leueth al great god quod wolde sowen dyffyculte sprynge cockel clene corne therfore hoost warne byforne lolly body shal tale tel shal ryngen mery bel shal waken al thys companye shal ben philosofye ne phisyke ne termes queynte lawe lytel laten mawe phere endeth squyers prologue hereafter foloweth hys tale sarra lade tartary dwelt kynge warred surry thrugh ther died many douyty thys noble kynge called cambusca whych hys tyme great renoun na regioun excellent lorde al thynge hym lacked naught longed kynge secte whych borne kept hys laye whych sworne therto hardy wyse ryche pytous iuste alwaye ylyche trewe worde benygne honorable hys corage centre stable yonge freshe stronge armes desyrous bacheler al hys hous fayre person fortunate kept alwaye royal astate na another man noble kyng tartre cabusca two sonnes eltheta hys wyfe whych eldest hyght algarsyfe cleped camballo pa doughter thys worthy kynge also yongest hyght canace tel al beaute lyeth tonge ne connynge dare vndertake hye thynge myne englyshe eke vnsufficient muste rethor excellent couth colour longyng ye arte yf shulde dystryue euery parte none muste speake byfel thys cambuscan hath twenty wynter borne hys dyademe wonte fro yere yere deme let feest hys natiuite done cryen throughout sarra hys cyte laste ydus marche yere phebus sonne full oly clere nye hys exaltation martes face hys mantion aries collorike hote sygne ful lusty wether benygne whych foules agaynst ye sonne shene season yonge grene ful loude songe affection hem semed han getten hem protection ayen swerde wynter kene colde pthys cabusca haue tolde royal vestementes syt hys deys wyth dyademe ful hye hys paleys helde hys feest royal ryche thys worlde na none lyche whych yf shall tel al array wolde occupye sommers day eke nedeth deuyse euery course ordre seruyce wol tel straunge sewes ne swannes ne heronsewes eke lande tellen knyghtes olde ther meate ful dainty holde thys lande men retche smal man maye reporten wyl tarye pryme frute losse tyme vnto fyrst purpose wol haue recourse pand byfel thyrde course whyse thys kyng syt thus noblay herkenyng minstralles thinges play beforne hym hys borde delicyously halfe dore al sodeynly come knyght stede brasse hys honde abrode myrrour glasse vpon hys thombe golde rynge hys syde naked swerde hongynge vp rydeth hye borde al hall ne spoke worde maruayle ye knyght hym beholde ful besely wayten yonge olde pthis strauge knyght yt come thus sodenly al armed saue hys heed ful royally salued kynge quene lordes al ordre sytten hall wyth hye reuerence obeysaunce wel speche countenaunce gawyn wyth hys olde curtesye thoughe come ayen fayre ne coude amende worde hye borde manly voyce sayd message forme vsed langage without vyce syllable letter tale shulde seme better accordant wordes chere teacheth arte speche hem lere al sowne style ne ne clymben hye style yet saye thus comen entente thus much amouteth al euer mente yf haue mynde phe sayd kynge araby ynde liege lorde thys solempne day salueth best may sendeth honoure feest redy heest thys stode brasse easely wel space daye naturel say foure twenty houres ye lyst drought shoures beren body euery place whych herte wylleth pace without weme foule faire yf ye lyst fleen eyre doth egle hym lyst sore stede shal beare euermore withouten harme tyl ye ben leste though ye slepen backe rest turne agayn ye writhyng pyn wrought coude ful many gyn wayted ful many constellation done operatyon knew ful many seale many bonde myrrour eke yt haue myne honde hath myght men may se shal fallen aduersite vnto reygne selfe also openly se frende foe ouer al thys yf lady bryght hath set herte myner wyght yf false shal treason se hys newe loue al hys subtylte openly shal nothynge hyde wherfore agayne lusty sommer tyde thys myrrour thys rynge ye maye se hath sente lady canace excellent doughter pthe vertue thys rynge yf ye woll thys yf lyst vpon thombe purse bere foule fleeth vnder heuen ne shal vnderstande hys steuen knowe hys meanynge openly playne answere hym hys langage agayne euery grasse groweth vpon rote shal wel know wol bote al hys woudes neuer depe wyde pthis naked swerde yt hangeth syde vertue hath yt man ye smyte throughout armure wol karue byte thycke braunched oke wouded wyth yu stroke shal neuer hole tyl lyst grace stroken ye platte thylke place hurte thys moche sayne ye mote wyth platte swerde agayne stroken hym wounde wol close thys soth wythouten glose fayleth whyles holde whe kniyt hath thus tale tolde rydeth halle downe lyght hys stede whych shone sonne bryght stante courte styl stone knyght chambre ladde anone vnarmed meate ysette al harneys byforne hym sette sayne swerd eke ye myrrour al borne hye tour wyth certayne offycers ordeyned therfore ca ace rynge bore solemnely sat table sekerly wythout fable horse brasse yt may remeued slante grounde yglewed maye man place dryue none engyne wyndlas polyue cause crafte therfore place hau lafte tyl yt kniyt hath taught hem ye manere voyden hym ye shal pgreat ye prees swarmed fro gauren horse standeth hye brode longe wel proporcioned ben stronge ryght stede lumbardye therwyth horsly quycke eye gentle courser poyle certes fro hys tayle hys ere nature ne arte coude hym amende degre al people wende euermore moste wonder howe couth gon bra fayrie people semed dyuers folke dyuersly demed many heedes many wyttes ben murmure doth swarme made skylles fantesyes rehersynge olde poetryes sayden ylyke pegase horse wynges flee el grekes horse synon brought troye dystruccion men thys olde bokes rede myne herte one euermore drede trowe men armes ben therin shapen hem thys cytie wyn right good yt thynges know rowned felow low sayd lyed rather ylyke apparence made magyke iogglours playen feastes grete sondry thoughtes thus iagle trete leude people demeth comenly thynges ben made subtelly leudnesse comprehende demen gladly badder ende wondren ye myrrour borne vp mayster toure howe men myght thynges se answerd certes myght wel naturally composicyons angel slye reflection sayden rome suche speken alocen vitilion aristote wryteth lyues queynte myrrours prospectiues knowen han bokes herde folke han wodred ye sworde wolde perce euery thynge fel speche telophus kynge achylles hys queynte spere couth wyth heale dere right wyse may wt swerde right ye haue selue herd speken sondry hardyng metal speken medycyns eke wythal shulde hardened whych vnknowe algate ptho speake canaces rynge sayden al suche wonder thynge crafte rynges herde neuer non saue moses kynge salomon name connynge arte thus sayen people drawe hem aparte nathelesse sayden wonder maken serue ashen glas yet glas yke ashen ferne han knowen ferne therfore sesen iaglyng woder sore wondren cause thoder ebbe fludde gossomer myste al thynge tyl cause wyste thus ianglen deme deuyse tyl kyng gan fro hys borde aryse pphebus hath lefte angle merydional yet ascendyng beest royal gentle lyon aldrian whan tartre kyng cambuscan rose borde sate ful hye byforne hym gothe loude mynstralcye tyl came hys chambre paramentes sownen dyuers instrumetes lyke heuen nowe dauncen lusty venus chyldre dere fyshe lady sate ful hye loketh hem frendly eye pthis noble kyng sette vpon hys trone straunge knyght fet hym ful sone daunce gothe canace reuel iolyce able dul man deuyse must hau knowe loue seruyse ben feestlyche man fresshe may shulde deuyse suche araye pwho coulde tellen forme dauces vncouth fresh countenaunces suche subtyll lokynges dissimulinges drede ialouse men apperceyuynges man lancelot deed therfore passe ouer al lusty heed say iolynesse lete hem tyl men supper dresse pthe steward byddeth spyces hye eke wyne al melodye vshers squyers ben ygone spyces wyne comen anone eten dronke wha ende vnto temple reason wende seruyce done soupen al day nedeth rehersen array eche man wot wel kynges feest plenty moste leest deyntes mo ben knowynge supper gothe noble kynge seen horse brasse al route lordes ladyes hym aboute wodrig ther hors bra sythen great siege troye men wondred horse also wondring tho fynally kyng asketh knyght vertue thys horse myght prayde tellen gouernauce horse anon gan tryppe daunce wha yt knightlayde honde hys rayne sayd syr sayne whan lyste ryden ye mote tryll pyn stante hys ere whiche shal tel bytwene v two ye mote nempne hym place also countre lyst ryde whan ye come lyste abyde bydde hym discende trylle nother pyn therin lyeth effecte al gyn wol downe discende wyl place wol abyde styl though al ye world cotrary sworne shal then ythrowe ne yborne yf lyst bydde hym then gon tryl thys pyn wol vanyshe anon syght euery maner wyght come ayen day nyght whan lyst clepen hem agayne suche gyse shal sayne bytwyxt ful sone ryde wha lyst ther ni done penfourmed wha ye kyng ye knyght hath conceyued hys wytte aright maner forme al thys thyng ful glad ful blythe noble kyng repayreth hys reuel byforne brydel toure yborne kept amonge iewels lese dere horse vanysshed manere syght ye get thus lete luste iolyte cambyscan hys lordes festyng tyl wel nye day began spryng pexplicit prima par et se quitur par secunda nortee digestyon slepe gan hem wynke bad hem take kepe myrth drinke labour wol haue reste galping mouthe hem al keste sayd tyme lye adoun blode hys domynacyoun cherysseth blode nature frende thanke galpyng two thre euery wight gan drawe reste slepe hem bade toke beste dremes shul ben olde ful heedes fumosyte causeth dremes whyche ther charge slepen tyl pryme large moste parte canace ful mesurable woman father take leue gon rest sone alter eue lyst appalled morowe vnfestlyche se slept fyrst slepe awoke suche ioy herte toke queynt rynge myrrour twenty tymes chaunged colour slepe ryght impressyon myrrour visyon wherfore sonne vp gan glyde cleped maistresses besyde sayd luste aryse pthese olde woman ben gladly wyse maystresse answerde anon sayd madame whither wol ye gon thus erly folke ben al reste pi wol quod aryse leste lenger slepe walken aboute maystresse cleped wome great route vp ryse wel ten twelue vp ryseth fresshe canace selue ioly bright yonge sonne ram four degree vp ronne hygher whan redy sorthe walketh easye paas arrayed lusty season sote lightly playen walken fete nought fyue sixe meyne trenche fer parke gethe pthe vapour whiche yt fro erth glode maketh sonne seme ruddy brode nathelesse fayre syght made al hertes lyght ceason morownyng soules herde synge right anon wyste ment right songe knewe al entent pthe knotte euery tale tolde taryed tyl luste colde hem han herkened yore sauour passeth euer lenger fulsomnesse prolixite reason thynketh shulde vnto knot condiscende make walkyng sone ende pamydde ti drye whyt chalke canace playeng walke sate fauron ouer heed ful hye pytous voyce gan crye al wodde resowned cry beaten selfe pytously bothe wynges tyl reed blode ran endelonge tre stode euer one cryed shright becke seluen pyght na tygre ne cruel beste dwelleth wodde eyther foreste nolde ha wept yf wepe coude sorowe shright alway loude na neuer yet man lyue couthe faucon wel discryue herde suche another fayrenesse wel plumage gentylnesse shappe al might trekened faucon peregryn semed scrude londe euermore stoode swouned lacke blood tyl welny fal fro tree pthis fayre kynges doughter canace fynger bare queynte rynge thrugh vnderstod wel euery thig foule may hys leden sayne coude answere hym leden agayne hath vnderstande faucon seyde welny routhe almost deyde tre gothe ful hastely faucon loketh ful pytously helde lappe abrod wel wyste faucon muste fallen twyste wha yt swouned next lacke bloode longe whyle wayten stoode tyl laste spake manere vnto hauke ye shalen pwhat cause yf tell ye ben furyal payne hell quod canace vnto hauke aboue thys sorowe dethe losse loue trowe ben cause two causen gentyll hert wo harme nedeth speke ye vpon selfe wreke whiche proueth wel eyther ire drede mote ben encheson cruell dede syu se none wyght chace loue god doth selfe grace may helpe west est ne sawe neuer er byrde ne beest farde hym selue pytously ye slee sorowe veryly haue great compassioun goddes loue come fro tre adowne kynges doughter trewe veryly cause knewe disease yf lay myght wolde amende certes nyght wysely helpe great god kynde herbes shal right ynowe fynde hele hurtes hastely tho shright faucon yet spitously euer dyd fell grounde anone lyeth swoune deed stone tyl canace hath lappe itake vnto tyme gan swoune awake swoune gan abreyde ryght haukes leden thus sayde pite renneth soone gentyl herte felyng semilitude paynes smerte proued al day men may se wel werke authorite gentle hert kepeth gentilnesse se wel ye haue distresse campassyon fayre canace womanly benignyte nature principle hath sette none hope fare bette obey vnto hert free make beware whelpe chastised lyon right cause conclusyon whyle haue leyser space myne harm wol confessen pace euer one sorowe tolde wepte water wolde tyl faucon badde styl sike thus sayd tyl pthere bredde ala ilke day fostred roche marble gray tenderly nothyng eyleth ne wist aduersyte tyl coude flye ful hye vnder skye dwelte terselet fast semed wel al gentylnesse al ful trayson falsnesse wrapped vnder humble chere vnder hewe trouth suche manere vnder pleasaunce vnder busy payne wight coud haue wede coud fain depe greyne dyed colour right serpent hideth vnder flour tyl may se hys tyme byte right god loues ipocrite dothe hys serymones obeysaunce dissimulynge fayre assemblaunce sowneth vnto gentilnesse loue tombe al fayre aboue vnder cors suche ye wote suche ipocrite colde hote wyse serued entent saue fende non wist ment tyl long weped complayned many yere hys seruyce yfayned tyl myn hert pitous nyce al innocent hys cruel malyce ferde hys dethe thought vpon hys othes hys suretee graunted hym loue vpon condition euermore myn honour renoun saued bothe preuy apert say hys desert yaue hym al myn hert thought god wote wyse nought toke hert chaunge myn aye sothe sayd gone sythen many day trewe wight thefe thynketh one whan sawe thyng fer ygone graunted hym fully loue suche gyse haue sayd aboue yeuen hym trewe hert fre swore yafe hert anon tygre ful doublenesse fyll hys knee deuout humblesse hye reuerence eke chere lyke gentyl louer manere rauyshed semed ioye neuer troylus ne paris troy iason certes ne non man syn lamet alderfyrst began louen two writen folke beforne ne neuer sythen adam borne ne couthe man twenty thousande parte counterfete sophymes hys arte ne worthy vnbocle hys galoche ther doublenesse faynyng shulde aproche ne couth thanke wight dyd maner heuen se tyl woman neuer wyse paynteth hys chere poynt deuyse wel hys wordes hys countenaunce loued hym hys obeysaunce trouthe demed hert yf thyng hym smert al neuer lyte wyst thought fetel dethe herte twyst shortly ferforth thyng went wyl wylles instrument say wil obeyed wyl al thyng ferre reason fyl kepyng boundes worshyp euer ne neuer thyng lefe ne leuer hym god wote ne neuer shal mo last lenger yere two supposed hym nothyng good fynally thus last stode fortune wolde twyn place whiche wo questyon make discriptyon thyng dare tel boldely knowe payne dethe therby suche harm felte ne might beleue pso day toke hys leue sorowfully eke wende verely felte moche harm wha herde speke saw hewe natheles thought trewe eke repaire shulde agayne withyn lytel whyle sothe sayne reason wolde eke must go hys honour ofte happeth made vertue necessite toke wel sythe must nedes best might hidde fro hym sorow toke ye hond seit iohn borow sayd thus lo al beth suche haue ben shal answerde nedeth reherce sayn bet wers whan al wel ysaid hath done therfore behoueth hym longe spone shal eten fende thus herd say last mote forth hys way forthe sle th til come lest whan come hym purpose rest trowe thylke text mynde al thyng repayring hys kynde gladeth selue thus sayn men gesse men louen kynde newfanglenesse briddes men cage fede though yu nyght day take hem hede strawe cage fayre softe sylke gyue hem sugre hony breed mylke yet right anon hys dore vppe fete wold sporne adown cup wood wolde wormes eate newfangled ben meate louen nouelries proper kynde gentylnesse blode may hem bynde ferde thys tercelet ala day tho gentel borne freshe gaye goodly se humble free sawe vpon tyme kyte flee sodaynly loued kyte al hys loue clene fro goo hath hys trouthe falsed wyse thus hathe kyte loue seruyce lorne without remedy ye worde faucon gan crye swouned ofte canaces barme great ye sorowe haukes harme canace woman made nyst might faucon glade canace home bereth lappe softely playsters gan wrappe wt becke hurt selue nowe canace herbes delue grounde make salues newe herbes precious fyne hewe helen hauke fro day nyght dothe besynesse might beddes heed made mewe couered veluettes blewe sygne trouthe woman sene al withouten ye mewe peynted grene peynted al false foules ben tydefes tercelettes owles ryght dispyte peynted hem besyde pyes hem crye chyde thys leue canace hauke kepynge wol nomore nowe speke rynge tyl come efte purpos sayn faucon gate loue agayn repentant story telleth v mediatyon camballus kynges sonne whiche tolde hensforthe wol proces holde speken auentures batayls yet neuer herd gret marue l fyrst wol tel cambuscan hys tyme many cyte wan howe wan theodora hys wyfe wol speke algarsyfe ful ofte great peryl ne ben holpen horse bra wol speke camballo fought listes brethern two canace er myght wyn left wol agayn begyn pexplicit secunda par apollo whirleth vp chare hye tyl god mercurius house slye pthere founde foresayd tale whiche hath ben sought dyuers place phere foloweth wordes marchaunt squyer wordes host marchaunt fayth squyer thou hast wel iquyt gentelly prayse wel thy wyt quod marchaunt consydryng thyne youth felyngly thou spekest alouth dome non eloquence shalbe thy pere yf thou lyue god gyue ryght good chaunce vertue sende perseueraunce thy spekyng haue great deynte haue sonne trinite leuer tha twenty poudesworth londe though nowe fallen honde man suche discressyon ye ben fye possessyon yf man vertuous haue sonne shybbed yet shal vertue lysteth nat entende play dyse spende lese al hath vsage leuer talke page comen gentyl wight myght lerne gentelnesse aryght strawe gentylnesse host marchaunt pardy wel thou wost eche mote tellen lest tale two breken behest know wel marchat certain pray haue nat disdayn though thys speke worde two ptel thy tale withouten wordes mo gladly syr host wol obey vnto wyl nowe herkeneth say wol nat contray wyse farre wittes may suffyse pray god may plesen wotte wel good ynow pthus ende wordes host marchant foloweth marchauntes prologue wepyng waylyng care sorowe haue ynowe euyn eke morowe quod marchaunt haue mo wedded trowe wel wote fareth haue wyfe worst may though fende coupled wold ouermatch dare wel swere shulde reherce special hygh malyce shrewe longe large difference betwyxt grisyldes great pacience wyfe passyng cruelte vnbounde also mote wolde neuer efte come snare wedded men lyue sorowe care assay wol shal fynde say sothe saynt thomas inde parte say nat al god shelde shulde befal ah good syr host haue wedded monethes two nat parde yet trowe hys lyfe hath wedded thoug men hym ryfe hert ne couthe manere tel moche sorowe nowe coude tell wyues cursednesse host marchant god yt blesse syn ye moche knowe arte ful hertely pray tell v parte gladly quod myn owne sore sory hert tel may phere endeth marchauntes prologue foloweth hys tale whylo dwellyng lombardy worthy knyght borne pauy whiche lyued great prosperyte syxty yeare wyfeles man folowed aye hys bodely delyte woman appetyte foles ben seculeres whan past sixty yeres holynesse dotage sayn suche great corage knyght ben wedded man day nyght dothe al espy wedded myght prayeng oure lorde graunten hym myghten one knowen blysful lyfe bitwixt husbande hys wyfe lyuen vnder holy bonde god fyrst man woma bonde non lyfe sayd worthe bean wedlocke easy clean worlde paradise thus saith olde knyght wyse certaynly sothe god kyng take wyfe glorious thyng n mely whan man olde hore wyfe frute hys tresore shulde take yonge wyfe faire might engendren heire lede lyfe ioye solace bachelers syngen ala whan fynden aduersyte loue whiche ny chyldes vanyte trewly sytte wel bachelers han ofte payne wo brotel grounde bylden brotelnesse finde freelte wha wene secrenesse lyue bryddes beestes lyberte vnder nyce arestes wedded man hys estate lyueth lyfe blisfully ordinate vnder yoke mariage ybounde wel may hert ioye blisse habounde buxome wyfe trewe eke tentife kepe hym sicke hole hys make wel ne wo nyl hym nat forsake ny nat wery hym loue serue though lye bedreed tyl sterue yet clerkes sayn nat whiche theophrast one tho force though theophrast lyst lye ne take wyfe hysbondrye spare housholde thy dispence trewe seruaunt doth dilygence thy good kepe thyn owne wyfe wol clayme halfe parte al lyfe yf thou sycke god saue thy frendes trewe knaue wol kepe better wayteth aye thy good hath done many daye yf thou take wyfe vntrewe ful ofte tyme shal sore rewe thys sentence hundred sithes worse wryteth thys god hys bone curse take kepe suche vanyte defyeth theophrast herkeneth pa wyfe goddes yefte verely al maner yeftes hardely landes rente pasture comune mouables al ben yeftes fortune passen shadowe wal drede yf playnly speake shal wyfe wol last thyne house endure wel lenger lyst parauenture mariage ful great sacrament whych hath wyfe holde shent lyueth helples al desolate speake folke secular estate herkneth say nouyt woman mannes helpe ywrought hye god wen adam maked sawe hym alone belly naked god hys great goodnesse sayd let v make helpe thys man lyke hymselfe made eue may ye se hereby may ye preue wyfe mannes helpe comforte hys paradyse terrestre hys dysporte buxome vertuous must nedes lyue vnyte one fleshe ben two soules gesse one herte wele dystresse wyfe ah saynt mary benedicite howe myght man haue aduersite hath wyfe certes sey blysse betwyxte hem twey may tonge tellen hert thynke yf poore helpeth hym swynke kepeth hys good wasteth neuer dei al husbande lust lyketh wel sayeth one naye sayth ye thys sayeth al redy syr sayth po blysful order wedlocke precious thou arte mery eke vertuous comended approued eke euery halte hym worth leke vpon hys bare knee ought hys lyfe thanken god hym hath sent wyfe praye god hym sende wyfe last vnto hys lyues ende hys lyfe sette sekernesse may dysceyued gesse werche hys wyues rede may boldely bear n vp hys hede ben trewe also wyse whych yf thou wolt werchen ye wyse alway woman wol rede lo iacob clerkes rede good counsayle hys mother rebecke bounde kydde skynne hys necke whych hys father benison wan lo iudyth story tel wyse counsayle goddes people kept slewe hym holofernes whyle slept lo abigail counsayle howe saued husbande nabal shulde haue slayne loke hester also good counsayle delyuered wo people god made mardochere assuere enhaunsed pthere ny nothynge gree superlatyfe sayeth senec aboue humble voyfe suffre thy wynes tonge caton byt shal comaude thou shalt sustre yet wol obey curtesye wyfe keper thyne husbondrye wel may sycke man wayle wepe ny wyfe ye house kepe warne yf wysely thou wylt werche loue wel thy wift christ loueth cherch yf thou loue thy selfe thou louest thy wyfe man hateth hys fleshe hys lyfe fostreth therfore byd cheryshe thy wyfe thou shalt neuer ithe husbande wyfe men iape playe worldly folke holde seker waye knit ther may none harme betide namely vpon wyues syde ianuary tolde consydred hath hys dayes olde lusty lyfe vertuous quiete mariage hony swete hys frendes daye sent tellen hem theffecte hys entent pwyth face sadde tale hath hem tolde sayd frendes hoore olde almost god wot pyttes brynke vpon soule somwhat must thynke haue body folyshly dyspended blessed god shal ben amended wol ben certayne wedded man anone al hast vnto mayde fayre tender age pray shapeth mariage sodeynly wol abyde wol fonden espye syde may wedded hastely moche ye ben ye shullen rather suche thynge espyen luste best alyen one thing war e fredes dere wol none olde wyfe haue manere shal passe fyftene yere certayne olde fyshe yonge fleshe wol haue fayne better pyke pykerel better olde befe tender veel wol woman thyrty wynter age ny anstrawe great forage eke olde wedowes god wote connen moche crafte wade bote moche broken harme hem lyst wyth hem shulde neuer lyue rest sondrye scholes maketh subtel clerkes woman many scholes halfe clerke certaynly yonge thynge may men gye ryght may warme war wt hades ply wherfore saye plainly clause nyl none olde wyfe haue thys cause yf myschaunce couth haue pleasaunce shulde lede lyfe auoutry streyght deuel dye ne chyldren shulde none vpon geten yet leuer houndes eten myne heritage shulde fal straunge handes thus tel al dote wote cause men shulde wedden forthermore wot speaketh many man mariage wot nomore doth page whych cause men shulde take wyfe yf may lyuen chast hys lyfe take hym wyfe wyth great deuotion bycause leful procreation chyldren honoure god aboue paramour loue shulden lechery eschewe yelde dettes dewe eche man shulde helpen myschefe suster shulde brother lyue chastite ful heuenly pbut syrs leaue god thanked dare make auaunt fele lymmes hole sufficiaunt done al man belongeth wote selfe best may though hore fare doth tre blossometh er frute ywoxe blossomed tre neyther drye ne deed fele hore heed myne herte lymmes bene grene laurel yere sene sythen ye haue herd al myn entent pray wyll ye wol assent dyuers men dyuersly hym tolde mariage many ensamples olde blameth prayseth certayne last shortly ta sayn al daye falleth altereacion betwyxt frendes dysputation fel stryfe betwyxt hys brother two whych one cleped placebo iustynus sothly called pplacebo sayd ianuary brother ful lytel nede han ye lorde dere counsayle axe ye ben ful sapience ne lyketh hye prudence vayne fro worde salomon thys worde sayth vnto euerychone worke al thynge counsayle thus sayd shalt thou repent tho salomon speake worde myne owne dere brother lorde wysely god soule bryng ease rest holde owne counsayle best brother myne take thys motyfe haue ben court man al lyfe god wote though vnworthy haue standen ful great degre abouen lordes ful great estate yet neuer wyth none hem debate neuer hem contraryed truely wote wel lorde sayeth holde ferme stable say el thynge semblable ful great foole counsaylour serueth lorde hye honour dare presume one thynke cousaile shuld passe lordes wy nay lordes fooles fay ye haue selfe spoken day hye sentence holy wel consent conferme euery del wordes al opinyon god ny man al thys town ne itayle coude bette haue sayd christ holdeth hym thys ful wel payde trewly hye corage man stopen age taken yong wyfe father kyn hert hongeth ioly pyn doth matere right lest finally holde best piustynus aye satte herde right thys wyse placebo answerde nowe brother myne pacyet pray sith ye haue said herkeneth say psenec among wordes wyse saith man ought hym wel auyse yeueth hys londe catel sythens ought auyse right wel gyue good away fro wel moche ought auysed gyue body alway warne wel childes play take wyfe wichout auysement men must enquere myne assent whether sobre wise dronkelwe proude wayes shrewe chider waster thy good riche poore el man wood al man fynde shal non worlde trotteth hole ne man ne beest suche men deuyse natheles ought ynough suffyse wyfe yf mo good thewes vice badde al thys asketh layser enquere god wotte haue wept many tere ful preuely sythe wyfe praise wol wedded mannes lyfe certeyn fynde cost care obseruaunces blysses bare yet god wote neyghbours namely woman many rout sayn haue stedfast wyfe eke mekest one beareth lyfe wot best wryngeth sho ye may right lyst auyse ye ben man age howe ye entren mariage namely yonge wife fayre made water erthe ayre yongest man al rout besy ynowe bringe haue wyfe alone trusteth ye shal nat pleasen yeres thre sayn plesaunce wyfe asketh ful moche obseruaunce praye ye nat yuel apayde wel ianuary hast thou al sayd strawe thy sence thy prouerbes count nat worth pannyer ful herbes schole termes wiser men thou thou hast herde assenteth right nowe purpose placebo say ye say cursed man letteth matrymony sekerly worde risen sodaynly ben assented fully shulde wedded whan list wolde hyghe fantasy curiousnesse fro day day gan soule empresse ianuary hys mariage many fayre shappe many fayre visage passeth throug hert night night al toke myrrour polysshed bright sette comen market place shulde se many figure pace myrrour wyse gan ianuary within thought deuyse maydens whiche dwellen besyde wyst nat myght abyde yf one beautie face another stout people grace sadnesse benignyte people grettest voyce riche badde name natheles bitwixt ernest game last apoynted hym one lete al hert gone chese awne authorite loue blynde al day may nat se whan yt bedde ybrought purtreyde hys hert hys thought freshe beaute age tender middle smal armes long slender wise gouernaunce gentylnesse womanly bearyng sadnesse wha condiscended thoght choise myght nat ameded whan selfe concluded thought eche mannes wyt bad impossyble reply ayenst choice hys fanta phi frendes sent instaunce prayeth hem hym plesaunce hastely wolde hym come wolde abrydgen labour al nedeth nomore hym go ne ryde appoynted wolde abyde pplacebo came eke hys frendes sone alder fyrst bad hem al bone none hem none argumentes make ayenst hys purpose hath ytake purpose pleasaut god said grounde hys prosperite said mayden towne whych beauty hath great renowne al smal degre suffyseth hym youth beaute whych mayde said wold haue wyfe leden ease holynesse hys lyfe thanked god yt myght hauen al wyght hys blysse parten shal prayeth hem labour thys nede shapeth fayle spede sayd hys sprete ease nothynge maye dysplease saue thynge prycketh conscience whych wol reherce presence pi haue herde sayd ful yore ago may haue parfyte blysses two thys say earth eke heuen though kept fro synnes seuen eke euery braunche thylke tre yet parfyte prosperite great ease lust mariage euer agast nowe myne age shal lede nowe mery lyfe delycate wythout wo stryfe shal haue myne heuen earth sythen heuen bought dere wyth tribulation great penaunce shulde lyuyng pleasauce al wedded men done wyth wyues come ye blisse ther christ eterne lyue thys drede ye brother twey assoyleth thys question prey piustinus whych hated hys foly answered anon ryght hys iapery wolde hys longe tale abrege wolde none authorite allege sayd syr none obstacle thys god hys hye myracle hys mercy may wyrche er ye han ryghtes holy chyrche ye may repent wedded mannes lyfe whych ye sayen neyther wo ne stryfe el god forbede yf sent wedded man grace hym repent wel ofter rather syngle man therfore syr best rede dyspayreth haue memory parauenture may purgatory may goddes meane goddes whip shal soule vp heuen skip swyfter doth arowe bowe hope god ye shal knowe ther ny none great felicite mariage ne neuer none shal shal let saluation ye vse skyl reason lustes wyfe attemperatly ye please amorously ye kepe eke fro syn tale done wytte thyn beth agast herof dere brother let v wade fro thys matter another wyfe bath yf ye vnderstande mariage whych ye haue hande declareth ful wel lytel space fareth wel god haue hys grace wt worde iustyne brother han take leaue eche hem sawe must nedes wrought wyse slye treate thys mayde whych may hyght hastely euer myght shal wedded thys ianuary trowe longe tary yf tolde euery escrite bonde whych fested hys londe herken ryche arraye fynally ycomen daye chyrch ben went receyue holy sacrament forth cometh ye prest wt stole neck badde lyke sara rebecke wysedome trouth mariage sayd hys orison vsage crouched hem bad god shuld hem bles made al seker ynowe wyth holynesse thus ben wedded wyth solempnite feest sytteth wyth worthy folke vpon deys al ful ioye blysse paleyes ful instrumentes vytayle moost deyntes al itaile beforne stode instrumetes sown orpheus ne thebe amphion ne made neuer melody pat euery cours came loude mynstralcy neuer ioab tromped neyther theodomas yet halfe clere thebe cytie doute bacchus wyne hem skynketh al aboute venus laugheth euery wyght ianuary become knyght wolde assayen hys corage lybertie eke mariage wyth fyre bronde hode daunceth bryde al rout certaynly dare wel sayen ryght emenius god weddynge saw neuer life mery wedded holde thou thy peace thou poet marcian wrytest v ylke weddynge mery philology hym mercury songes mus songe smal thy penne eke thy tonge dyscriuen thys mariage whe teder youth hath iwedded stouping age myrth yt may written assayeth selfe may ye wytten yf lacke none thys matere may sytte wyth benigne chere beholde semed fayrey quene hester loked neuer wyth eye assuere meke loke hath may deuyse al beaute thus moche beaute tel may like ye bryght morow may fullylde al beaute pleasaunce ianuary rauyshed traunce euery tyme loke face hys herte gan manace yt night armes wold strein harder euer parys dyd heleyn natheles yet great pyte ylke nyght offende muste thought ala tender creature wolde god ye myght wel endure al corage sharpe kene agast ye shal sustene god forbede dyd al myght wolde god waxe nyght nyght wolde last euer mo wolde al people ago fynally doth hys labour best myght sauynge hys honour hast hem fro meat subtel wyse tyme came reason ryse men dauncen drynke fast spice house cast ful ioye blysse euery man al squyer hyght damian whych carfe knyght many day rauyshed hys lady may payne ny wode almost swelte souned stode sore hath venus hurt hym wt brand freshe therto lycande hys bedde went hym hastely hym thys tyme speke let hym wepe ynowe playne tyl ye freshe may wol rewen hys payne perilous fyre yt bedstraw bredeth famyler foe hys seruyce bedeth seruaunt traytour false homely hewe lyke adder slye bosome vntrewe ianuary dronken plesaunce god shylde v al iniquitaunce mariage se howe thys damian thyne owne squyer thy borne man entendeth done villany god graunt thyne homely foe espye thys worlde ny wers pestilence homely foe al daye thy presence parfourmed hath son arke dyurne lenger may body hym soiourne orisont latitude nyght wt hys mantel darke rude gan sprede hemyspery whych departed lusty rout fro ianuary wyth thanke euery syde home house lustely ryde done thynges lest sawe tyme go rest sone thys lusty ianuary wol go bedde wolde lenger tary drynketh ypocras clarrey vernag spyces hote encrease hys corage many lectuary full fyne cursed monke dan costantyne hath wrytten hys boke coitu eaten hem al nolde nothyng eschewe thus hys preuy frendes sayd goddes loue sone may let voyde al house curteys wise sone pmen drinke trauers drewe anone hasted ianuary must done bryd brought bed styl ston whe bed ye preest yblessed ye chabre hath euery wight dressed ianuary hath fast armes take hys freshe may hys paradyse hys make lulleth kysseth ful ofte wyth thycke brystels hys berde vnsofte lyke ye skyn houdfysh sharp brere shaue al newe hys manere rubbeth vpon tendre face sayd thus ala mote trespace spouse greatly offende tyme come wol downe dyscende natheles consydreth thys ny workman euer may wyrche wel hastely thys wol done leyser parfytly force howe longe play trewe wedlocke coupled tway blessed yoke bene actes mowe syn man may synne wyth hys wyfe ne hurte hym selfe wyth hys owne knyfe haue leaue play v lawe thus laboureth tyl day gan dawe taketh soppe fyne clarre vpryght hys bedde sytteth syngeth full loude clere kyst hys wyfe maketh wanto chere al coltyshe ful ragery ful gergon flecked pye slacke skynne aboute hys necke shaketh whyle songe chauteth craketh god wot may thought herte hym sawe vpsyttyng hys sherte hys nyght cappe hys necke lene prayseth playeng worth bene sayd thus rest wol take daye come may lenger wake downe layd heed slept til prime afterward saw hys tyme vp ryseth ianuary freshe may holdeth chambre fourth day vsage wyues best euery labour somtyme mote haue rest el longe may endure thys say lyues creature fyshe beest brydde man wol speake woful damian langureth loue ye shal therfore speke hym thys manere pi say sely damian ala answere thys demaunde thys caas howe thou thy lady freshe may tel thy wo wol alwaye saye nay eke yf thou speke wol thy wo bewray god thyn helpe better say thys sycke damian venus fyre brenneth dyeth desyre whych put hys lyfe auenture lenger myght thys wyse endure priuely penner gan borowe lettre wrote al hys sorowe maner complaynt lay vnto thys fayre freshe lady may purse sylke hogyng hys shert hath put layde hys hert pthe mone noone tyde ylke day ianuary hath ywedded freshe may taure cancre gleden longe hath may chambre bydden custome vnto noble al bryde shal eaten hal tyl dayes foure thre leest passed bene let gon feest pthe fourth day coplete fro noon noone hye masse ydone hal sat thys ianuary may freshe thys bryght somers day befyl thys good man remembreth hym vpon thys damian sayd saynt mary may thys damian entendeth aye sycke may thys betyde hys squyers stode hym besyde excused hym bycause hys sycknesse whych letted hym done hys besynesse none cause myght make hym tary forthynketh ianuary gentle squyer trouthe dyed harme routhe wyse dyscrete secre man wote hys degre therto manly seruysable thryfty man ryght able meate sone euer may wol selfe vysete hym eke may done hym al comforte worde hym blessed euery man hys bounte hys gentylnesse wolde comforten hys dystresse hys squyer gentle dede dame thys ianuary take good hede meate ye wemen al ye haue ben chabre hal al ye gone se thys damian doth hym dysporte gentyl man telleth hym wol hym visite haue nothyng rested lyte spede fast wol abyde tyl ye slepe fast syde worde gan hym cal squyer marshal hys hal tolde certayn thynge wolde fresh may hath streight way ihold al woman vnto damyan downe hys beddes syde sat confortyng hym goodly may damyan wha tyme say secrete wyse hys purse eke hys byl whiche written al hys wyl hath put honde withouten saue syghed wonder depe sore sothly ryght thus sayd merry ye discouer nat deed yf thyng kydde purse hath bosome hydde went way ye gete vnto ianuary icome hys beddes syde sytte ful softe taketh kysseth ful ofte layde hym downe slepe anon fayned must gon ye wote yt euery wight hath nede whan byl hath taken hede rent al cloutes last preuy sothly cast studieth nowe faire fresshe may adown ianuary lay slepte tyl cough hath hym awaked anon prayde stripe al naked wolde said haue pleasauce said clothes dyd hym encombraunce obeyeth lese lothe lest precious folke wt wrothe howe wrought dare nat tel whether thought paradise hel lette hem worche wyse tyl euynsong ryng must aryse desteny auenture influence nature constellation suche estate heuen stode tyme fortunate put byl venus warkes al thyng hath tyme sayn clerkes woman gete loue nat say great god aboue knoweth non acte causeles demeth al wol holde pee sothe howe yt freshe may hath take suche impressyon day pyte thys sicke damyan fro hert dryue ne remembraunce downe hym ease certayn thought thys thyng displease recke hym assure loue hym best creature though hys shert lo pyte renneth soone gentyl hert may ye se howe excelent franchise woman whan hem narow auyse tyrant ben many one hath hert harde stone wolde haue lete sterue ye place wel rather tha haue graunted hym grace reioysed cruel pride nat haue retched homycide thys gentyl may fulfylled al pyte right honde lettre made whiche graunteth grace lacketh nought tyme place might hys lust suffyse shal right wol deuyse whan sawe tyme vpon day visite damya goth thys faire may subtelly lettre thryst vnder hys pyllowe rede yf hym lyst taketh ye hond herd twist secretely wight wyst badde hym ben al hole forth went ianuary whan sent vp ryseth damyan next morowe al passed hys sickenesse hys sorowe kembeth hym proy eth hym piketh dothe hys lady lust lyketh eke ianuary gothe lowe euer dyd dogge bowe plesaunt euery man crafte al euery wight fayn speke gode fully hys ladyes grace stode thus lette damyan nede tale forthe wol procede psome clerkes holden felycite stont delyte therfore certayn thys noble ianuary al hys might honest wyse longeth knyght shope hym lyue ful delyciously hys housyng hys array honestly hys degre made kynges among hys honest thynges garden walled al stone faire garden neuer none dout verily suppose wrote romant rose ne couth beaute wel deuyse ne priapus ne myght nat suffyse though god garden tell beaute garden wel stont vnder laurer alway grene ful ofte tyme kyng pluto hys quene proserpina al fayrie disporten hem maken melodye wel daunced men tolde noble knight ianuary olde suche deynte hath walke play wol suffre wight bere kay saue hym selfe smal wicket bare alway syluer clycket whan hym lyst vnshet whan wolde pay hys wyfe det somer season thider wolde go may wife wight two thinges whiche yt nat bedde garden parfourmed hem spedde thys wyse many mery day lyued ianuary thys freshe may worldly ioye may nat alway endure ianuary ne lyueng creature po sodayne hap thou fortune vnstable lyke scorpion disceyuable slatrest wt thy heed wha yu wolt stynge thy tayle deth thrugh thyn enuenomyng brotel ioye swete poyson queynt monster sodaynly canst peynt thy gyftes vnder hewe stedfastnesse thou discryuest bothe lesse hast thou ianuary thus desceyued haddest hym thy frende receyued thou hast beraft hym eyen sorowe whiche desyreth dyen ala noble ianuary fre amydde lust prosperite woren blynde al sodaynly dethe therfore desyreth vtterly therwithal fyre ielousy lest wyfe shulde fal foly brent hys hert wolde fayne man bothe hym slayne neuer hys dethe ne hys lyfe ne wolde loue ne wyfe euer lyue wedowe clothes blake sole turtle doth yt hath lost make last mouth tway sorowe gan swage sothe say whan wyst might non paciently toke hys aduersyte saue dout may nat gone na ielous euer one whiche ielousy outragious neyther hal ne non hous ne non place neuer mo nolde suffre neyther ryde ne go honde alway whiche ful often wepeth freshe may loueth damyan benignely mote eyther dye sodaynly el mote haue hym lest wayteth whan hert shulde brest vpon syde damyan become sorowfullest man euer neyther night ne day ne myght speke worde freshe may purpose suche matere yf ianuary must honde vpon euer mo natheles writyng fro preuy sygnes wist ment knewe al sygnes hys entent po ianuary myght auayle tho thou mightest se fer shippes sayle good blynde man disceyued disceyued whan man may se lo argus hundred eyen euer couthe pore prien yet blent god wotte ben mo wenen wisely nat passe ouer ease say fresh may spake yore warme waxe hath printed clycket ianuary bare small wicket whiche vnto hys garden ofte went damyan knewe entent clycket counterfayted priuely ny say hastely wonder clycket shal betyde whiche ye shul heren yf ye wol abyde po noble ouide soth sayest thou god wote sleight though long hote nyl fynde manere pyrramus thisbe maye men lere though kept ful log streyt ouer al ben accorded rownyng wal ther ni wight couth fynde sleight nowe purpose er yt dayes eyght passed er moneth iule befyll ianuary hath caught great wyl egging wife play garden wight tway morowe vnto may sayd ryse vp wife loue lady free turtel voyce herde lady swete wynter gon al raynes wete come forth thyn eyen columbyne nowe fayrer ben thy brestes wyne garden enclosed al come forth white spouse dout thou hast wounded hert wyfe spotte na al thy lyfe come forth lette v taken disport chese wyfe confort suche olde leude wordes vsed damyan sygne made shulde go hys clicket damyan hath opened wicket stert suche manere wight might se ne styl sate vnder busshe anon ianuary blynde ston may hys honde wight mo hys freshe garden go clapte wicket sodainly nowe wyfe ny thou arte creature best loue lorde sytte v al aboue leuer dyen knyfe offende dere trewe wyfe goddes sake thynke howe chees nat couetise ne good doutlees onely loue though olde may nat se trewe woll tel certes thre thynges shal ye wyn therby first loue christ selfe honour al myn heritage town toure gyue maketh charter ye lyst thys shal morowe er sonne ryst wisely god soule bring blysse pray couenaunt ye kysse though yt ielous wite nought ye ben depe enprented thought whan consyder beaute therwithal vnlikly elde may nat certes though shulde dye forbere ben company loue withouten dout kysse wife lette v rome fresh may wha wordes herd benygnely ianuary answerde fyrst forwarde began wepe haue soule kepe wel ye also myn honour wyfehode thilke tender flour whiche haue ensured honde whan preest body bonde wherfore wol answere manere leaue lorde dere pray god neuer dawe day ne sterue foule woman may yf euer kynne shame el empayre name false yf lacke stripe putte sacke next ryuer drenche gentyl woman wenche speke ye thus men ben euer vntrew woman haue reprofe aye newe ye non comunyng leue speke v vntrust repreue ye word sawe damia sate bushe knele began fynger sygnes made damyan shulde clymbe vp tre charged frute vp went verily knewe al entent euery sygne couth make welbet ianuary owne make letter tolde al mater howe worch shal thus lete hym sytte pery ianuary may romyng ful mery pbright day blewe ye fyrmament phebus golde doun hath stremes sent gladen euery flour hys warmnesse tyme geminy gesse lytel fro hys declynation causer iouis exaltation byfel bright morowe tyde garden farther syde pluto kyng fayrye many lady hys company folowyng wyfe quene proserpyne eche ryght lyne while gadred floures mede claudian ye may story rede howe grisely carte fette kyng fayry doun hym sette vpon benche turues freshe grene right anon thus sayd hys quene wyfe may nat say nay experience proueth euery day treason woman doth tenne hundred thousande tel notable vntrouth brotelnesse salomon richest al richesse fulfylde sapience worldly glory ful worthy ben thy wordes memory euery wight witte reason thus prayseth bounte man among thousande men yet fonde one al woman fonde neuer none thus saith ye kyng yt knoweth wickednesse iesus filius sirach gesse ne speketh selde reuerence wylde fyre corrupte pestilence fal vpon body yet nyght ne se ye nat thys honorable knyght bicause ala blynde olde owne man shal maken cokolde lo sytte lechour tre nowe wol graunt maieste vnto olde blynde worthy knyght shal haue agayn hys eye syght whan hys wyfe wolde villany shal knowe al harlotry bothe represe mo yea shal proserpyne wol ye nowe mother soule syr swere shal yeuen sufficient answere al woman sake though ben gylte itake face bolde shullen hem selue excuse bere hym doun wolde hem accuse lacke answere non hem shul dyen al sey thyng bothe hys eyen yet shulde woman visage hardely wepe swere chide subtelly ye shal ben leude gee recketh auctoritees wotte wel iewe salomon founde v woman foles many one though ne fonde good woman yet hath ifonde many man woman ful trewe ful good ful vertuous witnesse hem dwel christes hous martyrdom preued constaunce romain iestes eke make remembrauce many trewe wyfe also syr nat wrothe though said fond good woma pray take sentence man ment thus souerayn bounte ny non god sytteth trynyte eye god ny one make ye moche salomon though made temple goddes hous though riche glorious made temple false goddis might thing ye forbode parde faire ye hys name enplaster lechour idolaster elde god forsoke yf god nadde saith boke yspared hym hys father sake shulde haue lost reygne soner wolde sette nat al villany ye woman write butterflye woman nedes mo e speke el swel tyll myn hert breke sythen sayd ben iangleresses euer hole broke tress shal nat spare curtesy speke hem harme wold v villany dame pluto lenger wroth gyue vp sythe swore myn othe wolde graunt hym hys syght ayen worde shal stande yt warn certeyn kyng sytte nat lye quene fayrie answere shal haue vndertake lette v mo wordes herof make forsoth wol lenger contrary nowe lette v turne agayn ianuary garden faire may syngeth merier popyngay loue best shal non long aleyes gon tyl comen ayenst thylke pery damyan sytteth ful mery hye among freshe leues grene freshe maye bright shene gan sike sayd ala syde nowe syr ought may tyde must haue peeres se dye sore longeth eten smal peeres grene helpe loue heuyn quene tel wel woman plyte may haue frute great appetyte may dyen haue ala ne knaue couth clymbe ala ala blynde ye syr force wolde ye vouchsafe goddes sake pety armes take wel wotte ye mystrust shulde clymbe wel ynough may fote myght sette vpon backe forsoth sayd shal lacke might helpe myne hert blode stoupeth doun hys backe stode caught twist vp goth ladyes praye nat wroth nat glose rude man sodaynly anon damyan gan pullen vp smocke thronge great tent thrifty longe sayd meryest fytte euer lyfe yet lordes tent serueth nothyng thus foldeth twifolde swete iesus may nat swyue worth leke yet ful gentyl ful meke leuer euynsong whan pluto sawe thys wronge ianuary gaue agayn syght made hym se aswel euer myght whan caught syght agayn ne neuer man thyng fayn wyfe thought euer mo vp tree cast eyen two saw damian wife dressed suche manere may nat expressed yf wolde speke vncurtesly vp ya roryng crye dothe mother whan child shal dye helpe ala harowe gan crye sorowe almost gan dye wife swyued pery stronge lady hore dost thou pand answered syr ayleth haue pacience reason mynde haue holpen eyen blynde vp peryl soule shal nat lyen taught helpe eyen nothyng bette make se strogle man vpon tree god wote dyd ful good entent pstrogle yea algate went styffe rounde bel wonder though thy bely swel smocke hys brest lay theche euer though poynted ye breche god gyue bothe shame deth dyen swyued sawe myne eyen el honged halse medicyn false certayn yf ye myght se ye wolde nat say theke wordes ye haue glymsyng parfite sight se wel euer might thanked god bothe myne eyen two trouth thought dyd ye mase ye mase good syr thanke haue made se ala euer kynde dame let al passe minde come lefe haue missayde god helpe yuel apayde father soule wende haue seyn howe damyan leyn thy smocke lyen vpon brest ye syr ye may wene ye lest syr man waketh hys slepe may nat sodaynly wel taken kepe vpon thyng ne se parfitely tyl adawed verily right man longe hath blynde ne may nat sodaynly wel yse first whan sight newe comen agayn hath daye two ysayn tyl sight istabled may ful many sight begyle beware pray heuen kyng ful many man weneth se thyng al another semeth mysconceyueth ofte mysdemeth worde lepe doun fro ye tre ianuary gladde kysseth clyppeth ful ofte wombe stroketh ful softe hys paleys home hath ladde nowe good men pray beth ye al glad thus endeth tale ianuary god blesse v al hys mother mary pthus endeth marchauntes tale foloweth wife bathe prologue experience though none authorite worlde ryght ynowe speake wo mariage lordinges sith twelue yere age thonked god eterne lyue husbondes chirche dore haue fyue ofte myght haue wedded al worthy men degre tolde longe ago twys sythen christ went neuer onys weddyng caue galilee thylke ensample taught ne shulde wedded one plo sharpe word ye none besyde wel iesu god man spake rep efe samaritan thou hast fyue husbandes ilke man hath thyne husbonde thus sayd certayn ment therby sayn aske fyfte man n husbonde samaritan howe many myght haue mariage yet herde neuer tellen myne age vpon nombre trewe diffynition men may deuyne glosen vp doun wel wotte expresse without lye god badde v wexe multiply gentyl text wel vnderstonde eke wel wotte said myne husbonde shuld leaue father mother take nombre mention made bigamye octogamye shul men speke villany lo wyse kyng salomon trowe wyues mo one wolde god leful refreshed halfe ofte gifte god al hys wyuis man hath yt worlde lyue god wotte noble kynge wytte fyrst nyght many mery fytte eche hem wel hym lyue blessed god haue fyue welcome syxte whan euer shal sothe wol kepe chaste al whan myne husbonde fro world ygon crysten man shal wedde anon apostel saythe fre wedde godde shalbe lyketh saythe wedded synne better wedded brynne recketh though folke say villany shrewde lameth hys bigamy pi wotte wel abraham holy man iacob eke fer euer eche hem wyues mo two many another holy man also ye say maner age euer god defended mariage expresse wordes pray tel comaunded virginyte wotte wel ye drede apostel whan spake maydenhede sayd therof precept none men may counsayle woman one counsaylyng comaundement put owne iugement god comaunded maydenheoe tha dampned weddyng drede certes yf sede ysowe virginite wherof shulde growe poule durst comaunde leste thing maister yafe none heste darte set vp virgynite catche may renneth beste let se thys worde take euery wight god lyst yeue might wotte wel apostel mayde nathelesse though wrote sayde wolde euery wight suche al ny counsayle virginite ben wyfe yaue leue indulgence repreue wedde yf make dye without exception bygamye al good woman touche ment hys bedde hys couche peryl bothe fyre towe assemble ye knowe ensample may resemble al helde virginite parfyte weddyng freelte pfreelte clepe yf wolde lede lyfe al chastyte graunt wel haue none enuye though maydenhede preferre bygamye lyketh hem clene body goste myne estate wol make boste wel ye know lorde housholde hath nat euery vessel al golde ben tree lorde seruyce god clepeth folke hym sondry wyse eueriche hath god proper gifte hym lyketh shifte virginyte great perfection contynence eke deuocion christ perfection wel badde nat euery wight shulde go sel al gyue poore suche wise folowe hym lore spake hem wolde lyue parfitly lordinges leaue nat wol bestowe floure al myne age actes frute mariage tel also conclusyon membres made generation parfite wise wight iwrought trusteth wel nat made nouyt glose wol saye vp doun made purgatioun vryne thynges smale eke knowe female male non cause say ye experience wotte wele nat clerkes nat wroth saye maked bothe sayn offyce ease engendrure nat god displease shulde men el bokes sette man shulde yelde hys wyfe dette wherwith shuld pay paymet ne vsed sely instrument made vpon creature purge vryn eke engendrure say nat euery wight holde hath suche harnesse tolde gon vsen hem engendrure shulde men take chastite cure christ mayde shapen man many saynt sythen worlde began yet lyued euer parfyte chastite nyl enuy virginyte lette bredde pure whete fedde lette v wyues eate barly bredde yet barly bred marke tel lorde iesu refreshed many man suche state god hath cleped v wol perseuer nam nat precious wifehode wol vse myn instrument frely maker hath sent daungerous god gyue sorowe husbod shal haue euyn morow whan lyst come forth pay det husbande wol haue wol nat let whiche shal bothe dettour thral haue tribulation al vpon fleshe hys wyfe haue power duryng al lyfe vpon proper body nat right thus apostle tolde badde husbondes loue v wel al sentence lyketh euery del pvp stert pardoner anon nowe dame god saynt iohn ye ben noble prechour thys caas wedde wyfe ala shulde bye fleshe dere yet leuer wedde wyfe yere abyde tale begon nay thou shalt drynke another ton er go shal sauer worse ale haue tolde forth tale tribulation mariage whych expert al myne age thys say selfe haue ben whyp mayst th u chese whyther yu wylt syp thylke tonne shal set abroche beware er thou nere aproche shal tel ensamples mo ten wol beware men hym shal men corrected wordes wryteth ptholome rede hys almagest take dame wol pray yf wyll sayd thys pardoner ye began tel forth tale spareth man teache v yonge men practycke gladly yf may lyke praye al thys company yf speake fantasy taketh agrefe say myne entent play syrs shal tel forth tale euer mote drynke wyne ale shal say soth tho husbondes thre hem good two bad thre good men ryche olde vnnethes myght statute holde whych bounden vnto ye wote wel meane thys parde god helpe laugh thynke pirously night made hem swinke faye tolde store yeue londe tresore neded lenger diligence wynne loue hem reuerence loued wel god aboue ne tolde deynte loue wyse woman wol besy euer one gete loue ther hath none sythen hem holly honde gyue al londe shulde take kepe hem please yf profyte myn ease sette hem worke faye many nyght songen wel away bacon fet hem trowe men haue essex domowe gouerned hem wel lawe eche hem ful blysful fawe brynge gaye thynges fro fayre ful fayne whe spake hem fayre god wote chydde hem spytously nowe herkeneth howe bere properly ye wyse wyues vnderstande thus shul ye speake bere hem hande halfe boldly man swere lye woman saye thys wyues ben wyse yf hem mysse auyse wyse wyfe shal yf gode bere hem honde cowe wode take wytnesse owne mayde assent herkeneth howe sayde psyr olde steynarde thys thyn array neyghbours wyfe gay honoured ouer al goth sytte home haue thryfty cloth dost thou neyghbours hous fayre art thou amorous rownest thou wt mayd benedicite syr olde lechour let thy iapes yf haue gossyp frende wythout gylt thou chydest fende yf walke play vnto hys house thou comest home dronke mouse prechest thy benche wyth euel prefe thou sayest great myschefe wedde poore woman costage yf rych hygh parage sayst thou tourmentry suffre pryde melancoly yf fayre thou knaue thou sayest euery holour wol haue may whyle chastite abyde assayled euery syde thou sayst folke desyre v rychesse shape fairnesse eyther synge daunce gentylnesse daliaunce handes armes smale thus goeth al deuel thy tale thou sayst may kepe castel wall may longe assayled ouer yf foule thou sayest coueteth euery man may se spaneyl wol hem lepe tyll yt fynde man yt wold chepe ne none gray gese goth lake sayst thou wol ben wythout make sayst harde thynge welde wyght man wol thanke helde thus sayst thou lorel yu gost bed wyseman nedeth wedde ne man entendeth vnto heuen wyth wylde thunder dent fyre leuen mote thy wycked necke broke thou sayst droppyng house eke smoke chydyng wyues maken men flee owne house ah benedicite ayleth olde man chyde thou sayst wyues wol vyces hyde tyl fast wol hem shewe wel may thys prouerbe shrewe thou sayst yt ox horse ass houndes ben assayde dyuers stoundes basyns lauers er men hem bye spones stole al suche husbondrye pottes clothes arrayes folke wyues maken none assayes tyl ben wedded olde dottarde shrewe sayst wol vyces shewe thou sayest also dyspleaseth yf thou wylt prayse beaute thou pore alwaye face clepe fayre dame euery place thou make feest yske day borne make freshe gay thou done norice honour chamberer wythin bour father folke hys alyes thus sayest thou olde barel ful lye yet prentyse ienkyn hys cryspe heer shynyng golde fyne squyreth vp hast thou caught false suspectioun wol hym tho yu deed morowe tel hidest thou wt sorowe keyes thy chest away fro good wel thyne parde wenest yu make ydiot dame nowe ye lorde yt called saynt iame thou shalt though yu wode mayster body good one yu shalt forgon maugre thyne eyen helpeth enquere spyen trowe thou woldest locke thy chyst thou shuldest saye wyfe go lyst take dysporte wol leue tale knowe trewe wyfe dame ale loue man taketh kept charge go wol large pof al men yblessed mote wyse astrologien dan ptholome sayth thys prouerbe almagest al men hys wysedome best recketh hath ye world hade thys prouerbe thou shalt vnderstande haue thou ynowe dare ye recke care howe merely folke fare certes olde dottarde leue ye shal haue queynte ynowe eue great nygarde wol werne man lyght candel hys lanterne shal haue neuer lasse lyght parde haue thou ynowe thou darst playne thou sayst also yf make v gaye wyth clothes wyth precious arraye peryl chastite yet sorow thou must enforsen saye wordes apostels name habyte made chastite shame ye woman shulde appareyle tressed heir gaye perre perle ne wyth golde ne clothes ryche texte ne thy rubryche nyl worche moche gnatte pthou sayest also lyke catte wolde senge cattes skynne wolde catte dwellen hys ynne yf cattes skyn slicke gaye nyl dwel house halfe daye forth wol daye dawed shewe skyn gon carrewaued pthus thou sayest yf gay syr shrewe wol ren borel shewe syr olde foole helpeth spyen though thou play argus wt hys c eyen wardcors best fayth shal kepe lest yet couth make hys berde mote pthou sayest eke yt ben thynges thre whyche troublen al thys erth wyght may endure ferth lefe syr shrewe iesu shorte thy lyfe yet prechest thou sayest hateful wyfe rekened one myschaunces ben none resemblaunces ye maye lyken parable yf sely wyfe one tho thou lykenest eke woman loue hell barayn londe water may nat dwel thou lykenest also wylde fyre brenneth hath desyre consume thyng brent wolde thou saiest right wormes shende tre right wyfe distroyeth husbonde knowen ben wyues bonde plordiges right thus ye haue vnderstod bare stiffely myn olde husbande honde thus sayden dronknesse al false toke witnesse ienkyn nece also lorde payne dyd hem wo ful gyltles goddes swete pyne horse couth byte whyne couth playn though gylte el often tyme ben spylte fyrst myl cometh fyrst grynt playned fyrst warre islynt ful glad excusen hem blyue thyng gylt neuer lyue wench wol bere hem honde whan yt sicke vnnethes might stond yet tickled hert wende great cheerte swore al walkyng nyght espy wench dight vnder colour moche myrthe al suche witte gyuen v oure birthe disceite wepyng spynnyng god hath gyue woman kyndly lyue thus thyng may auaunt thende best eche degre sleyght force maner thyng contynual murmure grutchyng namely bedde mischaunce wolde chide plesaunce wolde lenger bedde abyde yf felte hys arme ouer syde tyl made raunsom vnto wolde suffre hym hys nycete therfore euery man thys tale tel wyue may al ben sel empty hondes men may haukeslure wynnyng wolde al lust endure make fayned appetite yet bacon neuer delyte maked euer yt wolde hem chide though pope sytten hem besyde wolde nat spare hem borde trouth quit hem word word helpe god omnypotent tho right nowe shulde make testamet ne owe hem worde quytte brought wytte must gyue vp best el neuer ben rest though loked wode lyon yet shulde fayle hys conclusyon wolde say good lete take kepe howe mekely loketh wylken shepe come nere spouse let kysse cheke ye shulde al pacient meke haue aswete spiced conscience sithe ye preche iobs pacyence suffreth alway syth ye wel preche yf shal teche fayre haue wyfe pee one v two mote obeyen doutles sithe man resonable woman ye must ben sufferable ayleth grutche thus grone ye wolde haue queynt alone take al lo haue euery del peter shrewe ye loue wel wolde sel belechose couth walke freshe rose wol kepe owne toth ye blame god say soth suche maner wordes honde wol speke fourth husbonde pmy fourth husbonde reuelour say paramont yong ful ragery stubburne stronge ioly pye wel coude daunce harpe finale syng ywis nyghtingale wha dronke draught swete wine metellus soule churle swyne staffe byrafte hys wyfe lyfe droke wine though wife ne shulde nat haue daunted fro drinke wyne venus must thynke also seker colde engendreth hayle lycorus mouth must haue lecherous taile woman vynolent defence knowe lechours experience lorde christ whan remembreth vpon youth iolyte tickleth myne hert rote vnto day dothe myne hert bote haue worlde tyme age ala al wol enuenyme hath birafte beaute pith let go farewel deuel go therwyth floure gone ny tel bran best nowe mote sel yet ryght mery wol fonde forth tel fourth husbonde pi saye hert great dyspyte delyte quyte god saynt ioce made hym wode troce body foule manere certaynly made folke chere hys owne grece made hym fry anger ielousy god erth hys purgatory whych hope hys soule glory god wote satte ful ofte songe hys shoe ful bytterly wronge none saue god wyst many wyse howe sore twyst dyed came fro hierusalem lyeth graue vnder rode beem al ny hys tombe curious sepulture hym darius whych appelles wrought subtelly wast bury hym preciously let farwel god giue soule good rest nowe hys graue hys chest pnowe fyfth husbande wol tel god let neuer hys soule come hel yet shrewe fele rybbes al rewe euer shal vnto myne endynge day bedde freshe gay therwythal couth wel glose wolde haue bele chose though bete euery bone couth wynne ayen loue anone trowe loued hym better hys loue daungerous woman haue yf shal lye thys matere queynt fantasy wayte thyng may lightly haue therafter wol alday crye craue forbyd v thynge desyren prese fast wol flee wyth daunger vttren al chaffare great prees market maketh dere ware great chepe holde lytel pryce thys knoweth euery woman wyse pmy fyfth husbande god hys soule blesse whych toke loue rychesse somtyme clerke oxenforde lefte schole wet home borde wyth gossyp dwellynge town god haue soule name alysoun knewe hert eke priuety better paryshe preest mote bewrayed counsayle al husbande pyst agaynst wal done thynge yt shulde haue cost lyfe another worthy wyfe nece whych loued wel wolde haue tolde hys counsayle euery dell dyd ful often god wote made hys face ful ofte reed hote shame blamed hym ofte tolde great preuyte pand befyl one lent ofte tyme gossyp went euer yet loued go gaye walke march apryll maye fro house house herken sondry tale ienke clerke gossep dame ale selfe feldes went husbonde london al lent better layser pleye se eke sey lusty folke wyst grace shapen ben place therfore made visytations vigilles procession preachyng eke pilgrymages playes myracles mariages weared gay skarlet gytes wormes moghtes ne mite vpon parel frette hem neuer del wost thou vsed wel nowe wol tel forth happed saye feldes walked tyl truely suche daliaunce thys clerke purueyaunce speake hym sayd yf wedowe shulde wedde certaynly say bobaunce yet neuer wythout purueyaunce mariage ne thynges eke holde mousse wytte worth leke hath one hole sterten yf fayle al ydo bare hym hade enchauted dame taught forsoth subtylte eke sayd mette hym al nyght wolde slayne laye vpryght al bedde ful blood yet hope truely shulde good blode betokeneth gold taught al fals dremed right nauyt folowed aye dame lore wel thynges syr let se shal sayne aha god haue tale agayne yt fourth husbande bere wept algate made sory chere wyues moten vsage wyth kerchefe couered vysage pu ueyed make wept smal vndertake church husbad borne morow wyth neyghbours hym made sorow ianken clerke one tho helpe god sawe go bere thought payre legges fete clene fayre al herte yaue vnto hys holde trowe twenty wynter olde fourty yf shal saye sothe yet alway coltes tothe gaptothed bycame wele printe dame venus seele helpe god lusty one fayre ryche yonge wel bygone truely myn husbande tolde best queynte myght certes al fully venetian felynge herte marcian venus yaue lust lycorousnesse mar yaue sturdy hardynesse myn ascendent taure mar therin ala ala euer loue syn folowed aye myne inclination vertue constellation made couth wythdrawe chambre venus good felawe yet haue martes marke vpon face also another preuy place god wysly saluation loued neuer dyscretion euer folowed myne appetyte al shorte longe blacke whyte toke kepe lyked howe poore ne eke degre shuld say ye monethes ende thys ioly clerke ianken hende hath wedded wyth great solempnite hym ya e al lande fee euer yeuen byfore afterwarde repented ful sore nolde suffre nothynge lyste god smote one wyth hys fyst rente hys boke lefe stroke eres wext defe stubborne lyonesse tonge tangleresse walke wolde done byforne fro house house although sworn ful oft tyme wolde preche olde romayne iestes teche sulpicius gallus left hys wyfe forsoke terme hys lyfe open heed sey lokynge hys dore dey romayne tolde name hys wyfe sommer game wythout hys wetynge forsoke eke wolde vpon hys byble seke ylke prouerbe ecclesiaste cumaundeth forbyddeth fast shal suffre wife go royle wolde say ryght thus donte pwho buyldeth hys house al falowes pricketh blynd horse ouer ye falowes suffreth wyfe seche hallowes worthy hanged gallowes al nought set hawe hys prouerbes ne hys olde sawe ne wolde hym corrected hate hym vyces telleth mo god wotte thys made hym wood wyth al vtterly nolde nat forbere caas wol say soth saint thomas rent hys boke le e whych smote defe boke gladly nyght daye hys dysporte wolde rede alway cleped valery theophrast whych boke lough alway ful fast eke ther clerke somtime rome cardinal hyght saynt ierome made boke ayenst iouinian whych boke eke tertulian crisyppus trotula helowys abbesse farre fro parys eke parable salomon ouydes arte bokes many one al bounden one volume euery nyght day hys custome leyser vacatioun worldly occupatioun reden boke wycked wyues knewe hem mo legendes lyues ben good woman byble trusteth wel impossyble clerke wolde speke good wyues yf ben holy sayntes lyues ne non woman neuer mo peynted lyon tel god yf woman writen story clerkes han within oratory wold haue writte men wickednesse al marke adam may redresse chyldren mercury venus ben workyng ful contrarious mercury loueth wysedom science venus loueth riot dispence dyuers disposition eche falleth others exaltation thus god wotte mercury desolate pisces venus exaltate venus falleth wher mercury reysed therfore woman clerke preysed clerke whan old may nought venus werkes nat worth olde shoe sytte doun write dotage woman nat kepe mariage nowe purpose tolde beten boke parde vpon nyght enken syre redde vpon boke sate fyre eue fyrst wickednesse al mankynde brought wretchednesse yt iesu christ hym selfe slayn bought v hert blode agayn lo expresse woman may ye fynde woman losse al mankynde tho rad sapson lost heeres slepyng lema cut hem sheres thorowe treson lost eyen tho rad yf shal nat lyen hercules deianyre caused sette selfe fyre nothyng forgate care wo socrates wyues two howe xantippe cast pysse heed sely man satte styl deed wyped heed durst sayn er thonder stynt cometh rayn pasiphae quene crete shreudnesse thought tale swete fye speke grisely thynge horrible lust lykyng clytennestra lechery falsely made husbande dye rad wel good deuosion tolde eke occasyon amphiaraus thebe lost lyfe husbonde legende hys lyfe eriphilem ouche golde hath preuely vnto grekes tolde husbonde hyd place thebe sory grace lyma tolde lucy made husbondes dye one loue hate lyma husbonde euyn late enpoysoned foe lucia lykerous loued husbonde shulde alway vpon thynke gaue hym suche loue maner drynke deed er morowe thus algates husbondes han sorowe tolde howe one latumeus complayned felowe arius garden growed suche tree whych sayd hys wyues thre honged hem selfe hertes dispitous lefe brother arius yeue plant thys blysful tree garden planted shal later date wyues hath redde han slayn husbondes bedde let lechour dight hem al nyght while cors lay slore vpright dryue nayles brayne while slepe thus haue slayn haue yeue hem poyson drynke spake harme hert may thynke therwithal knewe mo prouerbes world groweth grasse herbes bette thyne habitation lyon foule dragon woman vsyng chyde bette hygh rofe abyde angry wife hous ben wicked contrarious haten husbondes louen aye said woman cast shame away whan cast smocke farther mo fayre woman chast also lyke golde ryng sowes nose coude wene coude suppose wo myne hert pyne whan sawe wolde neuer fyne reden cursed boke al nyght al sodaynly thre leues haue plyght hys boke right radde eke fyst toke hym cheke fyre fell backwarde doun vp stert dothe wode lyoun fyst smote myne heed flore laye deed whan sey howe styl lay gast wold haue fledde awaye tyl last swoun brayde oh hast thou slayn false thefe sayde loude thus hast thou murdred er deed yet wol one kysse nere cam kneled faire doun said dere suster swete alysoun helpe god shal neuer smyte haue thy selfe wyte foryeue beseke yet efte sone hytte hym cheke sayd thefe thus moche wreke nowe wol dye may lenger speke last mokel care wo fel accorded within seluen two yaf al brydel myne honde haue gouernaunce house londe hys tonge hys honde also made hym bren boke anon tho whan goten vnto maistry al soueraynte sayd myne trewe wyse dothe thou lyste terme al thy lyfe kepe thyne honour eke myne estate alter day neuer debate god helpe hym kynde wyfe fro denmarke vnto inde also trewe praye god sytte maieste blysse hys soule mercy dere nowe wol say tale yf ye wol pthe frere lough whan herd al nowe dame haue ioye blysse long preamble tale whan sompner herd yt frere gale lo sompner goddes armes two frere wol entermete hym euermo lo good men flye eke frere wol fal euery dishe eke matere spekest thou preambulation amble trot eyther peace syt dou thou lettest disporte matere pyea wolt thou syr sopner ye frere nowe faye shal er go tel sompner suche tale two al folke shul laugh place nowe el frere beshrewe thy face quod sompner shrewe yf tel tale two thre freres er come sittyngburne shal make thyne hert murne wel wotte thy pacience goon pour hoost cried peace anoon sayd lette woman tel tale ye faren folke dronken ben ale dame tel forthe tale beste al redy syr ryght leste haue lycence thys worthy frere yes dame tel forthe tale wol phere endeth wyfe bathe prologue begynneth tale olde dayes kynge toure breton speken great honour al thys londe fulfylled fairy elfe quene ioly company daunsed ful ofte many grene mede olde opinyon rede speke many hundred yere go nowe man se none elfes mo nowe great charyte prayer lymytours holy freres serchen euery lande euery streme thicke mote sonne beme blissyng halle chambres kichens boures cyties borowes castelles hye toures thropes berne shepens deyties maketh ben fayries wonte walke elfe walketh lymitour hym selfe vndermeles mornynges saythe hys matyns hys holy thynges gothe hys lymitacioun woman may go safely vp doun euery bushe vnder euery tre ny none incubus ne wyl done hem dishonour pand fel kyng arrour house lusty bacheler day come rydyng fro ryuer happed alone borne sawe mayde walkyng hym byforne whiche mayde anon maugre hede force berafte maydenhede whiche oppression suche clamour suche pursute vnto kyng artour dampned knyght deed course lawe shuld haue lost heed peraduenture suche statute tho quene ladyes mo longe prayden kyng grace tyl lyfe graunted place yaue hym quene al wyl chese yt wolde hym saue spil quene thaketh ye king wt al might thus spake knyght whan sey tyme day pthou standest yet suche aray thy lyfe yet haste thou suerte graunte yt thy lyfe thou caust tel thyng woman moste desyren beware kepe thy necke bone yren yf thou canste tel anon yet wol yeue leue gon twelue moneth day seke lere answere suffycient matere suertie wol haue er thou passe thy body yelde place pwo knight soroufully syketh may done al lyketh laste chese hym wende come ayen ryght yeres ende answer god wold hym puruay taketh leue wedeth forth way seketh euery house euery place hopeth fynde grace lerne thyng woman louen moost ne couthe aryuen coost myght fynde matere two creature accordyng yfere sayd woman loued best rychesse sayd honour sayd iolynesse sayd riche aray said lust bedde ofte tyme ben wydowe wedde sayd herte moste esed whan ben flatered yplesed gothe ful nye sothe wol lye man shal wynne v beste flaterye attendaunce busynesse ben ilymed bothe lesse men sayn yt louen beste ben fre right v leste man repreue v vyce say wyse nothyng nyce trewly ny none v al wight wol clawe v gall nyl kyke sayth v sothe assay shal fynde dothe neuer victous within wol holden wyse clene syn men sayn yt great delite haue ben holde stable eke secre purpose stedfastly dwel nat bewray thyng men v tel tale nat worthe rake stele parde woman con nothyng hele witnesse midas wol ye tale pouyde among thynges smale said midas vnder long heeres growyng heed two ass eeres whiche vice hidde beste myght ful subtelly euery mannes syght saue wyfe wist mo loued trusted also prayde creature nolde tellen disfygure swore nat al ye world wyn nolde villany ne syn make husbonde haue foule name nolde nat tel shame natheles thought dyde long shulde counsayle hyde thought swole sore hert nedely worde stert syth durst tellen man marri fast ran tyl came hert fyre byttour bumbeth myre layd mouth vnto water adown bewray nat thou water thy sown quod tel mo husbonde hath long ass eres two nowe myne hert al hole nowe myght lenger kepe dout phere mowe ye se though tyme abyde yet mote counsayle hyde remenaunt tale yf ye wyl redeth ouyde ye may lere pthis knight tale specially whan sawe might come therby say woman louen moste within herte sorowful hys goste home gothe myght nat soiourne day come muste home returne way happed hym ryde al hys care vnder foreste syde sawe vpon daunce go ladyes foure twenty yet mo toward dauce drowe yt yerne hope wysedome shuld lerne certaynly er came fully vanyshed dauce niste creature sawe bare lyfe saue ye grene saw sytting old wife fouler wyght may man deuyse agayne knyght olde wyfe gan aryse sayd syr knight forth lyeth way tel ye seken fay parauenture may better olde folke conne moche thyng pmy lyfe mother thys knyght certayne nam deed yf sayne thyng yt wome moste desyre coude ye wilse wolde quite wel hyre plight thy trouth hode next thyng require thou shalte yf thy myght wol tel nyght haue trouth ye knight graunt pthan quod may wel auaunt thy lyfe safe wol stonde therby vpon lyfe quene wyl say let se whiche proudest hem al weareth kerchefe cal dare say nay shal teche let v go forthe without lenger speche tho rowned pistel ere bade hym glad haue fere pwha ben come ye court thys knyght sayd holde day hight redy hys answere sayde ful many noble wyfe many mayde many wydowe wyse quene selfe syttyng iustyse assembled ben answere afterwarde knight bode apere euery wight comaunded sylence knyght shulde tel audyence thyng worldly woman loued best knyght ne stode styl doth beste question anon answerde manly voyce al courte herde liege lady generally quod woman desyren haue soueraynte wel ouer husbondes loue ben maistrye hem aboue moste desyre though ye kyl dothe lyste wyl pin al courte na wyfe ne mayde ne wydowe contraried sayde sayd worthy han lyfe ye worde vp sterte olde wyfe yt knight fonde syttyng ye grene mercy souerayne lady quene er couete departe right taught answere vnto thys knyght whiche plight hys trouthe fyrst thyng wolde hym requere wolde yf lay hys might courte tha praye sir knight quod thou take vnto thy wyfe wel thou woste haue kept thy life say false saye nay vpon thy fay pthis knight answerd ala welaway wote right wel suche beheste goddes loue chese newe requeste take al good let body go nay shrewe v bothe two though foule olde poore nolde al metal ne ore vnder erthe graue lythe aboue yf thy wyfe thy loue pmy loue nay dampnation ala nacion shulde euer foule disparaged al naught ende costrayned yt nedes must wedde taketh olde wyfe gothe bedde pnowe wolden men say parauenture neglygence cure tellen ioye array feest ylke day thing answere shortly shal say ioy ne feest al na heuynesse moche sorowe priuely wedded morowe al day hydde hym oule wo hym wife loked foule gret ye sorow ye knight thouyt whan wife bedde ibrouyt waloweth turneth fro phi olde wyfe lay smylyng euermo sayd dere husbonde benedicite fareth euery knight thus ye lawe kyng artours house euery knyght loue daungerouse owne loue eke wyfe whiche saued hath lyfe certes yet dyd neuer vnryght fare ye thus fyrst nyght ye acen lyke man loste hys witte fy gilte god loue tel shal amended yf may pamended knyght ala nay nay wol ben amended neuer mo thou arte lothly olde also therto comen lowe kynde litel woder thogh walow wind wolde god myne herte wold brest pi cause onrest ye certaynly quod wonder ny pnowe syr couthe amende al lyst er dayes thre wel ye myght beare vnto ye speke suche gentylnesse discended olde richesse therfore shullen ye gentilmen suche errogaunce worthe hen lo moste vertuous alway preuy aperte entendeth aye gentyl dedes take hym greatest gentylman christ wolde claymed hym gentylnesse elder olde richesse though
