yeue v al herytage claymen ben hye parage yet may byquethe thyng none v vertuous lyuyng made hem gentylmen ycalled badde v folowen hem suche degre pwel wyse poete florence hyght daunte speke thys sentence lo suche maner ryme dauntes tale ful selde vp ryseth braunches smale prowesse man god goodnesse wol clayme hym oure gentylnesse elder may nothyng clayme teporal thyng yt may hurte maym eke euery wight wote wel gentilnesse planted naturally vnto certayne lynage downe lyne preuy aperte wolde neuer fyne done gentilnesse fayre offyce might vilanye ne vice take fyre beare derkest hous bytwixt mounte caucasus let men shytte dores go thenne yet wol fyre fayre lye brenne twenty thousande men might beholde offyce natural aye wol holde vp peryl lyfe yl dye phere may ye se wel howe gentrye annexed possession sythen folke operacion alway dothe fyre lo hys kynde god wotte men may ful often fynde lordes sonne done shame vilanye wol haue praise hys gentrye borne gentil house elder noble vertuouse nyl selfe gentil dedes ne folowe gentil auncetre deed ny gentyl duke erle fye vilaynes synful dedes maketh cherle gentilnesse ny renomie thyne aunceters hygh bountie whiche stronge thyng thy persone gentylnesse cometh fro god alone cometh gentylnesse grace nothyng byqueth v place pthynketh howe noble sayth valerius thylke tullius hostilius pouertie rose hye noblesse redeth senek redeth eke boece shal ye seen expresse drede gentil dothe gentil dedes therfore dere husbonde thus conclude myne aunceters rude yet may hye god hope graunt grace lyue vertuously gentil whan begynne lyue vertuously leuen synne ye pouertie repren hye god byleue wylful pouerte chese lede lyfe certes euery man mayde wyfe maye vnderstonde iesu heuen kyng ne wolde chese viciouse lyuyng glad pouert honest thyng certayne wol seneke clerkes sayne wolde hold payde pouerte holde hym ryche al sherte coueyteth ful poore wyght wolde han hys myght yt naught hath ne coueyteth haue rych al though ye holde knaue pouert synne properly iuuenal saythe pouert merily poore man whan gothe way byforne theues may synge play pouert hateful good gesse ful great bringer busynesse great amendet eke sapience hym taketh pacience pouert al thoughe seme elenge possession wyght wolchalenge pouerte ful often whan man lowe maketh hys god eke selfe knowe pouert spectacle thynketh one may frendes se therfore syn greue pouert repreue pnowe syr eke elde ye repreued certes syr though none autorite booke ye gentils honour sayne men shuld old wight honour clepe hem father gentilnesse autours shal fynde gesse pnow ye sayn yt foule olde drede ben coke wolde fylthe elthe foule also mote ben great wardeyus vpon chastite natheles syn knowe delyte shal fulfyl worldly appetyte chese one thiges tw haue foule olde tyl dry trewe humble wyfe neuer displease al lyfe el wol ye haue yonge fayre take auenture repayre shal come house bycause place may wel chese selue whether yt lyketh pthis knyght auyseth hym sore syketh last sayd manere lady loue wyfe dere put wyse gouernaunce cheseth selfe maye plesauce moste honour also force whether two lyketh suffyseth tha haue gote ye maistry syn may chese gouerne leste ye certes wyfe holde beste kysse ben lenger wrothe trouthe wol bothe say bothe fayre good pray god mote sterue wood also good trewe euer wyfe sythe ye world newe morowe fayre sene lady empresse quene bytwene este eke weste dothe lyfe right leste cast vp courteyn loke howe pand whan knyght sawe al fayre yonge therto ioy hente armes two herte bathed bathe blysse thousande tymes rowe gan kysse obeyed hym euery thyng mought done hym pleasure lykyng thus lyued vnto lyues ende parfyte ioy iesu christ v sende husbondes meke yonge freshe bedde grace ouerlyue hem wedde eke pray god short lyues wyl gouerned wyues olde angry nygardes dispence god sende hem sone pestylence phere endeth wyfe bathe tale begynneth streres prologue worthy lymytour thys noble frere made alway maner lourynge chere vpon sompner honeste vilaynes worde yet hym spake last sayd wyfe dame god yeue right good lyfe ye haue touched also mote schole mater ful great diffyculte ye haue sayd moche thyng right wel saye dame ryden waye v nedeth speken game lete auctorites goddes name prechyng schole clargy yf lyke vnto companye wol sompner tel game parde ye may wel knowe name sompner may good sayde pray none yuel payde sompner renner vp doun maundementes fornycation ybeate euery townes ende tho spake host said sir ye shulde ben hende curteys man estate companye wol debate telleth tale let sompner nay sompner let hym say hym lyst whan cometh lote god shal hym quite euery grote shal hym tel whiche great honour flatteryng lymytour eke many maner cryme whiche nedeth rehersen tyme hys offyce shal hym tel iwys hoste answerde peace thys afterwarde sayd vnto frere tel forthe tale myn maister dere phere endeth freres prologue foloweth tale whylom dwellyng countre archedeken man hye degre boldly dyd execution punishyng fornication withcrafte eke baudrie defamacion aduoutrie churche reues testamentes contractes lacke sacramentes vsure symonye also certes lechours dyd moche wo shulden synge yf hente smale tythers foule ishent person wolde vpon hem playne might asterte hem pecunyal payne smale tythes smal offrynge made people pitously synge er bishop caught hem hys hoke archedekens booke hys iurdictyon power done hem correction sompner redy honde slyer boye none englonde subtelly espiayle taught hym myght auayle couthe spare lechours one two techen hym foure twenty mo thogh sopner wode hare tel harlotrye wol spare ben hys correction haue v iurdiction ne neuer shullen terme al lyues ppeter ben woman stewes sompner yput cure peace mischauce misauenture sayd hoste let hym tel hys tale telleth forthe let sompner gale ne spareth myne owne maister dere pthis fals thefe sopner frere alway baudes redy hys honde hauke lure englonde telleth hym al secre knew aquayntauce come newe aprouers priuely toke hym selfe great profyte therby maister knewe alway wan without maundement leude man coude sommon payne christes curse glad fyllen hys purse made hym great feestes nale right iudas purse smale thefe right suche thefe maister halfe deutie yf shal yeuen hym hys laude thefe sompner eke baude eke wench hys retinue whether syr roberde syr hue iohan rafe lay hem tolde eere thus ye wench one assent wolde fetche fayned maundement sommon hem chapitre bothe two pylle man let wenche go wolde say frende shal thy sake stryken letter blake dare case trauayle thy frende may auayle certayne knewe bribries mo possible tel yeres two worlde ny dogge bowe hurte dere hole knowe bet sompner knewe slye lechour auoutrer el paramour fruite al hys rente therfore sette al hys entent befyl one day sompner waytynge euer pray rode sommo old wedowe ribybe faynyng cause wolde haue bribe happed sawe beforn hym ryde gay yoman vnder forest syde bowe bare arowes bright shene vpon courtpye grene hatte vpon heed strynges blake sir sompner haile wel ytake pwelcome euery good felawe whider ridest yu vnder grenwode shawe sayd yoman wolte thou ferre day sompner hym answerd sayd nay fast myne entent ryden reysen vp rent longeth lordes dewte arte thou bayly ye durst nat fylth shame say sompner name depardieur yoman lefe brother thou arte bayly another vnknowen countre thyne acqueyntaunce wol pray eke brotherhed yf thou list haue golde syluer chist yf ye happe come shyre al shal thyne right thou wolt desyre graut mercy sompner faithe euerich trouthe laythe sworne brethern tyl dey yt worde riden forth wey sompner wt ful iagles ful venym ben wariangles euer enquyring vpon euery thyng brother dwellyng another day yf shulde seche yoman hym answerde soft speche brother ferre north countre hope somtyme shal se departe shal wel wysse myne house thou shalte neuer mysse brother sompner pray teche ryden way sith ye ben baylye subtelte tel faithfully myne offyce howe may wynne spareth nat conscience ne synne brother tel howe ye nowe trouth brother dere sayd shal tellen faithful tale wage ben ful straite smale lorde harde daungerous myne offyce ful laborous therfore extortion leue forsothe al men wol yeue algate sleyght violence yere yere wyn al dispence better tellen faithfully nowe certes sompnour fate spare nat take god wote yf heuy hote may getten counsayle priuely maner conscience haue nere myne extorcion myght lyuen suche iapes wol nat shriuen stomake ne conscience knowe non shrewe al shrift father euerichon wel met god swete saynt iame lefe brother tel thy name quod sompner thys mean yoman gan lytel smyle pbrother wolte thou tel fende dwellyng hel ride purchasyng wete may gete thyng purchase theffecte al rent loke howe thou ridest entent wyne good thou reckest neuer howe right fare ride wol nowe vnto worldes ende pray ah sompner benedicite ye say wende ye woman trewly ye haue mannes shappe wel haue ye fygure determynate hel ye ben estate nay certaynly haue non whan v lyketh take v one el make seme ben shape somtyme lyke man lyke ape lyke angel ryde go wonder thyng though lousy iuggler disceyue parde yet crafte sompnour ride ye tha gon sondrie shappe nat alway one wol v suche forme make able prayes take maketh haue al labour pful many cause lefe syr sompnour sayd fende al thyng hath tyme day short passed pryme yet ne gote nothyng day wol enrende wynnyng yf may nat entende wyttes declare brother myne thy wyttes ben al bare vnderstand al though wolde tel thou askest laboren somtyme goddes instrumentes meanes comaundementes hym lust creature dyuers arte dyuers fygures withouten hem haue might certayn yf lyst stonden agayn somtyme praye haue leue onely body nought soule greue wytnesse iob deden wo somtyme haue myght bothe two sayn body soule eke somtyme ben suffred seke vpon man soule vnrest nat body al best whan withstandeth temptation cause hys saluation al nat entent shuld safe wolde hent somtyme seruauntes vnto man archbysshoppe saynt dunstan apostel eke seruaunt yet tel sompnour faithfully make ye newe body thus alway elementes fende answered nay somtyme fayn somtyme aryse deed body sondrie wise speke renably fayre wel phitonesse dyd samuel yet wolde men say nat force deuynite thyng warne wol nat iape thou wolte algates wete howe shape thou shalt herafterwarde brother dere come nedeth nat lere thou shalt thyne experience conne chare rede thys sentence bette vergyl lyue daunt also nowe lette v ride blyue wol holde company tyl thou forsake nay sompnour yt shal nat betide yoman knowen ful wyde trouth wol holde yt caas though thou deuyll sathanas trouth wol holde brother sworne eche v trewe brother caas brother gon purchaas take thou thy parte men wol yeue shal myne thus shal leue yf v haue let trew parte brother graunt deuyl fay wt worde riden forth way right thentrynge rownes ende ye sompner shope wed sawe carte charged wt hay carter droue forth way depe way carte stode carter smote striued wode heit scot heit brok spare ye ye stone fende fetch body bone ferforth euer ye yfoled moche wo haue tholed deuyl haue al horse carte hay sompnour shal haue pray nere ye fende drew nouyt ne ful preuily rowned ere herken brother herken thy fayth herest thou carter saith hent anon hath yeue hay carte eke caples thre nay deuyl god wotte neuer dele nat entent trust wele aske thy selfe yf thou trowest nat el stynt whyle thou shalte se carter thacked horse ye croupe begon drawe stoupe heit nowe iesu christ blesse al hondy werke lesse wel ytwight myn lyard boy pray god saue saynt loye nywe carte slowe parde lo brother fende tolde may ye seen myn owne dere brother carle spake thig thouyt another lette v go forth viage wyn nothyng vpon cariage wha yt come somwhat ye town thys sompner brother gan rown brother wonneth olde rebecke almost lefe lese necke yeue peny good wol haue xij pen tho wood wol sompne offyce yet god wotte knowe vyce thou canst nat countre wynne thy cost take ensample sopner clappeth ye wedowes gate come sayd thou olde veritrate trowe thou hast frere preest wt clappeth ther said wife benedicite god saue syr swete wyl haue sommos byl vp payne cursyng loke thou morowe archdeacon kne answere court certayn thynges nowe lorde iesu kyng kynges wisely helpe ne may haue ben sycke ful many day may nat go ferre ne ryde deed pricketh syde may nat aske lybel syr sompnour answere proctour suche thyng men wolde apposen yes sompnour paye anon let se twelfe pen wyl acquyte shal profyte haue therof lyte maister hath profyte nat come lette ryden hastely gyue xii pen may lenger tary twelf pen lady saynt mary wisely helpe care synne wyde world though shuld wynne ne haue nat xij pen within holde ye knowe wel poore olde kyth almesse poore wretche nay foule fende fetche yf excuse though thou shuldest spylt ala god wotte yet haue gylt ppaye swete saynt anne wol bere away thy newe panne dette whiche thou owest olde whan thou madest thyne husbonde cokolde payde home thy correction thou lyest saluation ne neuer er nowe wedowe ne wyfe sompned vnto court al lyfe ne neuer na body trewe vnto deuyl blacke rough hewe yeue thy body panne also whan deuyll herde curse vpon knee sayd manere nowe mably myne owne mother dere wyl ernest ye sey deuyl fette er dey pan al wol hym repent nay olde stotte nat myne entent quod sompner repent thyng haue wolde thy smocke euery clothe nowe brother deuyl nat wrothe thy body pan myne right thou shalt hel yet nyght thou shalte knowen preuyte maister deuynite ye worde foule fende het body soule deuyl went sompnours haue heritage god made hys ymage mankynde saue gyde v al leue sompnour good man become lordiges coud haue told frere leyser sompnour text christ poule iohn doctours many one suche peynes hertes myght agryse albeit tonge may deuyse though yt might thousande wynter tel peynes cursed house hel kepe v fro cursed place wake prayeth iesu hys grace kepe v temptour sathanas herkeneth worde beware caas lyon sytteth awayte alway slee innocent yf may disposeth aye hertes withstonde fende yt wolde make thral bonde may tempte ouer myght christ wol champion knyght prayeth sompnour repete hys misdede er fende hym hente phere endeth freres tale begynneth sompners prologue sompner styropes hye stode vpon frere herte wode lyke aspe lefe quoke yre lordynges one thyng desyre beseche curtesy sythens ye han herde false frere lye suffreth may tale tel frere bosteth knoweth hel god wote lytel wonder freres fendes ben lytel sonder parde ye han ofte tyme herde tell howe frere rauyshed hel spyrit one visyoun angel ledde hym vp doun shewe hym paynes al place sawe frere folke sawe ynowe wo vnto aungel spake frere tho nowe syr han freres suche grace none hem shal come place pyes aungel many myllyoun vnto sathanas ladde hym adoun nowe hath sathanas suche tayle broder caryke sayle holde vp thy tayle thou sathanas shewe forthe thyn erse let frere se neste freres place er halfe forlonge way space right bee swarmen hyue dyuels erse gan dryue twenty thousande freres route throughout hel swarmed al aboute comen ayen faste might gon erse crepten euerychon clapte hys tayle ayen lay styl pthis frere whan loked fyl vpon turmentes thys sory place spyrite god restored hys grace vnto hys body ayen awoke natheles yet fere quoke dyuels erse aye hys mynde heritage kynde god saue al saue cursed frere prologue wol ende manere phere endeth sompners prologue foloweth tale lordynges ther yorkshyre gesse marshy countrey called holdernesse whiche went lymytour aboute preach eke begge doute byfel day thys frere preched church manere specially abouen euery thyng exited people hys prechyng trental yeuen goddes sake wherwith men mighte holy house make diuyne seruyce honoured wasted deuoured ne nedeth yeuen possesseioners mowen el lyuen thonked god wele haboundaunce trental delyuereth sayde fro penaunce frendes soules wel olde yonge hastely isonge holde preest ioly gay syngeth one messe day delyuereth anon soules ful harde fleshe hoke wt oules ben yelawed brenne bake nowe spedeth hastely christes sake whan frere said al entent qui cum patre forthe hys way went whe folke church yeue lest went way enger wolde rest scryppe typped staffe ytucked hye euery house gan pore prye begged mele chese el come felowe slasse typped horne payre table al iuory poyntel polished fetously wrote alway name stoode al folke yaue hym goode askaunce wolde hem prey yeue v bushel wheate malte rey goddes kychel tryppe chese el ye lyst may chese goddes halfpeny masse peny yeue v brawne yf ye haue dagon blanket leue dame suster dere lo write name bacon befe suche thyng ye fynde sturdy harlot went hem ay behynde hostes man bare sacke yaue hem layde backe whan dore anone planed away name euerychone written ables serued hem ny le fable pnay thou lyest sopner frere peace host christes mother dere tel forthe thy tale spare al thrine sompner shal pso longe went fro hous house til came house ther wont refreshed hundred placis sicke lay good man whose place bedred vpon couche lowe lay deus hic thomas frend good day sayd frere curtessy softe thomas god yelde ful ofte haue vpon benche faren ful wele haue eaten many mery mele fro benche droue away catte layde adowne hys potent hatte eke scryppe set hym softe adowne felowe go walked towne forthe knaue hostelrye shope ilke night lye po dere maister quod syke man howe haue ye faren sythen marche began sawe fourtenight pgod wot laboured haue ful sore specially thy saluacion haue sayd many preciouse orison frendes god hem blesse haue day ben churche messe sayd sermon symple wytte al text holy writte harde suppose therfore wol teche al glose glosyng glorious thyng certayne letter sleeth clerkes sayne haue hem taught ben charitable spende good resonable sawe dame pyonder yerde trowe sayd thys man wol come anon peye mayster welcom ye saynt iohn sayd wyfe howe fare ye hertely pthis frere aryseth vp ful curtessy enbraseth armes narowe kysseth herswetely cherketh sparowe wt lippes dame right wele seruaunt euery dele thanked god yaue soule lyfe yet sawe day fayre wife al churche god saue ye god amende al fautes syr algates welcome ye fay graut mercy dame yt haue foude alway great goodnesse leue wol pray ye greue wol thomas speke lytel throwe curate ben ful neglygent slowe gropen tenderly mannes conscience schrift prechyng diligence studye peter wordes poules walke fyshe christen mennes soules yelde iesu christ propre rent sprede hys wordes al myne entent pnowe leue dere mayster chydeth hym wel saynt charite angry pysse myre though haue al desyre though hi wry anight make hi warme ouer hym lay legge myne arme groneth lyke bore yt lyeth stye dysporte hym ryght none haue may please hym maner caas thomas ie vo die thomas thomas maketh ye fende must ben ameded ire thynge god hyghly defended therof wol speake worde two pnow mayster wyfe er go wol ye dyne wol go ther aboute dame vous die sans doute haue capon lyuer whyte breed shyuer rosted pygges heed nolde beest deed ynowe suffysaunce man lytel sustinaunce spirite hath hys fosteryng byble body aye redy penyble wake body dystroyde pray dame ye nought anoyde though frendly cousaile shewe god nolde haue tolde fewe pnowe syr one worde er ye go chylde deed within wekes two sone ye wente thys toun hys death sawe reuelacioun sayd thys frere home dortoure dare wel sayne er halfe houre hys death sawe hym borne blysse myne auisioun god wysse dyd sexten fermerere han ben true freres thys fyftye yere may god thanked hys lone maken iubely wa ken alone vp arose al couente eke wyth many teere tryllynge cheke wythouten noyse claterynge belle te deum songe nothinge elles saue christ sayd orison thankynge hym reuelacion syr dame trusteth ryght wel orison ben effectuel sene christes secret thinges borel folke although kynges lyue pouerte abstinence borel folke rychesse dyspence meate drynke foule delyte han thys worldly luste al dyspyte lazar diues lyueden dyuersly dyuers guerdon therby wol pray muste faste clene fatte hys soule make hys body lene fare sayth apostle cloth foode suffyseth v though ful goode clennesse fastynge v freres maketh christ accepteth prayeres plo moyses fourty dayes fourty nyght fasted er hye god hys myght spake wyth hym mounte synay wyth empty wombe fastynge many day receyued lawe wrytten wyth goddes fynger hely wel ye witten mount horeb er speche wyth hygh god soules leche fasted longe contemplaunce paaron yt temple gouernaunce eke prestes euerychone temple shulde gone prayen people done seruyce nolde drynke maner wyse drynke dronke myght hem make abstinence praye wake lest deden take hede saye sobre people praye ware saye suffyseth lorde iesu holy wryte deuyseth yaue v ensample fastynge prayer therfore mendicantes sely freres ben wedded pouerte continence charite humblenesse abstinence persecution ryghtwysnesse wepynge mysericorde clennesse therfore maye ye se prayeres speke v mendicant freres ben hye god acceptable wyth feest table pfro paradyse fyrst yf shal lye man outchased hys glotonye chast man paradyse certayn herken yow thomas shal sayn haue texte therof suppose fynde maner glose specially swete lorde iesus spake thys freres sayd thus blessed poore spirite bene forth al gospel maye ye sene whether lyker perfection swymmen possession fye pompe glotonye leudnesse hem defye thynketh lyke iouinian fatte whale walkynge swan vinolent botel spen e prayer ful lytel reuerence soules say ye psalme dauid lo bouffe sayn cor meum eructauit foloweth christes gospel hys lo e humble chaste poore werkers goddes worde auditours therfore ryght hauke sour vp spryngeth eyre prayeres charitable chast busy freres maken sour goddes eeres two thomas thomas mote ryde go lorde cleped saynt yue ne yu brother yu shuldest thryue chapiter pray daye nyght christ sende helth myght thy body welden hastely pgod wore nothynge therof fele helpe christ fewe yeres haue spended vpon dyuers maner freres wel many poude yet fare neuer bette certayne good haue almost besette fare wel good almoste ago frere answered thomas dost yu nedeth dyuers freres seche nedeth hath parfyte leche sechen lech toun inconstaunce confusioun holde ye el couent prayen insufficient thomas tape ny worth myte maladye haue lyte yeue couent halfe quarter otes yeue couent foure twenty grotes yeue frere penny let hym go nay nay thomas may nothynge ferthyng worth parted twelue lo eche thynge oned hym selue stronge scatered thomas thou shalt ben yflatered thou wolst haue al labour nought hye god yt al thys world hath wrought sayeth yt workman worthy hyre thomas nought treasoure desyre selfe al couent praye aye dyligent buylden christes owne chyrche thomas yf ye wol lerne wyrche buyldynge vp chyrches may ye fynde yf good thomas lyfe inde ye lyggen ful anger yre ye deuel setteth hert fyre chyden thys holy innocent wyfe meke pacient therfore trowe thomas leste ne chyde wyth thy wyfe beste beare thys worde awaye thy fayth touchinge thing lo ye wyse sayth wythin thy house thou lyon thy subiectes thou none oppression ne make thyne acquayntaunce e yet thomas eftsones charge beware thy bosome slepeth ware serpent slyly crepeth vnder grasse styngeth ful subtelly beware sonne herken paciently twety thousade han lost lyues stryuinge lemans wyues nowe sen ye haue holy meke wyfe nebeth thomas make stryfe ny ywysse serpent cruel treden tayle ne halfe fell woma whe hath caught yre vengeaunce al desyre pire synne one greatest seuen abhominable vnto hygh god heuen hym selfe dystruction thys euery leude vycare p rson saye yre engendreth homecyde ire soth executour pryde coulde yre say muche sorowe tale shulde last tyl morowe therfore pray god daye nyght yrous man sende lytell myght great harme eke great pyte set yrous man hye degre whylom yrous potestate sayeth seneke durynge hys estate vpon daye rydden knyghtes two fortune wolde shulde one hem cam home yt nought anone knyght ye iudge brought said thus thou hast thy felowe slayne whych deme death certayne another knyght comaunded go lede hym death charge hapned went wey towarde place shulde dey kniyt came wede dede thought best rede lede iudge agayne sayde lorde knight hath slayne hys felowe stante hole alyue ye shullen deed mote thryue saye one two thre fyrst knyght ryght thus spake dampned thou must algate deed thou muste also lese nedes thyne heed thou arte cause thy felowe deyth ye thyrde knyght ryght thus seyth thou hast done comaunded thus dyd hem slayne al thre irouse c hyses eke dronkelewe aye dely hym ben shrewe byfel lorde hys meyne loued wel vertuous moralite said day betwyxt hem two right thus lorde lost yf aught vicious dronkennesse eke foule recorde man namely lorde many eye many eere awaytynge lorde notte goddes loue drynketh temporatly wyne maketh man lese wretchedly hys mynde hys lymmes euerychone pthe reuers shalte thou se anone preue thyne owne experience wyne ne doth folke offence ny wyne byreueth myght honde foote ne myne eye syght dispyte dronke mochel hundred tymes dyd ryght anone thys cursed yrouse wretch let thys knyghtes sonne byforne fetch comauding shulde byforne stode sodaynly toke hys bowe honde vp strynge pulled hys eere wyth arowe slough ye childe whether haue seker hode none al myght mynde agone hath wyne byreued myne eyen syght pwhat shulde tel answere ye knyght hys sone slayne say beware therfore wyth lordes howe ye play synge placebo shal yf yf vnto poore man poore man one shulde hys vyces tel lorde though shuld go hel lo yrous cirus thylke per ien howe destroyed ryuer gysen horse hys dreynt therin went babylon wynne made ryuer smal men myght ryde waden ouer al plo sayd wel teche ne felowe none yrous man ne wyth wode man walke way leste thou repente wol farther say pnow thomas leue brother leaue thyn yre thou shalt fynde iuste squyre hold dyuels knyfe aye thyne herte thyne angre doth al sore smerte shewe al thy confession pnay sycke man saynt symon haue shryue thys day curate haue tolde hym al myne estate nedeth nomore speke sayeth yf lyst myne humilite yeue thy gold make cloistre many muskle many oystre men haue ben ful wel ese hath ben foode cloystre rese yet god wote vnneth foundament parfourmed ne pauement tyle yet wythin wones god owe fourty pounde stone helpe thomas ye harowed hell el mote bokes sell yf lacke predication goeth thys worlde al dystruction wol fro thys worlde v byreue god saue thomas leue wolde byreue world sonne techen worchen conne lytel tyme syth helye helyse han freres ben fynde recorde charite ythanked lorde thomas saynt charite downe anone sytteth hys kne pthys sycke woxe nye woode yre wolde frere ben fyre wyth hys false dyssimulation suche thynges ben possessyon may yeue none ye sayn thus howe yt brother ye certes thys frere trusteth wele toke dame lettre sele pnowe wel somwhat shal yeue vnto holy couent whyle lyue thyne honde thou shal haue anone thys condicion none thou departe leue brother euery frere haue moche thys shalt thou swere thy profession wythout fraude cauelacion pi swere trere faythe therwithal hys hande hys laythe lo faythe shalbe lacke pthen put thyne hade downe backe sayd thys man grope well behynde byneth buttocke thou shalt fynde thynge haue hydde priuyte ah thought frere shal go adowne shofth hys honde clyste hope fynde good gyfte thys sycke man felte thys frere aboute hys towel gropynge amyd hys honde let frere farte ny capel drawynge carte myght haue let farte soun pthe frere vp starte doth wode lyon false churle frere goddes bone thys hast thou dyspyte none thou shalte abye thys farte yf may hys meyny herde thys afraye came leapyng chased frere forth goeth wyth ful angry chere fette hys felowe laye store loked wylde bore grynted hys teth wrothe sturdy pace downe court gothe woned great honour alway confessour worthy man lorde vylage thys frere came rage thys lorde sate catyng borde vnnethes myght frere speke worde tyl laste sayd god se pthys lorde gan loke sayd benedicite frere iho maner world se wel somthynge amys ye loke though ye wod ful theues syt downe tel grefe shalbe amended yf may pi haue dyspyte day god yelde adowne village world none poore page nolde haue abhominacioun haue receaued toun yet greueth nothynge sore olde churle wyth locke hore blasphemed hath holy couent eke pnow mayster thys lorde beseke mayster syr seruitour though haue schole honour god lyketh men v raby calle neyther market ne large halle force tel grefe psyr thys frere odious myschefe thys day betyde myne ordre per consequens eche degre holy churche god amende sone syr lorde ye wote done dystempre ye ben confessour ye ben salte earth sauour goddes loue pacience nowe holde telleth grefe anone tolde ye han herde ye wote well lady house aye styll satte tyl herde frere sayde eye goddes mother blysful mayde nought el tel faythfully madame howe thynketh ye therby howe thynketh god spede saye churle hath done churles dede shulde saye god let hym neuer hys sycke heed ful vanite ho de hym maner frenesye madame god shal lye wyse may ben hym awreke shal slaunder ouer al speke false blasphemour charged parte myght departed euery man ylyche wyth myschaunce lorde sate styl trau hys herte rolled vp doun howe thys churle ymaginacioun shewe suche probleme frere neuer erst ne herde matere trowe dyuel put hys mynde al arsmetryke shal man fynde byforne thys daye suche question shulde make demonstracion euery man shulde ilyke haue parte sowne sauoure farte nyce proude churle shrewe thy face lo syrs lorde harde grace euer hearde thynge nowe euery man ylyke tell howe impossyble may e nyce churle gyd let hym neuer rumblyge farte euery sonne ny eyre reuerberacyoune euer wasteth lytle lytle away man demen fay yf departed equally lo churle lo yet shreudly vnto confessour day spake holde hym certayne demoniake eteth meat let ye churle go play let hym go hongen hym selfe deuel way stode lordes squyer borde carfe meate herd word worde al thynge whych haue sayde lorde euel apayde couth tel gowne cloth syr frere ye ben wroth howe thys farte shulde euen ydeled amonges couent yf lyketh tel ye lorde thou shalt haue anon gowne clothe god saynt ihon lorde yt weder fayre wythouten wynde perturbynge ayre let brynge carte whele thys hall loke haue hys spoke twelue spoke hath carte whele comenly brynge xij freres wote ye thyrtene couent gesse confessour hys worthynesse shal perfourme vp nombre couet shulle knelen adowne one asset euery spoke ende thys manere ful sadly lay hys nose shal frere noble confessour god saue shal holde hys nose vpryght vnder ye naue shal churle wt bely styffe tought tabour hyther ben ybrought set whele right carte vpon naue make hym let farte ye shullen se vp peryl lyfe prefe whych demonstratyfe equally sowne wyl wende eke stynke vnto spoke ende saue yt thys worthy man confessour bycause man great honour shal haue fyrst frutes reson noble vsage freres yet thys worthest hem shul fyrst serued certaynly hath wel deserued hath day taught v moch good wyth prechynge pulpet stood may vouchsafe saye fyrst smel fartes thre wolde al hys brother hardely beareth hym fayre holyly pthe lord ye lady eche man saue ye frere sayd iankyn spake thys matere wel ouyde dyd ptholome touchynge churles sayd subtylte hye wytte made hym speke spake ny foole ne demoniake iankyn hath ywonne newe gowne tale done ben almoste towne phere endeth sompners tale foloweth clerke oxenfordes prologue sir clerke oxforde hoost sayde ye ryde stil coye doth mayde newe spoused syttynge borde day ne herd mouth worde trowe ye studye sophyme salomon sayeth al thynge hath tyme goddes sake bethe better chere tyme studye tel v mery tale faye man entred playe nedes mote vnto playe assent precheth freres done lent make v olde synnes wepe ne thy tale make v slepe tel v mery thynge auentures termes fygures coloures kepe hem store tyl ye endyte hyghe style men kynges wryte speketh playne thys tyme pray may vnderstande ye say pthys worthy clerke benyngly answerde hoste vnder yerde ye haue v nowe gouernaunce therfore wol obeysaunce farre reason asketh hardely wol tel tale whych lerned padowe worthy clerke preued hys wordes hys werke deed nayled hys cheste praye god sende hys soule good reste fraunces petrarke laureat poete hyght thys clerke whose rhetoryke swete enlumined al tayle poetrye lyuian dyd philosophye lawe arte perticulere death ye wol suffre v dwellen twynklynge eye hem bothe hath slayne al shal dye pbut tellen worthy man taught tale fyrst began say fyrst hye style endyteth body hys tale writeth proheme whiche discriueth piemount saluce countre speketh apenniny hylles hye ben boundes west lumbardye mount vesulus special poo wel smal taketh hys fyrst spring hys sour estwarde euer increseth cours emelle warde ferare venyse whiche longe tyme deuyse truly iugement thynketh thyng inpartinent saue hym lyste conuey hys matere tale ye shullen phere endeth prologue clerke oxenforde foloweth hys tale west syde itayle rote vesulus colde lusty playne habundaunt vitayle wher many town tour thou maist behold founded tyme father olde many nother delectable syght saluces noble countre hight markes whylom londe worthy elder hym byfore obeysaunt aye redy hys honde al hys liege bothe lesse thus delyte lyued hath done yore beloued drad fauour fortune bothe lordes hys commune therwith speke lynage gentylest yborne al lomberdy fayre person stronge yong age ful honour curtesye discrete ynowe countre gye saue thynges blame walter yonge lordes name blame thus consydred nou tyme comyng hym might betyde lust present al thought hauke hunt euerysyde welny al cure lette slyde eke ne wolde worst al wedde wife ought myght befal onely poynt hys people bare sore flockmele day hym went one hem wisest lore el lorde wolde best assent shulde tel people met el coude shewe suche matere markes sayd ye shullen po noble marque humanyte assureth v yeueth v hardynesse ofte tyme necessyte may tel heuynesse accepteth lorde gentylnesse pitous hert playne lette eares nat voice disdayne al haue nat done matere another hath place yet moche ye lorde dere haue alway shewed fauour grace dare better aske space audience shewen requeste ye lorde done right leste certes lorde wel v lyketh al werkes euer haue ye ne coulde owne selfe deuysen howe myght lyuen felycite saue one thyng lorde yf wyl wedded man lest tha people souerayn hertes boweth necke vnder blisful yoke soueraynte seruyse whiche men clepen spousayle wedloke thiketh lord amog thoughtes wise howe dayes passen sundrie wyse though slepe wake ronne ryde ye leeth tyme wol man abyde though grene youthe floure yet crepeth age alway styl stone dethe manaseth euery age smyte eche estate escapeth none also certayn knowen echone shul dye vncertayne al ben day dethe shal v fal accepteth v trewe entent neuer yet refused heste wol al lorde yf ye wol assent chefe wyfe shorte tyme lest borne gentillest meste al londe aught seme honour god nere ca deme delyuer v al busy drede take wyfe hye goddes sake yf befel god forbede thorowe dethe linage shuld slake straunge successour shulde take heritage wo v lyue wherfore pray hastely wyue pher meke prayere pytouse chere made maikes haue pyte wol ye myne owne people dere neuer erst thought constrayne reioyced lyberte selden tyme founde mariage free mote ben seruage natheles se true entente trust vpon wytte haue done aye wherfore fre wyl wol assente wedden sone euer may ye haue profred day chese wyfe relese choyce pray profer cese god wote child ofte vnlyke worthy elder hem bounte cometh al god nat streen whiche ben engendred ibore trust goddes bounte therfore mariage myne estate rest hym take may hym lest lette alone chesynge wyfe charge vpon backe wol endure pray charge vpon lyfe wyfe take ye ensure worship while lyfe may dure worde werke el emperours doughter furthermore thus shal ye swere yt ye ayenst choyce shal neuer grutch ne stryue sythe shal go lyberte request euer mote thryue myn hert set wol wyue ye wol assent suche manere pray speketh matere herty wyl sworen assent al thyng sayd wight nay besechyng hym grace er went wolde hem graunt certayn day spousaile soone euer may yet alway people somwhat dredde lest markes wolde wyfe wedde graunted hem day suche lest whiche wolde wedded sekerly sayd dyd al request humble entent ful buxomly knelyng vpon knee ful reuerently hym thonked al thus han ende entent home ayen wende vpon toke offycers commaundyng feest puruay priuy knyghtes squyers suche charge yaue lyst hem lay comaundement obey eche hem dothe hys dilygence done feest reuerence pexplicit par prima et incipit par secunda nought ferre fro thylke place honorable markes shope hys mariage stode thrope syght ful delectable whiche poore folke village hadden beestes ygage labour toke sustenaunce erthe yaue hem habundaunce amoge poore folke ther dwelled holden poorest hem hye god somtyme sende grace vnto lytel oxe stall ianycola men thrope hym cal doughter fayre ynough syght grisylde yonge mayden hyght speke vertuous beaute one fayrest vnder sonne ful poorely yfostred lykerouse lust herte ironne wel ofter wel tonne dronke wolde vertue plese knewe wel laboure ydel ese though mayde tender age yet brest virginite enclosed sadde rype corage great reuerence charyte olde poore father fostred fewe shepe spynnyng felde kept wolde ben idel tyl slept wha homward came wold bring wortes herbes tymes ful ofte shradde sethe lyuyng made bedde ful hard nothing softe aye kepte father lyfe lofte euery obeysaunce dilygence childe might father reuerece pvpon grisylde poore creature wel ofte hath markes sette eye huntyng rode parauenture whan fel myght aspye wanton lokyng solye eyen caste vpon sadde wyse vpon chere wolde ofte auyse commending herte womahode eke vertue passyng euery wyght yonge age wel chere dede though people haue great insyght vertue consydred ful ryght bounte disposed wolde wedde yf euer wedde shulde day weddyng com wight ca tel woman shulde whiche maruaile wondred many man sayden whan priuete wol lorde yet leaue vanyte wol wedde ala ala whyle wol thus selfe v begyle nathelesse markes hath make gemmes set golde asure broches rynges grisyldes sake clothyng toke mesure mayden lyke statute eke ornamentes al suche weddyng shulde fal tyme vndren day approched weddyng shulde al paleys put array bothe halle chambre eche degre house offyces stuffed great plente mayste thou se daynteous vitayle may founde fer lasteth itayle royal markes rychely arayde lordes ladyes companye feest prayde retinue bachelery many sowne sondrie melodye vnto village tolde aray right way hath holde pgrisylde god wotte ful innocent shape al array fetche water wel went cometh home sone euer may wel herde say ylke day ye markes shuld wedde might wolde fayne seen syght thought wold wt maydens stode ben felowes se markes therto wol fonde done home sone may labour longeth may leyser beholde way castel holde wolde ouer thresholde gon markes came gan call sette downe water potte anon besyde thresholde ore stal downe vpon knee gan fal sadde countenaunce kneled styl tyl herde lordes wyl thoughtful markes spake ye mayd wel soberly sayd manere father grisylde sayd reuerence meke chere answerde lorde al redy gothe without lenger lette markes father fette honde toke olde man sayd thus whan hym asyde ianycola neyther may ne lenger pleasaunce myne herte hyde thou vouchsafe euer betyde thy doughter wol take wende wyfe lyues ende thou louest wotte wel certayne arte faythful liege man ybore al lyketh dare wel sayne lyketh specially therfore tel poynte haue said thou wolt purpose drawe take thy sonne lawe pthis sodayne case man astoned reed wext abashed al quakyng stode ne vnneth sayd wordes mo onely thus lorde wyllyng ye wol ne ayenst lykyng wol nothyng ye lorde dere right lyste gouerne matere wol thus markes sothly thy chambre haue collation wost thou wol aske yf wyl wyfe rule al shal done thy presence wol speke thyn audyence chambre treties whiche ye shal people came house without wondred hem honest manere tentifly kept father dere vtterly grisylde wonder myght neuer erste sawe suche syght wonder though astoned se great gest come place neuer suche gestes woned loked ful pale face shortly fro mater pace wordes yt markes sayd benygne faythful mayde pgrisylde said ye shal wel vnderstonde lyketh vnto father wedde eke may stonde suppose ye wol demaundes aske fyrst sythen shal done hasty wyse wol ye therto assent el auyse say thus ye redy good herte al luste frely may best liketh though ye laugh smerte neuer ye grutche nyght ne day whan say ye ye say one nay neyther word ne frowning coutenace swere swere aliaunce pwodryng vpo wordes quakyng drede said lorde indigne vnworthy thylke honour ye bede right ye wol wol swere neuer wyllyngly word werke ne thouyt nil disobey deed though loth dey pthis ynough grisylde myne forthe gothe sobre chere dore came people said manere wyfe stondeth honoureth loueth pray loueth ny say thyng olde gere shulde bring house badde woman shulde dispoyle right ladyes nothing gladde hadle clothes clad nathelesse thys mayden bright hewe fro foote heed clothed han al newe heer han kembed yt laye vntressed ful rudely fyngres smale crowne heed han idressed set ful ouches great smale array shulde make tale vnneth people knew fairnesse whan transfourmed richesse pthis markes hath spoused wt ringe bought cause set vpon horse snowe white wel amblynge paleys lenger let ioyful people ladde met conueyed thus day spende reuel tyl sonne gan discende shortly forthe tale chace saye newe markessesse god hath ysent suche fauour hys grace semed lykelynesse borne fedde rudenesse cote oxe stal norished emperoures hal euery wight woxen dere worship ful ye folke ther bore fro byrthe knewe yere yere vnneth trowed durst haue swore ianycola whiche spake doughter na coniecture hem thought nother creature though euer vertuous encreased suche excellence thewes good set hye bounte discrete fayre eloquence benygne digne reuerence coulde people hertes enbrace eche loued loked face onely saluce town publyshed bountie name eke besyde many regioun one sayd wel sayd spradde bountie men woman bothe yonge olde gone saluces beholde pthis walter lowly ful royally wedded hath wyth fortunate honeste goddes peace lyueth ful easely outwarde grace ynough sawe vnder lowe degre honest vertue hyd people helde prudent man sene wel selde pnot grisylde wyt couthe al feate wyfely humblesse eke whan case required comen profyte coulde redresse na discorde rancour ne heuynesse al londe ne couthe apese bring hem al wysely rest ese though husbond absent none gentylmen countre wrothe wolde bring hem one wyse rype wordes iugement great equite fro heuen sent men wende people saue euery wronge amende pnot longe tyme grisylde wedded doughter ybore al leuer haue borne man chylde glad ye markes folke therfore though mayde chylde came al may man chylde attayne lykelyhode sythens barayne pexplicit par secunda et incipit par tertia fel befalleth oft tymes mo wha childe sucked throwe markes herte lo ged tempte hys wyfe sadnesse knowe ne myght hys herte throwe marueylous desyre hys wyfe assaye nedelesse god wot thought affray assayed ynoughe fonde euer good nedeth tempte alway though man praise subtyl wyt say ful yuel syt assay wyfe whan nede put anguyshe drede markes wrouyt manere came alone nyght lay sterne face right vgly chere sayd thus grisylde day toke thy poore aray put estate hye noblesse thou hast forgoten gesse say grisylde present dignyte whiche haue put trowe maketh foryetful toke poore astate ful lowe wele thou must thy selfe knowe take hede euery worde sey wight hereth twey thou wottest thy self yt thou came house longe ago though thou lefe dere vnto gentyls thou art nothyng say hem great shame wo ben subiette ben seruage borne arte smal village namely syth thy doughter ybore wordes haue spoken doutles desyre haue done byfore lyue lyfe hem rest pee may case recheles mote done thy doughter best wolde gentyls lest yet god wote ful lothe nathelesse without thy wetyng wol naught thus wol thou assent thys thyng shewe nowe thy pacience thy werkyng thou hight swore village day maked mariage pwha herde al ameued neyther word chere ne coutenaunce semed agreued sayd lorde al lyeth plesaunce childe hertely obeysaunce ben al ye may saue spyl owne worketh owne wyll may nothyng god soule saue lykyng may displese ne desyre nothyng haue ne drede lese saue onely ye wil herte aye shal length tyme deth may deface neyther chage corage another place pglad markes answering yet fayned al drery chere lokyng whan shulde chambre go sone thys forlonge way two priuely tolde al entent vnto man wyfe sent maner sergeat priuy faithful ofte founde thynges great eke suche folke wel done execucyon thynges badde lorde knewe wel loued dradde whan sergeant wyst lordes wil chambre stalked hym ful styl pmadame sayd ye mote foryeue though thing costrayned ye ful wyse ful wel knowe ye lordes hestes may fayned may wel bewayled complayned men muste nedes vnto luste obey wol ni sey childe comaunded take spake vp chylde hent dispitously gan chere make though wolde haue slayne wet grisylde must al suffre consent lambe sytteth meke styl let cruel sergeaunt wyl psuspecte fame man suspecte face suspecte hys worde also suspecte tyme whiche began ala doughter loued wende wold haue slayne right tho nathelesse neyther wepte ne syked confyrmyng markes lyked laste speke began mekely sergeaunt prayde worthy gentilman might kysse chylde er yt deyde barme lytel chylde leyde ful sadde face gan chylde blysse lulled gan kysse thus sayd benygne voyce farwel chylde shal neuer se sythen haue marked yu croyce thylke father yblessed mote thou v dyed vpon rode tree thy soule lytel chylde betake nyght shalte thou dyen sake pi trowe norice thys caas ben harde routhe se wel might mother crye ala nathelesse sadde stedfast endured al aduersyte sergeaunt mekely sayde haue ayen lytel yonge mayde goth doth lordes hest thing wolde pray grace yf lorde forbyd leste buryeth lytel body place beestes ne byrdes race worde purpose wolde say toke childe went anon way sergeaunt came lorde agayne grisyldes wordes chere tolde worde word short playne presented doughter dere somwhat lord routh manere nathelesse purpose helde styl lordes done wha wol haue wyl badde sergeaunt ful priuely shuld child wel soft wynd wrappe al circumstaunce tenderly cary cofre lappe payne hys heed swappe man shulde knowe entent ne whence came ne whyther went boleyne suster dere thilke tyme pauye countesse shulde take shewe matere besechyng done busynesse childe fostre al gentylnesse whose chylde yt bade hyde euery wight ought ye might betyde sergeaunt gothe hathe fulfylled thys thyng thys markes nowe retourne nowe gothe ful ofte ymaginyng wyues chere myght se wordes perceyue chaunged neuer coulde fynde euer one ilyke sadde kynde glad humble busy seruyse eke loue wont hym euery maner wyse ne doughter one worde spake none accident none aduersyte sene ne neuer doghters name nempned ernest ne game pexplicit tertia par et incipit par quarta thys estate passed ben foure yere er wyth chylde god wolde man chylde bare waltere wel gracious fayre beholde folke father tolde onely al countre merye chyld god thonke herye two yere olde brest departed hys noryce daye thys markes caught yet another lest tempten hys wyfe efte sone yf maye onedelesse tepted dare wel saye wedded men ne conne mesure fynde pacient creature wyfe markes ye haue herd people heuely bareth mariage namely sythen sonne borne worse euer age murmure sleeth herte corage myne eeres cometh ye voyce smerte wel nye destroyed hath herte say thus whe walter agone shal bloode iamcula succede ben lorde haue none suche wordes say people drede wel ought suche murmure take hede certaynly drede suche sentence though playnly speke audiece wolde lyue peace yf myght wherfore dysposed vtterly hys syster serued nyght ryght thynke serue hym priuely thus warne ye sodeynly selfe wo shulde outraye beth pacient therof praye haue sayd euer shal wol yl nothynge certayne lyst nought greueth al though yt doughter sone slayne comaundement thys sayne haue parte chyldren twayne fyrst sycknesse wo payne ye ben lord doth wt owne thyng ryght lyste taketh rede lefte home clothyng came fyrst ryght lefte wyll al lyberte toke clothing wherfor pray wyl wol obey certes yf prescience wyl knowe er ye lust tolde wolde done wythout negligence wote lust ye wolde al plesaunce fyrme stable holde wyste yt death wolde done ese gladly wolde suffre please death may make comparisoun vnto loue whe thys markes say constauce hys wyfe cast adoun hys eyen two wondred may suche pacience suffreth al thys array forth goeth wyth drery countenauce hys herte ful great pleasauce thys eygre sergeant wyse doughter caught ryght worse yf coulde werse deuyse hath hente sonne yt ful beaute euer one pacient chere made heuynesse kysseth chylde gan blesse saue thys prayd yf might lytel sonne wolde erth graue hys tendre lymmes delycate syght fro foules fro beastes saue none answere hym myght haue went hys waye nothynge rought boleyne tenderly brought markes wodred euer leger ye vpon pacience yf ne sothely knowen parfytly chyldren loued wolde haue wende yt subtelte malyce cruel corage suffred thys wt sadde vysage knewe wel yt next hym selfe certayne loued chyldren best euery wyse woman wolde aske fayne yf assayes mayght suffyse coulde sturdy husbonde deuyse preue wyfehode stedfastnesse contynuynge euer sturdynesse folke suche condicion whe han certayne purpose take couth stynte entencion bounden stake wol purpose slake ryght thys markes hath fully purposed tepte hys wyfe fyrst dysposed wayteth yf wordes coutenaunce hym chaunged corage neuer coulde fynde variaunce aye one herte vysage euer age truer yf possible hym loue penyble whych semeth thus hem two na one wyl walter lest lust pleasaunce also god thanked al fel beste shewed wel worldly vnreste wyfe selfe nothynge sholde wyllen effecte husbonde wolde sclauder walter woder wyde sprad cruel herte ful wretchedly poore woman wedded hath murdred hys chyldren priuely murmure amonge hem comenly wonder people ere ther cae word yt murdred whych hys people ther loued wel disclaudred defame made hem hated hym therfore ben murtherer hateful name nathelesse ernest ne game hys cruel purpose wolde stent tempt hys wyfe al hys entent yt hys doughter xii yere age court rome subtel wyse enfourmed hys wyl sent hys message comaundyng hem suche bylles deuyse hys cruel purpose may suffyse howe pope hys people reste bade hym wedde another yf hym leste saye bade shulde countrefete pope bulle makynge mencion hath leue hys fyrst wyfe lete pope dyspensacion stynte rancoure dyscencion betwyxt hys people thus spake yt bul whych han publyshed full rude people wonder ny wenden ful wel ben ryght tydynges come grisyldes deme herte ful wo lyche sadde euermo dysposed thys humble creature aduersite fortune endure abydynge euer hys luste hys pleasaute whome yeuen herte worldly suffysaunce certaynly yf thys storie tel shal thys markes ywritten hath special letter whych shewed hys entent priuely boloyne sent erle pauy whych wedded hys syster prayde specially bryngen ayen hys chyldren two honorable estate al openly one thynge hym prayde al vtterly wight though mewold enquire shulde tellen whose chyldren say yt mayden shulde wedded vnto markes saluce anone erle prayde dyd daye ysette hys way gone towarde saluce lordes many one ryche aray thys mayden gyde yonge brother rydynge syde arayed towarde mariage thys mayden freshe ful gemmes clere brother seuen yere age arayed eke freshely hys manere thus great noblesse glad chere towarde saluce shapen iournay fro day day rydynge forth way pexplicit quarta par et sequitur par quinta amonge al thys hys wycked vsage thys markes hys wyfe yet tempte vtterest profe corage fully haue experience lore yf stedfast daye open audience ful boystously hath sayd thys sentence certes grisylde ynough plesauce han wyfe goodnesse trouth obeysaunce lynage ne rychesse nowe knowe sothfastnesse great lordshyp yf wel aduyse great seruitude sondry wyse may done euery ploughma maye people constrayneth take another wyfe cryen daye daye eke pope thys rancoure slake consenteth dare vndertake truely thus moche wol saye newe wyfe comynge waye stroge herte voyde anone place thylke dowry ye brought take ayen graunt grace retourneth father house man may alwaye haue prosperite wyth euen herte rede endure stroke fortune auenture ayen answerde pacience lorde wote wyst alwaye howe bytwyxte magnificence pouert man ne maye maken comparison naye helde neuer dygne manere ben wyfe ne yet chamberere thys house ye lady made hye god take wytnesse also wysely soule glade helde neyther lady ne maystresse humble seruaunt worthynesse euer shal whyle lyfe may endure abouen euery worldly creature ye longe benignite haue holde honour nobley worthy thanke god prey yelde sey vnto father gladly wolde wende wyth hym dwel lyues ende fostred chylde ful smale tyl deed lyfe wol lede wydowe clene herte body al sythen yaue maydenhede trewe wyfe drede god shylde suche lordes wyfe take another man husbonde make newe wyfe god hys grace graunt welth hygh prosperite wol gladly yeue place whych blysful wonte sythen lyketh lorde whylom al hertes reste shal gone shal go leste ye profred dowayre fyrst brought wel mynde wretched clothes nothing fayre wer ful hard finde oh good god howe gentel kynde ye semed speche vysage daye maked mariage soth sayd algate fynde trewe effecte proued nowe loue olde newe certes lorde none aduersite dyen thys case shal neuer euer worde worke shal repent yaue myne herte good entent lorde ye wote father place ye dyd strype poore wede rychely ye cladde grace brought nought el drede fayth nakednesse maydenhede ayen clothynge restore eke weddynge rynge euermore remenaunt iewels redy wythin chambre dare safely sayne naked father house came naked mote turne agayne al pleasaunce wolde folowe fayne yet hope entent smocklesse paleys went ye coulde dyshonest thynge ylke wobe whych chyldre lay shulde people walkinge sene al bare wherfore pray let lyke worme go way remembreth myne owne lorde dere wife though vnworthy wherfore rewarde maydenhede brought ayen bere vouchesafe yeue mede suche smocke wonte therwith may wrie ye wombe wyfe take leue myne owne lorde lest greue pthe smock yt thou hast thy bake let styl bere forthe wel vnneth worde spake went way routhe pyte folke selfe strypeth smocke foote heed al bare towarde father house forth fare folke folowed wepyng wey fortune euer cursed gone fro wepyng kept eyen drey ne tyme worde spake none father tydinges herde anone cursed day tyme nature shope ben lyues creature doute olde poore man euer suspecte maryage euer demed sythen began whan lorde ifylled corage hym wolde thynke disparage estate lowe alyght voyden sone euer might payenst doughter hastely gothe ye noyse folk knew coming olde cote might couered ful sore wepyng body might bring rude clothe age dayes fele mariage pthus father certayne space dwelleth floure wysely pacience neuer wordes ne face byfore folke ne eke absence ne shewed done offence ne hye estate remembraunce ne countenaunce wonder great estate goste euer playne humylite tender mouthe ne herte delycate ne pompe ne semblaunce royalte ful pacience benygnyte discrete pridelesse aye honorable husbonde euer meke stable pmen speke iob hublesse clerkes whan hem lyste wel endyte namely men sothfastnesse though clerkes prayse woman lyte man humblesse hem aquyte woman ne halfe trewe woman ben befal newe pexplicit quinta par et sequitur par sexta fro boloyne erle pauy come whiche fame spronge lesse people eeres al couthe eke howe newe marquesesse wt brought pompe suche richesse neuer sene mannes eye noble aray west lumbardye pthe markes shope knewe al er yt erle come sent hys message thylke poore sely grisyldis humble herte glad vysage swellyng herte corage came heste knee sette reuerently wysely hym grette pgrisylde wyl vtterly mayde wedded shal vnto receyued morowe al royally possyble house eke euery wyght degre haue estate syttyng seruyse also plesaunt ye beste deuyse haue woman suffycient certayne chambres araye ordynaunce luste therfore wolde fayne thyne al suche gouernaunce thou knowest eke olde al plesaunce though thyn aray badde yuel besey thou thy deuer leste wey pnot onely lorde glad done luste desyre also please serue degre withouten faynyng shal euer mo ne neuer wele ne wo ne shal goste wythin herte stent loue best wyth true entent yt word gan ye house dyght table sette beddes make payned done al myght prayenge chamberers goddes sake hasten hem fast swepe shake moste seruisable hem al hath euery chambre arayed hys hal abouten vndren gan thys erle alyght wt hi brought noble childre twey whych people ranne se syght araye rychely besey erste amonges hem sey walter foole though hym lest chaunge hys wyfe ye best fayrer demen al grisylde tender age fayrer frute bytwene hem shal fal pleasaunce hye lynage brother eke fayre hys age hi sene ye people cauyt plesauce comendyng markes gouernauce sterne people vnsad vntrewe aye vndiscrete chaungynge fane delytynge euer rumer newe lyke moone euer waxe ye wane euer ful clappynge dere ynough iane dome false costace euel preueth ful great foole leueth thus sayden sad folke cyte people gased vp downe glad ryght wyth nouelte haue newe lady toun nomore thys make nowe mencioun grisylde ayen wol dresse tellen constauce busynesse wel busy grisylde euery thyng feest appertinent right nauyt abashed clothing though rude somwhat rent wyth glad chere yate went wyth folke greten marquesesse doth forth busynesse wyth ryght glad chere ye gestes receiueth buromly euerych hys degre man defaute perceyueth euer wondren myght poore araye se coulde suche honour reuerence worthely praysen prudence al meane whyle ne stente thys mayden eke brother comede wyth al herte benygne entente wel man coude pryse amede laste lordes wende sytten adowne meate gan cal grisylde busy hal grisylde hys play howe lyketh wyfe beaute ryght wel lorde good fay fayrer sawe neuer none praye god yeue prosperite hope wol sende plesaunce ynough vnto lyues ende one thynge besech warne also ye prycke wyth turmentynge thys tender mayden ye han mo fostred noryshynge tenderly supposynge coulde aduersite endure coulde poore fostred creature thys walter sawe pacience glad chere malyce al ofte hath done offence aye constante stable wal contynuyng euer innocence ouer al thys sturdy markes gan hys herte dresse rewe vpon wyfely stedfastnesse thys ynough grisylde myne agaste ne yuel apayde haue thy fayth thy benignite wel euer woman assayde great estate poorely arrayde nowe knowe dere wyfe thy stedfastnesse armes toke gan kesse wonder toke therof kepe herde thynge sayde fared sterte slepe tyl masednesse abrayde grisylde god v deyde thou arte wyfe none haue ne neuer god soule saue thys thy doghter yu hast supposed ben wyfe none faythfully shal myn heyre haue dysposed thou bare hem thy body truely boleyne haue kepte hem sekerly take hem ayen mayst thou say yu hast lorne thy chyldren tway folke wyse han sayd warne hem wel yt haue done thys dede malyce ne cruelte assaye thy womanhede slee chyldren god forbede kepen hem priuely styl tyl thy purpose knewe al thy wyl whe herd sowne falleth pytous ioye sownynge yonge chyldren calleth armes pytously wepynge enbrased hem tenderly kyssynge ful lyke mother wyth salte teeres bathed vysage heeres whych pytous thynge se sownynge pytous voyce graut mercy lorde god thanke ye haue sailed chyldren dere nowe recke neuer deed ryght sythe stade loue grace force deth ne spirite pace tendre dere yonge chyldre myne woful mother wende stedfastly cruel houdes foule vermyne eaten god hys mercy benigne father tenderly hath done kepe stounde al sodainly swapte downe groude swounyng sadly holdeth chyldre two gan hem enbrace wyth great sleyght dyfficulte chyldre fro armes gan race many tere many pytous face downe ran hem stoden besyde vnneth aboute myght man abyde walter gladdeth sorowe slaketh ryseth vp al abashed traunce euery wyght ioye feest maketh tyl hath caught ayen countinaunce walter doth faythfully plesaunce deynty sene chere betwyxt hem two whe met yfere ladyes tyme sey han taken chambre gon strypen rude arrey cloth golde bryght shone wyth crowne many ryche stone vpon heed hal brought honoured ought thus hath pytous day blysful ende euery man woman doth hys myght thys daye myrth reuel dyspende tyl welken shone sterres bryght solempne euery mannes syght thys feest greater costage reuel mariage wel many yere hye prosperite lyuen two concorde rest rychely hys doughter maried vnto lorde one worthyest al itayle peace rest hys wyues father hys courte kepte tyl hys soule hys body crepte hys sonne succedeth hys heritage reste peace hys father day fortunate eke mariage al put hys wyfe great assaye thys worlde stronge naye hath ben olde tymes yore herkneth thautour sayth therfore story said ye wiues sholde felowe grisyld al humilite importable tho wolde euery wyght hys degre sulde constante al aduersite grisild wherfore petrarke writeth story whych wt hye style endyteth sythe woman pacient vnto mortal man wel ought receyue al gree god v sent great skyll preueth wrought ne tempteth man bought sayeth saynt iame yf ye hys pystel rede preueth folke daye drede suffreth v exercyse wyth sharpe scourge aduersyte wel ofte beaten sondry wyse knowe wyl certes borne knewe al frelte best al hys gouernaunce let v lyue vertuous suffraunce one word herkneth lordynges ye go ful harde fynde dayes al countre grisyldes thre two yf put suche assayes golde hem hath bad layes wyth brasse though fayre eye wolde rather braste two plye ye wyues loue bathe whose lyfe secte myghty god mayntene hygh maystry el skathe wyl wyth lusty herte freshe grene saye songe glade wene let v stynte ernest matere herkeneth songe yt sayth thys manere plenuoye de chaucer le mariz de nostre temp grisylde deed eke pacience one buryed itayle crye open audience wedded man hardy assayle hys wyues pacience truste fynde grisyldes certayne shal fayle po noble wyues ful hye prudence let humilite tonge nayle ne let clerke haue cause ne deligence wryte storye suche maruayle grisylde pacient kynde lest chechiface swalow entraile pfoloweth ecco holdeth sylence euer answereth countre tayle beth adaffed innocence sharpely taketh gouernayle enprinteth wel thys lesson mynde comen profyte sythnesse maye auayle ne dredeth hem doth hem reuerece though thyn husbad armed mayle arrowes thy crabbed eloquence shal perce hys brest eke hys aduentayle ielousye eke loke thou hym bynde yt shal make couch doth quayle yf yu fayre folke bene presence shewe thou thy vysage thyne apparayle yf thou foule fre thy dyspence get frendes aye thy trauayle aye chere lyght lefe lynde let hym care wepe wrynge wayle ye archwyues stodeth aye defence syth ye stronge great camayle ne suffreth men offence ye sklendre wyues feble batayle beth eygre tygre inde aye clappeth myl counsayle phere endech clerkes tale oxforde foloweth wordes hoost worthy clerk whe ended tale hoost sayd swore cockes bone leuer barel ale wyfe home herd legede one thys gentle tale none purpose wyste ye wyl thynge wol let styl phere ende wordes hoste foloweth frankeleyns prologue old getyll briton dayes dyuers auentures maden layes rymed fyrst mother tonge layes wt instrumentes songe el reden hem pleasaunce one hem haue remembraunce whyche shal saye wyllinge syrs bycause borel man begynnynge fyrst beseche haue excused rude speche lerned neuer rethorike certayne thynge speke mote bare playne slepte neuer mounte pernaso ne lerned neuer marcus tullius cicero coloures ne knowe none withoute drede suche coloures growen mede el suche men dyen paynte coloures rhetoryke ben quaynte spirite feleth suche matere thys tale yf ye wol phere endeth frankeleyns prologue phere begynneth frankeleyns tale armorike ye called britain knyght loued dyd hys payne serue ladyes hys best wyse many labour many great empryse hys lady wrought er wonne one fayrest vnder sonne eke therto comen hye kynrede wel vnneth durst thys knyyt drede tel hys wo hys payne dystresse laste worthynesse namely hys meke obeysaunce hath suche pyte caught hys penaunce priuely fyl hys accorde take hym husbonde lorde lordship haue ouer wiues lede blysse lyues hys fre wyl swore knyght neuer al lyfe daye ne nyght ne shulde take vpon hym maystry agayne wyl ne kythe ielousye obeye folowe wyl al louer hys lady shal saue name soueraynte wolde haue shame degre thaked ful great humblesse sayd syr syth gentylnesse ye profred haue large rayne ne wolde god neuer betwyxte v twayne gylt eyther warre stryfe syr wol trewe humble wyfe haue trouth tyl herte breste thus ben quiete reste one thynge syrs safely dare seyne frendes eueryche must obeyne yf wol longe holden companye loue wol constrayned maystry maystry cometh god loue anone beateth hys wynges farewel gone loue thynge spirite free woman kynde desyren lyberte constrayned thral done men yf sothe say shal loke moste pacient loue hys auauntage al aboue pacience hye vertue certayne vaynquysheth clerkes sayne thynges rygour shal neuer attayne euery word may chyde playne lerneth suffre el mote gone ye shal lerne whether ye wol none thys world certayn wyght ther ne doth sayeth somtyme amys ire sycknesse constellacion wyne wo chaungynge complection causeth ful often done amysse speken euery wronge may wreken tyme must temperaunce euery wight gouernaunce therfore hath worthy wyse knight lyue ease suffraunce hight hym ful wysely gan swere neuer shulde defaut may men se humble wyse accorde thus hath take seruant lorde seruaunt loue lorde mariage bothe lordship seruage seruage nay lordshyp aboue sythen hath lady loue lady certes wyfe also lawe londe accordeth whan prosperite home wife goth coutre nat fer fro demarke ther dwelling lyueth ioye solas coude tel wedded ioye ease prosperite bitwixt husbande wyfe euermore lasted blysful lyfe tyl knyght speke thus caere iuda cleped arueragus shope dwel yere twayne englande cleped britayne seken armes worship honour al lust sette suche labour dwelt two yere boke saith thus pnowe wol stynt arueragus speke wol dor gen wyfe loueth husbonde hertes lyfe absence wepeth syketh noble wyues whan hem lyketh mourneth wayleth fasteth playneth desyre presence constrayneth al wyde worlde set nought frendes whiche knewe heuy thouyt conforten al euer may prechen tellen night day causeles slewe selfe ala euery comfort possyble caas al busynesse al maken leue heuynesse pby processe ye knowe euerychone men mowen longe grauen stone tyl fygure therin printed longe han comforted tyl receyued hath hope reson enprintyng constellacion great sorow ga aswage may alway induren suche rage eke aruyragus al care hath sent letter home welfare wol come hastely agayne el sorowe herte slayne frendes sawe sorowe gan slake prayden knee goddes sake come roman companye away driuen derke fantasye fynally graunted requeste wel sawe beste pnowe stode castel faste see ofte frendes walked disporte bankes hey may shyppes barge sey salyng course hem lyst go yet parcel wo selfe ful ofte ala sayd shyppe many se wol bring home lorde tha herte warished bytter paynes smerte panother tyme wolde sytte thynke caste eyen downward fro brinke whan sawe grysly rockes blake feare wolde herte quake fete myght sustene wolde sytte adown vpon grene pitously see beholde say right thus sorouful sykes colde peterne god thy purueyauce ledest worlde certayne gouernauce ydle sayn doste thou nothing make lorde grisly fendely rockes blake semen rather foule confusyon werke fayre creacion suche parfyte god wyse ful stable haue ye wrouyt werke vnresonable werke northe south west ne este ny fostred man byrde ne beste dothe good anoyeth se ye lorde howe makinde distroyeth hundred thousande bodyes mankynde haue rockes issayn al mynde sin makind fayre aparte thy werke thou madest like thyn owne werke semed ye great cherte towarde makynde tha may ye suche menes maken distroyen menes good euer anoyen pi wote wel clerkes wol sayne hem lest argumentes al best though ne cause wel knowe thilke god yt made wynde blowe kepe lorde conclusyon clerkes let al thys dysputacion wolde god al rockes blake sonken hel hys sake rockes slee myne herte feare thus wolde say wt many pytous teare frendes sawe dysport roman see dyscomfort shapen hem playen somwhere elles leden ryuers welles eke place delytables dauncen playen table daye ryght morowe tyde vnto gardeyne besyde made ordinauce vytayles purueyaunce gone playen hem al longe day thys syxte morowe may may hath paited wt softe shoures thys gardayne ful leues floures crafte mannes hande curiously arayed thys garden truely neuer na garden pryse yf paradyse odour floures freshe syght wolde haue made herte lyght euer borne yf gret sicknesse great sorowe helde dystresse ful beautye wyth pleasaunce dyner gone daunce synge also saue dorigene alone yet vnto selfe made mone ne sey hym daunce go husbande loue also nathelasse muste tyme abyde wyth good hope let sorowe slyde pvpon thys daunce amonge men daunced squyer dorigen fresher iolyer aray dome moneth may syngeth daunseth passynge euery man sythen worlde began therwythal men shulde hym dyscriue one best farynge men lyue yonge stronge vertuouse ryche wyse welbeloued holden great pryse shortly yf soth tel shal vnwetynge thys dorigene al thys lusty squyer seruaunt venus whych yclypped aurelius loued beste creature two yere hys auenture neuer durst tel hys greuaunce wythouten cuppe dronke al hys penaunce dyspayred nothynge durst say saue hys soges somwhat wold wray hys wo general complayninge said loued beloued nothinge whych matter made many layes songes complayntes roundel verilayes howe durste hys sorowe tel languyshe doth fury hel dye muste sayd dyd ecco narcissus durst tel hys wo pin maner ye herde say ne durst hys wo bewray saue perauenture somtyme daunces yonge folke kepen obseruaunces maye wel loked face suche wyse men asken grace nothynge wyst hys entent nathelesse happed er thence went bycause neyghbour man worshyppe honour knowen hym tymes yore fel speche forth vnto hys purpose drowe aurelius sawe hys tyme sayd thus pmadame god yt world made yt wyste yt myght herte glade wolde day aruyragus went ouer see aurelius went ther yt shuld neuer come agayne wel wote seruyce vayne guerdon ny bresting myne herte madame rueth vpon paynes smerte one worde ye may slee saue foote god wold yt graue ne haue nowe leyser sey haue mercy swete ye wol dey pshe gan loke vpon aurelius thys wyl saye ye thus neuer erste ne wyst ye mente nowe knowe aurelius entente thylke god yaue soule lyfe ne shal neuer vntrewe wyfe word ne w rke ferre haue wyt wol hys knyt take thys fynal answere thys play thus sayd paurelius god aboue yet wol graunt ben loue sythen se pytously complayne loke daye endelonge britayne ye remeue al rockes stone stone ne let shyppe ne bote gone say whe ye haue made costes clene rockes ny stone ysene wol loue best man haue trouth al euer none grace pno lorde maked wel wote shal neuer betyde let suche foly herte glyde deyntye shulde man haue hys lyfe go loue another mannes wyfe hath body whe hym lyketh paurelius ful ofte sore syketh wo aurely thys herde wt sorowful chere thus answerde pmadame thys impossible mote dye sodayne death horrible wyth worde turned hym anone ptho come frendes euerychone aleyes romeden vp doun nothynge wyst thys conclusioun sodeynly began reuel newe tyl bryght sonne loste hys hewe orizont hath te sonne light thys much saye nyght home gone ioye solas saue onely wretched aurelius ala hys house gone sorowful harte sayd myght hys death astarte hym semed felte hys herte colde vp heuen hys handes gan holde hys knee bare set hym adoun hys rauynge sayd thys orisoun wo hys wytte brayde ne wyst spake thus sayde pitous hert hath coplaynt begonne vnto goddes fyrst vnto sonne sayd god appollo gouernour euery plante herbe tre flour yeuest thy declinacion ylke hem hys tyme ceson thyne herberowe chaungeth lowe hye lorde phebus caste thy merciable eye wretched aurelius whych lorne lo lorde lady hath death ysworne wythout gylte thy benignite vpon deadly herte haue pyte wel wote lorde phebus yf ye leste ye maye helpe saue lady beste nowe vouche ye saue deuyse howe may holpen wyse pyour blysful suster lucina shene see goddesse quene though neptunus hath deite see yet empresse abouen hym ye knowen wel lorde ryght desyre quyckened lyghted fyre whych foloweth ful besely ryght see desyreth naturally folowen goddesse see ryuers lesse wherfore lorde phebus thys request thys myracle myne herte brest nowe nexte thys opposicion sygne shalbe lyon prayeth great floode brynge fyue fadome lest ouer sprynge hyest rocke armoryke britayne let thys floode dure yeares twayne rertes lady may saye holdeth heste rockes ben awaye thys thynge may ye lyghtly done pray gone faster course ye say thus prayeth ster go faster course ye yeres two shal ful alway spryng floode lastyng nyght day vouchsafe suche manere graunt souerayne lady dere pray synken euery rocke adoun owne darke regioun vnder grounde pluto dwelleth neuer shal lady wyn thy teple delphos wol barefote seke lorde phebus se teres cheke payne haue compassioun wyth ye worde swoune fel adoun longe tyme lay traunce brother yt knew penauce vp caught hym bed hym brought dyspayred thys turmet thought lette thys woful creature lye chese whether wol lyue dye paruyragus wyth heale great honour chyualry floure comen home worthy men blysful arte thou nowe dorigen hast thy lusty husbode thyne armes freshe knight ye worthy man armes thot loueth hys owne hertes lyfe nothynge lyst hym ymaginatyfe yf wyght spoke loue therof dout entendeth suche matere daceth lusteth maketh good chere thus ioye blysse let hym dwel woful aurelius wol tel pin langour tourment dyspitous two yere lay wretched aurelius er fote erth myght gone ne comforte thys tyme none saue hys brother whych clerke knewe al thys wo al thys werke none creature certayne thys mater durst worde sayne vnder hys brest bare secre euer dyd pamphilus galathe hys brest hole wythout sene hys herte aye arowe kene wel ye knowen sursanure surgery perlous cure myght touch ye arow come therby hys brother wepeth wayleth priuely tyl last hym fel remembraunce whyle orliauce frauce clerkes yonge ben lykerous reden artes ben curiouse seken euery halke euery herne perticuler science lerne hym remembred vpon dey orliaunce studye boke sey magyke naturel whych hys felawe tyme bacheler lawe al lerne another crafte priuely vpon hys dere ylafte whych booke spake mochel aperacions touchynge xxiiij mansion longen moone folye dayes worth flye holy church sayeth byleue ne sustreth none illusyon v greue thys boke remebrauce anone ioye hys hyrte gan daunce hym selfe sayd priuely brother shalbe waryshed sykerly syker science whych men maken dyuers aparences suche subtel tregetores play ofte feestes haue wel herde say tragetors wythin hal large haue made come water barge hall rowen vp doun somtyme hath semed grym lyoun somtyme floures sprynge meede somtyme vyne grape whyte rede somtyme castel lyme stone hym lyked voyden hem anone thus semed euery mannes syght pnow conclude thus yf yt myght orliaunce olde felowe fynde moones mansion mynde magyke naturel aboue shuld wel make brother haue loue wyth apparaunce clerke may make mannes syght al rockes blake britayne yuoyded euerychone shyppes brynke comen gone forme enduren yere two brother waryshed hys wo muste nedes holde behest el shal shame lest pwhat shuld make lenger tale thys vnto hys brother bedde comen suche comforte yaue hym gone orliaunce vp sterte anone hys way forth yfare hope ben lessed hys care pwhen comen almoste ye cyte yf two furlonge thre yonge clerke roming selfe met whych latyn thryftely hem gret afterwarde sayd wonder thynge knowe cause comynge er farther foote wente tolde hem al entente pthys breton clerke asked felowes whych knowen olde dayes answered hym deed whych wept ofte ful many tere pdowne horse aurelius light anone wyth magicien forth gone home hys house made hym wel ese hem lacked vytaile hem might plese wel arayed house one aurelius hys lyfe sawe neuer none phe shewed hym went suppere forestes parkes ful wylde dere sawe hertes wyth horne hye greatest euer sene wyth eye se hem hundred slaine houdes arowes bled wt bytter woudes sawe voyded wylde dere fauconers vpon fayre ryuere wyth haukes han heron slayne tho saw knightes iustyng playne thys dyd hym suche pleasaunce hym shewed hys lady daunce selfe dauced hym thought wha maister yt magike wrouyt sawe tyme clapped hodes farwel reuel al ago remeued neuer house whyle sawe al syght merueylouse studye bokes saten styl wight thre pto maister called squyer sayd hym thus redy supper almost hour vndertake sythen bade supper redy make whan worthy men went studye bokes psir squier whan lyketh al redy though ye wol right nowe pgo suppe best amerous folke sotyme mote haue rest supper fel trete somme shuld maisters guerdon remeue al rockes britayne eke fro gironde mouth sayne phe made strage swore god saue lasse tha thousad poude wold haue ne gladly somme nolde paurelyus blysful herte anon answerde thus fye thousande poude wyde worlde men say roude wolde yeue yf sorde bargayne ful driue knyt ye shal payde truely trouthe loke nowe negligence slouthe ye taryen v lenger morowe nay clerke trouth borow pto bedde gon aurelius whan leste wel nye alnight reste labour hope blysse woful herte penaunce lysse pvpon morowe whan day britayne toke right way aurelius magicyen besyde ben discended wolde abyde boke dothe remembre colde frosty ceson decembre pphebus waxed olde hewed ilyke laton afore hote declynacion shone ye brening golde wt stremes bright nowe capricorne adowne lyght shone ful pale dare wel sayne bytter froste slidder rayne distroyed hath grene euery yerde ianus syt fyre double berde drinketh bugle horne wyne biforn stont braune tusked swyne nowel cryeth euery lusty man paurelius al euer dothe maister chere reuerence prayeth dyligence bryngen paynes smerte swerde wold slyt herte clerke suche routhe hath night day spedeth wayte tyme hys conclusyon say make illusyon suche apparence iogelrye ne termes astrologye euery wight shulde wene say britayne rockes away el sonken vnder grounde tyl laste hath tyme yfounde make iapes wretchydnesse suche superstycious cursydnesse tollytan table forthe brought ful wel corrected hym lacked nought neyther collecte ne expans yeres ne rootes ne geres byn centrys argumentes proporcionel conuenyences equacions euery thyng eyght speres werkyng knew ful wel howe far alnath shoue fro heed thylke syxe aries aboue nynthe spere consydred ful subtelly calked al whan founde hys fyrst mansyon knewe remenaunt proporcion knewe rysyng moone wele suche face terme euery dele knewe also obseruaunces suche illusyons suche mischaunces hethen folke vsed thylke dayes whiche ne maked lenger delayes magike weke tway semed al rockes away paurelius whiche dispayred whether shal haue loue fare amys awayteth night day thys myracle whan knewe non obstacle yt voyded rockes euerychon downe maisters fete fel anon sayd woful wretche aurelius thanke lorde lady myne venus hath holpen fro care colde ye temple way forth hath holde knewe shulde lady se whan sawe tyme anon right dredful herte humble chere salued hath souerayne lady dere pmy rightful lady woful man serue loue best lothest al worlde displese nere haue suche disese must dye fete anon nought wold tel wome bego certes eyther muste dye playne ye slee gyltlesse payne dethe though ye haue routhe auysen er ye breken trouthe repenteth ylke god aboue ye slee bycause loue madame wel ye wote ye haue hight chalenge thyng right souerayn lady grace garden yonde suche place ye wotte right wel ye heyght myn honde trouth plyght ye loue best god wotte ye sayd al vnworthy therto madame speke honour saue myn hertes lyfe nowe haue done right ye commaunded yf ye vouchsafe ye may go se doth list haueth heste mynde quicke deed right ther ye shal fynde lythe al lyue deye wel wote rockes ben aweye toke leue astonyed stode al face na droppe bloode wende neuer han come trappe palas euer shulde happe wende neuer possibylite mister meruayle might ayenst processe nature home gothe sorouful
