creature feare vnnethes may go wepeth wayleth day two swonneth routhe se wight tolde towne gon arueragus selfe spake sayd thus complaynt ye shal face pale sorouful chere ala fortune playne vnware hast wrapped thy chayne fro whiche escape wot socoure saue onely dethe el dishonoure one two behoueth chese nathelesse yet leuer lese lyfe body haue shame knowe selfe false lese name dethe may quyt iwys hath many wyfe er many mayd islayn selfe ala rather body done trespas certes lo story beren wytnesse whan thurty tyrantes ful cursydnesse stayne phidon athene feest commaunded doughters areste bringen hem byforne hem dispyte al naked fulfyl foule delyte father bloode dyd hem dauce vpon pauemet god yeue mischaunce woful maydens ful drede rather wold lesen maydenhede priuely ben sterte wel drenched hem selfe bokes tell messene let enquire seke lacidomony fyfty maydens eke wolde haue lechery none al company na slayne glad enten chese rather dyen assent ben oppressed maydenhede shulde dye ben drede lo eke tyraunt aristoclides loued mayde yt hight symphalydes whan father slayne nyght vnto dyanes temple gothe anon ryght hente ymage armes two fro whiche ymage wolde neuer go wight might fro hondes race tyl slayne right selfe place sythnes yt maydens dispyte ben defouled mannes foule delyte wel ought wyfe rather selfe slee defouled thynketh shal say hasdruballes wyfe cartage byrafte selfe lyfe wha sawe ye romanes wan town toke chyldren al lepte adown fyre chese rather dye roman dyd villanye hath lucrece islayne selfe ala rome oppressed tarquyne thought shame lyue whan lost name eyght maydens melesye also han slayn hem selue drede wo rather folke gaule shuld oppresse mo thousande story gesse couthe nowe tel touchyng matere pwhan abradas slayn wife dere selfe slowe let bloode glyde abradas woundes brode wyde sayd body leste way shal wight defoule yf may pwhat shulde mo ensamples herof sayn sythens many han hem selfe slayn wel rather wolde defouled wol conclude best wel rather slee selfe manere dyd demo tious doughter dere bycause nolde defouled po sedasus ful great pyte reden howe thy doughters dyden ala slowen hem selfe maner caas great pyte wel theban mayden nychanore one macedone oppressed dethe maydenhede redressed pwhat shal sayne nycerates wyfe suche case birafte selfe lyfe phowe trewe eke alcibyades loue dyen rather thees suffren body vnburyed plo whiche wyfe alceste saythe homere good penelope al grece knoweth chastyte pparde laodomia written thus wha troy slayn protheselaus lenger nolde lyue day pthe noble portia tel may withouten brutus couthe lyue al herte igyue pthe parfyte wyfehode artemisy honoured throughout al barbary poh thenta quene thy wifely chastyte al wyues may myrrour thyng saye bil rodogone eke valeria pthus playned dorigene day twey purposyng euer wolde dey nathelesse vpon thyrde nyght home came arueragus worthy knight asked wepte sore gan wepen euer lenger palas euer borne thus haue said thus haue sworn tolde al ye haue herde nedeth reherce pthis husbode wt glad chere sodrie wyse answerde sayd shal deuyse aught el dorigene pnay nay god helpe wy moche goddes wyl pye wyfe let slepe styl may wel yet parauenture day ye shal trouthe holde fay god wysly haue mercy wel leuer stycked loue whiche haue yf ye shulde trouthe saue trouth hyest thyng may kepe worde brast anon wepe said forbyd payne dethe neuer while lasteth lyfe brethe wight tel misauenture may beste wol wo endure ne make countenaunce heuynesse folke may deme harme ne gesse forthe cleped squier mayde gothe forthe anon dorigene sayde bringeth suche place anone toke leue way gone ne wyste thyder went nolde wight tel entent pthis squier whiche hyght aurelius dorigen whiche amerous auenture happed mete amydde towne right hye strete wolde haue gon way forthe right towarde garden hyght garden warde also wel spyed whan wolde go house maner place thus met auenture grace salueth glad entent asked whyther went pand answerde halfe madde vnto garden husbonde badde trouthe holde ala ala aurelius gan wondren caas hert great compassyon chere lamentation aruyragus worthy knyght bade holde al hyght loth yt shuld breke trouth hys herte caught great routh consydryng beste euery syde fro luste better abyde hye churlishe wretchydnesse ayenst fraunchise ayenst al gentylnesse whiche fewe wordes said thus madame saythe lorde aruiragus sythen se great gentylnesse hym eke se wel distresse ye thus shuld holde trouthe certes thynketh great routhe haue wel leuer euer suffre wo departe loue bytwyxt two relese madame honde quyte euery surement euery bonde ye haue made byforne sythens thylke tyme ye borne trouth plight shal neuer repreue beheste take leue trewest beste wyfe euer yet knewe al lyfe euery wight beware byheste dorigene remembreth leste thus squyer done gently dede wel knyght withouten drede pshe thonked hym vpon knee al bare home vnto husbonde fare tolde al ye han herde sayde ye syker wel apayde vnpossible write shulde lenger case endyte arueragus dorigen wyfe souerayne blysse leden forthe lyfe neuer anger hem bytwene cherished though quene trewe euermore two folkes ye get nomore aurelius coste hath al forlorne curseth tyme euer borne ala ala euer beheyght pured golde thousand poude wright vnto philosopher howe shal se myne heritage nedes sel ben begger may leger dwel shame al kynrede place hym may get better grace nathelesse wol hym assay certayne dayes yere yere pay thonke hym hys great curtesye trouthe wol kepe wol lye herte ore gothe vnto cofer brought golde vnto phylosopher value fyne hundred poude gesse hym besecheth hys gentylnesse graunt dayes remenaunt sayd mayster dare wel make auaunt fayled neuer trouthe yet sykerly hette shal quyt towardes howe euer fare gon beggyng kyrtel bare wolde ye vouchesafe vpon suerte two yere thre respyte wel el mot sel myne heritage tel philosopher soberly answerde sayd thus whan worde herde haue holde couenaunt vnto yes certes wel truely haste thou thy lady lyketh sorily syketh cause tel yf thou aurelius anon tale began tolde hym al ye han herde byfore nedeth reherce sayd arueragus gentylnesse leuer dye sorowe distresse wyfe trouthe fals sorowe dorigene tolde hym al howe lothe ben wycked wyfe leuer haue loste lyfe yt trouth swore throug innocece neuer erste herde speke apparence made haue great pyte right frely sent frely sent hym agayne al ny philosopher answerde leue brother eueriche dyd gentilly thou arte squier knyght god forbyd blisful myght yf clerke coulde done gentyl dede wel drede syr relese thy thousande pounde thou crope grounde ne neuer er nowe haddest thou knowen syr wol taken peny al crafte ne nought trauayle thou haste payed right wel vitayle ynough farwel haue good day toke horse rode forthe way lordynges question wold aske whiche moste fre thynketh nowe telleth er ferther wende tale ende phere endeth frankeleyns tale begynneth seconde nonnes prologue mynistre norice vnto vyces men clepen englishe idlenesse porter yate delyces eschue contrarie oppresse sayne leful besynesse wel ought entent leste fende idlenesse v het thousande cordes slye contynually v wayteth clappe whan may man ydlenesse espye lightly catche trappe tyl man hente right lappe ni ware fende hath honde wel ought v werche ydlenesse witstonde though men dredden neuer dye yet se men wel reson doutles ydlenesse rote slogardye cometh neuer good encres sythnes slouth holdeth lee slepe eate drynke deuouren al swynke put v suche ydelnesse cause great confusyon haue done faythful besynesse legende translacion right thy glorious lyfe passyon thou wt thy garlode wrought wt rose lely mene mayd marter seynt cecely pand thou arte floure virgin bernarde lyst wel write begynnyng fyrst cal thou comforte v wretch endyte thy maydes deth yt wan thorow merite eternal lyfe fende victorie men may rede storie thou mayde mother doughter thy sone thou wel mercy synful soules cure god boute chese wone thou humble hye ouer euery ceature thou noblest farre ouer nature disdayne maker kynde sone bloode fleshe clothe wynde whiche cloystre thy blisful sydis toke mannes shappe eterne loue pee true compas lorde gyde heuen erthe see withouten le aye heryen thou virgyne wemles bare thy body dweldest mayden pure creatour euery creature assembled magnifycence mercy goodnesse suche pyt thou arte sonne excellence onely helpest hem prayenth often tyme thy benignyte ful frely men thyne helpe beseche thou goest beforne arte lyues leche helpe thou blisful meke fayre mayde flemed wretche deserte gal thynke woman canane sayd whelpes eaten ye cromes smal lordes table ben isal though yt vnworthy doughter eue synful yet accepteth beleue ye fayth deed withouten werkis werche yeue wytte space quyt ye place yt derke thou arte fayre ful grace myne aduocate hye place without ende songe osanna thou christes mother doughter anna thy light soule prison lyght troubled contagyon body also wyght erthly luste also false affection hauen refute saluacion hem ben sorowe distresse helpe werke wol dresse yet pray reden write foryeueth dyligence ylke storie subtelly endyte bothe haue wordes sentence hym sayntes reuerence storie wrote folowen legende pray ye wol werke amende pfyrst wol name seynt cecily expowne men may storie se say englishe heuens lylly pure chastnesse virgynite wytnesse honeste grene conscience good fame sote sauoure lylye name cecily say way blynde ensample good techyng el cecily written fynde ioyned maner conioynyng heuen lya fyguring heuen set thought holynesse lya lastyng besynesse cecily may eke sayd manere wantyng blyndnesse great lyght sapience thewes clere el lo maydens name bright heuen leo cometh whiche ryght men might heuen people cal ensample good wyse werkes al leo people englishe say right men may heuen se sunne moone sterres euery way right men gostly mayden fre sawen faythe great magnanymite eke clerenesse hole sapience sondrie werkes bright excellence right philosopher write heuen swyfte rounde eke brenyng right fayre cecily whyte ful swyfte besy euery good workynge rounde hole good perseuerynge brennyng euer charyte ful bright nowe haue declared hight phere endeth seconde nonnes prologue begynneth tale mayden bright cecile lyfe sayth comen romanes noble kynde forthe fostred vp fayth christ bare gospel mynde neuer cessed written fynde prayere god loue drede besechyng hym kepe maydenhede whan mayde shulde vnto man wedded ful yonge age whiche yeleped valeryan daye come maryage ful deuoute humble corage vnder robe golde ye sate ful fayre next fleshe yclad heyre whyles organ made melodye god alone thus herte songe lorde soule eke body gye vnwemmed leste counfounded hi loue dyed vpon tre euery seconde thirde day faste aye byddyng orison ful faste pthe night came bedde must gone husbonde often manere priuely sayd vnto hym anon swete wel byloued spouse dere counsayle ye wol right fayne wold sayne ye ensure bewrayne pvaleryan gan faste vnto swere case ne thyng myght shulde neuer none bewrayen erste thus hym sayd haue angel whiche loueth wt gret loue wake slepe redy aye body kepe yf may felen drede ye touche loue vylonye right anon wyl slee dede youthe thus shal ye dye yf ye clene loue gye wol loue clennesse shewe hys ioye brightnesse pthis valeryan corrected god wolde answerde ayen yf shal trust let aungel se hym beholde yf aungel wol done thou haste prayde yf thou loue another man forsothe right wt sworde tha wol sle pcecyle answerde anon wyse ye luste angel shul ye se ye trowe christ baptyse gothe forthe v apia town ne stat myles thre poore folke dwel say hem right thus shal tel tel hem cecyle hem sende shewen good vrban olde secret nedes good entent whan ye saynt vrban han beholde tel hym wordes tolde wha hath purged fro synne shal ye se aungel er ye twynne valeryan place ygon right taught lerning founde holy vrban anon amonge sayntes buryals loutyng anon without taryeng dyd message whan tolde vrban ioy gan hondes vp holde teres eyen let fall almighty god iesu christ sower chaste counsayle hierde v al frute thilke sede chastyte thou haste sowe cecyle take lo lyke besy bee withouten gyle serueth aye thyne owne thral cecyle thylke spouse toke newe ful lyke fierse lyon sendeth meke lambe ewe worde anon gan apere olde man cladde whyte clothes clere boke letter gold hode gan byforne valeryan stonde pvaleryan deed fel downe drede whan olde man sawe standyng whiche forwith anon herde rede lorde faythe god withouten mo christendom father al also abouen al ouer al euery wordes al golde written wha radde tha sayd olde leuest thou thyng none say ye nay leue al thyng valeryan vnder heuen wight ne thynke may sother thyng dare wel say tho vanyshed olde man nyst pope vrban hym christened right pvaleryan gothe home fyndeth cecilye within chambre aungel stonde aungel rose lyllye crownes two whiche bare honde fyrst cecyle vnderstonde yaue one gan take valeryan make body clene wt vnwemmed thought kepeth aye wel crownes paradyse haue hem brought ne neuer shullen rotten ne lese swete sauour trusteth ne neuer wight shal sene hem eye chaste hate vilonye thou valeryan thou sone assenteddest good counsayle also say yu lyst thou shalt haue thy bone haue brother valeryan tho world loue man pray brother may haue grace knowe trouthe place angel answerd god lyketh request bothe palme martyrdome shal ye come vnto blisful feest ye word tyburce brother come whan sauoure vndernome whiche rose lylyes caste within herte gan wonder faste pand sayd woder tyme yere whence sote sauoure cometh rose lylyes smel though hem myne hondes two sauour might deper go swete smel herte fynde hath chaunged al another kynde pvaleryan sayd two crownes haue snowe whyte rose reed shyneth clere thyne eyen han might se thou smellest hem thrugh prayere shalt thou seen hem leue brother dere thou wylte without slouthe byleue right knowe trouthe ptyburce answerd sayest thou sothnesse dreme herken dremes valerian han vnto tyme brother myne iwys nowe erst dwellyng trouthe howe wost thou quod tyburce wyse quod valeryan shal deuyse angel god hath ye trouth itaught thou shalt seen thou wilt reney ydols clene el naught myracles crownes twey saynt ambrose preface luste sey solempnly noble doctour dere comendeth saythe manere pthe palme martyrdom receyue seynt cecile fulfylled goddes yefte world eke chambre gan weyu witnesse tyburce cecyles shrifte god bounte wolde shyfte crownes two floures wel smellyng made angel tho crownes bryng mayde hath brought hem blisse aboue world hath wist worth certal deuotion chastyte wel loue tho shewed cecyle al open playn al ydolles ben thynges vayne ben dombe therto ben defe charged hym hys ydoles lefe troweth beest quod tyburce yf shal lye kyssed brest whan herde ful glad couthe trouthe espye day take myne allye sayd blisful mayden fayre dere sayd ye may plo right loue christ made thy brother wyfe right yt wyse anon myn alye take sythes thou wolte thyn ydoles dispyse go thy brother nowe baptyse make clene yt thou mayst beholde angel face whiche thy brother tolde tyburce answerd said brother dere fyrst tel whyther shal sayd come forth wt good chere wol lede vnto pope vrban vrban brother myne valeryan tyburce wylt thou thyder lede thynketh wonder dede ne menest thou vrban tho ofte dampned deed wonneth halkes fro dare one put forthe heed men shulde brenne fyre reed founde men might hym spye also bere companye whyles seken thylke diuinite yhidde heuen priuely algate ybrent worlde shulde cecile answerde boldely men might drede wel skylfully lyfe lese myne owne dere brother lyuing non better lyuyng place neuer shal loste ne drede nought goddes sone v told grace father sonne hath al thyng wrought al ye wrought skilful thought goste father gan procede hath souled hym without drede worde myracle lo goddes soune whan worlde declared lyfe ther men may wone answerde tyburce suster dere ne saydest thou right nowe manere na one god lord sothfastnesse nowe thre howe may yu bere witnesse pthat shal tel go right man hath sapyences thre memorye engyne intellecte also suche beyng diuinite thre person may right wel tho gan ful besily hym preche christes sonne paynes teche many poyntes passyon howe goddes sonne thys worlde witholde mankynde playne remyssyon bounde synnes care colde al thynges vnto tyburce tolde tyburce good entent valeryan pope vrban went thonked god glad hert light christned made place perfyte lernyng goddes knyght tiburce gate suche grace euery day sawe tyme space aungel god euery maner boone god asked sped ful soone pit ful harde order sayne many wonder iesu wrought laste tel shorte playne sergeaunt towne hem sought hem byfore almache ye preuost brought whiche hem aposed knewe al entent ymage iupiter hem sent sayd wol sacrifyce swappe heed sentece anon martyr deuyse one maximus officere prefectes councelere hem hent wha forth sayntes ladde hym selfe wept pyte whan maximus herde sayntes lore gate hem turmentours leue hem hys house withouten prechyng er eue gonne turmentour reue maximus hys folke echon false faythe trowen god alone pcecyle came whan woxen nyght preestes hem christened al fere afterward whan day woxen light cecile hem sayd sober chere nowe christes owne knyghtes leue dere casteth al away werkes derknesse armeth armoure brightnesse ye han sothe ydone great batayle cours fayth hath conserued gothe ye crowne life may fayle rightful iudge ye han serued shal yeue ye deserued whan thing sayd deuyse men ladde hem forth done sacrifyse wha vnto place ibrought tel shortly conclusyoun nold ensence ne sacrifyce right nought knee saten hem adoun humble herte sadde deuocioun losten bothe heedes place soules went kyng grace pthis maximus yt saw thyng betyde pytouse teres tolde anon right soules sawe heuen glyde aungels ful clerenesse lyght word couerted many wight almachius dyd hym bete whyppes leede tyl lyfe ga lete cecyle hym toke buryed hym anone tyburce valeryan sothly within buryeng place vnder stone almachius hastely bad hys mynisters fetchen openly cecily might presence sacrifyce iupyter encence conuerted wyse lore wepten ful sore yaue ful credence vnto worde cryden christ goddes sonne without difference god sentence hath seruaunt good serue thus wt voyce trow though sterue palmachius herde al doyng bad fetche cecily might se alderfyrst askyng maner woman arte thou gentylwoman borne aske thought greue thy relygion thy byleue pye haue bygon question folishly wolde two answer conclude one demaunde ye asken leudly almachius answerde symilitude whence cometh thyn answere rude whence wha frayned conscience good fayth vnfayned palmachius sayd ne takest thou none hede power hym answerde thys might ful lytel drede euery mortal mannes power ny ilyke bladder ful wynde iwys nedels poynte whan yblowe may al bos e layde ful lowe ful wrongfully beganste thou yet wronge thy perseueraunce woste thou howe mighty prince fre haue thus comaunded made ordinaunce euery christen wight shal haue penauce yf cristendome withsey gon al quyte yf wol reney pyour prince erren noble dothe quod tho cecile wode sentence ye make v gilty sothe ye knowen wel innocence moche done reuerence christe bere christen name ye put v cryme eke blame knowen thilke name vertuous may withsey almachius answerd chese one two sacrifyce christendom reney thou may scapen wey worde holy blisful mayde gan laught iuge sayde po iugge confused thy nycete wolte thou renye innocence make wycked wight lo dissymuleth audience stareth wodeth aduertence almachius sayd sely wretch thou wost far miyt may stretch hath mightye prince yeuen bothe power eke auctorite make folke dyen lyuen spekest thou proudely ne speke stedfastly proudly say syde hate deedly thilke vyce pryde yf thou drede sothe wol shewen al openly right thou hast made ful great lesyng thou sayste thy prince han yeue might bothe slee eke quicke wight thou ne mayest lyfe byreue thou haste non power ne leue thou mayst say thy prince ha ye make mynistre dethe yf thou speke mo thou lyest thy power ful naked doway thy boldnesse sayd almachius th sacrifyce goddes er thou go recke wronge thou profice suffre philosopher thilke wronges may endure thou spekest goddes cecile answerde nyce creature thou saydest worde sythens thou spakest ne knewe therwith thy nycite thou euery maner wyse leude offycer vayne iustyce lacketh nothyng thyne vtter eyen thou nart blynd thing yt seen al stone men may wel espyen ylke stone god thou wolte cal rede let thyn honde vpon fal taste wel stone thou shalte fynde sen thou seest wt thyn eyen blynde shame people shal scorne laugh thy folye comenly men wotte wel ouer al mighty god heuens hye ymages wel mayste thou aspye ne hem selfe may profyte effecte worthe myte pthus suche wordes sayde woxe wrothe bad shulde lede home house house brenne bathe flame rede bade right done dede bathe gan faste sheten nyght day great fyre vnder beten al longe night eke day also al fyre eke bathe hete sate al colde felte wo made droppe swete bathe lyfe mote lete almachie ful wicked entent sleen bathe hys sonde sente thre stroke necke smote tho turmentour maner chaunce might smyte al necke two tyme ordynaunce shuld person penauce fourth stroke smyte softe sore turmentour durste smyte halfe deed necke ycorue lette lye way went christen folke aboute shetes home ful fayre hente thre dayes lyued turmente neuer cesed faythe teche fostred hem gan preche hem yaue mouables thyng pope vrban bytoke hem tho sayd asked heuen kyng haue respyte thre dayes mo recomaunde er go soules might werche myne house perpetuellyche cherche saynt vrban dekens priuely body fette buryed night amonge sayntes honestly house churche saynt cecile hyght saynte vrban halowed wel might vnto day noble wyse men christ sayntes seruyce phere endeth seconde nonnes tale begynneth prologue chanons yeman wha ended lyfe saynt cecyle er fully rydden fyue myle boughton vnder blee v gan take man clothed clothes blake vnder whyte surplyse hakeney al pomely gryse swette wonder se semed pricked myles thre horse eke yoman rode vpon swette vnneth might gon aboute paytrel stode fome ful hye fome flecked pye male twyfolde croper lay semed caryed lytel aray al lyght sommer rode worthy man herte wondren began tyl vnderstode howe cloke sewed hode whan longe auysed demyd chanon hatte hynge backe alace rydden trot pace rode aye prickyng wode clote lefe layde vnder hys hode swette kepe heed fro hete inye se hym swete forheed dropped styllatorie ful plantayne peritorie whan come gan crye god saue ioly companye faste haue pricked sake bycause wolde ouertake ryden mery company phi yoman eke ful curtesye sayd syrs nowe morowe tyde hostery sawe ryde warned lorde souerayne whiche ryden ful fayne disporte loueth dalyaunce frede thy warnig god yeue ye good chace sayd host certayne wolde seme thy lorde wyse may wel deme ful soconde also dare lay ought tel mery tale tway glade may companye pwho syr lorde ye without lye myrthe eke iolyte ynough also syr trusteth ye hym knewe also wel ye wolde wonder howe wel thriftely couthe werke sondrie wyse hath taken many great emprise ful harde bring aboute lere homely rydeth amonge ye knewe wold ben prowe ye nolde forgon aquayntaunce mochel good dare lay balaunce al haue possessyon man hye discressyon warne wel passyng wyse man pwel hoste pray tel clerke non tel pa clerke nay greter tha clerke iwys sayd yoman wordes fewe hoste crafte somwhat wol shewe say lorde suche subtelte al crafte ye may wete somwhat helpe yet worchyng al grounde rydyng tyl come caunterbury towne coulde al clene turne vp downe paue al syluer golde pand whan yoman thus ytolde vnto hoste sayd benedicite thyng wonder meruaylous sen thy lorde hye prudence bycause men shuld hym reuerece worshyp recketh lyte ouerest sloppe worthe e effecte hym go al bandy tore also thy lorde slotlyche pray power better clothes bey dede acorde thy speche tel beseche pwhy yeman wherto aske ye god helpe shal neuer ythe wol auowe saye therfore kepe secret praye wyse fay beleue ouerdone nyl preue right clerkes sayne vyce wherfore holde hym leude ny whan man hath ouer great wytte ful ofte happeth hym misusen dothe lorde greueth sore god amende say ptherof force good yeman host sen connyng thy lorde thou wost tel howe dothe pray hertely sen crafty sly dwellen ye yf tel pin subbarbes towne lurkyng corner lane blinde robber theues kynde holden priuy fearful resydence dare shewen presence fare yf shal say soth pyet hoste let talke tothe arte thou discoloured thy face ppeter god yeue harde grace vsed hotte fyre blowe hath chauged colour trowe wonte myrrour prie swynke sore lerne multiplye blondren euer pooren fyre al faylen desyre euer lacken conclusyon moche folke illusyon borowe golde pounde two ten twelue many somme mo make hem wene leste way pounde coulde make tway yet false aye han good hope done grope science ferre v byforne mowe al though sworne ouertake slytte away fast wol v make beggers laste pwhiles yeman thus talkyng chanon drewe nere herd al thing yeman spake suspection mennes speche euer chanon cato saythe gyltye demeth al thing spoke hym iwys bycause ge gan nyghe drawe yeman herken al sawe thus sayd vnto yeman tho holde thy peace speke wordes mo yf thou thou shalt sore abye thou slaudrest thys companye eke dyscouerest yt thou shuldest hyde pye host tel euer betyde al hys threatyng recke myte pin fayth lyte thys chanon sawe wolde hys yeman wolde tel hys priuite fled away sorowe shame yeman shal ryse game al anone wol tel sen gone foule fende hym quel neuer wol wyth hym mete peny ne pounde behete brought fyrst vnto game er dye sorowe haue shame ernest fayth fele wel man sayeth yet al smerte al grefe al sorowe laboure myschefe couth neuer leaue wyse nowe wolde god wytte myght suffyce tellen al longeth arte nathelesse yet wol tel parte sen lord gone wol spare suche thynge knowe wol declare phere endeth prologue chanons yeman foloweth hys tale thys chanon dwelt seuen yere hys science neuer nere haue lost therby god wote hath many mo wonte ryght fresh gay clothynge eke good aray nowe may weare hose vpon heed wher colour freshe reed nowe wanne leeden hewe vseth sore shal hym rewe swynke yet blered myne eye lo whych auauntage multiplye slydynge science hath made bare haue good yt euer fare yet endetted therby golde haue borowed trewly whyle lyue shal quyte neuer let euery man beware euer maner man casteth hym therto yf continue holde hys thryfte ydo helpe god therby shal neuer wyn empte purse make wittes thyn thorow hys madnesse foly hath lost hys owne good ieopardy excyteth men therto lese good hym selfe hath vnto shrewes ioye ese haue felowes payne dysese thus one lerned clerke yt charge wol speake werke pwhen shal exercyse eluysh crafte semen wonder wyse termes ben clergial quaynte blowe fyre tyl myne herte faynte pwhat shulde tel eche proporcion thynges whych werchen vpon fyue syxe vnces maye wel syluer quantite besye tellen name orpyment brent bone yron squames poudre grounden ben ful small erthen potte howe put salt yput also papere byfore poudres speake wel ycouered wyth lampe glas moche thynge pottes glas englutynge ayre myght passe thynge esy fyre smerte also whych made care wo matter sublymynge amalgamyng calsenynge quycsyluer yclypped mercurye crude al sleyght conne conclude orpyment sublymed mercurye grounde lytarge eke porphirye eche vnces certayne helpeth v labour vayne ne eke spirites assencioun ne yet matter lyen al syre adoun mowe werkynge nothynge auayle loste al laboure trauayle al coste twenty dyuel waye loste also whych vpon laye pthere also ful many thynge crafte apertaynynge though ordre hem ne reherce bycause leude man yet wol tellen hem come minde though ne sette hem kynde bole armonyake verdegrece boras sondry vessel made erth glas vrinals dyscensories vyols crosselettes sublymatoryes concurbytes alembykes eke suche dere ynough leke nedeth reherce hem al water rubyfyeng bole gal arsneke sal armoniake brymstone herbes coulde tel eke many one egrimonye valerian lunarye suche yf lyst tarye lampes brennyng nyght daye brynge aboute craft yf maye fournyce eke calcinacion water albifycation vnsleked lyme chalke gleyre eye poudres dyuers ash donge pysse cley sered pokettes salt peter vytriole dyuers fyres made woode cole sal tartre alcaly sal preparate combust mater coagulate cley made wt horse duge man heere oyle tartre al n glas berme worte argo resalgor mater enbybynge eke mater encorporynge syluer cytrination sementynge eke fermentacion ingottes testis many mo wol tel taught also foure spirites bodyes seuen order ofte herde lorde nemene pthe fyrst spirite quycke syluer cleped seconde orpyment thyrde ywys sal armonyake fourth brymstone pthe bodyes seuen eke lo hem anone sol golde luna syluer threpe mar yron mercurye quycksyluer clepe saturnus leede iupiter tynne venus coper father kynne pthys cursed crafte wol exercyse shal good haue may hym suffyse al good spendeth theraboute lese shal therof haue doute lysten vtter hys folye let hym come forth lerne multiplye euery man hath aught hys cofer let hym apere philosopher askaunce crafte lyght lere nay nay god wote al monke frere preest chanon wyght though syt boke day nyght lernynge thys eluyshe nyce lore al vayne parde moche lere leude man thys subtelte fye speake therof wol al coulde lettrure coulde none effecte shal fynde al one two saluacion concluden multiplicacion lyche wel haue al ydo thys sayne faylen two pyet forgate moche rehersayle water corosyfe lymayle bodyes mollifycacion also induracion oyles ablucions metal fusyble tellen al wolde passe byble wherfore beste al name nowe wol reste trowe haue tolde ynowe reyse fende al loke neuer rowe pa nay let phylosophers stone alixer cleped seken faste echeone syker ynowe vnto god heuen make auowe al crafte han al ydo al sleyght wol come v hath made v spende moche good sorow almost waxe wood good hope crepeth herte supposynge euer though sore smerte ben releued hym afterwarde supposynge hope sharpe harde warne wel syken euer future temp hath made men dysceuer trust therof euer yet arte coulde waxe sad vnto hym bytter swete semed ne shete yt myght wrappe anyght bratte walken daye lyght wolden hem sel spede craft conne stynte tyl nothynge laft euer euer gone men may hem ken smel brymstone al worlde stynken gote sauour rammysh hote though man myle hem sauour wol enfecte hym trusteth lo thus smellyng thred bare aray yf men lyst thys folke knowe may yf man wol aske hem priuely clothed vnthryftely ryght anone wol rowne hys ere sayne yf aspyed men wolde hem slee bycause science lo thus folke bytrayen innocence passe ouer thys go tale vnto per potte fyre ydo metalles wyth certayne quantyte lorde hem tempreth man nowe gone dare saye boldely men sayne craftely algate wotte wel hath suche name yet ful ofte renneth blame wote ye howe ful ofte happeth potte breketh farewel al go metalles ben great violence walles may make hem resystence yf wrought lime stone percen wal gone hem synken grounde thus haue lost tymes many poude scatered al floore aboute lepen rofe wythouten doute tho yt fende syght hym shewe trowe v ylke shrewe hel lorde syre ne wo ne angre ne yre potte broke haue sayd euery man chyte holte hym yuel apayde sayd longe fyre makyng sayd nay blowyng ferde myn offyce pstrawe thyrde ye ben leude nyce tempred ought pnay fourth stynte herken bycause fyre made beche cause none theche tel wheron alonge wel wote great stryfe v amonge lord ther ny done perylles wol beware efte sone ryght syker potte crased maye ye amased vsage let swepe floore swythe plucke vp hert glad blythe mullocke heape yswepte floore caste canuas al thys mulloke syue ythrowe ysyfted aplucked many throwe parde one somwhat metall yet though haue tho thyng mishapped hath tyme may ben wel ynow put good auenture marchaunt parde maye aye endure trusteth wel hys prosperite somtyme hys good drowned see somtyme cometh safe vnto londe peace lord ye next tyme wol fonde brynge crafte al plyte syrs let haue wyte defaute somwhat wel wote pan sayd fyre ouer hote hote colde dare saye concluden euer amys faylen whych wolde haue madnesse euer raue together euerychon euery man semeth wyse salomon al thyng whych shyneth ye golde golde haue herde tolde ne euery appel fayre eye ny good men clappe crye pryght fareth amonge v semeth wysest iesus moost foole cometh prefe semeth truest thefe shal ye know er wede tale haue made ende pthere chanon religioun amonges v wolde enfecte al toun though great niniue rome alysaundre troye thre hys sleyght hys infinite falsnesse couth man wryten gesse though might lyue thousand yere al thys worlde falsnesse ny hys pere hys termes wol hym wynde speake hys wordes slye kynde comen shal wyth wyght wol make hym dote anone ryght fende hym selfe ful many man hath begyled er thys mo wol yf may lyue whyle yet men ryden gone ful many myle hym seke haue aquayntaunce knowynge hys false gouernaunce yf ye lust gyue audience wol tellen presence pbut worshypful chanons religiouse ne demeth sclaunder house al though tale chanon euery ordre shrewe parde god forbyd al companye shulde rue syngler mannes folye slaunder myne entente correcte mysse mente thys tale tolde eke mo ye wote wel howe amonge christes apostle twelue ther traytour iudas hym selue shulde remnaut haue blame gyltlesse saye saue thys yf ye wol herken yf iudas couent remeueth hym betyme rede yf shame losse may causen drede nothynge dyspleased praye thys case herkeneth saye londen preest annuellere therin dwelt many yere whych pleasaunt seruysable vnto wyfe table wolde suffre hym nothynge pay borde ne clothyng went neuer gay spendynge syluer ryght ynowe therof force wol procede nowe tel forth tale chanon brought thys preest confusyon pthys false chanon came vpon daye vnto thys preestes chambre laye besechynge hym leue hym certayne golde wolde quyte hym ayen leueth marke dayes thre daye wol quyte yf chat thou fynde false another daye hange halfe prest toke marke swyth thys chanon hym thanked ofte syth toke hys leaue went forth hys wey thyrde daye brought hys money thys preest toke thys golde acyen wherof thys preest glad fayn pcertes nothynge anoyeth leue man noble two thre thynge possession trewe condicion wyse breke wol hys daye suche man neuer saye naye chanon shulde vntrewe nay thynge fallen newe trouth thynge wol euer kepe vnto daye whych shal crepe graue el god forbede beleueth thys syker crede god thanke good tyme sayde na neuer man yet yuel apayde golde ne syluer lent ne neuer falshede myne herte ment syr nowe priuete sen ye goodlyche haue ben kythe great gentylnesse somwhat quyte kyndenesse wol shewe yf ye wol lere shal shewe anon right howe werche philosophye taketh good hede ye shal se eye wol done maistrye go pye syr preest wol ye marye therof pray hertely pat comaundement ser truely chanon el god forbede lo howe thefe couthe seruyce bede ful sothe suche profered seruyse stynketh wytnesseth olde wyse ful sone wol verifye chanon rote al trecherie euermore delyte hath gladnesse fendely thoughtes hert empresse christes people may mischefe bring god kepe v false dissymulyng pwhat wyst thys preest wt yt delte ne hys harme comyng nothyng felte sely preest sely innocente couetyse anon thou shalte blente gracelesse ful blynde thy conceyte nothyng arte thou ware hys disceyte foxe hath shapen wylye wrench thou mayste fle wherfore go conclusyon referreth thy confusyon vnhappy man anon wol hye tel thyne vnwytte ne thy folye eke falsnesse wretche ferforthe connyng wol stretche pthis chanon lord ye wolde wene syr host faythe heuen quene another chanon hundred folde subtelte hath betrayed folke many tyme falsnesse doleth ryme euer whan speke hys falseheed shame hym chekes waxen reed algates begynnen glowe rednesse haue non right wel knowe visage sumes dyuerce metal whiche ye haue herde reherce consumed wasted hath rednesse nowe take hede chanons cursydnesse syr preest let man gon quick syluer anon let hym brynge vnces two thre whan cometh faste shul ye se wonder thyng ye saw neuer er syr preest shal done iwys badde seruaunt fetch thyng al redy hys byddyng went forth came anon agayne quicksyluer shortly sayne toke vnces thre chanoun hem layde wel fayre adoun bade seruaunt cole bryng anon might go hys werkyng pthe cole right anon yfet chanon toke crosselet bosome shewed preest instrument thou seest take thy honde put thy selfe therin quicksyluer vnce begyn name christ wexe philosopher ful fewe whiche wolde profer shewe hem moche science shul ye se experience quicksyluer wol mortifye right syght anon withouten lye make good syluer fyne purse myne el make malliable el holde false vnstable amonges folke euer appere pi haue poudre coste dere shal make al good cause al connyng whiche shewe shal voydeth man let therout shette dore whyles ben aboute priuetie man v espye whyles werken philosophye al bade fulfylled dede ylke seruaunt anon yede hys maister shette dore anon labour spedily gon preest cursed chanons byddyng vpon fyre anon set thyng blewe fyre besyed hym ful faste chanon croslet caste pouder wherof ymade eyther chalke erthe glasse somwhat el worthe flye blynde preest badde hym hye cole couchen al aboue crosselet token loue quod chanon thyne hondes two shal werke al thyng shal graunt mercy preest ful glad couched cole chanon bad whyle busy thys fedely wretch thys false chanon foule fende fetch hys bosome toke bechen cole whych ful subtelly made hole therin put syluer limayle vnce stopped wythout fayle hole wyth waxe kepe limayle vnderstandeth thys false gyn made made thynges shal tel hereafter whych wyth brought er came begyle hym thought dyd er wente twynne tyl turned hym could blynne dulleth hym speke hys falshede fayne wolde wreke yf wyst howe variaunt hydeth pbut taketh hede syrs goddes loue toke hys cole whych spake aboue hys hande bare priuely whyles preest couched besely cole tolde er thys thys chanon sayd frende ye doue amys thys couched ought sone shal amende nowe let medle therwyth whyle haue pyte saynt gyle ye ben ryght hotte se wel howe ye swete haue cloth wype awaye wete whyle preest hym wyped hace chanon toke cole shrewe face layde abouen vpon mydwarde croslet blewe well afterwarde tyl cole gonne faste brenne pnowe yeue v drynke thys chano swyth al shall wel vndertake sytte downe let v mery make thys chanons bechen cole brent al limayle hole crosselette anone fel adoun muste nedes resoun sen euen aboue couched therof wyst preest nothynge ala demed al cole lyche goode sleyght nothynge vnderstode whe thys alkamystre sawe tyme ryseth vp syr preest standeth wote wel yngot haue none goth walketh forth brynge chalke stone wol make shappe yngot yf maye haue happe brynge eke wyth bolle panne ful water ye shal se thanne howe busynesse shal happe preue yet ye shal haue mysbeleue ne wronge conceyte absence wol ben presence go wyth come wyth agayne chambre dore shortly sayne opened shette went forth wey forth wyth hem caryed key comen ayen wythouten delaye shulde tarye al longe daye toke chalke shope wyse yngot shal deuyse saye toke hys owne sleue teyne syluer yuel mote cheue whych vnce weyght taketh hede nowe hys cursed sleyght shope hys yngot lenght brede teyne wythouten drede slyly preest aspyde hys sleue agayne gan hyde fyre toke vp hys matere yngot put wyth mery chere water vessel caste hym lyst bad preest faste loke ther put thyn hade grope thou shalt fynde syluer hope dyuel hel shulde el shauynge syluer syluer parde put hys hande toke vp reyne syluer fyne glade euery vayne thys preest sawe goddes blyssynge hys mother also al hallowes haue ye syr chanon sayd thys preest malyson ye vouchsafe teche thys noble crafte thys subtelte wol al euer may chanon yet wol make assay seconde tyme ye mowe take hede ben expert thys nede another daye assay myne absence thys dysciplyne thys crafty science lette take another ounce tho quycke syluer wythouten wordes mo done therwyth haue done er thys wyth whych nowe syluer pthys preest hym besyeth al done thys chanon thys cursed man commaunded hym faste blewe fyre come effecte desyre chanon right mean al redy preest efte begyle countynaunce honde bare holowe sticke take kepe beware thende vnce syluer lymaile putte al cole stopped wexe wele kepen lymaile euery dele while peest besynesse chanon sticke gan dresse hym anon pouder cast dyd erst deuyl hys skyn torne praye god falshede euer false thought dede sticke aboue crosselette ordayned false iette styrreth cole tyl al relent gan waxe agayne fyre euery man fole wot wel mote nede al hole yede crosselet hastely fel preest supposed nothynge wel besyed hym faste wonder fayne supposyng nought trouth soth sayn glad nat expresse manere hys myrthe gladnesse chanon profered efte sone body good ye chanon anone tho poore crafty thou shalt fynde warne yet behynde coper within sayd pye syr preest trowe el go bye aswythe nowe good syr go forth thy way hythe phe went way ye coper came chanon honde name coper wayed vnce al symple tonge pronounce minystre wytte doublenesse chanon rote al cursydnesse semed fredly hem yt knew nought fendly werke thought weryeth tel hys falsenesse nathelesse yet wol expresse entent men may beware therby none cause truely phe put vnce coper crosselet fyre swythe hath sette cast pouder made ye preest blowe workyng stoupe lowe dyd erste al na iape ryght hym lyst ye preest made hys ape afterwarde yngot caste panne put laste water put hys owne honde hys sleue ye beforehonde herde tel syluer teyne slily toke thys cursed heyne vnwetynge thys preest hys false crafte pannes botome hath lafte water rombleth fro wonder priuely toke vp also coper teyne knowynge thys preest hyd hent hym brest hym spake thus sayd hys game stoupeth adowne god ye blame helpeth nowe dyd wylere put honde loketh pthis preest toke vp syluer teyne anon sayd chanon let v gon thre teines han wrouyt goldsmyth wete yf ought fayth nolde hoode yf syluer fyne good swyth proued shalbe pvnto ye goldsmyth teynes thre went put assaye fyre hamer might man say naye ought sotted prest gladder neuer byrde gladder ayenst day ne nyghtyngale ayenst ceson may neuer none lyste better synge ne lady lustyer carollynge speake loue womanhede ne knyght armes hardy dede standen grace hys lady dere thys preest thys crafte lere chanon thus spake sayd loue god v al deyd may deserue vnto shal receit cost telleth nowe pby lady thys chanon dere warne wel saue frere englande man make force nowe syr goddes sake shall paye tel praye wy ful dere saye syr one worde yf ye lyst haue ye shal pay fourty pounde god saue nere frendshyp ye dyd er thys ye shulde paye ywys pthis preest ye sume fourty poude anone noble fette tolde hem euerychone thys chanon thys ylke receyte al hys worchynge fraude dysceyte sir prest said kepe haue loo crafte wolde kept cloos ye loue kepeth secre men knowe al subtelte god men wolde haue great enuye bycause philosophye shulde deed none way pgod forbyd preest ye say yet leuer spende al good whych haue el waxe wood ye shulde fallen suche myschefe good wyl haue ye ryght good prefe chanon farewel graunt mercy went hys way neuer preest hym sey day thys prest sholde maken assay tyme wolde thys receyte farewel nolde lo thus iaped begyled thus maketh hys introduction brynge folke destruction consydereth syrs howe eche estate betwyxt men golde debate ferforth vnnethes none thys moultiplyenge blyndeth many one good fayth trowe greatest cause suche scarsite phylosophers speaken mystely craft men come therby wytte men haue dayes may wel chattre iagle ye iayes termes set luste payne purpose shul neuer attayne man may lyghtly lerne yf haue ought multiplye brynge hys good nought lo suche lucre thys lusty game man myrth wol turne al grame empten also great heuy purse maken folke purchase curse hem han also good ylente fye shame han brente ala flye fyres hete ye vsen rede ye lete lest yt ye lesen al better neuer late neuer thryue longe date though yt ye prolle aye ye shal neuer fynd ye ben bolde bayarde blynd blodereth forth peryl casteth none bolde renne ayenst stone go besyde waye faren ye multiplyen saye yf eyen sene aryght loketh mynde lacke syght though ye loke neuer brode stare ye shal wynne myte chaffare wast al ye may repe renne wythdrawe fyre leste fast brenne medleth wyth arte mene yf ye done thryfte gone ful clene ryght swyth wol tellen yt philosopher sayn matere plo thus sayeth arnolde new toun hys rosarye maketh mencioun sayeth ryght thus wythouten lye may man mercurye mortifye yf wyth hys brother knowlegyng lo howe yt whych fyrst sayde thys thyng philosopher father hermes sayeth howe dragon doutles ne dyeth yf slayne wyth hys brother thys sayne dragon mercurye none vnderstode yt brimstone brother sol luna ydrawe therfore sayd take hede sawe let busye hym arte seche entencion speche philosopher vnderstande yf lende man thys science thys connyng secre secres parde palso dysciple plato tyme sayd hys mayster hys boke semor wol bere wytnesse thys hys demaude sothfastnesse tel name preuy stone pand plato answered vnto hym anone take stone tytanos men name pwhych ye magnatia sayd plato yea syr thus thys ignotum per ignotius magnatia good syr pray pit water made say elementes foure quod plato ptel roche good syr tho water yf wyl nay nay plato certayne nyll philosopher ysworne echone shulde dyscouer vnto none ne boke wryte manere vnto christ lefe dere wol dyscouered lyketh hys deite man enspyre eke defende hym lyketh lo thys ende pthen conclude thus sen ye god heue ne wyl phylosophers nemen howe shal come vnto thys stone rede best let gone maketh god hys aduersarye werch thynge contrarye vnto hys wyl certes neuer shal thriue though multiplye terme lyue poynte ended tale god sende euery true man bote hys bale phere endeth tale chanons yeman foloweth doctour phisykes prologue thys yeman hys tale ended thys false chanon whych bad hoste gan saye truely certayne thys preest begyled sothe sayne wenynge philosopher tyl ryght golde lefte hys cofer sothly thys preest alther iape thys cursed chanon put hys hode ape al thys passe ouer syr doctour phisyke yet pray tel v tale honeste matere shalbe done yf ye wol sayd thys doctour hys tale began anone good herkeneth euerychone phere endeth doctour phisykes prologue begynneth hys tale telleth v tytus liuius knyght clypped virginius fulfylled honour worthynesse stronge frendes rychesse doughter hys wyfe neuer mo al hys lyfe fayre thys mayde excellent beaute abouen euery wyght man may se nature hath wyth souerayne diligence formed great excellence though wolde say lo nature thus forme paynt creature lyste counterfete pigmalio though alway forge bete graue paynte dare wel sayne appelles zeusis shulde werche vayne graue paynte forge bete yf presumed counterfete former principall hath made hys vycar generall fourme paynte erthely creaturis right lyste al thyng cure vnder moone may wane waxe werke nothyng wol axe lorde ben fully corde made worshyp lorde al myne creature coloure fygures thus semeth nature wolde say mayd age twelue yere tway nature hath suche delyte right paynte lyllye whyte rody rose right suche paynture paynted hath noble creature er borne vpon lymmes fre al bright suche colour shulde phebus died tress grete lyke stremes burned hete yf excellent beaute thousande folde vertuous ne lacketh conditioun preyse discretioun wel body gost chaste whiche floured virginite al humylyte abstynence al attemperaunce pacience mesure eke beryng array discrete answeryng alway tho wyse pallas dare sayn faconde eke ful womanly playn counterfayted termes seme wyse degree spake al wordes lesse sownyng vertue gentyllesse shamfast maydes shamfastnesse constant hert euer busynesse dryue al slogardry bacchus mouthe maistry wyne youth done venus encrece men fyre wol casten oyle grece owne vertue vnconstrayned hath ful ofte sicke yfayned wolde slye company lykely treten foly feestes reuels daunces ben occasyons dalyaunces suche thynges maken chyldren sone rype bolde men may se whiche ful perillous hath ben yore al sone may lerne lore boldnesse whan wyfe ye maistresses olde lyfe lordes doughters han gouernaunce ne taketh worde diplesaunce thynke ye ben set gouernynges lordes doughters onely two thynges eyther ye han kepte honeste eyther ye han fal freelte knowen wel ynough olde daunce conne forsake fully mischaunce euermore therfore christes sake kepeth wel tho ye vndertake pa thefe venyson hath forlafte lykerousnesse al theues crafte kepe forest best man nowe kepeth hem wel ye wol ye loketh wel vice ye assent lest ye dampned yuel entent dothe traytour certayn taketh kepe shal sayn al treyson souerayne pestilence whan wight betrayeth innocence ye father eke ye mother also though ye han chyldren one mo charge al sufferaunce while ben gouernaunce beth ware ensample lyueng eyther neglygence chastisynge ne perishe dare wel say ye shal ful sore obey vnder shepeherde softe neglygent wolf hath many shepe lambe rent suffyseth one ensample nowe mote turne ayen matere pthis maid tel tale expresse kepte selue neded maistresse lyueng maydens myght rede boke euery good worke dede longeth mayde vertuous prudent bountuous whiche spronge euery syde bothe beaute bounte wyde thorowe ye lode preysed echon loued vertue saue enuy alone sorye mennes wele gladde sorowe vnhele doctour maketh discriptioun mayde went day toun towarde temple mother dere yonge maydens manere pnowe iustice toun gouernour regioun befyl iustice eyen cast vpon mayde auisyng ful fast came foreby iuge stode anone hys herte chaungeth hys mode caught wt beaute mayde hymselfe ful priuely sayde thys mayde shalbe myne man anone fende hys herte taught hym sodeynly sleyght mayde purpose wynne myght certes force ne mede hym thought able spede stronge frendes eke confyrmed souerayne beaute wel wyst myght neuer wyn make wyth body synne whych wyth great delyberatioun sent clyent toun whych knew ful subtyl full bolde iuge vnto thys cliet tale hath tolde secrete wyse made hym ensure shulde vnto creature yf yd shulde lese hys hede assented thys cursed rede glad iuge made good chere yaue hym gyftes precious dere pwhen shapen al thys conspiracie fro poynt poynt howe hys lecherie parfourmed shulde ful subtelly ye shullen openly home goeth thys clyent ye hyght claudius thys false iuge hyght appius hys name fable knowe hystorial thynge notable sentence sothe doute thys false iuge goeth nowe fast aboute hasten hys delyte al maye byfell sone daye thys false iuge telleth v storie wonte sate hys consystorie yaue hys dome vpon sondry caas thys false client came forth ful gret paas sayd lorde yf wyll doth ryght vpon thys pytous byll whych playne vpon virginius yf wol say thus wol proue fynde good wytnesse soth byl wol expresse iuge answerde thys hys absence maye yeue diffynite sentence let hym cal wol gladly thou shalt haue ryght wronge virginius came wete iuges wyl ryght anone radde thys cursed byl sentence ye shal pto lorde appius dere sheweth poore seruaunt claudius howe knyght called virginius ayenst lawe ayenst al equite holdeth expresse ayenst wyl seruaunt whych yt thrale right whych fro myne house stole night whyles ful yonge wol preue wytnesse lorde ye greue hys doughter saye wherfore lorde iustyce praye yelde thrale yf wyll lo thys al sentence byll pvirginius gan vpon clyent beholde hastely er hys tale tolde wolde haue defeded shulde knight wytnesse many trewe wyght al false sayd hys aduersarye thys cursed iuge wolde lenger tarye ne worde virginius yaue hys iudgement sayd thus pi deme anone client seruaut haue thou shalt leger thyne house saue go brynge forth put warde cliet shal haue thral thus award pand whe thys worthy knyght virginius assent iudge appius muste force hys dere doughter yeuen vnto iudge lechery lyuen goeth hym home set hym hys hall let anone hys dere doughter call wyth face deed ashen colde vpon humble face gan beholde father pyte stickyng hert al wolde hys purpose conuert pdoughter virginia thy name ben two wayes eyther deth shame thou muste suffre ala yt borne neuer thou deseruedest wherforne dyen wyth sworde wyth knyfe oh dere doughter comforte lyfe whych haue fostred vp wyth plesauce thou ne remembrauce doughter whych arte last wo lyfe last ioye also iemme chastite pacience take thou thy death thys sentence loue hate thou must deed pytous hande mote smyte thyne heed ala euer appius sey thus hath falsly iudged dey tolde al case ye han herde nedeth tel po mercy dere father thys mayde wyth worde armes layde hys necke wont teeres braste eyen two sayd good father shal dye grace remedye pno certes dere doughter myne yeue leaue father myne death complayne lytel space parde iepte yaue hys doughter grace complayne er slough ala god wote nothynge trespas ranne father fyrst se welcome hym wyth great solempnyte word fel swoune anone whon swounynge gone ryseth vp father sayd blyssed god shal dye mayde yeue death er haue shame doth wt child wil goddes name wyth ye worde prayeth hym ful ofte wt swerd smitte softe word swoune fel father wyth sorowfull herte fell heed smote toppe hente iudge yaue presente sate dome consystorye iudge sawe sayth storye bade take hym hange hym also faste ryght anone al people thrast saue knyght routh pytie knowen iudges iniquitie people anone suspect thing maner thys clyentes chalengynge assent appius wyste wel lecherous whych vnto appius gone casten hym prison ryght anone slowe hym selfe claudius seruaunt vnto thys appius demed hanged vpon tre virginius hys great pyte prayed hym exiled el certes ben begyled remnaunt hanged lesse consented thys cursydnesse may men se syn hath hys meryte beware wot god wyl smyte degre ne maner wyse worme conscience wol aryse wycked lyfe though priuy man wote god whether leude man lered howe sone may affered therfore rede thys counsayle take forsake synne synne forsake phere endeth doctour phisykes tale foloweth wordes hoost ovr hoste gan swere woode harowe nayles bloode thys false thefe cursed iustyce shameful death herte may deuyse come iustyce adu ca algate thys sely mayden slayne ala ala dere bought beaute wherfore saye al men maye se yeftes fortune nature ben cause death many creature beaute death dare wel sayne ala pytously slayne wol procede nowe men haue ful ofte harme prowe truely myne owne mayster dere thys pytous tale nathelesse passe ouer force pray god saue thy gentel cors thy vrinalles thy iordanes thyne ypocras eke thy galyanes euery boxe ful letuarye god blesse hem lady saynt marye mote thou arte propre man ylyke prelate saynt runian saue speake wel terme wel wote yu doest myn herte yerne haue almost ycaught cardyacle corpus domini haue tryacle el draught moyste corny ale anone mery tale herte loste pyte thys mayde thou belamy thou iohan pardoner said tel v mery tale iape ryght anone shalbe done saynt runyon fyrst thys ale stake wol drynke eate cake ryght anone gentyls gan crye nay let hym tel v rebaudrye tel v moral thing mow lere wytte wol gladly graunt twys mote thynke honest thyng whyles yt drynke phere ende wordes host foloweth prologue pardoner lordynges chyrche whan preche payne haue hauteyn speche ring rounde dothe bel al roote tel teme alwaye euer radix omnium malorum est cupiditas fyrst pronounce fro whens come bylles shewe al ege lorde seale patent shewe fyrst body warent man bolde preest ne clerke distourbe christes holy werke tel forthe tale bulles pope cardynales patriarkes byshoppes shewe latyn speke wordes fewe sauer predication steere men deuotion shewe forth long christal stone ycrammed ful cloutes bone relykes ben wene echone haue laton sholderbone whiche holy iewes shepe good men saye take wordes kepe bone washen wel cowe calfe shepe oxe swel worme hath eeten hem stonge take water wel washe tong hole anon farthermore pockes scabbes euery sore shal shepe hole wel drinketh draught take kepe tel pif good man beestes oweth wol euery day er cocke croweth fastyng drynke wel draught thilke holy iewe elder taught beestes store shal multiplye syrs also healeth ielousye though man fal ielous rage let make water potage neuer shal wyfe mistryst though sothe defaute wyst al take preestes two thre phere myttayne eke ye may se honde wol put thys mittayne shal haue multiplyeng grayne whan hath sowen whete otes offer good pen grotes men woman thyng warne wight ben churche nowe hath done synne horrible dare shame shriuen woman yonge olde hath made husbonde coke wolde suche folke shul haue powre ne grace offre relykes place fyndeth hym suche blame commeth vp offre goddes name assoyle hym auctorite suche bulle graunted pby gaude haue wonne euery yere hundred marke sythen pardonere stonde lyke clerke pulpet leude people byn downe yset preche ye haue lered tel hundred iapes payn stretche forth necke este west vpon people becke dothe doue syttyng vpon berne hondes tonge gon ful yerne ioy se besynesse auarice suche cursydnesse al prechyng maken hem fre yeuen pen namely vnto myne entent wynne nothyng correction synne recke neuer whan ben beryed thoughe soules gon blacburyed certes many predycation cometh oft tyme yuel entencion psome pleasaunce folke flatery ben auaunced hipocrysy veyne glorie hate whan dare wayes debate wol sting hem toge smerte prechyng shal asterte ben diffamed falsly yf hath trespased bretherne though tel propre name men shal wel knowe signes circunstaunces thus quyte folke yt dothe v displesauces thus put venym vnder hewe holynesse semen holy trewe shortly myne entent wol deuyse preche nothyng couetyse therfore teme yet euer radix omnium malorum est cupiditas pthus preache ayenst vyce whiche vse auarice though selfe gilty synne yet maken folke twynne auarice sore hem repent principal entent preche nothyng couetyse matere ought ynough suffyse tel hem ensamples many one olde story longe tyme agone leude people louen tale olde thynges wel reporte holde trow ye while may preche wynne golde syluer teche wol lyue pouert wilfully nay nay thought neuer trewly wol preche begge sodrie londes wol labour myn hondes ne make baskettes lyue therby bycause wol begge idelly wol none apostels counterfete wol haue money mault chese whete al yeuen poorest page poorest wydowe village though child shuld sterue famy nay wol drinke lycoure wyne haue ioly wenche euery toun herkeneth lordynges conclusyoun lykyng shulde tel tale nowe haue droken draught corny ale god hope shal tel thynge shal reson ben lykynge though selfe ful vycious man morall tale yet tel whiche wonte preche wynne nowe holdeth peace tale woll begyn phere endeth pardoner prologue foloweth tale flaunders whilo ther company yonge folke hau ted foly hasarde ryotte stewes tauernes wyth harpes lute geternes dauncen playen dyce nyght day eeten also ouer might may dyuel sacrifyce within dyuels temple cursed wyse superfluite abhominable othes ben great damnable grisly hem swere blissed lordes body al tere hem thought iewes rent ynough eche hem others synne lough right anon comen tomblesteres fetys smale yonge froytereres syngers wilh harpes bandes waferers whiche ben verely dyuels offycers kyndlen blowe fyre lechery anexed vnto glotony holy writte take wytnesse lechery wyne dronkenesse plo howe dronken lothe vnkyndly lay doughters two wetyngly dronke nist wrought therfore sore repent hym ought herodes wol story seche may ye lerne ensample teche whan wyne replete feste right owne table yaue heste sleen iohan baptiste ful giltlesse seneke saythe eke good wordes doutlesse saythe difference fynde betwixt man mynde man dronklewe woodnesse fallen shrewe perseuereth lenger dothe dronknesse gloteny ful cursydnesse cause fyrst confusyon original dampnacion tyl christ bouyt v wt blode agayn lo howe dere shortly sayn bought fyrst cursed vilanye corrupt al world glotony adam forn father wyfe also fro paradyce labour wo driuen vyce drede whyles adam fasted rede paradyce whan ete frute defended tre anon caste wo payne gloteny wel ought v playne poh wyste man howe many maladyes foloweth excesse glotenyes wolde ben mesurable dyete syttyng table ala shorte throte tender mouthe maketh este west northe southe erthe eyre water man swynke getten gloton dayntye mete drinke mater poule wel canste thou trete mete vnto wombe wombe eke vnto mete shal god distroy bothe poule saythe ala soule thyng faythe say worde fouler dede whan men drinketh whyte rede trothe maketh priue thilke cursed superfluite pthe apostle sayth wepyng ful pitously walken many tolde haue say nowe wepyng pitous voyce ben enemyes christes croyse ye ende deth wombe god bely wombe stynkyng cod fulfylled donge corrupcioun eyther ende soule soun howe great coste laboure fynde coke stape strain grinde turne substaunce accident fulfyl al thy lykerous talent harde bone knocken mary caste awey may go gullet safe sote spycerie leues barke rote shal ben sauce ymade delyte maken hym haue newer apetyte certes haunteth suche delytes deed while lyueth vyces pa lecherouse thyng wyne droknesse ful stryuyng wretchydnesse oh dronken man disfygured thy face sower thy breth foul art thou enbrace thy droke nose sowneth ye soun tho thou saydest aye sampson sapson yet god wote sapson drok neuer wyne thou fallest stycked swyne thy tonge lost al thyne honest cure drynkennesse sepulture mannes wytte discretion drinke hath domynation counsayle kepe drede nowe kepe fro whyte fro ye rede namely fro white wyne lepe sel fishe strete chepe wyne spayne crepeth subtelly wynes growyng fast whiche riseth suche fumosyte whan hath drock draughtes thre weneth home chepe spayne right towne lepe nought rochel ne burdeaux toun wol say sampsoun sapsoun herkeneth lordiges word pray al souerayne actes dare say victory olde testament thorowe god omnipotent abstinence prayere loketh byble ye mow lere loketh attyla great conquerour deyd slepe shame dishonour bledyng aye nose dronknesse capitayne shulde lyue sobernesse ouer al auyse right wel comaunded vnto lamuel nat samuel lamuel saye redeth byble fyndeth expresly wyne yeuyng hem haue iustyce may ynoughe suffyce nowe haue spoke glotenye nowe wol defende hasardrie hasarde mother lesynges disceyte cursed swerynges blaspheme christ maslauyter wast also batayle ofte tyme mo reprefe contrarye honour holden comen hasardour euer hyer estate holden desolate prince vse hasardrie al gouernaunce policie comen opinyon holde lesse reputacion pstyllebon holde wyse ambassadour sent corinthe wt ful great honour fro calydone maken hem alyaunce whan came happed chaunce al greatest londe playeng hasarde hem fonde whiche sone might stale hym home ayen countre sayd wol lese name nyl take great defame alye none hasardours sendeth wyser enbassadours trouthe leuer dye shulde hasardours alye ye ben gloriouse honour shal alye hasardours wyl ne tretie wyse philosopher thus sayd ploke eke howe kyng demetrius kyng parthes boke saythe v sent hym payre dyce golde scorne vsed hasardrie byforne helde glorie renoun value reputacioun lordes might fynde maner play honest ynough driue day away nowe wol speke othes false great worde two bokes entreat great sweryng thyng abhomynable false sweryng yet reprouable hye god forbade sweryng wytnesse mathew specyall sweryng saythe holy ieromye thou shalte swere soth thyn othes lye swere dome eke rightwysnesse ydle sweryng cursydnesse pbeholde se fyrst table hye goddes hestes honorable howe seconde heste hym take name ydelnesse amys lo rather forbyddeth sweryng homicide cursed thyng say thus order stondeth knoweth yt hestes vnderstondeth howe seconde heste god wol tel al plat vengeauce shal parte fro hou hys othes outragyous goddes preciouse herte bone blode christ shed v one seuen chaunce thyn fyue thre goddes armes yf thou falsly play daggar shal thorowe thyn herte go frute cometh thylke bone two swering ire falsnesse homicyde yt loue christ v dyde leaueth othes bothe great smale shal tel meruaylous tale pthese ryottours thre tel longe erste prime ronge bel set hem tauerne drinke sate herde bel clynke byforne cors yt caryed graue one hem gan cal knaue go bette aske redely cors passeth forthe loke thou reporte name wele psyr nedeth neuer dele told er ye came two houres parde olde felowe al sodaynly slayne nyght dronke sate benche vpright came priuy thefe men clepen dethe countrey al people slethe speare smote hert two went way withouten wordes mo hath thousande slayne pestilence mayster er ye come presence thynketh necessarye beware suche aduersarye bethe redy meten hym euer thus taught dame say pby saynt mary sayd tauernere chylde sayth sothe hath yere hence ouer myle slayne great village bothe man woman chylde page nowe habytacioun ben auysed great wysedome er dyd man dishonour pyea goddes armes ryottour suche peril mete shal hym seche style eke strete make vowe goddes digne bone herkeneth felowes thre ben al one let eche v holde vp honde eche v become others brother wol slee false traytour dethe shal slayne many slethe goddes dignite er nyght pto gider ha thre trouthes plight lyue dye eche hym though owne brother vp sterten al dronken rage forthe gone towarde village tauerner hath spoke many grisly othe han swore christes blessed body rent dethe shal deed may hym hent pwhan han gone fully myle right wold haue troden ouer style olde poore man hem mette olde man ful mekely hem grette sayd nowe lordynges god se pthe proudest ryottours thre answerde ayen chorle wt harde grace art thou al forwrapped saue thy face lyuest thou longe great age pthis olde man gan loken hys visage sayd thus fynde man though walked iude neyther cyte ne village wol chaunge youthe myne age therfore mote haue myn age styl longe tyme goddes wyl ne dethe ala nyl haue lyfe thus walke lyke restlesse caityfe ye ground mother gate knocke staffe erlyche late say leue mother let lo howe vanyshe fleshe bloode skyn ala whan shal bone ben reste mother wolde chauge cheste chamber longe tyme hath ye heren cloute wrappe yet wol done grace whiche ful welked face syrs curtesye speken vnto olde man villanye trespace worde eyther dede holy writte ye may selfe wel rede ayenst olde man hoore vpon heede ye shulde aryse therfore rede ne doth vnto old man harme ye wolde man dyd age yf may longe abyde god whether ye go ryde mote go thyder haue go pnay olde chorle god thou shalt sayd hasardours anon thou partest lightly saynt iohn thou spakest right thilk trayter deth countre al frendes slethe haue trouthe thou arte espye tel el thou shalt dye god holy sacrament sothely thou arte hys assent slee v yonge folke thou false thefe pnowe syrs yf sy lefe fynde dethe turne vp croked way groue lefte hym fay vnder tree wol abyde ne boste nyl hym nothyng hyde se ye yoder oke right ye shal hi fynde god saue bought ayen mankynde amende thus sayd thus olde man pthan eueryche ryottours ran tyl came tree foude floreynes golde fyne ycoyned rounde wel nye seuen bushel hem thought lenger dethe sought eche hem glad syght floreyns fayre ben bright downe sytte precious hord worst hem spake fyrst word pbrethern take kepe say wytte great though borde play tresure hath fortune v yeuen myrthe iolyte lyfe lyuen lightly cometh wol spende hey goddes precious herte wende day shulde haue fayr grace might thus gold caryed fro place home house el wel wote al golde hye felycite trewly day may men wolde say theues stroge owne tresoure v honge tresour muste ycaried night wisely ily might wherfore rede let loke amonge v al drawe let se cutte wol fal hath yt shortest cutte hert blyth shal renne towne ful swythe bring v breed drinke ful priuely two v shal kepe ful subtelly tresour wel yf wol tarye whan night wol tresour carye one assent v lyste best one hem brought grasse fest bad draw loke wold fal fel yongest hem al forth towarde towne went anon al sone gone one hem spake vnto thou wost wel thou art sworn brother thy profyte wol tel right anone thou woste wel felowe gone golde ful great plente shal departed amonge v thre n thelesse yf shape departed amonge v two done frendly turne answerd yt might wol wel golde two shulde might pshal cousayle said fyrst shrewe shal tel wordes fewe wol done bryng wel aboute graunt doute trouth wol yt bewrayne pnow thou wost wel ben twayn twayne v shal stronger one loke whan sette anone aryse though thou woldest wt hym play shal ryuen ye sydes tway whyles yt thou strugglest wt hym game thy dagger loke thou shal al golde departed dere frende betwixt may bothe lustes fulfyl play dyce right owne wyl thus accorded ben shrewes tway slee thyrde ye herde say yongest yt went towne ful often herte rolled vp beautie floreyns fayre bright lorde yf might haue al tresour selfe alone ny man lyueth vnder trone god shulde lyue mery laste feude enemy put thought shuld poyson bey might sleen felowes twey fende fonde hym lyuing leue sorowe hym bryng vtterly hys entente sleen hem bothe neuer repente pand forth goth lenger wold tary towne vnto potecary prayde hym wol hym sel poyson might rattes quel eke polkat hawe sayd capon yslawe sayd wold wreken hym yt might vermyn distroyed hem night pthe potecary answerde thou shalt haue thyng wisely god soule saue al worlde ny creature eateth drinketh confecture moutenauce corne whete ne shal hys lyfe anon forlete yea sterue shal lesse whyle tha thou woldest gon pace myle poyson harde violent pthis cursed man hath honde hent poyson bore sythe ran next strete vnto man borowed hym large botels thre two poyson poured thyrde kept clene drinke al night shope hym swynke caryeng golde place whan riottour sorie grace fylde hym hys great bottels thre felowes ayen repayred pwhat nedeth therof sermon right caste dethe right han hym slayne anone whan done spake ye one nowe let v syt drinke make v mery afterwarde wolne body bury happed hem per caas one toke botel therin yt poyson dronke yaue felowe drinke also anon sterne two pbut certes suppose auicenne wrote neuer cannon ne fenne wonder sorowes enpoysonnyng wretch two ending thus ended ben homicide two eke false enpoysonner also cursed synne ful al cursydnesse traytours homicide wickydnesse glotenye luxure hasardye thou blasphemour christ wyth vilanye othes great vsage pryde ala mankynde howe may betyde thy creatoure yt wrought precious bloode bought thou arte false vnkynde ala good godforyeue trespas ware fro synne auaryce myne holy pardon may al waryshe ye offre noble starlynges el syluer spones broches rynges boweth heed vnder bulle cometh vp ye wyues offreth wol name entre rolle anon blisse heuen shul ye al gon assoyle myne high powere ye offren clene eke clere ye borne lo syrs thus preche iesu christ soules leche graunt hys pardon receyue beste wol disceyue sir one worde yate tale haue relykes pardon male fayre man englonde whiche yeuen pope honde wol deuocion offren haue myne absolucion cometh forthe anon kneleth adoun ye may haue parte pardoun el taketh pardon ye wende al newe freshe euery townes ende ye offren alway newe newe noble pen whiche ben good trew great honour eueryche ye may haue sufficient pardonere assoyle countre ye ryde auentures whiche may betyde perauenture may fal one two downe horse breke necke two loke whiche suertie al felowshyp yfal maye assoyle bothe lasse whan soule shal fro body passe rede oure hoste shal begynne moste enuelopte synne cometh forthe sir hoste offre fyrst anon thou shalte kysse relykes euerychon yea grote vnbokyl anon thy purse pnay nay haue christes curse let shal theiche thou woldest make kisse thyn old breche swere relyke seynt though wt thy foundemet depeynt crosse seynt helayne fonde wolde thy coylons myne honde stede relykes sanctuarye let cutte hem wol helpe ye hem cary shul shrined hogges torde pardoner answerde worde wrothe wolde worde say pnow oure hoste wol lenger play ne non angry man pbut right anon worthy knight began whan sawe al people loughe nomore right ynoughe sir pardoner mery glad chere ye sir hoste ben dere praye ye kysse pardoner pardoner pray drawe ner dyd let v laughe play anon kyssed ryden forthe way phere endeth pardoner tale begynneth shipmans prologue nowe frendes sayd oure hoste dere lyketh iohn pardonere hathe vnbokeled wel male hath v tolde right thrifty tale touchyng hys mysgouernaunce pray god yeue hym good chaunce ye han herde ryottours thre nowe gentyl mariner hertely pray tel v good tale right anon shal done god saynt iohn sayd maryner wel euer right anon tale thus began phere endeth shypmans prologue foloweth hys tale marchaunt whilom dwelled sait denise ryche held hi wise wyfe excellent beaute copynable reuelous whyche thynge causeth dispence worthe al chere reuerence men hem done feestes daunces suche salutation countynaunces passeth dothe shadowe wal wo hym paye mote al sely husbonde algate mote paye mote v bothe cloth eke araye al owne worshippe richely whiche array dauncen iolyly yf may nat parauenture el lust suche spence endure thynketh wast ylost mote another paye coste lende v golde perilous noble marchant held noble hous whiche al day great repayre largesse hys wyfe fayre wonder herkeneth tale amonge al gestes great smale monke fayre man bolde trowe thurty wynter olde euer one drawing place yonge monke yt fayre face aquaynted good man sythens fyrst knowlege began house famylier possyble frende moche good man eke monke began bothe two borne one village monke hym claymed cosynage agayne sayd one nay glad therof foule day herte great pleasaunce thus ben knytte wt eterne aliaunce eche hem gan ensure brotherheed whyles lyfe may dure pfre dan iohan namely dispece house ful diligence pleasaunce eke great costage foryate yeue leste page al house degre yaue lorde sythen hys meyne whan yt came maner honest thyng whiche glad coming foule fayne whan sonne vp ryseth herof nowe suffyseth pbut byfel marchaunt day shepe hym make redy hys aray towarde towne bruges fare bye porcion ware whiche hath sent parys anon messanger prayde hath dan iohn shuld come saint denys playn wife day twayn bruges went al wyse pthis noble monke deuyse hath abbot hym lyst lycence bycause man hye prudence eke offycer ryde seen graunges berne wyde vnto saynt denys cometh anon welcome lord dan iohn dere cosyn ful curtesye brought iubbe maluesy eke another ful fyne vernage volatily aye vsage thus let hem eate drinke play marchant monke day tway pthe thyrde day marchaunt vp ryseth nede sadly hym auyseth vp countyng house gothe reken hym selfe wel may thilke yere howe hym stoode howe spended goode yf encresed none bokes bagges many one laythe afore hym counter borde ful ryche hys tresour horde whiche ful faste counter dore shet eke nolde man shulde hym let hys accomptes mene tyme thus sate tyl passed prime dan iohan rysen morow also garden walked two fro hath hys thynges sayd ful curtesly pthis good wyfe come walkyng priuely garden walked softe hym salueth hath done ful ofte mayden chylde came companye luste may gouerne gye yet vnder yerde mayde po dere cosyn dan iohan sayde eyleth rathe ryse pnece ought ynough suffyse fyue houres slepen night olde palied wight ben old wedded men lye dare forme sytteth wery hare al forstraught houndes gret smale dere nece loke ye pale trowe certes good man hath laboured sythe night began nede resten hastely worde lough ful merily owne thought woxe al reed fayre wyfe gan shake heed sayd thus yea god wote al nay cosyn myne stondeth god yaue soule lyfe al realme fraunce wife lesse luste hath sory play may syngen ala welaway borne wight dare tel howe stonte wherfore think world wed el selfe sone make ende ful drede eke care pthis moke began vpon wyfe stare sayd ala nay nece god forbede ye sorowe drede selfe telleth grefe perauenture may mischefe counsayle helpe therfore telleth al anoye shal secret portouse make othe neuer lyfe lefe ne lothe ne shal counsayle bewray ayen say god portouse swere thoug men wolde al peces tere ne shal neuer go hel bewray worde thyng ye tel cosynage ne alyaunce verily loue affyaunce thus ben sworne vpon kyste ylke hem tolde hem lyste pcosyn yf space haue none namely place wolde tel legende lyfe suffred haue sythe wyfe myn husbonde though cosyn nay moke god seynt martyn ni cosyn vnto lefe hongeth tre clepe saynte denys fraunce haue cause aquayntaunce haue loued specially abouen al woman sykerly swere professyoun telleth grefe leste come adoun hasteth goth way anon dere loue dan iohn ful lefe counsayle hyde mote may lenger abyde husbonde worste man euer sythe worlde began sythen wyfe sytte tellen wight priuyte neyther bedde ne none place god shylde shulde tel grace wyfe ne shulde say husbonde al honoure vnderstonde saue vnto thus moche tel shal helpe god nought worthe al degre value flye yet greueth moste nygardye wel ye wote woman naturally desyren thynges syxe wel wolden husbondes shulde hardy wyse riche therto fre buxom wyfe freshe bedde ylke lorde v bledde hys honoure selfe arraye sonday next mote nedes paye hundred frankes el lorne yet leuer vnborne done slaunder vilanye yf myn husbonde eke might aspye nere loste therfore prey lene somme el mote dey dan iohn say lene hudred frakes parde wol fayle thankes ye lyste pray certayne day wol pay done plesaunce seruyce may right ye lyste deuyse god take vengeaunce foule euer genilion fraunce pthis getil moke answerd manere nowe truly myne owne lady dere haue great routhe swere plight trouthe wha husbod flauders fare wol delyuer al care wol brynge hundred frankes caught flankes enbraced herde kyssed ofte go nowe way al styl softe let v dyne sone euer ye may kalender prime day gothe nowe beth true shal nowe el god forbyd syr sayd forthe gothe ioly pye bade coke shulde hem hye men might dyne anone vp husbonde wyfe gone knocked counter e boldely qui est la peter quod howe longe wol ye fast howe longe tyme wol ye recken caste somme bokes thynges dyuel haue parte al reckeninges ye haue ynough goddes sonde come day let bagges stonde ne ye shamed dan iohn shal fastyng al longe day gon let v go masse go dyne pwyfe lytel canst thou diuyne curyous besynesse haue chapman god saue lorde called seynt iue scarsly amonge twenty twelue shal thriue contynually lastyng vnto theyr age may wel make chere good vysage driue forthe worlde may kepe estate priuyte tyl deed el play pylgrimage gone way therfore haue great necessyte vpon queynte worlde auyse euermore mote stonde drede happe fortune chapmanhede flauders wol gone morow day come ayene sone euer may whiche dere wyfe beseke euery wight buxom meke kepe good curyouse honestly gouerne wel house thou haste ynough euery maner wyse thrifty huswyfe may suffyse lacketh none array ne vitayle syluer thy purse thou mayst fayle ye worde counter dore shette gothe lenger wold lette hastely masse isayde spedely table ilayde dyner faste hem spedde richly chapman monke fedde dyner dan iohan soberly chapman toke parte al priuely sayd hym thus cosyn stondeth wel se bruges ye wol go god saynt austen spede gyde pray cosyn wysely ye ryde gouerneth also wel dyete al temperatly namely hete betwixt v two nedeth straunge fare farwel cosyn god shylde fro care thyng day night lye power might ye wol comaunde wyse shal done right ye wol deuyse thyng ye go yf may wolde pray leue hundred frankes weke twey certayne beestes mote nedes bey store place god helpe wolde shal fayle surely day thousande frankes myle way let thyng secret pray yet night beestes mote bey fare nowe wele myne owne cosyn dere graunt mercy coste chere pthis noble marchaunt gentilly anon answerde sayd cosyn dan iohn nowe sikerly smal request golde whan leste golde chaffare take ye lyste god shilde ye spare one thyng ye knowe wel ynough chapman money plough may creaunce whyle haue name goldlesse shame paye ayen whan lythe ese might fayne wolde plese pthese hundred frankes set forthe anon priuely toke hem dan iohn wight worlde wyst thys lone sauyng marchaut dan iohan alone drinke speke rome pley tyl dan iohan rydeth abbey morow came forth ryd marchat flauders warde pretes brought auat tyl came bruges wel merily nowe gothe marchaunt wel besily nedes byeth creaunseth neyther playeth dyce ne daunseth marchaunt shortly tel ledde lyfe let dwel pthe sonday next yt marchat gon saynt denys comen dan iohn crowne berde al freshe newe ishaue al house na lytel knaue ne wight el ful fayne yt lorde dan iohn comen agayn shortly poynte gon fayre wyfe acordeth dan iohn hundred frankes shulde al night haue armes bolte vpright acorde parformed dede myrthe
