al nyght besy lyfe lede tyl day yt dan iohn yede way bade meyne farwel haue good day none hem ne wyght toun dan iohan suspection forthe rydeth home abbey hym lyste hym sey pthis marchaunt whan ended ye faire saynte denys gan repaire wyfe maketh feest chere telleth chaffare dere nedes muste make cheuesaunce bounden reconisaunce pay twenty thousande shildes anon whiche marchaunt paris gon borowe certayne frendes certayne frankes hym lad whan comen toun chierte great affection vnto dan iohn fyrst gothe hym pley nought borowe hym money wete se welfare tellen chaffare frendes done wha ben mette fere dan iohan maketh feest mery chere tolde ayen ful specially howe bought ful wel graciously thonked god al hole hys marchaundyse saue muste al maner wyse maken cheuesaunce beste shulde ioye reste da iohn answerd certes right fayn ye heale comen home agayne yf riche haue blisse twety thousand shildes shuld ye misse ye kyndely day lent golde may thonke god saynt iame nathelesse toke vnto dame wyfe home golde agayne vpon benche wote wel certayne certayne token tel nowe leue may lenger dwel abbot wol towne anon hys companye mote gon grete wel dame myne owne nece swete farwele dere cosyn tyl mete pthis marchant ful ware wyse creaunced hath eke payde parys certayne lombardes redy houdes somme gold gate hem ye bondes home gothe mery popyngay wel knewe stode suche aray nedes muste wyn viage thousande frankes aboue al costage phi wyfe ful redy met hym yate wonte olde vsage algate al night myrthe sette ryche clerely dette wha day marchat gan enbrace wyfe al newe kyssed face vp gothe made wonder tough god ye haue ynough wantonly ayen hym playde tyl laste marchant thus sayde god lytel wrothe wyfe al though lothe wot ye god gesse ye haue made maner straungenesse betwixt cosyn dan iohn ye shulde haue warned gon hundred frankes payde redy token helde hym yuel apayde hym spake cheuesaunce semed countenaunce nathelesse god heuen kyng thought aske hym nothyng pray wyfe ne tel alway er fro go dettour hath myne absence ypayde leste thy neglygence might hym aske thyng hath payd pthis wyfe ferde ne affrayde boldely sayd anon mary defye false monke dan iohn kepe hys token neuer dele toke certayne golde wot wele yuel thedom monkes snoute god wotte wende without doute yeue bycause therwith myne honoure prow cosynage eke bellye chere hath ful often tymes sythe se stonte suche disioynte wol answere shortly poynte ye haue mo slacker dettours wol pay wel redily fro day day yf fayle wyfe score tayle el shal pay sone euer may trouth haue myne aray waste bestowed euery dele haue bestowed wele honour goddes sake say wrothe let v laughe play ye shal ioly body haue wedde god nyl pay bedde foryeue myne owne spouse dere turneth hitherwarde make better chere pthis marchant sawe ther remedy chyde folye sythen thyng may amended nowe wyfe sayd foryeue thy lyfe large kepe bet good yeue charge thus endeth nowe tale god v sende talynge ynough vnto lyues ende phere endeth shypmans tale foloweth wordes host wel sayd corpus domini hoste nowe longe mote thou sayle coste thou gentyl mayster gentel marinere god gyue ye moke thousand last quad yere ha felowes beware suche iape moke put marchates hode ape hys wyues eke saynt austyn draweth moke inne nowe passe ouer let v seke aboute shal tell nowe fyrst thys route tale wyth worde sayde curteously bene mayde lady prioresse leue wyste shuld greue wol deme ye tellen sholde tale nexte yf ye wolde nowe wol yt vouchsafe lady dere gladly sayd thys manere phere ende wordes oure hoste begynneth prioresse prologue domine dominus noster quam admirabile est nomen tuum vniuersa terra lorde lorde thy name maruaylous thys wyde worlde ysprad thy lande precious parfourmed men dygnite mouth chyldren thy bounte parfourmed brest soukynge sometyme shewen thyne heryenge wherfore laude best may whyte lylly floure whych bare mayde alway tellen storye wol laboure nought may encrese honoure selfe honoure rote bountye nexte sonne soules bote mother mayden mayden mother fre bushe vnbrent brennyng moses syght rauyshedest downe fro deyte thyn hublesse ye gost yt light whose vertue whe thine hert pight conceyued father sapience helpe tel thy presence lady thy bounte thy magnifycence thy vertue thy great humilite may tonge expresse science somtyme lady er men pray thou goest thy benignyte gettest v ye lyght thy prayere gyden v vnto thy sonne dere connyng weake blysful quene declare thy hygh worthynesse ne may weyght sustene child twelue moneth olde lesse vnnethes worde expresse ryght fare therfore praye gydeth songe shal say phere endeth prioress prologue foloweth tale asye great cytie amonges christen folkes iewrye sustayned lorde countre foule vsure lucre villany hateful christ hys company ye strete myght ryde wede free open euery ende lytel schole christen folke stode downe ye farther end ther chyldren hepe comen christen blode lerned schole yere yere suche manere doctrine men vsen thys saye synge rede smale chyldren done chyldhede amoges childre wedowes son lytel clergion vij yere age daye daye schole hys also eke sey ymage christes mother vsage hym taught knele adowne say aue maria goeth way thus hath wedow litel child icauyt blyssed lady christes mother dere worshyp aye foryate naught sely chylde wolde al day soone lere aye whe remebre thys matere saint nicholas stadeth euer presence yonge christ dyd reuerence thys lytel chylde hys lytel boke lernyng sate schole hys prymere alma redemptoris mater herde synge chyldren lered antiphonere durst drewe aye nere nece herkened wordes note tyl fyrst verse couth al rote nought wyst latin say yonge tender age daye hys felowe gan pray expoune hym songe langage tellen thys songe vsage thys prayde hym constre declare ful ofte tyme vpon hys knee bare hys felowe whych elder answerd hym thus thys song haue herde say made blessed lady free salewe eke prey ben helpe socoure dey erpowne thys mater lerne songe smal grammer thys songe ymade reuerence christes mother sayd thys innocent nowe certes wol done diligence tonne al er christmasse went though primer shalbe shent shulde beten thryse houre wol conne lady honoure hys felowe taught homewarde priuely fro daye daye tyl couth rote songe wel boldely fro worde worde accordynge note twyse day passeth hys throte scholewarde homeward whe went christes mother set al hys entent haue sayd iewrie thys lytel chylde came fro ful merely wolde synge crye alma redemptoris mater euer mo swetnesse hath hys herte persed christes mother praye stynte syngynge waye fyrst foe serpent sathanas iewes herte hys waspes nest vpswale sayd brake people ala thys thynge honest boy shal walke hym lest dyspyte syngen sentence whych ayenst lawes reuerence pfrom thence forth ye iewes han conspyred thys innocent thys worlde chase homicide therto han hyred aley priuy place chylde gan forby pace thys cursed iewe hym hent helde fast cutte hys throte pytte hym caste say wardrope threwe iewes purged intrayle cursed folke heraudes al newe may yuel entent auayle murther wol certes wol fayle namely ther ye honour god shalsprede bloode cryeth cursed dede po mater sowned vnto virginite mayst thou synge folowyng euer whyte lambe celestial whiche great euangelyst saynt iohn pathmos wrot whiche sayth yt gon lambe synge asonge newe neuer flesshly woman ne knewe pthis poore wydowe awayteh al yt nyght lytel childe came nought whiche sone day lyght face pale drede besy thought hath schole el hym sought tyl fynally gan farre aspye laste seyne iurye wyth mother pyte breste enclosed goth halfe mynd euery place hath supposed lyklyhede childe fynde euer christes mother meke kynde cryed last thus wrought amonge cursed iewes hym sought freyneth prayeth pytously euery iewe dwelleth thylke place tellen yf chylde went sayd nay iesu hys grace yaue thought wythin lytel space place sonne cryde cast pyt besyde great god perfourmest thy laude mouth innocence lo thy myght thys iemme chastite thys emeraude eke martyrdome rubye bryght wyth throte yeorne lay vpryght alma redemptoris gan synge loude al place gan rynge christen folke yt ye strete wet comen wonder thys thynge hastely prouoste sent came anone wythout taryenge heryeth christ heuen kynge eke hys mother honour mankynde iewes let bynde thys chylde wyth pytous lamentacion vptaken syngyng songe alway wyth honoure great processyon caryen hym next abbey hys mother swounyng bere lay vnneth myght people thys newe rachel bringe fro bere turmet shamful deth ilke one thys prouost doth iewes sterue thys murder wyste anone nolde suche cursednesse obserue yuel shal haue yuel wol deserue therfore wt wylde horse dyd hem drawe afterwarde honge hem lawe vpon hys bere aye lyeth thys innocent beforne chefe aulter whyles ye masse last abbot wyth hys couent hem spedde burye hym al fast holy water hym cast yet spake ye child whe spreit holy water songe alma redemptoris mater thys abbot whych holy man monkes ben el ought yonge chylde couer began sayd dere chylde haylfe vertue holy trinite tel thy cause synge sythens thy throte cutte semynge throte cutte vnto necke bone sayd thys chylde waye kynde shulde haue deyde ye longe tyme agone iesu christ ye bokes fynde wol hys glorye laste mynde worshyp hys mother dere yet may synge alma loude clere wel mercy christes mother swete loued alway connynge lyfe shulde forlete came bad synge thys antem verely dyenge ye han herde songe thought layde grayne vpo toge wherfore synge synge mote certayne honoure blysfull mayden fre tyl fro tonge taken grayne thus sayd lytell chylde nowe wol fetche grayne fro thy tonge ytake agaste wol forsake thys holy monke thys abbot mene hys tonge caught toke away ye graine yaue vp goste ful softly thys abbot thys woder seyne hys salt teeres trykled downe rayne grofe fell al platte grounde styll laye ben ybounde couent lay eke vpon pament wepyng heryeng christes mother dere rysen forthe ben went toke away martyr fro bere tombe marble stone clere enclosen lytel body swete nowe god lene v mete yonge hewe lyncoln slayne also cursed iewes notable lytel whyle ago pray eke v synful folke vnstable hys mercy god merciable v hys great mercy multiply reuerence mother mary phere endeth prioresse tale folowe wordes host chaucer whan sayde thys myracle euery man sobre woder se tyll oure hoste iapen began erste loked vpon sayd thus man arte thou thou lokest thou woldest fynde hare euer vpon grounde se stare aproche nere loke vp merily ware syrs let haue place wast shapen wel popet armes enbrace woman smal fayre face semeth eluyshe countenaunce vnto wight dothe dalyaunce say sowhat sithes folke ha sayd tel v tale myrthe anon hoste ne yuel apayde tale certes none ryme lerned yore agone yea good shullen som daynte thing thinketh thy chere phere endeth wordes host foloweth ryme syr thopas lysteneth lordinges good intet wol tel verament myrth solas al knight fayre gent batayle turnament hys name syr thopas iborne farre countre flaundres al beyonde see poperynge place hys father man ful fre lorde countre goddes grace syr thopas doughty swayne whyte hys face payne mayne hys lyppes reed rose hys rudde lyke scarlet grayne tell good certayne semely nose hys heer hys berde lyke safroun hys gyrdel raught adoun hys shone cordewane bruges hys hosen broun hys robe chekelatoun coste many iane couth hunte wylde dere ryde haukynge forby ryuere wyth gray goshauke hande therto good archere wrastlynge none hys pere ram shulde stande full many mayde bryght houre mourne hym paramoure hem bet slepe chaste lechoure swete bramble floure beareth reed hype byfel vpon daye forsoth tel maye syr thopas wolde ryde worth vpon hys stede graye hys honde launce gaye longe sworde hys syde prycketh thorowe fayre foreste therin many wylde beest yea bucke hare prycketh north este tell hym almeste betydde sorye care spryngen herbes great smale lycores setuale many clowe gelofer nutmygges put ale whether newe stale lye cofer byrdes syngen naye sperhauke popyngaye ioye throstell eke made hys lay wodcocke vpon spray songe full loude clere psyr thopas fyl loue longynge herde throstel synge prycked wode hys fayre stede hys pryckynge swette men myght hym wrynge hys sydes blode psyr thopas eke wery prickynge softe gras fyers hys corage downe layde hym place maken hys stede solace gaue good forage poh saynt mary benedicite ayleth thys loue blynde sore dremed al thys nyght parde elfe quene shal lemman slepe vnder gore pan elfe quene wol loue ywys thys worlde woman worthy make towne woman forsake elfe quene betake dale eke downe pinto hys sadell clombe anone pricketh ouer style stone elfe quene espye tyll longe hath rydden gone fonde pryue wone countre fayrie wylde countre na none neyther wyfe ne chylde tyl hym came great giaunt hys name called syr oliphaunt peryllous man dede sayd chylde termagaunt yf thou prycke haunt anone slee thy steed wyth mace euer go thys place phere quene fayry wyth harpe pype symphony dwellynge thys place chylde sayd al mote morowe wol meten whan haue myne armure yet hope par faye thou shalte launce gay abyen ful sore thy mawe shal perce yf maye fully prime daye thou shalt slawe sir thopas drowe abacke ful faste gyaunt hym stone caste fel staste slynge fayre escaped sir thopace al goddes grace thorowe hys fayre beryng pyet lysteneth lordynges tale meryer nyghtyngale nowe wol ye rowne howe sir thopas sydes smale prickyng ouer downe dale comen ayen towne hys mery man commaunded maken hym bothe game gle nedes muste fyght gyaunt heedes thre paramoures tolyte one shone ful bright come sayd mynstrales iestours tellen v tale anon myne armyng romaunces ben royal pope cardynals eke loue longyng fette hym fyrst swete wyne meede eke mazelyne royal spycerye gynger breed ful fyne lycores eke comyne wyth sugre trye dyd nexte hys whyte lere clothe lake fyne clere breche eke sherte next sherte ha ton ouer haberion percyng hys herte ouer fyne hauberke al ywrought iewes werke ful stronge plate ouer hys core armoure whyte lylly floure whiche wolde debate shylde al golde reed therin bore heed carbocle syde swore ale breed howe gyaunt shulde deed betyde betyde tambeux cure buly swordes shethe yuorie helme laton bright sadel ruel bone bridel sunne shoue moone light spere fyne sypres byddeth warre nothyng pee heed ful sharpe ygrounde stede al dappel gray gothe aumble way ful softely rounde londe plo lordes myne fyt ye wol tellen wol fonde nowe holde mouthe cha rite bothe knight lady fre herkeneth spel batayle cheualrye ladyes loue diery anon wol tel men sp ken romaunces pris hornechilde potys beuys syr gye syr lybeaur blayndamoure sir thopas bereth floure royal cheualrye good stede strode forthe vpon way glode sparke bronde vpon creste bare toure therin stycked lilly floure god shylde cors fro shonde knyght auentrouse nolde slepen none house lygge hood bright helme hys wangre hym fedde hys destper herbes fyne good hym selfe dronke water well dyd knight sir persyuel worthy vnder wede phere endeth ryme syr thopas beginneth wordes oure hoste thys goddes dignite hoost thou makest wery thy leudenesse also wysly god soule blesse myne eares aken thy drafty speche nowe suche ryme dyuell beteche thys may wel cleped ryme dogrel wolt thou let tale man sen best ryme god playnly worde thy drafty rymynge worth torde thou doest nought el spendest tyme syr one worde thou shalt leger ryme let se whether thou canst tell ought geste tel prose somwhat leste ther may som myrth doctrine gladly goddes swete pyne woll tell lytell thynge prose ought lyke suppose el ye certes daungerous morall tale vertuous albe tolde somtyme sondry wyse sondrye folke shall deuyse thus ye wote euery euangelyste telleth v payne iesu christe ne sayth al thynge hys felowe doth nathelesse sentente al soth al accorden sentence al tellynge dyfference hem sayne lesse hys pytouse passion expresse meane marke mathen luke iohn doutlesse sentence al one therfore lordynges beseche yf ye thynke vary speche thus though tell somwl prouerbes ye han herde byfore comprehended thys lytel treatyse enforcen wyth effecte matere though wordes saye ye han herde yet praye blameth sentence sul ye fynde mochel dyfference fro sentence thys treatyse lyte whych thys mery tale wryte therfore herkeneth shall saye let tell tale praye phere ende wordes host begynneth chaucer tale melibeus yonge called melibeus myghtye ryche begat vpon hys wyfe called prudence doughter called sophye pvpon daye byfell dysport wente feldes hym playe hys wyfe eke hys doughter hath left hys house whyche dores faste yshette foure hys olde foe han aspyde sette ladder walles hys house wyndowes ben entred bete wyfe wounded hys doughter fyue mortall woundes fyue sondrye place saye fete handes eeres nose mouth leften deed wente waye melibeus retourned hys house se thys myschefe lyke madde rentyng hys clothes gan wepe crye prudence hys wyfe ferforth durste besought hym hys wepynge stynte thy gan wepe crye euer lenger thys noble wyfe prudence remembred vpon sentence ouyde hys boke cleped remedye loue sayeth foole dystourbeth mother wepe death chylde tyl haue wept fyll certayne tyme shall man done diligence wyth amiable wordes recomforte praye wepynge stynte whych reason thys noble wyfe prudence suffred husbonde wepe crye certayne space sawe tyme sayd hym thys wyse ala lorde quoth make ye selfe like foole forsoth apperteyneth vnto wyse man maken suche sorowe youre doughter wyth grace god shall waryshe escape ryght deed ye ne oughte death selfe distroye seneke saythe wyse man shal take gret discomforte dethe hys child certes shuld suffre paciece wel abydeth ye deth hys owne proper person pthys mellebeus answerde anon sayd man shuld hys wepynge stynt hath great cause wepe iesus hym selfe lorde wepte ye dethe lazarus hys frende prudence answerd certes wel wote temperate wepynge nothyng defended hym sorouful amonge folke sorowe rather grau ted hym wepe apostel poule vnto ye roman writeth men shuld reioyce maketh ioye wepe suche folke wepen though temperate wepyng graunted certes outragyous wepynge defended mesure wepyng shulde cosydred lore techeth v sencke whan thy frende deed let thyne eyen moist ben teeres ne moch drie although teeres comen thyn eyen let hem fal whan thou hast forgon thy frende diligence gette nother frende wisdom tha wepe thy frende thou hast lorne therin bote therfor yf ye gouerne sapience put away sorowe herte remembreth iesus sirake sayth man ioyus glad herte conserueth storishyng hys age sothely sorowful maketh hys bone drie sayth eke thus sorowe herte sleeth ful manye man salomon sayth right moughthes shepes sleyse anoyeth clothes smale wormes yt tree ryght anoyeth sorowe hert man wherfore v ought wel dethe child losse temporal goodes haue pacience remembre vpon pacient iobe wha loste hys child hys temporal substaunce hys body endured receyued ful many greuous trybulacion yet sayde thus oure lorde sent oure lorde hath byrafte right lorde wold right done iblessed name lorde forsayd thinges melibeus vnto hys wyfe prudence answerd al thy wordes ben true therto profytable truely myn herte troubled sorow greuously let cal prudence youre true frendes al thy lynage ben wyse telleth hem case herkeneth say counsaylyng gouerne sentence salomon saythe werke thy thynges counsayle thou shalte neuer rue cousayle wife prudece melibeus let caule great congrygacion people surgyens physicions olde folke yong hys olde enemyes reconciled semblant hys loue hys grace therwithal ther came neighbour dyd hym reuerece drede tha loue happeth oft comen also ful many subtyl flaterers wyse aduocates lerned law wha folke togyders assembled melibeus sorowfull wyse shewed hem case maner speche semed herte bare cruel yre redy vengeaunce vpon hys foos sodainly desyred yt e shulde begyn nathelesse yet asked counsayle vpon mater surgyen lycence assent suche wyse vp rose vnto melibeus sayd ye shal psir v surgiens apertayneth euery wight best ben withholde pacient damage wherfore happeth many tyme ofte whan two men haue eueriche wounded one surgyen healeth hem wherfore vnto oure arte pertinet norishe werre ne party supporte certes warysshyng doughter al perilously wounded shal tentyfe besynesse fro day night ye grace god shal ben hole sounde sont possible almost right wyse physiciens answerd saue sayde fewe wordes ryght malady ben contrary cured right shal man warisshe werre peace hys neyghbours full enuye hys fayned frendes semed reconciled flatterer maden semblauce wepyng enpayred agrutched moche mater praysinge greatly melibe might power richesse frendes dispysing power aduersaries sayd vtterly anon shulde wreken hym hys foos begyn warre vp rose aduocat wyse byleue counsayle wyse sayd nede whych bene assembled thys place full heuye thynge great mater bycause ye wronge wyckednesse hath done eke reason great damage tyme commynge ben possyble fallen ye eke reason great rychesse power partyes whyche reason full greate peryll erren thys matter wherfore melibeus thys oure sentence counsayle abouen thynge ryghte anone thou thy delygence kepynge thy proper persone suche wyse thou ne wante none espye ne watche thy bodye saue counsayle thyne house thou et suffyciet garryson may well thy bodye thy house defende certes mouen warre done sodeynly vengeauce maye deme lytel tyme yt profytable wherfore aske leyser space haue delyberacion thys case deme commen prouerbe sayeth thus sone demeth sone shall repente eke men sayne thylke iudge wyse sone vnderstandeth matter iugeth leyser taryenge noyfull algate reproued yeuynge iudgemente ne vengeaunce takynge sufficyent resonable shewed oure lorde iesu christe ensample woman take auoutry brought hys presens knowen shulde done persone al wyst wel hym self wold answere yet ne wold answere sodeynly wolde haue delyberacion grounde wrote twyse thys cause asken delyberation shall grace god cousayle yt thynge shalbe profytable vp sterte yonge folke one ye moste parte company haue scorned thys olde wyse man bega make noyse sayde ryght whyles yron hote men shulde smyte ryghte men shulde wreken wronges whyle bene freshe newe wyth loude voyce tryed warre warre vp rose tho one ye old wyse wyth hys hande made coutenaunce shulde holde hem styl yeuen hym audience lordynges ther ful many man cryeth warre warre ye wote full lyte warre amounteth warre hys begynnynge hath great entryng large euery wyght may entre whe hym liketh lightly fynd warre certes ende therof shal fal lightly know ye warre one bygon full many chylde vnborne hys mother yt shal sterue yoge bycause thilke warre el lyue sorowe dye wretchednesse therfore yt warre bygon men muste haue great counsayle good delyberation thys olde man wende enforcen hys tale reson well nye one bygon ryse breken hys tale bydde ful ofte hys wordes abrege certes yt precheth hem lyst wordes sermo hem anoyeth iesus syrake sayth yt weping musyke noyous thynge moch say moch auayleth speake byforne folke speche anoyeth syngen byforne hem wepe thys wyse man sawe yt wated audiece al shamfaste set adowne ayen salomo sayth thou mayst haue audience enforce speake se wel thys wyse man comen prouerbe soth yt good counsayle wanteth moste nede yet thys melibeus hys counsayle many folke priuely hys eere counsayled hym certayne thynges counsayled hym contrary general audience melibeus herde greatest parte hys counsayle accorded shuld make warre anone consented cou saylynge fully affyrmed sentence dame prudence sawe husbonde shope hym awreke hym hys enemyes begyn warre ful huble wyse sawe tyme sayd hym wordes lord seche hertely dare ne hast fast guerdon yeue audiece peter alphos sayth doth good harme hast quyte thys wyse thy frende woll abyde thyne enemye shall lenger lyue drede prouerbe sayth hasteth wel yt wisely abyde wycked hast profyte thys melibe answered hys wyfe prudence purpose quoth werke thy counsayle many cause reason certes euery wyght wolde holde foole thys saye yf thy counsaylynge wolde chaunge thynges bene ordayned affyrmed many wyse secondly saye woman bene wycked none good hem thousande men sayeth salomon founde one good man certes woman foude neuer none also certes yf gouerned thy counsayle shulde seme yeue ouer maystrye god forbyd yt iesus syracke sayeth yf wyfe haue maystrye contrarious husbande salomon sayeth neuer thy lyfe thy wyfe ne thy chylde ne thy frende ne yeue power ouer thy selfe better thy chyldren aske thy thinges hem nedeth thy selfe handes thy chyldren also yf woll werche thy cousayle certes counsayle must somtyme secret til tyme muste knowen thys ne maye yf shulde counsayled dame prudence full debonairly great paciece herde al husbonde lyked saye asked hym lycence speake sayd thys wyse lorde quoth youre fyrste reason maye lyghtly ben answered saye folye chaunge counsayle thynge chaunged el ye thynge semeth otherwyse semed afore ouer saye thoughe ye haue sworne behyght performe youre empryse iuste cause ye men shulde saye therfore ye lyer forsworne boke sayeth wyse man maketh lesynge turneth hys corage better albeit empryse establyshed ordeyned great multytude folke yet dare accomplyshe thylke ordynaunce lyketh trouth thynges profyte ben rather founden fewe folke ben wyse full reason greate multytude folke euery man cryeth clattereth hym lyketh sothly suche multytude honest seconde reason ye saye wome ben wycked saue grace certes ye dyspyse woman thys wyse despyseth sayeth boke dyspleaseth senecke sayeth woll haue sapience shal man dysprayse shall gladlye teache science wythout presumption pryde suche thynges nought ne shall ben ashamed lerne hem enquyre lesse folke hym selfe hath bene many good woman maye lyghtly proued certes syr lorde iesu christ nolde neuer haue descended borne woman yf al wome wycked ye great bounte wome lorde iesu christ whe rysen fro death lyfe apered rather woma apostle though salomon sayde founde neuer woman good foloweth therfore woman wycked thoughe ne founde good woman certes many man hathe founde many woman full good trewe el parauenture entente salomon thys souerayne bountye founde woman thys saye wyght hath parfyte bountye saue god alone hym selfe recordeth hys euangelye ny creature good hym ne wanteth somwhat perfection god hys maker youre thyrde reason thys ye saye yf yt gouerne counsayle shulde seme ye yeue maystrye lordshyppe youre persone syr saue youre grace yf man shulde counsayled onely hem han lordshyppe maystrye hys persone men nolde counsayled ofte sothly thylke man asketh counsayle purpose yet hathe free wyl whether woll counsayle none fourth reason ye sayne ianglerye woman hyde thinges wote sayeth woman hide wote syr wordes ben vnderstande woman ben ianglers wycked woman men sayne thre thynges dryuen hys house saye smoke droppynge rayne wycked wyues suche woman salomon sayeth man better dwell deserte wyth woman riottous syr leaue ye haue ful oft assayde great sylence greate pacience eke howe well hyde heale thynges men oughten secretly hyden sothly youre fyfth reason ye saye wycked counsayle woman venquyshe men god wote thylke reason stante stede vnderstandeth nowe ye asken counsayle wyckednesse yf ye wolde werken wyckednesse wyfe restrayneth thylke wycked purpose ouercome reason good counsayle certes wyfe oughte rather praysed blamed thus shuld ye vnderstande philosopher sayeth wycked counsayle woman venquyshe husbandes ye blame woman reason shall shewe many ensamples manye woman haue full good yet bene counsayle holsome profytable eke men haue sayde counsayle woman eyther dere lytell worthe full many woman bene badde counsayle vyle noughte worthe yet han men foude full many good woman full dyscrete wyse counsaylynge lo iacob counsayle hys mother rebecke wanne benyson hys father ye lordshyp hys brother iudith good counsayle delyuered cyte bethule whyche dwelt hade holoferne al beseged wolde haue dystroyed abigayle delyuered naball husbande fro dauid kynge wold haue slayne apeased yre kynge wyte good counsayle hester cou sell enhaunsed greatly ye people god raygne assuerus kynge bountye good cousaylyng many good woman may men rede tell furthermore lorde created adam oure former father sayd thys wyse good man alone make helper hym selfe semblable maye ye se yf woman good counsayle good profytable lorde god heuen ne wolde neither han wrought hem ne called hem helper man rather confusyon man sayde clerke one two verse better gold iasper better iasper wysedome better wysedome woma better good woman good man better good man nothynge syr many reason maye ye sene many woman bene good eke counsayle good profytable therfore syr yf ye woll truste counsayle shall restore doughter hole sounde eke woll moche ye shall haue honoure thys case melibe herde wordes hys wyfe prudence sayd thus se well wordes salomon soth sayeth wordes spoken dyscretlye ordynaunce bene honycombes yuen swetnesse soule holsomnesse bodye wyfe bycause thy swete wordes eke haue proued assayed thy greate sapience thy greate trouthe woll gouerne thy counsayle thynge nowe syr quoth dame prudence sythens ye vouchsafe gouerned counsayle woll enfourme howe ye shall gouerne youre selfe chosynge counsaylours ye shall fyrste youre werke mekelye besechynge hye god wolde counsaylour shapeth suche entent yeue counsayle comforte taught thobye hys sonne tymes thou shalte blysse god praye hym dresse thy wayes loke eke thy counsayles ben hym euer saynt iames sayeth yf anye man haue nede sapience aske god afterwarde shullen ye take counsayle youre selfe examyne well youre owne thoughtes suche thynges thynketh ben best youre profyte shall ye dryue fro herte thynges cotrarious good cousayle saye yre couetous hastynesse fyrste asketh counsayle hym selfe certes muste wythouten yre wrath hym self many cause fyrst thys hath greate yre wrathe selfe weneth alwaye maye thynge yt may secodly yrous wrothfull maye wel deme maye wel deme maye well counsell thyrde thys yrous wroth sayeth seneke maye speake blamefull thynges wyth thylke vycious wordes styreth folke anger yre eke syr ye muste dryue couetyse herte apostle sayeth couetyse roote harmes trusteth ryght wel couetous man ne deme ne thynke fulfyll ende hys couetyse certes ne maye neuer accomplyshed euermore aboudaunce hath rychesses desyreth syr ye muste also dryue herte hastynes certes ye maye deme best dayne thought falleth herte ye muste auyse full ofte ye haue herde byfore come prouerbe thys sone demeth sone repenteth syr ye ne alwaye lyke dysposicion certes thynge semeth somtyme yt good time semeth contrarye ye han taken counsaile selfe han demed good delyberacion suche thynge semeth beste rede ye kepe secrete bewraye ye counsayl persone yf ye wene sekerly youre bewrayeng codicion shalbe profytable iesus syrack sayeth neyther thy foe ne thy frende dyscouer thy secrete ne thy folye wol yeue audience lokynge supportacion youre presence scorne absence clerke sayth scarsly shal fynde persone maye kepe cousayle secretly boke sayeth whyle thou kepest thy counsayle thyne herte thou kepest thy pryson thou bewrayest thy counsayl wyght holdeth yt hys snare therfore better hyde cou sayle herte pray hym ye haue bewrayed counsayle yt woll kepe close styl seneca sayth yf yt thou mayst thyne owne counsayle hyde howe darste thou praye wight thy counsayle secrete kepe nathelesse yf thou wene sykerly bewrayeng thy counsayle persone woll make thy condycion stonde ye better plyght shalt thou tell hym thy counsayle thys wyse fyrst thou shalte make semblaunt whether leuer peace warre thys ne shewe hym thy wyll ne thyne entent trust well comenly cousaylers ben flatterer namely counsaylers greate lordes enforce hem alway rather speake pleasaunt wordes enclynynge lordes luste wordes bene trewe profytable therfore men saye yt rych man hath selde good cousayle yf haue hym selfe thou shalt consyder thy frendes thyne enemyes touchynge thy frendes thou shalte consyder whych hem ben moste faythful wyse eldest moste approued cou saylynge hem shalt thou aske thy cou sayle case requyreth saye fyrst ye shal call counsayle frendes ben trewe salomon sayeth ryght herte man delyteth sauoure sote ryght counsayle trewe frendes yeueth swetnesse soule sayeth also may thynge lykened trewe frede certes golde ne syluer moche worth good wyll trewe frende also sayeth trewe frende stronge defece fyndeth hath great treasure shall ye also consyder yf true frendes dyscrete wyse boke sayeth aske alwaye thy counsayle ben wyse thys reason shall ye call counsayle frendes ben age suche seme ben experte many thynges ben approued cousaylyng boke sayeth olde men sapience longe tyme prudence tullius sayeth great thynges bene aye accomplyshed strength ne delyuernesse body cousayle auctorite persones science whych thre thinges ne ben feoble age certes enforce encrease daye daye shall ye kepe thys generall rule fyrste shall ye call counsayle fewe frendes ben especial salomon sayeth many frendes haue thou amonge thousande chose one thy cousaylour al thou fyrst ne tell thy counsayle fewe thou mayste afterwarde tel mo folke yf nede loke alway thy counsaylers haue condicions haue sayd saye trewe wyse olde experience werke alway euery nede one counsayler alone somtyme behoueth counsayled many salomon saythe saluacio thynges many counsaylers pnowe haue tolde folke ye shall counsayled nowe wol tel whiche counsayle ye ought eschue fyrste ye shall eschue counsaylynge fooles salomon sayth take counsayle foole wol counsayle owne lust hys affection boke saythe propertie foole troweth lightly harme euery man lightly troweth al bountie selfe thou shalt eschue counsaylyng al flatterer enforce hem rather prayse persone slatterye tell sothfastnesse thynges wherfore tullius saith amonge al pestelencie ben frendshyp greatest flaterye therfore nede thou eschue drede flaterers tha people boke sayth thou shalt rather flee fro swete wordes flatering praysynge fro eygre wordes thy frendes sayth sothes salomon sayth wordes flaterer snare catche innocence sayth also speketh frende wordes flatery plesaunce setteth nette beforne hys fete catche hym therfore tullius sayth enclyne thyne eares flatterer caton saythe auyse wel eschue ye wordes swetnesse pleasaunce eke thou shalt eschue counsaylynge thyne olde enemyes ben reconciled boke saythe wight retourneth safely grace olde enemy esope saith ne trust hem whiche thou hast somtyme werre enemyte ne tell hem thy counsayle seneke telleth cause may saith great fyre hath longe tyme endured yt dwelleth vapoure hete therfore saith salomon thyn olde foe trust thou neuer sikerly though thy enemy reconciled make sygne humilite lout hys heed truste hym neuer certes maketh thilke fayned humylite hys profyte humilite loue thy person bycause yt demeth haue victorie ouer thy persone suche fayned countynaunce whych vyctorie myght haue stryfe werre petrus alphons saith make felowship thyne olde enemyes yf thou hem bountye wollen peruerte wyckednesse eke thou must eschue counsaylynge hem ben thy seruauntes beren ye gret reuerence parauenture sayen drede loue therfore saythe philosopher wyse wyght parfetly true hym yt dredeth tullius saith might great emperour longe may endure haue loue people drede ye shall eschue also counsaylyng folke ben dronklewe ne cousayle hyde salomon saythe ny priuyte ther reygneth dronknesse ye shal haue also suspecte counsaylyng suche folke counsayle one thynge priuely counsayle contrary openly cassidorie saith maner sleight hynder enemye whan sheweth done thynge openly werketh priuely contrarye thou shalte haue also suspecte counsaylyng wycked folke alway ful fraude dauid saythe blisful man hath folowed counsaylyng shrewes thou shalte also eschue counsaylynge yonge folke counsaylynge rype salomon saythe pnowe sir sythens haue shewed suche folke ye shal counsayled folowe nowe woll teche howe ye shal examyne counsayle doctryne tullius examenynge youre counsayloures ye shall consydere manye thynges fyrst thou shalt cosyder thylke thyng thou purposest vpon thynge yt thou wolt haue counsayle trouth said coserued say tel truely thy tale sayth false may well counsayled case whiche lyeth thou shalte consyder thynges acorden thou purposest thy cousaylours reason accorde therto eke yf thy might maye attayne therto parte better parte counsaylours accorden therto shalte thou consyder thynge shal folowe cousaylinge hate peace werre grace profyte damage many thinges al thynges thou shalte chose beste weyue al thynges tha shalt thou consyder rote engendred mater thy counsayle fruite maye conceyue engender thou shalt eke consyder al thy cause frome whence spronge whan thou hast examyned thy counsayle haue sayd whiche party better profytable haste approued many wyse folke olde thou shalt consyder yf thou mayste performe make good ende certes reson wol shal begyn thyng yf myght performe hym ought ne wight shuld take vpon hym heuy charge might beare prouerbe sayth moch enbraceth distrayneth lytel caton saythe assay thinges thou haste power done leste charge oppresse sore behoueth weyue thyng thou haste begon yf thou dout whether thou mayst perfourme thynge none chose rather suffre begynne peter alphons saythe yf thou haste myght thynge whiche thou muste repente better holde thy tonge styl speke mayst thou vnderstonde stronger resons yf thou haste power perfourme werke thou shalt repente better thou suffre begyn wel sayne defenden euery wyght assaye thyng doute whether may performe none whan ye haue examined counsayle haue sayde know wel ye maye performe emprise conferme tha sadly tyl ende pnowe reason tyme shewe whan wherfore ye maye chaunge counsayle wythouten reprofe sothly man may chaunge hys purpose hys counsayle yf cause ceaseth whan newe case betydeth lawe sayth vpon thinges newly betyden behoueth newe counsayle seneke saythe yf thy counsayle come eeres thyne enemyes chaunge thy counsayle thou mayste also chaunge thy cousayle yf thou fynde errour anye cause harme damage may betyde also yf thy counsayle dyshonest el come dyshonest cause chaunge thy counsayle lawe saythe al behestes dishonest ne ben value eke yf vnpossyble may gladly parformed kepte take thys general rule euery counsayle enfourmed strongly may chaunged condycion may betyde say ilke counsayle wycked melibeus whan hadde herde doctryne hys wife dame prudece answerde thys wyse dame yet vnto tyme ye han well taught gouernayle howe shall gouerne chosynge wytholdynge counsayle nowe wolde fayne yt ye wolde condiscende especial howe ye semeth counsaylours haue chose present nede pmy lorde beseche humblesse ye wol wylfully replye ayenst reason ne distemper youre herte though speke thynge yt displese god wote myne entent speke beste honoure profyte eke sothly hope benygnyte wol take pacience trusteth wel counsayle case ne shuld speke properly called counsaylyng mocion mouynge folye counsayle ye haue erred many sondrie wyse fyrst ye haue erred assemblynge counsaylours fyrst ye shulde haue cleped fewe folke counsayle ye might haue shewed mo yf nede ye haue cleped counsayl great multytude people ful chargeous ful noyous also ye haue erred ye shulde haue onely cleped counsayle trewe frendes olde wyse ye haue cleped straunge folke yonge folke false flatterer enemyes reconcyled folke done reuerece withouten loue eke ye haue erred ye haue brought counsayle ire couetyse hastynesse thre thynges ben contrary euerye good counsayle honest profytable whiche thre thynges ye haue distroyed neyther youre selfe e counsaylours ye ought ye haue erred also ye haue shewed counsaylours talent affectios make werre anon vengeaunce haue espyde wordes thyng ye ben enclyned therfore haue rather counsayled talente profite ye han erred eke semeth suffyseth haue counsayled counsailours onely lytel auysement hye great nede ben necessary mo counsaylours delyberacion performe emprise ye ha erred also ye haue examyned counsayle forsayd mater ne dewe maner case requireth ye haue erred also ye made diuision bytwene true frendes fayned cousaylours ne ye haue knowe ye wil trew cou saylours frendes olde wyse ye haue caste al wordes hochepot encyned herte parte gretter nombre fooles wyse men therfore counsaylynges ben congregacions multitude folke men take regarde nomber sapiece person ye sene wel counsaylinges fooles han maistrye melibe answerde sayd ayen graunt wel haue erred thou hast tolde byforne yt ny blame chaungeth cousayle certayne case certayne iuste cause al redy chaunge counsaylours ryght thou woldest deuyse prouerbe saythe done synne mannysshe certes perceuer longe synne werke dyuell thys sentence answereth anon dame prudence sayd examyneth wel counsayle let v se whyche hem hath spoke moste resonably taught beste counsayle moche examinacion necessarye lette v begyn surgens physiciens fyrst spake thys mater saye physiciens surgiens haue sayd counsayle discretly hem ought speche sayd ful wisely office hem apertayneth done euery wight honoure profyte wyght anoye crafte great dyligence vnto cure hem whych haue gouernaunce sir right haue answerde wysely discretly right rede ben hyely soueraynly guerdoned noble speche eke shul done theyr ententyfe besynesse curacion doughter al ben frendes therfore shulle ye suffre serue naught ye ought therafter guerdo hem pay hem largesse touchyng proposicion whyche physiciens entreteden case sayne malady contrarie warished co trarie wolde fayne knowe howe ye vnderstonde thylke texte sentence certes melibeus vnderstonde thys wyse right han contrarye shulde done hem ryght han venged hem vpon done wronge ryght woll venge vpon hem hem wronge haue cured one contrarie lo lo dame prudence lightly euery man enclyned hys owne desyre hys owne plesaunce certes wordes physiciens ne shuld ben vnderstonde wyse certes wyckednesse contrarie wickednesse ne vengeaunce contrarie vengeaunce ne wronge wronge euery hem encreseth engendreth certes ye wordes phisiciens shulde vnderstonde thys wyse good wyckydnesse ben two contrary peace werre vengeaunce suffraunce discorde acorde many thynges certes wyckidnesse shalbe warished goodnes discorde acorde werre peace forthe thynges therto acordeth saynt poule apostel many place saith ne yeld harme harme ne wicked speche wycked speche wel hem harme blesse sayd harme manye place amonissheth peace acorde nowe wol speke counsayle whiche lyeue vnto men law wyse folke olde folke sayde al one accorde ye herde byforne ouer al thynges ye shal done besynesse dyligence kepe youre person warnstore house sayd also yt thys case ye ought werchenfull wysely great delyberacion syr fyrste poynte toucheth kepynge person ye shall vnderstonde hath werre shal euer deuoutely mekely prayen byforne thynges iesu christ mercy wol haue protection souerayne helper nede certes worlde ny wight maye counsayled ykepte suffyciently without kepynge lord iesu christ thys sentence acordeth prophete dauid sayth god ne kept cyte ydel waketh kepeth nowe sir shulde commytte kepynge person youre true frendes ben approued yknowe hem shul ye aske helpe person kepe caton saith thou haue nede helpe aske thy frendes ny none good physicien thy true frende shal ye kepe fro al straunge folke fro lyers haue alway suspecte co panye peter alphons saythe ne take company way straunge man yf thou haste knowen hym lenger tyme yf fal thy companye parauenture withouten thyn assent good wyl enquire subtelly thou canst conuersacion hys lyfe byforne fayne thy way sayeng thou woldest go thyder thou wolte go yf beare spere hold right syde hym yf beare swerde hold lefte syde hym shal ye kepe wysely maner people haue said byfore hem counsayle eschue shal ye kepe suche maner anye presumpsion bodely strength ye dispyse ne acounte might aduersary lyte ye lete keping person presumpcion euery wyse dredeth enemy salomon saith foole al hath drede certes yt thorowe hardynesse herte hardynesse self hath great presumpcion hym shall yuel betyde shal ye euermore encountrewayte enbushementes espyaile seneke saythe wyse man dredeth harmes escheweth harmes ne falleth perylles peryll escheweth al thou seme yt thou secret place yet shalt thou alway dyligence kepyng thy person say ne neglygent kepe thyne owne person onely thy greatest enemy also thy leste enemy seneke sayth man wel aduysed dredeth leste enemye ouyde saythe lytel wesel wol slee great bulle th wylde herte prouerbe saythe lytel thorne wol greue kyng ful sore lytel hounde wol holde wylde bore nathelesse say thou shalt cowarde thou doute drede boke saythe men haue great luste disceyue yet drede disceyued kepe fro companye skorners boke sayth skorners ne make companye flye wordes venym pnowe seconde poynte wyse counsaylours counsayled warne store youre house greate delygence wolde fayne knowe howe ye vnderstode thylke wordes sentece melibeus answerd sayd certes vnderstonde wyse shal warne store myn house wyth toures suche haue castels maner edyfices armurye archery bitwene thynges maye person house kepe defende myne enemyes shullen drede myne house aproch sentence answerde anon prudence warnishyng hye toures hye edyfices great costages great trauayle whan ben accoplished yet ben worth strawe yf ben defended trew frendes ben olde wyse vnderstondeth wel ye greatest strogest garnyson ryche men maye haue wel kepen parsone goodes yt byloued subiectes neyghbours thus saythe tullius maner garryson man may venquishe ne discomfyte lorde byloued cytezyns people pnowe sir thyrde poynte olde wyse counsaylours sayde ye ought sodainly ne hastely procede nede ye oughten puruayen aparayle case great dylygence delyberacion verily trowe yt sayde right trewly ryght sothe tullius sayth euery dede thou begyn apparayle great dyligence say vengeaunce takyng werre batayle warnestoryng thou begyn rede thou apparayle therto great delyberacio tullius saith longe apparelynge fore batayle maketh shorte victorie cassidorus saith garryson stronger whan longe tyme auysed nowe let v speke counsayle acorded neyghbours suche reuerence withoute loue olde enemyes reconciled flatterer counsayled certayne thynges priuely openly counsayled contrarye yong folke also counsayled venge make werre anon certes syr haue sayde byfore ye haue greatly erred clepe suche maner folke youre counsayle whiche counsaylours ben ynoughe reproued resons forsayd nathelesse let v nowe discende special ye shul fyrste procede doctryne tullius certes trouthe thys mater thys counsayle nedeth dyligently enquire wel wyste ben han done trespas vilanye howe many trespasours maner haue done al thys wronge al vilanye thys shul ye examyne seconde condicion whiche tullius addeth thys mater tullius putteth thyng whiche clepeth consentyng say ben whiche ben howe manye cosenten thy counsayle thy wylfulnesse done hasty vengeaunce let v consyder also ben howe manye ben consented youre aduersaries fyrst poynt wel knowen whiche folke cosented hasty wylfulnesse trewly al tho counsayl maken sodayne werre ne frendes let se nowe whiche ben ye holden greatly fredes person al ye mighty rich certes ye ben alone trewly ye ne haue chyld doughter ne ye haue brethern ne cosyns germayns ne none nye kynrede wherfore enemyes shuld stynte plede ne distroye person ye knowe also youre rychesse mot dispended dyuers party wha euery wight hath parte wollen take lytell regarde venge dethe thyne enemyes ben thre haue manye brethern child cosyns nye kynred though thou haddest slayne hem two thre yet dwelleth ther ynowe auenge dethe slee thy person though kynrede stedfaste syker kyn aduersaryes yet neuer lesse kynrede kynrede ben lytel sybbe kynne enemyes ben nye sybbe hem certes condicion better let v consyder also counsaylynge hem counsayled take sodayne vengeaunce whether acorde reson non certes ye know wel nay ryght reson maye man take vengeaunce wight iuge hath iurisdiction whan graunted hym take vengeaunce hastely attemperatly lawe requireth yet ouer thylke worde tullius clepeth cosentynge thou shalte cosent yf thy might thy power may consente suffyse thy wilfulnesse thy counsaylours certes thou mayste wel saye naye sykerly speke properly may nothyng suche thynge may done ryghtfully certes righfully ye may take vengeaunce propre auctorite maye ye se youre power ne consenteth ne accordeth wylfulnesse nowe let v examyne thyrde poynt tullius clepeth consequence thou shalte vnderstonde vengeaunce yt thou purposest take consequent therof foloweth vengeaunce peryl werre damage withouten nombre whiche ware tyme touchynge fourth poynte yt tullius clepeth engendring thou shalte consyder wrong whiche done engendred ye hate thyne enemyes ye vengeaunce takyng vpon hem wolde engender nother vengeaunce mochel sorowe wastyng rychesse sayde ere nowe sir touchyng fylte poynte tully clepeth cause whiche laste poynte thou shalte vnderstonde wronge thou haste receyued hathe certayne cause whiche clerkes callen orien efficien causa longinqua causa propinqua saye ferre cause nyghe cause ferre cause almyghty god cause al thynges nere cause thre enemyes cause accidental hate cause material ben fyue woundes thy doughter cause formal maner theyr werkynge brought ladder clambe thy wyndowes cause fynal sle thy doughter letted moche speke yu ferre cause ende shulde come fynally shal betyde thys case ne canne deme coniectynge supposynge shall suppose shall come wycked ende bycause boke decree saythe selde wyth greate payne ben cause brought good ende whan ben badly begonne sir yf men wolde aske god suffred men villanye truly wel answere sothfastnesse apostel saythe scyences iugementes lorde god almighty ben ful depe may man comprehende ne serche hem nathelesse certayne presumpcyous coniectynges holde byleue god whyche ful iustyce rightwisnesse hathe suffred thys betyde iuste cause resonable pthy name melibee saye man drinketh hony thou haste dronke moche hony swete temporel rychesses delyces honour worlde thou arte dronke haste forgoten iesu christ thy creatour thou ne haste done hym suche honoure reuerence ought ne thou ne haste taken kepe wordes ouide sayth vnder ye hony goodes thy body hyd venym sleeth thy soule salomon sayth thou hast founde hony eete hony suffyseth yf thou eete ye hony mesure thou shalte spewe also nedy poore parauenture almyghty god iesu christ hath dispyte hathe turned awaye fro hys face eeres myserycorde mercye also hath suffred gyue lycence thou thus shuldest punished chastised ye maner thou haste trespased offended thou hast done synne agaynst lorde christ certes thre enemyes mankynde say fleshe fende worlde thou haste suffred hem entre thyne herte wylfully wyndowes thy body hast defended thy selfe suffyciently agaynst assautes temptacions haue wounded thy soule fyue place shy deedly synnes ben entred thy hert thy fyue wyttes maner oure lorde christ hathe wolde suffred thy thre enemyes entred thy house ye wyndowes haue wounded thy doughter forsayd maner truely melibee se well ye enforce moche wordes ouercome suche maner shall venge myn enemyes shewynge perilles yuels myght fal vengeaunce wolde consyder al vengeaunces peril yuels myght e vengeaunce takyng man wolde neuer take vengeaunce harme ye vengeaunce takynge ben wycked men disceuered good men haue wyll wickednesse restrayn theyr wycked purpose whan se ponishyng chastysyng ye trespasours yet say ryght synguler person synneth takynge vengeaunce nother ryght synneth iuge yf vengeauce hem haue deserued seneke saythe thus mayster saythe good preueth shrewes cassyodor saythe man dredeth outrage whan wote knoweth dyspleaseth iuges soueraynes saythe iuge dredeth ryght maketh men shrewes saynt poule apostle saythe hys epystle whan wryteth vnto romayns iuges beare speere wythout cause beare punyshe shrewes mysdoers defende good men pyf ye woll take vengeaunce enemy ye shul returne haue recourse iuge hath iurisdyction vpon hem shall punyshe hem lawe asketh requyreth ha sayd melibee thys vegeauce lyketh nothynge bethynke nowe take hede howe fortune hathe nouryshed fro childhode hath holpe passe many stronge paas nowe woll assaye trowynge wyth goddes helpe shall helpe shame auenge truely said prudece yf ye wol werke counsayle ye shal assay ne waye ne ye shall lene bowe vnto worde senek thynges bene foolyshlye done bene done hope fortune shal neuer come good ende seneke sayeth clere shynynge fortune brytel soner broke trusteth stedfast ne stable thou trowest moste sure stedfaste helpe woll fayle dysceyue ye saye fortune hath nouryshed fro youre chyldhode saye moche ye shall lesse truste wytte seneke sayeth man noryshed fortune maketh great foole nowe syth ye desyre aske vegeauce vengeaunce done lawe iuge ne lyketh vengeaunce done hope fortune peryllous vncertaine haue ye none remedye haue recourse vnto soueraine iuge vegeth vylanyes wronges shal vege hym selfe wytnesseth sayeth leaue vengeaunce shall melibee answered yf ne venge villany men haue done sommo warne hem haue done vyllanye al vyllanye wrytten yf thou take vengeauce olde vyllany thou somonest thyne aduersaryes newe vyllany also suffrauce men wolde moche vyllany myght neither bere ne sustayne shulde put holden ouer lowe men sayne mykel sufferyng shal many thynges fal vnto thou shalt mowe suffre certes prudence graunt ouer moch suffraunce good yet ne foloweth therof euery persone whome men vyllanye shulde take geaunce appertayneth longeth iuges shulde venge ye vyllanyes iniuryes therfore two authority ye haue sayd afore bene vnderstande iuges suffre ouer moche wroges vyllanyes done wythout punyshment sommon man newe wronges comaunde also wyse man sayeth iuge correcteth ye synner comaundeth byddeth hym synne ye iuges souerayns myght theyr lande moch suffre shrewes mysdoers shulde suffrauce processe tyme wexe power myght shulde put iuges soueraynes fro theyr place laste make hem lese lordshyppes let v suppose ye haue leue venge saye ye myght power nowe venge yf ye woll make comparyson vnto myghte youre aduersaryes ye shulde fynde many thynges haue shewed er thys yt theyr condicyon better therfore saye good nowe ye suffre pacient furthermore ye knowe well comen sawe woodnesse man stryue wyth stronger mighty hym selfe stryue wyth man euen strength saye wyth stronge man peryl stryue wyth weaker man folye therfore shulde man slye stryuynge mykel myght salomon sayeth great worshyppe man kepe hym fro noyse stryfe yf befal happe man greater myght strength thou arte greuauce study besye rather styll greuaunce venge seneke sayeth putteth hym great peryll stryueth wyth greater man hem selfe caton sayth yf man hygher astate degre mighty thou anoye greuaunce suffre hym one hath greued maye tyme releue helpe yet sette case ye haue lycence venge saye ben ful many thynges shal restrayne vengeaunce takyng make enclyne suffre haue pacience wronges haue ben done fyrst formest yf ye wol consyder fautes ben owne person whyche fautes god hath suffred haue trybulacion haue sayd poete saythe ought paciently take trybulacions come v whan thynke consyder haue deserued haue saynt gregorie saythe whan man consydereth wel nombre hys defautes hys synnes paynes trybulacions suffreth seme lesse vnto hym moche thynketh synnes heuy greuous moche semeth payne lighter esyer vnto also ye owe enclyne bowe herte take pacience lorde iesu christ sayth saynt peter epystles iesu christ saythe hath suffred v yeuen ensample euerye man folowe sewe hym dyd neuer synne ne neuer came villaynous worde hys mouthe whan men cursed hym cursed hem whan men bete hym manaced hem also great pacience whyche sayntes ben paradyse haue tribulacyon haue suffred wythout deserte gylte ought moche styrre pacience ferthermore ye shul enforce haue pacience co sydryng trybulacions thys world lytel whyle endure sone passed ben gon ye ioy man seketh haue pacience tribulacions perdurable apostle saythe epystle ioye god sayth perdurable saye euerlastyng also troweth byleueth stedfastly wel nourished wel taught haue pacience wol receyue pacyence salomon saythe doctryne wytte man knowen pacience place sayth pacient gouerneth hym great prudence salomon saythe angry wrathful man maketh noyses pacient attempreth stylleth hem saythe also worth pacient ryght stronge maye haue lordeship owne herte prayse tha force strength taketh great cyties therfore sayth saynt iame hys epystle pacyence great vertue perfectyon certes melibee graunt dame prudence pacience great vertue perfection euerye man maye haue perfection ye seke ne bre ryght perfyte men myn herte may neuer peace vnto tyme auenged al great peryl myne enemyes villanye taking vengeaunce vpon yet toke hede peryl fulfylled wycked wyll corage therfore thynketh men ought repreue though put lytel peryl auenge though great excesse saye venge one outrage pah dame prudence ye say wyl lyketh case worlde man shulde outrage ne excesse venge cassiodor sayth yuel dothe vengeth outrage dothe outrage therfore ye shal venge order right saye lawe excesse ne outrage also yf wol venge outrage aduersaries maner right commaundeth ye synne therfore saythe seneke man shal neuer venge shreudnesse shreudnesse yf ye saye right asketh defende violence violence fightyng fighting certes ye saye soth whan defence done without interual without taryeng delay defende hym venge hym behoueth man put suche attemperauce defence haue cause ne mater repreue yt defendeth hym outrage excesse el agayne reson parde ye knowe wel ye make defence nowe defende venge sheweth ye haue wyll dede attemperatly therfore thynketh pacience good salomon sayeth pacient shall haue great harme certes sayd melibee graut impacient wroth toucheth appertaineth vnto though harme hym wonder lawe sayth culpable entremetleth meteth wyth suche thynges apertayneth vnto hym salomo sayeth entremetleth noyse stryfe another man lyke hym taketh straunge hounde cere ryght taketh strauge houde ye cere whyle bytte ye honde right wyse reason haue harme hys impacience medleth hym noyse man appertayneth vnto hym ye knowe wel thys dede saye grefe dysease toucheth ryght nyghe therfore though wrothe impacient maruayle sauynge youre grace se yt myght greatly harme thoughe toke vengeaunce rycher myghtye myne enemyes well knowe ye money hauynge great possessyons ben thynges thys worlde gouerned salomo sayeth al thynges obey money prudence herde husbande auaunt hym hys rychesse hys money dyspraysynge ye power hys aduersaryes spake sayd thys wyse certes dere syr graunt ye ryche myghty ye rychesse good hem haue well gotten hem well vse hem ryght body man may lyue wythout soule may lyue temporel goodes ryches may man get hym great frendes therfore sayeth pamphillus yf nerthes doughter sayth riche may chefe thousand men whyche woll take husbande thousande one woll forsake ne refuse thys pamphillus sayeth also yf thou ryght happy say yf thou ryche thou shalte fynde greate nombre felowes frendes yf thy fortune chauge farewel frendshyp felowshyp thou shalte alone wythout copany yf companye poore folke yet sayeth thys pamphillus ouer bene bonde thrall lynage shall made worthye noble rychesses ryghte rychesses come many goodness ryghte pouertie come many harmes yuels greate pouertie costrayneth man many yuels therfore calleth cassiodor pouertye mother ruyne saye mother ouerthrowynge fallynge downe therfore sayeth peter alfonce one greatest aduersyties thys worlde free man kynde byrth constrayned pouerty eat almesse hys enemye sayeth innocent one hys bokes sayeth sorowfull myshappy condicion poore begger yf aske hys meate dyeth honger yf aske dyeth shame algates necessite constrayneth hym aske therfore sayeth salomon better dye haue suche pouerte salomon sayeth better dye bytter deth lyue suche wyse reason haue said vnto many reason coulde say graunt rychesses ben good hem yt getten hem well hem wel vsen tho rychesses therfore wol shewe howe ye shal behaue gatherynge rychesses maner ye shullen vse hem fyrst ye shall get hem wythout great desyre good leyser sokynglye ouerhastelye man desyrynge get rychesse habandoneth hym fyrste thefte yuels therfore sayeth salomon hasteth hym besely waxe ryche shall none innocent sayeth also rychesse hastely cometh man sone lyghtly goeth passeth man rychesse cometh lytel lytel wexeth alwaye multiplyeth syr ye shall gette rychesse wyte trauayle vnto profyte wythout wronge harme doynge persone lawe sayeth maketh selfe riche yf harme wyght thys say nature defendeth forbyddeth ryghte man make hym selfe ryche vnto harme person tullius sayeth sorowe ne drede death ne nothing maye fall vnto man moche ayenst nature man encreace hys owne profyte harme though great myghty get rychesses lyghtly thou yet shalte thou ydell ne slowe thy profyte thou shalte wyse flye ydelnesse salomon sayeth ye ydelnesse teacheth man many yuels salomon sayeth trauayleth besyeth hym tylth lade shall eate breed ydell casteth hym besynesse ne occupacion shal fal pouerte dye honger ydell slowe neuer fynde couenable tyme hys profyte versyfyer sayeth ydel man excuseth wynter bycause greate colde sommer bycause heete cause sayeth caton waketh enclyne net ouer moche slepe ouer moche reste nourysheth causeth many vyces therfore sayeth saynt ierom good dedes deuell whyche enemye ne fynde vnoccupyed dyuel ne taketh lyghtly vnto wer kynge suche fyndeth occupyed good werkes thus gettynge rychesses ye must flye ydelnesse afterward ye shul vse rychesses whyche ye haue gote wyte youre trauayle suche maner men holde scarce ne sparyng ne foole large say ouer large speder ryghte men blame auaricious bycause hys scarcite chynchery wyse blame spendeth ouer largelye therfore sayeth caton vse sayeth rychesses thou haste gotten suche maner men maye haue mater ne cause call nother wretche ne chynche greate shame man haue poore herte ryche purse sayeth also goodes thou haste gote vse measure saye spende mesurably foolyshly waste dyspende goodes haue haue propre owne shape hem take ye goodes man saye ye shall flye auaryce vsynge youre rychesse suche maner men saye youre rychesses bene buryed ye haue hem myghte youre weldynge wyse man repreueth auaricyous man sayeth thus thys verse two wherto buryeth man hys goodes hys great auaryce knoweth well nedes muste dye death ende euerye man thys presente lyfe cause encheson ioyneth hym knytteth hym faste vnto hys goodes hys wyttes mowe dysceuer hym ne departe hym fro hys goodes knoweth well ought knowe deade shall nothynge beare wyth hym thys worlde therfore sayeth saynt augustyne auaricyous lykened vnto hell swaloweth desyre hathe swalowe deuoure well ye wolde eschewe called auaricyous man chynche well shulde ye kepe gouerne wyse men call foole large therfore sayeth tullius goodes thyne house ne shulde hydde ne kepte close myghte opened pyte debonayrte saye yeue hem parte haue greate nede ne thy goodes shulde open euerye man goodes afterwarde gettynge youre rychesses vsynge hem ye shall alwaye haue thre thynges youre herte say lorde god conscience good name fyrst ye shall haue god herte ryches ye shuld thyng whych may maner dysplease god creatour maker worde salomon better haue lytell good ye loue god haue moche good treasoure lese loue lorde god prophete sayeth better good man haue lytel good treasour holden shrewe haue great rychesse yet say furthermore ye shulde alwaye busynesse get rychesses ye get hem good conscience apostle sayeth ny thynge thys worlde whyche shulde haue great ioye oure conscience beareth v good wytnesse wyse man sayeth substaunce man full good synne man conscience afterwarde gettyng rychesses vsynge hem ye muste haue great besynesse great diligence good name alwaye kept conserued salomon sayeth better auayleth man haue good name haue many rychesses therfore sayth place great diligence sayeth salomon kepynge thy frendes thy good name shall lenger abyde wyth treasure neuer precious certes shuld called great gentylman god good conscience thynges lefte ne doth hys deligence besynesse kepe hys good name cassyodor sayeth sygne gentyll herte loueth desyreth haue good name therfore sayeth saynte augustyne ben two thynges ben ryght necessarye also nedefull good conscience good lose saye good co science thyne owne persone inwarde good lose thy neyghbour outwarde trusteth hym moch hys good co science dyspyseth setteth nought good name loose recketh though kepe hys good name ny cruell churle syr nowe haue shewed howe ye shulde gettynge rychesses howe ye shulde vse hem se well trust ye haue rychesses ye woll moue warre batayle counsayle ye begyn warre truste youre rychesses ne suffyse warres maynteyne therfore sayeth philosopher desyreth wolde algates haue warre shall neuer haue suffysaunce rycher greater dyspeces must make yf woll haue worshyppe vyctorye salomon sayeth greater rychesses yt man hath dyspendours hath therfore syr youre ryches ye maye haue moche folke yet behoueth ne good begynne warre ye maye maner haue peace vnto youre worshyppe profyte vyctorye batayls bene thys worlde lyeth great nombre multytude people ne vertue lyeth wyll hande oure lorde god almyghtye therfore iudas machabeus whyche goddes knyght shulde fyght ayenst hys aduersarye hadde greater nombre greater multytude folke stroger hys people machabee yet recomforted hys lytell company sayd ryght thys wyse also lyghtly sayd maye lorde god yeue vyctorye fewe folke many folke vyctorye batayle cometh greate nombre people cometh oure lorde god heauen dere syr moche man certayne yf worthye god yeue hym vyctorye salomon sayeth therfore euery man shuld greatlye drede warres begyn bycause batayles fall many peryls happeth whyle sone greate man slayne lytel man wrytten seconde boke kynges dedes batayles ben aduenturous nothyng certayne lyghtlye one hurte wyth speere ther great peryll warre therfore shulde man slye eschue warre moch man may goodly salomo sayeth loueth peryl shall fall peryll dame prudence spoken thys maner melibe answered sayd se well dame prudence fayre wordes resons ye haue shewed warre lyketh nothynge haue yet herde youre counsayle howe shall thys nede certes said cousayle ye accorde wyth aduersaries ye haue peace wyth hem saynt iames sayeth hys epystle concorde peace small ryches waxe great debate dyscorde ryches decaye ye knowe well one greatest moste souerayne thyng worlde vnite peace therfore sayeth oure lorde iesu christe hys apostle thys wyse wel happy ben loue purchace peace called chyldren god ah sayd melibee se wel ye loue myne honour ne worshyp ye knowe wel myne aduersaryes haue begon debate bryge theyr outrage ye se well ne requyre ne praye peace ne aske reconsiled wol ye go meke obey crye hem mercye forsoth yt worshyp ryghte men saye ouer great humblenesse engendreth dyspraysynge fareth great humilite mekenesse began dame prudence make semblant wrath sayd certes syr saue grace loue honour profyte myne owne euer haue ye ne none neuer se cotrary yet yf said ye shulde haue purchased peace reconsiliation ne moche mystake ne sayd amysse wyse man sayeth dyscention begynneth man reconsylynge begynneth thy selfe prophete sayeth flye shreudnesse goodnesse seke peace folowe moch yet saye ye shulde rather pursue youre aduersaries peace shulde knowe well ye bene harde herted ye woll nothynge salomon sayeth hath ouer harde herte laste shal myshappe mysbetyde melibee herde dame prudence make semblaunt wrathe sayde thys wyse dame praye ye dyspleased ye thynge saye ye knowe well angrye wroth wonder wrothe wote well ne saye therfore prophete sayeth troubled eyen haue clere syght saye cou sayle lyketh ready ryght ye wol desyre yf ye reprefe folye holden loue prayse salomo sayeth repreueth hym doth foly shall fynde greater grace dysceyueth swete wordes sayde dame prudence make semblaunt wrath ne anger great profyte salomon sayeth worth repreueth chydeth fole hys folye shewynge hym semblaunt wrath supporteth prayseth hym hys mysdoynge laugheth hys folye thys salomon sayeth afterwarde sorowfull vysage man saye sorye heuy countenaunce man foole correcteth amendeth hym selfe sayde milibee shall con answere vnto many fayre reason ye put shewe saye shortly wyl youre counsayle readye performe fulfyll pthen dame prudence dyscouered wyll vnto hym sayde counsayle sayd aboue al thynges ye make peace bytwene god reconsyled vnto hym hys grace haue sayd god hath suffred haue thys tribulation dysease synnes yf ye saye god wyl sende youre aduersaryes vnto make hem fall fete ready youre wyll commaundement salomon sayeth condicion man pleasaut lykynge god chau geth hertes man aduersaries constrayneth hem beseche hym peace grace praye let speke aduersaryes priuelye shal knowe wyll assent knowe theyr wyll theyr entente maye counsayle surely dame sayde melibee dothe youre wyll lykynge put holy dysposicion ordynaunce dame prudence sawe good wyll husbonde delybered toke aduyse selfe thynkyng myght brynge thys nede vnto good conclusion good ende sawe tyme sente aduersaries come vnto priue place shewed wisely vnto hem ye great goodes come peace greate harmes peryls bene warre sayd hem goodly maner howe hem ought haue great repentauce iniury wronge done melibeus lorde vnto doughter herde ye goodly wordes dame prudence supprysed rauyshed great ioye wonder tel pah ladye sayde ye haue shewed vnto v blessyng swetnesse sayeng dauid prophete reconsyling nat worthy haue manere ought require great cotricion humilite ye goodnesse haue presented vnto v se wel science conyng salomon ful trewe saith swete wordes multiply encreace frendes maketh shrewes debonaire meke certes sayd put dede al mater cause al holy goodwyl redy obey comaundement oure lorde melibeus therfore dere benygne lady praye beseche mekely maye lyke vnto great goodnesse fulfyll dede goodly wordes consyder knowe haue offended greued oure lorde melibeus measure forforth nat power make hym amendes therfore oblige bynde v frendes hys wyll commaundement parauenture hath suche heuynesse suche wrathe v warde bycause offence woll enioyn v suche payne mowe nat beare ne sustayne therfore noble lady besech womanly pyte take suche aduysement thys nede ne fre de nat disherited ne distroyed foly certes sayd prudence harde thynge ryght perilous man put al vtterly arbytration iugement might power hys enemye salomon saythe leueth yeueth credence shal saye ne yeueth neuer power ne gouernaunce thy goodes thy son thy wyfe thy frende ne thy brother ne yeue thou neuer might ne mastry ouer thy body thou liuest nowe syth defendeth man shulde nat yeue brother ne frende might body stronger reason defendeth forbedeth man yeue hym selfe enemy nathelesse counsaile ye mystrust nat lorde wot wel know verily debonair meke large curteys nothynge desirous ne couitous goodes ne ryches nothynge worlde desyreth saue onely worshyp honoure ferthermore knowe ryght sure shal nothyng thys nede without cousayle shall worke thys case grace lorde god ye shalbe reconsyled vnto v sayd one voyce worshypful lady put v oure goodes fully wyl disposycion ben redy come day lyketh vnto noblesse lymyte v assyne v make oblygacion bonde stronge lyketh vnto goodnes mowe fulfyl wyl lorde melibe whan dame prudence herde answere men bad hem go ayen priuely returned lorde melibe tolde hym howe founde hys aduersaries ful repentaunt knowlegynge ful lowly synnes trespas redy suffre al payne requiryng prayig mercy pyte sayde melibe wel worthy haue pardon foryeuenesse hys synne excuseth hys synne knowlegeth repenteth hym askyng indulgynce seneke sayth remission yeuenesse confessyon confessyon neyghbour innocence therfore assent confyrme haue peace good nought wtout assente wyl frendes prudence ryght gladde ioyful sayde certes sir ye haue wel goodly answered ryght counsayle assent helpe frendes ye haue steered venge make werre right without counsayle shall ye accorde ne haue peace aduersaries lawe sayth nothyng good waye kynde thyng vnbounde ybounde dame prudence wythout delay taryenge sent anone messanger kynsfolke olde frendes whyche trewe wise told hem order presence melibe al mater aboue expressed declared prayed hem wolde saye theyr aduyse counsayle best nede whan melibeus frendes taken aduyse delyberacion forsayd mater examyned great busynesse dilygence yaue ful counsaile haue peace rest melibee shulde receyue wyth good hert hys aduersaris foryeuenesse mercy whan dame prudence herd thassent lorde melibee counsayle hys frendes accorde wyl entencion wondersly gladde hert sayde olde prouerbe sayd ye goodnesse thou maist day abyde nat ne delay nat tyl next daye therfore counsayle ye sende messenger suche discrete wyse vnto aduersaries tellyng hem behalf yf wol treat peace accorde shape wyth delay taryeng come vnto v whyche thyng performed dede whan trespasours repentyng folke folie say aduersaries melibeus herde messangers sayd vnto hem ryght gladde ioyful answered ful mekely benygnely yeldyng grace thankes lorde melibe al hys companye shope hem without delaye go wyth messangers obeyed commaundement lorde melibeus ryght anone toke way courte melibe toke hem true fredes make faythe hem borowes wha comen presence melibee sayd hem wordes stondeth thus sayde melibee soth causelesse without skyl reson ye haue done great iniuries wronges wyfe prudence doughter also ye haue entred house violence haue done suche outrage men knowe wel ye haue deserued dethe therfore woll knowe wete whether ye woll put punishynge chastylyng vengeaunce thys outrage wyl wyfe ye wol wysest hem thre answerd hem al sayd sir sayd know wel ben vnworthy come courte great lorde worthy ye haue gretly mistaken v haue offended agylted wyse agayn hygh lordshyp truely haile deserued dethe yet great goodnesse debonairte al worlde wytnesseth person submytte v ye excellecye benygnytye gracious lordeshyp ben redy obey al commaundementes besechynge mer iable pyte ye wel consyder oure great repentaunce lowe submyssyon graunt v foryeuenesse outragyous trespace offence wel knowe liberal grace mercye stretcheth ferther goodnesse oure outragious gyltes trespaces wyckednesse al cursedly damnably haue agilted agaynst hygh lordshyp melibee tooke hem vp fro grounde ful benygnely receyued oblygacions bondes othes vpon pledge borowes assyned hem certayne day retourne vnto hys courte receyue accept sentence iugement melibeus wolde co maunde hem cause aforsayd thynges ordayned euery man returned hys house whan dame prudece sawe tyme fayned asked lorde melibe vengeaunce thought take hys aduersaries whyche melibe answerde sayde certes sayde thynke purpose fully disherit al euer haue putte exile euer certes sayd dame prudence thys cruel sentence moche ayenst reason ye rich ynough haue nede mennes rich ye might lyghtly wyse gete couetous name whiche vicious thyng ought eschewed euery good man sayeng apostel couetise rote al harmes therfore wer better lese moch good owne take theyr good thys maner better lese good worship wyn good vilanye shame euerye man ought dilygence busynesse gette good name yet shal onely busy kepyng hys good name shal al enforce hym alwaye thynge whiche may renewe hys good name writte old good lose good name soone gone past whan renewed touchynge ye say ye wol exile aduersaries thynketh moche ayenst reason measure consydringe power haue yeue vpon selfe wrytten worthy lese hys pryuilege mysuseth ye might power gyuen hym sette case ye might enioyne hem yt payne right lawe whiche trowe ye maye nat saye ye myghte put execution parauenture lyke tourne ye werre therfore yf ye woll men obeysaunce ye muste demean curteisly saye ye muste yeue easy sentence iugement wrytten curteisly commaundeth hym men moost obey therfore praye thys necessyte thys nede ye caste ouercome youre hert senet sayth ouercometh hys herte ouercometh twise tully sayth nothyng commendable great lorde whan debonaire meke apeseth hym lyghtly praye ye woll nowe forbere vengeaunce suche maner youre good name maye kepte conserued men may haue cause mater prayse pyte mercye ye haue cause repent thynge done senecke saythe ouercometh yuel manere repenteth hym hys victorie wherfore praye let mercy hert theffecte entent god almyghty haue mercy vpo hys last iugement saynt iames sayth hys epistel iugement without mercye shal hym hath mercy another wight whan melibee herde great skylles reason dame prudence wyse information techynges hys herte gan enclyne wyl hys wyfe consydryng trew entent confirmed hym anon assented fully worke counsayle thanked god whome procedeth goodnesse vertue hym sent wyfe great discretion whan day came aduersaries shulde appere prensence spake hem goodly sayde thys wyse al pryde high presumption foly negligence vnconnyng ye haue misborne trespaced vnto yet mikel se beholde great humilyte ye sory repentaut gyltes costrayneth grace mercy wherfore receyue grace forgyue holy al offence iniuries wronges ye haue agaynst myne theffecte ende god endlesse mercy wol tyme oure dyeng forgyue v gyltes haue trespaced thys wreched worlde doutlesse yf sory repentaunt synnes gyltes whyche haue trespaced ye syght oure lord god fre merciable woll forgyue v oure gyltes brynge v blysse neuer shall haue ende amen phere endeth tale chaucer foloweth monkes prologue whan ended tale malibee prudence benygnyte host sayd faythfull man precious corp madrian leuer barel ale goodlefe wyfe herd thys tale nothyng suche pacience thys melibeus wyfe prudence goddes bone wha bete knaues bringeth great clubbed staues crieth slee dogges euerichone breke bothe backe euery bone yf neyghbour myne wol churche wyfe enclyne hardy trespace whan cometh hom rapeth face cryeth false cowarde wreke thy wyfe corpus domini wol haue thy knyfe thou shalt haue distaffe go spynne fro day tyl nyght wol thus begynne palas saith euer shape wedde mylksop cowarde ape wol ouerleyde euery wight thou darst stonde thy wyues right lyfe yf wold fight dore anon mote dight el lost yf lyke wylde lyon fole hardy wote wel wol slee day neyghbour go way perlous knyfe honde al dare withstonde bygge armes faithe shal fynd mysdoth saith lette v passe away matere pmy lord sayd sir moke mery chere ye shal tel v tale trewly lo rochester stondeth fast ride sorth myne owne lorde breke oure game trouthe knowe name whether shal cal lorde dan iohn dan thomas dan robert dan albon house ye farther kyn vowe god thou hast ful fayre chyn gentyl pasture thou gost thou arte lyke pynaunt ghost vpon faythe thou arte officere worthy sexten celerere father soule dome thou art mayster whan thou art home poore cloysterer ne poore nouyse gouernoure ware wyse therwith brawne bone wel faryng person none pray god yeue confusyon fyrst brought religyon thou woldest trede foule right haddest thou gret leue thou hast might perfourme al thy lust engendrure thou haddest begoten many creature ala werest thou wyde cope god yeue sorowe pope thou euery mighty man though shore hyghe vpon pan shuld haue wyfe al world lorn religyon hath take vp al corne tredynge borel men ben shrimpes feble tree cometh wretched impes maketh heires slender feble maye wel engender maketh wyues wol assay religious folke may better pay venus paymentes mowe god wote lusheburghs paye ye wroth lorde though playe full ofte game sothe haue herde saye worthy monke toke al pacience sayd wol dilygence ferre sowneth honeste tel tale ye two thre yf ye lyst herken hytherwarde wol sayne lyfe saynt edwarde el tragedyes fyrst wol tel whiche haue hundred cel tragedy tel certayne story olde bokes maken memory hem stode great prosperyte fallen hye degre mysery ended wretchedly ben vercifyed comenly syxe fete whiche men cal exametron prose eke ben endyted many metre many sondrye wyse lo ought ynough suffyse nowe herkeneth yf lyste fyrst beseche matere though order tel nat thynges pope emperours kynges age men written fynde tellen hem behynde cometh nowe remembraunce haue excused myne ignoraunce phere endeth monkes prologue begynneth hys tale wyl bewayle maner tragedy harme hem stoden hye degre fyl na remedy bryng hem aduersyte certayn whan fortune lyst flye may course withold lette man trust blynde prosperite bethware ensample yonge old plucifer lucifer though angel nat wyl begynne though fortune maye nat angel dere fro hye degre yet fel synne doun hel yet inne lucifer brightest angel al art thou sathanas yt maist nat twyn mysery whiche thou arte fal padam plo adam felde damascene goddes fynger wrought begotten mannes sperm vnclene welte al paradise sauyng tree neuer worldly man hye degre adam tyl mysgouernaunce dryuen hys hygh prosperite labour hel myschaunce psampson plo samson yt annunciate angel longe hys natiuite god almighty consecrate stode noble myght se neuer another speke strength therto hardynesse wyues tolde secre slough wretchednesse sampson
