noble mighty champion without wepen saue hondes twey slough al rent lyon toward hys weddyng walking wey false wyfe coulde hym psese praye tyl counsayle knewe vntrewe vnto foe counsayle gan vewray hym forsoke toke another newe hundred fox toke sampson yre al tayles togyther bonde set fox tayles al fyre euery tayle hath put bronde brent al cornes londe olyues vynes eke thousand men eke slough hond wepen asse cheke wha slayne thristed yt wel nye lorne gan prey god wold payn haue pyte sende drinke el mote dey asse cheke drey wange tothe sprange anon wel whiche dronke ynough shortly sey thus holpe god iudicum tel force gasa nyght maugre philystens cyte gate towne hath vp plyght hys backe ycaried hem hath high hyl men myght hem se noble mighty sampson lefe dere thou nat tolde woman thy secre al wrolde ne thy pere sapson neither syder drake ne wyne ne heed cam rasour none ne shere precepte messangere diuyne al hys strength heeres fully twenty yere yere israel gouernaunce soon shal wepe many tere woman shal bryng hym myschaunce vnto lemman dalyda tolde heeres al strength lay falsely hys foe hym solde slepyng barme vpon day mad clyppe shere heeres away made fomen al crafte espyen whan fonde suche aray bounde faste put eyen er hys heeres clypped ishaue bonde might bynde nowe put prison caue made hym ye querne grynde noble sapson strongest mankynde whylom iuge glorie rychesse mayst thou wepe wt thyn eyen blynde sith yu art wele fal wretchidnesse ende caytife shal sey fomen made feest vpon daye made foole byfore pley temple great araye last made foule afray two pyllers shoke made hem fal downe fel temple al lay sloughe hym selfe eke fomen say prince euerychone eke thre thousad bodyes ther slayn fallyng great temple stone sampson wol sayne beth ware ensample olde playne men tel counsayle wyues thyng wold haue secret fayn touche lymmes lyues phercules hercules souerayne conqueroure syngen hys werkes laude hye renoun hys tyme strength bare floure slough rafte skyn lyoun centaur layde boste adoun harpia slewe cruel byrdes fel golden appels rafte fro dragon drewe cerberus hounde hel slewe cruel tyraunt bustrus made horse frete flesh bone slough serpent venemous achelous two horne brake one slewe cacus caue stone slough gyaunt antacus stronge slough grisly bore anon bare heed vpon spere longe neuer wight sythe worlde began slough many monster dyd wyde worlde name ran strenght bounte euery realme went se stronge yt man might let bothe worldes endes trophe stede boundes brasse pyllour set palemman noble champyon hight de anire freshe may clerkes make mencion hath sent shyrte freshe gay ala shirte ala wel awaye enuenomed subtelly al er weared halfe daye made fleshe al fro hys bone fal nathelesse clerkes excusen one hight nessus maked may wol accusen body shyrte ware al naked tyl fleshe venym slaked whan sawe none remedye hote cole hath selfe iraked venym dayned dye thus sterfe worthy mighty hercules lo may truste fortune throwe foloweth al world prees ware ofte layde ful lowe ful wyse hym selfe knowe beware whan fortune lyst glose wayteth downe throwe suche waye wolde leste suppose pnabugodonosor mighty trone precious tresore glorious septre royal mayeste kynge nabugodonosore tonge vnneth may discryu twyse wanne hierusalem cyte vessel temple lad babilon souerayne se whiche glorie delyte fayrest child blode royal hierusalem dyd gelde anone made eche hem ben hys thral amonge al danyel one wysest euerychone dre kyng expowned caldee clerkes non wyst fyne dreme sowned proude kyng let make statu gold sixty cubites longe seuen brede whiche ymage bothe yonge olde commaunded loute haue drede furneys ful flame rede shulde deed wolde obey neuer wolde assent dede danyel ne yonge felowes twey pthys kynge kynges proude elate wende god sytteth maieste ne myght hym byreue hys estate sodeynly lost hys dygnite lyke beest hym semed eate hey oxe laye therout rayne wyth wylde beestes walked tyll certayne tyme come aboute lyke egles fethers hys heeres hys nayles lyke byrdes clawes god releued hym certayne yeres yaue wytte many tere thanked god hys lyfe fere amysse trespace er layde hys bere knewe yt god full myght grace pbalthaser sonne whyche hyght balthasare helde reygne hys father daye hys father coulde beware proude herte aray eke ydolaster aye hys hygh estate assured hym pryde fortune cast hym downe laye sodeynly hys raygne gan deuyde feest made vnto hys lordes al vpon tyme made hem blyth hys offycers gan call gothe brynge forth vessel whych father hys prosperite temple hierusalem byrafte goddes thanken honoure elder v lafte hys wyfe hys lordes hys cocubynes aye dronken whyles appetytes laste noble vessel sondrye wynes wall thys kynge hys eyen caste saw hode armelesse wrote faste feare whych quoke syghed sore honde ye balthasar made sore agaste wrote mane techel phares pin al lande magicien ther none coude expowne thys letter ment daniel expowned anone sayd kynge god thy father sent glorye honoure reygne treasour rent proude nothynge god drad therfore great wrath god vpo sente hym byrafte raygne caste mannes companye wyth ass hys habitacion eate hey beest wete drye tyl knewe grace reson god heauen hath domination ouer euery reygne euery creature god hym compassyon hym restored reygne fygure peke thou ye art hys sonne arte proude also knowest thynges priuely arte rebell god hys foe thou dranke eke hys vessel boldly thy wyfe eke thy wench synfully dronke vessel sondrye wynis heryed false goddes cursedly therfore shapen great payne honde sent fro god yt wall wrote mane techel phares truste thy reygne done thou worest al deuyded thy realme shalbe medes perciens quod nyght kynge slawe darius occupyed hys dignite though therto nether ryght ne lawe lordynges emsample mowe ye take howe lordshyp sykernesse fortune wol man forsake bereth away hys raygne hys rychesse eke hys frendes lesse man hath fredes fortune myshap wol make hym enemyes gesse thys prouerbe ful soth ful comune pzenobia zenobia palmerye quene wryteth percy noblesse worthywas armes kene yt wight passed hardynesse ne linage ne none getilnes kynges blode perce dyscended say moste fayrnesse shape myght amended chylhode fynde fledde offyce woman woode went many wylde hertes bloode shedde wyth arowes brode hem sent swyfte anone hem hent elder wolde kyll lyon lybardes beeres al rent armes welde hem wyll durst wylde beestes dennes seke renne mounteyns al nyght slepe vnder bushe coulde eke wrastell force myght wyth yoge neuer wyght myght thynge armes stonde kept maydenhede fro euery wyght man dayned bonde last frendes hath maryed odenat prince countre al hem longe taryed ye shall vnderstande howe suche fantasyes nathelesse knyt fere lyued ioye felicite eche hem lefe dere saue one thynge nolde neuer assent waye shulde lye one playne entent haue chylde worlde multyplye also sone myght aspye wt chylde wyth dede wolde suffer hym hys fantasye efte sone one drede yf wyth chylde caste nomore shulde playe game tyll fully fourty dayes paste wolde one suffre hym thys odenat wylde tame gate nomore thus sayd wyues lechery shame case yf men wyth hem playde ptwo sonnes thys odenat whych kept vertue lettrure nowe vnto tale turne saye worshypfull creature wyse therwyth large wyth mesure penyble warre curteys eke ne laboure myght warre endure none though al thys worlde wolde seke ryche araye ne myght tolde well vessell clothynge al clad pierry golde eke lefte none huntynge haue sondry tonges folke knowynge leyser entende lerne bokes lykynge howe vertue lyfe myght dyspende shortly thys storye treate doughty husbonde coquered many reygnes gre orient wyth many fayre cyte apperteynaunt vnto maieste rome wyth strength helde faste ne neuer myght men slee whyle odenates dayes laste batayles lyste hem rede agayne sapor kynge mo howe thys proces fyll dede coquered title therto myschefe wo howe besieged ytake let hym mayster petrarke go wryteth ynough thys vndertake pwhen odenat deed myghtely realmes helde wyth owne honde agaynst foe fought truely ther prince ne kynge al londe glad yf grace fonde ne shulde vpon hys lande werrey wyth made alyaunce bonde peace let hem ryde pley emperour rome claudius ne hym beforne romayne galyen ne durst neuer coragius ne none armen ne none egypcien ne surrien ne none arabien wythin felde durst wyth fyght lest yt wolde hem wyth hondes sle wyth meyne put hem flyght kynges habyte wente sonnes two heyres realmes hermanno titamallo name perciens hem call aye fortune hath hony gall myghty quene may whyle endure fortune reygne made fal wretchednesse mysauenture paurelian gouernaunce rome came hys hondes twey shope vpon thys quene vengeaunce wyth hys legion toke hys wey towarde zenobia shortly say made flye laste hent fettered eke chyldren tway wan lode home rome went amonge thynges wan chare yt golde wrought pierre thys great romayne thys aurelian hath wyth hym ladde men shulde se beforne hys tryumphe walked wyth golden chaynes necke hongyng crowned degre full pier e charged clothynge palas fortune whylom dredfull kynges emperoures nowe gaureth people ala helmed starke stoures wan force townes stronge toures shall heed nowe autremyte bare septre ful floures shal beare dystaffe coste quyte pnero although nero vicious fende lyeth full lowe adoun yet telleth v suetoni al worlde subiectio este west septentrion rubyes saphers perles whyte al he clothes broudred vp doun gemmes greatly gan delyte delycate pompous aray proude neuer emperour ylke cloth wered day tyme nolde neuer se nettes golde threde great plente fyshe tyber lyst play hys lustes lawe hys degre fortune hys frende wolde hym obay rome brent hys delycacye senatours slewe vpon day wyues wolde wepe crye slough hys brother syster laye hys mother made pytouse aray wombe let slytte beholde conceyued welaway lytell hys mother tolde teeres hys eyen syght ne came sayd fayre womon great wonder coude myght domysman deed beaute wyne brynge hym commaunded dranke anone none wo made myght ioyned vnto cruelte ala depe wyl venyme wade youth mayster thys emperoure teache hym lettrure curtesye moralite floure hys tyme yf hys bokes lye whyles mayster mastrye made hym connynge souple longe tyme tyrannye vyce durste hym vncouple senec maister deuyse bycause nero hym suche drede hys vyces wolde hym chastyse dyscretly worde dede syr wolde saye emperour mote nede vertuouse hate tyrannye whych made hym bath blede hys armes tyll muste dye thys nero eke customaunce youth ayenst hys mayster ryse afterward though gret greuauce bycause ofte wolde hym chastyse therfore made hym dye thys wyse chose bath dye thys manere rather haue another turmentyse thus hath nero slayne hys master dere pnowe fell fortune lyst longer hygh pryde nero cheryshe tho stronge yet stroger thought thus god nyce set man fulfylled vyce hye degre emperour hym call god hys sete woll hym tryce lest weneth sonest shall fall people rose vpon hym nyght hys defaute aspyed dores anon hath dyght alone wende haue ben alyed knocked faste aye cryed faster shette dores tho wyste wel selfe begyled went way lenger durste call people cryed rombled vp doun wt eeres herde howe sayde vhere false tyraunt neroun feare ful nere wytte brayde goddes right pitously prayde socoure might betyde drede thought deyde ranne gardeyn hyde gardayne foude chorles twey syttyng fyre great reed chorles two gan prey flee gyrde heed bodye whan deed dispyte done diffame selfe slough coulde better rede whiche fortune lough game pholofernes neuer capitayne vnder kyng reignes mo put subiectyo nestroger feld al thing tyme ne greater ofrenou ne pompous hygh presumpcioun holopherne fortune aye kyste lycorously ladde vp doun tyl deed er wyste world awe lesyng rychesse lyberte made euery man renye lawe nabugodonosor lorde sayd none god shulde honoured ayenst hest dare wight trespace saue bethulia stronge cyte eliachym preest place pbut take kepe ye dethe holopherne amyd host dronke laye al nyght within tent large berne yet al pompe al might iudith woman lay vpright sleping heed smote fro tente ful priuely stale euery wight heed vnto towne wete pantiochus nedeth kynge antiochus tell hys hyghe royall maieste hys great pryde hys werke venemus suche man na neuer redeth machabe redeth proude wordes sayde fyl prosperyte hyl howe wretchedly deyde fortune enhaunsed pryde verily wende might attayne vnto sterres vpon euery syde balaunce wey eche mountayne al floodes see restrayne goddes people moste hate hem wolde slee turment payne wenyng god ne might pryde abate nychanore tymothe iewes venquished mightyly vnto iewes suche hate bad greythe chare full hastely swore sayd ful dispytously vnto hierusalem wolde eftsone wreke yre ful cruelly purpose let ful sone god manace sore smote inuysible wounde aye incurable guttes carfe bote hys paynes importable certaynly wreche resonable many mannes guttes dyd payne purpose cursed dampnable al smerte nolde restrayne bade anon aparayle hoste sodainly ware god daunted al pride al boste sore fel chare al lymmes skyn tare ne myght go ne ryde chayre men aboute bare al forbrused bothe backe syde wreche god smote cruelly body wicked wormes crept therwith al stanke horribly none hys meyne hym kept whether woke el slept ne myght hym stynke endure hys myschefe wayled eke wept knewe god lorde euery creature hys hoste hym selfe also ful lothsome stynke hys carayne man myght hym beate ne fro hys stynke hys horrible payne sterfe ful wretchedly mountayne thus hath thys robbour thys homicide many man made wepe plaine suche gue belongeth pryde palexander storye alexander commune euery wyght hath dyscretion hath herde somwhat al hys fortune thys wyde worlde conclusyon wanne strength hys renoun glad peace vnto hym sende pryde man bost layde adoun came vnto worldes ende comparison myght yet neuer maked betwyrre hym conqueroure al thys world dred hi hath quaked knyghthode fredome floure fortune hym made ye heyre hygh honoure saue wyne wome nothig might aswage hys hygh entent armes laboure full louynge corage price though told darius hundred thousande mo prynces erles knyghtes bolde whych conquered brought wo saye ferre man may ryde go world shuld deuise though wrote told euer mo hys knyghthode myght suffyse twelue yere reigned rede machabe philippes sonne macedone fyrst kyng grece countre worthy gentyl alexander ala euer shulde fall suche caas enpoysoned thy folke thou thy syce fortune hath tourned ace yet ne wept neuer tere shal yeue men teares complayne death gentylnesse fraunchyse worlde welded hys demayne yet hym thought myght suffyse ful hys corage hygh empryse ala shall helpe endyte false fortune poyson dyspyse whych thys wo wyte piulius cesar wysdome manhode hyghe laboure humble bedde royal maieste vp rose iulius conqueroure al occident londe see wan strength honde el trete vnto rome made hem trybutary syth rome emperour tyl fortune wexte hys aduersary myghty cesar thessaly ayenst pompei father thyne lawe orient chyualry ferre daye begynneth dawe knyghthod hast take slawe saue fewe folke ye wyth pompeius fledde whych yu puttest ye oriet awe thanke fortune wel spedde pbut nowe lytel whyle wol bewayle pompei thys noble gouernoure rome whych fledde thys batayle saye one hys men false traytour hys heed smote wynne hym fauour iulius hym heed brought ala pompei orient conquerour fortune vnto suche fyne wrought pto rome agayne repayreth iulius wyth hys triumphe lauriate ful hye tyme brutus cassius euer hys hye estate enuye full priuely made conspyracye ayenst thys iulius subtel wyse caste place whych shulde dye wyth bodkyns shal deuyse thys iulius vnto capitol went vpon daye wonte gone capitol anone hym hent thys false brutus hys fone stycked hym wyth bodkyns anone wyth many woude thus let lye neuer geueched stroke one el two yf hys storye lye manly thys iulius herte well loued estately honeste tho hys deedly woudes sore smerte hys mantel ouer hys yppes caste man shulde se hys priuety laye dyenge traunce wyste verely dye shulde honestye yet remembraunce plucan thys storye recomende sueton valery also thys storye wrytten worde ende howe conquerours two fortune fyrst frende sythe foe man truste vpon fauoure longe haue awayte euer mo wytnesse conquerours stronge pcresus ryche cresus whylom kynge lyde whyche cresus cirus sore hym drad yet caught amydde hys pryde brenne men fyre hym lad raine downe fro yu fyrmamet shad queynt fyre made hym scape beware yet grace tyl fortune galowes made gape escaped could sten begyn newe araye agayne wende wel fortune hym sent suche happe yt escaped ye rayne hys foe myght slayne eke sweuen vpon nyght mette whych proude eke fayne vengeaunce hys herte sette vpon tree hym thought ther iupiter hym wyshe backe syde phebus eke fayre towel brought drye therwith wext prid hys doughter stode hym besyde whych yt knewe hye sentence habounde bade tell sygnyfyed dreme ryght thus dyd expounde tree galous mene iupiter betokeneth snowe rayne phebus wyth hys towel clene betokeneth sonne beames soth sayne thou shalt honged father certayne rayne shall washe sonne shall drye thus warned hym full plat ful payne hys doughter called phanye honged cresus proude kynge hys royall trone myght hym auayle tragedye none maner thynges ne ca syngynge crye ne bewayle fortune aldaye wol assayle wyth vnware stroke ye reygnes yt proude whe men trusteth wol fayle couer bryght face wyth cloude ppeter spayne oo noble worthy petro glory spayne whome fortune helde hygh maieste wel ought men thy pytous death complayne thy lande thy brother made fle siege subtelte thou betrayed ladde vnto hys tente hys owne hande slewe succedynge thy raygne thy rente felde snowe wt thegle black therin caught wyth ye lymrod coloured ye glede brewe thys cursydnesse al synne wycked neste werker thys dede charles oliuer toke aye hede trouth honoure armorike genilion oliuer corrupte mede brought thys worthy kynge bryke ppetro kynge cypre worthy petro kinge cypre also alexandrye wanne hygh mastrye ful many hethe wroughtest yu wo whych thyne owne lyeges enuye thynge thy chyualrye thy bed han slayne ye ye morowe thus fortune whele gouerne gye ioye bryng men sorowe pbarnabo vicounte millan great barnabo vicounte god delyte scourge lumbardye shulde thyn infortune accounte sen astate thou clomben hye thy brother sonne yt thy double alye thy neuewe sonne lawe within prison made dye ne yt thou slawe phugelyne pyse erle hugelyne pyse langour may tonge tel pyte lytell oute pyse stonte toure whyche toure prison put hym ben lytel child thre eldest scarsly fyue yere age ala fortune great cruelte suche byrdes put suche cage dampned dye prison roger byshop pyse hym made false suggestyon ye people gan vpon rise put prison suche wyse ye haue herde meate drinke smal vnnethe may suffyse therwithal ful poore bad day befel houre wha meate wont brought geylour shette doores toure herde wel spake right nought herte anon fyl thought hunger wolde dyen ala ala wrought therwith teeres fyl fro hys eyen phi yonge sonne thre yere age vnto said father father ye wepe whan wyl geylour bring potage morsel breed ye kepe hungry may slepe nowe wolde god might slepe euer shuld hunger wombe crepe ny nothig breed yt leuer pthus day day child began crye tyl father arme adowne laye sayd farwel father mote dye kyste father deyde day whan woful father dyd sey wo armes two gan byte said ala fortune welaway thy false whele wo al may wyte child wende huger armes gnewe wo sayd father nat ala rather eate fleshe vpon v two flesh yu yaue v take flesh v fro eate ynough right thus said within day two layde hem lappe adoun deyde thus ended mighty erle pyse selfe dispeyred eke hungre starfe hygh estate fortune away hym carfe tragedy ought ynough suffyse wol longer wyse redeth great poete itayle hyght dante al deuyse fro poynt point word wol sayle phere endeth monkes tale phere stynteth knyght moke tale foloweth prologue nonnes preest ho knyght good sir nomore ye haue said right ynough ywys mokel lytel heuynesse right ynough moche folke gesse saye great disease men haue welth ease sodayne fal ala contrary ioye solas whan man hath ben pore estate clymbeth vp wexeth fortunate abydeth prosperite thynges gladsome thynketh suche thyng good tel ye host saynt poules bel ye say right soth monke clappeth loude spake fortune coue cloude wote also tragedy right nowe ye herde perdy remedy bewaylen ne complayne done al payne ye haue sayd heuynesse sir moke god blesse tale anoyeth al company suche talkyng worth butterfly therin disporte ne game therfore sir monke da pier name pray hertely tel v somwhat elles sykerly nere clynkyng belle bridell honge euery syde heuen kyng v al dyde shulde er haue fal downe slepe al though slough ben neuer depe tale al tolde vayne certaynly clerkes sayne man may haue none audyence nought helpeth tel hys sentence wel wote substaunce thyng shal wel reported sir saye somwhat huntyng pray nay moke haue lust play nowe let tel haue tolde ptha spake host wt rude speche bolde sayd vnto nonnes preest anon come nere yu prest come hider thou sir iohn tel v thing may hertes glade blythe though thou ryde vpon iade though thy horse bothe foule lene wol serue recke bene loke thy herte mery euer mo pyes sir yes host mote go mery iwys wol blamed right anon tale hath atamed thus sayd vnto v euerychon swete preest goodly man sir iohn phere endeth prologue nonnes preest foloweth hys tale poore wydowe dele ystept age whylom dwellyng pore cotage besyde groue stondynge dale wydow tel tale sen day laste wyfe pacience ledde ful symple lyfe lytel catel rent husbondrie suche god sent foude self eke doughters two thre large sowes mo thre kyne eke shepe hyght mal wel sooty bou e eke hal whyche ete many slender mele poynaut sauce ne knewe neuer dele ne deynty morcel passed throte dyet accordaunt cote replection ne made neuer syke temperate dyete phisyke exercyse hertes suffysaunce goute let nothing daunce ne apoplexie shent heed wyne ne dranke whyte ne reed borde serued wt whyte black milke brou breed fode lack seynde bakon somtyme eye twey maner dey pa yerde enclosed al aboute slyckes drie dytched without cocke hight chauteclere al londe crowyng na hys pere voyce meryer mery orgon masse dayes church gon wel sykerer crowyng hys loge clocke abbey orloge nature knewe eche assentioun equinoctial toun whan degree xv assended tha crewe might amended combe redder fyne coral batelled castel wal byl blacke gete shone lyke asure legges tone nayles whyter lylly floure lyke burned golde coloure pthis gentil cocke gouernaunce seuen hennes done plesaunce susters paramour wonder lyke colour whiche fayrest hewed throte called fayre damosel pertelote fethered hundred tymes daye pleaseth al euer maye curteys discrete debonayre compenable bare selfe fayre sen tyme seuenyght olde trulyche hath herte holde chaunteclere lokyng euery lyth loueth wel therwith suche ioye hem synge whan bright sunne gan sprynge swete acorde lefe ferre londe tyme haue vnderstonde beestes byrdes coulde speke synge pand fyl dawnyng chaunteclere amonge wyues al sate perche hal next hym sate fayre pertelote chauteclere ga grone throte man dreme drenched sore wha pertelot thus herde rore agaste sayd herte dere eyleth grone manere ye sleper fye shame answerde thus god madame pray ye take grefe god mette suche mischefe right yet myn hert sore fright nowe god sweuen retche right kepe body foule prisoun mette romed vp doun within yerde sawe beest lyke houde wold haue made areest vpon body wolde haue deed colour betwyxt yelowe reed typped tayle bothe eeres black vnlike remenat heeres snowte smal glowyng eyen twey yet loke almoste feare dey causeth gronyng doutlesse paway fye shame hertlesse ala god aboue nowe haue ye loste herte al loue loue cowarde faythe certes woman saythe al desyre yf myght haue husbondes hardy wyse fre secrete nygarde ne fole ne hym agaste euery tole ne none auauntour god aboue howe durst ye say shame vnto loue anye sweuen might make ferde haue ye mannes herte haue berde ala con ye ferde sweuenis nothing vanyte god wotte insweuen sweuens ben engendred replections fume complections whan humour ben habundat wight certes thys dreme whyche ye haue met tonight tel trouthe ye may trust cometh superfluyte reed colour parde whiche cause folke drede dremes arowes fyre reed lemes reed beestes wol hem byte conteke waspes great lyte right humour melancolye causeth many man slepe crye fere great bulles beres blake el blacke dyuels wol hem take humour coulde tel also worke man slepe moche wo wol passe lightly lo caton wyse sayd thus force dremes sir wha flye fro ye bemes goddes loue taketh laxatyfe vp peryl soule lyfe counsayle beste wol lye bothe colour melancolye ye purge ye shul tary though towne none apotecary shal selfe two herbes teche shal heale prow yerde tho herbes shal fynde whiche haue properte kynde purge byneth eke aboue foryete goddes owne loue ye right coleryke complection sunne ascention ne fynde replete humour hote yf ye dare wel lay grote ye shal haue feuer terciane el ague may bane day two ye shal haue digestyues wormes ye take laxatyues laurel centorie femetere el elder beryes growe cataprice gaytres beris herbe yue growing yerde yt mery plucke hem vp growe eate hem mery husbonde father kyn dredeth dreme say pmadame gramercy lore nathelesse touchyng dan catoun wysdom hath great renoun though bade dremes drede god men may olde bokes rede many man auctorite euer caton mote al reuers saythe hys sentence haue wel founde experyence dremes ben signyfycations wel ioye trybulations folke endure lyfe present nedeth make none argumet prefe sheweth dede one greatest auctours rede sayth thus whilom two felowes wet pylgrimage ful good entent happed come toun suche congregation people eke strayte herbygage ne fonde moche cotage whiche bothe might yloged wherfore mote necessyte nyght departe company eche hem gothe host iry toke hys lodgyng wolde fal one hem lodged stal farre yerde ox plough man lodged wel ynough auenture fortune v gouerneth al comune befel longe day mette bedde lay howe felowe gan vpon cal sayd ala ox stal nyght shal murdred lye nowe helpe dere brother dye al haste come sayd man hys slepe feere abrayd whan waked slepe turned toke kepe thought dreme vanyte thus twyse slepe dremed thyrde tyme yet felawe cam thouyt sayd slawe beholde blody woundes depe wyde ryse vp erly morowe tyde west gate towne carte ful donge shalt thou se whiche body hydde ful priuely thou carte areste boldly golde caused dethe sothe sayne told euery point slayn ful pytous face pale hewe trust wel dreme foud right trew morowe sone day felowes inne toke waye whan came ox stal felowe began cal hosteler answerde anon sayd syr felowe gon sone day went ye toun man gan fal suspectioun remembring dremes mette forthe goth lenger wolde lette vnto westgate towne fonde donge carte donge londe arayed wyse ye haue herde deed man deuyse hardy herte gan crye vengeaunce iustyce felonye felowe murdred night carte lythe gapyng vpright crye mynisters shulde kepe rule cyte harowe ala lythe felowe slayne shulde tale sayne people starte tall ye carte groud myddel donge founde deed man murdred al newe po blysful god arte good trewe lo howe thou wrayest murdre alway murdre wol se day day murdre waltsome abhomynable god iuste resonable ne wol suffre healed though abyde yete two thre murdre wol conclusyoun right anon mynisters toun haue hente carter sore pyned eke hosteler sore engyned beknewe wickednesse anone hanged necke bone may ye se dremes ben drede pand certes lefe rede right next chapiter gabbe haue ioye blys two men wolde haue passed ouer se certayne cause ferre countre wynde ne contrarie made hem cyte tarye stode ful mery vpon hauen syde daye ayenst euen tyde wynde gan chaunge blew hem lest ioly glad went rest caste hem ful erly sayle herken one fyl great meruayle one hem slepyng lay mer wonder dreme agayn day thought stode beddes syde hym comaunded shulde abyde sayd thus thou morow wende thou shalte dreynt tale ende phe woke tolde felow mette prayed voyage lette day prayed abyde felowe lay beddes syde gan laugh scorned ful faste dreme may herte agaste wol let thynges set strawe thy dremynges sweuens ben vanytees iapes men meten alday oules ape eke many mase therwithal dremen thing neuer ne shal sythe se thou wolte abyde thus slouthe wylfully thy tyde god wote rueth haue good day thus toke leue went way er halfe course ysayled ne mischaunce ayled casuelly shyppes botome rent shyp men vnder water went fyght shyppes besyde hem sayled tyde therfore fayre pertelot dere suche ensamples olde mayste thou lere man shulde rechelesse dremes say doutlesse many dreme ful sore drede lo lyfe saynt kenelm rede kenelphus sonne noble kyng mereturike kenelm mette thyng lytel er murdred day murder hys visyon say norice expowned euery dele sweuen badde kepe wele fro trayson seuen yere olde therfore lytel tale therof tolde dreme holy hert god rather shert ye herde legende haue dame pertelot say trewly macrobius writeth auisyon affrike worthy scipion affyrmeth dremes sayth warnyng thynges seen farthermore pray loketh well olde testament danyel yf helde dremes vanyte rede eke ioseph shal ye se wonder ben somtyme say nat al warnyng thynges shal fal plo egipt kyng hight pharao baker butteler also whether felte none effecte dremes wol seke actes sondrie remes may rede dremes wonder thyng lo cresus whiche lyde kyng mette satte vpon tree whiche signifyed shulde honged lo adromeda hector wyfe day hector shulde lefe lyfe dremed night beforne howe lyfe hector shulde lorne yf day went vnto bataile warned might nat auayle wente fyght neuerthelesse slayne anon achilles tale long tel eke nigh day may nat dwel shortely say conclusyon shal haue auision aduersyte say farthermore ne tel laxatyues store ben venemous wote wele hem defye loue hem neuer dele let v speke myrthe stynte al madame pertelot haue blys one thyng god hath sent large grace whan se beautie face ye scarlet reed aboute eyen maketh al drede dyen also syker principio mulier est hominis confusio pmadame sentence latyn woman mannes ioye blys whan fele night softe syde al may ryde perche made narowe ala ful ioye solas defye bothe sweuen dreme ye worde flew fro ye beme day eke hennes al chucke gan hem cal founde corne lay yerde royal ferde feddred pertelot twenty tyme tradde eke oft er prime loketh grymme lyoun toe romed vp doun deyned set fete grounde chucked whan corne ifounde ran wyues al royal prince hal leaue chaunteclere pasture wol tel auenture pwhan ye monthe whiche ye worlde bega hight marche god first made complete passed also sythe marche began twenty dayes two befyl chauntecler al pride seuen wyues walkyng besyde caste vp eyen bright sonne sygne taurus ironne fourty degree one somwhat knewe kynde none l e prime crew wt blisful steue sunne sayd clombe vp heuen fourty degree one sowhat iwys madame pertelot worldes blysse herken howe blisful byrdes synge se freshe floures howe sprynge ful myne hert reuel solas sodainly fel sorouful caas euer later ende ioye wo god wote worldly ioye soone ago rethore coude faire endite cronycle myght sauely write souerayne notabilyte nowe euery wyse man herken storie also trewe vndertake boke launcelot du lake woman holde ful great reuerence nowe wol turne ayen sentence pa col foxe ful sleyght iniquite groue wouned yeres thre hygh ymagynacion forne caste nyght hedge braste yerde chauteclere fayre wonte eke wyues repayre bedde wortes styl lay tyl passed vndren day waytyng tyme chaunteclere fal gladly done homycides al wayte lye murdre men false murdrer ruckyng thy den newe scariot newe genylion false dissymuler greke synon broughtest troy vtterly sorowe chauntecler acursed morowe thou thy yerde flewe ye bemes thou ful wel warned thy dremes ilke day peryllous yt god afore wote must nedes opynion certayne clerkes witnesse clerke schole great altercation mater great disputation hath ben hundred thousande men ne boulte bren holy doctour saynt austyn boece byshop bradwardyn whether goddes worthy forewetyng strayneth nedely thyng nedely clepe symple necessyte yf fre choyce graunted thyng nought though god forwote wrought yf wetyng strayneth neuer dele necessyte condycionele wol haue done suche matere tale cocke ye shal toke cousayle wife wt sorow walke yerde vpon morowe met dreme tolde woman counsayles ben ful ofte colde woman counsayle brought v fyrst wo made adam fro paradise go ful mery well e myght displease counsayle woman wolde blame passe ouer sayd game redeth author wher trete matere say woman ye inowe ben cockes wordes myne woman harme deuyne pfaire sonde bathe merily lieth perteloe al susters ayenst sunne chaunteclere free songe meryer mermayde ye see phisiologus saythe vtterly howe syngen wel merily befyl cast eye among wortes butterflye ware foxe laye ful lowe nothyng lyst hym crowe cried cocke cocke vp stert one affrayde hert naturally beestes desyreth flye fro contrary yf may se tho neuer erst seen eye chaunteclere whan gan hym espye wolde haue fledde foxe anone sayd gentil sir ala wol ye done ye afrayde frende nowe certes worse fende yf wolde harme villany come counsayle espye trewly cause commyng onely howe ye syng sothly ye haue mery steuen angel hath heuen therwith ye haue musyke felyng boece syng lorde father god soule blesse eke mother gentylnesse haue house ben great ease certes sir ful fayne wolde please men speken syngyng wol sey mote broken wel myn eyen twey ue ne herde neuer man synge dyd father mornynge certes herte al songe make voyce stronge wold payne yt eyen muste wynke loude muste cryen slouden typtoes ther withal stretche forth necke longe smal eke suche discrecion man regyon songe wysedom might passe haue wel redde dan burnel asse among verse yt cocke preestes sonne yaue hym knocke vpo legges whyle yonge nyce made lese benefyte certayne comparyson betwyxt wysedom discrecion father subtylte nowe syngeth sir saynte charyte let se ye father counterfete pthis chauteclere wynges ga bete man coulde treson aspye rauyshed flaterye ala ye lordes many false flaterour courte manye false lesyngour please wel faythe sothfastnesse vnto saythe redeth ecclesiast flaterye beware ye lordes trecherye pthis chauteclere stode hye vpon toos stretching necke helde eyen cloos gan crowe loude none dan russel foxe starte vp one gorget hent chaunteclere backe toward ye woode bere yet man hym sued desteny mayst eschued ala chaunteclere flewe fro bemes ala wyfe raught dremes friday fyl al mischaunce venus arte goddesse plesaunce sithnes yt thy seruaut chautecler thy seruyce dyd al powere delyte tha worlde multiplye woldest yu suffre thy day dye po gaulfryde dere mayster souerayne wha ye worthy king richard slayn shot complaynedest dethe sore ne nowe thy science thy lore friday chyde dyd ye friday shortly slayne tha wold shew yt coude playn chauntecleres drede payne pcertes suche crye ne lamentacion na neuer ladyes made whan ilion pirrus bright swerde whan hent kyng priam berde slough sayd eneidos made al hennes cloos whan lost chauteclere syght soueraynly dame pertelot shright wel louder dyd hasdruballes wyfe whan husbonde loste lyfe romayns brent cartage ful turment rage wylfully fyre sterte brent herselfe stedfaste herte po woful hennes right cryed ye whan nero brent cyte rome cryed senatours wyues husbondes shulde lese lyues withouten gylte nero hath hem slayne nowe wol turne tale agayne pthe sely wydowe doughters two herde hennes crye make wo dore sterte anon sawe foxe towarde wodde gon bare vpon backe cocke away cryed harowe wel away ha foxe ran eke staues many nother man ran col dogge talbot eke garlonde malkyn distaffe honde ran cowe calfe eke hogges sore ferde dogges shoutyng men woman eke ran herte thought breke yellen fendes hel duckes cryed men wolde hem quell goose feare flewe ouer tree hyues came swarme bee hydous noyse benedicite certes iacke strawe ne meyne ne made neuer shoutes halfe shril whan wolde flemmyng kyl day made vpon foxe brasse blewe trompes boxe horne bone blew pouped therwith shriked shouted semed though heuen shulde fal nowe good men pray herken al lo howe fortune turneth sodainly hope pride enemy cocke lay vpon fox bake al drede vnto foxe spake sayd syr ye yet shulde say wyse god helpe turneth ayen ye proude churles al pestylence vpon fal nowe come vnto woodes syde maugre heed cocke shal abyde wol hym eete faythe anone pthe foxe answerd fayth shal done spake worde al sodaynly cocke brake mouthe deliuerly hygh vpon tree slewe anon whan foxe sawe gon ala chaunteclere ala haue trespas moche made aferde wha hent brought yerde sir dyd wicked entent come downe shal tel ment shal say sothe god helpe pnay shrewe v bothe two first shrew self blode bone thou begyle ofter one thou shalte thy flaterye synge wynkyng eye wynketh whan shulde se al wylfully god let neuer thee nay ye foxe god yeue mischace indiscrete gouernance iangleth wha shuld haue pee plo suche recheles neglygent truste f aterye ye holde tale lye foxe cocke hen taketh moralyte good men saynt poule saythe al written doctryne written iwys taketh fruyte let chaffe styl nowe good god yf thy wyl saythe lorde make v al good men brynge v thy hygh blysse amen phere endeth tale nonnes preest foloweth manciples prologue sir nonnes preest oure hoste sayd anone yblessed thy breche euery stone mery tale chauntecler trouthe yf thou seculer thou woldest tredfoule right yf thou haue corage thou hast might nede hennes wene ye seuen tymes seuentene se whiche brawnes hath gentil preest great necke suche large breest loketh sperhauke hys eyen nedeth colour dyen brasyl ne grayne portyngale sir fayre fal tale ful mery chere sayd nother man ye shal pwote ye stondeth lytel towne whiche called bob vp downe vnder blee cauntebury way gan hoste ape play said sir dunne myre man prayer ne hyre wol awake felowe behynde thefe might ful lightly robbe bynde se howe nappeth se cockes bone howe wol fal horse atones coke london mischaunce conforte knoweth penaunce shal tel tale fey al thought worthe botel hey awake thou coke god yeue sorowe eyleth slepe morowe hast thou steen al night art yu dronke hast yu al night som queen iswonke thou mayste hold vp thyn heed coke ful pale nothing reed sayd sir host god soule blesse fal great heuynesse leuer slepe best gallon wyne chepe pwel manciple yf may ese sir coke wight displese whiche ryde companye hoste wyl curtesye wol nowe excuse thy tale good faythe thy visage ful pale thyn eyen dase sothely thynketh wel wot thy breth ful sowre stinketh sheweth wel thou art wel disposed certayne thou shalt glosed se howe galpeth lo dronke wight though wolde v swalow anon right holde close thy mouthe thy father kyn dyuel hel set fote therin thy ursed rethe wyl enfecte v al fye slynking swyne fye soule mote befal taketh hede sir lusty man owe swete sir wol ye iuste van therto thynketh ye wel shape trowe ye haue dronken wyne ape whan men play strawe wt speche coke wexed al wrawe manciple gan nodde faste lacke spech horse cast lay tyl men vp toke fayre cheuesaunce coke ala ne holde ladyl er ayen sadyl great shouyng fro lyfte vp moche care wo vnweldy sely palled goste manciple spake host pbycause drinke hath domynation vpon man saluation trowe leudely wol tel tale wyne olde moysty ale hath dronke speketh ye nose snyueleth fast eke hathe pose also hath ynough kepe caple slough yf fal caple efte sone shal al haue ynough done lyftyng vp dronken corce tel thy tale hym make force yet manciple fayth thou art nyce thus openly repreue vyce day wol parauenture recleyme bring thy lure mene speke wyl smale thynges pynche thy rekenynges honest yf came prefe pno ye manciple yt gret mischefe myght bringe snare yet leuer paye mare rydeth tha shuld wt stryue wol wrathe mote thriue spake sayd bourde wote ye haue gourd draught wyne ye rype grape right anon ye shal se good iape coke shal drinke therof yf maye vp payne lyfe wol say naye certaynly tellen vessel coke dranke faste ala nedeth dranke ynough beforne whan pouped horne manciple toke gourde agayne drinke coke ful fayne thonked suche wyse coude gan host laugh woder loude sayd se wel necessary wher gon good drinke wt v cary wyl turne rancoure disese accorde loue many worde pese bacchus yblessed thy holy name canste turne ernest game worshyp thonke thy deite mater ye get tel thy tale thou manciple pray wel sir herkeneth say phere endeth manciples prologue foloweth hys tale whan phebus dwelled erth adoun old bokes make cioun moste lusty bacheler al worlde eke best archer slough phetou serpent lay slepyng ayenst sunne vpon day many nother noble worthy dede bow wrought mow rede play coulde euery mynstralcye synge melodye clere voyce soun certes kyng thebe amphion songe walled cyte coude neuer synge halfe wel therto semelyst man sythe worlde began nedeth feture discryue worlde na none fayre lyue therwith fulfylled gentylnesse honoure perfyte worthynesse phebus yt floure bachelerye wel fredome chyualrye disporte signe eke victory pheton telleth v story wonte beare honde bowe phebus house crow within cage ifostred many daye taught speche men teche iaye whyte thys crowe whyte swan countrefete speche euery man coulde whan shulde tel tale al world nightyngale ne coulde hundred thousande dele synge wonderly mery wele phebus house wife whiche loued lyfe nyght day dyd euer dyligence plese reuerence saue onely yf sothe shal sayne ielous wolde haue kept fayne lothe iaped euery wight suche degre al naught auayleth nought good wife yt clene werke thought shulde kept none awayte certayn trewly labour vayne kepe shrewe wol holde nycete spyl laboure kepe wyues thus writen olde clerkes lyues nowe purpose fyrst began worthy phebus dothe al plese wenyng plesauce manhode gouernaunce man shulde put grace god wote may man enbrace distrayne thyng nature hath naturally set creature take byrde put cage al thyne entent thy corage foster tenderly meate drinke al daynties thou canste thynke kepe also clenly thou may al though cage golde neuer gay yet byrde twety thousand folde leuer forest wyde colde go cete wormes suche wretchydnesse euer byrde wyl besynesse escape cage whan maye lyberte byrde desyreth aye let take catte foster mylke tender fleshe make couche sylke let se mouse go wal anon weyueth fleshe couche al euery deyntie house suche appetyte hath erte mouse lo hath luste domynacion appetyte flemeth discrecion wolfe hath also vylanous kynde leudest wolfe may fynde l ste reputacion wol take tyme whan luste haue make al ensamples speke men ben vntrue thyng woman men haue euer lycorouse appetyte lower thyng perfourme delyte wyues neuer fayre ne neuer trewe ne debonayre fleshe newfangel mischaunce ne conne nothyng haue pleasauce sowneth vnto vertue whyle pthis phebus whiche thought gyle disceyued al io yte vnder man lytel reputation nought worthe phebus comparyson harme happeth ofte whiche cometh moche harme wo befel whan phebus absent wyfe anon hath lemman sent lemman certes knauysh speche foryeue beseche pthe wyse plato saythe ye mowe rede worde must nedes acorde dede men shulde tel properly thyng worde muste cosyn werkyng boystouse man right thus say lytel difference truely betwyxt wyfe hye degre body dishonest poore wenche werke bothe amys gentyl estate aboue shal called lady loue tother poore woman shal called wench lemma god wote myn owne dere brother men lay lowe one right betwixt tytlelesse tyraunt outlawe thefe erraunt say dyfference alysaunder tolde sentence tyraunt greater might force meyne slee downe right brenne house home make al playn lo therfore called capitayne outlawe hath smal meyne may great harm ne brynge countrey great mischefe men callen outlawe thefe pbut man textuele wol tel textes neuer dele wol go tale began wha phebus wife sent lemma anon wrought al theyr luste volage whyte crowe hynge aye yt cage behelde werke said neuer worde wha hom come phebus ye lorde crowe songe cuckow cuckow cuckow birde phebus syngest thou ne thou wont merily synge herte reioysyng thy voyce ala songe pby god synge amys phebus al thy worthynesse al thy beaute thy gentylnesse al thy songe thy mynstralsye al thy waytyng blered thyn eye one lytel reputatyon worthe comparison mountenace gnat mote thriue thy bed thy wife sawe hym swyne wol ye ye crow anon told sadde token wordes bolde howe wyfe done lechery great shame great vyllany tolde eft sawe eyen pthis phebus gan awayward prie thought woful herte braste two bowe bent set therin flo yre hath wyfe slayne effecte sayne sorow wherof brake mynstralsye bothe harpe lute getern sautrye eke brake arowes bowe thus spake crowe ptraytour tonge scorpion thou haste brought confusyon ala wrought nere deed dere wyfe gemme lusty heed sadde eke trewe lyest thou deed face pale hewe ful gyltlesse durst swere iwys rakel honde foule amys troubled wytte yre retchelesse vnauysed smytest gyltlesse wantrust ful false suspection thy wytte thy discretion oh euery man beware rekylnesse ne trowe thyng without strog wytnesse smyte sone thou wete auysed wel sykerly ye execution vpon yre suspection ala thousande folke hath rekel yre fully fordone brought hem myre ala sorowe wol selfe sle crowe false said wol quite anon thy false tale thou songe whylom lyke nyghtyngale nowe shalt thou false thefe thy song forgon eke thy whyte fethers euerychon ne neuer al thy lyfe shalte thou speke thus shul men traytour awreke thou thyn spring euer shal blake ne neuer swete noyse shal ye make euer cryen ayenst tempest rayne token wife slayne crowe sterte anon pulled hys whyte fethers euerychon made blacke reft al songe eke speche dore slonge vnto dyuel whiche betake cause ben al crowes blake plordiges ensaple wol pray beware take kepe say ne telleth neuer man lyfe howe hath dight wife wol hate mortally certayne dan salomon wyse clerkes sayne techeth man kepe tonge wel sayd tertuel nathelesse thus taught dame sonne thinke ye crowe goddes name sone kepe wel thy tonge kepe thy frede wycked tonge worse fende sonne fende men may hem blesse sonne god endelesse goodnesse walled tonge tethe lyppes eke man shulde auyse speke sonne ful ofte mykel speche hath many man spylte clerkes teche lytel speche spoken auysedly man shente speke generally sonne thy tonge shuldest thou restrayne al tymes whan thou doest thy payne speke god honoure prayere fyrst vertue sonne yf thou wolt lere restrayne kepe wel thy tonge thus lerne child whan yonge sonne mykel spekyng vnauysed lasse spekyng ynough suffysed cometh mykel harme thus taught moche speche synne wanteth naught woste thou wherfore rakel tonge serueth right asworde forcutteth forke ueth arme two dere sonne right tonge cutteth frendshyp al tangler god abhomynable rede salomon wyse honourable rede dauid psalmes rede senecke sonne speke ne wyth thy heed deck dissimule thou deefe yt thou ianglour speketh perious matere fleming sayth lerne thou leste lytel ianglyng causeth moche reste sonne thou wicked word hast saide dare drede bewrayde hath missayd dare wel sayne may way clepe worde agayne thyng sayd sayd forthe gothe though repent neuer loth thral hath sayde tale whiche nowe yuel apayde sonne beware none auctour newe tidynges whether false trewe thou come amonge hye lowe kepe wel thy tonge thynke crowe phere endeth manciples tale begynneth person prologue manciple hys tale ended sonne fro south syde dyscended lowe syght degree fyue twe tye hyghte ten clocke gesse elleuen foote lytell lesse shadowe tyme suche fete lengthe parted syxe fete equally proportion rwyth moones exaltation meane libra alwaye gan ascende entrynge thropes ende hoste wont gye aye thys case thys ioly companye sayd thys wyse lordynges euerychone nowe lacketh v tale one fulfylled sentence decre woll nowe tell tale let se almoste fulfylled myne ordinaunce pray god yeue ryght good chauce telleth thys tale v lustely syr preest arte thou vicary arte thou person say soth thy fay thou breke thou play euery man saue thou hath tolde tale vnbokell shewe v thy male truely thynketh thy chere thou shuldest knyt vp well great matere tell v fable anone kockes bone pthys person hym answerde one thou gettest fable none tolde paule wryteth timothe repreueth hem wayuen sothfastnesse teachen fable suche wretchednesse shulde sowe draffe fyst maye sowe wheate yf lyst whych saye yf ye lyst moralite vertuous matere yf ye woll yeue audience wolde full fayne christes reuerence done pleasaunce lefull trusteth well sotherne man ieste rum ram ruf letter god wote ryme holde lytel better therfore yf ye lyst woll glose woll tell lytell tale prose knyt vp al thys feest make ende iesu hys grace wyt sende shewe waye thys voyage thylke perfyte gloriouse pylgrimage hyght hierusalem celestiall yf ye vouchsaue anone shall begyn vpon tale whych pray tel aduyse better say nathelesse thys meditacion put aye vnder correction clerkes textuell take sentence trusteth well therfore make protestation woll stande correction pvpon thys worde haue assented sone semed done ende vertuous sentence yeue hym space audience bad hoste shulde hym saye tell hys tale hym pray hoste wordes v syr preest nowe fayre mote befal sayeth ye lyste shal gladly wyth word sayd manere telleth meditation hasteth sunne woll adoun beth fructuous lytell space wel god sende grace phere endeth persones prologue foloweth hys tale pieremi vi state super vias et vt dete et interrogate de semitis antiquis que sit via bona ambulate ea et inuenietis refrigerium animabus vestris ovr swete lorde god heuen wolde shulde peryshe tourne al know lege hym blysfull lyfe perdurable amonysheth v prophete ieremye sayeth thys wyse standeth vpon wayes seeth asketh olde pathes saye olde sentence whych good waye walketh waye ye shall fynde refreshynge soules c many wayes espirituels lede folke oure lorde iesu christe reygne glorye whych wayes full noble way full couenable maye fayle man ne woman synne hath mysgone fro ryght waye hierusalem celestiall thys waye called penitence whych man shulde gladly herke enquire wyth al hys herte wete penitece whych called penitence many maners bene action werkynges penitence howe many speces bene penitence whych thinges appertayne behoue penitence thynges dystourbe penitence saynt ambrose sayeth penitence playnynge man gylte yt hath done thynge whych ought playne doctoure sayeth penitence waymentynge man soroweth synne paineth selfe hath mysdone penitece wyth certayne circumstaunces repentauce man holt hym selfe sorowe payne hys gyltes shalbe penytent shall fyrst bewayle synnes hath done stedfastlye purpose hys herte haue shryfte mouth satisfaccion neuer thynge whyche hym ought bewayle complayne continue good workes el hys repentaunce maye auayle saint isoder sayeth iaper lyer repentaunt eftsone doth thinge hym ought repent wepynge stynte synne may auayle natthelesse shal hope euery tyme man falleth neuer ofte maye aryse penauce yf haue grace certayne great doute sayeth saynt gregorye vnnethes aryseth synne charged wyth ye charge yuel vsage therfore repentaunt folke stynt synne leue synne synne leue holy churche holdeth syker theyr saluacion synneth verely repe teth hym hys laste ende holy churche yet hopeth hys saluacion great mercye lorde iesu christ hys repentaunce take syker waye pand nowe syth haue declared thynge penitence ye shal vnderstad ben thre action penitence fyrst man baptysed hath synned saynt austyn sayeth penitent hys olde synfull lyfe maye begynne newe clene lyfe certes yf baptysed wythout penitence hys olde gylte retayneth ye marke baptyme grace ne remissyon hys synnes tyll haue repentaunce defaute thys men deedly synne haue receyued baptysme thyrde defaute thys men fall veniall synnes baptysme fro day day therof sayeth saynt augustyne penitence good humble folke penitence euery daye speces penitence ben thre one hem solempne comune thyrd priuy penauce solempne two maners put holy churche lent slaughter chyldren suche maner thynge man hath synned openly whyche synne fame openly spoken countrey holy church iugement dystrayneth hym open penaunce comen penaunce preestes enioyne men certayne case go peraueture naked pylgrymage barefote priuy penaunce men al daye priuy synnes whych shryue v priuely receyue priuy penaunce pnowe shalt thou vnderstande behouefull necessarye perfyte penytence thys stonte thre thynges contricion herte confession mouthe satisfaction whych sayth saynt iohn chrisostome penitence dystrayneth man accept benignely euery payne hym enioyned wyth contricion herte shryfte mouthe wyth satisfaction werdynge maner humilite thys frutefull penitence ayenst thre thynges whyche wrath lorde iesu christe thys saye delyte thynkynge retchlesnesse speakinge wycked syn full werkynge ayenst wycked gyltes penitence maye lykened vnto tree roote thys tree contricion hydeth hym herte hym verye repentaut ryght roote tree hydeth hym earth thys roote contricion spryngeth stalke beareth braunches leues confessyon frute satisfaction whych christ sayth hys gospel doth digne fruyte penitence thys fruyte men maye knowe tre rote hyde herte man ne ye brau ches ne leues confession therfore lorde iesu christ sayeth thus fruyte hem shall ye knowe hem thys roote also spryngeth sede grace yt whych sede mother sykernesse thys sede egre hote grace thys sede spryngeth god remembraunce daye dome paynes hell thys mater sayeth salomon ye drede god man forletteth hys synne heate thys sede loue god desyrynge ioye perdurable thys hete draweth herte man god doth hate hys synne sothly nothynge sauoureth well chyld ye mylke hys nouryce ne nothynge hym abhominable malke whe medled wyth meate ryght synfull man loueth hys synne hym semeth hym moost swete thynge fro tyme loueth sadlye lorde iesu christe desyreth lyfe perdurable hym nothinge abhominable sothly lawe god loue god whyche dauid prophete sayeth haue loued thy lawe hated wyckednesse loueth god kepeth hys lawe hys worde pthys tree sawe prophete daniell spirite visyon nabuchodonosor counsayled hym penitence penaunce tree lyfe hem receyue holdeth hym penitence blessed sentence salomon thys penitence contricion man shal vnderstand foure thynges say contrityon whyche ben cause moue man contricion howe shulde contryte contricion auayleth soule thus contricion sorowe receyueth hys herte hys synnes wyth sadde purpose shryue hym penaunce neuer synne thys sorowe shalbe thys maner sayeth saynt bernarde shalbe heuye greuous full sharpe poynaunt herte pfyrste man hath agylted hys lorde hys creatoure sharpe poynaunt hath agylted hys father celestiall yet sharpe poynaunt hath wrathed agylted bought hym wyth hys preciouse bloude hath delyuered v fro bondes synne fro cruelte dyuell fro paynes hell cause ought moue man co tricion bene syxe fyrste man shall remembre hym hys synnes loke remembraunce ne hym delyte waye great shame sorowe hys synnes iob sayeth synfull men done workes worthy confessyon therfore sayeth ezechiel wol remembre al yeres lyfe bytternesse herte god sayeth apocalypse reme bre ye whence ye fall tyme ye synned ye chyldren god lymmes raygne god youre synne ye waren thrall foule membres fende hate aungels slaunder holye churche foode false serpent perpetual matere fyre hel yet foule abhominable ye trespace oft tymes doth houde returneth ayen eate hys owne spewynge yet ye fouler youre longe co tinuynge synne youre synfull vsage whyche ye rooted youre synne beest hys donge suche maner thoughtes make man haue shame hys synne delyte god sayeth prophet ezechiel ye shal remebre wayes shal dysplease sothly synnes ben wayes lede folke hell seconde cause oughte make man haue dysdayne sinne sayeth saynt peter doth syn thrall synne synne putteth man great thraldome therfore sayeth prophete ezechiel wente sorowfull dysdayne selfe certes well ought haue dysdayne synne wythdrawe hym fro thraldome vylanye lo sayeth seneke thys mater sayeth thus though wyste neyther god ne man shulde neuer knowe yet wolde haue dysdayne synne seneke also sayeth borne greater thynge thral body make body thral ne fouler thrall maye man ne woman make hys bodye yeue body synne al ye foulest churle foulest woman lyueth lest value yet foule seruitude euer fro hygher degre man falleth thrall god worlde vyle abhomynable good god well ought man haue great dysdayne synne sythe throughe synne free made bonde therfore sayeth saynt austyne yf thou hast dysdayne thy seruaunt yf oftede synne haue thou dysdayne thou thy selfe shuldest synne take rewarde thyne owne value thou ne foule thy selfe ala wel ought haue dysdayne seruau te thralles synne sore ashamed selfe god hys endlesse goodnesse hathe sette hygh astate yeue hem wytte strength bodye heale beauty prosperite boughte hem fro death wyth hys herte bloude vnkyndlye agaynst hys gentylnesse quyte hym vylaynously slaughter owne soules good god ye woman bene greate beautye remembreth prouerbe salomon sayeth lykeneth fayre woman foole body rynge golde yt worne groyne sowe ryghte sow wroteth euery ord ne wroteth beaute stynkyng ord e synne thyrde cause oughte meue man contricion drede daye dome horrible paynes hel saynt ierome sayeth euery tyme reme breth daye dome quake whe eate drynke euer semeth trompe sowneth myne eare ryseth ye vp bene deed cometh iudgement good god moch ought man drede suche iugement ther shalbe al saint poule sayeth ye sete lorde iesu christe shal make generall congregation man may absent certes auayleth none essoyne ne excusation oure defautes shalbe iuged also w rkes shal opely knowe sayeth saint bernarde ne shal pleading auayle ne sleyght shal yeue rekenyng euery ydell worde shall haue iuge maye dysceyued ne corrupte certes thoughtes bene dyscouered hym ne prayer ne mede shall corrupte therfore sayeth salomo wrath god ne wol spare wyght prayer ne yeffe therfore daye dome hope escape wherfore sayeth saint anselme full greate anguyshe shall synfull folke haue tyme shal ye fyerce wroth iuge sytte aboue vnder hym horrible pytte hell open destroy muste knowe hys synnes whych synnes openlye ben shewed god euery creature lefte syde mo dyuels herte may thynke hale drawe synfull soules payne hel wythin hertes folke shalbe bytynge conscience wythout forth shall worlde al brennynge whyther shal wretched synfull man flye hyde hym certes maye hyde hym must come forth shewe hym certes sayeth saynt ierome earth shall cast hym see also ayre shalbe ful thonder clappes lyghtenynges sothly woll remembreth thynges gesse thys synne shall turne hym delyte greate sorowe dredde payne hell therfore sayeth iob god suffre lorde may whyle bewaile wepe er go without returnynge derke londe couered wyth darkenesse death lade mysese derknesse shadowe death none ordre ordynaunce ferefull drede euer shall last lo maye ye se iob prayed respyte whyle bewepe wayle hys trespace sothly one day respyte better al treasoure thys worlde moche man maye acquyte hym selfe god penitence thys worlde treasoure therfore shulde praye god yeue hym respyte whyle bewepe wayle hys trespace certes al sorowe man myght make fro begynnynge worlde ny lytell thynge regarde sorowe hell cause iob calleth hell lande darknesse vnderstandeth calleth lande earth stable neuer shal fayle derke hell hath defaute lyght material certes darke lyght shall come fyre euer shall brenne shall turne hym payne hell sheweth hym horrible deuels hym turmenteth couered wyth darkenesse death saye hel shal haue defaute syght god certes syght god ye lyfe perdurable derkenesse death bene synnes wretched man hath done whyche dystourbe hym se face god ryght derke cloude betwyxt v sunne londe mysese bycause ben thre maner defautes ayenst thre thynges folke thys worlde haue thys present lyfe saye honour delyces richesse ayenst honoure haue hell shame confusyon well ye wote men call honoure reuerence man doth man hell none honoure ne reuerence certes reuerence shalbe kynge knaue whyche god sayeth prophete ieremye folke dyspise shalbe dyspyte honour also called great lordshyp shall wyght serue harme turment honoure also called great dygnite hyghnesse hel shal al fortroden dyuels god sayeth horrible deuels shall go come vpon heedes dampned folke thys moche ye hygher present lyfe shal abated defoyled hell ayenst rychesse thys worlde shal haue mysese pouerte shal foure thynges defaute treasoure whyche dauid sayeth ryche folke enbrase knytte herte treasoure thys worlde shall slepe slepynge death nothynge ne shul fynde hondes treasoure ouer mysese hel shalbe defaute meate drynke god sayeth thus moses shalbe wasted wyth honger byrdes hell shal deuoure hem wyth bytter death gall dragon shall drynke venym dragon morsel also mysease shalbe defaute clothynge shalbe naked bodye clothynge saue fyre whych brenne fylthes naked shall soule maner vertues whyche clothynge soule bene gaye robe softe shetes smale shertes lo sayeth god hem prophete isaye vnder hem shall strewed moughtes couertures shall wormes hell also mysease shalbe defaut frendes poore hath good frendes frende neyther god ne creature shalbe frende eche hem shall hate wyth deedly hate sonnes doughters shall rebell ayenst father mother kynrede ayenst kynred chyde dispyse eche daye nyght god sayeth prophete micheas louynge chyldre yt whylom loued fleshlye eche wolde eche hem eate yf myght howe shulde loue togyther paynes hell whe hated eche ye prosperite life trust wel fleshly loue deadly hate sayeth prophet dauid yu loueth wyckednesse hateth soule hateth hys owne soule certes may loue none wyght maner therfore hel solace ne frendshyp euer yt kynredes ben hel cursynges chydynges ye deedly hate amonge also shal haue defaute maner delyces certes helyces ben appetite fyue wittes syght hearynge smellynge sauourynge touchynge hell syght shalbe ful derknesse smoke therfore full teares hearynge full waylynge gryntynge tethe sayeth iesu christe nostrylles shalbe ful stynkynge sayeth isaye prophete sauourynge shalbe full bytter gall touchynge al bodyes ycouered wyth fyre neuer shall quenche wyth wormes neuer shall dye god sayeth mouthe isaye moche shall wene maye dye payne death flye fro payne maye vnderstande wordes iob sayeth shadowe deathe certes shadowe hath lykenes thynge whych shadowed shadowe ye thynge whych shadowed ryght fareth payne hel lyke death horrible anguyshe payneth hem euer though shulde dye anone certes shal dye sayeth saynt gregory wretched caytyses shall death wythout death ende wythout end defaute wythout fayling death shal alway lyue ende shall euer begyn defaute shal fayle therfore sayeth saynt iohn euangelyst shal folowe death shall fynde hym shall desyre dye death shall slye fro hem also iob sayeth hel ordre rule al god hath create al thynge ryghte order nothynge wythout order thynges ben ordred nombred yet nathelesse ben dampned ben nothynge order ne hold none order erth ne shal beare hem frute prophete dauid sayeth god shall destroye frute earth hem ne water ne shal yeue hem moysture ne eyre refreshynge ne fyre lyght sayeth saynt basil e brennynge fyre thys worlde shal god yeue hell hem bene dampned lyght clerenesse shall yeue heauen hys chyldren ryghte good men yeue fleshe chyldren bone houndes shal haue none hope escape sayeth saynt iob last shal errour grisly dreade dwell without ende horrour alway dred come drede shal alwaye dwell hertes hem damned therfore haue lost hope vii cause fyrst god yt iuge shalbe without mercye hem maye please hym ne none saynctes ne maye gyue nothyng raunsom ne shall haue voyce speke hym ne may stye fro payne ne haue goodnesse hem maye shewe delyuer hem fro payne therfore sayeth salomon wycked man dyeth wha deed shal haue hope escape fro payne wolde wel vnderstonde paynes bethynke hym well hath deserued paynes synnes e shuld haue talet sygh w ye synge playe sayth salomon whoso sciece knowe paynes ben ordeyned synne wolde make sorowe science sayeth sayncte austyn maketh man weyment herte fourth poynt ought make man haue contrition sorowfull remembraunce good hath lefte erthe also good hath loste sothlye good werkes hath left eyther good werkes wroughte er fyll deedly sinne el good werkes wrought whyle laye synne sothlye good werkes dyd fell synne ben mortifyed astonyed dull oft synnynge werkes dyd whyle laye syne deed lyfe perdurable heuen good werkes ben mortifyed oft synning whiche dyd beinge charitie may quyck ayen without penitece sayth god mouth ezechiel yf ryght full man returne ayen fro ryghtousnesse wyckednesse shall lyue nay al good werkes hath done shal neuer remembraunce shall dye synne vpon chapter sayth gregorye thus shall vnderstonde principally yf deedly syn nought reherse drawe memory good werkes haue wrought certes werkynge deedlye syn truste good werke haue done saye haue therby lyfe perdurable heue nathelesse good werkes quycken come agayne helpe auayle haue lyfe perdurable heuen whan haue contrition sothlye good werkes men whyle deedly synne moch wer deedly syn may neuer quycke ce te thynge neuer lyfe maye neuer quycke nathelesse al auayle haue lyfe perdurable yet auayle abredge payne hel el get teporall rychesses el god wol rather enlumyn lyght hert synful man haue repentauce eke auayl vse man good werkes fende haue lesse power soule thus carteys lorde iesu christ ne wol good werke lost somwhat shal auayle moch good werkes men done whyle ben good lyfe ben amortified syn folowyng also syth good werkes men whyle ben dedly syn ben vtterly deed haue ye lyse perdurable wel may man good werke ne doeth synge fresshe newe songe iay tout perdu mon temp et mon labure certes synne byreueth man bothe goodnesse nature also goodnesse grace sothlye grace holye ghooste fareth lyke fyre maye ydle fyre fayleth anon forletteth werkyng ryght grace fayleth anon forletteth werkynge leseth synfull man goodnesse glory onely behyght good men labour werke wel maye sory oweth hys lyfe god loge hath lyued also longe shall lyue goodnesse ne hath pay det god whome oweth hys lyfe trust well shall yeue accoptes sayth saynct bernarde goodes haue ben yeue hym present lyfe hath hem dispeded insomoch yt ther shall perysh heer heed ne moment houre ne shal perisshe hys tyme ne shall yeue rekenynge fyfth thynge ought moue man contrition remembraunce passion lorde iesu chryst suffred synnes sayth saynt bernard whyle lyue shall haue remebrauce trauayles lord iesu christ suffred preachynge werynesse trauaylynge temptation whan fasted longe wakynges whan prayed hys teares whan wept pytie good people wo shame fylth men sayde hym foule spyttynge men spyt face buffettes yt men yaue hym foule mowes reproues men sayde hym nayles wyth whiche nayled crosse remnaunt passion suffred synnes nothyng gylt ye shal vnderstond man synne euerye maner ordre ordynaunce turned vp downe soth god reason sensualitie body man bene ordayned eche foure thynges shoulde haue lordshyppe ouer thus god haue lordshyppe ouer reason reason ouer sensualytye sensualitie ouer body man sothly whan man synneth ordre ordinaunce turned vp downe therfore moche reason man ne woll subiect ne obeysaut god lorde ryght therfore leseth lordshyppe shulde haue ouer sensualytie also ouer bodye man sensualitie rebelleth ayenst reson way ledeth reson lordshyp ouer sensualitie ouer body ryght reason rebell god ryght sensualitie rebell reason body also certes disordinaunce rebellion lord iesu christ bought vpon precious body full dere hearken wyse moche reason rebel god therfore man worthye haue sorowe deed suffred oure lord iesu christ man betrayed disciple distrayned bound bloude brast euery nayle hondes sayth austin ferthermore moche reason man wol daunt sensualite may therfore man worthye haue shame thys suffred lord iesu christ man whan spyt visage ferthermore moch tha caytif body man rebel reso sensualitie therfore worthy death suffred lord iesu chryst vpon crosse parte bodye free withoute greate payne bytter passyon suffred lord iesu chryst neuer forfayted therfore resonably maye sayd iesu maner moch pained thinges neuer deserued moch defouled shame man worthye haue therfore may synful man wel say saynt bernarde accursed bytternesse synne ther must suffred moche bitternesse certes dyuers discordaunce wickednesse passyon iesu chryste ordayned dyuers thynges thus certes synfull man soule betrayed deuyll couetyse temporal prosperitie scorned disceyte cheseth fleshly desyres yet turmented impatience aduersitie bespet seruage subiection syn last slayne fynallye disordinauce synful man iesu christ betrayed yt boude came vnbynde v synne payne bescorned yt shuld haue honoured al thinges tha vysage ought desyred sene al kynde visage angel desire loke vylaynsly bespet scourged yt nothing trespassed finally tha crucifyed slayne accoplisshed wordes esay wouded mysdedes defoyled felony sith iesu christ toke paine wickedness moch ought synful man wepe bewayle hys synnes god sonne heuen al payne endure sixt thing shuld meue man cotrition ye hope thre thinges say foryeuenesse syn ye yeft grace well ye glory heuen wt god shall rewarde man good dedes moche iesu christ yeueth v yeftes largenesse souerayn bouty therfore called iesus nazarenus rex indeoru iesus saye sauyour saluacio men shall hope haue foryeuenesse synnes proprely saluacion synnes therfore said angel ioseph thou shalte call name iesus shall saue people synnes sayth peter none name vnder heuen yt yeue man man maye saued iesus nazarenus moche saye floryshing shal hope yeueth hym remyssyon synnes shall yeue hym al grace well dore thyne hert sayth iesus called enter openeth shal haue foryeuenes synne wyl entre hym grace suppe hym good werkes shall whiche werkes ben foode soul shal suppe ye great ioye shal yeue hym thus shall man hope werkes penaunce god shall yeue hym hys reygne behyghte hym gospell shal man vnderstonde whiche maner shall contrytion saye shalbe vniuersall totall saye man shalbe repentaunt synnes hath done delyte thought ryght peryllous ben two maner consentinges one hem called consentyng affection whan man moued syn delyteth hym longe thynke synne reason apperceyueth well synne ayenst law god yet reason refrayneth foule delyte talent though se well apertlye ayenste reuerence god although reason ne consent synne dede yet saye doctoures suche delyte dwelleth longe ful perillous albeit neuer lytle also man shoulde sorowe namely euer hath desyred ayenst lawe god wyth perfyt consentyng reason thereof doubt deedly synne consentyng certes deedly synne fyrste man thought delyte forth consentynge dede wherfore saye many ne repet hem neuer thoughtes delytes ne neuer shryue hym onelye dede greate synnes outwarde wherfore saye suche wycked delytes bene subtyll begylers shalbe dampned moreouer man ought sorowe wycked wordes well hys wycked dedes certes repentauce synguler syn repentaunt synnes el repent hym synnes syngular syn may auayle certes god almightye good therfore eyther foryeueth el ryght nought therfore sayth saynct austyn wot certaynly god enemye euery synner tha obserueth one synne shal haue yeuenesse synnes naye moreouer cotrition shuld wonder sorowfull anguishous therfore yeueth hym god playnly hys mercy therfore wha soule anguyshed sorowfull wt remembraunce god prayer myght come hym ferthermore contrition must contynuall man haue stedfaste purpose shryue hym amende hym lyfe sothly whyle contrition lasteth man maye euer hope haue foryeuenesse thys cometh hate synne destroyeth bothe synne hym selfe also folke hys power sayeth dauid loue god hate wyckednesse loue god loue loueth hate yt hateth last thynge men shal vnderstande wherfore auayleth contrition saye contrition somtyme delyuereth man fro synne dauid sayth saye sayd dauid purposed fermely shryue thou lorde releaseddest synne ryght contrition auayleth without sad purpose shrift haue oportunitye ryght lytle worth shryfte satisfaction withoute contrition moreouer contrition destroyeth priso hell maketh weake feble strengthes deuylles restoreth yeftes holy ghost al good vertues clenseth soule syn delyuereth fro payne hell fro company dyuel fro seruage synne restoreth goodes spirituels companye communion holy churche ferthermore maketh hym whylom sonne yre sonne grace thynges ben proued holye wrytte therfore wolde set hys entent thynges full wyse truly ne shulde haue al life corage synne yeue hert body serue chryst therof hym homage truly lord hath spared v meke lye follyes yf ne pytye mannes soule sorye songe myghte synge pexplicit prima par penitentie et incipit par secunda seconde parte penitence confessyon signe contrition shul ye vnderstod confessyon yf ought done thynges couenable confessyon fyrst shalt thou vnderstond ye confessyon shewyng synnes prest saye must confesse hym condicions belonge synne ferforth al must said nothing excused ne hydde auaunt thy good werkes also necessary vnderstonde whence synnes spring howe entre ben springyng synnes sayeth saynt poule thys wyse ryght one man syn entred fyrst worlde syn deth ryght deth entreth men synne man adam synne entred world whe brake commaundement god therfore fyrst mighty ne shuld haue dyed becam must nedes dye whether wolde progeny worlde sayd man synned loke state innocency whe adam eue naked paradyse shamed therof serpent wylyest beastes god made sayde woman commaunded god yt ye shulde eate euery tree paradyse woman answered frute sayde tree paradyse fede v frute mydle tre paradyse god forbod v eat touche lest shuld dye serpent sayd woman nay nay ye shall dye death forsoth god wotte daye ye eat therof eye shall open ye shalbe goddes knowing good harme woman tha saw tree good fedyng fayr eyen delectable syght toke frute tree ate yaue husbonde ate anon eyen hem opened wha knew wer naked sowed fyggeleues maner breches hyde mebres maye ye se deedly syn hath fyrst suggestion fende sheweth adder afterwarde delyte flesh sheweth eue consentyng reason sheweth ada trust wel though ye fend tempted eue say flesh fleshe delyte beautye frute defended yet certes tyll reason say adam consented eatyng frute yet stode state innocencie sayd adam toke sayde original syn hym fleshly discended engendred vyle corrupte mater whan soule put oure bodyes right anon contract original syn erst onely payne concupiscencie afterward payne syn therfore bene borne sonnes wrath dampnatio perdurable nere baptym receyue whiche benymmeth v coulpe forsoth pyne dwelleth wyth v temptation pyne hyght concupyscence concupiscence whan wrongfully disposed ordayned man maketh hym coueyte couetysye flesshe fleshly synne syght eyen erthlye thynges also couetyse hyghnesse pryde herte speake first couetise concupiscence lawe membres lawfully made rightful iudgement god saye moche man obeysaunte god lorde therfore flesh hym disobeysaunt concupiscence whiche called noryshing synne occasyon synne therfore whyle man hath within pyne concupyscence impossyble tepted somtyme moued fleshe syn thynge may fayle long lyueth may wel waxe feble vertue baptim grace god penitence fully ne shall neuer quenche ne shall somtyme moued self wer al refrayned sycknesse malyce sorcery colde drynkes lo sayth poule flesh coueteth ayenst spyryte spyrite ayenst flesh bene contrary stryuen man maye alway wold saynt poul greate penaunce water londe water night day greate peryl great pyne londe famyne thurst colde clothlesse one sloned almost deth yet sayde ala caytyfe man shall delyuer fro prison caytyfe body saynt ierom whe longe yme dwelled desert companye wylde beastes meate herbes water drink ne bed naked erth wherfore flesshe blacke ethiopien hete nye distroyed colde yet sayd e brennyng lechery boyled al body wherfore wot well disceyued saye tempted bodyes wytnesse saynt iames yt sayeth euerye wyght tempted hys owne consciece say eche v hath mater occasion tempted norishing syn body therfore sayth saynt iohn euangelist yf say ben without synne disceyue self truthe v shall ye vnderstonde syn wexeth encreaeth man first thing noryshing syn spoke fleshlye cocupiscence cometh suggestyon deuil say deuyls belous bloweth fire cocupiscence bethinketh wheder wyll ye thing tepted yf man withstod weyue first entisyng fleshe fende tha syn yf tha feleth anon flame de te tha good beware kepe well el wyll fall anon cosentynge syn wyll yf maye haue tyme place mater sayth moses deuyll maner ye fed sayth wyll chace pursue man wycked suggestyon wyll take hym mouyng steryng syn woll depart pryse praye delyberation lust shal accoplyshed delyte wyll drawe sworde consentynge certes ryght swerde departeth thynge two peces ryght cosentyng departeth god fro man wyl sle hym hond dede syn thus sayth fende certes man deed soule thus syn acco plyshed temptation delyte consentyng syn actual forsoth syn two maners eyther venyall deedly syn sothlye whan man loueth creature iesu chryste creatour deedly synne venyall synn yf man loue iesu chryst lesse tha ought forsoth dede venyal syn ful perylous mynissheth loue man shuld haue god therfore yf man charge hym selfe manye suche venyall synnes certes somtyme discharge hym hem shryft may ful lyghtly mynysh hym al loue hath iesu christ wyse skyppeth venyall synne deedly sin certes man chargeth soule venyall synnes enclyned fall deedlye synne therfore lette v neglygent charge v venyal synnes prouerbe sayth many small make great herken ensample greate vawe see commeth sometyme greate vyolence drowneth shyppe harme somtyme smal droppes water entreth lytle creueys tymbre botume shyp yf men geglygent dyscharge hem bytymes therfore althoughe dyfference betwyxt two cause drownynge allgates shyppe drowned ryghte fareth sometyme deedlye synne anoyous venyall synnes whan multyplye man greatlye worldlye thynges loueth whyche synneth venyally great herte loue god therfore loue euery thing beset god ne done pryncipallye goddes sake althoughe man loue selfe god yet venyal synne deedly synne whe loue thing weyeth hert man moche loue god deedly synne sayth saynct austyn man turneth hys hert fro god souerayne bounty maye chaunge gyueth hert thyng may chaunge flit certes euery thyng saue god heauen sothe manne gyue hys loue whyche oweth god hert vnto creature certes moche loue yeueth creature moche bereueth fro god therfore doth synne dettour god ne yeldeth god al det saye al loue hert sith vnderstandeth generally whiche venyall syn couenable tell specyallye synne many peraduenture demeth hem synnes shryueth hym thinges yet neuerthelesse synnes sothly clerkes write saye euery tyme man eateth drinketh suffiseth ye sustenauce body certayne doth synne also speaketh nedeth sinne also herkeneth benignly coplaynt pore also heale body wol fast folkes faste withoute cause resonable also slepeth nedeth cometh perchauce late church werkes charitie also vseth wyfe without souerayne desyre enge drure honour god entent yelde wyfe dette body also wol vysit sycke prisoner yf maye also yf loue wyfe child wordly thyng reason requyreth also yf flatter blandyse ought necessitye also yf minish withdrawe ye almesse pore also apparel meat deliciously nede eate hastelye lycorousnes also yf talke vanityes churche god seruise talker ydle wordes foly vylanye shal yelde accomptes daye dome also behyghteth assureth thynges may performe also yt lyghtnesse folye myssayeth scorneth neighbour also hath wicked susspection thynge ne wot sothfastnesse thinges mo without nobre synnes sayth austyn shal men vnderstande albeit yt none erthly man maye eschue al venyal synnes yet maye refrayne hym brennyng loue yt hath lord iesu chryst prayer confession good werkes shalbe lytle grefe saeth austin yf man loue god insuch maner al euer doth loue god ye loue god verely bre neth loue god loke moch one droppe water whiche doth fal great furneys ful fyre anoyeth greueth brennyng fyre lyke maner anoyeth greueth venyall syn vnto stedfast perfyte loue sauyour iesu chryst ferthermore maye also refrayne put awaye venyall syn commenyng receyuing worthely body sauyour iesu chryst also takynge holy water almesdede general confessyon confi masse complyn blessynges byshops prestes good werkes pde septem peccatis mortalibus et de eorum dependentus circumstantis et speciebus expediet tel bene seuen deedly synnes saye chefetayns synnes renne lee dyuers maners bene called seuen cenes moch chefe sprynge al synnes roote seuen synnes pryde general rote al harmes rote spryngeth certen brauches yre enuy accidie slouth auarice couetyse come vnderstanding glotony lechery eche chefe synnes haue braunches twigges shalbe declared
