chapiter folowynge though yt noman vtterly tel bre twigges harmes com pryde yet wol shew parte hem ye shall vnderstonde inobedience auauntyng ypocrisy dispite errogance impedence swellyng hert insolence elation impacience strife contumacy presumption irreuerence pertinacy veyne glory many twygges declare inobedience disobeyeth dispyte commaundementes god souerains gostly father auaunter bosteth harme boute hath done ipocrite bedeth shewe hym sheweth hym seme dispitous hath disdayne hys neighbour saye hys euyn christen hath dispite hym ought errogance thynketh yt hath bou e hym hath weneth shulde haue hem hys desertes el demeth impedent yt hys pride hath shame hys pride ne synne swellyng hert whan man reioyseth hym harme hath done insolence dispiceth iudgement folke regard value hys conyng hys spekyng hys berynge elation whan ne may neither suffre haue maister ne felow impacient wyl taught ne rebuked hys vyce stryfe denyeth trouth wyttyngly defendeth hys foly c umaxe throughe hys indignation ayenst euerye auctorite power hem ben hys souerayns presumption wha man vndertaketh emprise ought el may nat called surquidie irreuerence whan manne dothe honoure hym ought loke reuerenced pertinacye whan men defende foly trust much owne witte vaynglory haue pompe delite hys temporel hynesse glorye hym worldlye estate ianglynge whan men speke much folke clappeth myl take kepe say yet priuy spice pride wayteth fyrst salewed woll salue lesse worthy tha also wayteth desyreth sytte el go aboue hym waye kysse paxe encensed go offrynge hys neyghbour semblable thynges ayenst dutie paraueture hath hys hert hys entente suche proude desyre magnyfyed honoured people nowe bene two maners pride one hem wythin hert man wythout whych forsayd thynges sothlye mo haue sayd apertayn pride hert man spice pride ben wythout nathles one spice pride signe ryghte gay leuesel tauerne signe wyne celer thys many thynges speche coutenance outragious aray clothyng certes yf ther ben syn clothing christ wold sone haue noted spoken clothyng ryche men gospell saint greg saith precious clothing culpable derth softnesse hys straungenesse disguisyng superfluite inordinate scantnesse ala may nat man se dayes synfull costlye arraye clothyng namely much superfluite elles disordinate scantnesse fyrst synne superfluite clothynge suche maketh dere harme people cost imbroydring disguysed endendyng barringe oundyng palyng wyndynge bendynge semblable wast cloth vanite also costlye furrynge gownes much pousyng chesel make hooles much daggyng sheres forche superfluite lengthe foresayd gownes traylyng donge myre horse also fote well man woman traylynge verilye effecte wasted consumed thredebare rotten wyth donge rather yeue poore greate damage forsayde pore folke yt sodrie wise thys saye cloth wasted muste coste poore people scarsnesse moreouer yf wold yeue pounsed dagged clothyng poore people couenient estate ne sufficient necessite kepe hem fro distemperaunce firmament vpon syde speke ye horrible disordinate scatnesse clothinge ben cutted sloppes hanselines yt shortnes couer shamful mebres wicked intent ala hem shew bosse shap horible swole membres semeth like malady hernia wrappyng hose also buttockes hem fare hynder parte sheape ful mone moreouer wretched swollen mebres shewe disguising departing hosen white reed semeth halfe shameful preuy membres flayne yf depart hosen colour white blew whyte blacke blacke red forth tha semeth variauce colour yu halfe part preuy bres ben corrupt fyre saynt anthony canker mischaunce hinder part buttockes ful horrible se certes parte body purge stynkynge ordure foule partie shew ye people proudly dispite honestie honestie iesu christ hys frendes obserued shewe life outragious araye woman god wotte thoughe yt visage hem seme full chast debonayre yet notify araye afyre licorousnes pride say honestie clothing woman vncouenable certes superfluitie disordinate quantite clothynge reprouable also syn ornement apparayle thinges apertayne rydynge companye delicate horse bene holden delite ben fayre fatte costlye also many nyce knaue susteined bicause hem curious harneis sadels cropers peytrels bridels couered wt precious clothing rich barres plate gold siluer god sayth zacharye prophete woll confounde ryders horse folke take lytel regarde riding goddes sonne heuen hys harneys whan rode vpo asse non harneys pore clothes disciple ne rede euer rode beest speke thys synne superfluitie resonable honestye whan reason requireth moreouer certes pryde greatly notyfyed holdynge great meyny whan lytle profyte ryght profyte namely whan meyne felonous dammageous people hardynes hygh lordshyp waye offyces certes lordes sell tha lordshyppe dyuel hell wha sustayne wickednesse meyne el whan folke lowe degree kepe hostelry sustayne hostelers manye maner disceytes maner folke ben flyes folow hony el houndes folow arayn forsaid folke strangel spirituelly lordshyps thus sayeth dauid prophete wicked death might come lordship god gyue might discend b l house bene iniquity shreudnesse god heuen certes tyll done amendemet right god yaue hys blessing pharao seruice iacob laban seruice ioseph ryght god wol yeue hys curse lordshyps sustayn wyckednes seruauntes come amendement pride table appeareth also full ofte certes ryche men ben called festes pore folke ben put awaye rebuked also excesse diuers meates drynkes namely maner bake meates dishemetes brenning wylde fyre peynted castelled w th paper semblable waste usyon thynke also greate cyousnesse vessell curiosytye stralcye whyche man sterred mo delyces lecherye yf sette hys herte lesse vpon oure lorde iesu chri certaynlye synne certaynlye delyces myght greate thys case man myghte lyghtlye fall hem deadly synne especes sourde pride sothly whan sourde malyce ymagined auysed forecaste el vsage ven deedly syn dout wha sourde freelte vnauysed sodenlye sodenlye wythdrawe ayene greuouse synnes gesse nat deedly might aske wherof pride sourdeth springeth saye sotyme spryngeth goodes nature somtyme goodes fortune sotyme goodes grace certes goodes nature stondeth goodes bodye goodes ye soule certes goodes body bene heel body strength deliuernes beautie gentry frachise goodes nature soule ben good sharpe vndersta dyng subtel engin vertue naturel good memory goodes fortune ryches hye degree lordship praysyngs people goodes grace bene science power suffer spounell traueyle benigne vertuous co templation vnderstanding temptation semblable thynges whych forsayd goodes certes full greate folye man haue pride hem nowe speke goodes nature god wot somtyme haue hem nature asmoche damage profyt speke heel body truly passeth ful lyghtly also full oft occasion sickenesse soule god wot ye fleshe great enemy shule therfore bodyes hole peril fal also haue pride hys strength body hie foly certes fleshe coueteth ayenst spirite strog fleshe sorier maye soule ouer strength body worldly hardinesse causeth ful oft many man perell mischaunce also haue pride gentry right great foly oftyme getry ye body taketh awey gentry soule also ben al father mother ben nature rotten corrupt rich pore forsoth maner getry praise aparelleth mane courage wyt vertue moralite maketh christes chyld trust well ouer syn hath maystry churle synne nowe ben general signes getlenes esche wyng vice ribaudry seruage sy n worde werke countenaunce vsyng vertue curtesy clennes liberal say large measure yt yt passeth measure foly synne another remembre hym boutie folke hath receiued another benigne hys good subictes wherfore sayth senecke nothyng couenable hygh estate debonairte pite therfore flyes men call bee whan make kynge chese one hath pricke wherwyth may stynge another man haue noble hert diligent attayne hyghe vertuous thynges nowe certes man haue pride goodes grace also outragious foly gyftes grace yt shulde haue tourned hym goodnesse medycen tourneth hym venym confusion fayth saynte greg certes also hath pride goodnesse fortune ful greate fole somtyme great lorde morne catyfe wretche nyght somtyme ryches man cause death somtyme delyces man cause greuous melady throughe whyche dyeth certes comendation people somtyme full false brotell trust thys day prayse morow blame god wot desyre haue comendation people hath caused death manye busye man nowe syth ye haue vnderstande pride speces whence sourdeth spryngeth nowe ye shall vnderstand remedy ayenst humilytie mekenesse remedye ayenst pride yt vertue whyche hath knowledge hym selfe holdeth hym selfe price ne deyntie regarde hys desertes consyderynge euer hys freelte bene thre maner humilytes humylyte herte another humylytye mouthe thyrde workes humilytie herte four maners one whan manne holdeth hym selfe nought worth god heuen seconde whan dispiceth none man thyrde whan ne recketh nat though men holde hym nought worth fourth wha sory humiliation also humilitie mouth four thinges temperate speche humilitie spech wha cofesseth owne mouth suche thynketh hert another wha prayseth bounte another man nothyng therof minyssheth humilitye also werke foure maners fyrste whan putteth men ye second chese lowest place ouer al thyrde gladly assent good cousayle fourth stand gladly awarde souerains hier degre certeyn gret werke humilite pde inuidia pride woll speke foule synne enuye whyche worde philosofer sorow mennes prosperitie worde saynt augustin sorowe mennes wele ioy menes harme foule synne platly agaynste holy ghost al euery synne ayenst holy gost yet nathles asmoch bounte apertayneth properly holy gost enuy cometh properly malice therfore properlye ayenst bountie holy gost nowe hath malice two speces yt say hardines herte wickednes el fleshe man blynde cosidreth nat syn recketh nat yt syn hardines ye deuyl spece enuy whan denyeth trouth wha knoweth trouth also wha repenteth ye grace god hath yeue neyghbour enuy certes tha enuy ye worst sinne sothly al sinnes time onely ayenst speciall vertue certes enuy al vertues al goodnes sory ayenst al bouties neighbour maner diuers al synnes ala ne synne ne hathe delyte selefe saue enuy euer hath selfe anguishe sorow speces enuy ben fyrste sorowe mennes goodnesse prosperitie prosperite kyndlye mater ioye enuye synne ayenst kynde seconde spece enuye ioy mennes harme properly lyke deuyll euer reioyseth hym mannes harme two speces cometh bacbytynge thys synne bacbytynge detractynge hathe certayne speces thus man prayseth hys neyghboure wycked entent maketh alwaye wycked knot last ende alway maketh last ende digne blame tha worth al praysyng seconde spece good doth sayeth thynge good entente backbyter woll turne al yt goodnesse vp downe hys shreude entente thyrde amynishe bountye hys neyghbour fourth spece backbytyng thys yf men speke goodnesse man woll backbiter saye perfay man yet better dispraysynge hym ye men prayse fyfth spece thys cosent gladly herke gladly ye harme men speke folke thys synne ful great aye encreseth wycked entent backbiter backbytynge cometh grutching murmuration somtyme spryngeth unpacience ayenst god somtyme ayenst man ayenst god whan man grutcheth ayenst payne hel ayenst pouertie losse catel ayenst rayne tempeste el grutcheth shrewes haue prosperite el good haue aduersite thynges shulde men suffre paciently come ryghtfull iudgement ordinaunce god somtime cometh grutching auarice iudas grutched ayenst maudelen whan anoynted heed lorde iesu christe precious oyntment thys maner murmu rynge suche whan man grutcheth goodnes hym selfe doth folke done owne catel somtyme cometh murmure pride whan symon pharisee grutched ayenst maudeleyn whan aproched iesu christ wepte hys fete synnes somtyme sourdeth enuy wha discouer man harme yt priuy bereth hand thing false murmure also ofte among seruautes ye grutche wha soueraynes byd hem lefull thynges much dare opely wythsay ye co maudemet soueraynes yet woll say harme grutche murmure priuely dispite wordes cal dyuels pater noster though dyuel neuer pater noster yt lende folke yeueth name somtyme cometh yre pryuy hate yt nourysheth rancoure herte afterwarde shall declare cometh also bytternesse herte thorowe whych bytternesse euery good dede hys neyghboure semeth hym bitter vnsauery cometh discorde vnbyndeth al maner frendshyp cometh scornyng hys neyghbour neuer well cometh accusynge whan man seketh occasion anoy neighbour whych lyke craft dyuel yt wayteth daye nyght accuse v cometh malignitie whyche man anoyeth hys neyghbour priuely may yf may algate hys wycked wyll shall let brenne house priuely enpoyson sle hys beastes semblable thynges nowe woll speke remedye ayenst thys foule synne enuy first loue god principally louyng hys neyghbour hym selfe sothly one ne may wythout truste well name thy neyghbour thou shalte vnderstande name thy brother certes haue one father fleshly one mother yt saye adam eue also one father spirituell yt god heuen thy neyghboure art thou bounde loue wyll goodnesse therfore sayth god loue thy neighbour thy selfe yt saye saluatio lyfe soule moreouer thou shalte loue hym worde benigne admonyshynge chastysyng comforte noyaunces pray al thy hert dede thou shalte loue wyse thou shalt charitie thou woldest done thine owne person therfore thou ne shalt hym damage wicked worde ne harme bodye ne catel ne hys soule entysyng wicked ensample thou shalte desyre hys wyfe ne none hys thynges vnderstande also name neyghbour compreheded hys enemy certes man shal loue hys enemy commaundement god sothly thy frende thou shalt loue god saye thine enemy shalt thou loue goddes sake hys comaudemet reason man shulde hate enemy forsoth god wolde receyue v hys loue yt ben hys enemy ayenst thre maner wro ge enemy doth shall thre thynges thus ayenst hate racour hert shal loue hym hys hert ayenst chiding wicked wordes shall praye enemy ayenst wicked dedes shal bountie christe sayeth loue enemy pray hem yt speke harme hem chase pursue bounte hem yt hate lo thus comau deth v lorde iesu christ enemy soth nature driueth v loue frendes parfay enemyes haue nede loue frendes yt nede haue certes hem shall men goodnesse certes dede haue remembraunce loue iesu christ yt dyed hys enemyes asmuche loue greuous perfourme much gret merite therfore louyng enemye hath cofounded ye dyuels venym ryght dyuel co founded humilitie righte wounded deth loue enemy certes tha loue medicyn casteth venym enuie fro mannes herte speces place shall largely declared chapiter folowyng pde ira enuye wol discriue synne ire sothly hath enuye vpon hys neyghbour anone woll comenlye fynde hym mater wrathe word dede ayenst hym hath enuye wel cometh ire pride enuy sothly proud enuyous lyghtly wrothe thys synne yre discriuynge saynte austyn wycked wyll aueged worde dede ire phylosopher feruent bloude yquycked hys hert wolde harme hym hateth certes herte man eschaufynge mouyng hys bloude wexeth troubled al maner iugement reason ye shal vnderstande ye ire two maners one hem good wicked good ire ielousye goodnes wrothe wickednes ayenst wickednesse therfore saith wise man ire bet tha playe ire debonairte wroth without bitternes wroth ayenst man wrath misdede man saith prophete dauid irascimini et nolite peccare nowe vnderstande wicked ire two maners saye sodayn ire hasty ire wythout auysement consentyng reason meaning sence reason ne cosent sodayne ire venyal another ire ful wycked cometh felony hert auysed cast wyth wicked wyl vengeaunce therto reason cosenteth sothly thys deedly synne thys ire displeasaunt god troubleth hys house chaseth holy goste man soule wasteth distroyeth likenesse god say vertue man soule putteth hym lykenesse dyuel taketh man fro god rightful lord ful great pleasauce dyuell dyuels fournayes eschaufed fyre hell certes ryght fyre myghtye distroy erthly thinges tha elemet ryght ire myghty distroy al spirituel thynges loke fyre smale cole ben almost deed vnder asshen woll reuyue quycke ayen whan bene touched wyth brymstone right ire wol euermore quyck ayen whan touched pride couered man hert certes fyre ne maye come nothynge yf first thinge naturally fyre drawe flyntes wyth stele ryght pride many tymes mater ire ryghte rancour nourice keper ire maner tree sayth saynt isodore yt whan man maketh fyre sayd tree couer cole wyth asshen sothly fyre wol last yere right fareth racoure wha one conceyued hertes men certes wol last peraueture one ester day vntyl another ester day certes man ful ferre mercy god al whyle forsayde dyuels fourneis forge thre shrewes pride aye bloweth encreaseth fyre chiding wicked wordes standeth enuy holdeth hote yron ye fyre vpon hert man payre longe tonges long racour tha stadeth syn cotumely strife chest battereth forgeth vilaynous repreuinges certes cursed syn anoyeth man hym selfe also hys neyghbour sothly almoost al harme damage anye doth neighbour cometh wrath certes outragious wrath dothe euer foule fende willeth comaundeth hym ne spareth neither lorde iesu christe neyther swete mother hys outragiouse angre yre ala ala ful many diuers time feleth hert ful wickedly christ also al halowes cursed vice yes certes ala taketh fro witte hys reason debonayre lyfe spirituell shulde kepe soule certes wythdraweth also goddes dewe lordshyp man soule loue hys neighbour stryueth also day ayenst trouth reueth quyete hert subuerteth hys soule tre cometh stinkinge engendrures first hate yt olde wrath discord man forsaketh olde frend yt hath loued ful long cometh warre euerye maner wrong doth neyghbour body catell cursed syn cometh also maslaughter vnderstand wel homicide manslaughter diuers wyse maner homicide spirituell bodily spirituell manslaughter vi thynges fyrst hate sayth saynte iohan hateth hys brother homicide homicede also backebytynge whyche backebytinge sayeth salomon haue two sweatdes wyth whych slee neyghbours sothlye wycked take hym hys good name hys lyfe homicide also geuing wycked counsel fraude geue counsayle areyse wrongfull customes talages whyche sayeth salomon lyon roringe e hongry lyke cruel lordes wythholdyng abredging shepe ye hyre wage seruauntes el vsury wythdrawyng almesse poore folke whyche wyse man sayeth fedethe hym almooste dyeth honger sothly ye fede ye slee al bene deedlye synnes bodylye manslaughter thou sleest hym wyth thy tonge maner thou commaundest slee el yeuest cousayle slee man manslaughter dede foure maners one lawe ryghte iustyce dampneth hym coulpable death let iustice ware ryghtfully delyte spyll bloode kepyng ryghteousnes homicide done necessitie sleeth defence ne maye none otherwyse escape wythout slaughter hys aduersary doth synne shal beare penaunce deedly synne also yf man case aduenture shote arowe caste stone whych sleeth man homicide al woma negligece ouerlieth child slepynge homicide deedly synne also man distourbleth conception chylde maketh woman eyther bareyne drynkynge venymous herbes thorough whyche maye conceyue sletth chylde drynkes el putteth certayne materiall thynges secre place slee chylde el doth vnkyndly synne whyche man woma shedeth nature maner place chylde maye conceyued el yf woman hathe conceyued hurteth selfe myshap chylde slayne yet homicide saye woman murtheren chyldren bycause eschewynge worldly shame certes horryble homicide homicide also yf man approche woma desyre lecherye thorough whyche chylde peryshed el smyteth woman wetyngly throughe whyche leseth chylde bene homicide horrible dedly synnes yet come yre mo synnes well worde thought dede arretteth vpon god blameth god thynge whych hym selfe gylty dyspyseth god hys halowes done cursed hasardours dyuers countreyes thys cursed synne done fele herte ful wyckedly god hys halowes also treate vnreuerentlye sacrament aulter synne great vnneth may released mercy god passeth al hys werkes greate benygne commeth yre atterly anger whe man sharpelye amoneshed hys shryfte leaue hys synne woll angry answere hokerlye angerlye defende excuse hys synne vnstedfastnesse hys fleshe elles dydde holde companye wyth hys felowes elles sayeth fende entyced hym elles dothe hys youth elles complexion coragious maye forbeare elles hys destenye sayeth vnto certayne age elles sayeth commeth hym ge tylnesse hys aucesters semblable thynges maner folke wrappe hem synnes ne woll delyuer hym selfe sothlye wyghte excuseth hym selfe wylfullye hys synne maye delyuered hys synne tyl mekelye beknoweth hys synne thys commeth swearynge expresse agaynste commaundemente god thys befalleth often angre yre god sayeth thou shalte take name thy lorde god vayne ydell also oure lorde iesu christe sayeth worde saynte mathewe ne wyll ye sweare maner neyther heauen goddes trone ne earth benche feete ne hierusalem cytie greate kynge ne thyne heed thou mayste make heere neyther whyte ne blacke say youre worde yea yea naye naye yuell thus sayeth christe christes sake sweare synfullye dysmembrynge christe soule herte bone bodye certes semeth ye thynke cursed iewes ne dysmembred ynoughe preciyous persone christe ye dysmembre hym yf lawe compell sweare ruleth lawe god swearyng sayeth ieremy fourth chapter thou shalte kepe thre condicions thou shalt swere trouth dome ryghtwysenesse thys saye thou shalte sweare sothe euerye lesynge ayenst christ christ verye trouth thynke well thys euerye great swearer compelled laufully swere plage shal depart fro house whyle vseth suche vnlawfull swearynge thou shalte swere also dome thou arte constrayned thy dome man wytnesse trouthe also thou shalt sweare enuye neyther fauoure neyther mede rewarde onelye ryghteousnesse declarynge honoure worshyppe god aydinge helpe thyne euen christen therfore euerye man taketh goddes name ydel falselye sweareth wyth hys mouthe el taketh hym name christe called christen man lyueth ayenst christes lyuynge hys teachynge take goddes name ydell loke also sayeth saynt peter actuum iiij capitu non est aliud nome sub celo c none name sayeth saynt peter vnder heauen yeue men whyche maye saued saye name iesu christ take hede eke howe precious name iesu christ sayeth saynt paule ad philippenses secundo nomine iesu c name iesu euery knee heauenly creature earthlye hell shulde bowe hye worshypfull cursed fende hel shulde tremble heare named semeth men sweare horriblye hys blessed name dyspyse boldely cursed iewes el dyuell trembleth whe heareth hys name nowe certes syth swearyng yf lawfullye done hyelye defended moche forswearynge falslye yet nedelesse say also hem delyte hem swearynge holde genterye maly dede sweare great othes hem yt vsage ne cease sweare greate othes cause worthe strawe certes thys horrible synne swerynge sodeynly also great synne let v go horrible synne swearynge adiuration coniuration done false enchautours nigromacers basyns full water bryght swearde cercle fyre sholderbone shepe saye done cursedly dampnably ayenst christe fayth holy churche say hem yt beleue deuinales flyghte noyse byrdes beestes sorte geomacye dremes chyrkynge dores crakynge house gnawynge rattes suche maner wretchednesse certes al thynges ben defended god holy church whyche accursed tyl come amendemet yt fylth set belyue charmes wou de maladye men beestes yf take effecte maye perauenture god suffreth folke shuld yeue fayth reuerence hys name nowe woll speke leasynges whych generally false sygnifyaunce worde entent dysceyue hys euen christen lesynge cometh none auau tage wyght leasyng turneth profyte ease man damage man leasynge saue hys lyfe hys catell whych commeth delyte lye delyte woll forge longe tale paynt wyth al circumstaunces al tale ye groud false leasynge cometh woll susteyne hys wordes leasyng cometh retchelesnesse wythout auysemet semblable thynges lette v nowe touche vyce flaterye whyche ne cometh gladlye drede couetyse flatterye generally wronful praysynge flaterers bene dyuels nouryces noryshe hys chyldren wyth mylke losyngerye forsoth salomon sayeth flatery worse detraction somtyme detractio maketh hauteyne man humble dredeth detraction certes flaterye maketh man tenhaunce hys herte countenaunce flaterers ye deuels enchautours make man wene hym selfe lyke lyke lyke iudas betraye man sell hym hys enemy flaterers ben dyuels chapleyns yt euer singe placebo reken flatery vyces yre ofte tyme yf man wrothe wyth another woll flater wyghte sustayne hym hys quarell speake nowe suche cursynge cometh yrous herte malyson generally maye sayd euery maner power harme cursing bereueth man fro raygne god sayeth saynt poule oft tyme cursyng wrongfully returneth ayen curseth byrd turneth ayen hys owne neste ouer thynge men ought eshewe curse chyldren yeue deuel engendrure farre forth hem certes great peryll great synne lette v speake chydynge reproche whych ben full great woundes ma herte vnsowe semes frendshyp man herte certes vnneth maye man playnly accorded wyth hym hym openly hath reuyled repreued dyslaundred thys full gastly synne christe sayeth gospell take hede nowe repreueth hys neyghboure eyther repreueth hym harme paine hath vppon hys body mesell croked harlot synne doth yf repreue hym harme payne turneth efe iesu christ payne sende ryghtwyse sonde god hys suffraunce meselry meyme maladye yf repreue vncharitably synne thou holour thou dronkelewe harlot forth pertayneth reioysynge deuell whyche euer hath ioye yt men done synne certes chydynge maye come vylaynous hert haboundaunce herte speaketh ye mouth full ofte ye shal vnderstande loke waye man shall chastyse correct another beware fro chydyng repryuynge truely beware maye full lyghtlye quycken fyre angre wroth whych shulde quenche perauenture sleeth whych myght chastyse wyth benignite sayeth salomo amiable tonge tree lyfe saye lyfe spirituell sothlye dissolute tonge sleeth spirites hym repreueth also hym whych repreued lo sayeth saynt augustyne nothynge lyke dyuels chylde whych ofte chydeth seruaunt god behoueth chyde thoughe chydynge vyllainous thynge betwyxte maner folke yet certis moost vncouenable bytwene man hys wyfe neuer reste therfore sayeth salomon house vncouered droppynge chydynge wyfe ben lyke man whych droppynge house many place though eschewe droppynge one place droppeth hym place fareth chydynge wyfe yf chyde hym one place woll chyde hym another therfore better greatly plesaunt morsell lytell gobet bread wyth ioye house fylled full delyces wyth chydynge guerrynge sayeth salomon saynt poule sayeth ye woman beth ye subiecte youre husbandes behoueth ought god ye loueth wyues ad colossenses iij afterwarde speke scornyng whych wycked synne namely scorneth man hys good werkes certes suche scorner fare lyke foule tode maye endure smell ye swete sauoure vyne whe flourysheth scorner bene partynge felowes wyth dyuell haue ioye whe dyuell wynneth sorowe yf leseth ben aduersaryes iesu christ hate loueth saye saluation soule speake nowe wycked counsayle ye whych traytoure dysceyueth hym trusteth hym vt achitofel ad salomonem nathelesse yet hys wycked counsayle fyrst ayenst hym selfe sayeth wyse man euery false lyuynge hath properte hym selfe wol anoye another man anoyeth fyrst hym selfe men shall vnderstande man shall take hys counsayle false folke ne angrye folke greuous folke ne folke loue specially moche worldly folke namely counsaylynge soules nowe cometh synne hem sowe make dyscorde amonge folke whyche synne christ hateth vtterly wonder deyde make concorde shame christe dyd hym crucifyed god loueth better frendship amonges folke dyd hys owne body gaue vnite therfore ben lykened dyuell euer aboute make dyscorde nowe commeth synne double toge speke fayre folke wyckedly behynde el make semblaut though spak good entencion el game playe yet speake wycked entent nowe cometh hewrayenge counsayle whych man dyffamed certes vnneth maye restore domage nowe cometh menace open folye ofte menaceth threateth maye performe full ofte tyme nowe commeth ydell wordes wythout profyte hym speaketh wordes also hym herkeneth wordes el ydel wordes ben ben nedelesse wyth entent naturall profyte ydell wordes somtyme venyall synne yet shulde men doute hem shall yeue rekenynge hem god cometh ianglynge maye wythout synne sayeth salomon sygne perte folye therfore philosopher sayde men asked hym howe shulde please people answerde many good workes speake vanity cometh synne iaperies ben ye deuels ape make folke laughe iaperye folke gaudes ape whych iapes defendeth saynt paule loke howe vertuous wordes holy comforte hem trauayle seruyce christ ryght comforteth villaynous wordes knackes iapers hem trauayle seruyce deuell bene synnes tonge come yre synnes remedy ayenst ire remedy ayenst ire vertue men cal mansuetude debonairie also another vertue men clepe pacience sufferaunce debonayrte wythdraweth refrayneth stee rynges mouynges mannes corage herte suche maner ne skyppe anger ne yre sufferaunce suffereth swetely anoyaunces wronges ye men done man outwarde saynt ierome sayeth thys debonairte yt doth harme wyght ne sayeth ne harme men ne saye ne chafeth ayenst reason thys vertue somtyme cometh nature sayeth philosopher man quycke thynge nature debonayre tretable goodnesse debonairte enformed grace worth pacience another remedye ayenst ire vertue suffreth swetely euery mannes goodnesse wroth harme done hym philosopher sayeth pacience vertue suffreth debonairly outrage aduersite euerye wycked worde thys vertue maketh man lyke god maketh hym goddes owne chylde sayeth christ thys vertue dyscomfyteth thyne enemye therfore sayeth wyse man yf thou wolde vanquyshe thyne enemye learne suffre thou shalte vnderstande man suffreth foure maner greuaunces outward thynges ayenst whyche foure muste haue foure maner paciences fyrst greuaunce wycked wordes whyche suffred iesu christe wythout grutchynge full paciently iewes dyspysed hym full ofte suffre thou therfore paciently wyse man sayeth yf thou stryue foole though ye foole wroth though laugh alwaye thou shalte haue reste greuaunce outwarde haue domage thy catell ayenst suffred christ full paciently whe spoyled al thys lyfe hys clothes thyrde greuaunce man haue harme hys body suffred christ full paciently al passion fourth greuaunce outragious laboure werkes wherfore saye folke make seruauntes trauayle greuouslye tyme holy dayes sothly great synne ayenst suffered christ full paciently taught v pacience bare vpon hys blessed shoulder crosse vpon shuld suffre dyspytous death maye men learne paciet certes christen paciente loue iesu christ reward blessed lyfe perdurable certes olde paynems neuer christened comended vsed vertue paciece philosopher vpon tyme wolde haue beate dysciple hys great trespace whych moued brought rodde beate chylde chyld sawe rodde sayd hys mayster thynke ye woll beate sayd mayster thy correction forsoth sayd childe ye ought fyrst correct selfe haue lost al pacience offence chylde forsoth sayd mayster wepynge thou sayest soth haue thou rodde dere chylde correcte myne impacience pacience cometh obedience throughe whyche man obediente christ al hem ought obediet christ vnderstand wel obedience perfyte man doth glad lye hastely good herte entierlye shulde obedience generally perfourme doctryne god hys ueraygnes whych hym ought obeysaunt ryghteousnesse pde accidia synnes enuy yre nowe woll speke synne accidie enuy blindeth herte yre troubleth man accidie maketh hym heuy thoughtfull pensyfe enuye yre maken bytternesse herte whych bytternesse mother accidie taketh fro hym loue al goodnesse accidie anguyshe trouble herte saynt augustyne sayeth anoye goodnesse anoye harme certes thys dampnable synne doth wronge iesu christ moche benometh seruyce men ought christe sayeth salomon accidie doth suche diligence doth thynge wyth anoye wrawnesse slacknesse excusation wyth ydelnesse vnlust whych boke sayeth acursed doth seruice god negligently accidie enemye euery estate man certes state man thre maners eyther estate innocency estate adam fyll synne whych estate hold worke praysynge laudynge god ther estate ye estate synfull estate men bene holden laboure prayenge god amendement synnes woll graunte hem ryse synnes another estate state grace whiche state holden workes penitence certes thynges accidie contrary loueth busynesse nowe certes thys foule synne accidie also full great enemye lyfelode body ne hath purueyaunce ayenst teporel necessite forswoleth forslogeth destroyeth al goodes temporel rechelesnesse iiij thynge accidie lyke hem ye bene payne hel bycause slouth heuynesse dampned bene bounde maye neyther well ne thynke accidie cometh fyrst man anoyed encombred goodnesse maketh ye god hath abhominacion accidie sayeth saynt iohn nowe cometh slouth wol nat suffre hardnesse ne penaunce sothly slouth teder delycate sayeth salomon woll suffre hardnesse ne penaunce therfore marreth doth ayenst thys rotten synne accidie slouth shulde men exercise hem selfe vse hem good workes maly vertuously catch corage thyn kynge lorde iesu christe quyteth euery good dede neuer lyte vsage labour great thyng maketh sayeth saynt bernard ye labourer haue stroge armes harde senewes slouth maketh heuye feble tender cometh drede begynne worke good workes certes enclyneth synne hym thynketh great empryse vndertak workes goodnesse casteth hys herte circumstaunces goodnesse bene greuouse weyghtye suffre dare vndertake workes goodnesse sayeth saynt gregorye nowe cometh wanhope dyspayre mercye god cometh somtyme moch outragious sorow somtyme moch drede ymaginynge hath moch synne wol auayle tho wolde repent hym forsake synne thorough whych dyspayre drede abandoneth al hys herte euery maner synne sayeth saynt augustyne whych dampnable synne yf continue vnto hys ende called synnynge holy goost thys horrible synne peryllous dyspayred ny felony ne synne douteth shewed well iudas certes aboue al synnes thys synne moost dyspleasaunt christ moste aduersary sothly dyspayreth hym lyke cowarde champion recreaunt flyeth wythout nede ala ala nedeles recreaut nedelesse dyspayreth certes mercy god euer redy penitent person aboue al hys werkes ala bethynke hym gospel saint luke xv christ sayeth well shall ioye heauen vpon synfull man doth penitence vpon foure score nynetene ryghtful nede penitence loke ferther gospell ioye ye feest good man loste hys sonne whe hys sonne wyth repentaunce retourned hys father remembre hem also sayeth saynt luke capi xxx howe thefe haged besyde iesu christ sayd lorde remembre thou commest thy reygne forsoth sayd christ saye daye shalte thou paradyse certes none horrible synne man ne maye hys lyfe dystroyed penitence thorough vertue passyon death christe ala nede men dyspayred syth hys mercy ready large aske haue commeth sompnolence sluggye slombrynge whyche maketh man heuy dull body soule sinne cometh slouth certes time waye reason man shulde slepe ye morowe yf cause reasonable sothely morowe tyde couenable man saye hys prayer thake god honoure god yeue almesse poore cometh fyrst name iesu christ lo sayth salomo woll morowe awake seke shall fynde cometh neglygence retchelesnesse recketh nothynge though ignoraunce mother al harmes certes neglygence noryce negligence ne dothe force shall thynge whether well euell remedye two synnes sayeth wyse man dredeth god spareth ought loueth god woll dylygece please god hys werkes abadone hym selfe wyth al hys myght wel cometh ydelnesse yate harmes ydell man lyke place hath walles ye dyuell maye entre euerye syde shote hym dyscouert temptation euery syde thys ydelnesse thorruke wycked vylayne thoughtes al ordure certes heauen yeue hem wyll laboure ydell folke also dauid sayeth ne laboure men ne shall whypped wyth men certes semeth shall turmented wyth dyuels hell yf penaunce cometh synne cal tarditas man latered tarienge woll tourne god certes great foly lyke hym falleth dyche woll aryse thys vyce cometh false hope thynketh shall lyue longe hope fayleth full ofte cometh lachesse whe begynneth good worke anone wol leaue stynte done haue persone gouerne ne take hede anone fynde contrary anoye ben newe sheperdes let theyr shepe wyttyngly go renue ye wolfe breres force owne gouernaunce thys cometh pouerte destruction bothe spirituall temporell thynges cometh maner coldnesse freseth herte man cometh vndeuotion whyche man blont sayeth saynte bernarde hath suche langour hys soule may neyther rede ne synge holy church ne ne thynke deuotion ne trauayle wyth hys handes good worke ny hym vnsauery al apalled wareth slowe slombry sone wol wroth sone enclyned hate enuy cometh synne worldly sorowe called tristitia sleeth man sayeth saynt poule certes suche sorow worketh death soule body also therof cometh man anoyed hys owne lyfe wherfore suche sorowe shorteth full ofte lyfe man er hys tyme come waye kynde premedium contra peccatum accidie ayenst thys horryble synne accidie braunches ther vertue called fortitudo stregth affection throughe whiche man dispyseth anoycus thynges vertue mighty rygorous dare withstonde mightily wisely kepe hym self fro perylles ben wycked wrastel ayenst thassautes dyuel enhaunceth enforceth soule right accidie abateth maketh feble thys fortitude may endure longe suffraunce trauayles ben couenable vertue hath manye speces fyrste called magnanimite say great corage certes behoueth great corage ayenst accidie lest ne swalowe ye soule synne sorowe distroye wanhope certes vertue maketh folke vnder take harde greuous thynges wyl wisely resonably moch deuyll fyghteth ayenst man subtylte sleyght strength therfore shall man wythstonde hym wytte reason discretion tha vertues faythe hope god hys sayntes eschue accomplisshe good workes whyche purposeth fermely contynue cometh suretie sykernesse whan man ne douteth traueyle tyme commyng good workes hathe begonne cometh magnifycence saye whan man dothe parformeth great workes goodnesse hath begon thende men shuld good workes accomplishyng good workes lyeth great guerdon tha constance stablenesse corage thys shulde hert stedfast faythe mouthe ynge chere dede also ben mo specyall remedyes ayenst accidie dyuers workes cosyderatyo ye paynes hell ioyes heuen truste grace holy ghoost wyll yeue hym myght performe good entent pde auaricia accidie woll speke auarice couetyse whych syn saynt poule sayth rote al harmes couetyse ad timoth vi sothly whan hert man co founded selfe troubled soule hath lost confort god seketh ydell solace worldlye thynges auarice discryption saynt augustyn lycorousnesse hert haue erthly thynges folke saye auaryce purchace many erthely thynges nothynge yeue hem haue nede vnderstonde auarice stodeth nat onely londe ne catel somtyme sciece glorye euerye maner outragious thynges auaryce couetyse thys couetyse coueit suche thynges thou hast nat auarice holde kepe suche thynges thou haste wythout right sothly auarice synne ful dapnable al holy writ curseth speketh ayenst ye vice doth wrong iesu christ taketh fro loue men hym owe tourneth backeward ayenst al reason maketh auarycious man hath hoope hys catell iesu christ dothe obseruaunce kepyng hys treasour dothe seruyce iesu christ therfore saythe saynt poule ad ephesios quinto auarycious man thraldome idolatrye dyfference betwyxt ydolaster auaricyous man ydolaster perauenture ne hathe nat mawmet two auaricious man hath many certes euery floreyn hys co maumet certes synne maumetry fyrste god defended x commaudements beareth wytnesse exodi capitu xx thou shalte haue false goddes ne thou shalte make graue thynge thus auaricious man loueth hys treasour god idolaster cursed synne auyryce couetyse cometh harde lordeshyppes whyche ben streyned tyllages customes cariages duetye reason elles take bondman amercyamentes whyche myght resonablye called extortion mercyamentes whiche amerciamentes raunsomynge bondman lordes stewardes say rightful moche churle hath temporel thynge ne lordes saye certes lordshyppes wrong bereue theyr bondman thynges neuer yaue hem augustinus de ciuitate dei libro ix sothe conditio thraldom fyrst cause thraldome synne thus may ye se thoffence deserued thraldome nat nature wherfore lordes ne shulde moche glorifye hem lordeshyps sythe natural co dycion ben lordes ouer thralles thraldome came fyrste deserte synne ouer law sayth temporel goodes bonde folke ben goodes lorde ye vnderstonde goodes emperour defende hem ryght robbe hem ne reue hem therfore saythe seneca thy prudence shulde lyue benygnly ye thralles thou callest thy thralles ben goddes people humble people ben christes frendes ben contubernyall wt lordes thynke also suche sede chorles sprynge suche sede spryng lordes wel may chorle saued lorde dethe taketh chorle suche dethe taketh lorde wherfore rede right chorle thou woldest thy lorde dyd wyth yf thou hys plyght euery synful man chorle syn rede lorde certes thou werke suche wyse thy chorles rather loue tha drede wote wel degree aboue degree reson skyll men deuoyre due certes extorcions dispyte vnderlynges dampnable ferthermore vnderstonde wel conquerours tyrauntes make ful ofte thralles hem ben borne royal bloode ben hem conquere name thraldom neuer erst knowe tyl noe sayd sonne canam shulde thral brethern hys synne saye pyl extorcions holy church certes swerde men yeue fyrste knyght whan newe dubbed sygnyfyeth shulde defende holy churche robbe pyl doth traytour chryst saythe saynt austyn ben dyuels woulues strangle shepe iesu christ done worse woulues sothely whan woulfe hathe full hys wombe stynteth strangle shepe sothlye pyllours dystroyers holy church goodes ne ne stynte neuer pyll nowe haue sayde sythe synne fyrste cause thraldom thus tyme thys world synne tha al worlde thraldom subiection certes syth tyme grace came god ordayned yt folke shulde hye estate degre folke lowe eche shulde serued hys astate therfore coutreys thralles wha haue turned hem ye faythe make thralles free thraldome therfore certes lorde oweth hys man man oweth lorde pope calleth hym selfe seruaunte seruauntes god estate holy churche ne might haue ben ne comen profyte myght haue kept ne peace ne reste erthe yf god ordayned hier degree men lower therfore soueraynte ordayned kepe mayntayne defende vnderlynges subiectes reason ferforth lyeth power distroye ne confounde hem wherfore say lordes ben lyke wolues deuour possessyons catel poore folkes wrongfully mercy mesure shal receyue mesure yt haue mesured poore folke mesure iesu christ amended nowe cometh disceyte betwixt marchaunt marchaunt thou shalt vnderstonde marchaundyse two maners one bodily goostly one honest leful dishonest vnleful bodily marchaundyse lefull honest thys god hath ordayned reygne countreye suffysaut hym selfe honeste lefull haboundaunce hys countrey men helpe countrey nedy therfore muste merchautes bring fro one countrey marchaundyse marchaundyse haunten fraude trecherye disceyte leasynges false othes right cursed dampnable espirituel marchaundyse properly symonye ententife desyre bye thynge espyrituel thynge whyche apertayneth sayntuarye god cure soule desyre yf man hys dilygence perfourme al hys desyre ne take non effecte yet deedlye synne yf ordred irreguler certes symonye called symon magus wolde haue bought temporell catell yefte god yeue holy goost saynt peter apostels therfore vnderstonde selleth byethe thynges espyrituels ben called symonyakes catell procuring fleshly prayer frendes fleshly frendes espyrituell frendes flesshly two maners kynred frendes sothlye yf praye hym worthy able symonye yf take benefice yf worthy able none maner whan man woman prayeth folke auaunce hem wycked fleshly affection whyche haue vnto person foule symonye certes seruyce men yeuen thinges espyrituel vnto seruautes must vnderstonde seruice muste honest el also without bargeynyng person able sayth saynt damasen al synnes worlde regarde synne thyng naught greatest synne may synne lucifer antichrist synne god forleseth churche soule whyche bought wyth hys precious bloode hem yeue church hem worthy put theues hondes steale soules iesu christ distroy hys patrimony suche vnworthy preestes curate haue lende men lesse reuerence sacramentes holy churche yeuers church put chyldren christ put churche dyuels owne sonnes sel soules lambes shulde kepe wolfe strangleth hem therfore shal neuer haue parte pasture lambes blysse heuen nowe cometh hasardrie wyth hys apertenauntes table rafles whyche cometh disceyte false othes chydynges al rauynesse blasphemynges renyenges god hate hys neyghbours waste goodes myspendynge tyme somtyme manslaughter certes hasardours ne mowe without great synne auarice cometh also lesynges theft false wytnesse false othes ye shall vnderstonde great synnes expresse ayenst commaundementes god haue sayd false wytnesse worde also dede worde byreue thy neyghboures good name thy false wytnesse byreue hym catel herytage thy false wytnessyng wha thou yre mede enuye bearest false wytnesse accusest excusest thy selfe falsly ware ye questmongers notary certes false wytnessynge susan ful great sorowe payn manye another mo syn thefte also expresse ayenst goddes hest two maners corporell spirituel temporel theft take thy neyghbours catel ayenst wyl force sleight mette mesure stealynge also false endytementes vpo hym borowyng thy neyghbours catell entent neuer paye ayen semblable thynges espyrituel thefte sacrylege say hurtyng holye thynges sacred christ two maners reason holy place church churche yerdes euery villaynous synne men suche place maye called sacrylege euerye vyolence semblable place also withdrawe falsely rightes longe holye churche pleasynge generally sacrilege reue holy thing fro holye place vnholye thynge holye place holy thynge vnholy place preleuatio contra peccatum auaricie howe shal ye vnderstonde releuynge auarice misericorde pyte largely taken men might aske misericorde pyte releuyng auarice certes auaricious man sheweth pyte ne misericorde nedeful man delyteth hym kepynge hys treasure nat rescuynge ne releuynge euyn christen therfore speke fyrste mysericorde mysericorde saythe philosopher vertue whyche corage man stered ye mysease hym myseased vpon whyche mysericorde foloweth pyte performyng fulfilling charitable workes mercy helpeth comforteth myseased certes thynges moue stere man mysericorde iesu christ yaue hym selfe offence suffred dethe mysericorde forgaue v original synnes therby released v fro paynes hel mynished paynes penitens yeueth grace wel laste blysse heuen speces mysericorde ben lene also yeue foryeue releace haue pyte herte compassyo mischefe euen christen also chastyse nede another maner remedy ayenst auaryce resonable largesse sothlye behoueth consyderacyon grace iesu christ temporell goodes also goodes perdurable iesu christ yafe v haue remembraunce dethe whyche shal receyue knoweth whan ne howe also shall forgo hath saue onely whyche hath expended good werkes moche folke vnmesurable menne ought auoyde eschue folyshe largesse whiche people cal waste certes foole large yeueth hys catel leseth hys catel sothlye thynge yeueth veynglorye mynstrels folke beare renome world hath synne therof none almesse certes leseth foule hys good ne seketh wyth yefte hys good nothyng synne lyke horse seketh rather drynke drouy troubled water drynke water clere welle hem apperteyne sayd cursynges christ shal yeue day dome hem shal dampned psequitur de gula auaryce cometh gloteny whyche expresse ayenst commaundement god gloteny vnntesurable appetyte eete drynke el ynough vnmesurable appetyte disordeyned couetyse eate drynke synne corrupteth thys worlde well shewed synne adam eue loke also saythe saynt poule glotenye many saythe gone whyche haue often sayde nowe say wepynge ben enemyes crosse chryst whyche ende dethe whyche wombe god glorye confusyon hem deuour erthly thinges vsed synne gloteny ne may synne withstonde must seruage al vice dyuels hourde hydeth resteth hym synne hath many speces fyrste dronkenesse horryble sepulture man reson therfore whan man dronke hath loste reson thys deedly synne sothly whan man wonte stronge drynke parauenture ne knoweth ye strength drynke hath feblesse hys heed hathe trauayled whych drinketh al sodainly caught wt drynke deedly synne venyal seconde spece glotenye spyrite man wexeth al troubled dronkenesse byreneth discretion wytte thyrde maner spece glotonye whan man deuoureth meate hath ryghtful maner eetyng fourth whan great abundaunce hys meete humour hys body ben distempred fyfth foryetfulnesse moche drynkyng whych somtyme man forgetteth er mornyng dyd euenyng maner ben distyncte speces glotenye saynt gregorie fyrste eate tyme eate seconde wha man gyueth hym delycate meate drynke thyrde whan men take moche ouer measure fourthe curiosyte wyth great entent make appareyle hys meate fyfthe eate gredely ben fyue fyngers dyuels honde whyche draweth solke synne pthe remedy ayenst glotony ayenst glotony remedy abstyne ce sayth galyene holde nat meritorious yf heale hys body saynte augustyne woll abstynence done vertue wyth pacience abstinence sayth lytel worth yf man haue good wyl therto enforced pacience charyte men goddes sake hope haue blysse heuen felowes abstynence attemperaunce holdeth meane thynges also shame escheweth dishonestye suffysaunce seketh ryche meates ne drynkes ne dothe nat force outragi g appareylyng meate mesure also restreyneth reason vnmesurable appetyte eatyng sobernesse also restrayneth outrage drynke sparynge also restrayneth ye delycate ease sytte longe meate wherfore folke stonden owne wyl whan eete bycause wol eate lasse leysar pde luxuria glotonye cometh lecherye two synnes nye cosyns oftyme wol nat depart god wote synne ful displesaunt god sayde hym selfe lecherye therfore putteth great paynes ayenst thys synne olde lawe yf woman thrall take thys synne shulde beate wyth staues dethe yf gentylwoman shulde slayne wyth stone yf bysshops doughter shulde brent goddes commaundement moreouer synne lecherye god drowned al world brent fyue cytees thunder lightnyng sanke hem hel nowe lette v speke sayd stynking synne lechery men cal auowtrye wedded folke saye yf one hem wedded el bothe saynt iohan saythe auoutrers shalbe hell stacke brennynge fyre brimstone stenche ordure certes brekynge sacrament horryble thyng made god hym selfe paradyse confermed iesu christ wytnesseth saynt mathewe gospel man shall leaue father mother take hym hys wyfe shalbe two one flesh thys sacrament betokeneth knyttyng togyther chryste holye churche onely god forbade auoutrye dede also commaunded thou shuldest coueyte thy neyghbours wyfe thys heste saythe saynt augustyne forboden maner couetyse lecherye lo saythe saynt mathewe gospell seeth woman couetyse hys lust hath done lecherye wyth herte may ye se dede thys synne forboden also desyre synne thys cursed synne anoyeth greuouslye hem haunte fyrst soule oblygethe synne payne dethe whyche perdurable vnto body anoyeth greuously also dryeth hym wasteth shenteth hym hys bloode maketh sacryfyce fende hel wasteth hys catell substauce certes yf foule thynge man waste hys catell woman yet fouler thynge whan suche ordure woman dispende vpon men catell substaunce synne sayth prophete taketh man woman good fame honour full delectable pleasaunt dyuell therby wynneth parte thys wretched worlde ryght marchaut delyteth chaffare whiche hath moste auauntage profyte ryght delyteth ye fende ordure honde dyuel fyue fyngers catche people hys vilanye fyrste folyshe lokynge folyshe woman folysshe man sleeth ryght basilycock cokatryce sleeth folke venym hys syght couetyse eyen foloweth couetyse ye herte seconde fyngre vilaynous touchynge wycked maner therfore sayth salomon toucheth handleth woman fareth man handleth scorpyon whiche styngeth sodaynly sleeth enuenemyng toucheth warme pytche blemysheth hys fyngers thyrde foule wordes whych fareth lyke fyre right anon brenneth herte fourth fynger kyssynge truely great foole wolde kysse mouthe brennyng ouen forneys fooles ben kysse vilanye mouth mouthe hell namely olde dotardes holours woll kysse flicker besye hem selfe thoughe maye naught certes ben lyke houndes hounde whan cometh nigh rosere bench though maye pysse yet woll heue vp hys legge make countenaunce pysse manye man weneth maye synne lycorousnesse dothe wyth hys wyfe truely oppynyon false god wote man maye slee hym selfe wyth hys owne knyfe make hym selfe dronke owne tonne certes wife chylde anye worldly thynge loueth god hys maumet ydolaster man shulde loue wyfe discrecyon paciently attemperatlye though suster fyfthe fyngre dyuels honde stynkynge dede lecherye truely fyue fyngers glotonye dyuell putteth wombe man wyth fyue fyngers lecherye grypeth hym ye reynes throwe hym furneys helle shal haue fyre wormes euer shal laste wepynge waylynge sharpe hungre thurste grymnesse dyuels whyche shal al trede hem withouten ende lecherye sayd sourdeth springeth dyuers speces fornycacyon bytwene man woman maryed deedly syn ayenst nature al enemye distruction nature ayenst nature perfay reason man telleth wel also deedly synne moche god forbade lecherye saynte poule yeueth hem reygne ni dewe wyght hem done deedly synne synne lecherye byreue maydes maydenhede dothe certes casteth mayden hyest degre thys presente lyfe byreueth precious frute boke calleth hundred frutes ne saye none wyse english latyn hight centesimus fruct certes dothe cause many damage vilanyes mo anye man reken ryght cause many damage somtyme beestes felde breke hedge closure distroyeth maye restored certes may mayden hede restored arm smytte fro body u retourne ayen maye haue mercy wote wel yf haue wel penitence neuer shall na corrupte yt haue spaike somwhat auoutry also good shew perylles longe auoutrye eschewe foule synne auoutrye latyn saye approchynge mannes bedde throughe whyche somtyme one flesh abandon bodyes persones thys synne saythe wyse man folowe many harmes firste breakynge faythe certes faythe keye christendome whan faythe broke loste sothly christendom stout veyneard without fruite thys synne also theft thefte generally reue wight thyng ayenst hys wyll certes thys foulest thefte may whan woma stealeth body fro husbonde yeueth holour defoyle stealeth soule fro christ yeueth dyuell fouler thefte breake church steale away chalyce auouterers breke temple god spyrituellye steale vessell grace body soule whyche christ shall distroye hem sayth saynte paule sothlye thys thefte doubted greatlye ioseph whan hys lordes wyfe prayed hym vylanye whan sayde lo ladye howe lorde hath take vnder warde hathe thys worlde ne nothynge hys thynges power ye wyfe shulde thys wyckednesse syn horrible ayenst god ayenst lorde god forbede ala lytell suche trouthe nowe founde thyrde harme fylthe throughe whyche breake commaundemente god defoyle outer matrymonye christe certes muche sacrament maryage noble digne muche greater synne breake god made maryage paradyse estate innocencye multiply mankynde seruice god therfore breakynge therof greuous whiche breking come false heyres ofte time wrongfullye occupye folkes heritage therfore wol christ put hem reygne heuen herytage good folke thys breakyng cometh also oft time folke vnware wedde synne wyth owne kyn ed namely harlottes haunte bordels foule woman maye ekened comune gonge men pourge ordure say also putours lyue horrible synne putrye constreyne woman yeue hem certeyne rente bodyly putery yee tyme hys owne wyfe hys chylde done baudes certes bene cursed synnes vnderstande also auoutrie sette gladlye ten commaundementes bytwene thefte man slaughter greatest thrft yt may thefte bodye soule like homicide kerueth two breketh two hem fyrst made one fleshe therfore olde lawe god shulde slaine nathlesse ye law iesu christ lawe pytye whan sayde woman fonde auoutrye shulde haue slayne wyth stone wyll iewes lawe go sayde iesu christe haue wyll sinne sothly vengeaunce auoutrye awarded paynes hell distourbed penitence yet bene mo speces thys cursed synne whan one hem relygyouse elles bothe folke bene entred ordre subdeaken deaken preeste hospitaliers euer hyer ordre greater synne thynges greatlye agredge synne breaking auow chastitie wha receyued order ouer sothe holye order chefe treasorye god hys especial signe maike chastite shew ben ioyned chastitie whych moost precious life ordred folke bene speciallye titled god special meyne god whyche whan done deedly synne bene traytoures god hys people lyue people preestes ben angel dignetie misterye forsoth saynt paule sayth yt sathanas transfourmeth hym angell lyght sothly preest haunteth deedly synne maye lykened angell derkenesse transfourmed aungell lyght semeth angel lyght forsoth angel derkenesse suche preestes sonnes helye sheweth boke kynges sonnes beliall dyuell beliall saye wythout iudge fare hem thynketh free haue iuge hathe free bulle taketh whiche cowe hym lyketh towne fare wemen ryght one free bulle ynoughe al towne ryghte wycked preeste corruption ynoughe paryshe countre preestes sayth boke ne ministre mistery presthode people ne knowe god ne helde hem apayed sayth boke sodeyne fleshe hem offered toke force flesshe raw certes shrewes ne helde hem apayed rosted sodde fleshe people fedde hem greate reuerence wol haue rawe fleshe folkes wyues doughters certes woman yt cosente harlotry done great wronge christ holy church al halowes al soules byreue al hem shulde worshyp christe holy churche praye christen soules therfore haue preestes lem man also consente lecherye cursing al court christen til come amendemente thyrde spece auoutrye somtyme betwixt wyfe whan take regarde assemblynge fleshly delyte sayeth saynt ierome ne reken nothing ben assebled bycause ben maryed al good ynough thinke suche folke hath dyuell power sayde angell raphaell tobye assemblyng put iesu christ herte gyue selfe ordure fourthe spece asseble hem bene affinitie el hem wyth father kynred haue dealed synne lecherye thys synne maketh hem lyke houndes take kepe kynred certes parentele two maners eyther ghostly fleshly gostly deale wyth hys godsyb ryght engendreth chyld hys fleshly father right hys god father hys father espirituell whyche woman maye lesse synne assemble wyth godsyb wyth owne fleshly brother fifth spece abhominable synne whyche abhominable syn man vnneth ought speke ne write nathlesse openly rehersed holy writ thys cursed synne done men woman diuers entente diuers maner though holy writ speke horrible syn certes holy writte maye defoyled tha sune shyneth donghyll another synne apertayneth lecherye cometh sleping syn cometh often hem maydens also hem corrupt syn cal polucion commeth thre maners somtime languyshyng body humour bene ranke aboundaunt body man time infirmite feblenesse vertue retentife phisike maketh mencion somtime surfet meate drinke somtime vylanous thoughtes ben enclosed mannes mynd wha goeth slepe maye without synne whych men muste kepe hem wyselye elles maye men synne full greuously premedium contra peccatum luxurie nowe cometh remedy ayenst lecherye yt generally chastitie continence restrayne disordinate menynges yt come fleshely talentes euer greater meryte shal haue moost restreyneth wycked chaufynges ordoure thys sin thys two maners say chastite mariage chastite widowhed shalt yu vnderstande ye matrimony leful asseblyng man woman uen vertue thys sacramente bonde throughe whyche maye departed lyfe saye lyue thys sayeth boke full greate sacramente god made haue sayd paradyse wolde hym selfe borne mariage halowe maryage weddynge turned water wyne whyche fyrste miracle wrought earthe hys disciple trew effecte mariage clenseth fornication replenysheth holye churche good lynage ende mariage chaungeth deedly synne venyal sinne bitwene hem ben wedded maketh hertes one hem bene wedded well bodyes mariage established god er syn began whan naturall law ryght poynt paradise ordayned man shulde haue woman woma man saith saint augustyne many reason fyrste mariage figured betwixt christ holy churche another man head woma alway ordinaunce shuld yf woma mo men tha one shuld haue mo heedes tha one ryght horrible synne god also woman myght please manye folke one also shuld neuer rest ne quiete amonge hem eche hem wolde aske owne ryght furthermore man shulde know hys owne engendrure ne shulde haue hys heritage woman shulde lesse beloued cometh man shulde bere hym wyth hys wyfe namely two thynges saye sufferaunce reuerence shewed christ whan fyrste made woma ne made ye heade adam shulde claym greate lordshyp woman hathe maystrye maketh muche variaunce nede mo ensamples thys experience al daye ought ynough suffice also certes god ne made woman fote adam shuld behold lowe paciently suffre god made woman rybbe adam woman shulde felowe vnto man man shulde beare hym hys wyfe fayth trouth loue sayth saynt paule man shulde loue hys wyfe christ loueth holye churche loued well dyed shulde man hys wyfe yf nede nowe howe woman shulde subiecte husbande telleth saynte peter fyrst obedience also sayth decree woma wyfe long wyfe hath none auctoritye swere ne beare witnes without leaue husbande yt lorde alwaye shulde reason shulde also serue hym al honestye attepperate array woll well shulde set entent please husbades queintise araye ierom sayeth wiues yt apparelled sylke precious purple ne mowe nat clothe hem iesu christe saynt greg sayeth also wyghte seketh precious aray vaynglory honoured people great foly woman haue great araye outwarde selfe foule inwarde wyfe shulde also mesurable lokynge bearyng laughing discrete al wordes dedes aboue worldelye thynges shulde loue husbande wyth al herte hym true bodye shulde husbande hys wyfe sythe body husbandes shuld hert el betwixte hem two perfyte mariage shall men vnderstande thre thynges man hys wyfe fleshly may assemble first thentent engendrure chyldren seruice god certes cause finall matrimony another cause yelde ech hem ye dettes bodyes neyther hem hath power ther owne bodyes thyrde eschew lechery vyllanye fourthe forsoth deedlye synne fyrste meritorye seconde also sayeth decre hath meryte chastite yeldeth husbande dette body yee thought ayenst lykynge luste herte thyrde maner venyall synne truelye scarscely may anye wythout venyal synne corruption delyte fourth maner vnderstand assemble amorous loue none forsayde cause accomplyshe brennynge delyte recke howe ofte sothlye deedly sinne yt wyth sorowe folke woll payne hem appetyte suffiseth seconde maner chastitye clene wydowe eschew enbrasynges man desyre enbrasynge iesu christe bene haue bene wyues haue forgote husbandes also woman haue done lecherye bene receyued penitence certes yf wyfe coulde kepe chaste licence husbande yeue neuer none occasion offende greate meryte thys maner woman obserueth chastitie clothynge countenaunce abstinent eatinge drinkyng spekyng dede vessel boxe blessed maudelayne ye fulfylleth holy church good ordour thyrde maner chastitie virginitie behoueth holye herte clene body spouse iesu christe life aungels pray synge thys worlde martyr regaly hath yt tonge maye tell ne herte thynke virginitie bare lorde iesu christe virgyn hym selfe another remedy ayenst lechery speciallye withdrawe suche thynges yeue occasyon vylanye ease eatynge drinkyng certes whan potte boylleth stronglye best remedy wyth draw fyre slepyng longe great quiete also great nouryce lecherye another remedy ayenst lechery man woman eschew company hem whiche douteth tepted dede withstande yet great temptation sothly whyte walle thoughe ne brenne fullye stickyng candell yet wal blacke flame ful oft tyme rede trust hys owne perfection stronger sampson holyer daniel wyser salomon nowe haue declared seuyn deedly sinnes brauches wyth remedy sothly yf coulde wolde tel ten commaundementes hye doctrine put diuines nathlesse hope god ben touched treatise eche hem psequitur secunda par penitentie nowe asmuche seconde parte penitence stont confession mouth gan fyrste chap saye saynte austen sayeth sinne euery worde euery dede men coniecte agaynst lawe iesu christe thys synne hert mouth dede fyne wyttes ben syght hearyng smellyng tastyng sauour felynge nowe good vnderstande agredgeth muche euery sinne thou shalt consider thou art doste syn whether thou male female yonge olde gentyll thrall free seruaunt hole sicke wedded single ordred vnordred wyse fole clerke seculer yf thy kynrede bodilye gostly yf thy kynred haue synned wyth many mo thynges another circumstaunce whether done fornicacion aduoutry maner homiced horrible great synnes smal long thou hast cotinued synne thyrde circumstaunce place thou hast done synne wheder mennes house thyne owne felde church churchyarde church dedecate yf churche halowed man woman spyl kinde within place way sinne wicked teptation churche enterdited preest dyd villany terme hys life shulde synge masse shulde deedly synne euery tyme yt songe masse fourth circustauce mediatours messe gers enticement cosentment beare copany felowshyp manye wretche beare copanye wol go dyuel heel wherfore egge co sent sinne ben parteners sinne temptation synner fyfth circumstaunce howe many time hath synned minde oft hath fallen oft falleth syn dispiceth mercy god encreseth sinne vnkynde christ eth feble withstande syn synneth lyghtly later ryseth slow shriue namely yt cofessour whiche folke wha fal ayen olde folyes eyther leaue theyr olde cofessour el depart shrift diuers partes sothly suche departed shrifte deserueth mercy god synnes sixte circumstaunce man sinneth temptation selfe procure temptation excitinge folke syn wyth woman force assente yf woman maugre heede haue forced none shall tell whether couetise pouertye yf procurement thinges seuenth circumstaunce maner hathe hys synne howe hathe suffred folke haue shall man tell playnly wyth circumstaunces whether hathe synned wyth comen bordel woman none done hys synne holye tymes none fasting time none hys shrifte hys later shryfte hath parauenture broke therby penaunce enioyned whose helpe whose counsayle soce e crafte muste tolde thynges gret smale grudge conscience man woma eke preest thy iuge maye better auysed iugement yeuyng penauce thy contrition vnderstande wel tyme man hath defoyled hys baptyme synne yf woll come saluation none waye penaunce shryfte satisfaction namely two yf confessoure may shriue thyrde yf haue lyfe perfourme shall man loke consider yf wol make trewe profitable confession must foure condition fyrst must sorowfulnesse hert sayth kynge ezechiel god wol remebre al yeres lyfe bitternesse hert codition bytternes hath fyue signes fyrst confession muste shamefaste couer ne hide sin hath offeded lord god defoyled soule herof sayth saynte augustyn herte traueyleth shame sinne hath greate shamefastnes worthy haue gret mercy god cofession publicaue wolde heaue vp hys eyen heuen offended god heuen shamfastnesse anone ye mercy god therof sayeth saynt augustyn yt suche shameful folke next foryeuenesse mercy another signe humilite cofession sayth saynt peter humbleth vnder might god ye hande god strong cofession therby god foryeueth thy sinnes alone hath power humilite shalbe hert outwarde signes righte hath humilitie god herte ryghte shulde humble bodye outwarde preest yt sytteth goddes stede maner syth christe souerayne preeste meane mediatoure betwixte christe synner laste waye reason shulde nat synner sytte hye cofessour knele fete yf syckenesse cause shal take hede sytteth whose place sytteth man hath trespassed lorde cometh aske mercye make hys accorde sytteth hym downe hym men wolde holde hym outragious nat worthy sone haue remission hys trespace thyrde signe howe thy shryfte shulde full teares yf thou maye yf thou maye nat wepe wyth thy bodily eyen wepe thyne herte whyche confession saynte peter forsake iesu christe wente wepte full bitterly fourth signe thou ne lette nat shame shewe thy cofession confession magdaleyn ne spared shame hem feest go oure lorde iesu christe beknowe hym synnes fyfth signe man woman obeysaunte receyue penaunce hem enioyned certes iesu christe offence man obedient deth seconde condition confession hastely done certes yf man deedly wounde euer lenger taryeth heale hym selfe wolde corrupte haste hym hys deathe also wounde wolde worse heale ryghte fare synne longe tyme man vnshewed certes man ought hastelye shewe hys synnes manye cause drede deathe commeth ofte sodaynlye certayne tyme shall ne place also drenchyng synne draweth another also lenger taryeth farther fro christe abide hys last day scarscely may shriue hym remembre hym hys synnes repente greuous maladye hys death muche ne hathe hys lyfe herkened iesu christe whan hath spoken shall crye iesu christe hys last day scarscely woll herken hym vnderstande thys condition muste haue foure thynges thy shryfte must prouided auysed wycked hast doth profyte yf shriue hys synnes pride enuye forthe wyth speces circumstaunces synne haue coprehended hys mynde nombre greatnesse hys synnes howe longe hathe lyen syn also hathe contrite hys synnes stedfaste purpose grace god neuer ayen fal synne also drede counterwayte hym selfe flye occasion synne whych enclined also thou shalt shryue al thy synnes man part man part another vnderstande entent depart thy co fession shame drede stranglynge thy soule certes iesu christe entierly al good hym ny none imperfection therfore eyther foryeueth perfeitely el neuer deale saye nat yt yf thou assigned thy penytencer certayne synne thou arte bounde shewe hym ye remenant thy synnes thou haste shryuen thy curate yf lyke thy humilite thys parte thy shrift ne say nat speke diuision cofession yf thou haue licence shryue discrete honeste preeste lyketh lycence thy curate thou ne mayest well shryue al thy synnes let synne vntolde farre thou hast remembraunce whan thou shalt shryuen thy curate tell hym thy synnes thou haste syth thou wast laste shriuen thys wycked entent diuision shrift also shrift asketh certayne co dicions fyrst thou shriue thy fre wyl nat constrayned shame folke sickenesse ne thynges reason trespaceth free wyll free wyl confesse trespace none man tell hys synne selfe ne shal nat nay ne deny sin ne wrath ayenst preest amonysshyng leaue hys synne seconde condition thy shryfte laufull say thou shriuest also preest hereth thy confession veryly fayth holy churche man ne dispeyred mercy iesu christe caym iudas also man muste accuse self owne trespace another shall blame wyte hym selfe owne malice synne none nathelesse another man occasion entycer hys syn estate person synne agredged el yt may playnly shryue tel personne wyth whiche hath synned may tell entent ne backbyte person declare hys confession thou ne shalte also make leasynges thy confessio humilitie parauenture say thou hast commised done suche synnes whyche thou ne neuer gyltye saint augustyn sayeth yf thou bicause thyne humilitye makest leasynges thy selfe though thou sinne yet arte thou synne thy leasynge thou muste also shewe thy synne thyne owne proper mouthe thou dombe letter thou hast done synne shalte haue shame therfore thou shalt eke paynt thy cofession fayre subtell wordes couer thy synne begylest thou thy selfe nat preest thou muste tell playne neuer foule ne horrible thou shalte also shryue preest discrete cou sayle also thou shalte nat shriue vaynglorye ne ypocrisye ne cause loue feare iesu christ heale thy soule thou shalte also ren preest sodainly tel lightly thy sinne sayth tel tape tale auysedly good deuotion generally shryue ofte yf thou ofte fal ofte aryse confession though thou shriue ofter one synne thou hast shriuen merite sayth saynt augustyn thou shalt haue lyghtly foryeuenes grace god sinne payne certes one yere leest laufull houseled surely one yere thynges renouellen nowe haue tolde cofession seconde parte penitence pexplicit secunda par penitentie et sequitur tertia par thyrde part penitence satisfaction stant moste generallye almesse dedes bodily payne ben thre maner almes cotritio hert offreth self god haue pytie default neyghbour thyrde gyuyng good counsayle goostly bodily wheras men haue nede namely sustenance man fode take kepe yt hath nede thynges generallye hath nede fode clothing herbrow hath nede charitable counsayle visityng prison sickenesse sepulture body thou mayst nat visite nedeful thy persone visite thy message yeftes generally almesse workes charite hem haue temporal rich discretion counsaylyng workes shalte thou daye dome almesses shalt thou thyn owne proper thynges hastesy priuely thou mayst nathelesse thou mayst nat priuely thou shalte nat forbeare almesse though se nat thanke worlde thanke iesu christ witnesseth saynt mathu cap v cyte maye nat hydde set mountayne ne men lyght nat lantern putte vnder abusshel sette vpon candelsticke yeue light men ye house right shul lyght light men maye se good workes glorify father heuen speake bodely payne stont prayer wakyng fastyng vertuous teachyng orison ye shal vnderstonde orison prayer saye pitious wyll herte setteth god expresseth worde outwarde remeue harmes haue thynges spiritual durable somtyme temporall thynges orison certes oryson pater noster hath iesu chryst enclosed moost thynges certes priuileged thre thinges dignitie whyche digne anye prayer iesu chryst hym selfe made short shuld lerned yt lyghtly holde easye hert helpe hym selfe ofter orison manne shulde lesse werye saye excuse hym lerne shorte easye comprehendeth selfe good prayer exposition holy prayer excellent digne refere master theology saue thus moche woll saye whan thou prayest god shoulde foryeue thyne offence thou foryeuest haue offended well ware thou oute charitye holy orison aminisheth also venial syn therfore appertayneth specyallye penitence prayer must truly sayd parfyte fayth men praye god ordinatly discretly deuoutly alwaye man shall put wyll subiecte wyll god oryson muste also sayd great humblenesse full pure honestlye auoyaunce anye man woman muste also continued workes charitie auayleth also ayenst vice soule saith saynct ierome fastyng ben saued vice flesshe prayer vyces soule thou shalt vnderstond bodily prayer stont waking iesu christ sayth wake ye praye ye ne entre wycked temptation ye shul vnderstonde also fastyng stont thre thynges forberyng bodily mete drinke forbering wordly iolitie forberynge deedly syn say man shall kepe hym fro deedly syn myght thou shalt vnderstond also god ordayned fastynge fastynge pertayneth four thynges largenesse pore folke gladnesse hert spiritual angrye ne anoyed ne grutche fasteth also resonable hour eat measure saye man shall eate vntyme ne syt lenger table fasteth shalt thou vnderstonde bodily payne stont disciplyne teachynge worde wrytynge example also wearynge heer stamyn harbergions naked flesshe chrystes sake suche maner penaunces ne make nat thyne hert bytter angrye ne anoyed thy selfe better cast awaye thyne heere cast away swetnesse iesu chryst therfore sayth saynct poule clothe ben chosen god hert misericorde debonartie suffrauce suche maner clothyng iesu chryste pleased heeres habergions disciplyne also knockynge thy brest scourgyng roddes knelyng tribulation suffrynge pacientlye wronges ben also paciet suffrynge sycknesse lesyng worldlye goodes cattel wyfe chylde frendes shalt thou vnderstande thinges distourbe penaunce foure maners drede shame hope wanhope desperation speake fyrste drede whiche weneth maye suffre penaunce ayenst remedy thynke bodilye penaunce shorte lytle regarde payne hell cruell longe lasteth without ende nowe ayenst shame man hath shryue hym namely ypocrytes wold hold perfyte haue nede shryue hem ayenste shame shulde man thynke way reason hath ashamed foul thynges certes hym ought ashamed fayre thynges cofessyons man shuld also thinke god seeth knoweth thoughtes hys werkes hym may nothyng hyd ne couered men shoulde also remembre hem shame com day dome hem ben penitent shryuen present lyfe creature erth hell shall se apertly hydde present worlde nowe speake hope hem bene negligent slow shryue stondeth two maners one hopeth lyue longe purchace moche rychesse delyte tha wol shriue hym sayeth hym semeth tymely ynough come shryft surquidrie hath christes mercy ayenst fyrst vyce shal thynke lyfe sykerneke also rychesses world ben aduenture passe shadowe wall sayth saynct gregorye appertayneth great ryghteousnesse god neuer shal payne stynte hem neuer wold withdrawe hem fro synne thankes euer continued synne perpetuall wyll synne shall haue perpetuall payne wanhope two maners fyrst wanhope mercy god thynke ne myght longe perseuer goodnesse fyrste wanhope commeth demeth hath synned greatlye oft longe lyen synne shal saued certes agaynst cursed wa hope shuld thynke passion iesu chryste stronge vnbynde synne stronge bynde ayenste seconde wanhope shal thynke often falleth maye ryse agayne penitence though neuer long hath lyen synne mercy chryst alway redy receyue hym mercye ayenste wanhope deemeth shoulde longe perseuer goodnesse shall thynke feblenesse deuyl may nothyng yf men woll suffre hym also shall haue stregth helpe iesu christ holye churche protection angel yf hym lyst shal men vnderstande fruyte penaunce wordes iesu chryst endlesse blesse heauen ioye hath neuer ende contrariety wo ne greuaunce ther al harmes ben passed preset lyfe ye sykernes fro payne hell blysfull company reioyse hem euermo eueriche others ioye ther body man somtyme foule dark clere sunne body somtyme sycke freyle feble mortall immortall stronge hol ne maye nothyng appeyre ther neyther hungre thurst ne colde euery soule replenysshed syght perfyte knowynge god blysfull reygne may men purchace pouertie espirituel glory lownesse plentie ioye hungre thurst rest trauayle lyf deth mortification syn whiche lyfe v bryng bought v pecious bloude amen phere endeth person tale phere begynneth plowman prologue ploweman plucked vp plowe whan mydsommer mone comen sayd b estes shuld rate ynowe lyge grasse vp chynne ben feble oxe cowe hem ny left bone skynne shoke snare cultre drowe honge harneys py e phe toke tabarde staffe eke heed set hat sayde wolde saynt thomas seke pylgremage goth forth platte scrippe bare breed lekes forswonke forswatte men might haue sene chekes euery wang toth sat pour hoste behelde wele sawe man sunne ybrent knewe well senged shoute clothes rent man wont walke na nat alway cloystre ypent coulde religiouslyche loute therfore fully shent pour host axed man art thou syr quod hyne wont go plowe erne meate yer dyne swete swynke make auowe wyfe chyldren therwith fynde serue god wyst howe leude men bene full blynde pfor clerkes saye shullen fayne lyuelod swet swynke ryght nought v gyue agayne neyther eate ne yet drinke mowe lawe sayne v curse dampne hell brynke thus putten v payne candle queynt belle clynke pthey make v thralles lust sayne mowe nat el saued haue corne dust speaketh ther agayn say raued pwhat man host canst thou preache come nere tell v holy thynge psyr quod herde ons teache prest pulpyt good preachynge psaye quod host beseche syr redy byddyng praye noman reproche whyle tale tellynge thus endeth prologue foloweth fyrst parte tale sterne stryfe stered newe many stedes stounde sodry sedes bene sewe semeth som ben vnsounde great growen vngrounde ben soule symple small whether hem falser sounde falser foule mote hym befall pthat one syde tell pope cardynals prelate parson monkes freers fell priours abbottes great estate heuyn hell kepe yates peter successours ben demed olde date falshed foule mought befall pthe syde ben poore pale people put prease seme caytyffes sore cale euer one without encrease clepeth iollers loudlese toteth hem bene vntall ben arayed peace falsshed foule mote befall pmany countrey haue sought knowe falser two euer trauayle nought ferre haue go wandred wro wodde besyde wall two foules sawe sytte tho falser foul mote hym befall pthat one dyd plede pope syde gryffon grymme stature pellycane withouten pryde lollers layde lure mused matter measure counsayle chryst euer gan call gryffon shewed sharpe fyre falshed foule mote befall pthe pellycan began preache mercy mekenesse sayd chryst gan v teache meke mercyable gan blesse euangely beareth wytnesse lambe lykeneth christ ouer tokenynge mekest sith pryde heuen fall pand shulde euery christned preestes peter successours beth lowlyche lowe degree vsen none erthly honour neyther crowne ne curious couetours ne pylloure ne proude pall ne nought cofren vp great treasours falshed foule mote befall ppreests shulde cattel plede chasten hem charite ne bateyle shulde men lede inhaunsyng owne degree nat wylne syttynges hye see ne souerayntie house ne hall worldly worshippe defye flee wylleth highnes foule shall fall palas may suche sayntes call wylneth welde erthlye honour lowe lucifere suche shall fall baleful blacknesse ybuylden boure eggeth people errour maketh hem thrall chryst holde suche one
