hatte floures freshe may chapelet rose whytsondaye suche araye ne costneth lyte thine handes washe thy teeth make white let fylth vpon thy nayles blacke yf thou mayst se voyde awaye delyuerly kembe thyne heed ryght iolyly farce thy visage wyse loue thempryse loue doth haten fynde beaute cometh nat kynde alwaye hert rede glad mery ioyfull thou loue hath ioye sorowful man yuel ful curtesy knoweth hys malady euer loue sycknesse meynte wyth swete bytternesse sore loue maruaylous nowe louer ioyous nowe playne nowe grone nowe syngen nowe maken mone day playneth heuynesse morowe playneth iolynesse lyfe loue ful contrarye whyche stoundemeale ofte varye yf thou canst myrthes make men gre wol gladly take goodly commaunde men shulde euer thynge hem syttynge therof commeth good loo pris wherof thou vertuous ne straunge ne daungerous yf thou good ryder prycke gladly men may se armes also yf thou come pursue tyl thou name haste wonne yf thy voice fayre clere thou shalt maken greate daungere whan synge goodly pray thy worshyp abey also longeth aye harpe gyterne daunce playe yf wel fote daunce maye hym greatly auaunce amonge eke thy lady sake songes complayntes thou make wol meuen hete whan reden thy smerte loke man scarce holde may greue manyfolde reson wol louer gyftes large fre chorles louyng therof thyng shal lefe aye yeue londes lore wolde leue sodayne syght kyssyng anon ryght yaue hole herte wyl thought hym selfe kepeth right nought swyfte good reason yeue good abandon nowe woll reherce haue sayde verce sentence wordes fewe compendously thou mayste better hem thynke whether thou wake wynke wordes lytel greue man kepe whan breue loue wol gon ryde mote curteyes voyde pryde mery full iolyte largesse losed first ioyne penaunce euer without repentaunce thou set thy thought thy louyng last without repentyng thynke vpon thy myrthes swete shal folowe whan ye mete thou trew loue shalt wyl comaunde one place thou set al hole thyne hert wythout halfen dole trechery sykernesse loued neuer doublenesse many hert wol depart eueryche shal haue lytel parte hym drede right nought one place setteth thought therfore place sette lette neuer then flette thou yeuest lenyng holde wreched thyng therfore yeue hole quyte thou shalt haue meryte lent soone bounte thanke done loue free yeuen thyng requireth great guerdonyng yeue yeft al quyte fully make thy gyfte debonairly men yefte holde dere yeuen wyth gladsome chere gyfte nought praysen man yeueth maugre whan thou haste yenen thyne hert haue sayd openly auentures shall fall whych harde heuy bene wyth oft whan thou bethynkest thy louynge thou folke thou must depart hye none perceyue thy malady hyde thyne harme thou must alone go forth sole make thy mone thou shalt whyle state whylom colde whylom hate nowe reed rose yelowe fade sorowe trowe thou neuer hade cotidien ne quarteyne nat full peyne often tymes shall fall loue amonge thy paynes thou thy selfe al holy foryeten shalt vtterly many tymes thou shalt styl ymage tree dome stone wythout steryng fote hande wythout spekyng sone al thy payne memorye shalt thou come agayne man abashed wonder sore syghen wytte thou wele wythouten wene estate ful ofte haue bene haue yuel loue assayde wher thou arte dismayde thought shal take thy loue ferre fro thou shalte saye god maye thys ne may lady se myne hert alone go abyde al sole wo departed fro myne owne thought wyth myne eyen se ryght nought ala myne eyen sene ne may carefull hert conuay myne hertes gyde prayse nothyng euer se shulde abyde nay gone visiten wythout delay myne herte desyreth certaynly yf go foole selfe may wel holde whan ne se myne hert wolde wherfore wol gone sene eased shal neuer bene haue tokenyng gost thou forth wythout dwelling oft thou faylest thy desyre er thou mayst come nere wastest vayne thy passage fallest thou newe rage want syght thou gynnest mourne homewarde pensyfe thou dost returne greate mischefe shalt thou agayne shall come syghes playntes wyth newe wo itchynge prycketh wote nought may go lere hem byen loue dere thyng thyne herte appesen maye ofte thou wolt gone assaye thou mayst sene auenture thy lyues ioye thyne hertes cure grace yf thou myght attayne haue syght shalt thou done none dede wyth syght thyne eyen fede fayre freshe whan thou mayst se thyne herte shal rauyshed neuer thou woldeste thy thankes lete ne remoue se swete thou seest sothfastnesse thou couytest swetnesse thyne hert brenneth fyre thyne hert desyre consydreth euerydele may lykened wonder wele payne loue vnto fere euermore thou neyghest nere thought soth tel hotter euer shalt thou brenne experience shal kenne comest coste next fyre brenneth moste yet forsoth al thyne hete thoughe thou loue swelte swete ne thynge thou felen maye thou shalt wyllen passe awaye though thou go yet must nede thynke al day fayre hede thou behelde wyth good wyll holde thy selfe begyled yll thou ne haddest none hardyment shewe ought thyne entent thyne hert full sore thou wolte dispise eke repreue cowardyse thou dull euery thyng dome drede wythout spekyng thou shalt eke thynke thou dydest folye thou fast bye durst auntre say thyng er thou come away thou haddeste wonne speke whan thou begonne yet wolde thy sake armes goodly haue take shuld haue bene worth treasour great plente thus shalte thou mourne eke coplayne get encheson gone agayne vnto thy walke thy place thou behelde fleshely face neuer false suspection thou woldost fynde occasion thou gone vnto house arte thou desyrouse syght haue thou thyne honour myghtest saue erande myghtest make thyder thy loues sake ful fayne thou woldest drede thou goest leest men take hede wherfore rede thy goyng also thyne agayne commyng thou wel ware men ne wyt feyne cause go waye fast bye heale wel folye yf happe thou thy loue mayst se seker wyse thou salewe wherwyth thy colour wol transmewe eke thy bloude shall quake thy hewe eke chaungen sake worde wytte wyth chere full pale shal wante tell thy tale yf thou mayst ferforth wynne thou reason durst begynne woldest sayne thre thynges mo thou shalt ful scarsly sayne two though thou bethynke neuer wele thou shalt foryete yet somdele bvt yf thou deale wyth trecherye false louers mowe folye saine lust wtoute drede double falshede herte thynke thynge sayne another spekynge whan thy speche ended ryght thus shall befall worde come mynde thou saye haste lefte behynde thou shalt brenne great martyre thou shalt brenne fyre thys stryfe eke affraye batell lasteth aye thys bargayne ende maye neuer take yf thy peace wyll make whan nyght comen anon thousande angres shall come apon bedde faste thou wolte dyght thou shalt haue small delyght whan thou wenest slepe full payne shalte thou crepe sterte thy bedde aboute full wyde turne full often euery syde nowe downwarde grosse nowe vpright walowe wo longe nyght thyn armes shalte thou sprede brede man werre forwerede shall come remembraunce shappe semblaunce wherto none maye pere wete thou well wythout shall se somtyme nyght thou haste bryght naked betwene thyne armes sothfastnesse though thou shalte make castels spayne dreme ioye al vayne delyten ryght nought whyle thou slombrest thought swete delytable whyche soth ny fable ne shall whyle laste shalte thou syghe wepe faste saye dere god thynge dreme turned amys whyche ful swete apparent nowe wake shent nowe yede thys mery thought away twenty tymes vpon day wolde thys thought wolde come agayne alegeth well payne maketh full ioyefull thought sleeth lasteth nought ah lorde nyll ye socoure ioye trowe langoure deth wolde shulde slo whyle lye armes two myne harme harde wythouten wene great vnease full ofte mene bvt wolde loue myght haue fully ioye bryght payne quitte richly ala greate thynge aske folye wronge wenyng aske outragious thyng asketh folyly mote warned hastely ne wote maye say ferre way wolde haue full great lykyng full greate ioye lasse thyng wolde gentylnesse withouten one kesse greate guerdon relece al passion harde come therto foly hygh haue myne herte sette maye comforte gette wote saye wel nought thys wote well thought thet better alone stynte wo mone loke cast goodly haue vtterly hole play ah lorde shal byde day euer shal lady full cured maye se god whan shall dawnyng sprynge lyggen thus angry thynge haue ioye thus lye whan loue bye man lyen hath great disese whyche may slepe ne rest ese wolde dawed day nyght went away daye wolde vp ryse ah slowe sunne shewe thyne enprise spede sprede thy beemes bryght chace derkenesse nyght put away stoundes stronge whych lasten al longe nyght shalte thou contynue wythout rest payne wo yf euer thou knewe loue distresse thou shall mowe lerne sickenesse thus endurynge shalte thou lye ryse morowe vp erly thy bedde harneys er euer dawnyng thou mayst se al priuely shalte thou gone whyder thy selfe alone reyne hayle snowe slete thyder dwelleth swete whiche may fall slepe thynketh lytle vpon shalte thou go ful foule aferde loke yf gate vnsperde wayte wythout wo payne ful yuel coulde wynde rayne shalt thou go dore thou mayst fynde shore hole refte euer shalte thou stoupe laye eer wythin slepe meane al saue thy lady free wakynge yf thou mayst aspye go put thy selfe inpardye aske grace bymene may wete wythout wene thou nyght reste haste sore thou bestad woman well ought pytie take hem sorowen sake loke loue relyke thou thynke none lyke whan thou hast great annoy shal kysse er thou go awey holde ful great deynte man shal se house ne way loke thou begone agayne er day commyng goyng heuynesse walkyng maketh louers wythouten wene vnder clothes pale lene loue leaueth coloure ne cleernesse loueth trewe hath fatnesse thou shalt well thy selfe se thou must nedes assayed men shape hem way falsely ladyes betray wonder though fatte wyth false othes loues gatte ofte se suche losengeours fatter abottes priours yet wyth thynge charge saye thou large vnto mayde doth serue best thanke thou shalt deserue yeue gyftes get grace thou may thanke purchace worthy holde fre thy lady al may se also seruauntes worshyp aye please much thou maye great good hem maye come bycause wyth bene priue shal tell howe fande curreys wyse wel doande shal preyse wel loke lande thou fore yf cause thou haue behoueth gone countre leaue hole thyne hert hostage tyl thou agayne make thy passage thynke longe se swete thyng hath thyne herte kepyng nowe haue tolde wyse louer shal seruice yf thou wolte haue mede thou craue whan loue al thys boden sayd hym sir howe may louers may manere endure ye paine ye haue said meruayle wonder faste howe man may lyue laste payne brennyng sorowe thought syghyng aye vnrelesed wo make whether slepe wake anoy continually helpe god meruayle howe man made stele myght lyue month paynes fele god loue sayde frende fayth owe may man haue good bye man lyueth tenderlye thyng hath bought moste dere wete thou well wythout thanke thinge taken whych man hath suffred sore certes wo ne may attayne vnto sore loues payne none yuell therto ne may amounte man counte droppes water drye wel greate see thou myghtest harmes tell hem wyth loue dwell seruice peyne hem sleeth eche man wolde flye deth trowe shulde neuer escape nere hope couthe hem make glad man prison sete may getten ete barlye breed water pure lyeth vermyn ordure wyth thys yet lyue good hope comforte hath hym yeue whiche maketh wene shall delyuered come liberte fortune full trust though lye strawe dust hope hys sustaynyng louers wenyng loue hath shytte hys prisoun good hope saluatioun good hope howe sore smerte yeueth hem wyll herte profer bodye martyre hope sore doth hem desyre suffre eche harme men deuyse ioye afterwarde shall aryse hope desyre catche victorye hope loue glorye hope ye loue maye yeue nere hope shulde leger lyue blessed hope whych desyre auaunceth louers manyre good hope curteyse please kepe louers disease hope kepeth hys lande woll abyde peryll maye betyde hope louers moost chefe doth hem endure mischefe hope helpe whan myster shall yeue eke ywys thre thynges greate solace doth hem lace fyrste good maye founde hem lace bounde swete thought recorde thynge wherwyth thou canst accorde best thyne herte thynkyng absence good whan louer doth complayne lyueth distresse payne swete thought shall come blyue awaye hys angre dryue maketh louers haue remembraunce comforte hygh pleasaunce hope hathe hyght wynne thought anone shall begynne ferre god wotte fynde make myrrour hys mynde beholde wol lette person shall afore hym sette laughyng eyen persaunt clere shappe forme goodly chere mouth gratious swete eke sauerous feyters shall take hede eyen wyth lymmes fede thus swete thynkynge shall aswage paynes louers rage thy ioye shall double wythout gesse whan thou thynkest symelynesse laughyng chere made thy lady dere thys comforte woll thou take yf nexte thou wolte forsake whiche lesse sauerous thou shuldest bene daungerous seconde shall swete speche hathe manye leche brynge hem oute wo helpe manye bachelere many lady sent succour haue loued paramour spekynge whan myght louers hem dere voydeth al smerte whiche closed herte herte maketh hem glad lyght speche whan mowe haue syght therfore cometh mynde olde dayes fynde clerkes wryten knewe ther lady fresh hewe loue made songe hym remembre amonge sayd whan speken hym dere voydeth smerte wy sytteth nere herte speake hym eue morowe cureth sorowe none hygh pleasaunce person dalyaunce wyst ful wel swete speakyng comforteth full moche thynge loue full well assayde hym full well apayde speke hym ioye set therfore rede thou get felowe wel concele kepe thy counsayle wel hele whome go shewe holly thyne hert well wo ioye smerte get comfort hym thou go priuyly bytwene two ye shall speake goodly thyng hath thyne hert kepynge beautie semblaunce goodly countenaunce al thy state thou shalt hym say aske hym counsayle thou maye thyng may plese shall great ese may wete thou trust hym bothe thy wele thy wo yf het loue set company moche bet reson wyll shewe vtterly priuitie loueth playnly shall vndo without drede shame bothe tell renome name shall farther ferre nere namely thy lady dere syker wyse yea euery shall helpen owne brother trouth without doublenesse kepen close sykernesse noble thynge fay haue man thou darst say thy priuy counsayle euery dele wyll comfort ryght wele thou shalt holde wel apayed whan suche frende thou hast assayed thyrde good greate comforte yeueth louers disporte commeth syght beholdynge cleped swete lokyng maye none ese whan thou art ferre thy lady fro wherfore thou prese alway place thou mayest se thyng moost amerous moost delytable fauerous aswage man sorowe sene lady morowe full noble thynge whan thyne eyen haue metyng relyke precyous wherof desyrous daye soth haue drede faren amys dreden neyther wynde ne rayne ne non maner payne thyne eyen thus blysse yet curtesye ywys alone haue ioye hert conuoye parte blysse hym thou sende harme make ende eye good messangere hert suche manere tydynges sende hath sene voyde hym paynes clene wherof hert reioyseth great partye wo voyded put awaye flyght ryght darkenesse nyght chased clerenesse mone ryght al wo full soone deuoyded clene whan syght beholden may fresh wyght herte desyreth darknesse ago hert ease whan sene hem please haue declared thou drede dout haue tolde faythfully may curen vtterly louers wol faythfull full stabylitie good hope alway kepe thy syde swete thought make eke abyde swete lokyng swete speche thyne harmes shalbe leche euery thou shalt haue great pleasaunce yf thou canst byde suffraunce serue well without fayntyse thou shalt quyte thyne empryse guerdoun yf thou lyue tyme yeue god loue whan al daye taught ye haue herde saye enfourmed compendously vanyshed away sodaynly alone left sole full complaynt dole sawe noman woundes greued wondersly curen nothyng knewe saue bothom bryght hewe wheron set holly thought comfort knewe nought god loue knewe ele behoue myght ease comfort gete yf wolde hym entermete roser withouten dout closed hedge without ye toforne haue herde sayne fast busyed wolde fayne haue passed haye yf myght haue getten sleyght vnto bothom fayre se euer drad blamed men wolde haue suspectioun wolde ententioun haue stole rose therfore entre fere last bethought whether shulde passe nought sawe come glad chere lustye bachelere good stature good height bialacoil forsoth hight sonne curtesy graunted full gladly passage vtter hay sayde syr ye maye passe yf wyll fresh roser se ye swete sauour fele warrans may ryght wele thou kepe fro foly shal man vylany yf may helpe ought shall fayne dredeth nought bounde seruyse fully deuoyde feyntyse vnto bialacoil sayd thanke syr full hertely behest take gre ye goodly proffer cometh great fraunchyse ye profe seruyse full delyuerly breers anon went whereof encombred haye well plesed soth saye se bothom fayre swote fresh spronge rote bialacoil serued wele whan nygh myght fele bothome swete odour lusty hewed colour churle foule hym betyde besyde rose gan hym hyde kepe rose rosere whome name daungere churle hyd greues couered grasse leues spye take fonde vnto roser put honde fole mo hym two wicked maners euyl fame one cleped name wycked tonge god yeue hym sorowe neyther eue ne morowe man good speake many iust man doth wreke woman eke hyght shame reken ryght trespasse father name mother reason thus shame brought ylke two yet trespasse neuer ado reson ne neuer laye hydous vgly meane trespasse hyght reason conceyueth syght shame spake aforne whan shame borne ordayned chastitie shulde roser lady bothoms la sondrye folke assayled ne wyst venus assayleth nyght day stal bothoms rose ouer reason prayeth chastitie venus hath flemed ouer see doughter wolde leue kepe roser fresh grene anon reason chastitie fully assented graunted request shame bycause honest shal keper roser thus kepe thre none shulde hardy ne bolde yonge olde agayne wyll away bere bothoms ne rose well sped nat bene awayted thre sene bialacoil fayre gratious debonayre quytte hym full curtesly please bad shulde drawe bothom nere prese touche rosere bare rose yafe leue graunt ne myght lytle greue sawe lyked ryght nygh bothom pulled leafe al grene yaue full nygh bothom sat made leafe ful queynt felte acquaynt bialacoil pryue wende wyll wext hardy tell bialacoil befell loue toke wounded sayd syr mote maye ioye haue wyse vpon syde ryse syth yf shall feyne hert haue great peyne great anoy suche affray ne wot shall saye drede wrath deserue leuer knyues kerue body shulde peces small wyse shulde fall ye wrathed shulde ben saye boldly thy wyll quod nyl wroth yf maye nought thou shalt saye sayde syr displease knowen greate vnease whiche onelye loue hath brought paynes greate disese thought fro day day doth drye supposeth syr lye fyue woundes dyd make sore shall neuer slake ye bothom graunt moost passaunt beautie lyfe deth martyre treasour moost desyre bialacoil affrayed sayd syr may fall ye desyre maye aryse wolde ye shende wyse mokel foole yf suffred away bere fresh bothom fayre syght neyther skyll ne ryght roser ye broke rynde take rose aforne kynde ye curteys aske let styll roser syt let growe tyl amended parfetly come beautie nolde pulled fro roser bere lefe dere anon stert daunger place hydde malyce chere kydde full great blacke hewe sturdy hydous whoso hym knewe lyke sharpe vrchons heer growe eye red sparklyng fyre glowe nose frounced full kyrked stode come cryande wood sayd bialacoil tell thou bryngest hyther boldly hym nygh rosere thou worchest wronge manere thynketh dishonour thou art well worthy haue maugre let hym rosere wytte serueth felon euyll quytte thou woldest haue done great bountie shame wolde quyte flye hence felowe rede go wanteth lytle wol slo bialacoil ne knewe nought whan serue set thought thou wolt shame hym yf thou myght agayne reason ryght woll nomore affye comest slyghly tespye proueth wonder wele thy sleyght trayson euery dele durst nomore make abode churle wode gan thret manace hay dyd chace feare hym trymbled quoke churlyshly heed shoke sayd yf eft myght take shulde hondes scape bialacoil fled mate sole disconsolate left alone payne thought shame death nygh brought thought hygh folly body vtterly yeue payne martyre therto hadde great yre ne durst hayes passe hope grace trowe neuer man wyst payne laced loues chayne ne man soth yf loue angre loue holdeth heest ryght wele whan payne sayd shulde fele hert may thynke ne tonge sayne quarter wo payne myght angre last myne hert poynt brast whan thought rose daunger cast fro longe whyle stode state tyll sawe mad mate lady hygh warde tower loked thytherwarde reason men clepe lady tower delyuerly come downe without neyther yonge ne hore ne hygh ne lowe ne fat ne lene best mene eyen two clere lyght candel brenneth bryght heed crowne semed well hygh person rounde enuyron crownet full ryche stone fret goodly semblaunt deuyse trowe made paradyse nature neuer suche grace forge werke suche compasse certeyne yf letter lye god hym selfe hye made ymage yaue sythe suche auauntage hath myght segnorie kepe men folly woll trowe lore ne may offenden neuermore whyle stode darke pale reason began tale sayde alhayle swete frende foly chyldhode wyll shende haue put great affraye thou hast bought dere tyme maye made thyne herte mery euyll tyme thou wentest se garden wherof ydlenesse bare keye mastresse whan thou yedest daunce acquayntaunce acquayntaunce peryllous fyrst soft noyous hath trasshed without wene god loue nat sene ne ydlenesse conueyde verger myrth hym pleyde yf follye haue supprysed recouered welware take nomore counsayle greueth sore wyse wyll hym selfe chastyse though yonge man wyse trespasse amonge folly let hym tary hastely let hym amende whatso mys eke counsayle ywis god loue holly foryet hath suche payne set hert turmented sene thou must go wayes garysoun daunger feloun felly purposeth werrey full cruell soth sey yet daunger commeth blame rewarde doughter shame hath ye rose ward maye musarde wycked tonge two suffreth man thyther go er thyng shal cometh ouer fourty place yf sought say thing neuer ne wrought moche trayson male falsnesse sayne tale thou delest angry folke ywys wherfore better folke awaye fare wol make lyue care euyll loue call wherin foly loue folly euery dell loueth nowyse maye well ne setteth though good werke schole leseth yf clerke craft eke yf shall thryue therin loue shall haue passyoun monke hermyte chanoun payne herde mesure ioye maye eke whyle endure possessyoun moche tribulatioun ioye short lastyng happe gettyng se many trauayle last foule fayle nothyng thy counsayler whan thou made homager god loue hastely wysdom folly thyne hert ioly sage whan thou brought suche rage yelde redely loue great maystry rede loue awaye dryue maketh retche thy lyue folly fro day day shall growe thou put awaye take thy teeth brydle fast daunt thyne hert eke cast yf thou mayest get defence redresse thy fyrst offence whoso hert alway wol leue shall fynde amonge shal hym greue whan herde thus chastyse answered full angry wyse prayed cesse speche eyther chastyse teche byd thought refreyne loue hath caught demeyne wene ye loue woll consent assayleth bowe bent drawe myne hert honde quyckly bonde ye counsayle may neuer fyrst arested toke myne hert sore hym tyll nothyng wyll thought hym obey sparred key praye let styll ye may well yf ye wyll wordes waste ydlenesse vtterly wit houten gesse al ye sayne vayne leuer dye payne loue mewarde shulde arette falshed treson sette wyll get pryse blame loue true saue name chasteseth hym hate worde reson went gate whan sawe sermonyng myght fro foly brynge dismayed left sole forwery forwandred fole ne knewe cherysaunce fell remembraunce loue bade puruey felowe myght sey counsel priuytie shulde moche auayle bethought felowe fast true syker curteys hende called name frende trewer felowe non haste hym went anon hym wo tolde hym ryght nought wold witholde tolde hym without made compleynt daungere nowe se hydous mewarde contrarious crueltie poynt haue meymed bialacoil whan heme sey within garden walke pley fro made hym go beleste alone wo durst lenger hym speke daunger sayd wolde wreke whan sawe howe went fresh bothom hent yf hardy come nere bytwene hay rosere frend wyst thought discomforted ryght nought sayd felow mad ne abashed bestad selfe knowe full well daungere howe fers chere prime temp loue manace full oft haue bene case felon fyrst though thou shalt hym souple se longe passed knewe hym wele vngoodly fyrst though men hym fele woll meke bearynge ben seruyce obeysynge shal tell thou shalt mekely rede thou go hym herte praye hym specyally thy trespace haue mercy hote hym well plese thou shalt neuer hym displese best serue flatery shall please daunger vtterly frende hath sayd wele eased hath somdele eke alegged turment hym hardement agayne daunger go preue myght meke hym daunger came asshamed whiche aforne blamed desyrynge pea woo ouer hedge durst go forbode passage founde hym cruell rage honde great burdowne hym kneled lowe adowne full meke porte symple chere sayde syr comen onely aske mercy greueth full greatly euer lyfe wrathed amenden come myght loude styl done ryght owne wyll loue made haue trespassed hytherto fro ne maye withdrawe myne herte yet shall neuer ioye ne smert befall good yll offende agayne wyll leuer haue endure disease shulde displease requyre pray ye haue mercy pytye stint yre greueth wol swere euer mo redressed lykyng yf trespasse thynge saue praye graunt thyng may warned maye loue onely none thynge aske shall done well ywis yf grace ye graunt thys ye maye nat letten well wote ye loue free shall louen suche wyll euer lyke well yll yet ne wolde fraunce thynge displesaunce daungere fyll hys entent foryeue hys male talent hys wrathe yet last hath released prayde fast shortely sayd thy request nat mokell dishonest ne woll nat werne yet nothynge engreueth though thou loue thus euermore neyther softe ne sore loue lyst retcheth ferre fro rose trust nat none assaye tyme passe haye thus hath graunted prayere went forthe withouten vnto frende tolde hym whyche right ioyfull tale sayd nowe gothe well thyne affayre shall debonayre though aforne dispitous shall herafter gratious touched good veyne shulde yet rewen thy peyne suffer rede boost make tyll thou good me mayst hym take sufferaunce wordes softe man maye ouercome ofte hym aforne drede bokes sothely rede thus hath frende great comforte auaunced wyth hygh disporte whyche wolde good moche anone full sodainly toke leaue streight went vnto haye great talent hadde sene freshe bothom wherin laye saluatioun daungere kepe yf kepe hym couenaunt trewly sore dradde hys manasyng durste nat breke hys byddyng lest hym shent brake nat hys commaundement purchase hys good wyll come tyll hys mercy ferre behynde kepte ne myght fynde complayned sighed sore languyshed euermore durst nat ouer go vnto rose loued throughout demyng vtterly knowlege certaynly loue ladde suche wyse fentyse falsheed ne trechery yet full villany disdayne cruelte ne wolde haue pyte hys cruel wyll refrayne tho wepte alwaye complayne thys tourment come grace god sent fraunchyse pyte fulfylde bothom bounte go daungere anon ryght forther wyth myght helpe worde dede well sawe nede fyrst grace dame fraunchyse hath taken thys empryse sayd daungere great wronge ye worche thys man moche wo pynen hym angerly great villany canne nat se ne hath trespassed agayne saue loueth wherfore ye shulde cherete hym holde force loue maketh hym thys wolde hym blame dyd amys lefeth ye maye hys payne harde ye maye se lo loue wyse wolde consent ye haue power repent though quicke ye wolde hym slo fro loue hys herte may nat go nowe swete syr ease hym angre disease ala maye auaunce done hym great greuaunce worshyppe agayne hym take man werre make sithe lowly euery wyse redy ye luste deuyse loue haue caught hym hys lace bey euery caas ben subiecte wyll shulde ye therfore wyllen hym yll ye shulde hym spare hym bothe proude stout curtesy woll ye socure hem ben meke vnder cure hys hert harde woll nat meke whan men mekenesse hym beseke thys certayne sayd pyte se ofte humylyte bothe yre also felony venquysheth also melancoly stonde forthe suche duresse thys cruelte wyckednesse wherfore pray sir daungere mayntene lenger suche cruell werre agayne man holly euer ye worchen wo vpon thys caytife languysheth whyche woll trespace put hym holly grace hys offence ne lyte god loue wyte thrall greatly yf ye harme hym ye done amys hath full harde penaunce sythe ye reste hym thaqueyntaunce bialacoil hys moste ioye whyche hys paynes myght acoye anoyed sore ye doubled hym well blysse hath ben full bare sythe bialacoil fro hym fare loue hath hym great distresse hath nede duresse voydeth hym yre rede ye may wynnen thys dede maketh bialacoil repayre agayne haueth pyte vpon hys payne franchyse woll pyte mercyfull hym ye sythe accorde haue vpon hym mi icorde pray eke mou ste nought refusen requeste harde fell thought v two woll right nought daunger ne might endure meked hym vnto mesure wol wyse saythe daungere deny ye haue asked great vncurtesye woll ye haue companye bialacoil ye deuyse woll hym let wyse bialacoil went hye fraunchyse sayde full curteslye ye haue longe deignous vnto thys louer daungerous fro hym withdrawe presence whyche hath hym great offence ye wolde vpon hym se wherfore soroufull man shape ye paye hym please loue yf ye woll haue case fulfyll hys wyll sythe ye knowe daunger daunted brought lowe helpe pyte dare aferde shall right ye wyll saythe bialacoil skyll sythe daunger woll fraunchyse hath hym sent byalacoil begynnyng salued hys comyng straugenesse sene tha ne wrathed bene fayre semblaunt shewed goodly aforne dyd honde without done wythin haye ryght ladde wyth right good chere enuyron vergere daunger hadde chased fro nowe haue leaue ouer go nowe raysed deuyse fro hell vnto paradyse thus bialacoil gentylnesse wyth hys payne besynesse hathe shewed onely grace eftres swote place sawe rose whan nygh greatter woxen high fresshe roddy fayre hewe coloure euer yliche newe whan hadde longe sene sawe leues grene rose spredde spaunyshinge sene goodly thynge ne sprede brede men within myght knowe sede couert close bothe leues rose stalke euen grene vpright theron goodly syght wel better without wene seed nat sene ful fayre spradde god blesse suche another gesse aforne ne ne vermayle abawed marueyle euer fayrer bounden loues laas longe abode sothe saye tyl bialacoil ganne praye whan sawe wyse warnen seruyce wolde graunt thynge whiche remembre wel syttynge sayne grace wolde yeue leysar space desyrous haue kyssynge prectous goodly freshe rose swetely smelleth nose displeased nought wolde gladly haue sought haue cosse therof freely yeft certainly wol none haue leue lothe greue sayd frende god spede chastite haue suche drede thou shuldest nat warned dare nat chastyte agayne dare nat mysdo alwaye byddeth yeue louer leaue kysse therto maye wynnen ywisse surplus praye lyfe hoope gette daye kyssynge maye attayne loues payne hath sothe sayne best auenaunt ernest remenaunt hys answere sighed sore durst assaye tho hadde suche drede greue hym aye shuld nat moche assaye chafe hys frende measure putte hys lyfe auenture man fyrst stroke ne maye nat fel downe oke reysyns haue wyne tyll grape rype well fyne sore empressed ensure drawen pressure forpeyned wonder stronge though abode right longe kysse payne wo sythe kysse desyred tyll rennynge distresse come venus goddesse whyche aye werryeth chastite came grace socour whose myght knowe ferre wyde mother cupyde god loue blynde stone helpeth louers manye one lady brought right honde brennynge fyre blasyng bronde wherof flame hote fyre hath many lady desyre loue brought sore hette seruyce hert sette thys lady good entayle right wonderfull apparayle atyre bryght shene men myght perceyue well sene nat relygioun nyll make mencioun robe tresour broche neyther riche attour ne gyrdell syde nyll nat longe abyde knoweth well certaynly arrayed richely deuoyde pride certayne bialacoil went paas hym shortely clause sayd sir cause ye ben porte daungerous vnto thys louer daynous graunt hym nothyng kysse warne hym ye done amysse sythe well ye wotte howe loues seruaunt ye maye se hath beaute wherthrough worthy loue haue blys howe semely beholde se howe fayre howe free howe swote debonayre age yonge lusty fayre lady hawtayne duchesse countesse ne chastelayne nolde holde vngoodly refuce hym vtterly hys brethe also good swete eke hys lyppes roddy mete onely playne kysse graunt hym kysse gentylnysse hys teth arne also whyte clene thynketh wronge withouten wene ye nowe warne hym trusteth graunt kysse haue lasse ye helpe hym ye haste tyme shull ye waste whan flame bronde venus brought right honde hadde bialacoil hys hete smete anone badde withouten lete graunt rose kysse payne ganne lysse rose anone went kyssed full faythfully nede man aske yf blythe whan sauour softe lythe stroke myne hert without allegged sore full ioye blysse fayre suche floure kysse swote sauerous myght nat anguysshous mote gladde ioly whan remembre yet euer amonge sothly fayne suffre noye moche payne see may neuer styll wyth lytell wynde wyll ouerwhelme tourne also woode wawes go calme trouble sonne mote folowe chaunge moone right fareth loue selde one holdeth hys ancre ryght anone whan ease wene best lyue ben wyth tempest fordryue serueth loue cannt tel wo stoundmele ioye mote ouergo nowe hurteth nowe cureth selde poynte loue endureth nowe ryght procede howe shame gan medle take hede fel angres haue hade howe stronge wall made castell brede length god loue wan wyth hys strength thys romaunce wyll sette thyng ne wyll lette lykynge floure beaute maye best labour quyte loue shall endyte wycked tonge couyne euerye louer deuyne worste addeth somdele wycked tonge saythe neuer wele mewarde bare ryght great hate espyenge erly late tyll hathe sene great chere bialacoil yfere myght hys tonge wythstonde worse reporte fonde full cursed rage satte hym wele hys lynage hym irishe woman bare hys tonge fyled sharpe square poignaunt ryght keruyng wonder bytter spekyng whan gan espye swore affyrmyng sykerly bytwene bialacoil yuel aquayntaunce pryue spake therof folilye awaked ielousye whyche afrayde hys rysyng whan herde ianglyng ran anone wode bialacoil stode whyche leuer thys caas haue ben reynes amyas foote hote hys felonye hym thus sayd ielousye haste thou ben neglygent kepen whan absent thys verger left eyn thy warde thou haddest regarde truste thy confusyon hym thus suspection haue ryght great nede well shewed dede great faute nowe haue founde god anone thou shalt bounde faste locken toure without refuyte socoure shame longe hath fro ouer soone ago whan thou hast lost bothe drede fere semed well nat besy wyse kepe chastice helpen chastite kepe roser thynketh boye knaue boldly ne shulde nat haue hardy verge hadde suche game whyche nowe tourneth great shame bialacoil nyst saye full fayne wolde haue fledde away frare haue hydde nere sodaynly toke hym wyth whan sawe thys ielousye take v two astoned knewe rede fledde away drede shame came fortheful symply wende haue trespaced ful greatly huble porte made symple wearyng vayle stede wymple nonnes done abbey bycause herte affray gan speke wythin throwe ielousye right wonder lowe fyrst hys grace befought sayd sir ne leueth nought wycked tonge false espye whyche glad fayne lye hath made flateryng bialacoil false leasyng hys falsnesse nowe newe longe hym knewe fyrst daye wycked tonge hath custome aye yonge folkes bewrye false lesynges hem lye yet neuerthelesse se amonge loigne longe bialacoil hertes lure loues seruyce endure drawyng suche folke hym hath nothynge wyth sothnesse trowe nought bialacoil euer thought trespace vilanye hys mother curtesye hathe taught hym euer good aqueyntaunce pryue loueth none heuynesse myrthe play gladnesse hateth trechours soleyne folke enuyous ye weten howe woll euer glade ioyfull honestly wyth folke pley haue neglygent good fey chastyse hym therfore nowe herte crye mercy haue ben recheles tamen hym wythouten lee foly repente nowe woll hole set myne entente kepe bothe lowe styll bialacoyl youre wyll shame shame sayde ielousye bytrasshed great drede haue lecherye hathe clombe hye almoste blered myne eye wonder yf drede haue ouer reygneth lechery whose myght groweth nyght dey bothe cloystre abbey chastyte werreyed ouer therfore woll wyth syker wall close bothe rose rosere haue longe thys manere lefte hem vnclosed wylfully wherfore right inwardly soroufull repente nowe shall lenger vnclosed yet drede sore shall repent ferthermore game gothe amys counsayle must newe iwys haue longe trusted nowe shall lenger may beste euery coste disceyue men trusten moste se well nyghe shent yf shette full entent remedye puruey wherfore close shall wey fro hem woll rose espye come waite vilonye good faythe trouthe woll let slouthe lyue sykernesse make anone fortresse close rose good sauour myddes shall make tour put bialacoil prison euer drede treson trowe shall hym kepe shall haue myght go aboute make companye hem thynke vilanye ne suche hath ben aforne founde hym good chere whyche han assayled hym shende wyth trowandyse blende foole eyth begyle may lyue lytell whyle shall forthynke hys fayre semblaunt worde came drede auaunt whyche abashed great fere whan wyste ielousye drede suche affray worde durste saye quakyng stode full styll alone tyll ielousye hys way gone saue shame hym forsoke bothe drede full sore quoke laste drede abrayde hys cosyn shame sayde shame sayd sothfastnesse great heuynesse noyse ferre go sclaunder v two sythe befall may agayne call whan one spronge fame many yere wythouten blame haue ben many day many aprill many may han passed shamed tyll ielousye hath v blamed mystrust suspection causelesse wythout encheson go daunger hastely let v shewe hym openly hath right wrought whan set hys thought kepe better purprise hys doyng wyse hath v great wronge hath suffred nowe longe bialacoil haue hys wyll hys lustes fulfyll muste amende vtterly el shall vilaynously exiled thys londe werre may wythstonde ielousye grefe sythe bialacoil mischefe daunger shame drede anon right way ben gon chorle foud aforne ligging vnder hawethorne vnder hys heed pylowe stede trusse gras slombred nappe toke tyll shame pitously hym shoke great manace hym gan make slepest thou whan thou shuld wake quod shame thou doest v vilanye trusteth dothe folye kepe rose bothoms whan ben fayre sesons thou arte woxe famyliere thou shulde straunge chere stoute thy porte redy greue thou doest great folye leue bialacoil inne call yonder man shenden v though thou slepe maye ielousye great noyse arte thou nowe late ryse vp hye stoppe sone delyuerly gappes hay fauoure pray falleth nothynge thy name make fayre semblant thou mayst blame bialacoil swete free dogged fell thou shuldest frowarde outragious ywys chorle chaugeth curtyse thys haue herde ofte sayenge man may dauntynge make sperhauke bosarde men woll holde musarde debonayre haue founden sytteth nought curteys men pleasaunce seruyse recreaundyse let thy werkes ferre nere lyke thy name whych daungere abawed shewynge anone spake drede ryght thus sayenge sayd daungyr drede thou ne wolte besy kepe thou hast kepe thou shuldesh wake thou arte slepe thou shalt greued certaynly yf aspye ielousye yf fynde blame hath daye assayled shame chased away wyth great manace bialacoil thys place swereth shortly shall enclose hym sturdy wall thy wyckednesse fayleth straungenesse thyne herte trowe fayled thou shalt repent speciall yf ielousye sothe knewe thou shalt forthynke sore rewe wyth yt churle clubbe gan shake frownynge hys eyen gan make hydous chere man rage yre brent hys vysage herde hym blamed sayd wytte go dyscomfyte haue great wronge certes haue nowe lyued longe syth maye thys closer kepe quycke woll doluen depe yf man shall repayre thys gardyn foule fayre myne herte yre gothe fere lette enter haue folly nowe se nowe shall amended setteth fote truly shall repent sore man thys place entre shall haue grace leuer wyth swerdes twayne throughout myne herte euery vayne perced wyth many wounde slouth shulde founde hence forth nyght daye shall defende yf maye wythouten excepcion eche maner condicion yf man graunt holdeth recreaunt dauger hys fete gan stande hente burden hande wroth hys yre ne left nought verger hath sought yf myght fynde hole trace mote forth pace gappe dyd close man myght touche rose roser aboute shytteth euery man wythout thus daye daye daunger wers wonderfull dyuers feller eke euer hym full ofte synge ala ne maye nought hys yre recouer moste desyre myne herte ala woll brast two bialacoil wrathed certaynly euery membre quake remembre bothom whych wolde full ofte daye sene beholde thynke vpon kysse howe moche ioye blysse sauour swete wante grone grete thynketh fele yet nose swete sauour rose nowe wote mote go ferre freshe floures fro full welcome dethe absence therof ala slethe whylom wyth thys rose ala touched nose mouth face nowe death muste abyde loue consent tyde one touche maye kysse trowe payne shall neuer lysse theron couetyse whych brent myne herte many wyse nowe shall repayre agayne syghynge longe watche nyghtes slepynge thought wyshynge turment wo wyth many turnynge fro halfe payne tell fallen hell paradyse welth turment greueth anoyeth nowe bytternesse forne haue felte swetnesse wycked tonge hys falshede causeth wo drede leyeth pytous charge bycause hys tonge large nowe tyme shortly tell somthynge ielousy great suspection aboute hym selfe mason stone coulde laye ne querrour hyred hem make tour fyrst rose kepe aboute hem made dyche depe ryght wonder large also brode vpon whych also stode squared stone sturdy wall whych cragge founded ryght great thycknesse eke bare aboute founded square hundred fadome euery syde lych longe wyde lest tyme assayled full well batayled rounde enuyron eke sette full many ryche fayre tourette euery corner thys wall set toure full principall eueryche wythout fable portcolyse defensable kepe enemyes greue force wolde preue eke amydde thys purpryse made toure great maystryse fayrer saugh man wyth syght large wyde great myght drad none assaut gynne gonne skaffaut temprure mortere made lycoure wonder dere quycke lyme persaunt egre whych tempred wyth vynegre stone harde adamant wherof made foundemant toure rounde made compas thys worlde rycher ne better ordayned wythall aboute toure made wal betwyxt toure rose sette swete sauoure wyth many rose bere eke wythin castell spryngoldes gonne bowes archer eke corner men seyne ouer wall stonde great engyns nere honde kernel arblasters great plentye none armure myght stroke wythstonde foly preace honde wythout dytche lystes made wyth wall batayled large brade men horse shulde attayne nygh dyche ouer playne thus ielousye hath enuyron sette aboute hys garnyson wyth walles rounde dyche depe onely roser kepe daunger erly late keyes kept vtter gate whych openeth towarde eest wyth hym leest thurty seruauntes eche one name gate kepte shame whych opened couthe towarde parte southe sergeauntes assygned full many wyll drede bayllye kepynge conestablerye towarde north vnderstonde opened vpon lyfte honde whych nothynge may sure yf besy cure erly morowe also late strongly shette barre gate euery thynge may se drede aferde wyth puffe lytell wynde drede astonyed mynde therfore stealynge rose rede yate vnclose foules flyght woll make fle eke shadowe yf se wycked tonge ful enuye wyth soudyours normandye causeth bate keper fourth gate also tother thre went full ofte se hys lotte wake nyght hys instrumentes wolde dyght blowe make sowne hath enchesoune walken ofte vpon wall corner wyckettes ouer full narowe serchen espye though nought fonde yet wolde lye dyscordaunt euer fro armonye destoned melodye controue wolde foule fayle wyth hornepypes cornewayle floyres made dyscordaunce hys musyke wyth myschaunce wolde seyne wyth note newe fonde woman trewe ne sawe neuer hys lyfe vnto husbonde trewe wyfe ne none full honeste nyll lauge mery hereth maye espye man speaken lecherye eueryche hem hath vyce one dyshonest another nyce yf one full vyllanye another hath lykerous eye yf one full wantonnesse another chyderesse thus wycked tonge god yeue hym shame put hem euerychone blame wythout deserte causelesse lyeth though ben gyltlesse haue pyte sene sorowe walketh eue morowe innocentes doth suche greuaunce praye god yeue hym yuell chaunce euer besye woman seyne amys eke ielousye god confounde hath made toure rounde made aboute garyson sette bealacoil pryson whych shette tour full longe holde soiour lyue penaunce hym greuaunce whyche hath ordeyned ielousye olde vecke espye maner hys gouernaunce whych dyuell enfaunce lerned loues arte hys pleys toke parte except hys seruyse knewe eche wrenche euery gyse loue euery wyle harde begyle bealacoil toke aye hede euer lyueth wo drede kept hym koye eke pryne leest hym se foly countenaunce knewe olde daunce thys ielousye bealacoil hys baillye shette hym vp fre sure hym wolde trusteth sore hys castell stronge werke hym lyketh well dradde glotons sulde steale hys rose bothoms rose assured defenced wyth stronge wall nowe ielousye full well maye drede deuoyde lyberte whether slepe wake hys rose maye none take bvt ala nowe mourne shall bycause wythout wall full moche doole mone made wyst wo hadde trowe wolde haue pete loue dere solde good hys loue went queyntly nowe doublynge payne se wolde sell agayne newe bargayne lere whych dere solace haue lorne neuer aforne certayne full lyke dede hym cast earth hys sede hath ioye newe sprynge greneth gynnynge also fayre freshe floure lusty sene swote odoure er sheues shere maye fall wether shall dere make fade fall stalke greyne floures tyllers fordone hope sone drede certayne fare hope trauayle sykerly ben byraste wyth storme floure nyll seden corne loue hath auaunced began pryuyte bailacoil tell whome ne founde frowarde ne fell toke agree hole playe loue harde assaye one reued wente best abouen haue loue fortune chaungeth ofte nyll contune whych whylom woll folke smyle glombe hem another whyle nowe frende nowe foe shalt fele twynclynge tourneth whele wrythe heed awaye thys concourse playe areyst doth mourne whirle adowne ouertourne sytteth hyghest lust foole woll trust come downe charge reuolutioun syth bialacoil fro twyne shette prison yonde wythinne hys absence myne herte fele ioye myne hele hym rose woll whych hym doth close open maye hym se loue woll cured paynes endure cruell auenture ah bialacoil myne owne dere though thou nowe prisonere kepe leest thyne herte suffre daunted ne let ielousye hys rage putten thyne herte seruage though chastyce wythout make thy body vnto hym lout haue herte harde diamaunt stedfast naught plyaunt prison though thy body large kepe thyne herte free trewe herte woll plye manace maye drye ielosye doth payne quyte hym hys whyle thus agayne venge leest thought yf waye thou mayst nought thys wyse subtelly worche wynne maystry yet great affraye lest thou saye drede thou canst great maugre thou enprysoned arte trespas neuer dyscouered yet thynge ought secret well annoye thys myschaunce endure harde penaunce sayne thynke sorowe almost synke remembre wo full nyghe wytte go inwarde myne herte fele blede comfortlesse death drede owe well haue dystresse false wyckednesse traytours arne enuyous noyen coragious ah bialacoil full well se hem shape dysceyue make buxome lawe wyth corde drawe hem lust ryght wyll drede haue brought tyll wythout comforte thought slethe thys game woll brynge dethe yf good wyll lese deed maye chese yf thou foryete myne herte shall neuer lykynge elswhere fynde solace yf put grace shall neuer ben hope shulde fall wanhope ala wanhope naye parde woll neuer dyspeyred yf hope fayle vngratious vnworthy hope woll conforted loue betaught sayd hope go shulde aye relees wo bale bete curteys swete nothynge full certayne louers put full great payne maketh hem wyth wo dele fayre behest dysceyueth fele woll behote sykerly faylen vtterly ah full noyous thynge many louer louynge hangeth vpon trusteth fast whych lese trauayle last thyng comen wote ryght nought therfore yf wysely sought counsayle foly take many tymes woll make full good sylogysme drede afterwarde shall dede folowe yuell conclusyoun put confusioun many tymes haue sene many haue begyled bene truste haue set hope whych fell hem afterwarde slope bvt nathelesse yet gladlye wolde woll hym wyth holde altymes purpose clere wythout dysceyte desyreth sykerly blamed dyd foly auayleth good wyll ne may staunche stounde yll helpeth lytell may outtake behest vnto wo heest certayne wyse wythout yefte prayse heest dede sondre vary done great contrary thus possed vp downe wyth doole thought confusyoun dysease nombre daungere shame encombre drede also ielousye wycked tonge full enuye whych sharpe cruel ire full ofte put great martyre haue ioye fully lette syth bialacoil haue beshette fro pryson wyckedly whome loue entierly woll bane sooner maye hym se yet ouer worst set kepe foule befall rympled vecke ferre roune rage frownynge yelowe vysage whych awayte lyeth daye nyght none hem maye haue syght nowe mote sorow enforsed full soth loue yafe thre wonder yeftes hys grace whych haue lorne thys place syth ne may wythout drede helpen lytell taketh hede auayleth swete thought swete speche helpeth ryght nought thyrde called swete lokynge nowe lorne wythout lesynge yeftes fayre thy helpe symply bialacoil loosed gone large free hym lyfe lyeth doute yf come rather oute ala trowe woll bene howe shulde euermore hym sene maye wronge bycause toure stronge howe shulde whose prowesse stronge forteresse certayne nyll god wotte haue wytte therto well wote rage loue dyd homage cause sothfastnesse selfe dame idelnesse whych conueyd fayre prayere entre fayre vergere blame leue whych nowe doth sore greue fooles worde nought trowe ne worthe apple lowe menne shulde hym snybbe bytterly pryme temp hys foly foole leued ryght nought releued accomplyshed wyll nowe greueth wonder yll reason sayd shulde fall foole selfe maye well call loue asyde layde trowed dame reason sayde reason skyll ryght blamed wyth myght medle loue hath shent certayne nowe woll repent shulde repente naye parde false traytour shulde dyuels engyns wolde take yf loue wolde forsake bialacoil falsly betraye shulde myschefe hate hym naye syth nowe hys curtesye pryson ielousye curtesye certayne dyd moche maye yolden hay passen lete kysse rose fayre swete shulde therfore con hym maugre naye certaynly shall loue shall neuer yeue good wyll worde wyll offence complaynt lesse neyther hope idelnesse certes wronge hated hem curtesye el suffre thynke waken shulde wynke abyde hope tyll loue chaunce sende socour allegeaunce expectant aye tyll maye mete getten mercy swete whylom thynke howe loue sayd wolde take gre seruyce yf vnpacience caused done offence sayd thanke shall take hygh mayster eke make yf wyckednesse ne reue soue trowe shall hys wordes semed loued truely nowe serue hym wele yf thynke hys thanke fele good myne harme lyeth hole loue maye defaute trewe loue ne fayled neuer man sothly faute mote nedes god forbyd founde cometh se nowe let gone maye go whether loue woll socoure slo may hole hys wyll sore bounde hym tyll hys seruyce maye lene lyfe death wythouten wene hys hande maye chese maye wynne lest syth sore doth greue yet yf luste wolde acheue bialacoil goodly yeue force fell though dye mote nede praye loue hys goodlyhede bialacoil gentylnesse whome lyue suche dystresse mote dyen penaunce fyrst wythout repentaunce woll confesse good entent make hast testament louers done felen smerte bialacoil leaue myne herte hole wythout departynge doublenesse repentynge pcoment raison vient lamant thus made passage complaynt cruell rage fynde leche couthe vnto myne helpynge eche sodaynly agayne comen doune tour sawe reasoun discrete wyse full pleasaunt port full auenaunt ryght waye toke stode great perplexitie posshed euery syde nyst myght abyde tyll demurely sad chere sayd came nere myne owne frende art thou greued quarel yet atcheued loues syde anon tell hast thou yet loue thy fyll art thou nat wery thy seruyce hath suche wyse ioye hast thou thy louyng swete bytter thyng canst thou yet chese let se best thy socour myght thou seruest full noble lorde maketh thrall thy rewarde aye returneth thy turment foly hath blent thou fell myschefe thylke daye whan thou dyddest sothe saye obeysaunce eke homage thou wroughtest nothyng sage whan thou became liege man thou dyddest great foly thou wystest nat fell therto lorde thou hadst yf thou haddest hym well knowe thou hadst nought brought lowe yf thou wystest thou woldest serue hym halfe yere nat weke halfe daye ne yet houre without delaye ne neuer loued paramour lordshyp full shours knowest hym ought lamaunt yea dame pardye reasoun nay nay lamaunt yes reasoun wherfore let se lamaunt sayd shulde glad haue suche lorde master suche seignorie reasoun knowest hym nomore lamaunt nay certes saue ye yafe rule went way nyst abode bounde balaunce lo noble conysaunce preasoun bvt woll thou knowe hym nowe gynnynge ende syth thou arte anguyshious mate disfigured astate maye wretche haue wo ne cautyfe none enduren euery man syttyng lorde haue knowledgyng yf thou knewe hym doubt lyghtly thou shuldest escapen thy pryson marreth lamaunt ye dame syth lorde man made myne honde wolde ryght fayne vnderstonde knowe kynde yf wolde enforme preasoun wolde sayde reason lere sith thou lerne hast de shew wtoute fable sire thyng yt demonstrable thou shalt withouten science knowe withouten experience thyng may knowen ne wyst ne shewed degree thou mayst soth nat wytten though wrytten thou shalt knowe therof whyle thou art ruled lore vnto hym loue woll flye knotte maye vnclosed hath founde longe knytte vnbounde sette well thyne ententioun loue descriptioun loue hatefull pee free acquaintaunce without relees fret full falshede syckernesse set drede herte dispayryng hope full hope wanhope wyse woodnesse voyde reason swete peryl drowne heuy burthen lyght beare wicked vawe awaye weare carybdes perylous disagreable gratious discordaunce accorde accordaunce discorde connyng without science wysedome without sapience without discretioun hauoyre without possessyoun lyke hele hole sycknesse trust drowned dronkenesse helthe ful maladye charyte ful enuye angre ful habundaunce gredye suffisaunce delyte right ful heuynesse dreried ful gladnesse bytter swetnesse swete errour right yuel sauoured good sauour sen pardon hath within pardon spotted without synne payne also ioyous felony ryght pytious also playe selde stable stedfast ryght meuable strength weyked stande vpryght feblenesse full myght wytte vnaduysed sage follye ioye full tourmentrye laughter wepyng aye rest trauayleth nyght daye also swete hell sorowfull paradys plesaunt gayle prisoun full frost somer season pryme temp full frostes whyte maye deuoyde delyte seer braunches blossom vngrene newe frute fylled wynter tene slowe maye forbeare ragges rybaned golde weare well woll loue sette vnder ragges ryche rochette eke wel amorettes mournyng blacke bryght burnettes none mokel pryse ne noman founden wyse ne none hygh parage ne noman founde wyt sage man hardye ne wyght ne man mokell myght none fulfylled bountie loue maye daynted worlde holdeth waye loue maketh gone myswaye euyll lyfe whome genius cursed man wyfe wrongly werke agayne nature none suche loue ne haue cure suche loue seruauntes bene woll counsayle flene ne preyse louynge wherthrough men last endyng shall call hem wretch full wo loue greueth hem shendeth yf thou wolt well loue eschewe escape mewe make hole thy sorowe slake better counsayle mayst thou take thynke fleen well ywys maye nought helpe el wyt thou yf thou flye shall flye folowe folowen shall plamaunt whan herde al reason sayne spylt speche vayne dame sayde dare well saye auaunt well maye schole deuiaunt neuer auaunt ryght nought doctrine dull vnder disciplyne wot nomore wyst euer contrary fer euery thynge ye lere yet al partuere hert foryeteth therof ryght nought wrytten thought depe grauen tender myne hert render rede ouer communely selfe leudest bvt syth ye loue discryuen lacke preise bothe two defyneth letter maye thynke better herde neuer defyned wylfully wolde lere yf loue searched well sought syknesse thought annexed lined bytwyxt tweyne male female cheyne frely byndeth ne twynne whether therof lese wynne rote spryngeth hote brenning disordinate desyryng kyssen embrace lust solace thynge loue retcheth nought setteth hert thought delectatioun procreatioun frute engendrure loue god nat pleasure body frute get yeue forse set vpon delyte play fere haue also manere faynen hem loue seke suche loue prayse leke paramour fayne loue truly disdayne falsen ladyes traytoursly swerne hem othes vtterly many lesyng many sable fynden disceyuable whan han lust getten hote erne foryeten woman harme byen full sore men thynken euermore lasse harme mote disceyue disceyued namely ne may fynde none meane way wot well sothfastnesse doeth nowe busynesse woman dele lust may fele yf engendrure doth trespasse ensure shulde letten wyll getten lykely thyng hym tyll sustayne yf myght kepe forth kyndes ryght owne lykenesse semblable bycause corumpable fayle shulde successyoun ne theyr generatioun sectes sterne saue whan father mother arne graue chyldren shulde whan ben bede full diligent bene stede vse warke suche wyse one may another ryse therfore set kynde therin delyte men therin shulde haue delyte dede erke oft sythens haunt werke none wolde drawe therof draught ne delyte hath hym caught subtyl dame nature none goth ryght ensure ne hath entent hole ne perfyte desyre delyte fortened crease eke playe loue oft seke thrall hem selfe nyse vnto prince euery vyce eche synne rote vnlefull lust though sote euyll racyne tullius determyne tyme full sage boke made age prayseth elde though croked vnwelde comendatioun youth descriptioun youth set man wyfe paryll soule lyfe parell men haue grace paryll youth pace without deth distresse full wyldnesse oft doth shame domage hym lynage ledeth man vp nowe downe mokell dissolutioun maketh hym loue well company led lyfe disrulely halte hym payde none estate within hym selfe suche debate chaungeth purpose entent yalte couent lyuen empryse leseth fredom fraunchyse nature hym sette whiche agayne may gette yf make mansyon abyde professyon though tyme hert absent maye fayle shall repent eke abyde thylke daye leaue habyte gone waye leseth worshyp name dare come agayne shame lyfe doth mourne bycause dare home retourne fredom kynde lost hath neuer may recured yf god hym graunt grace may hence pace conteyne vnder obedience vertue patience youth set man folye vnthryft rybaudrye lechery outrage oft chaungeth corage youth gynneth oft suche bargayne may ende without payne great paryll set youth hede delyte doth brydell lede delyte hangeth drede nought man body thought onely youthes chambere done euyll customere naught el taketh hede onely folkes lede disporte wyldenesse fro warde sadnesse elde draweth hem therfro wote may wel go mo hem nowe arne olde whylom youthe holde whiche yet remembreth tender age howe hem brought many arage many folly therin wrought yt elde hath hym sought repent hem follye youth hem put ieopardye paryll moche wo made hem oft amysse sewen euyll companye ryot auoutryce bvt elde agayne restrayne suche folly refrayne set men ordynaunce good rule gouernaunce euyll spendeth seruyse noman woll loue neyther preyse hated wote wele acquayntaunce wolde man fele ne han elde company men hate alye man wolde become olde ne dye whan yonge bolde elde maruayleth ryght greatly whan remembre hem inwardly many peryllous empryse wrought sondry wyse euer myght without blame escape awaye without shame youth without domage reprefe lynage losse membre shedyng bloude parell deth losse good wost thou youth abyt men preysen wyt delyte halte soiour dwellen tour longe youth season dwell one mansyon delyte youth woll haue seruyce woll deuyse youth redy euermore obeye smerte sore vnto delyte hym yeue seruyce whyle maye lyue elde habytte wol tell shortly whyle dwel thither behoueth yt go yf deth youth slo iourneye thou mayst fayle labour trauayle lodged ben sorowe wo neuer courte go payne distresse syknesse yre melancoly angry syre bene paleys senatours gronyng grutchynge harbegeours daye nyght tourment cruell deth present tellen erlyche late deth standeth armed gate brynge remembraunce folly dedes enfaunce causen mourne wo youth hath begyled sodaynly away hasted wepeth tyme hath wasted complaynyng preterytte present nat abytte olde vanitie aforne maye se future socour leggen dolour graunt tyme repentaunce synnes penaunce last gouerne wynne ioye eterne fro go bakwarde youth made vanitie drowne wade present tyme abydeth nought swyft thought lytle whyle doth endure ny compt ne measure euer game go lyst loue ioy myrth also loue hye lowe frute shulde hem delyte parte may el quyte saue hem selfe honestie yet full many one se woman sothly sayne desyre wolde fayne playe loue wylde coueyte go chylde yf chylde perchaunce wol holde great mischaunce euer wo fele woll playne concele yf foole nyce whome shame hath iustyce delyte echone drawe haunt worke hye lawe saue suche arne worth right nought moneye woll bought suche loue prayse wyse whan gyuen couetyse preyse woman though woode yeueth selfe good lytle shulde man tell wyl body sell mayde wyfe quycke wyll sell lyfe fayre chere euer make wretche vndertake loued suche one swete soure though hym called paramoure laugheth maketh feest certaynly suche beest loued worthy beare name drury non shulde please woode woll dispoyle hym good yet nathelesse woll saye solace playe maye iewell thyng take louers free yeuyng aske wyse drede shame couetyse may hym certayne without slaunder yeuen agayne ioyne hertes togyther loue take yeue also trowe woll hem twynne whan loue synne woll togyther go han ado curteys shulde debonayre loue beren hem fayre without vyce alwaye honestie fro folly loue kepe hem clere brenneth hertes fere loue wyse deuoyde couetyse good loue shulde engendred true hert iust secree suche set thought haue lust el nought caught loues lace truly bodily solace fleshly delyte present set thyne entent without shuld glose get haue rose maketh mate wood thou desyrest none good thou art yuche nerere euer abydest sorowe werre thy face sene maketh pale lene thy myght thy vertue goth awaye sory gest good faye thou harborest thyne inne god loue whan thou let wherfore rede thou shet hym shall greue dout thy profyt wyll turne yf nomore soiourne great myschefe sorowe sonken ben hertes loue arne dronken thou peraduenture knowen shall whan thou hast lost tyme spent thought ydlenesse waste wofull lustynesse yf thou mayst lyue tyme se loue delyuered thy tyme thou shalt bewepe sore neuer thou mayest restore tyme lost men may se nothyng may recouered yf thou scape yet last fro loue hath fast knytte bounden lace certayne holde grace many one seyne haue lost spent also veyne seruyce without socour body soule good treasour wytte strength eke rychesse neuer redresse plamant thus taught preached hath reason loue spylte sermon imped thought doctryne set nought yet ne sayd neuer dele ne vnderstode wele worde worde mater vnto loue thral calleth ouer praye chaseth thought aye holdeth myne hert vnder seale trusty true stele deuocion ne sermon dame reason ne rede toke soiour myne heed yede one ere dyd lere fully lost lore speche greued wonder sore vnto yre sayd angre dydde abrayde dame wyll algate loue hate men ye teche yf speche syth ye sayne loue good must nedes saye mode yf leue hatred aye lyuen voyde loue alwaye synfull wretche hated teche maye go none gate eyther must loue hate yf hate men newe loue woll rewe prechyng semeth loue nothyng ne prayseth ye yeue good counsayle sykerly precheth al day shulde loues lore alowe foole wolde trowe speche also ye han taught another loue knowen nought herde repreue loue eche leue yf ye wolde diffyne wolde gladly se lest yf may lere sondry loues manere praison certes frende fole art thou whan thou nothynge wolt alowe thy profyte saye yet woll saye saye redy leest acomplysh thy request woll aueyle vayne peraduenture shall traueyle loue sondry wyse shall deuyse loue lefull good mene nat yt maketh woode bryngeth many fytte rauysheth fro thy wytte marueylous queynt suche loue nomore acqueynt pcoment reason diffinist aunsete loue frenshyppe also whych maketh man done amys wyl knytte betwyxte two wol breke wele ne wo whych longe lykely contune whan wyl goodes bene commune grounded goddes orddinaunce hoole wythout discordaunce wyth hem holdyng comunte al good charite none exceptioun chaungyng ententioun eche helpe nede wysely hele worde dede trewe meanyng deuoyde slouth wytte nought wythout trouth tone dare al thought sayne frende spare nought selfe without dredyng discouered wreying glad coniunction whan none suspection wolde proue trewe parfyte loue man may amiable yf ferme stable fortune chaunge hym nat ne blynde hys frende alwaye fynde poore ryche state yf hys frende gate wol complayne pouerte shulde nat byde longe tyl hys helpyng hym requyre good dede done prayere solde bought dere ywys herte great valure hert fulfylled gentylnesse yuel demeaue distresse man worthy name asken often hath great shame good man brenneth thought shame whan asketh ought hath great thought dredeth aye hys disease whan shal praye frende lest warned tyl preue stabilite whan hath founden one trustye trewe stone assayed al founde stedfast wal hys frenshyp certayne shal shewe ioye payne al dare thynke saye wythout shame wel maye howe shulde shamed one tolde whan wotte hys secrete thought thyrde shal know therof ryght nought twey nombre bette thre euery counsayle secree repreue dredeth neuer dele besette wordes wele euery wyse man drede kepe hys tonge tyll se nede fooles nat holde tonge fooles belle sone ronge yet shal trewe frende helpe felowe hys sore succour whan hath nede al may done dede gladder hym pleaseth felowe easeth yf request shal much molest hys felowe maye fulfyl hys volunte fully hath requyred hertes loue hath fyred ioye wo shal departe take euenly eche hys parte halfe anoye shall haue aye comfort maye thys blysse parte shal loue wol departed whylom thys vnite spake tulllius dyte shulde maken hys request vnto frende honest goodly shulde fulfyl skyl otherwyse graunt therto excepte cause two men frende dethe wolde dryue let hym besy saue hys lyue also yf men wollen hym assayle hys worshyp make hym fayle hyndren hym renoun let wyth ful ententioun deuer done eche degre hys frende ne shamed thys two case wyth hys myght takyng kepe skyl ryght ferre loue maye hym excuse thys ought man refuse thys loue haue tolde nothyng contrary thys wol thou folowe wele leaue tother euery dele thys loue vertue al entendeth tother fooles blent shendeth another loue also contrary vnto thys whych desyre constrayned wyl fayned awaye fro trouth doth varye good loue contrarye maymeth many wyse syke hertes wyth couetyse al wynnynge profyte suche loue setteth delyte thys loue hangeth balaunce yf lese hys hope parchaunce luere set vpon wol fayle quenche anon man may amorous ne hys lyuyng vertuous loue moode men hem selfe goode loue profyte doth abyde false bydeth tyde loue cometh dame fortune lytle whyle wyl contune shall chaungen wonder soone take eclyps ryght moone whan v lette erth betwyxt sette sunne may fal partie al shadowe maketh bemes merke horne shewe derke parte hath lost lyght phebus fully syght tyl whan shadowe ouerpast enlumyned agayne fast bryghtnesse sune bemes yeueth agayne lemes loue ryght nature nowe fayre nowe obscure nowe bryght nowe clipsy manere whylom dymme whylom clere sone pouerte gynneth take wyth mantel weedes blake hydeth loue lyght away nyght turneth day may se ryches shyne tyl blacke shadowes fyne whan rychesse shyneth bryght loue recouereth ayen lyght whan fayleth wol flyt greueth greueth thys loue saye ryche men loued aye namely tho sparande bene wol nat washe hertes clene fylth byce gredy brennyng auaryce ryche man ful fonde ywys weneth loued hys herte vnderstode hys good may wel weten thought hys good loued ryght nought yf nygarde eke men wyl set hym leke haten hym thys soth lo profyte hys catel doth euery man may hym se getteth hym nough cumyte amende hym selfe vyce knowe hym selfe wyse certes shulde aye frendly gette hym loue also bene fre el wyse ne sage gote ramage loueth dede proueth whan hys rychesse wel loueth wol hyde aye spare hys poore frendes sene forfare kepen aye hys purpose tyl drede hys eyen close tyl wycked death hym take hym leuer sondre shake let al hys lymmes sondre ryue leaue rychesse lyue thynketh parte wyth man certayne loue howe shulde loue wythin hym whan hys hert pyte trespaseth wel wate eche man knoweth hys estate wel hym ought reproued loueth nought ne loued syth arne fortune comen hath sermon nomen wonder wyl tel nowe thou hardest neuer one trowe thou leuen shal though sothfastnesse al writen soth vnto men profyte doth frowarde fortune contraire swote debonaire yf thynke doutable argument prouable debonayre softe falseth begyleth ofte lyche mother cheryshe mylken doth norice good hym deles yeueth part weles great rychesse degnite hem hoteth stabilyte state stable chaungyng aye variable fedeth wyth glory vayne worldly blysse noncertayne whan hym setteth whele wene right wele stable state wythall neuer wene fall whan sette hygh wene haue certeynte hertly frendes great nombre nothynge myght state encombre truste hem euery syde wenyng wyth hym wolde abyde euery parel mischaunce wythout chaunge variaunce catel good also spende blood al membres spyll onely fulfyl wyll maken hole many wyse hoten hem full seruyse howe sore hem smerte naked sherte herte also hole gyue tyme may lyue wyth flatterye maken fooles glorifye wordes spekyng han chere reioysyng trowe hem euangyle al falsheed gyle shal afterwarde se whan arne fallen pouerte bene good catel bare shul sene frendes ware hundrede certaynly thousande ful scarsly ne shal fynde vnnethes one whan pouerte comen vpon thus fortune tell wyth men whan lust dwell maketh hem lese conysaunce norisheth hem ignoraunce frowarde fortune peruerse whan hygh estate doth reuerse maketh hem tomble doune whele wyth sodayne tourne rychesse doch hem flye plongeth hem pouerte stepmother enuyous layeth playstre dolorous vnto hertes wounded egre whych tempred wyth vynegre wyth pouerte indigence shewe experience fortune verylye man shulde affye yeftes haue fyaunce full varyaunce thus maken hye lowe whan rychesse arne throwe fully knowen without frende affecte frende chere whych loue trewe stable whych also varyable fortune goddesse pouerte eyther rychesse yeueth drede vnhappe bereueth dede fortune let one frendes whan fortune gone meane tho frendes wyll fle anone entreth pouerte yet woll leaue hem eche place go cal hem wretche scorne blame mishappe hem diffame namely rychesse pretendeth moost stablenesse whan hey sawe hym set lofte hym socoured ofte moost yholpe al nede nowe take maner hede seyne voyce flatery nowe appereth foly ouer al fare synge go farewel feldefare al frendes beshrewe trewe fewe sothfast frendes betyde euery fortune wollen abyde han hertes noblesse nyl loue rychesse fortune may hem sende wollen hem socour defende chaunge softe ne sore frende loueth euermore though men drewe swerde hys frend slo may hewe loue two case shal say pride ire lese may reproue nycete discoueryng priuite wyth tonge woundyng felon venemous detraction frende thys case wol gon hys way nothyng greue ne may nought el wol fle loue stabylyte certayne wel begone amonge thousande fyndeth one maye rychesse ayenst frendshyp worthynesse ne may hygh attayne may valure soth sayne hym loueth trewe wel frendshyp catel frende courte aye better peny purse certis fortune mishappyng whan vpon men fablyng though misturnyng chaunce cast hem balaunce maketh aduersite men ful clerely se hym frende existence hym apparence fortune maketh anone knowe thy frendes fro thy fone experience ryght whych prayse ywys much rychesse tresour depe profyte valour pouerte aduersyte doth prosperite one yeueth conysaunce tother ignoraunce thys pouerte dede troth declared fro falshede faynt frendes wol declare trewe also wey fare whan hys rychesse frendes ful doublenesse offred hym many wyse herte body seruyce wold tha haue haue bought knowen openly thought nowe hath clerely sene lasse begyled shulde haue bene perceyued rychesse nolde let hym wytte wel auantage doth hym syth maketh hym wyse man great mischefe perceyueth doth rychesse hym deceyueth rychesse riche ne maketh nought hym tresour sette hys thought rychesse stoute suffysaunce nothynge habundaunce suffysaunce al onely maketh men lyue rychly hathe mytches tweyne ne value hys demayne lyueth ease ryche doth chiche hys berne hath soth sayne hundrede mauys grayne though chapman marchaunt haue golde many besaunt gettynge hath wo kepynge drede also sette euermore hys besynesse encrease lesse augment multyplye thoughe heapes lye hym yet neuer shal make hys rychesse asseth vnto hys gredynesse poore recheth nought saue lyuelode hys thought whych getteth wyth hys traueyle dredeth naught shal feyle though haue lytle worldes goode meate drynke easy foode vpon hys traueyle lyuyng also suffysaunt clothyng yf syckenesse fall loth meate drynke wythall though haue nat bye shal bethynke hym hast ly put hym al daungere meate hath mistere may wyth lytle eke befounden whyle seke men shul hym berne haste lyue tyl hys syckenesse paste may sondewe besyde caste nought shal hym betyde thynketh nought euer shal syckenesse fal though fal maye al tyme spare shal mokel shal hym suffyce e sycke wyse doth wol content wyth pouerte wythout nede man much lytle haue apayed wyth hys fortune nyl importune vnto wyght ne onerous goodesse coueytous therfore spareth may wel bene hys pore estate sustene yf hym luste spare suffreth forthe ne ware laste hapneth maye ryght vnto hys last daye take worlde wolde euer hert thynketh sooner deth hym slo paradyse sooner go shall lyue blysse shal good mysse thyder hopeth god shal sende hys wretched lyues ende pythagoras hym selfe reherses boke golden verse cleped nobylite honorable dyte whan thou gost thy body fro free heyre thou shalt vp go leauen al humanyte purely lyue deite foole wythouten troweth haue hys countrey erth countre may clerkes seyne se boece consolation maked mention countre playne eye techyng phylosophye leude men mygh lere wyt wolde translaten well lyue hys rent maye hym yeue desyreth haue may fro pouerte hym saue wyse man sayd may sene man wretched wene kynge knyght rybaude many rybaude mery baude swynketh bereth day nyght many burthen great myght whych doth hym lasse offence suffreth pacience laugh daunce tryppe synge lay nought vp lyuyng tauerne dispendeth wynnyng god hem sendeth goth fardel bere wyth good chere dyd ere swynke trauayle fayneth robben disdayneth right anon hys swynke goeth tauerne drynke al ryche abundaunce thus haue suffisaunce wel vsurere god wel knoweth wythout vsurer god se shal neuer rychesse ryche euermore poore indigent scare gredy hys entent soth displese may marchaunt lyue ese hys herte set quycke brenneth get ne neuer shal though hath geten though hath golde garner yeten nedy dredeth sore wherfore getten set hys hert hys desyre hote brenneth fyre couetyse maketh hym wood purchase mennes good vnderfongeth great payne vndertaketh drynke vp sayne drynketh aye leaueth soth saye thus thurst false gettyng last euer coueytyng anguyshe distresse wyth fyre gredynesse fyghteth hym aye stryueth herte asonder ryueth suche gredynesse hym assayleth whan hath moste sayleth physiciens aduocates gone ryght yates sel seyence wenyng haunt craft great gettyng wenyng suche swetnesse yf man fall sycknesse full glad encrase wyl without lease eueryche man shulde seke though dye set l ke whan golde haue take ful lytle care hem make wolde fourty sycke one yea two hundred fleshe bone yet two thousande gesse encresen rychesse wol worchen wyse luere couetyse physycke gynneth fyrst phy phisycien also sothly sythen gothe fro fye fye trust hem folye nyl maner gre ryght nought charite eke sect sette al tho prechen gette worshyps honour rychesse hertes arne great distresse folke lyue holyly abouen al specially prechen veynglory towarde god haue memory forth ypocrites trace soules deth purchace outwarde shewyng holynesse though ful cursednesse nat lyche apostle twelue disceyue hem selue begyled gyler preachyng cursed man thoughe may profyte hym selfe aueyleth amyte ofte good predicatioun cometh el ententioun hym nat vayleth hys preachyng al helpe wyth hys teachyng good ensample take wyth vayn glorye shake lette v leuen preachours speke hem tour heape vp golde fast shette sore theran herte sette neyther loue god ne drede kepe nede bagges sore bynde sunne wynde put vp nede ware whan sene pore folke forfare hungre dye colde quake god wel vengeaunce therof take great mischeues hem assayleth thus gadryng aye trauayleth wyth much payne wynne rychesse drede hem holdeth distresse kepe gather faste wyth sorowe leaue laste wyth sorowe dye lyue vnto rychesse hertes yeue defaute loue sheweth ful wel ywis yf gredy soth sayne loueden loued agayne good loue reygned ouer al suche wyckednesse ne shulde fal shulde yeue moost good hem nede bestade lyue wythout false vsure charyte ful clene pure hem yeue goodnesse defendyng hem fro ydlenesse al thys worlde poore none shude fynde trowe one chaunged thys worlde vnstabale loue ouer al vendable se man loueth nowe wynnyng prowe loue thralled seruage whan solde auauntage yet woman woll bodyes sell suche soules goeth dyuell hell loue tolde hem hys entent baronage cousayle went many sentence fyll dyuersly sayd wyll dyscorde accorded acorde loue recorded syr sayden ben atone euen accorde euerychone take rychesse onely sworne hath full hauteynly castell nyll assayle n un te stroke thys batayle wyth darte ne mace speare ne knyfe man speaketh beareth lyfe blameth empryse ywys hoste departed leest waye thys plyte hath thys man dyspyte sayeth ne loued neuer therfore woll hate hym euer woll gather treasore hath wrath euermore agylte neuer caas lo holy hys trespas sayeth well thys daye asked leaue gone waye clypped moche yeuynge spake full fayre hys prayenge prayed poore therfore warned hym entre ne yet thryuen hath getten peny two quytely hys owne holde thus hath rychesse v tolde rychesse v thys recorded wythouten ben accorded fynde accordaunce false semblant abstinaunce wyth folke batayle shull hynder gate assayle wycked tonge hath kepynge wyth hys norman full ianglynge hem curtesy largesse shull shewe hardynesse olde wyfe kepte harde fayre welcomynge wythin warde shall delyte well helynge fonde shame adowne brynge wyth hoost early late shull assaylen ylke gate agaynst drede shall hardynesse assayle also sykernesse wyth folke leadynge neuer wyst fleynge fraunchyse shall fyght eke pyte daugere ful cruelte thus hoost ordeyned wele shal ye castel euery dele yf eueryche hys entent venus present mother full vesselage canne ynough suche vsage wythouten maye wyght spede thys werke neyther worde ne dede therfore good ye sende maye thys worke amende lordynges mother goddesse lady maystresse ny al wyllyng ne doth al desyryng yet canne somtyme done labour luste socour nede atcheue nowe thynke nat greue mother chylde hede worshyp eke drede dredeth syre ne dame shall abye body name nathelesse yet conne sende yf nede nygh comen wolde trowe nothynge myght holde mother great prowesse hath tane many forteresse cost hath many poud er na present ywys yet men sayd dede come neuer stede ne ne lyketh mote suche toures ben take wyth thynketh wyse maye cleped marchaundyse go bye courser blacke whyte paye therfore arte yu quyte marchaut oweth ye right noght ne thou hym thou bought woll sellynge clepe yeuynge sellynge asketh guerdonynge lyeth thanke ne meryte one goeth quyte thys sellynge semblable hys horse stable maye selle agayne parde wynnen suche happe maye maye manne lese ywys leest skynne hys el yf betyde woll kepe hys horse ryde yet lorde aye hys horse thylke chaffare well worse venus entremeteth ought suche chaffare hath bought shall worchen
