wysely ne shall lese vtterly hys money hys caffare seller ware pryse profite haue shall certayne byer shall lese ne dere bye haue lordshyppe full maystry ne haue power make lettynge neyther yefte ne preachynge hys chaffare maugre hys another shall haue moche ywys yf woll yeue moche h countrey ryght nought happe maye yf flatter paye ben suche marchauntes wyse fooles euery wyse bye suche thynge wylfully lese good folyly nathelesse thys dare saye mother wonte paye neyther foole ne nyce entremete suche vyce trust well shall paye repent hys bargayne shall pouerte putte hym dystresse scholer rychesse great yernynge assenteth wyllynge bvt mother saynt venus father saturnus engendred hys lyfe vpon hys wedded wyfe yet woll vnto swere make thys thynge surere nowe fayth beaute owe brother free whych ny wyght vnder heuen father name neuen dyuers many wyth mother haue pryue yet wolde swere syckernesse pole helle wytnesse nowe drynke thys yere clarre yf lye forsworne goddes vsage hym forsweareth amys shall yere drynke clarre nowe haue sworne ynough parde yf forswere lorne woll neuer forsworne syth rychesse hath sayled shall abye trespas full dere leestwaye arme wyth swerde sparth gysarme certes syth loueth fro thylke tyme maye se castell toure shake sorye tyme shall awake yf maye grype ryche manne shall pulle hym yf canne shall fewe stoundes lese hys markes hys poundes shall hym make hys pen slynge hys garner sprynge maydens shall eke plucke hym hym shall neden fethers mo make hym sell hys lande spende bette conne hym defende poore men han made lorde thoughe myghtye maye fede delyte woll haue hem dyspyte good man hateth hem gesse chynche feloun rychesse chase hem dyspyse hem defoule sondrye wyse louen ful bette god spede dothe riche chynchy grede bene good faythe stable trewer seruyable therfore suffyseth good herte beaute han sette thought therfore foryet hem nought woll hem brynge great noblesse god rychesse god loue sothely suche routh vpon playnt haue therfore muste hys socour payneth hym seruen yf deyde loue thys semeth loue ther sir sayd soth euery dele ye reherce wot wele thylke oth hold resonable good couenable ye rych han sworne syr thys wote well beforne yf ryche men done homage fooles done outrage ye shull forsworne ne let therfore drynke clarre pyment maked freshe newe ladyes shull hem suche pepyr brewe yf fall laas wo mowe sayne ala ladyes shullen euer curteys shall quyte othe free ne seketh neuer vycayre shall speake wyth hem fayre ye shall holde ye payde full wele though ye medle neuer dele late ladyes worche wyth thynges shall hem tell fele tydynges moue hem eke many requestes slatery honest therto yeue hem suche tankynges wyth kyssynge wyth thalkynges certes yf trowed shall neuer leaue hem londe ne fee nyll moeble fare whych fyrst delyuered nowe maye ye tell v wyll hestes shall fulfyll bvt false seblant dare drede syr medle hym thys dede sayeth ye ben hys fo yf ye wol worche hym wo wherfore praye beausyre ye forgyue hym nowe yre maye dwell man wyth abstinence hys dere lemman thys acorde wyll nowe parfey sayd loue graunt woll well holde hym man nowe let hym come forth ran false semblant loue thys wyse take seruyce thou frendes helpe alwaye hyndreth hem neyther nyght ne daye thy myght hem releue eke enemyes thou greue thyne thys myght graunt kynge harlotes shalte thou woll thou haue suche honour certayne thou arte false traytour eke thefe syth thou borne thousande tymes thou arte forsworne nathelesse herynge put folke doutynge bydde teche hem wost thou howe generall sygne nowe place thou shalt founden yf men myster howe men shall best espye knowe great maystrye tell place thyne hauntynge syr haue full dyuers wonnynge kepe rehersed ye wolde respyten yf tell sothe maye haue harme shame bothe yf felowes wysten tale shulden quyt certayne wolde hate yf euer knewe cruelte wolde ouer holde hem styll trouth agayne wyll suche tale kepen myght eftsone bye full dere yf sayd hem thynge ought dyspleaseth herynge worde hem prycke byteth worde none hem delyteth gospell euangyle wolde reproue hem gyle cruell hautayne thys thynge wote well certayne yf speake ought payre loo court shall well cloos ne shall wyte last good men nought agast woll taken hem nothynge knowe meanynge woll hem take woll hym selfe suspecious make hys lyfe let couertly gyle ipocrisy engendred yaue fostrynge made full good engendrynge quod loue sothly tell engendred dyuell hell bvt nedely howe euer quod loue wyll charge ye tel anon thy woning place hearynge eche wyght thys place lyfe thou lyuest also hyde lenger nowe wherto thou must dyscouer thy worchynge howe thou seruest thynge though yt thou shuldest thy soth sawe ben beaten drawe yet arte thou wonte parde nathelesse though thou beaten thou shalt fyrst hath sothsawe suffred wo syr syth maye lyken thoughe shulde slayne ryght nowe shal done comaudement therto haue great talent wythoute wordes mo ryght false seblant hys sermo began sayd hem thus audience baron take hede sentece ye wyght yt lyst haue knowing false semblant full flateryng must worldly folke hym seke certes cloysters eke wone hem twey lyke euen soth say shortly woll herberowe hope best hulstred certaynly sykerest hydynge vnderneth humblest clothynge religious folke ben full couerte seculer folke ben apperte nathelesse wyll blame religious folke ne hem dyffame habyte euer go religyon humble trewe also woll blame ne dyspyse nyll loue wyse meane false religious stoute ben malicious wollen habyte go setten herte therto religious folke ben pytous thou shalt sene one dyspytous louen pryde ne stryfe humbly woll lede lyfe wyth whych folke woll neuer yf dwell fayne maye well habyte go leuer necke two lette purpose take couenaunt euer make dwell wyth hem proude full wyles subtelte worshyp thys worlde coueyten great nede connen expleyten gone gadren great pitaunces purchace hem acqueyntaunces men myghty lyfe may leden fayne hem poore hem selfe feden wyth good morcels delicious drynken good wyne precious preche v pouert dystresse fyshen hem selfe great rychesse wyth wyly nettes caste woll come foule laste ben fro clene religion went make worlde argument hath foule conclusyon haue robe religion religious thys argument roignous worth croked brere habyte ne maketh neyther monke ne frere clene lyfe deuocion maketh good men religion nathelesse none answere howe hygh euer hys heed shere wyth rasour whetted neuer kene gyle braunches cutte thurtene wyght dystyncte dare saye worde therto herberowe euer take semblaunt euer make meane gyle folowe ryght gybbe cat awayteth myce rattes kyllen ne entende begylen ne wyght may clothynge wete wyth folke dwellynge ne wordes yet parde soft pleasaunt beholde dedes thou blynde thou oughtest varye wordes fro dede thynke gyle wythout drede maner clothynge estate euer bere leted leude lorde lady knyght squyer burgeys bayly ryght thus whyle false semblant sermoneth eft sone loue hym aresoneth brake hys tale hys speakynge though hym tolde leasynge sayd deuell folke hast thou v nempned maye men fynde religion worldly habitacion yea syr foloweth shulde lede wycked lyfe parfey ne therfore soules lese hem worldly clothes chese certes great pyte menne maye seculer clothes se floryshen holy religioun full many saynt felde towne wyth many virgyn glorious deuoure full religious han dyed comen cloth aye beren yet sayntes neuerthelesse coude recken many ten yea welnygh holy wemen menne church herry seke maydens wyues eke baren full many fayre chylde weared alwaye clothes seculere dydden sayntes ben alwaye pthe xi thousande maydens dere bearen heuen cierges clere whych men rede church synge take seculer clothynge receyued martyrdome wonnen heuen vnto home good herte maketh good thought clothynge yeueth ne reueth nought good thought worchynge maketh religion flourynge lyeth good religioun ryght ententioun toke wether skynne wrapped gredy wolfe therinne shuld go labes whyte wenest thou wolde hem byte yes neuerthelesse wode wolde hem wirry drynke blode well rather hem dysceyue syth coude perceyue hys tregette hys cruelte wolde hym folowe tho flye wolues suche hewe amonges apostle newe thou holy church thou mayst bewayled syth thy cyte assayled knyghtes thyne owne table god wote thy lordshyp doutable yf enforse wyn shulde defende fro wythin myght defence ayenst hem make wythout stroke mote take trepeget mangonell wythout dysplayenge pensell yf god nyll done socoure let renne thys coloure thou muste thy heestes letten nought yelde yeue hem trybute doutles holde hem haue pee greater harme betyde mayster well conne scorne wythall day stuffen wall nyght mynen naye thou planten muste el thyne ympes yf thou wolt fruyte haue abyde thy selfe saue bvt peace turne agayne woll nomore thys thynge sayne yf maye passen hereby myght maken wery woll heten alwaye helpe frendes maye wollen company shent vtterly yf fall ofte wyth hem wyth eke lemman mote serue shull loue deserue forsoth false traytour god iuged thefe trechour forsworne well nygh none wote gyle tyll done tthrough hath many one death receaued treget neuer aperceyued yet receyueth shall receyue falsnesse shall neuer apperceyue doth yf wyse hym ryght good beware slyghe aperceyuynge late cometh knowynge protheus coude hym chaunge euery shappe homely straunge coude neuer suche gyle ne treasoune come neuer towne myght knowen though men myght se full well clothes chaunge take one make another straunge nowe knyght nowe chastelayne nowe prelate nowe chapelayne nowe preest nowe clerke nowe fostere nowe mayster nowe scholere nowe monke nowe chanon nowe bayly euer myster man nowe prynce nowe page herte euery langage somtyme hoore olde nowe yonge stoute bolde nowe robert nowe robyn nowe frere mynor nowe iacobyn wyth foloweth loteby done solace company hyght dame abstinence raygned many queynt arraye fayned ryght cometh lykynge fulfyll desyrynge somtyme woman cloth take nowe mayde nowe lady somtyme religious nowe lyke anker hous somtyme prioresse nowe nonne nowe abbesse go regiouns sekynge religiouns order sworne take strawe beate corne ioly folke enhabyte aske habyte woll ye euery wyse ryght lyst dysgyse well beare vnder wede vnlyke worde dede thus make trappes fall people priuyleges bene christendome lyue maye assoyle maye shryue prelate maye let folke euer founde prelate maye done onlye mo made thylke establyshynge nowe thys propre thynge sleyghtes aperceyued wonte woste thou dyd hem tregetry therof yeue lytell tale haue syluer male haue preached eke shryuen haue take haue yeuen foly husbande wyfe lede ryght ioly lyfe symplesse prelacye knowe tregettrye bvt moche man wyfe shulde shewe peryshe preest lyfe one yere saythe boke er wyght hys housel toke haue priuyleges large maye moche thynge dyscharge maye saye ryght thus parde syr preest shryfte tell whome shryuen hath assoyled yeuen penaunce sothly syn whych fonde gylty ne ne haue neuer entencion make double confessyon ne reherce efte shryft shrift ryght ynough thys ought suffyse wele ne rebell neuer dele certes though thou haddest sworne wote preest ne prelate borne may shrift efte constrayne yf done woll playne wote playne wele thou shalt streyne dele ne enforce ne trouble make confessyon double ne haue none affection haue double absolution fyrst right ynough thys latter assoylyng quyte vnbounde mayst thou fynde synnes vnbynde myght hath hys honde synnes vnbonde yf thou wolte thus constrayne mote nedes playne shall iuge imperyall ne byshop ne offyciall done iugement shall gone playne openly vnto shriftfather newe hyght frere wolfe vntrewe shall chuse hym trowe hamper lorde wolde wrothe wythall men hym wolde frere wolfe call wolde haue pacience done cruell vengience wolde hys myght done leest nothyng spare goddes heest god wyse socour thou yeue sauyour eester whan lyketh wythout preasyng woll forthe hym gone shall housell anon thy grutchyng kepe deale wyth nothyng thus may shryue hym forsaketh hys paryshe preest taketh yf preest woll hym refuse full redy hym accuse hym punishe hamper churche shall go bvt hath hys felyng consequence shryuyng shall sene preest maye neuer haue myght knowe conscience right hym vnder hys cure thys ayenst holy scripture byddeth euery heerd honest haue knowyng hys beest poore folke gon strete haue golde ne somme grete hem wolde let prelate let preestes knowe state right nought yeue ne may ben bare take kepe woll haue fatte shepe let paryshe preestes haue lene yeue harme bene yf prelate grutche oughten woth wyt lese fatte beestes shall yeue hem stroke two shall lesen wyth force ye bothe mytre croce thus iape hem haue longe priuileges ben stronge false semblaunt wolde haue stynted loue ne made hym suche chere werye hys sawe make hym glad fawe sayd specially howe tha thou seruest vntruely tell orthe shame neuer dele hyne h oyt sheweth wele thou seruest holy heremyte sothe ypocryte thou gost prechest pouerte ye syr rychesse hath poste thou prechest abstynence also syr woll fyllen mote go paunche good meate wyne shulde maister diuyne thowe poore fayne yet poore folke disdayne loue better acqueyntaunce ten tymes kyng fraunce poore mylde mode though hys soule also good whan se beggers quakyng naked myxins stynkyng hongre crye eke care entremet fare ben poore full pyne myght one yeue dyne haue nothyng lyfe shulde yeue lycketh hys knyfe folly entremete seke houndes nest fatte mete lette beare hem spyttle anone comforte gette none ryche sycke vsurere wolde visyte drawe nere hym woll comforte rehete hoope hys golde gete yf wycked dethe hym haue woll go wyth hym hys graue yf reproue lette poore wost thou howe ascape saye swere hym full rape riche menne han tetches synne han poore wretch hanne counsayle myster therfore wolde drawe hem ner great hurte maye hath soule right great pouerte soule great richesse forsothe al hurten bothe richesse mendicitees bene cleped two extremytees meane cleped suffysaunce lyeth vertue aboundaunce salomon full well wote hys parable v wrote knowe many wyght hys thrittene chapiter ryght god thou kepe thy poste fro rychesse mendycite yf ryche manne hym dresse thynke moche rychesse hys herte ferre sette hys creatour dothe foryette hym beggeth woll aye greue howe shulde hys worde hym leue vnneth ny mycher forsworne el goddes lyer thus saythe salomon sawes ne fynde written lawes namely christen laye saythe yea dare say naye christ ne hys apostels dere walked erthe neuer seen herbred beggyng nolden beggen nothyng right thus men wont teche thys wyse wolde preche maysters dyuinyte somtyme parys cyte yf men wold gayne appose naked texte lette glose myght soone assoyled menne may wel yt soth se pardie myght aske thynge playnly forthe wythout beggynge goddes heerdes dere cure soules hadden nolde nothyng begge foode chryst done rodde wyth theyr proper hondes wrought wyth traueyle el nought wonnen sustenaunce lyueden forthe penaunce remenaunt yaf awaye poore folkes alwaye neyther bylden towre ne halle house small wyth alle mighty man canne maye shulde wyth hys honde body alwaye wynne hym hys foode laboryng ne haue rent suche thyng though relygious god seruen curyous thus mote done trespas yf certayne caas reherce yf myster ryght well whan tyme ise seke boke saynt austyne paper perchmyne writte worchynges thou shalt sene none excusynges parfyte man ne shulde seke wordes ne dedes eke though religyous god seruen curyous ne shall mote go wyth propre hondes body also get hys fode laboryng ne haue proprete thyng yet shulde fell hys substaunce hys swynke haue sustenaunce parfyte bounte thus han bookes tolde woll gone ydelly vseth aye besyly haunten mennes table trechour full fable ne ne may good reason excuse hym hys orison men behoueth gyse ben somtyme goddes seruyse gone purchasen nede men mote eaten drede slepe eke thyng longe may leaue prayeng may eke prayer blynne whyle werke meate wynne seynt austyn woll therto accorde thylke boke recorde iustinian eke made lawes hath thus forboden olde sawes man vp payne deed mighty body begge hys breed may swynke gete men shuld hym rather mayme bete done hym aperte iustyce suffren hym suche malyce done well mote go taken suche almesse yf haue somme priuilege payne hem woll alege howe se yf prynce disceyued ne ne wene sykerly may haue ryghtfully woll determyne prince power ne defyne ne worde comprehende iwys ferre may stretche thys woll intremete dele trowe boke saythe wele taketh almesses dewe folke men may se lame feble wery bare poore suche maner care conne wynne hem neuer mo haue power therto eateth hys owne dampnyng yf lye made thyng yf ye suche truaunt fynde chastyse hym well yf ye kynde wolde hate parcaas ye fyllen laas wolde eftsones scatche might late rathe full pacient han worlde thus foule blent weteth well god bad good man sell folowe hym poore yeue wolde therfore lyue seruen hym mendience neuer hys sentence werken whan nede folowe hym good dedes saynt poule loued holy churche bade apostels wurche wynnen lyue lode wyse hem defended truandyse sayd werketh wyth honden thus shulde thyng vnderstonden nolde iwys haue byd hem beggyng ne sellen gospell ne prechyng lest berafte wyth askyng folke catell thyng thys worlde many man yeueth hys good ne werne shame el wolde asker delyuered hym encombreth yeueth hym good let hym go hym thyng profyte lese yefte meryte good folke poule preched profred hym ofte whan hem teched good charyte therfore right nothyng toke hys hondewerke wolde gete clothes wryne hym hys mete tell howe man may lyuen al good poore hath yeuen woll onely bydde hys bede neuer wyth hondes labour hys nedes maye ye syr howe syr woll gladly tell seynt austen saith man may house han properte templers hospytelers chanons regulers whyte monkes blake woll mo ensamples make take therof hys susteynyng therin lythe beggyng otherwayes ywis yet austyn gabbeth thys yet full many monke laboureth god holy churche honoureth whan swynkyng agon rede synge churche anon hath ben great discorde manye wyght may beare recorde vpon estate mendicience woll shortly presence tel howe man may begge nede hath wherwith hym fede maugre hys felowes iangelynges sothfastnesse woll none hydynges yet parcase may abey sothly thus sey lo case especiall man bestyall crafte hath science nought desyreth ignorence tha may go begging yerne tyll maner crafte lerne whyche wythout truandyng may trouthe haue hys lyuyng yf may done labour elde sicknesse langour hys tendre age also may yet beggyng go yf haue perauenture vsage hys noriture lyued ouer delyciously oughten good folke comenly han hys mischefe pyte suffren hym also may gon aboute begge hys breed honger deed yf haue crafte connyng strength also desyryng worchen fynde neyther thys ne may begge tyll haue getten hys necessyte yf hys wynnyng lyte hys labour woll acquyte suffyciantly hys lyuyng yet may go hys breed beggyng fro doore doore may go trace tyll remenaunt may purchace yf man wolde vndertake emprise make rescous lay defenden may armes lettrure couenable cure poore may begge tyll may fynde trouthe swynke get hym clothe meate drynke swynke wyth hys hondes corporell wyth hondes espyrituell case semblables ben mo resonables may begge tell el manere willyam seynt amour wolde preche ofte wolde dispute teche thys mater openly parys full solemply also god soule blesse thys stedfastnesse accorde vniuersyte people semeth good man ought refuse ne ought hym therof excuse wrothe blythe woll speke tel shulde dye put doun seynt poule derke prisoun exiled thys caas wyth wronge mayster william mother hypocrise banysshed great enuye mother flemed hym seynt amour thys noble dyd suche labour susteyne euer loyalte moche agylte made boke let write wheryn hys lyfe dyd write wolde yche renyed beggyng lyued traueylyng ne rent ne good weneth wood labour might neuer plese haue wyll ben ese haue well leuer sothe saye people pattre pray wrye foxerye vnder cope papelardie qvod loue dyuell wordes tellest yu sir falsnesse apert dredest thou god certis selde great thyng shall spede worlde god woll drede folke hem vertue yeuen truely owne lyuen hem goodnesse aye coutene hem lytell thrifte ysene suche folke drinken great misese lyfe may neuer plese se golde han vsurers syluer eke garner tayla er monyours bayliff bedels prouost countours lyuen well nygh rauyne smale people hym mote enclyne wolues wol hem eten vpon poore folke geten full moche spende kepe ny none hem nyll strepe w yne hem selfe well full wythout scaldyng hem pull stronge feble ouergothe weare symple clothe robbe bothe robbyng robbours gyle gylyng gylours treget gather threst great tresour cheste lyeth wyth faste bounde myne hygh paleys founde delytes fulfyll wyth wyne feestes wyll table full entremees woll lyfe ease pee wynne golde spende also whan great bagge go cometh ryght iapes make well tomble myne ape wynnen alway myne entent purchace better rent though shulde beten ouer entremet without may wight dure walke soules cure worlde cure haue brede length boldly woll bothe preche eke counsaylen hondes wyll trauaylen pope haue bull ne holde wyttes dull woll stynten lyue emperours shriue kynges duke lordes grete poore folke quyte lete loue suche shryuyng parde cause recke poore men astate worthe hen fyndest thou swynker labor haue vnto hys confessour empress duchess quenes eke countess abesses eke bygyns great ladyes palasyns iolye knyghtes bayliues nonnes burgeys wyues ryche ben eke plesyng maydens welfaryng clad naked vncounsayled gothe none fro soules sauete lorde lady meyne aske whan hem shriue proprete lyue make hem trowe bothe moste leest parysshe preest ny beest ayens company shrewes ben great whyche woll hyde holde pryuite tolde worde signe ywis ne woll make hem knowe wollen also tellen hele fro pryuite make hem perceyuen vsen folke thus disceyuen woll sayne withouten drede menne maye gospell rede saynt mathue gospelere saythe shall saye vpon chayre moyses thus glosed doutlees olde testament therby chayre ment sytte scribe pharysen sayne cursed men whyche hypocrite call dothe preche rede dothe nat done dele bene nat wery saye wele well wyll haue wolde bynde folke alwaye bene begyled able burdons ben importable folkes shulders thynges couchen nyll wyth fyngers touchen woll nat touche hem ne lyste nat sykerly sadde burdons men taken make folkes shulders aken yf ought good folke shulde se burdons larger maken make hemmes wyde alwaye louen seates table fyrste honorable hanne fyrste chayris synagogges hem full dere wyllen folke hem loute grete whan passen strete wollen cleped mayster also ne shulde nat wyllen gospell agaynst gesse sheweth well wyckednesse another custome vse hem wol ayenst v hate hi deedly euerichone wol werrey one hym ye one hateth hate al coiecte done fal yf sene hym wynne honour rychesse preyse hys valour prouende rente dignyte full faste ywis compassen ladder clomben maken hym downe go trayson woll hym defame done hym lese hys good name thus hys ladder hym take thus hys frendes foe make worde ne wete shall noon tyll hys frendes bene hys foon yf dyd openly myght haue blame redily hadde wyste malyce hadde hym kepte nyce another thys yf fall ther one amoge v al doth good tourne drede sayne alder dede ye sikerly though famed hym lyste hym dayned manne hym auaunced therof parceners tellen folke go manne v sprongen haue menne preysyng purchace flatterynge ryche menne great poste letter wytnesse bounte manne weneth maye v se vertue v alwaye poore v fayne howe begge playne bene folke without leasyng thynge haue wythout hauyng thus dradde people ywis gladly purpose thys pi deale wyth wyght haue golde treasour great plente acqueyntaunce well loue thys moche desyre shortely entremete brocages make peace mariages gladly executour many tymes procuratour somtyme messagere falseth nat mystere many tymes make enqueste offyce nat honest deale mennes thynge great lykynge yf ye haue ought place repeyre shall speden wyt soone ye haue tolde ye serue paye seruyce shalbe alwaye wol chastyce anone loue lost hath loue man gyse wol repreue chastyce wolde al folke vndertake wyght teachyng take folke chasty wol taught fro foly loue none hermytage al desertes holtes hoore greate woodes euerychone let baptiste iohn queth hym quyte hym relesse egypte al wyldernesse ferre al mansion fro al city good town paleys myne house make menne may renne openly saye worlde forsake al amydde bylde make house swymme playe therinne bette fyshe doth wyth hys fynne antechristes menne whiche christe sayeth openly haue habyte holynesse lyuen wyckednesse copye yf hym talent toke euangelistes boke ther myght se great trayson ful many false comparison moche though hys greate myght heate lyght sunne surmounteth moone troubler chaungeth soone nutte kyrnel shelle skorne telle ryght wythouten gyle surmounteth thys noble euangyle worde euangelist tytel token christ many comparysoun whyche make mencioun myght men booke fynde coulde hem haue mynde vniuersyte tho slepe gan brayde taken kepe noyse heed vp cast ne neuer sythen slepte fast vp sterte armes tooke ayenst thys false horrible booke redy batayle make iuge boke take broughten boke hent anone away fere nolde shewe dele kepte kepen wele tyl tyme may se stronge woxen wyght maye hem wel wythstonde boke durst nat stonde awaye gonne bere ne durst nat answere expositioun glose clerkes wol appose ayenst cursednesse ywys boke wrytten wotte nat ne nat se maner ende shall al thys hyde yet algate shal abyde tyl may bette defende thys trowe best woll ende thus antechrist abyden bene al hys meyne man wol ryght soone shal hys lyfe go outwarde lamben semen ful goodnesse pyte inwarde wythouten fable bene gredy wolues rauysable enuyroun lande see wyth al worlde werryen wol ordayne al thyng folkes good lyuyng castel citye wherin bougerons al though myllayne therof bene blamed yf wyght measure wolde leane golde take vsure coueytous yf lecherous haunten simonye prouost ful trechery prelate lyuyng iolyly preest halte hys queyn hym olde hoores hostylers baudes bordellers el blamed vyce whyche men shulden done iustyce al sayntes prey defende wyth lamprey wyth luce wyth elys wyth samons wyth tendre gee capon wyth tartes wyth cheffes fatte wyth deyntye flaunes brode flatte wyth caleweys wyth pullayle wyth conynges fyne vytayle vnder clothes wyde maken golet glyde wol come haste roe venyson bake paste whether loure groyne shal haue corde loygne wyth whiche men shal hym bynde lede brenne hym hys synful dede men shulde hym crye rore myle waye aboute el shal prison dye yf wol hys frendshyp bye smerten hath hys gylte amounteth couth hys sleyght make vp toure heyght nought rought wheder stone tre erth turnes though though vounde stone wrought wyth squyre scantilone toure stuffed wel wyth al rychesse temporel wolde vp dresse engyns lesse cast v euery syde bere hys good name wyde sleyghtes shal neuen barels wyne syxe seuen golde sackes greate plente shulde sone delyuered yf haue pytences let hym study equipolences let lye fallaces wolde deserue grace shal beare hym wytnesse nne hys wretchednesse done hys lose wyde renne al quicke shulde hym brenne el yeue hym penaunce wel worse pytaunce thou shalt neuer nothyng con knowen ryght clothyng traitours ful trecherye thou werkes aspye ne good kepyng whylom vniuersite kepeth key christendome bene turmented al bene stynkyng prophetis ny none hem good prophete wycked entention yere incarnation thousande two hundred yere fyue fyfty ferther ne nere broughten boke wyth sory grace yeue ensample comune place sayd thus though fable thys gospel pardurable fro holy ghost sent wel worth bene brent entytled manere thys boke whyche tel na wyght al parys beforne lady parnys ne myght booke sentence pleased hem well trewly wol stynte thys matere wonder longe ylke boke endured better estate ensured frendes haue yet parde han set great degre al thys worlde emperour gyle father trechour empresse mother maugre holy ghost ywys myghty lynage route reygneth euery reygne aboute wel worthy maystres al thys worlde gouerne folke wel disceyue none gyle perceyue though done dare say soth dare wyght bewray christes wrath hym ledeth christ brethern dredeth ny ful good champion dredeth similacion payne wol refusen v correcte accusen wol entremete ryght ne haue god hys eye syght therfore shal god hym punyce ne recketh vyce sythen men v louen comunably holden v worthy may folke repreue echone nyl haue reprefe none shulden folke worshypen v stynten neuer mo patren whyle folke may v se though behynde hem woode foly enhaunce chiualry loue noble men gaye ioly clothes alwaye folke semen clene men clothes demen wordes folowe dede great pyte drede wol none hypocritis hem thynketh great spyte loue hem syde beggers wyth hoodes wyde wyth sleygh pale face leane graye clothes nat ful cleane fretted ful tatarwagges hygh shoe knopped wyth dagges frouncen lyke quayle pype bootes ryuelyng gype folke deuyse shulde prince lordes wyse take al landes thynges warre peace gouernynges folke shulde prince hym yeue wolde hys lyfe honour leue yf nat seme seruen thus worlde queme wolde dwelle disceyue folke shal parceyue ne speke suche wyse men shulde humble habytte dispyse pride vnder man shulde hate thynketh poore man clothyng god ne preyseth hym nothyng sayeth hath worlde forsake hath worldly glory hym take wol delyces vse maye begger wel excuse papelarde hym yeldeth wol worldly ease go sayth worlde hath lefte gredyly grypeth efte hounde shame sayne hys castyng goth agayne bvt vnto dare lye myght felen espye ye perceyued nothyng ye shulde haue starke leasyng ryght hande thus begynne nolde let synne god loughe wonder tho euery wyght ganne laughe also sayd lo man aryght trusty euery wyght false semblant loue saye sythe thus haue auaunced courte thy dwellyng rybaudes shalt kyng wolte thou wel holden forwardes yee sir hence forwardes wol people vpon hym areyse gyle done hym ceyse hym sharpe speares ryue wayes brynge hym fro lyue yf wol folowe ywys boke written thus muche wol boke signyfye whyle peter hath mastrye maye neuer iohn shewe wel hys myght nowe haue declared ryght meanyng barke rynde maketh ententions blynde nowe erst wol gyn expowne pythe wythin seculers comprehende christes lawe wol defende shulde kepen mayntenen ayenst hem al susteynen falsly people teachen iohan betoketh hem prechen ny lawe couenable thylke gospell pardurable fro holy ghost sent turne folke bene myswent strength iohan vnderstonde grace whych say stonde doth synful folke conuerte hem iesu christ reuerte ful many horriblete maye men booke se bene commaunded doutelesse ayenst lawe rome expresse al wyth antechrist holden men may boke beholden commaunden sleen al tho wyth peter shall neuer haue myght god forne stryfe fyght ne shal ynough fynde peter lawe shal haue mynde euer beholde mayntene last shal sene shall al come therto aught speke thylke lawe shal stonde ihon haue vnderstonde maugre hem shal doun hem brought confusioun neuer father beforne seruaunt trewe syth borne ayenst al nature sir put auenture though ye borowes take sykerer shal ye neuer hostage ne sykernesse charter bere wytnesse take selfe recorde men ne maye manere teren wolfe hys hyde tyl slayne backe syde though men hym beate al defyle wene ye wol begyle clothed mekely vnder al trechery myne hert chaungeth neuer mo none habyt whych go though haue chere simplenesse wery shreudnesse lemman strayned abstenaunce hath mister purueyaunce ful longe ago dede nere counsayle rede let alone loue answerde trust wythout borowe woll none false semblaunt thefe anone ryght ylke place treson al face ryght blacke wythin whyte wythout thankyng hym gan hys knee lout nought euerye man nowe assaute saylen quod loue ful hardely armed hem comenly armoure hem fell whan armed fyers fel went hem forth al aroute set castel al aboute wyl away drede tyl bene dede tyl haue castel take foure batels gan make partid hem foure anone toke way forth gone foure gate assayle whych kepers woll fayle bene neyther sycke ne dede hardy folke stronge dede nowe wol sayne countenaunce false semblaunt abstinaunce bene wycked tonge went fyrst helde parlyment whether done maken hem knowen el walken forth dysgysed laste deuysed wolde gone tapynage pylgrymage lyke good holy folke vnfeyned dame abstinence streyned toke robe camelyne gan gratche bygyne large couercheife threde wrapped al aboute hede forgate psaltere payre beedes eke bere vpon lace al whyte threde whych beades bede ne bought hem neuer dele gyuen wote wele god wote ful holy frere sayd father dere ofter went frere hys couent vysited also many sermon sayd nolde let man lyue ne wolde ofte shryue wyth great deuotion made confession ofte none two heedes one hode one fayre shappe deuysed pale face somtyme false traytouresse vntrewe lyke salowe horse hewe apocalips shewed signyfyeth folke beshrewed bene al ful trecherye pale hypocrisye horse colour onely deed pale ywys colour enlangoured abstinence ywys coloured estate repented vysage represented burdowne al thefte gyle yeue hys yefte skryppe faynte distresse ful elengenesse forth walked sobrely false semblaunt saynt ie vous die mistere done cope frere wyth chere symple full pytous hys lokyng disdeynous ne proude meke ful pesyble hys necke bare byble squierly forth gan gon rest hys lymmes vpon treason potent feble hys way went hys sleue gan thryng rasoure sharpe wel bytyng forged forge whyche men clepen coupe gorge longe forth waye nomen tyl wycked tonge comen hys gate syttyng sawe folke way passyng pylgrymes sawe faste beren hem ful mekely humbly wyth hym mette dame abstinence fyrst hym grette syth hym false semblant salued hem remeued ne dred hem dele whan sawe face wele alwaye herte hym thought shulde knowe hem two wele knewe dame abstynaunce ne knewe constreynaunce ne knewe nat constreyned ne theues lyfe fayned wende come wyll al fre come another degre yf good wyl beganne wyl fayled thanne false semblant sayne alse knewe nat false yet false falsenesse ne coulde espye gesse semblant slye wrought falsenesse ne espyed nought haddest thou knowen hym beforne thou woldest boke haue sworne whan thou hym saugh thylke araye whylome gaye daunce ioly robyn tho become iacobyn sothly men hym call frere preachours bene good men order wyckedly beren minstrel yf bene augustyns cordylers carmes eke sacked freers al freres shodde bare though hem bene great square ful holy men hem deme eueryche hem wolde good man seme shalt thou neuer apparence sene conclude good consequence none argument ywys existence fayled men may fynde alwaye sopheme consequence eueneme hath subtelte double sentence se whan pylgrymes comen wycked tonge dwelled harneys nygh hem algate wycked tonge adowne sate badde hem nere hym come tidynges telle hym sayde hem case maketh come place nowe sir sayde strayned abstinaunce drye penaunce hertes pytous deuoute comen pylgrimes gon aboute wel nyght fote alway go ful doughty ben heeles two thus bothe ben sent throughoute worlde myswent yeue ensample preche also fyshen synfull menne go fyshynge ne fyshe syr charite wont herborowe craue lyfe amende christ saue shulde nat displease wolden yf case shorte sermon vnto sayne wicked tonge answered agayne house quod ye se shal warned say lyst wol graunt mercy swete syr dere quod alder first dame abstynence thus began sentence sir fyrst vertue certayne greatest moost souerayne may founde man hauyng wytte hys tonge refrayne therto ought euery wyght hym payne better styl speken harme parde herkeneth gladly good man sykerly sir abouen al synne arte thou moost gylty inne thou spake iape longe ago sir ryght yuel yonge man repayred neuer yet thys place apayred thou saydest awayted nothynge deceyue fayre welcomyng ye sayd nothyng soth sir ye lye tel plat ne cometh ne goth parde trowe ye shal hym nen se fayre welcomynge prison ofte hath played wyth er thys fayrest game coulde wythout fylth styl loude nowe dare selfe solace ye han also man chace dare neyther come ne go meueth hate hym properly wycked thought many false leasyng hath thought meueth youre foole eloquence iangleth euer audience folke areyseth blame doth hem shonour shame thyng maye haue preuyng lykelynesse contryuyng dare sayne reason demeth al soth thynge semeth synne controue thyng reproue thys wote ye wele syr therfore ye arne blame nathlesse recketh lyte yeueth nat nowe therof myte yf thought harme parfaye wolde come gone al daye coulde selfe abstene nowe cometh sene ne taketh cure yf auenture lasse folke algate thou watchest gate wyth speare thyne arest alwaye muse musarde al daye thou wakest nyght daye thought iwys thy traueyle nought ielosy wythouten fayle shal neuer quyte thy trauayle skath fayre welcomyng wythout trespassyng shal wrongfully prison wepeth languysheth though thou neuer yet ywys agyltest man thys take grefe worthy put thys bayly afterwarde prison lye fettre tyl thou dye thou shalt thys synne dwelle ryght dyuels arse helle yf thou repent mafaye thou lyest falsely quod welcome mischaunce haue therfore herbered saye shame eke reproue sory hap behoue today harbegere go herber el han lyer called two tregeturs art thou myne house shame sothe sawe ye blame sermon ye make deuyls take el god thou confounde er men dydden castell founde passeth ten dayes twelue tolde ryght selue sayd ryght tolde kyst rose priuyly thus sayd haue sayd yore dyd shulde men saye thynge yf ben gabbynge ryght sayd woll say yet trowe lyed bemes woll blowe neyghbours arowe hath comen gone tho spake false semblaunt ryght anon gospell dout men sayne towne laye deefe ere speakyng swere syr gabbyng trowe ye wot well certaynly man loueth hym tenderly sayth hym harme yf wote neuer poore wyt sothe also sykerly knowe ye syr well louers gladly woll vysiten place loues habyten man loueth eke honoureth man serue laboureth clepeth frende dere man maketh good chere euery meteth salweth greteth preseth oft ye ought commyng encombred presen folke full ofter doth nowe yf hert hym strayned vnder rose go ye shulde hym sene oft nede ye shulde take hym dede coude commyng forbeare though hym thrilled speare nere nat nowe trusteth well swere clene thought syr certes ne thynketh nought nomore ne doth fayre welcomyng sore abyeth thynge yf one assent full soone rose hent maugre wolde syr thyng herkeneth syth ye man loueth han sayd suche harme shame wytteth well yf gessed ye maye well demen wyt noulde nothynge loue ne callen frende also nyght daye wol wake castel destroye take yf soth ye deuyse man maner wyse myght warne hym euery dele hym self perceyue wele syth myght come gone whylom wont done myght soone wyte se nowe otherwyse wot haue syr vtterly deserued hell iolyly deth hell doutlesse thrallen folke gyltlesse false semblaunte proueth thynge canne none answerynge seeth alwaye suche apparaunce nygh fell repentaunce sayd hym syr maye well semblaunt good man semen ye abstinence full wyse ye seme talent deme counsayle woll ye yeuen ryght anon thou shalt shryuen say thy synne without shalt thou repent sore prest haue poste shryue folke moost dignitie ben wyde worlde may dure al worlde haue cure neuer yet persoun ne vicarie maner toun god wot haue thousande tymes pytye hath thy prest parochial though thy frende specyall haue auauntage wyse prelate ben wyse ne halfe lettred lycenced boldly diuinitie rede confessen drede yf ye woll nowe confesse leaue synnes lesse without abode knele downe anon shall haue absolucion finis phere endeth romaunt rose foloweth boke troylous creseyde ptroylus creseyde double sorow troilus tellen kynge priamus sonne troy louyng aduentures fellen woo wele ioye purpose er parte froye thou thesiphon thou helpe tendite woful verse wepen write clepe thou goddesse tourment thou cruel furye sorowyng euer payne helpe sorowful instrument helpeth louers complayue well syt soth sayne woful wyght haue drerie fere sorouful tale sorye god loues seruauntes serue ne dare loue myne vnlykelynesse prayen spede al shulde therfore sterue farre fro helpe derkenesse nathelesse maye done gladnesse louer cause aueyle haue thake myne trauyle ye louers bathen gladnesse yf drope pytie remembreth passed heuynesse ye haue felte aduersitie folke thynketh ye han felt loue durst displease ye han hym great ease prayeth hem ben case troylus ye maye heare hem brynge heuen solace eke prayeth god dere haue might shew som manere payne wo loues folke endure troylus vnsely aduenture byddeth eke hem yt ben dispeyred loue neuer wyl recouered eke hem falsely ben apeyred wycked tonges thus byddeth god benignitie graut hem sone world pace ben dispayred loues grace byddeth eke hem bene ease god hem graut aye good perseuerauce sende hem grace loues please loue worshyp pleasaunce hope selfe best auaunce praye hem yt loues seruauntes wryte wo lyue charitie haue hem compassyoun though owne brother dere herkeneth good ententioun wyll go streyght matere ye maye double sorowes troylus louyng creseyde forsoke er yt dyed well wyst grekes stronge armes thousande shyppes went troye wardes cytie longe besiegeden nygh ten yeres er stent dyuers wyse one entent rauyshyng wreke quene heleyne parys wroughte al peyne fell ye towne dwellyng lorde great authoritie great diuyne cleped calcas science expert knewe wel troye shulde destroyed answere god hyght thus dan phebus apollo delphicus wha calcas knewe calculing eke answere god apollo grekes shulde people bryng thorowe troye must fordo cast anon towne go wel wyst sort troye sholde destroyed yea wolde nolde wherfore departen softely toke purpose ful knowyng wyse grekes host full priuyly stale anon curteys wyse dyd hym worshyp seruyce trust hath connyng hem rede euery peryll drede great rumour rose wha fyrst espyed towne openly spoken calcas traytour fled alyed hem grece cast wroken hym falsly hath fayth broken sayd kynne atones worthy brent fel bone calcas lefte mischauce vnwyst false wycked dede doughter whiche great penaunce lyfe ful sore drede wyst neuer best rede wyddowe al alone nyst myght make mone creseyde ladyes name aryght dome al troyes cytie fayrest lady fer passynge euery wight angelyke shone natyle beautie mortall thyng semed therwith parfyte creature made scornyng nature lady daye herde eare father shame falshed traysoun full nigh wit sorowe feare widowes habite large samite brown hector knee fyl adowne mercy bad selfe excusyng pitious voyce tenderly wepynge hector pytious nature sawe sorowful begone fayre creature goodnesse gladded anon sayd let father trayson gone forthwith mischauce ye selfe ioye dwelleth v whyle lyst troye yt honour yt men may haue ferforth thogh father dwel shull haue body shull men saue may ought enquyre thaked ful humble chere ofter wolde ben wyll toke leaue went home held styll house abode wt suche meynye tyll honour nede holde whyle dwellyng cytie kept estate yonge olde full welbeloued well men tolde whether chyldren none rede nat therfore let gone pthe thynges fellen done werre betwyxen hem troye grekes ofte som day boughte troye derre eft grekes founden nothyng softe folke troye thus fortune alofte vnder eft gan hem whelmen course aye whyle wroth towne came distruction ne falleth purpose tell longe digressyon fro mater longe dwell troyan iestes fell omer dare dyte yt may reden hem wryte though ye grekes hem troy shetten citye besieged olde vsages nolde letten honouren goddes full deuoute aldermost honour dout relyke hyght palladion trust abouen euerychon befyll whan comen tyme april whan clothed mede newe grene lusty veer pryme swete smellyng floures whyte red sondry wyse shewed rede folke troy theyr obseruaunces olde palladions feest went holde vnto temple theyr best wyse generallye went many wyght herken palladions seruyce namely many iustye knyght many lady fresh mayden bright full wele arayed leest season hye feest amonge folke creseyda wydowes habyt blacke nathelesse ryght fyrst letter nowe beautie fyrst stode makelesse goodly lokyng gladded prees na neuer sene thyng praysed derre vnder cloude blacke bryght sterre creseyd sayden euerychone behelde blacke wede yet stode full lowe styl alone behynde folke lytle brede nyt dore vnder shame drede symple attyre debonayre chere full assured lokyng manere troylus wont guyde yonge knyghtes lad hem vp downe thylke large temple euery syde beholdyng aye ladyes towne deuocioun none reuen hym rest ganne prayse lacke hym lest walke ful fast gan wayten yf knyght squyre company gan syke let eyen bayten woman coude espye wolde smyle holde folye saye hem thus lord slepeth soft loue whan thou turnest full ofte haue herde tel pardieux lyuynge ye louers eke leude obseruaunces labour folke haue winnyng loue kepynge suche doutaunces wha pray lost wo penauces fooles blynde nyce ye one ware another ye worde gan cast vp browe ascaunces lo well yspoken god loue gan loken rowe ryght despyte shope hym wroken kyd anon bowe nat broken sodaynly hyt hym full yet proude peckoke gan pull blynde worlde blynde ententioun often falleth theffect contrayre surquedie foule presumtioun caught proude caught debonair troylus clomben stayre lytel weneth mote discenden al day fayleth fooles wenden proude bayarde begynneth skyp waye prycketh hym corne tyl lash haue longe whyppe tha thinketh though prauce al beforn fyrst tracie ful fat newe yshorne yet horse horse lawe must endure feeres drawe fared fiers proud knight though worthy kynges sonne wende nothynge suche myght ayenst wyl shulde hert stere yet loke hert woxe fyre pride aboue woxe sodaynly subiect vnto loue thy ensample taketh man ye wyse proude worthy folkes scornen loue sone edom hertes hym thrall euer euer shall loue thyng may bynde man may fordo lawe kynde soth hath preued doth yet owe ye knowe men reden nat folke han greater wyt tha yt han ben loue ynome strengest folke b n therwith ouercome worthyest greatest degre yet men shall se trulych sytte well alder wysest han therwith ben plesed han ben aldermost wo loue han ben comforted esed oft hath cruell hert apesed worthy folke made worthyer name causeth mooste dreaden vyce shame syth may goodly withstonde thyng vertuous kynde refuseth nought loue ben bonde syth hym seluen lyst may bynde yerde bet bowen woll wynde ye brest therfore reed nowe foloweth hym well lede tellen forth specyall kynges son tolde leuen thyng collaterall hym thynke tale forth holde ioye care colde werke touchyng matere gan wol therto refere within teple went forth playig troylus euery wyght lady lokyng towne without vpon case befell rout eye perced depe went tyll creseyde smote stent sodaynly wonder wext astoned gan bet beholde thryfty wyse god thouyt wher hast thou woned art fayre goodly deuyse therwith hert gan sprede ryse soft syghed lest men myght hym caught ayen fyrst playing chere na nat stature lymmes wel answering womanhode creature neuer lasse mannysh semyng eke pure wyse meanyng shewed wel men myght gesse honour estate womanly noblesse tho troylus ryght wonder wel withall gan lyke meanynge chere somdele deignous let fal loke alyte asyde suche manere ascaunces maye stonden lokyng gan lyght neuer thouyt hym sene good sight loke gan quycke great desyre suche affection hertes botom gan stycken fyxe depe impressyon though erst pored vp doune glad horne shrynke vnethes wyst loke wynke lo lete hym seluen connyng scorned hem loues paynes dryen full vnware ye loue dwellyng within subtyll stremes eyen sodaynly hy thought felt dyen ryght loke spyrite herte blessed loue thus folke conuerte blacke lykyng troylus ouer al thyng stode beholde desyre ne whefore stode thus neyther chere made ne worde tolde ferre maner holde thyng somtyme loke cast eftte whyle seruyce last fully h whaped temple e lyche went repentyng hym euer iaped loues folke lest fully discent scorne fyl selfe ment lest wyst maner syde wo gan dyssimulen hyde whan fro teple thus departed streyght anon vnto pallayes turneth right loke thrugh shotte darted al fayneth lust soiourneth al chere speche also bourneth aye loues seruauntes euery whyle hym selfe wrie al hem gan smyle sayd lorde lyue lust ye louers conyngest serueth moost ententiflyche best hym tyte often harme therof prowe hyre quyte ayen yea god wot wele wele scorn good seruice fayth ordre ruled good wyse certayne bene obseruaunces sely fewe poyntes ne nothyng reth great atendauces doth laye knowe ye worst mote tolde worst poynt leue sayde soth ye wolden greue take ye louers oft eshewe el done good entention full ofte thy lady wol mysse constrewe deme harme opynion yet yf encheson wroth tha shalt thou haue groin anone lorde wel maye ben one al wha seeth tyme held pee non bote gayned loue began fethers lyme wel vnneth vnto folke fayned besy nedes hym distrayned wo hym done nyst bad folke gon hem lyst whan chambre alone downe beddes fete hym sette fyrst gan syke efte grone thought aye withouten lette satte woke spyrite mette saugh temple ye wyse ryght loke gan newe auyse thus ga make myrrour hys mynde whiche saugh al holy fygure wel coude hys herte fynde right good auenture loue suche one yf dyd hys cure seruen yet myght fall grace el one seruauntes pace imaginyng traueyle grame ne myght goodly one lorne ne hym hys desyre shame al wyft prise vp borne al louers wel beforne argumented hys gynnyng full vnauysed hys wo commyng thus toke purpose louers crafte sewe thought wolde worken priuely fyrst hyde desyre mewe euery wight yborne al ouerly myght aught recouered ben therby remebryng loue wyde yblowe yelte bytter fruit though swete sede sowe ouer al ful mokel thought speke holden inne arten loue sought songe anon right begynne gan loude hys sorowe wynne good hope gan fully assente creseyde loue nought repente songe onely sentence writte myne auctour called lollius playnly saue tonges difference dare wel say troylus said song lo euery worde right thus shall sayne lyste lo next verse may fynde pthe songe troylus loue god fele yf loue thig whiche loue good frome whece cometh wo wycke wonder thynketh whan euery turment aduersyte cometh may sauory thike aye thurst yche drinke yf myne owne lust brenne fro whece cometh wayling pleynte harme agree wherto playn thenne ne vnwery feynte quicke dethe swete harme queynte howe may suche quantyte yf consente yf consente wrongfully complayne ywis thus possed fro al sterelesse within bote mydde see atwyxen wyndes two contrarie stonden euer mo ala thys wonder maladye heate colde colde heate dye god loue thus sayd wyth pytous voyce lorde nowe spyrite whiche ought thanke lorde ye ha brought whether goddesse woman ywis whiche ye serue man wol aye lyue sterue ye stonden eyen mightyly place vertue digne wherfore lorde yf seruyce may lyken beth benigne myne estate royall resigne honde full humble chere become man lady dere hym ne deigned sparen bloode royall fyre loue wherfro god blesse ne hym forbare degre hys vertue excellent prowesse helde hym thrall lowe distresse brende sondrie wyse aye newe sixty tymes day lost hewe mochel day fro day hys thought luste gan quicken increase eueryche charge set nought thy full ofte hys hotte fyre cease sene goodly loke gan prease therby ben eased well wende aye nere brende aye nere fyre hotter trowe knoweth companye ferre nere dare say thys nyght day wysedom folye herte whyche brestes eye aye fayrer sene euer heleyne polixene eke day passed houre selfe thousande tyme seyde god goodly serue laboure best nowe wolde god creseyde ye wolden rewe er deyde dere herte ala myne heele hewe lyfe loste ye woll rewe al dredes hym fledde bothe thassiege hys sauacion ne desyre non fownes bredde argumentes hys conclusyon hym wolde han compassyon ben man whyle may dure lo hys lyfe dethe cure sharpe shoures fell armes preue hector hys bretherne dydden ne made hym therfore one meue yet washe went rydden founde one ye beste lengest tyme abyden peryl dyd eke trauayle armes thynke meruayle none hate grekes ne also rescous toun ne made hym thus armes mad onely lo thys conclusyoun lyken bette hys renoun fro day day armes spedde grekes dethe hym dredde fro forth reste loue slepe made meate foe eke sorow gan multiplye toke kepe shewed hewe eue morow therfore tytle gan hym borowe sicknesse leste men hym wende hotte fyre loue hym brende sayd feuer fared amys certayne nat say hys lady vnderstode nat thys fayned nyste one twey well rede maner wey ne semed hym rought hys payne euer thought felte troylus suche wo wel nigh wode aye drede wyght loued neuer hym wolde han take hede thought felt hert blede ne hys wo ne durst nought begynne tellen thys worlde wynne whan space care thus hym selfe full ofte gan playne sayd foole nowe arte thou snare whylom iapedest loues payne art yu het gnaw thyn chayn thou aye woned eche louer reprehede thing fro thou canst yt defende wol nowe euery louer sayne wyst euer thyne absence laughen scorne sayne lo gothe man great sapience helde v louers leste reuerence thaked god may gon ye dauce hem loue lyste febly auaunce thou wofull troylus god wolde syth thou must louen thy destyne thou beset suche one yt sholde knowe thy wo lacked pyte also colde loue towardes thy lady froste wynter moone thou fordo snowe fyre soone god wolde aryued porte dethe whiche sorowe wol lede ah lorde great comforte quyt languyssyng drede hyd sorowe yblowe brede shall beiaped ben thousande tyme ye foole whose folye men ryme helpe god ye swete playne ycaught ye neuer wight faste mercy dere herte helpe dethe yt lyfe may laste selfe wol loue laste fredly loke gladeth swete though neuer thyng ye byhete pthese wordes ful many mo spake called euer hys compleynte name tellen hys wo tyll nyghe salte teeres dreynte al naught herde pleynte whan bethought folye thousande folde hys wo gan multiplye bewaylyng hys chambre thus alone frende hys called pandare came one vnware herde grone sawe hys frende suche distresse care ala causeth thys fare mercy god vnhap may mene han nowe thus sone grekes made lene haste thou remorce coscience arte nowe fall deuocioun waylest thy synne thyne offence hast ferde caught contricioun god saue hem besieged han toun lay iolyte presse brynge lusty folke holynesse wordes sayd none wt thing miyt angry make anger sorowe fal tyme hys corage awaken wel wyste ferre tonges spaken na man gretter hardynesse ne desyred worthynesse pwhat ca troylus auenture hath gyded sene languyssyng refuse euery creature loue god prayeng go hence away certes deyeng woll disese mote nedes dey therfore go way ny sey yf thou wene thus sycke drede nat therfore scorne nought thyng take hede well tha aught ye grekes ha yet wrouyt cause deth sorow thouyt though nowe tell ne leste thou wrothe hyde beste padare ye nygh molte wo routh ful often sayd ala may nowe frende yf euer loue trouthe hath ben er betwyxen ne thou neuer suche cruelte hyden fro thy frende great care woste thou nat well pandare woll parten thy payne comforte frendes right sothe sayne enterparten wo glad disporte haue shall trewe false reporte wronge right yloued al lyue hyde nat thy wo fro tell blyue gan soroufull troylus syke said thus god leue best tellen sythe may lyke yet wol tell though herte brest well wote thou mayste rest leste thou deme truste nat nowe herke frend thus stant loue ayenst whych defendeth hym seluen moste hym alder leest auayleth dispeyre soroufully offendeth streight vnto ye deth myne hert sayleth therto desyre brennyngly assayleth ben slayne greater ioye kyng grece troye suffyseth full frende pandare haue said wost thou wo loue god colde care hyde well tolde neuer mo harmes myghten folowen mo two wyst thou gladnesse let sterue vnknowe distresse howe hast thou thus vnkyndly longe hyd fro thou fole pandarus parauenture thou mayst one loge myn auyse anon may helpen v wonder thyng troylus thou couldest neuer loue thy selfen wysse dyuel mayst thou bringen blysse pyea troylus herke pandare though nyce happeth often one ax dothe full yuell fare good cousayle kepe frende therfro haue selfe seyne blynde man go fell coude loken wyde foole may eke wyse man ofte gyde whetstone keruyng instrument yet maketh sharpe keruyng tolis ther yu wost haue aught miswent eschue thou suche thyng schole often wyse men ben ware foolis thou thy wyt well bywared contrarye euery thyng declared might euer swetnesse haue know hym neuer tasted bytternesse ne man wote gladnesse trow neuer sorowe distresse eke white blacke shae eke worthinesse eche set semeth men may sene wyse demeth sythe thus two contrary lore haue loue ofte assayed greuaunces ought connen well counsaylen thou arte dismayed eke ne ought nat ben yuell apayed though desyre wyth bere thyne heuy charge shall lasse dere wote well fared thus thy brother parys hierdesse whyche cleped oenone wrote complaynte heuynesse ye sawe letter wrote ge nay neuer yet iwys troylus nowe pandare herkeneth thus phebus fyrst fonde arte medicyne quod coude euery wightes care remedy rede hertes knewe fyne yet hym selfe hys connyng ful bare loue hym bounden snare al doughter kyng admete hys craft ne coude hys sorowe bete right fare vnhappy loue one best smerteth sore yet parauenture reden nat selfe repreue haue cause wot well sore dothe hauke lysteth play thyne helpe yet somwhat say thyng right syker mayst thou certayne dyen payne shall neuer mo discouer ne trouhe kepe restreyne fro thy loue though heleyne thy brother wyfe yf yche wyste loue lyst therfore frendfullyche assure tell platte thyn encheson fynall cause wo ye endure douteth nothyng myne entencion na nat reprehensyon speke nowe wight may byreue man loue tyll hym lyst leue weteth wel two ben vycis mystrusten elles leue well wot meane vyce trusten wight preue trouth thy wold fayne remeue thy wronge coceyte yt som wight trust thy wo tell tell yf lust wyse eke sayth wo hym alone fall hath none helpe ryse sythe thou haste felowe tell thy mone thys ny nought certayne next wyse wynnen loue techen v wyse walowe wepe niobe quene whose teeres yet marble ben ysene let thy wepyng thy drerynesse let v lyssen wo wyth speche may thy wofull tyme seme lesse delyte naught wo thy wo seche fooles sorowes eche wyth sorowe whan han misauenture lusten nought sechen cure men sayne wretche consolacion haue another felawe payne ought well ben opinyon bothe thou loue playne full sorowe sothe sayne certainly harde grace may syt space god woll thou art nought agast l ste wolde thy lady begyle thou wost thy selfe loue parde best gon sythen longe whyle sythen thou wost wyle sythe thou trustest moste crime somwhat sen al wo thou woste pyet troylus al thys word sayde longe lay styll deed thys wyth sykyng abrayde pandarus voyce lente hys eere vp ayen caste seere pandarus leste frenseye shulde fall el sone deye said wake ful wonderlyche sharpe slombrest thou lytargye arte thou lyke asse harpe hereth soun wha men yt stringes ply hys mynde melodye maye synke gladen dull hys bestyalite padare wordes stent troylus hym thyng answerde tel nought hys entent neuer man ferde sayd men maken ofte yerde wyth whiche maker hym selfe ybeten sondrie maner wyse treten namelyche hys counsayle tellyng toucheth loue ought ben e hym selfe woll ynough spryng yf bet gouerned eke somtyme crafte seme slee thyng whiche effecte men hunte faste gan troylus hys herte caste nathelesse wha herde cry wake gan syke wonder sore sayd frende though styll lye nam nat deefe nowe peace crye haue herde thy wordes thy lore suffre fortune bewaylen thy prouerbes may nought auaylen cure canst thou none eke nyl ben cured woll dey knowe quene niobe let thyne olde ensamples prey frende pandarus therfore sey suche delyte fooles bewepe wo seken boote ne kepe nowe knowe reson fayleth tell yf wyste misauenture ayleth durste thou tolde eere thy wo sith thou darst thy self feere besought han routhe nay god trouthe besily pandarus though myne owne lyfe lay nede parde sir thys troylus thou shuldest neuer spede woste thou well ye drede troylus al euer ye conne wol wretche wonne pandarus ala may thou dispayred arte thus causelesse lyueth nat thy lady benedicite howe wost thou thou arte gracelesse suche yuel alwaye botelesse put nat impossible thus thy cure sythe thyng come ofte auenture graunt wel thou endurest wo sharpe dothe tesiphus hel whose stomake foules tyren euer mo hyghten vulture bokes tell may endure thou dwell vnskylfull opinyon thy wo ny curacion one nyll thou thy cowarde herte thyne ire folyshe wylfulnesse wantrust tellen thy sorowes smerte ne thyne owne helpe besynesse moche speke worde ye lesse lyest lyfe nothyng retche woman coude loue suche wretche may demen thy dethe thou thus dye feare yolden vp thy brethe grekes han besieged v ywis lorde thake shalt yu haue tha thus woll sayne towne atones wretche deed ye diuel haue bone thou mayst alone wepe crye knele loue woman wote nought wol quite thou shalte nat fele vnknowe vnkyst lost vnsought many man hath loue full dere abouyt twenty wynter hys lady ne wyste neuer yet hys lady mouth kyste shuld therfore fallen dispayre recreaunt hys owne tene slayne hym selfe hys lady fayre nay nay euer one fresh grene serue loue hys dere hertes quene thynke guerdone serue thousande parte deserue worde toke hede troylus thought anone folye howe sothe hym sayde pandarus sleen self might nat wyn bothe done vnmanhode syn hys dethe hys lady nought wyte hys wo god wote knewe full lyte ye thought gan full sore syke sayd ala best pandare sayd yf lyke best thou tell thy wo haue trouth yf thou fynde thy bote full longe peces drawe sythen honge ye sayst thou troylus ala god wote naught rather full harde helpen thys caas well fynde fortune foe ne men ryde conne go may cruell whele harme withstod lyst playeth wyth fre bonde pandarus tha blamest thou fortune thou arte wroth ye nowe erst se wost thou nat well fortune comune euery maner wight degree yet thou hast thys comforte lo parde ioyes moten ouergone mote sorowes passen euerichone yf whele stynt thyng tourn cesseth fortune anone sith whele way may soiourn woste thou yf mutabylite right thy seluen lust woll nought ferre fro thyn helping parauenture thou haste cause synge therfore woste thou yu beseche let thy wo turnyng grounde lyst haue healyng hys leche hym byhoueth first vnwrie hys wounde cerberus hell aye bounde suster thy sorowe wyl shulde thyn morowe loke vp say tel anon may gon aboute thy nede know h aught loue tel wolde hope rather spede tho gan veyne troylus blede hyt woxe reed shame ha pandare begynneth game yt worde ga shake sayd thou shalte name tell tho gan sely troylus quake though men shulde han hel sayd ala wo well swete foe called crescyde wel nigh wt word feare deyde wha ye padare herde name neuen lorde glad sayd frende dere nowe fare ryght iones name heue loue hath beset wel good chere good name wysedom manere hath ynough eke gentyllesse fayre thou woste thy selfe gesse ne neuer sey bounteous estate ne gladder ne speche frendlyer ne gracious well ne lasse nede seche done thys bet eche honour farre maye stretche kynges herte semeth wretche thy loke good comforte thou certaynly fyrst poynt thys noble corage well ordayne man haue peace wyth hym selfe ywys oughtest thou nought good louen well worthy place ought clepe happe grace also thynke therwyth glad syth thy lady vertuous foloweth pyte amonges generall se thou speciall requyre nought ayen name vertue stretcheth hym selfe shame well euer borne thou beset arte good place troth loue durst haue sworne thou shuld neuer haue tyde fayre grace wost yu yu wont chace loue scorne dyspyte hem call saynt idiote lorde foles often hast thou made thy nyce iapes sayd loues seruauntes euerychone nycete ben goddes ape wolde monch meate alone lyggynge bedde make hem grone thou saydest blauche feuere praydest god shulde neuer keuere hem toke hem ye colde ynough saydest thou full ofte han fayned ofte tyme tolde howe waken slepe soft thus wold haue set hem selfe aloft nathelesse vnder last thus saydest thou apedest full fast yet saydest thou parte louers wolde speake generall thoughten syker arte faylynge assayen ouer al nowe maye iape yf shall natheles though shulde dey thou arte none tho dare well sey nowe bete thy brest say god loue thy grace lorde nowe repent yf myspake nowe selfe loue thus saye wt thyne herte good entent quod troylus ah lorde consent pray iapes thou foryeue shal neuer whyle lyue thou sayst wel padare nowe hope thou goddes wrath hast al apesed syth thou haste wepten many drope said thig wherwt thy god plesed nowe wolde neuer god yu eased thyncke wel ryst al thy wo may thy comforte ben also thylke groude yt beareth ye wedes wycke beareth eke holsome herbes ful ofte next foule nettle rough thycke rose wexeth soote smoth softe next valey y hyll lofte next derke nyght glad morowe also ioye next fyne sorowe nowe loke attempre thy brydelle best aye suffre tyde el labour ydell hasteth well wysely abyde dyligent trewe aye well hyd lusty free perseuer thy seruyse well yf thou werke thys wyse departed euery place hole writen clerkes wyse wonder suche one haue grace eke wost thou fareth seruyse plante tre herbe sondrie wyse morowe pull vp blyue wonder though may neuer thriue syth ye god loue hath bestowed place digne vnto thy worthynesse stonde fast good porte hast yu rowed thy selfe heuenesse hope alwaye well yf drerynesse ouerhast labour shende hope thys maken good ende wost yu lasse afered thys mater wyth nece trete thys haue herde saye wyse lered neuer man woman yet beyete vnapte suffre loues hete celestiall el loue kynde grace hope fynde speake speciall beauty bethynken youth syt nought ben celestiall yet though lyst kouth truely syt well ryght nouth worthy knyght louen cheryce holde vyce wherfore woll ben aye redy payne thys seruyce please thys hope ye ben wyse conne counsayle kepe suche wyse man shall wyser maye ben gladed thre trouth haue ryght nowe good conceyt wytte gesse woll nowe thou se thynke syth loue hys goodnesse hath conuerted wyckednesse thou shalt ben best post leue hys laye moste hys foe greue ensample se great clerkes erren aldermost ayen lawe ben conuerted wycked werkes grace god yt lest hem wtdraw arne folke yt han god awe strengest faythed ben vnderstande conne errour alderbest wythstonde whe troylus herde pandare assented ben hys helpe louynge creseyde wext hys wo sayeth vnturmeted hotter wext hys loue sayd wyth sobre chere though hys hert playde nowe blysful venus helpe er sterue ye pandare mowe thake deserue dere frende howe shal wo lesse tyll thys done good eke tel thys wylt thou sayne dystrese lest wrothe thys drede ywys woll heren howe thys drede eke manere eme nyll suche thynge quod pandarus yu hast full great care lest chorle maye fall moone lorde hate nyce fare entremete thou hast doone goddes loue bydde boone let alone shalbe thy beste frende done ryght ye leste herke pandare worde nolde thou wendest great foly lady desyren shulde toucheth harme vylany dredlesse leuer dye ought el vnderstood myght sownen good tho lough padarus anon answerde thy borow fye wyght doth raught though stode herde howe yt thou sayest fare well woll go dieu glad god spede v two yeue thys labour thys busynesse spede thyne swetnesse tho troylus gan downe knee fal pandare hys armes hente faste sayd nowe fye grekes yet parde god shall helpen laste dredlesse yf lyfe maye laste god forne lo hem shall smerte yet athinketh yt auaut masterte nowe pandare say thou wyse thou wost thou mayst yu art lyfe death hole thyne hode lay help yes trouth shal god yelde frende thys specyall quod troylus thou recomaunde maye death comaunde pthys pandarus tho desyrous serue hys full frende sayd thys manere farewell thynke wol yt thake deserue haue trouth thou shalt went way thynking matere best might besechen grace fynde tyme therto place euery wight hath house foude renneth worke begynne wyth rakel hande woll byde stoode sende hys hertes lyne fro wythin alderfyrst hys purpose wynne thys pandare hys herte thought cast werke ful wisely er wrought troylus lay tho lenger downe anone vpon hys stede baye felde played lyoun wo ye greke yt wyth hym met daye towne maner tho forth aye goodly gat hym grace eche hym loued loked hys face bycame frendlyest wyght gentylest eke moste fre thryftyest one best knyght hys tyme myght deed hys iapes hys cruelte hys hygh porte hys maner straunge eche hem gan vertue chaunge nowe let v stynte troylus stounde fareth lyke man hurte sore somedele akynge hys wounde ylessed well healed dele easy pacient lore abyte hym goeth aboute hys cure thus dryueth forth hys auenture pexplicit liber primus ovt black wawes sayle wynde weder gynneth clere thys see bote hath suche trauayle connynge vnneth stere thys see clepe tempestous matere dyspayre troylus nowe hope kalendes begyn lady myne called arte cleo thou spede fro thys forth muse ryme well thys boke tyll haue nedeth none arte vse euery louer excuse sentement thys endyte latyn tonge wryte wherfore nyl haue neither thake ne blame thys worke pray mekely dysblameth yf worde lame myne auctour sayd say eke though spake loue vnfelyngly wonder thynge newe blynde man iugen well hewis knowe yt forme speche chaunge wythin thousande yere wordes tho hadde pryse woder nyce strage thynketh hem yet spake hem spedde well loue men nowe eke wynnen loue sondrye age sondrye londes sondrye ben vsages thy yf happe wyse louer thys place herkeneth story woll deuyse howe troylus came hys ladyes grace thynketh nolde loue purchace wondreth hys speche hys doynge wondrynge euery wight rome went halte path ne alwaye manere eke lande gamen shent yf men farde loue men done thus open doynge chere vysityng forme sayd sawes thy sayne ech coutre hath lawes eke scarsely ben thys place thre haue loue sayd lyke done thys purpose thys maye lyken ryght nought yet done shall eke graue tre stone wall betyde syth haue begonne myne authour shal folowe konne pexplicit prohemium may mother monthes glade freshe floures blewe whyte rede ben quycke ayen wynter deed made full baume fletynge euery mede whe phebus doth bryght beames sprede ryght whyte bole betydde shal synge mayes daye thrydde pandarus hys wyse speche felte eke hys parte loues shottes kene coude neuer wel louyng preche made hys hewe daye full ofte grene shope hym fyll daye tene loue whych wo bedde wente made er daye full many wente swalowe proigne sorowful lay whe morow come gan make waimeting forshapen euery lay pandare bedde halfe slomberyng tyl nygh hym made waymetyng howe thereus gan forth suster take wyth noyse gan wake call dresse hym vp ryse remebrynge hym hys arande done troylus eke hys great empryse cast knewe good plyte ye mone done voyage toke hys way full sone vnto hys neces paleys besyde nowe ianus god entre thou hym gyde come vnto hys neces place lady folke quod tolde forth gan pace founde two ladyes syt wythin paued parlour thre herden mayden hem reden geste siege thebe whyle hem leste quod pandarus madame god se wyth boke companye eygh vncle myne welcome ywys quod vp rose honde hye toke hym faste sayd thys nyght thrye good mote turne mette wt word bech set yea nece ye shul faren well bet yf god woll thys yere quod pandarus sory haue let herken boke ye praysen thus goddes loue sayeth tel v loue good ye lere vncle maystresse wyth yu gonnen laugh tho seyde thys romaunce thebe rede haue herd ye kyng layus deyde edippus hys sonne al deede stynten letter reede howe byshop boke tell amphiorax fyl grounde hell quod padarus al thys knowe selue thassiege thebe care herof ben maked bokes twelue let thys tell howe ye fare way barbe shewe face bare way boke ryse vp let v daunce let v done may obseruaunce eygh god forbyd ye mad wydowes lyfe god saue god ye maken ryght sore adrad ye ben wylde semeth ye raue sate well bet aye caue byde rede holy sayntes lyues let maydens gone dauce yonge wyues euer thryue quod thys pandarus yet coulde tell thynge done playe nowe vncle dere quod tell v goddes loue thassiege aweye grekes ferde deye nay nay euer mote thryue thynge well bet suche lyue yea holy god thynge bet suche fyue eygh nay ywys al thys worlde ne reden shulde ben iape trowe seluen tell v wyt arede leene helpe god ye meene borowe ne neuer shall thing told mote thryue vncle myne god woll tell blyue prouder woman none lyue ye wyste al towne troye iape euer haue ioye tho gan wondren thousande folde downe eyen caste neuer syth tyme bore knowen thynge desyred faste wyth syke sayd hym laste nowe vncle myne nyll dysplese asken may dysese thys wyth many wordes glade frendly tale wyth mery chere thys speake gonnen wade many vnkouth glad depe matere frendes done bethe yfere tyll gan asken hym howe hector ferde townes wall grekes yerde ful wel thanke god sayd pandarus saue hys arme hath lytel wounde eke hys freshe brother troylus wyse worthy hector seconde whome euery vertue lyst habounde trouth gentylnesse wysedome honoure fredom worthynesse good fayth eme lyketh faren well god saue hem two truelych holde great deynte kynges sonne armes well good condicions therto great power morall vertue selde ysene one persone yfere good fayth soth pandarus trouth ye kinge hath sonnes twey meane hector troylus certaynly though shulde dey ben voyde vyces dare sey men lyuen vnder sonne might wide yknow cone hector nedeth nomore tell worlde ny better knight worthynes well well vertue hath myght thys knoweth many wise worthy kniyt pryse troylus sey god helpe knowe suche twey god hector soth troylus thynge trowe dredelesse men telleth doth armes daye daye worthely beareth hym home gentilly euery wyght pryse hath hem leuest praysed ye say ryght soth ywys pandarus yesterday wyth hym ben myght haue wondred vpon troylus neuer yet thycke swarme ne flewe grekes fro hym gan fleen feld euery wyghtes eere crye troylus hunted hem fast na grekes blode troylus nowe hem hurte hym al downe cast aye went arayed thus dethe shelde lyfe v yt day durst none wtstode whyle yt helde hys blody swerde honde vherto frendlyest man great estate euer sawe lyue hym lyst best felowshyp ran suche hym thynketh able thryue wyth ye worde tho pandarus blyue toke hys leaue sayd woll gon hen nay blame haue vncle ayleth thus wery soone namelyche woman woll ye naye sytteth downe god haue done wyth speake wysedome er ye go euery wyght hem tho herde gan ferre awaye stonde whyle two al hem lyst hode yt tale al brought ende estate gouernaunce quod pandarus tyme yt wende yet say aryseth let v daunce cast wydowes habyt mischauce lyst thus selfe dysfygure syth tydde glad aduenture well bethought loue god shall weten ye meane thys thys thyng asketh leyser tho eke wolde moche greue ywys yf tolde ye toke amys yet bet tonge holde styll saye soth yt ayenst wyll nece goddesse mynerue iupiter maketh thoder rynge blysfull venus serue ye ben woman thys worlde lyuynge wythouten paramour wetynge best loue lothest greue ye weten well selfe leue iwys myne vncle quod graut mercy frendshyp haue founden euer yet man holden truely moche haue lytell quyt wyth grace god emforth wyt gylte shall neuer offende yf haue er thys woll amende loue god beseche ye loue moste tryste let fremed maner speche saye nece ye lyste wyth yt worde vncle anone kyst sayd gladly leue nece dere take good shall saye wyth gan eyen downe cast pandarus cough gan lyte sayd nece alwaye lo laste howe men hem delyte wyth subtel arte tale tendyte yet entencioun tale conclusioun syth thende euery tale strength thys mater behouely shulde paynt drawen length ben frende faythfully word gan ryght inwardly beholden loken face sayd suche myrrour good grace thought thus yf tale endyte aught harde make processe whyle shall sauour haue therin lyte trowe wolde wyll begyle tendre wyttes wenen wyle playnlych vnderstode thy wyt seruen woll fonde loked besy wyse ware behelde ah lorde fast ye auyse sawe ye neuer er say ye yes yes bet woll er go trouth thought nowe yf ye fortunate nowe men shall se euery wyght goodly auenture somtyme shape yf receyuen yf nyll take cure cometh wilfully weyuen lo neyther case fortune hym deceyuen ryght hys owne slouth wretchydnesse wyght blame gesse good auenture belle nece haue ye full lyghtly founden ye conne take loue god eke catche anone lest auenture flake shulde lenger processe make yeue hode world none yf lyst wyght well begone syth speake good ententioun haue tolde well beforne loue well honour renoun creature worlde yborne othes haue sworne ye wroth therfore wene lye ne shall neuer sene efte wyth eye beth agast ne quaketh wherto ne chaungeth feare hewe hardely worst thys though tale newe yet trust alwaye ye shall fynde trewe thynge yt thought vnsyttyng wolde suche tale bryng nowe good eme goddes loue pray quod come tell agast ye woll say eke longeth wete ywys whether well amys say let thys feare dwell woll done nowe herkeneth shal tel nowe nece myne kynges dere sonne good wyse worthy freshe free whych alwaye done wel wonne noble troylus loueth ye helpe woll hys barte lo shulde sey doth lyst make lyue dey yf ye let hym dye woll steruen haue trouth nece nyl lyen al shuld thys knyfe throte kerue wyth teeres burst hys eyen sayd yf ye done v dyen thus gyltlesse haue ye fyshed fayre mende ye though yt apayre ala lorde dere true man noble gentle knyght nought desyreth frendlye chere se dyen goth vpright hasteth hym al full myght ben slayne yf hys fortune assent ala god suche beautye sent yf ye cruell deth lysteth nought rech true worthy se nomore iaper wretche yf ye suche beautie may stretch make mendes cruell dede auysement good nede wo worth fayre geme vertulesse wo worth herbe also doth bote wo worth beautie routhlesse wo worth ye wyght yt trede eche vnder fote ye ben beautye crop rotte yf therwithall ne routh harme ye lyuen trouth also thynke wel gaude leuer thou wer haged shuld baude hygh men myght v yse thyne eme shame well yf shulde assent thrugh myne abet thyne honoure shent vnderstod nought requyre bynde hym behest saue ye make hym better chere ye han done er feest lyfe saued leest playnly entent god helpe neuer ment lo request nought skyll iwys ne dout reson parde none set worst ye dreden men wold wodre sene hym come gone therayenst answer anon euery wight foole kynde wol deme loue fredship mynde woll demen though se man temple gon ymages eeteth thynke eke howe wel wysely yt gouerne hym selfe yt nothinge foryeteth cometh pris thok hi getteth eke therto shal com seld force though towne helde loue frendes reigneth al toun wrye mantell euermo god wy sauacion haue sayd best good nece alway stynt wo let daunger sugred ben alyte death ye nat wyte pcreseyde yt herd hym wyse thought shal fele meneth iwis eme wolde ye deuyse rede shulde done well sayd certayne best ye hym loue ayen louyng loue loue skylfull guerdonynge thynke eke elde wasteth euery houre eche parte beautye therfore er age deuoure go loue olde woll wyght ye let prouerbe lore vnto late yware bautie whan past elde counteth daunger last kynges foole wont crye loude wha yt thinketh woma bereth hye longe mote ye loue proude tyll crowes foot growe vnder eye send myrrour prye yt ye maye se face morowe nece byd wysh nomore sorowe stynt cast downe heed began brest wepe anon sayd ala wo nere deed worlde fayth agone ala shulden straunge done whan best frende wende rate laue shulde defende ala wolde haue trusted doutlesse yf thrugh disaduenture loued eyther hym achilles hector maner creature ye nolde haue mercy ne measure alwaye repreue false worlde ala may leue ioye feest rede blysful caas mede behest paynted processe sayd ala ryght fyne lady myne pallas thou dredefull case purueye astonyed dye gan full sorowfully syke ne may bet quod pandarus god shal nomore come weke god toforne mystrusted thus se well nowe ye setten lyght v death ala wofull wretche myght yet lyue nought retche cruell god dispytous marte suries thre hell crye let neuer house departe yf ment harme vyllanye syth se lorde mote nedes dye hym shryue sey wyckedly ye done v dey syth lyketh deed neptunus god see fro forth shall neuer eten breed tyll myne owne hert bloude maye se certayne woll dye sone vp stert waye raught tyll agayne hym lappe caught creseyde ye welnygh starfe feare fearfullest wyght might herde eke care sawe sorowful ernest knight prayer sawe eke none vnryght harme eke might fall gan rewe dred wonder sore thought vnhappes fallen thycke day loue suche maner caas men ben cruell hem selfe wicke yf man slee hym selfe alaas presence nyl solace men wolde deme nat saye nedeth ful slyghly playe sorowfull sygh sayd thrye ah lorde tyd sory chaunce myne astate
