creseyde owne hert swete pexplicit liber tertius bvt lytle welaway whyle lasteth suche ioy ythonked fortune semeth trewest whan woll begyle fooles songe entune hem hent ye blet traytour comune wha wight fro whele ythrow tha laugheth maketh hym mow troylus gan bryght face away wryth toke hym none hede cast hym clene ladyes grace whele set vp diomede myn hert riyt gyueth blede pen ala wt wryte quaketh drede muste endyte creseyde troylus forsoke leste howe vnkynde mote hence forthe ben mater boke write folke mynde ala shulde euer cause fynde speke harme yf lye iwys hem selfe shulde haue vilanye ye herynes nyghtes doughters thre endlesse complayne euer payne megera alle eke tesiphonee thou cruell mar eke father quiryne ylke fourth boke helpe fyne loo loue lyfe yfere troylus fully shewed pincipit liber quartus ligging host haue sayd er grekes strog aboute troy toun byfell whan phebus shynyng vpon brest hercules lyon hector many bolde baron caste day grekes fyght wont greue might longe shorte bytwene purpose day fyghte mente day wel armed bright shene hector many worthy knight wente speare hond bygge bowes bente berde withouten lenger lette fomen felde anon hem mette longe day wt speares sharpe ygroude arowes dartes swerdes mace fell fight bringen horse man groude ax braynes quell laste shoure sothe tell folke troye hem seluen misledden ye worse night hom fledde wyche day taken anthenor maugre polymydas monesteo xantyppe sarpedon palestynor polyte eke troyan dan rupheo lasse folke phebuseo harme ye day folke troye dredden lese great parte ioye priamus yeue grekes requeste tyme truce tho gonnen trete prisoner chaungen moste leste surplus yeuen somme grete thyng anon couthe euery strete thassege towne euery fyrst came calkas eere whan calkas knew tretyse shulde hold consystorie amonge grekes sone gan thring forthe lordes olde set hym wonte done chaunged face hem bade aboue loue god done reuerence stynten noyse yeue audyence sayd thus lo lordes myne troyan knowen drede yf remembre calkas alderfyrst yaue comforte nede tolde wel howe ye shulde spede dredelesse shal stounde ben troy ybrent beaten groude forme maner wyse town shende al luste tacheue ye haue er wel herde deuyse knowe ye lordes leue grekes leue came selfe propre persone teche best done hauyng vnto treasour ne rent right regarde respecte ease thus al good lefte went wenyng lordes please losse ne dothe disease vouchsafe wisely haue ioye lese haue troye saue doughter lefte ala slepyng home whan troy stert sterne cruell father might haue harde hert ala ne brought shert sorow wol nat liue morow yf ye lordes rewe vpon sorowe bycause sawe tyme er nowe delyuer iche holden haue pee nowe neuer yf lyke may haue right soone doutlees helpe grace among al prees rewe olde caytyfe dystresse sith haue al heuynesse ye haue nowe caught fettred prison troyans ynow yf wylles chylde one maye haue redemption nowe loue god bounte one fele ala yefe hym nede prayer werne sith ye shul haue folke town yern peryll lyfe shall nat lye apollo hath tolde full faytfully haue eke founde astronomy sorte augury trewly dare wel saye tyme fast fyre slambe ye town shal sprede thus shall troy turne ashen dede certayne phebus neptunus bothe makeden walles toun ben wt folke troye alway wrothe wol bring confusyoun right despyte kyng lamedoun cause nolde payen hem hyre towne troye shall ben set fyre tellyng tale alway olde grey humble speche lokyng eke salte teeres eyen twey full faste ronnen downe eyther cheke longe gan socoure hem beseke heale hys sorowes sore gaue antenor withouten glad ynough calcas tho thyng full sone nedes leyde hem shulden tretyse go hem antenor ful ofte preyde bringen home kynge thoas creseyde whan priam safegarde sente thembassadours troy streight wet cause tolde comyng olde priam kyng full sone generall let vpon parlyment holde whiche theffecte rehercen shall thembassadours ben answerde fynal eschaunge prisoner al nede hem lyketh wel forthe procede troylus present place whan asked antenor creseyde whiche full sone chaungen gan hys face yt tho wordes well nyghe deyde nathelesse worde seyde leste men shulde affection espye wyth mannes herte gan sorowes drie full anguyshe grisly drede abode lordes wolde sey yf wolde graunt god forbede theschauge tha thouyt thiges twey first saue honour wey might best theschaunge withstonde ful faste caste howe al might stonde loue made al prest done byde rather dyen shulde go reason sayde syde withouten assent nat leste thy werke wolde thy foe sayn yt thorugh thy medling yblowe bother loue erst vnknowe whyche gan delyberen best though lordes wolde went wolde lete hem graunt hem lest tel lady fyrst ment whan sayd entent therafter wolde worken also blyue tho al worlde ayen wolde stryue hector whiche well grekes herde antenor wold haue creseyde gan wythstonde soberly answerde syrs ny prisoner seyde charge leyde parte ye may eftsones hem tel vsen woman sel noyse people vp sterte atones brymme blase strawe yset fyre fortune wolde none shulden confusyon desyre hector gost may enspyre woman thus shild done v lese dan antenor wronge waye ye chese wyse eke bolde baroun haue nede folke men may se one grettest thys towne hector lette thy fantasy kyng priam thus segge voice forgone creseyde delyuer antenore preyde iuuenall lorde trewe thy sentence lytell wenen folke yerne ne fynden desyre offence cloude errour lete hem discerue best lo ensample yerne folke desyren nowe delyueraunce antenore brought hem mischauce traytour toun troye ala quytte rathe nyce worlde lo thy discrecion creseyde whiche neuer dyd hem scathe shall nowe lenger blysse bathe antenor shal come home towne shall thus said heere howne whiche delybered parlyment antenor yelden creseyde pronounced presydent though hector nay full ofte prayde fynally wight withsayde naught muste ben sholde substaunce parlyment wolde departed parlyment echone troylus wythout wordes mo vnto chambre spedde hym faste alone yf man hys two bade fa te go bycause wolde slepen sayde hastely vpon bedde layde wynter leaues ben byrafte eche tyll tree bare ny barke brauche ylafte lythe troylus byrafte eche welfare bounden blacke barke care disposed woode wytte breyde sore sate chaungyng creseyde ryst vp euery doore shette wyndowe eke tho soroufull man vpon beddes syde downe sette full lyke deed ymage pale wan breste heaped wo began bueste worken wyse woodnesse shall deuyse right ye wylde bulle begynneth spring nowe nowe ydarted herte dethe roreth complaynyng right gan aboute chambre sterte smyting brest aye fystes smert heed wal body grounde full ofte swapte seluen confounde eyen two pyte hys herte stremeden swyfte welles twey highe sobbes sorowes smerte speche refte vnnethes myght sey dethe ala nylte thou dey acursed daye whiche nature shope ben lyues creature whan fury rage whiche hert twysle fast threst length tyme somwhat gan aswage vpon bedde layde downe rest tho begon teares brest wonder body maye suffyse halfe wo deuyse sayd thus fortune ala ye whyle haue done haue agylte howe myghtest thou routhe begyle grace shal thus spylt shal thus creseyde awaye yt thou wylte ala mightest thou thyn herte fynde ben thus cruell vnkynde haue nat honoured lyue thou wel worest aboue goddes wylte thou fro ioye thus depriue troylus may men nowe call wretche wretch honour fall mysery wol bewayle creseyde ala tyll brethe fayle ala fortune yf lyfe ioye displeased vnto thy foule enuye ne haddest thou father king troy berafte lyfe done brethern dye slayne selfe yt thus complayne crye combre worlde may nothyng serue euer dye neuer fully sterue creseyde alone lafte naught raught whyder thou woldest stere ala tha hast thou byraft euermore lo thy manere reue wight moste dere preue thy gierful vyolence thus loste helpeth defence lorde loue god ala knowest best myn hert al thouyt shal sorouful lyfe done caas forgo dere haue bought sen ye creseyde haue fully brought grace hertes sealed howe may ye suffre ala repealed may done shal whyle may dure lyue turment cruel payne infortune disauenture alone borne woll complayne ne neuer wol sene shyne rayne ende wol edippe derknesse sorouful lyfe dyen distresse wery goste errest fro nylt thou styen wofullest body euer might grounde go soule lurkyng thys woful neste flye forthout myn herte breste folowe alway creseyde thy lady dere thy right place nowe lenger wofull eyen two sen disporte al sene creseydes eyen bright shal ye done discomforte stonde naught wepen syght sen queynt yt wot light veyne forth haue eyen twey formed sen vertue awey creseyde lady souerayne wofull soule thus cryeth shal nowe yeuen comforte thy payne ala wight whan myne herte dyeth spyrite whiche vnto hyeth receyue gree shall aye serue thy force though body sterue ye louers hygh vpon whele ben sette fortune good auenture god lene ye fynden aye loue stele longe mote lyfe ioye endure whan ye comen sepulture remembreth felowe resteth loued eke though vnworthy olde vnholsome mislyued man calkas meane ala eyled ben greke sen thou art borne troyan calcas whiche wolte bane cursed tyme waste thou borne wolde blysful ioue ioye wolde troye thousande syghes hotter glede brest eche went medled playnte newe wo fede whiche woful teeres neuer slente shortly hys sorowes hym rente woxe mate ioye penaunce feleth none lyeth traunce pandare whiche parlyment herde euery lorde burgeys seyde howe full graunted one assent antenor yelden creyseyde gan wel nigh wode wyt breyde wo nyste mente race troylus wente certayne knight tyme kepte chambre doore vndyd hym anon pandare full tenderly wepte derke chambre styll stone towarde bedde gan softely gone confuse nyste say wo wytte nyghe away chere lokyng al torne sorowe armes folden stode woful troylus beforne hys pytous face gan beholden ofte gan hys herte colden seyng frende wo whose heuynesse herte slough thought distresse woful wight troylus felte frende pandare ycomen se gan snowe ayenst sonne melte whiche woful pandare pyte gan wepe tenderly spechelesse thus ben ylke twey neyther might sorowe worde sey laste wofull troylus nygh deed smert gan bresten rore forouful noyse sayd thus amonges sobbes syghes sore lo pandare deed withouten haste thou nat herde parlyment seyde antenor howe loste creseyde pandare ful deed pale hewe ful pitously answerde sayd yes wysely false trewe haue herde wote al howe mercy god wolde haue trowed thys wold haue wede yt lytell throwe fortune ioye wolde haue ouerthrowe worlde creature dome euer sawe ruyne strauger tha case aueture may al eschue al deuyne suche worlde thy thus defyne ne trust wight fynde fortune aye propretie yeftes ben comune tel thou art mad sorowe thus lyest thou wyse sen thy desyre al holly haste thou right ought ynough suffyse neuer felte seruyce frendly chere lokyng eye let thus wepe waylen tyl dye ouer al thou wel wost thy selue towne full ladyes al aboute dome fayrer suche twelue euer shall fynde route yea one twey withouten doute thy glad myn owne dere brother loste shall recouer god forbyd alway yt eche plesaunce thyng non wight one synge another well daunce goodly glad light fayre good aright eche vertue holden dere bothe heroner faucon ryuere eke writ zansis ful wyse newe loue chaseth ofte olde vpon newe case lythe newe auyse thynke eke thy selfe sauen art thou holde suche fyre processe shall kynde colde sen casuell plesaunce case shall put remembraunce also sure day cometh nyght newe loue labour wo el selde seynge wight done olde affection al ouer go thy parte thou shalte haue one tho abredge thy bytter paynes smerte absence shal driue herte wordes sayd none helpe frende leste sorow deyde doutlesse wo fall raught vnthrift seyde troylus nygh sorowe deyde toke lytel hede al euer mente one eere herde went laste answerde said frende lechcrafte healed thus wel syttyng yf fende trayen wight trewe vnto pray god let counsayle neuer ythe rather sterue anon right er thus done thou woldest lere serue ywis thou seye myn herte enhabyt right shall haue holly tyll deye pandarus sen haue trouth hight wol nat ben vntrewe wight man woll aye lyue sterue neuer none creature serue ther thou sayest yu shalt fayre fynde let make comparyson creature yformed kynde leue pandare conclusyon wol nat ben thyne opinyon touchyng al thys whiche beseche hold thy pece thou sleest wt thy spech thou byddest shulde loue another freshly newe let creseyde go lythe nat power leue brother though might yet wol nat canste thou playen raket fro netle docke ye padare nowe foule fall thy wo care thou farest eke pandarus whan wight wo bygon cometh pace saith right thus thynke nat smerte thou shalt fele none thou mayste fyrst transmewe stone reue passyons thou lightly wo fall dethe may wel brest departe lyfe longe may sorowe myne fro soule shall creseydes darte neuermore proserpyne whan deed wol wonne pyne woll eternally complayne wo twynned twayne thou hast made argumet forfyne howe shulde lasse payne creseyde forgon myne lyued ase felycite gabbest thou saydest vnto worse fro wele ythrowe erst none wele knowe tel sen yt thinketh light chaungen loue aye fro haste thou nat done besily thy might chaungen dothe al thy wo nylte thou let fro thyne herte go nylte thou loue another lady swete may thyne herte setten quyete thou haste loue aye yet mischauce canste nat thyne herte dryue lyued lust plesaunce moche creature lyue howe shulde foryet blyue hast thou ben hyd long mewe canste wel formelyche argewe nay godwote naught worth al thy rede whiche euer may befall withouten wordes mo wol ben deed dethe ender arte sorowes come nowe sen ofte call sely dethe sothe sayne ofte ycleped cometh endeth payne wel wote whyle lyfe quiete er thou slewe wolde haue yeuen hyre nowe thy commyng swete worlde nothyng desyre dethe sen thys sorowe fyre thou eyther anon teeres drenche thy colde stroke myne herte quenche sen thou sleest fele sondrie wyse ayenst wyl vnprayed day nyght request thys seruyce delyuer nowe world doste thou right wofullest wight euer tyme sterue s world right nauyt serue troylus teeres gan distyll lycoure allambyke ful faste pandarus gan holde tonge styll grounde hys eyen downe caste nathelesse thus thought laste parde rather felawe dey yet shal somwhat vnto sey said frende sen thou hast distresse sen lyst myne argumentes blame nylt thy seluen helpe redresse thy manhode letten thys game go rauish ne canst thou nat shame eyther let towne fare holde styll leaue thy nyce fare arte thou troye haste non hardymet take wight whiche loueth wolde seluen ben thyne assent nowe nat thys nyce vanyte ryse vp anon let wepyng sythe thou arte man hour woll ben deed shall ben answerde hym troylus ful softe sayd iwys leue brother dere al haue selfe yet thought full ofte thyng thou deuysest thing laft yu shalt wel whan thou haste yeuen audyence therafter mayst thou tell thy sentence first syn yu wost toun hath al werre rauyshyng woman might shulde nat ben suffred erre stonte nowe ne done great vnright shulde haue also blame euery wight father graunt yf withstode sen chaunged townes gode haue eke thought assent aske father hys grace thynke thys accusement sen well wote may purchace sen father hygh place parlyment hath eschaunge ensealed nyll hys lettre repealed yet drede moste herte perturbe wyth violence yf suche game yf wolde openly dysturbe muste dysclaundre name leuer dye defame nolde god shulde haue honour leuer lyfe saue thus loste aught se certayne knyght muste honour leuer haue euery case louer ought ryght thus desyre reason twyght desyre dystourben redeth reason nyll myne herte dredeth thus wepynge could neuer cease sayd ala shall wretch fare well fele alwaye loue encrease hope lasse lasse pandare encreasen eke cause care welawaye nyll myne herte breste loue lytell reste pandare answerd frende thou mayst done lyst hote thyne estate shulde go wyth tho al towne cryed thys thynge note nolde set al noyse grote whe haue cryed woll ronne eke woder last ix dayes neuer tonne deuyne reason aye depe ne curtesly helpe thy selfe anone bet thy seluen wepe namely sen ye two ben one ryse vp myne heed shall gone rather blame lytell yfounde sterue gnat withoute woude shame vnto ne vyce wyth holden ye loueth moste parauenture myght holde nyce letten go thus vnto grekes hoste thinke eke fortune wel thy seluen woste helpeth hardy man vnto hys empryse weyueth wretch cowardyse though thy lady wolde alyte greue thou shalt thy selfe thy peace herafter make certayne leue wolde nowe yuell take shulde feare thyne herte quake thynke howe paris hath yt thy brother loue shalt thou haue another troylus thynge dare swere yf creseyde whych thy lefe nowe loueth well thou doste god helpe nyll take grefe though yu boote anone myschefe yf wylneth fro passe false loue well lasse thy take hert thynke ryght knight loue broken aldaye euery lawe kyth somwhat thy corage thy myght haue mercy thy selfe awe let wretched wo thyne hert gnawe manly set worlde syxe seuen yf thou dye marter go heuen wol selfe ben wyth thys dede though kyn vpon stounde shulde strete dogges lyggen deede gyrte wyth many bloody woude euery case woll frende founde yf lysteth steruen wretche adieu deuell spede hym retche thys troylus gan wt tho wordes quicken sayd frende graunt mercy assent certaynly thou mayst prycken ne payne none ne may turment case myne entent short wordes though dyen sholde rauyshen yf selfe wolde meane padarus al day tel hast thou well assayde sorowest thus answerde nay wherof arte thou padare dysmayde nost woll ben euel apayde rauyshe sen thou hast ben yf ioue tolde thyne eere thy ryse vp nought ne anone washe thy face ye kynge thou wede may wondren whyther thou art gone thou must wt wysedome hym blede vpon case may sende thou beware shortly brother dere glad let werke thys matere shall shape sekerly thou shalt night sotime maner come speken wyth thy lady priuely wordes eke chere thou shalt full sone aperceyue wel entent thys case beste fare nowe wel poynt reste swyfte fame whych yt false thinges equall reporteth lyke thynges trewe throughout troy isled wt prestwinges fro man man made hys tale al newe calcas doughter bright hew parlyment wythout wordes graunted chaunge antenore whych tale anone ryght creseyde herde whych yt father rought thys case right nauyt ne whe deyd ful busely iupiter besought yeue hem myschauce yt thys tretys brought shortly leste tale soth durste wyght asken fere herte al mynde troylus yset wonder faste al world ne miyt loue vnbynd ne troylus herte caste wold hys whyle yt lyfe may last thus brenneth loue drede nyst best rede men sene towne aboute woman vsen frendes visyte creseyde woman came route pitous ioye wenden delyte wyth tale dere ynough myte woman whych cyte dwell set hem downe sayd shall tell quod fyrst one glad trewly bycause shall father se another sayd ywys lytle hath wyth v quod tho thyrd hope ywys shall bryngen v peace euery syde whe goeth almyghty god gyde tho wordes tho womannyshe thynges herd ryght though thece god wote hert thynge although body sat amonge hem aduertence alwaye el troylus full faste soule sought wythoute worde hym alway thought woman thus wende plese naught gonne tale spende suche vanite ne done none ese thys meane whyle brende passyon wende felte almoste herte dye fo wo wery companye whych myght lenger restrayne teryes gan vp well gaue sygnes bytter payne whych spirite must dwell remebrynge fro heuen vnto whych hell fallen sen forgo syght troylus sorowfully syght thylke fooles syttynge aboute wende wepte syghed sore bycause shulde route departen neuer playe wyth hem knowen yore se wepe thought kyndnesse eche hem wepte eke dystresse besely gonnen comforten one thig god wot lytel thouyt wyth tale wenden dysporten glad oft besought ease therwith wrought ryght man eased fele ache heed clawen hym hys hele thys nyce vanyte toke leue home wente creseyde full sorowfull pyte chambre vp wente hall bedde gan deed fall purpose neuer thence ryse thus wrought shal deuyse ownded heer yt sonnyshe hewe rent eke fyngers longe smale wronge ful ofte bad god rewe wyth death bote bale hewe whylom bright tho pale bare wytnesse wo constraynte thus spake sobbyng coplaynt palas quod thys regioun wofull wretch infortuned wyght borne cursed constellatioun mote gone thus departen fro knyght wo worth ala ylke dayes lyght sawe fyrst wt eyen twayne causeth hym thys payne therwyth teeres eyen two downe fell shoure apryll swythe whyte brest bette wo death cryed thousande syth sen wonte wo lyth mote forgone whych dysauenture helde selfe forloft creature sayd howe shall done also howe shuld lyue yf yt twynne dere herte eke loue shall ye sorowe slene ye ben inne calkas father thyne thys synne mother myne cleaped argyue wo worth yt daye thou bare lyue fyne shuld lyue sorowen thus howe shuld fyshe wythouten water dure creseyde worth troylus howe shulde plante lyues creature lyue wythouten hys kynde noriture whych full ofte worde sey rotelesse mote grene sone dey shal thus sen neither sword ne darte dare none handle cruelte ylke daye fro departe yf sorowe nyl bane shall meate ne drynke come tyll soule brest vnshethe thus seluen woll done dethe troylus clothes euerychone shul blacke ben tokenynge herte swete thys worlde agone wonte set quyete myne ordre aye tyll death mete obseruaunce euer absence shal sorowe ben complaynt abstynence myne herte eke wofull gost therin byqueth wyth spirite complayne eternally shall neuer twyn though erth twynned twayne yet felde pyte payne hyght elysos shall ben yfere orpheus erudice hys fere thus herte myne antenor ala sone shalbe chaunged wene howe shull ye done thys sorowful ca howe shall tendre herte thys sustene herte myne foryet thys sorowe tene also sothly sey ye welfare retche dey howe myght euer redde ben ysonge playnt made dystresse lytell tonge yf dyscryuen wolde heuynesse shulde make sorowe seme lesse chyldyshly deface hye complaynt therfore pace pandare whych sent troylus vnto creseyde ye haue herde deuyse best acorded thus full glad done hym seruyse vnto creseyde full secrete wyse lay turment rage came tell al holy hys massage fonde seluen gan trete full petously wyth salte teeres brest face ybathed full wete myghty tress sonnysh heeres vnbroyden hangen aboute eeres whych yaue hym sygne matere death whych herte gan desyre hym sawe gan sorowe anon tery face atwyxte armes hyde whych thys pandare wo bygon house myght vnneth abyde felte sorowe euery syde yf creseyde erst complayned sore tho gan playne thousand tymes aspre playnte thus seyde pandare fyrst ioyes mo two causynge vnto creseyde nowe transmued ben cruell wo whether shall saye welcome alderfyrst brought vnto seruyse loue ala endeth suche wyse endeth loue wo ye men lyeth worldly blysse thynketh ende blysse aye sorowe occupyeth troweth let hym vpon wofull wretch se selfe hate aye byrth curse felynge alwaye fro wycke go worse seeth seeth sorowe al atonis payne turment playnte wo dystresse wofull body harme none langour anguyshe cruell bytternesse annoye smerte drede furye eke sycknesse trowe ywys heuen teeres rayne pyte aspre cruell payne thou syster full dyscomforte quod padarus thinkest thou ne hast thou thy seluen resport wylt thou thus ala thy selfe fordo leaue al thys werke take nowe hede shall sayne herken good entent message yt troylus sente turned tho creseyde wo makynge great death se ala wordes maye ye brynge woll dere herte sayne whych drede neuer se woll haue playnte teeres er wende haue ynough yf therafter sende ryght sene visage wyght men bere bynde face lyke paradys ymage ychaunged another kynde play ye laughter wont fynd eke ioyes euerychone ben fledde thus lyeth creseyde alone aboute eyen two purpre rynge bytrent sothfast tokenynge payne beholde deedly thynge whych pandare myght restrayne teeres hys eyen rayne nathelesse best myght seyde troylus wordes creseyde lo nece trowe ye han herde al howe kynge wyth lordes beste hath made eschaunge antenor cause thys sorowe thys vnrest howe thys case doth troylus moleste thys may none earthly mannes tonge say wo hys wytte away whych haue sorowed lytell v slawe counsayle thys daye fynaly somwhat fro wepynge wythdrawe semeth desyreth fawe wyth ben nyght deuyse remedye thys yf wyse shorte playne theffect message ferforth wytte comprehende ye ben turment suche rage may longe prologe nowe entende hervpon ye maye answere hym sende loue god nece dere leaue thys wo troylus great wo syghed sore feleth deedly sharpe dystresse yet hys sorowe mokell loue hym bet hym selfe gesse ala hath heuynesse pytously complayne iwys thys sorowe doubleth al payne greuous god wot twynne quod yet harder sene sorowe whych inne well wote wol bane dye wol certayne tho quod byd hi come er deth yt thus threteth driue yt gost whych myne hert beteth wordes sayd armes two fyll gruffe gan wepen pytously quod pandarus ala ye sen ye well wote tyme fast shall come aryse vp hastely bewopen thus ne fynde ye wol haue wode minde wyst ye farde thys manere wolde hym selfe flee yf wende haue thys fare shulde come good priam maye dyspende fyne wolde anone pretende knowe well thy yet sey leaue sorowe plainly wol dey shapeth hys sorowe abredge encrease lefe nece swete beth rather hym cause plat edge wt wysedom ye hys sorowes bete helpeth wepen full strete though ye salte teeres dreynte bet tyme cure aye pleynte meane thus whe hym hether brynge sen ye wyse one assent shapeth howe distourbe goynge come ayen sone ye went woman ben wyse short auysement let sene howe wyt shall auayle may helpe shal fayle go quod creseyde vncle truely shall done myght restrayne wepynge hys syght besely hym glad shall done payne herte seken euery vayne yf thys sore maye ben founden salue shall lacke certayne myne halue goth pandarus troylus sought tyll temple founde hym al alone hys lyfe lenger rought pytouse goddes euerychone full tendrely prayed made hys mone done hym sone thys world pace wel thought ther non grace shortly soth seye fallen dyspayre day vtterly shope deye ryght thus hys argument alway sayd na lorne welaway cometh cometh necessite thus lorne destyne certaynly thys wote well sayd forsyght diuyne purueyaunce sene alwaye forgone creseyde sen god seeth euery thing doutauce hem dysposeth hys ordynauce hys merytes sothly shull comen predestyne nathelesse ala shall leue ben great clerkes many one destynie argumentes preue sayne nedely none free choyce yeuen v euerychone welawaye slygh arne clerkes olde whose opinion maye holde men sayne ye god seeth al byforne ne god maye dysceyued ben parde tha mote fallen though sworne purueiaunce hath sene beforne wherfore saye eterne yf hath wyst beforn thouyt eke dede haue fre choyce clerkes rede thought dede also myght neuer ben suche purueyaunce whych maye ben dysceyued neuer mo hath feled byforne wythouten ignoraunce yf myght ben variaunce wrythen fro goddes purueynge nere prescience thynge comynge rather opinion vncertayne stedfast foreseyng certes abusyon god shuld haue parfite clere weting men yt haue doutous wening errour vpon god gesse false foule wycked cursednesse eke thys opinion haue top ful hygh smoth yshore sayn right thus yt thing come prescience hath sene shall come sayne yt therfore shall come therfore purueyaunce wote beforne wythouten ignoraunce thys maner thys necessyte returneth hys parte contrary agayne nedefully behoueth thylke thynges fallen certayne purueyed nedfully sayn behoueth thynges whych fall certayne ben puruayed meane though laboured enquyre thige cause thig whether presciece god certayne cause necessite thynges comen pardy necessite thynge comynge certayne purueyeng ne enforce shewyng ye ordre ye cause stat wel wote behoueth befallyng thynges wyst certaynly necessary seme therby prescience put fallynge necessayre thynge come fall foule fayre yf syt man yonde see necessite behoueth certes thyne opinion soth wenest coniectest syt ouer nowe ayenwarde yet lo ryght parte contrarye thus nowe herken woll tarye saye yf opinion soth syt saye thys mote sytten necessyte thus necessyte eyther hym nede syttynge ywys nede soth thus forsoth mote necessite ben thou mayst sayne ye syt therfore thyne opinion hys syttynge soth rather man sat therfore thyne opinion soth ywys saye though cause soth thys cometh hys syttynge yet necessite entrechaunged hem thus wyse dontaunce maye well maken semeth reasonynge goddes purueyaunce thynges comen whych reason men may well yse thylke thynges erth fall necessite comen al though forthing shal come ywys therfore purueyd certaynly cometh purueyed yet nathelesse behoueth nedefully thynge come purueyed truely el thinges purueyed betyden necessyte suffyseth ryght ynough certayne destroye free choyce euerydel nowe thys abusyon sayne fallynge thynges temporel cause goddes prescience eternell nowe truely false sentence thing come shuld cause presciece might wene thought god purueyeth thynge yt come come el nought might wene thinges al whylom ben byfal ouercome ben cause thylke souerayne purueyaunce forewote wythouten ignoraunce oueral thys yet say therto right whe wote thinge iwys thynge mote nedefully eke ryght wote thing comyng mote come thus befallynge thynges ben wyst tyde mowe ben eschewed syde sayd thus almyghty ioue trone wotest al thys thyng ye sothfastnesse rewe sorowe dyen sone brynge creseyde fro thys dystresse whyle thys heuynesse dysputynge wyth hym selfe thys matere came pandare sayd ye may myghty god pandarus trone eygh sawe euer wyse man faren troylus thynkest thou done hast thou suche luste ben thyne owne foe parde yet creseyde ago lyst thy selfe fordone drede thyne heed thyne eyen semen dede hast thou lyued many yere beforne wythouten farde full well atease arte thou none borne hath kynde ye wrought please let thynke ryght thus thy dysease ye dyce right falle chauces ryght loue come go plesauces yet wonder moost thou thus sorowest sith thou wust nat yet touching going yt shal fall ne yf selfe distourben thou hast nat yet assayed wyt man maye al betyme necke bede whan shall sorowen nede thy take hede shal say haue yspoke longe ybe accorded betwyxt v twey euermo thynketh thus hath somwhat hertes priuitie wherwith yf shall aryght rede disturbe al thou art drede counsayl whan night thou go make ende blysful iuno gret myght shal hope grace vnto v sende myne hert seeth certayne shal nat wend thy put thy hert whyle rest holde thy purpose best troylus answerde syghed sore thou sayest ryght wel wil ryght list sayd vnto whan tyme go full priuely hym selfe withouten mo vnto came wont done wrought shal tell sone soth whan gone first mete gan payne hertes twyst neyther hem myght grete hem armes toke kyst lasse wofull hem nyst wher yt ne might word bring sayd erst wo sobbyng wofull teares letten fal bytter teres kynde payne lignealoes gall bytter teeres wept nat fynde woful myrra ye bark rynd world ther ni hard hert nold haue rewed paine smert whan woful wery gostes twayne returned ben hem ought dwell somwhat weaken gan ye payne length playnt ebben gan wel teares hert vnswell wt broke voyce al horse shright creseyde troylus ylke wordes sayde ioue dye mercy beseche helpe troylus therwith face vpon brest layde lost speche woful spyrit propre place ryght wt worde away poynt pace thus lyth wt hewes pale grene whylom fresh fayrest sene troylus gan beholde cleping name lay deed wtouten answer felt lymmes colde eyen throwen vpwarde heed sorouful nowe non rede oft tyme colde mouth kyst wher wo god selfe wyst riseth vp long streight layd signe lyfe ought may none fynde nothing creseyde songe ful oft welaway whan sawe spechelesse laye wt soroufull voyce herte blysse bare sayd fro world yfare longe coplayned hodes wronge sayd seye wt teeres salte brest berayned gan tho teeres wypen full dreye pytously gan soule preye sayd lorde set art thy trone rewe eke shal folowe sone colde without sentement ought wot breth felt ne none thus preignant argument forth world agon wha sawe ther non gan lymmes dresse suche manere men hem yt shall ben layen bere sterne cruel herte swerde anon sheth twight self sleen howe sore smerte soule soule folowe myght ther dome mynos wold dight syth loue cruell fortune ne wolde worlde lenger lyuen shold sayd thus fulfyld high disdayn cruel ioue thou fortune aduerse al falsely haue ye slayne creseyde syth ye may werse fye myght workes dyuerse thus cowardly ye shal neuer wyn shall deth fro lady twyn world sith ye haue slayn thus wol let folowe spyrite lowe hye shall neuer louer sayne troylus dare nat feare lady dye certayne woll beare company syth ye wol nat suffre v lyuen yet suffreth soules ben yfere thou cytie lyue wo thou priam brother al yfere thou mother farewel go attropose make redy thou bere thou creseyde swete hert dere receyue spyrite wolde sey swerde herte redy deye god wolde swough abrayde gan sygh troylus cryde answerd lady myne creseyde lyue ye yet let swerde downe glyde yea hert myne thanked cupyde quod therwithal sore syght began glad myght toke armes two kyst ofte glad dyd entent goost yt flyckered aye loft woful hert ayen went last eye glent asyde anon gan sworde aspye laye bare gan feare crye asked hym drawe troylus anon cause tolde hi self therwt wold haue slawe creseyd vpon hym gan beholde gan hym armes fast folde sayde mercy god lo dede ala nygh deed yf nad spoken grace ye wolde haue slayne self anon yea doutlesse answerde ala ylke lorde made nolde forlonge way lyue haue deth haue ben trowned quene al ye londe sunne shyneth shene selue swerd yt selfe wolde haue slayne tho ho haue ryght ynough let v ryse streyght bed go let v speken wo marter se brene knowe ful well day nat ferre hen whan bed armes folde nought lyke tho niytes beforn pytously eche gan beholde hadden blysse ylorne bewaylyng aye ye day wer borne til ye last sorowful wyght creseyd troylus ylke wordes seyde lo hert myne wel wot ye quod yf wight alway wo complayne seketh nat holpen ny folye encrease payne syns yt assembled twayne fynde bote wo ben tyme soone begyn woman full well ye wot aduysed sodaynly woll tell whyle whote thynketh thus neyther ye ought halfe wo maken skylfully arte ynough redresse yet mysse sleen heuynesse soth wo ben ought wot nothyng el cause shulde twyn consydred al ny nomore amys remedy vnto shape v soone mete dere hert swete shal well bryngen come ayen sone go therof maner thyng dout dredelesse within weke two shal ben mayebe ryght wordes fewe shall well heape wayes shewe wol make longe sermon tyme ylost may recouered wol go conclusyon best ought se loue god foryeue yf speke ought ayenst hertes rest truly speke best makyng alway protestacion wordes shal saye ny shewen mocion fynde vnto helpe best waye taketh none otherwyse pray effect ye comaunde wol demaunde herkeneth ye haue wel vnderstod going graunted parlyment ferforth yt may ben withstonde worlde iudgement syth ther helpeth non aduysement letten let passe mynde let v shape better way fynde soth twynnyng v twayne wol v disease cruelly anoye behoueth somtyme haue payne serueth loue yf wol haue ioye syth shal ferther troye tha may ryde ayen halfe morowe ought lasse causen v sorowe shal ben hyd mewe day day myne owne hert dere syns well wot nowe trewe ye shall ful well myne estate er truce shal ben haue ye antenor ywon also beth glad yf ye con think right thus creseyd agon shal come hastely ayen whan ala god right anon er dayes ten dare safely sayne erst shall fayne shall togythers euer dwell world ne might blysse tel se oft tyme ben nowe best counsayl hyde ye speake fourtenyght ne se ye go ne ryde may ye nat ten dayes abyde myne honour suche auenture iwys ye mowe el lyte endure ye knowe eke howe al kyn father eke myne thynges al yfere namely dere herte ye nolde leauen se al world wide hath space el se neuer ioues face trowe ye father wyse coueyteth se drede lest towne folkes dispyse bycause vnhappy dede wote father lyfe lede wyste troye howe wel fare v neded wendyng nat care yea euery day eke men treate peace supposed men quene heleyne shal restore grekes v restore mys though nere cofort none men purposen peace euery syde ye may better ease hert abyde yf peace myne hert dere nature peace mote nedes dryue men must entercomune yfere fro eke ryde gone blyue al day thycke slyen fro hyue euery wyght haue lybertie bleue lyst bet withouten leue though ye peace ther may none yet hither though ther neuer peace ne must come whyder shulde gone mischaunce shulde dwel amonge tho men armes euer feare wysely god soule rede nat sene wherof ye shulde drede haue another way yf al thing ne may nat suffyse father ye knowen well parde olde eke ful couetyse right haue founden gyse withouten net wherwith shal hym hente herkeneth yf ye wyl assent lo troylus men sayne ful harde wolfe ful weder hole haue sayne men ful oft iwys mote spenden part ye remnaunt saue aye gold men may hert graue hym set vpon couetyse meane shal deuyse mouable yt haue toun vnto father shall take say ryght trust saluatioun sent frende tway frendes feruently praye sende hye whyle yt town stant thus ieopardy shalbe golde huge quantitie thus shal sayne lest folke espyde may sent wyght shal eke shewen hym yf peace betyde frendes haue euery syde towarde court wrath pace priamus hym stonde grace thyng swete shall enchaunten sawes right heue soul shal mete apollo clerkes lawes calculyng auayleth nat thre hawes desyre golde shall soule blende lyst shall well make ende yf wolde ought sorte preue lye certayne shal fonde distourben plucke sleue makyng sorte bearen hym honde hath nat well goddes vnderstonde goddes speke amphibology soth tellen twenty lye eke drede fonde first goddes suppose thus shall sayne coward hert made hym amysse goddes text glose whan ferde delphos stert make hym sone conuert rede within day twey woll oblege deye truly wrytten well fynde al thing sayd good entet hert true kynde towardes spake ryght ment yt starfefor wo nigh whan went purpose euer trewe thus wryten yt werkes knewe troylus hert eares sprad herde thyng deuysed two fro verily semed selue wyt yet let go hert mysyaue hym euermo fynally gan hert wrest trusten toke best great fury penaunce queynt wt hope therwt hem bytwene began ioye amorous daunce ye byrdes whan sun shene delyten songe leues grene ryght wordes spake yfere delyten hem make hem hertes clere nathelsse wendyng creseyde al world may mynd ful oft pytously preyde heest might true fynde sayd certes yf ye kynde ye come day set troye ne shal neuer haue heale honour ne ioye soth sunne vpryst morowe god wysely thou woful wretche rest bryng cruell sorowe woll seluen slee yf ye dretche deth though lytle retche yet er ye causen smert dwell rather myne owne swete herte truly myne owne lady dere sleyghtes yet yt haue herde stere full shapely ben fallen yfere thus men sayth yt one thynketh ye bere al another thynketh ledere sire wyse sayd drede men may wyse ren rede full harde halten vnespyed creple crafte father sleyght argus eyed al mouable byraft olde sleyght yet hym lafte ye shall nat blende hym womahed ne sayne aryght al drede yf peace shall euermo betyde peace ernest ne game wot syth calcas grekes syde hath one ben lost foule name dar nomore come agayne shame ought espy trusten ny fantasye ye shal eke sene father shal glose ben wyfe wel preche shal greke preyse wel alose rauyshen shal speche force shall teache troylus ye nyll haue routh shall causelesse steruen trouth ouer father shal despyse v al sayn citie lorne thassege neuer shal aryse grekes haue sworne tyl slayne walles torne thus shal wordes fere aye drede ye wol bleuen ye shall eke sene many lustye knyght amonge grekes full worthynesse eche hem hert wyt myght plesen besynesse ye shull dullen rudynesse sely troyans yf routh remorde vertue trouth greuous thynke fro brest woll soule rende ne dredlesse may synke good opinyon yf ye wende father sleyght woll v shed yf ye gone haue tolde yore think nam deed withouten humble true pitous hert thousande tymes mercy praye reweth myne aspre paynes smert doth somwhat shall say let v steale away betwyxt v tway thinke yt foly wha man maye chese accident substaunce lese meane thus syns nowe day well steale awaye ben togyther wyt putten assaye case ye shulden father go ye myghten come ayen thus meane great folly put sykernesse ieopardy vulgarly speken substaunce treasour may v lede ynough lyue honour pleasaunce tyl vnto tyme shal ben deed thus may eschewen al drede euery waye ye recorde myne hert ywys may therwith nat accorde hardely ne dredeth pouertie haue kyn frendes el though comen bare sherte v shulde neyther lacke golde ne gere ben honoured whyle dwelten go anon myne intent best yf ye woll assent creseyde sygh ryght wyse answerde ywys dere herte true maye wel steale away ye deuyse fynden suche vnthryftye wayes newe afterwarde full sore woll v rewe helpe god moost nede causelesse ye suffren drede thylke day cherysshyng drede father wyght estate delyte weddyng false troylus knyght saturnus doughter iuno migh wode achamat dwel eternally styx pyt hell ad euery god celestiall sweare eke eche goddesse euery nymphe deitie infernall satiry fauny lesse halfe goddes ben wyldernesse attrapos threde lyfe brest false trowe yf ye lest thou synoys arowe clere thrugh troy renest aye dounward ye se wytnesse worde yt sayd ylke daye vntrue troylus myne owne hert free thou returne bakwarde thy well body soule synke hell ye speke away thus go leten al frendes god forbede woman ye shulden namly syns troy hath nede helpe eke thyng taketh hede yf wist lyfe laye balaunce honour god shylde v myschaunce yf peace herafter betake daye heppeth angre game lorde ye sorowe wo ye wolden make ye ne durst come ayen shame er ye ieoparden name beth nat hasty hote fare hasty man ne wanteth neuer care trowe ye people eke al wolde say ful lyght arede wolden say swere dout loue ne draue nat dede lust voluptuous cowarde drede thus lost iwys myne hert dere honour yt shyneth clere also thynketh myne honestie floureth yet foul shuld shed fylth spotted shulde forme shoulde wende ne though lyued vnto worldes ende name shulde neuer ayenwarde wyn thus wer lost yt routh synne thy slee reason al hete men sayne suffraunt ouercometh parde eke wol haue lefe lefe mote lete thus maketh vertue necessitie pacience thynke lorde fortune aye yt nought wol retche ne dauteth wight wretche trusteth certes hert swete phebus suster lucina shene lyon passe ariete wol ben withouten wene mene helpe iuno heuens quene tenth day death assayle woll sene withouten fayle thus soth quod troylus shall well suffre vnto tenth daye syns se nedes mote thus loue god yf maye let v stelen priuely away euer one lyuen rest myne hert sayth woll best mercy god lyfe ala ye slee thus tene se well ye mystrusten wordes well ysene loue scithia shene mistrust nat thus causelesse routh si tru haue plight trouth thynketh wel sotyme wyt spende tyme tyme wyn ne parde lorne nat fro yet though ben daye two twyn driue tho fantasyes within trusteth leaueth eke sorowe trouth wyl nat lyue tyll morowe ye wyst sore doth smerte ye wold cesse god thou wost pure spyrit wepeth myne herte sene wepen yt loue moost mote gon vnto grekes host yea nere wyst remedye come ayen ryght wolde dye certes nyce wyght ne ymagynen away come ayen daye haue hyght may holden thyng yt wol awaye father nought queynt playe thrift wendyng troy daye shall turne v ioye thy myne hert beseke yf lyst done ought prayer ye loue loue eke er departe fro good comfort chere may sene ye may bring rest myne herte poynt brest ouer praye tho myne owne hertes sothfast suffysaunce syth thyne hole withouten mo whyle absent plesauce fro remembraunce euer agast men rede loue thyng aye ful besy drede thys worlde leueth lady none vntrewe god defende betrayed wo begone al trouth entende doutlesse yf iche wende deed er ye cause fynde goddes loue beth naught vnkind answered troylus seyde god ny cause ywrie glade wy neuer vnto creseyde sith thylke day saw fyrst wyth eye false ne neuer shal tyl dye shorte wordes wel ye may leue shal founde preue graut mercy good hert myn ywis blysful venus let neuer sterue er may stonde pleasaunce degre quyte wel wel deserue whyle yt god wyt wyl conserue shal done trewe haue founde aye honour ward shall rebound trusteth wel estate royal ne veyne delyte onely worthynesse werre turuay marcial ne pompe array nobley eke rychesse ne made rewe distresse moral vertue grounded vpon trouth ye cause first routh eke gentyl hert manhede ye ye thought dispyte euery thyng sowned bad rudenesse peoplyshe appetyte reason bridled deiyte made abouen euery creature yt shal may endure thys may lengthe yeres nat fordo ne remnable fortune deface iupitter myght may sorouful glad yeue v grace er nyghtes ten meten place may hert myn suffyse fareth wel time ye ryse longe yplayned ofte ykyst strayte armes folde day gan ryse troylus clad rufully lady gan beholde felte dethes care colde grace gan hym recomaunde wo holde demaud mannes heed ymaginen ne ne entendement consyder ne tonge tel cruel paynes sorouful man passen euery torment downe hel whan sawe ne might dwel soule herte rent withoute chambre went pexplicit liiiii et incipit liv aprochen gan fatall destyne ioues hathe disposytioun angrye parcas sustren thre committeth done execusioun creseyde must toun troylus shal dwel forth pyne tyl lachesis threde lenger twyne golde tressed phebus hyghe loste thrise al beames clere snowes molt zephyrus ofte ybrought ayen tender leaues grene sen sonne eccuba quene began loue first sorowe al departe shulde morowe ful redy prime diomede creseyde vnto grekes hoost leed sorowe felte hert blede nyste best reed trewly men bookes reed men wyst neuer woman haue care ne lothe towne fare thys troylus wythouten rede lore man hath ioyes eke forlore waytyng hys lady euer sothfast croppe al lust ioyes tofore troylus fare wel al thy ioye shalte thou neuer sene efte troye sothe yt whyle bade manere gan wo ful manly hyde wel vnneth sene chere yate shulde ryde certayne folke houed abyde wo begon al wolde playne hys horse vnneth sate payne ire quoke herte gnawe whan diomede horse gan dyght sayd vnto selfe thys ylke sawe ala thus foule wretchydnesse suffre nyl redresse nat bet atones dye euermore langour thus crye nyl make one ryche poore haue ynough done er go nyl brynge al troye vpon roore nyl een thys diomede also nyl rather wyth man two steale away wol endure nyl helpen myne owne cure nolde done fel dede shal sayne hym lyste spare herte alway maner drede leste creseyde rumour thys fare shulde haue ben slayn lo hys care el certayne sayd yore done withouten wordes creseyde whan redy ryde ful soroufully syghed sayd ala forth mote aught yt may betyde forth rydeth ful soroufully paas none remedye caas wat wonder though sore smerte whan forgoth owne swete herte thys troylus gyse curtesye wyth hauke hande huge route knyghtes rode dyd companye passyng al valey ferre wythout ferther wold haue rydden doute ful fayne wo hym gon sone turne must eke done ryght wyth antenor ycome grekes hoste euery wyght hym glad sayd welcome troylus al nere hys herte lyght payned hym wyth al hys ful myght hym wythholde wepyng leste antenor kyste made feste therwythal must leaue take cast eye vpon pytously nere rode hys cause make take honde al sobrely lorde gan wepen tenderly ful softe slyghly gan sey holde day dey hys courser turned aboute wyth face pale vnto diomede worde spake ne none al route sonne tydeus toke hede kouth crede crafte rayne hente troylus troye homwardes went diomede ladde bridel whan saw folke troye away thought al labour shal ben ydel may somwhat shal say worste shorte may way haue herde say eke tymes twyse twelue foole wol foryete hym selue nathlesse thys thought wel ynough certaynly nought speke loue make thought doutelesse yf haue thought gesse may ben ybrought sone away shal fynde meane shal yet wete meane thus diomede coulde gode wha gan falle forth speche aske stode disease gan eke beseche yf encreasen myght eche wyth thyng ease sholde comaund sayd done wolde trewly swore knyght yt ther na thyng wt myyt plese nolde hys payne al myyt done herte ese prayde wolde sorowe apese sayd ywys grekes haue ioye honouren well folke troy said eke thus wote thiketh straug wonder newe thacqueyntauce troyans chaug folke grece ye neuer knewe wolde neuer god yf trewe greke ye shuld amonge v al fynde troyan eke kynde bycause swore ryght nowe ben frende helply might acqueintaunce eke haue another straunger wight fro forth pray daye nyght comaudeth howe sore smerte done al may lyke vnto herte ye wold brother treat taketth nat frendshpyp dispyte though sorowes ben thinges gret nat respyte myn hert hath amend great delyte yf may harmes nat redresse ryght sory heuynesse though ye troyans wt v grekes wroth haue many day ben alway yet parde god loue soth seruen loue god lady free ye hate beth wroth wyth trewly wyght serue halfe loth wrath wolde deserue nere ben nere tent calcas sene v may wolde thys tel al myne entent thys ensealed tyl another day yeue hande shal aye god helpe yt life may endure owne abouen euery creature thus saide neuer er woma borne god myne herte wysely glade loued neuer woman beforne paramour ne neuer shal mo loue god foe al nat lady dere complayne aryght yet lere wodreth nouyt myn owne lady bryght though yt speke loue thus bliue haue herde thys many wyght hath loued thynge neuer sawe lyue eke power stryue ayenst god loue hym obey wol alway mercy prey beth worthy knyghtes place ye fayre eueryche hem al wol payne hym stonden grace myght fayre grace fal ye seruaunte wolde cal lowly ne trewly serue nyl none hem shal tyl sterne creseyde vnto purpose lyte answerde wyth sorowe oppressed effecte naught tale herde nowe worde two thought sorouful hert brast two whan gan father ferre espye wel nyghe downe horse gan sye nathlesse thonketh diomede al trauayle good chere lyst frendshyp bede accepteth good manere wol fayne lefe dere trusteth hym wold wel might sayd horse alyght father hath armes nome twety time kyst doughter swete sayd dere doughtee mine welcome sayd eke fayne wt mete stode forth muet mylde mansuete leaue wyth father dwell forth wol troylus tell troye come woful troylus sorowe abouen al sorowes smerte felon loke face dispytous tho sodaynly downe fro horse sterte paleys swolne herte chabre went nothyng toke hede ne non dare speke worde drede sorowes spared yaue issue large dethe cryde throwes frenetyke mad curseth iuno apollo eke cupide curseth bachus cere cipride byrth selfe fate eke nature saue lady euery creature bed goth weyleth turneth furye doth ixion hell wyse nygh tyl day soiourneth tho began herte alyte vnswel teeres ye gonnen vp wel pytously cryed vpon creseyde hym selfe thus spake seyde myne owne lady lefe dere white brest ben armes eyen clere yesterdaye tyme nowe may wepe alone many teere graspe aboute may place saue pylowe fynde naught embrace shal wha shal come agayne ala let go wolde god tho slayne hert myne ceseyde swete fo lady myne loue mo euer myne hert dowe se howe dye ye nyll rescowe seeth nowe ryght lode sterre sytteth ryght nowe presence comforten hertes werre gon yeue ye audience speketh ryght nowe absence ala wyght al care wel wote yuell ye fare howe shulde thus ten dayes ful endure whan fyrst nyght haue al thys tene howe shal eke sorouful creature tendernesse howe shall thys sustene suche wo pytous pale grene shal ben freshe womanly face langour er ye turne vnto thys place whan fyl slombrynges anon begyne shulde grone dreamen dredfullest thynges myght ben mete alone place horrible makyng aye hys mone meten amonges al hys enemyes handes fal therwithal hys body shulde sterte wyth sterte al sodaynly awake tremour fele herte feare hys body shulde quake therwythal shulde noyse make seme though shulde fal depe hygh alofte wolde wepe rewen hym selfe pytously wonder hys fantasye another tyme shulde myghtely comforte hym selfe sayne folye causelesse suche drede drie efte begyn aspre sorowes newe euery man might paine rewe coulde tel al fully discryue wo playnt hys langour pyne nat al men han ben lyue thou reder mayst thy selfe ful wel deuyne wo wyt defyne ydel write shulde swynke whan wyt wery thynke heuen yet sterres sene although full pale ywoxen moone whyten gan orizonte shene al eestwarde wonte doone phebus wyth hys rosy carte soone gan dresse vp fare whan troylus hath sent pandare pandare al day beforne ne might hym comen thys troylus se although hys heed sworne kyng priam alday laye nat lyberte wher gon ye morowe went troylus whan hym sent hys herte coulde wel deuyne troylus al nyght sorowe woke wolde tel hym hys pyne thys knew well ynough wythout boke chabre streyght ye way toke troylus tho sobrely grette bed ful sone gan hym sette pandarus troylus sorowe drie may longe endure trowe shal lyuen tyl morowe wolde alwayes auenture deuysen sepulture forme mouable thou dispone ryght semeth best done fyre flambe funerall body brennen shall glede feest playes palestrall vygyle pray take good hede wel offre mar stede sworde myn helme leue brother dere sheld pallas yeue shyneth clere poudre min hert ibrede shal turn pray thou take conserue vessel men clepeth vrne golde lady serue loue thus pytously sterue yeue thys plesaunce prayen kepe remembrauce wel fele maladye dreames nowe yore ago al certaynly mote nedes dye oule eke hyght ascaphylo hath shryght al nyghtes two god mercury wofull wretche soule gyde whan lyste fetche pandare answerde sayd troylus dere frende haue tolde yore folye sorowen thus causelesse wol nat trowen rede ne lore sene hym remedye let hym worchen fantasye troylus pray tel nowe thou trowe er thys wyght hath loued paramour wel thou ye god wote fro many worthy knyght hath hys ladye gone fourtenyght nat yet made haluendele fare nede maken al thys care sen day day thou mayst thy seluen se loue el hys wyfe man mote twynnen necessyte yee though loue owne lyfe yet nyl wyth selfe thus maken stryfe wel thou wost leue brother dere alway frendes may ben yfere thys folke yt sene loues wedded frendes myght betydeth ful ofte sene hem spouse bed ybedded god wote take wysely fayre softe good hope halt vp herte alofte tyme sorowe endure tyme hem hurteth time doth hem cure shuldest thou endure letten slyde tyme fonde ben gald lyght ten dayes ny longe abyde sen comen hath behyght nyl heste breken wyght drede nyl fynde way come ayen lyfe durst laye thy sweuenesse eke al fantasye dryue let hem faren mischaunce procede thy melancolye doth fele slepe al thys penaunce strawe al sweuenes signifyaunce god helpe counte hem nat abeene ther wot aright dremes meene preestes temple tellen thys dreames bene reuelations goddes al wel tel ywys bene infernales illusyons lech sayne complections proceden faste glotonye wot soth thus signyfye eke sayne impression yf wyght hath faste thinge mynde therof cometh auisions sayne bokes fynde tymes yere kynde dreme theffect goth mone leue dreame done well worth dremes aye olde wyues trewly eke augurye foules feare wemen lese liues raues qualm schriching oules trowen false foule ala ala noble creature man shulde drede ordure al myne herte beseche vnto thy selfe al thys thou foryeue ryse nowe vp withouten speche let v cast forth may best dryue time eke freshly may lyuen wha cometh yu shall right sone god helpe best thus done ryse let v speke lustye lyfe troye haue lad forth time dryue eke tyme comyng v reioye bryngen shal blysse blyue langour twyse dayes fyue shal therwyth foryete oppresse well vnneth done shal v duresse thys towne ful lordes al aboute truce lasten thys meane whyle go playen v lusty route sarpedon hence myle thus thou shalt tyme wel begyle driue forth vnto blysful morow thou se cause thy sorow nowe ryse dere brother troylus certes non honoure wepe thy bedde rouken thus trewly thyng trust thou thus lygge daye two thre folke woll wene yt thou cowardyse faynest sicke thou darst ryse troylus answerde brother dere thys knowe folke haue ysuffred paine though wepe make sorouful chere feleth harme smert euery vaine wonder though euer playne alway wepe nothyng blame sen yt haue loste ye cause al game sen fyne force mote aryse shal aryse sone euer may god myne hert sacrifyse sende v hastely tenthe daye neuer foule fayne may shal ben whan yt cometh troye cause turment ioye whyder thy rede troylus may playe v beste al thys toun god counsayle quod pandarus ryde playe v wyth king sarpedoun longe speken vp doun tyl troylus gan laste assent ryse forth sarpedon went thys sarpedon honourable euer lyue ful hye prowesse wythal myght yserued bene table deyntie al cost great rychesse fed hem day day suche noblesse sayden moost eke leest neuer er daye wyst feest worlde ther none instrument delicious wynd touch corde ferre wyght hath euer ywent tonge tell herte maye recorde feest na wel herde recorde ne ladyes eke fayre companye dauce er tho neuer ysene eye auayleth thys troylus sorowe nothyng rought ruer one hert pytous ful besily creseyde lady sought al euer hert thought thys nowe fast ymaginyng glad ywys festyng ladyes eke thys feest ben sen sawe lady wey sorowe vpon hem seen instrumentes pley hys herte hath key absent lo thys fantasye wyght shulde make melodye na houre al day nyght wha ther myght ne sayd louesom lady bryght howe haue ye faren sen ye welcome ywys myne owne lady dere welaway al na mase fortune houe entended bet glase letter eke olde tyme hym ysent wolde alone rede hundred sythe atwixte noone prime refiguryng shappe womanhede wythin hert euery worde dede passed thus droue ende fourth day sayd wol wende sayd leue brother pandarus intendest thou shal bleue tyl sarpedon woll forthe conueyen v yet fayrer toke leue goddes loue let v nowe sone eue leaue take homwarde let v turne trewly nyl thus soiourne pandare answerde comen hyther fetchen fyre rennen home agayne god helpe tellen whyther myght gone yf shall sothly sayne wyght v fayne sarpedon yf hence hye thus sodeynly holde vylanye sayden wolde bleue wyth hym weke nowe thus sodaynly fourth daye take hym leue wolde wondren truely let v holden forth purpose fermely sen ye behyghten hym abyde holde forewarde nowe let v ryde thys pandarus wyth pyne wo made hym dwell wekes ende sarpedon toke leaue tho way spedden hem wende quod troylus lorde grace sende may fynde myne home comynge creseyde comen therwyth gan synge ye haselwode thought thys pandare hym selfe full softely seyde god wote refroyden may thys hotte fare er calkas sende troylus creseyde natheles iaped thus seyde swore ywys hys hert wel behyght wold come sone euer myght vnto palays ycomen troylus downe horse alyght ye chabre way haue nomen vnto tyme gan nyght speken creseyde lady bryght thys hem leste spedde hem fro supper vnto reste morowe sone daye began clere thys troylus gan hys slepe abreyde pandarus hys owne brother dere loue god full pytously seyde go sene paleys creseyde sen yet may haue feest let v sene paleys leest therwythall hys meyne blende cause fonde towne go creseydes house gone wende lorde thys sely troylus wo hym thought sorowful hert brast two sawe dores sperred wel nyg sorowe adowne gan fall therwith whe ware gan beholde howe shet euery wyndowe place frost hym thought hys herte gan colde whych wyth chaunged deedly pale face wythouten worde forth gan pace god welde gan faste ryde wyght hys countenaunce aspyde sayd thus paleys desolate house house whylom best yhyght paleys empty dysconsolate thou lanterne whych queynt ye light paleys whylom daye yt nowe art nyght well oughtest thou fall dye sen went wont v gye paleys whylom crowne house enlumyned wyth sunne blysse rynge whych rubie fall cause wo cause haste ben blysse yet sen maye bet fayne wolde kysse thy colde doores durst thys route farwel shryne saynt therwyth cast pandarus hys eye wyth chaunged face pytous beholde myght hys tyme aryght aspye aye rode pandarus tolde hys newe sorowe eke hys ioyes olde pytously wyth deed hewe euerywight might sorow rewe fro thence forth rydeth vp downe euery thynge came remebraunce rode forth place towne whych whylom hys plesaunce lo yonder sawe myne owne lady daunce temple wyth eyen clere kaught fyrst ryght lady dere yonder haue herde full lustely dere herte laugh yonder play sawe ownes eke full blysfully yonder one gan saye nowe good swete loue well praye yonde goodly gan beholde death myne herte holde corner yonder house herde myne alderleuest lady dere womanly wyth voyce melodyouse syngen well goodly clere soule yet thynketh blysfull sowne yonder place lady fyrst toke vnto grace thought thus blysful lorde cupide processe haue memorye howe thou haste weryed euery syde men myght boke make lyke storye nede seke vyctorye sen thyne holy thy wyll ioye hast thou thyn owne folke spyl wel hast thou lord ywroke thyn yre thou myghty god dredfull greue nowe mercy lorde thou woste wel desyre thy grace moste lustes leue lyue dye woll thy beleue whych ne aske guerdon boone thou creseyde ayen sende soone dystrayne herte fast returne thou doest myne longen se wote wel nyll soiourne nowe blysfull lorde cruell thou ne vnto bloode troye praye iuno vnto bloode thebane ye folk thebe caught bane thys yates wente creseyde rode ful good paas vp downe made many wete hym selfe ful ofte sayd ala fro hence rode blysse solas wolde blysfull god nowe hys ioye myght sene ayen come troye yonder hyll gan gyde ala toke leue yonde sawe father ryde sorowe myne hert shall cleue hyther home come eue dwell cast al ioye shall tyll maye sene efte troye hym selfe ymagined ofte ben defeyted pale woxen lesse wont men sayden softe maye soth gesse troylus hath thys heuynesse thys na hys melancolye hym selfe suche fantasye another tyme ymagynen wolde euery wyght went wey hym routh sayne sholde ryght sory troylus woll dey thus droue day yet forth tweye ye haue herde suche lyfe gan lede stode bytwixen hope drede whych hym lyked hys songes shewe thencheson hys wo best myght made songe wordes fewe somwhat hys wofull herte lyght euery mane syght wyth softe voyce hys lady dere absent gan synge ye may sterre whych lost haue al light wyth herte sore well ought bewayle euer derke turment nyght nyght towarde deth wt wynde stere sayle whych tenth nyght yf fayle gydyng thy beames bryght houre shyp carybdes woll deuoure thys songe whe thus songe soone fyll ayen hys syghes olde euery nyght wont doone stode bryght moone beholde hys sorowe moone tolde sayd ywys whe thou arte horned newe shall glad yf worlde trewe sawe thyne horne old eke morowe hence rode ryght lady dere cause turment sorowe whych bryght lucina clere loue god ren fast aboute thy spere thyne horne new gynne sprynge shall come yt may blysse brynge daye lenger euery night ben wote hym thought tho sonne went hys course vnryght lenger waye wonte go sayd ywys drede euer mo sonnes sonne pheton lyue hys father carte amysse dryue vpon walles fast eke wolde walke grekes hoste wolde se hym selfe ryght thus wolde talke lo yonder myne owne lady free el yonder tentes thence cometh thys ayre soote soule fele dothe boote hardly thys wynde thus stoundemele encreaseth face ladyes depe syghes sore preue thus none space thys towne saue thys place fele winde sowneth lyke payne sayeth ala twynned twayne thys loge tyme dryueth forth ryght thus tyll fully passed nynth nyght aye besyde hym thys pandarus besyly dyd hys full myght hym comforte make hys herte lyght yeuynge hope alway ye tenth morowe shal comen stynten al sorowe vpon syde eke creseyde wyth woman fewe amonge ye grekes stroge whych full ofte day ala seyde borne wel may myn herte loge death nowe lyue longe ala ne maye amende nowe worse euer yet wende father nyll nothynge grace gone ayen ought hym queme yf terme pace troylus shall hys herte deme false maye well seme thus shall haue vnthanke euery syde borne welawaye tyde yf put ieopardye steale awaye nyght fall caught shalbe holde spye el lo thys drede moste yf handes wretche fall nam bust loste bemyn herte trewe mighty god thou sorowe rewe full pale ywoxen bryght face lymmes leane daye stode durst loked place borne dwelt aye nyght wepynge ala laye thus dyspayred al cure ladde lyfe thys wofull creature full ofte day syghed eke dystresse selfe went aye purtrayeng troylus great worthynesse hys goodly wordes recordyng sen fyrst day loue bega spryng thus sette wofull herte fyre remembraunce yt gan desyre thys world ny cruel herte herde coplaynen sorowe nold haue wepte paynes smert tenderly wepte eue morowe neded teeres borowe thys yet worst payne wyyt durst playne full rewfully loked vpon troye behelde toures hygh eke hallis ala pleasaunce ioye whych nowe al turned gall haue ofte wythin yonder wallis troylus doest thou nowe seyde lord whether thou yet thinke vpo creseyde ala ne ytrowed lore went wyth ye redde er thys nowe syghed halfe sore myght haue sayd yt done amys steale awaye wyth suche one late cometh lectuary men corse vnto graue carye late nowe speke matere prudence ala one thyne eyen thre lacked alwaye er came tyme passed well remembred present tyme eke coulde well se future tyme er snare coulde sene causeth care nathelesse betyde betyde shall morowe nyght eest west thys hoost steale syde gone wyth troylus hem lest purpose wol holde ye best force wycked tonges ianglerye euer loue haue wretch enuy wol euery worde take hede rulen hym euery wyghtes wyt ne shall neuer thryuen drede men blamen euer yet lo maner folke comenden suche variaunce felicite clepe suffysaunce whych wythout wordes mo troy woll conclusioun god wote er fully monethes two full ferre fro entencioun troylus troye toun shall knotlesse throughout herte slyde woll take purpose abyde thys diomede whome tell goeth nowe wythin hym selfe aye arguyng wyth sleyght euer howe maye best wyth shortest taryeng hys nette creseydes herte brynge thys entente couth neuer fyne fyshen layde hoke lyne nathelesse well hys herte thought na wythout loue troye neuer sythen then brought ne couth sene laugh maken ioye nyst howe best herte tacoye tassey sayd naught ne greueth naught assayeth nauyt atcheueth yet sayd hym selfe vpon nyght nowe fole wote wel howe wo loue another wyght hervpon gon assaye nowe maye well wete nyll ben prowe wyse folke bokes expresse men shall wowe wyght heuynesse myght wynnen suche floure fro mourneth night daye myght sayne conquerour ryght anone bolde aye thought hert happe happe may shulde dye woll herte seche shall lesen speche thys diomede bokes v declare hys nedes prest coragious wyth sterne voyce mighty lymmes square hardy testyfe stronge cheualrous dedes lyke hys father tydeus men sayne tonge large heyre calcidony arge creseyde meane stature therto shappe face eke chere myght ben fayrer creature ofte tyme thys manere gone ytressed wyth herres clere downe colere backe behynde threde golde wold bynde saue browes ioyneden yfere na lacke aught espyen speken eyen clere lo trewly wrytten seyen paradys stode formed eyen wyth ryche beaute euermore stroue loue ay sobre eke symple wyse withal beste ynoryshed eke myght goodly speche generall charitable estately lusty fre ne neuer ne lacked pyte tendre herted slydynge corage truely tell age troylus well woxen hyght complete formed proporcioun wel kynde naught ameden might yonge freshe stronge hardy lyoun trewe stele eche condicioun one beste entetched creature shal whyle yt world may dure certaynly story fonde troylus neuer vnto wyght hys tyme dregre seconde darynge longeth knyght al myght gyaunt passen hym myght hys herte aye wyth fyrst wyth ye best stode peregall dare done hym leste tellen forth diomede fyll tenthe daye sen creseyde cyte yede thys diomede fresh brauche may came tente calkas lay fayned hym wt calcas haue doone mente shal tellen soone creseyde shorte wordes tell welcomed hym downe hym sette eth ynough maken dwell thys wythouten longe lette spyces wyne forth hem fette forth speke thys yfere frendes done whych shal ye gan fyrst fallen werre speche betwyxen hem folke troye toun thassiege gan eke beseche tellen hym opinioun fro demaunde dyscendeth doun asken yf straunge thought grekes gyse werkes yt wrought father taryeth longe wedden vnto worthy wyght creseyde paynes stronge loue troylus owne knyght ferforth connynge myght answerde hym tho hys entente semed wyste mente nathelesse thys ylke diomede gan hym selfe assure thus seyde yf aryght haue taken hede thynketh thus lady myne creseyde sen fyrst hode brydel leyde ye came troye morowe ne myght neuer sene sorowe sayne may cause yf loue troyan whych ryght sore wolde athynken ye wyght dwelleth shulden spyll quarter teere pytously seluen begyle dredelesse worth whyle folke troye sayth al pryson ben ye seluen se fro thence shall one lyue come golde atwyxen sunne see trusteth well vnderstandeth shall one mercy gone lyue lorde worldes twyse fyue wrech hem fetchyng heleyne shall take er hence wende maunes ye goddes peyne shal ben agast grekes wol hem shende men shall drede vnto worldes ende hence forth rauyshen quene cruell shall wreche hem sene yf calcas lede v wyth ambage sayne wyth double wordes slye clepen worde wt two visage ye shall well knowen ne lye thys thinge ryght sene wt eye yt anone ye nyll trowe howe soone nowe taketh hede doone wene ye wyse father wolde haue yeuen antenor anone yf ne wyst cytie shulde dystroyed ben nay mote gone knewe full well shal scapen one troyan great feere durst ye dwelte lenger woll ye louesom lady dere let troye troyans fro herte pace dryue yt bytter hope make good chere clepe ayen beaute face ye wyth salte teeres deface troye brought suche ieopardye saue nowe remedye thynketh wel ye shal grekes fynde parfyte loue er nyght troyan kynde bet seruen woll done hys myght yf ye vouchsafe lady bryght woll ben seruen selue yea leauer lorde greces twelue wyth yt worde gan waxen reed hys speche lytel whyle quoke cast asyde lytell wyth hys heed stynte whyle afterwarde woke sobrely threwe hys loke sayd al ioye gentyll man wyght troye yf father tydeus seyde ilyued ben er thys calcidony arge kynge creseyde hope shalbe ywys slayne ala harme vnhappely thebe rathe polymyte many man scathe herte myne sythe ben fyrst whome seche grace serue hertely euer shall whyle lyue haue space er departe thys place ye woll graunt maye morowe better leyser tell sorowe shulde tell hys wordes yt seyd spake ynough daye mest preueth well spake creseyde graunted morowe hys request speake wyth hym leest nolde speake suche matere thus hym sayd ye mowe herte troylus fast maye none arace straungely spake sayd thus diomede loue ylke place borne ioues thy grace delyuer soone doth care god thy myght leue well fare grekes wold wrath troy wrek yf myght knowe wel ywys shall naught befallen ye speke god forne farther ouer thys wote father wyse redy hath bought ye tolde dere vnto hym holde grekes ben hygh condition wote eke wel certayne men shal fynde worthy folke wythin troy toun connyng parfyte kynde ben betwyxtr orcades inde ye coude well lady serue trowe eke well thanke deserue speke loue ywys seyde lorde whome wedded whose myne herte tyll deyde loue helpe nowe pallas myne herte ny ne neuer ye ben noble hygh kynrede haue well herde tellen drede doth haue great wonder ye woll scorne woman eke god wote loue ben fer asonder dysposed bet mote go vnto death playne make wo shall done say trewly yet lyst play myne herte nowe tribulatioun ye armes besy daye daye herafter ye wonnen haue toun perauenture happen may se neuer ere say woll werke yt neuer ere wrought thys worde ynoughe suffysen ought morow eke wol speke wyth fayne ye touchen naught thys matere lyst ye may come againe er ye gone thus moche saye helpe pallas wyth heeres clere yf shulde greke haue routhe shulde seluen trouthe saye therfore wol loue ne say nay conclusioun meane well god syt aboue therwythall caste eyen doun ga sigh said troilus troy toun yet bydde god quyete reste maye sene myne herte breste effecte shortly saye thys diomede freshly newe agayne gan preasen faste mercy praye thys soth sayne gloue toke ful fayne fynally woxen eue well rose toke hys leue bryght venus folowed aye taught way brode phebus downe alight cythera chare horse ouer raught whyrle lyon yf myght signifer hys candels sheweth bryght creseyde vnto bedde wente wythin father fayre bryght tente retournyng soule aye vp downe wordes thys sodayne diomede hys great estate peryl towne alone nede frendes helpe thus gan brede cause soth tell toke fully purpose dwell morow came goostly speke diomede come vnto creseyde shortly leste ye tale breke wel hym selfe spake seyde syghes sore downe leyde fynally sothe sayne lefte great payne storye telleth v yaue fayre baye stede whiche one wan troylus eke broche lytel nede troylus yaue diomede eke bet sorowe releue made weare pencell sleue fynde eke story el whan body hurte diomede troylus tho wepte many teere wha sawe wyde woundes blede toke kepen good hede healen smerte men sayn yaue herte trewly storie telleth v made neuer woman wo whan falsed troylus sayd ala nowe clene ago name trouthe loue euermo haue falsed one gentyllest euer one worthyest ala vnto worldes ende shal neyther ben ywritten ysonge good word bokes wol shede irolled shall ben many tonge throughout ye worlde bel shal ronge woman moste woll hate ala suche caas shulde fall wol sayne moche haue hem done dishonour welaway albe nat fyrst dyd amys helpeth blame away sen se better way late nowe rewe diomede woll algate trewe troylus sen better may sen thus departen ye yet pray god yeue right good day gentyllest knyght trewly euer sawe seruen faythfully best aye ladyes honour kepe ye worde braste anone wepe certes ne haten shall neuer frendes loue shal ye haue good worde shulde lyuen euer trewly wolde right sorie sene aduersyte gyltlesse wote wel leue shall passe thus take leue trewly howe longe bytwene forsoke diomede none auctour telleth wene take euery man nowe bokes hede shall terme fynden drede though began wow soone er wan yet done ne ne lyste sely woman chyde ferther storie woll deuyse name ala publyshed wyde gylte ought ynough suffyse yf might excuse wyse sory vntrouthe iwys wolde excuse yet routhe troylus haue tolde thus driueth forth wel hath might ofte herte hote colde namely ylke nynthe nyght whiche morowe behyght come ayen god wote fall lytel reste night nothyng slepe leste laurer crowned phebus heate gan course aye vpwarde wente warmen eest see waues weate cyrces doughter songe fresh entet whan troylus pandare sente walles towne pleyde loke yf sene aught creseyde tyll noone stoden se ther came euery maner wight came fro ferre sayden tyll colden knowen aright nowe herte dull light thus beiaped stoden stare aboute naught troylus pandare pandarus troylus tho seyde aught wotte noone sykerly town ne cometh nat creseyde hath ynough done hardely wynnen father trowe olde father wol yet make dyne er go god yeue herte pyne padarus answerd may well ben certayne thy let v dyne beseche noon tha mayst thou come agayn go without speche comen ayen longe may seche er fynde gape fortune hem bothe thynketh iape quod troylus se well nowe taryed olde father er come woll nygh euen come forthe woll vnto yate go porter ben vnkonnyng euermo woll done hem holden vp yate naught ne though come late day gothe faste came eue yet came nat troylus creseyde loketh forthe hedge tree greue ferre heed ouer wall leyde laste turned seyde god wote meanyng pandare almoste ywis al newe care nowe doutelesse thys lady goode wote cometh rydyng priuely commende wysedom myne hode woll nat maken people nycely gaure whan yt cometh softly nyght town thynketh ryde dere brother thynke nat longe abyde haue naught el ywis pandarus wylte thou trowen haue trouthe se yonde heaue vp thyne eyen man mayst thou nat se pandare answerde nay mote al wrog god sayst yu wher arte se yonde ny farre carte ala thou sayest right sothe troylus hardely nat al nought myne herte nowe reioyce thus ayenst good haue thought nat howe sen yt wrought ne felte suche comfort dare say cometh night lyfe yt durst lay padarus answerd may wel ynough helde al euer sayde herte thought softe lough selfe full soberly sayde frome haselwodde ioly robyn pleyde shall come thou abydest yea farwell snowe ferne yere wardeyn yates gan call folke without yt yates bade hem driuen beestes night muste bleuen ferre within night many tere troylus gan homwarde ryde wel seeth helpeth nat abyde nathelesse gladded thought myscounted hys dey sayd vnderstonde haue al amys thylke night laste creseyde sey sayd shall ben yf may er moone dere herte swete lyon passe aryete may yet hold al este morowe vnto yate wente vp downe west eke este vpon walles made many wente al naught hope alway blent whiche night sorowe syghes sore wente hym home withouten hope clene hys herte fledde ne hath wheron nowe lenger honge yt payne thouyt herte bledde throwes sharpe woder strog whan sawe abode longe nyste iudgen myght sen hath broken hym behyght thyrde fourthe fyfthe syxte day tho dayes ten whiche tolde betwyxen hope drede herte lay yet somwhat trustyng hestes olde whan saw nolde terme holde nowe sene none remedye shape sone dye therwith wicked spiryt god v blesse men clepen woode ialousye gan crepe al heuynesse whyche bycause wolde sone dye ne ete ne dronke hys melancolye eke euery companye fledde lyfe al tyme ledde defayte maner man vnneth might knowen wente leane therto pale wan feble walketh potente ire thus selfe shente asked wherof hym smerte sayd harme al aboute herte priam full ofte eke mother dere bretherne sustren gan frayne soroufull chere thyng ye cause al payne al naught nolde hys cause playne sayd felte greuous maladye aboute herte fayne wolde dye day laye downe slepe byfell slepe thought forest faste walked wepe loue yt paynes wrought vp downe forest sought mette sawe bore tuskes greate slept ayenst bright sonnes heate bore faste armes folde lay kyssyng aye lady bright creseyde sorow whan gan beholde dispyte slepe breyde loude cryed pandarus seyde pandarus nowe knowe croppe roote nam deed ny non boote lady bright creseyde hath betrayde trusted moste wight el hath nowe herte apayde blyfful goddes gret might haue dreame yshewed full right thus dreme creseyde haue behold thyng pandarus tolde creseyde ala subtylte newe lust beaute science wrathe iuste cause haue ye gylte fel experience hath rafte ala thyne aduertence trust faythe depe assuraunce hath rafte creseyde plesauce ala let hence go wel nigh wyt breyde shall nowe trowe othes mo god wote wende lady bright creseyde euery worde gospel ye seyde may bet begyle yf hym lyste men wenen best tryste shall done pandarus ala fele nowe sharpe newe payne sen remedye caas bet myn hodes twayn seluen slowe alway thus playn throgh ye deth wo shuld haue end ther euery day lyfe selfe shende pandare answerde sayd ala whyle borne haue nat sayd er thys dreames many maner man begyle folke expounden hem amys howe darste thou sayne false thy lady dreame right thyn owne drede let thought yu canst dremes rede paraueture thou dreamest bore may may signifye father whiche olde eke hore ayen sonne lythe poynte dye sorowe gynneth wepe crye kysseth lythe ye grounde thus shuldest yu thy dreme aright expounde howe might done troylus knowe yea neuer lyte sayest thou wisely pandarus rede sen thou canst wel endyte hastely letter thou write yu shalt well bringen knowe sothe thou arte doute se nowe dare wel sayne yf vntrewe nat trowen wol write agayne yf write thou shalt ful sone yse whether hath lyberte come ayen el clause let woll assygne cause thou hast nat writte sen yt went durste lay may suche cause ben entente hardely thou wolt thy seluen say abode best tway nowe write thou shalt fele sone sothe done acorded ben conclusyoun anon ylke lordes two hastely sate troylus adoun rolleth herte fro howe may best discryuen wo creseyde owne lady dere wrote right thus sayd ye may pthe copy letter right freshe floure whose haue ben shall withoute parte el seruyce wyth herte body lyfe luste thought wofull wight euery humble wyse tonge tel herte may deuyse ofte mater occupyeth place recommaunde vnto noble grace lyketh weten swete herte ye wel knowe howe longe tyme agon ye left aspre paynes smerte whan ye went whiche yet bote non haue non euer worse bygon fro day day mote dwell whyle lyst wele wo well dredeful hert trewe write sorowe driueth write wo euery houre encreaseth newe complaynyng dare endyte defaced may ye wyte teares fro myne eyen rayne wolden speke yf yt durste playne fyrst beseche eyen clere toke defouled ye nat holde ouer al ye nat lady dere wol vouchsafe
