letter beholde cause eke colde sleeth wyt yf aught amys sterte foryeue myne owne swete herte seruaunt durst ought ryght vpon lady pitously complayne wene ought wyght cosydred ye monthes twayn haue taryed ye sayden sothe sayn ten dayes ye nolde hoste soiourne two monthes yet ye nat retourne moche mote nedes lyke lyst dare nat playne humbly soroufull syghes syke write myne vnresty sorowes sore fro day day desyryng euer knowen fully yf wyll howe ye haue fared ye whose welfare heale eke god encrease honour suche vpwarde degree growe alway neuer cease right herte aye lady free deuyse pray god mote graunt ye soone vpon rewe wisely trewe yf lyketh knowen fare whose wo ther may wiyt discryue chest euery care writyng letter lyue al redy wofull gost dryue whiche delay holde yet honde vpon syght mater sonde myne eyen two vayn se soroufull teares salte arn woxen wellis songe playnt myne aduersyte good harm myn ease eke woxe hell ioye wo sey nowe nought elli turned whiche lyfe wary euery ioye prease contrary wt comyng home aye troy ye may redresse thousande sythe euer encressen ioy neuer herte yet blythe haue lyfe shall ben swythe se though maner routhe meuen yet thinketh trouthe yf gylte hath dethe deserued yf lyst vpon se guerdon yet haue serued beseche myn owne lady fre vpon ye wolden write loue god right lode sterre deth may make ende al werre cause aught doth dwel letter ye may recomforte though absence hell wyth pacience woll wo comforte lettre hope wol disporte writeth swete let thus nat playn hope dethe delyuereth fro payne iwys myne owne dere herte trewe wote whan ye next vpon se loste haue myn heale eke myn hewe creseyde shall nat conne knowen iwys myne hertes day lady fre thursteth aye myne herte beholde beaute vnneth lyfe holde say haue sey wel tell may whether ye lyue dey yet pray god yeue right good day fareth wel goodly fayre fresh may ye lyfe dethe may commaunde youre trouthe aye recomaunde wyth heale suche ye yeuen heale shal none heale haue lythe whan lyst day clothen shal graue lyfe might saue fro disease paynes smerte fare nowe well myne owne swete herte le vostre lettre forth sent vnto creseyde whiche answere affecte thys full pitously wrote ayen seyde also sone myght ywis wold come mende al amys fynally wrote sayd wolde come ye nyste letter made suche feestes woder swore loued best founde botomlesse byhestes troylus thou mayst nowe eest west pype iuy leefe yf lest thus gothe worlde god shylde v fro mischaunce euery wight meneth trouth auauce encreasen gan wo fro day nyght troylus taryeng creseyde lessen gan hope eke myght al bedde leyd ne ete dronke ne slept ne worde seyde imagynyng aye vnkynde wel nigh wext mind dreme told haue eke beforn may neuer come remembraunce thought aye well lady lorne ioues hys purueyaunce hym shewed slepe signyfiaunce vntrouth disauenture bore shewed fygure whiche sybille suster sente called cassandre eke aboute dreame tolde er stente besought assoylen doute stronge boore tuskes stoute fynally within lytell stounde cassandre gan thus hys dreme expoude gan first smyle sayd brother dere thou soth desyrest knowe thou muste fewe olde story purpose howe fortune ouerthrowe hath lordes old wtin throw thou shalt bore know kynde comen men bookes fynde diane wroth yre grekes nolde done sacrifyce ne encens vpon aulter sette fyre grekes gonne dispyse wrake wonder cruel wyse bore great oxe stall made vp frete corne vynes slee bore al ye countrey reysed amonge whiche came bore se mayd one worlde best ypraysed meleager lorde countre loued freshe mayden fre manhode er wolde stente bore slough ye heed sente whiche olde bokes tellen v rose conteke great enuye lorde discended tideus lygne el olde bokes lye howe meleager gan dye mother woll nat tell longe dwell tolde eke howe tideus er stente vnto stronge cyte thebe claymen kyngdom cyte went felawe dan polimites whiche brother dan ethiocles ful wrongfully thebe helde ye strentgh tolde processe length tolde eke howe hemonydes asterte whan tydeus slough fyfty knightes stoute tolde eke prophesies herte howe seuen kynges route besiegeden cyte aboute holy serpent well furyes al gan hym tell associat profugum tydeus primo polimidem tidea legatum docet insidias que secundis tertius hermodien canit et vates latitantes mors furie leuine quinto narrantur et angues quartus habet reges ineuntes prelia septem archynon bustum sexto ludi que leguntur dat graios thebe vatem septimis vmbris octauo cecidit tibeus spes vita pelagis ipomedon nono moritur cum parthonepeo fulmine percusso decimo canapus superatur vndecimo lese perimunt per vulnera fratres argiuam flentem narrant duodenis et ignem archinories buryeng playes amphiorax fyll ye groude howe tideus slayne lorde argeyes howe hypomedon lytell stounde dreynte deed parthonepe wounde also howe campaneus proude wyth thoder dynte slayne ye cryed loude ga eke tel eyther brother ethiocles polimites also scarmyshe eche hem slough argynes wepyng mo ye town brent told eke tho tho discended downe iestes olde diomede thus spake tolde ylke bore betokeneth diomede tideus sonne downe discended fro meleager made bore blede thy lady ywis diomede herte hath hys wepe yf thou wolte leaue doute diomede thou arte oute thou sayest nat soth thou sorceresse wyth thy false goste prophecie thou wenest ben great deuyneresse nowe seest thou nat foole fantasye paynen ladyes lye away ioues yeue sorowe thou shalt fals paraueture yet morow wel thou mightest lyen good alceste creature men lye euer kyndest beste whan husbonde ieopardye dye selfe yf wolde dye chese dye gon hell starfe anon v bokes tell cassandre gothe wyth cruell herte foryate wo angre speche bedde sodaynly sterte though al hole hym ymade leche day day gan enquire seche sothe wyth hys full cure thus dryueth forth auenture fortune whiche permutacion thynges hath commytted purueyaunce disposycion hygh ioue reygnes shall ben flytted fro folke folk wha shal ben smytted gan pull away fethers bright troye fro day day tyl ben bare ioye amonge fyne ieoperdy hector gan approchen wonder blyue fate wolde soule shulde vnbodye shapen meane driue ayenst whych fate helpeth nat stryue day fyghten gan wende whiche ala caught lyues ende thynketh euery maner wyght haunteth armes ought bewayle dethe noble knight drough kyng thauentayle vnware achilles mayle body gan hym ryue thus ye worthy knight refte lyue olde bookes tellen v made wo ye tonge may tell namely sorowe troylus next worthynesse wel wo gan thoylus dwell sorow loue vnreste ful ofte daye bade herte breste nathlesse though gan dispayre dredde aye lady vntrewe yet aye herte gan repayre louers sought aye new get ayen creseyde bryght hewe hert went excusyng calcas caused al taryeng ofte time purpose greate hym seluen lyke pylgrym disgyse sene may countrefeate ben vnknowen folke wise ne fynde excuse aryght may suffyse amonge grekes knowen wepte ful ofte many teere wrote yet ofte tyme al newe ful pytously lefte slouth besechyng sen trewe wol come ayen holde trouth creseyde vpon day routh take touchynge al thys matere wrote ayen sayd ye may cupides sonne ensample godlyhede sworde knighthode sour getilnesse myght wight turment drede healelesse sende yet gladnesse hertlesse sycke distresse sen ye wt wyth may deale neyther sende herte may heale letter ful paper al yplaynted conceyued hath myne hertes pyte haue eke sene wyth teares al depaynted letter howe ye requyren come ayen yet ne may nat leste letter fouden mencion ne make nowe feere greuous god wote vnrest haste goddes ordinaunce semeth ye take beste thyng ny remembrauce thynketh onely plesaunce beth nat wroth beseche tary al wycked speche haue herde wel wende touchyng v two thinges haue ystode whych shal wyth dissimulyng amende beth wroth haue eke vnderstonde howe ye ne holden honde force gesse al trouth al gentylnesse come wol yet disioynte stode nowe yt yere daye shal apoynte effecte pray maye good worde frendship aye trewely whyle lyfe may dure frende ye may assure yet praye yuel ye ne take short whych write dare wel letter make ne neuer yet ne coulde wel endyte eke great effecte men write place lyte thentent al letter space fareth well god haue hys grace la vostre c troylus thouyt letter al strauge whan sawe soroufully syght thought lyke kalendes eschaung finally ful ne trowen myght ne wolde holde hight ful yuel wyl lyst hym leue yt loueth well case though greue nathlesse men sayne laste thynge men shal soth se suche case betydde faste troylus wel vnderstode na nat kynde ought finally wote nowe doute al lost hath ben aboute stode day hys melancolye thys troylus suspectioun wende dye befyl throughout troy toun gyse yborne vp doun manere cote armure sayth storye beforne deiphebe signe victorye whyche cote telleth lollius diephebe rent fro diomede daye whan thys troylus sawe gan taken hede auysyng length brede al werke gan beholde ful sodaynly hys herte gan colde coler fonde wythin broche creseyde yaue morowe troye must nedes twyn remembraunce sorow layde ayen fayth borow kepe aye nowe full wel wyst hys lady na lenger tryst goth hym home gan ful sone sende pandarus al thys newe chaunce broch tolde worde ende complaynyng hertes variaunce longe loue hys trouth penauce deth without wordes ful faste cryed reste restore spake thus lady mine creseyde wher sayth behest loue trouth seyd diomede haue ye al feest ala wolde haue trowed leest sen ye nolde trouth stonde ye thus nolde haue holden hode shal nowe trowen othes mo ala neuer wolde haue wende er thys ye creseide coulde haue chaunched ne agylte done amys cruel wende herte ywys slee thus ala name trouthe nowe fordon al routhe none broche lyste lete feffe wyth newe loue quod thylke broche wyth teeres wete yaue remembraunce none cause ala ne ye dispyte eke ye mente al vtterly shewen entent se clene minde ye haue cast ne may al worlde within mine herte fynde vnlonen quarter daye cursed tyme borne welaway done al thys wo endure yet loue best creature nowe god sende yet grace may meten diomede trewly yf haue myght space yet shal make hope sydes blede nowe god oughtest taken hede forthren trouth wronges punice nylt thou vengeauce thys vice pandarus dremes tryst blamed hast wont arte ofte vpbreyde mayst thou sene thy selfe yf ye lyst trew thy nece bryght creseyde sondry formes god wote seyde goddes shewen ioye tene slepe dreame nowe sene certaynly withouten speche hence forth ferforth may myne owne deth armes wol seche retche nat howe soone daye trewly creseyde swete maye haue al might yserued ye thus done haue deserued padarus al thynges herde wyste wel sayd soth worde ayen hym answerde sory frendes sorowe shamed nece hath done amys stante astonyed cause tway styl stone worde ne coulde say laste thus spake seyde brother dere may shuld sayne hate ywys creseyde god wote wol hate euermore thou besoughtest done yore hauyng vnto myne honour ne reste ryght regarde dyd al leste dyd aught myght lyken lefe treason nowe god wote sorowe dredelesse hertes ease ryght fayne wold amend wyst fro worlde almyghty god pray delyuer soone say great sorow playnt troylus forthe course fortune aye gan holde creseyde loueth sonne tydeus troylus mote wepe care colde worlde beholde eche estate lytle hertes reste god leue v take beste many cruel batayle drede troylus thys ylke noble knyght men may olde bokes rede sene hys knygthod great might dredelesse hys yre day nyght ful cruelly grekes aye abought alway diomede sought ofte tyme fynde mette bloody stroke wordes greate assayeng howe speares whette god wote wyth many cruel heate gan troylus vpon helme beate nathlesse fortune nought ne wolde outher hande eyther dyen shulde yf ytaken write armes ylke worthy man wolde battaylles endyte writen fyrst began hys loue haue sayd hys worthy dedes hem lyste rede dare tel hem al yfere besechyng euery lady bryght hewe euery gentle woman al creseyde vntrewe gylt ye nat wroth ye may gylt bokes se gladder wol write yf lest penelope trouth good alcest ne say thys al men moste woman betrayed throuy false folke god yeue sorow ame wyth great wyt subtylte betrayen thys meneth speke effecte al pray beth ware men herkeneth say go lytle boke go lytel tragedy god thy maker yet er dye sende might make comedye lytle boke make thou none enuye subiecte ben vnto al poesye kysse steppe wher yu seest pace vergil ouide homer lucan stace great diuyrsite englyshe writyng tonge pray god none miswrite ne mysse metre defaute tonge redde thou el songe thou vnderstonde god beseche yet purpose rather speche wrath began sey troylus grekes boughten dere thousandes hys handes maden dey wothouten pere saue hys tyme hector welaway saue onely goddes wyl dispytously slough feirse achyl wha slaine manere lyght goste ful blisfully went vp holownesse seuenth spere hys place letyng eueryche element sawe wyth ful auysement arratykes sterres herkenyng armonye wyth sownes ful heuenysse melodye downe thence faste gan auyse lytle spotte erth wyth see enbraced fully gan dispise thys wretched worlde helde al vanite respecte playne felicite heuen aboue last ther slayn loking cast selfe lough ryght wo hem wepten hys erh fast dampned al werkes yt foloweth blynde lust whych maye nat last shulden al herte heuen cast forth went shortly tel mercurie sorted dwel fyne hathe lo troylus loue fyne hath al greate worthynesse fyne hath hys estate royal aboue fine lust fyne hath noblesse fyne hath false worldes brotelnesse thus began louyng creseyde haue tolde thys wyse deyde yonge freshe folkes ye loue vp groweth age repayreth home worldly vanite hertes vp casteth visage thylke god ymage made thynketh ny fayre world yt passeth sone floures fayre loueth yt right loue vpon crosse soules bey fyrst starfe rose syt heuen aboue nyl falsen wyght dare sey wol herte al holy ley sen best loue moste meke nedeth fayned loues seke lo paynems cursed olde rytes lo al goddes may auayle lo thys wretched worldes appetytes lo fyne guerdon trauayle ioue apollo mar raskayle lo forme olde clerkes speche poetrye yf ye bokes seche moral gower thys boke directe philosophical strode vouchsafe nede correcte benignityes zeles goode sothfast christ yt starfe roode wythal myne herte mercy euer pray lorde aright thus speake say thou one two thre eterne lyue raignest aye thre two one vncircumscript mayst circumscryue v visible inuisible fone defende thy mercy euerychone make v iesus thy mercy digne loue mayde mother thyne benigne pthus endeth fyfth boke last troylus foloweth pyteful dolorous testament fayre creseyde testament creseyde adolye seasonne tyll careful dyte shulde coresponde equiuolent right wha began write thys tragedy yt weder ryght feruent whan aries myddes lent showres hayle fro north descende scantly fro colde miyt defende yet neuertheles wythin myne orature stode wha titan beames bright withdrawen downe scyled vnder cure fayre venus beautye nyght vprayse set vnto west ful ryght golden face oppositiowne god phebus directe discendinge downe throuyout ye glasse bemes brast fayre might se euery syde northern wynde purifyed ayre shedde mysty cloudes fro skye froste fresed blastes bytterly fro pole artike come whisking loud shyll caused remoue ayenst wyll trusted venus loues quene somtyme hyght obedience saded hert loue wold make grene therupon humble reuerence thought pray hye magnifycence great colde letted chambre fyre pa though loue hote yet man age kyndleth nat soone youtheed blode flowyng rage olde corage dul deed fyre outward beest remeed helpe phisyke ye nature fayled experte haue assayed made fyre beaked toke drinke spirites conforte armed wel fro colde therout cut wynter night make shorte toke queare lefte al sporte written worthy chaucer glorious fayre creseyde lusty troylus founde diomede receyued lady bryght hewe troylus nere wytte abrede wepte sore wyth visage pale hewe wanhope teares gan renewe whyle esperous reioysed agayne thus ioy liued paine behest great comfortynge trusting troy yt wolde make retour desyred al erthly thynge onely paramoure whan saw passed day hour gayncome sorowe oppresse woful herte care heuynesse distresse nedeth reherse worthy chaucer boke goodly termes ioly verse compyled hath care wyl loke breake slepe another queare toke whych founde fatal desteny fayre creseyde ended wretchedly wote al chaucer wrote trew wotte yf narration authoryzed forged newe poete hys inuention made reporte lamentation woful ende thys lusty creseyde distresse deyde whan diomede al appetyte fulfylled thys fayre lady vpon another sette al delyte sende lybel repudy excluded fro company desolate walked vp downe men saine courte comune fayre creseyde floure per se troy grece thou fortunate chaunge fylth al thy femynite fleshly luste maculate go among grekes early late giglotlyke taking thy soule pleasaunce haue pyte shulde fal mischaunce yet neuerthelesse euer deme say scornful langage thy brutelnesse shal excuse ferforth may thy womanheed thy wisedome fayrnesse fortune hath put distresse pleased nothing gylte wicked langage spilte thys fayre lady thys wise destitute al comforte consolation right priuely wythout felowshyp refute disheuelde passed town myle two vnto mansioun bylded ful gay father calcas tha amoge grekes dwelling whan sawe cause enquyre comyng sayd syghyng ful sore fro diomede goten desyre wore wery wolde calcas doughter wepe thou therfore parauenture al cometh best welcome thou arte ful dere gest thys olde calcas lawe tho keper temple preest venus sonne cupido honoured hys chambre nest creseyde wt bale enewed brest vsed passe prayer say whyle last vpon solempne day custome people ferre nere noone vnto temple went sacrifyce deuoute theyr manere styl creseyde heuy entent church wolde selfe present gyuyng people demyng expulse fro diomede kyng passed asecrete oratore myght wepe woful desteny behynde backe closed fast dore knee bare fel downe hye vpon venus cupide angerly cryed sayd thys wyse ala euer made sacrifyce ye gaue one diuyne responsayle shulde floure loue troy made vnworthy outwayle al care translated ioye shal gyde shal couoy syth fro diomede noble troylus clene excluded abiecte odious false cupyde none wyte thou thy mother loue blynd goddace ye caused vnderstande alway trow seede loue sowem face aye grewe grene throuy souple grace nowe ala yt seed wyth frost slayne fro louers lefte al forlayne whan thys sayd downe extasy rauyshed sprite dreame fel apparaunce herde dyd lye cupide kyng tynkyng syluer bel men myght fro heuen hel whose sounde cupide aperes seue planet discendyng fro speres hath power thyng generable rule stere great influence weder wynde course variable fyrste al saturne gaue hys sentence gaue cupide lytle reuerence boystous churle hys manere came crabbedly wyth austryne loke chere face frounced lere lyke ye leed hys teth chattred sheuered wyth chyn eyen drouped hole sonken hys heed nose myldrop fast gan ryn lyppes blo chekes leaue thyn yse yekels yt fro hys heer downe honge wonder great speare longe attour hys belte lyarte locke lay feltred vnfayre ouerfret wyth frostes hore garment gate fal gay gray widdred wede fro hi ye winde wore boustous bow within hande bore vnder gyrdel fashe felone flayns feddred yse heeded wyth holstayns iupiter ryght fayre amiable god sterres fyrmament norice al thyng generable fro hys father saturne farre different burly face browes bryght brent vpon hys heed garlonde wonder gaye floures fayre ben maye voice clere christal eien goldde wier glettring heare garmente gyte ful gay grene wyth golden lystes gylte euery geare burly brande aboute myddle beare ryght hande grounde spere hys father wrath fro v bere next came mar god yre stryfe debate discentioun chyde fyght feirse fyre harde harnesse hewmode habergioun haunch rousty fel fauchoun hande rousty sworde writhyng face many angry worde shaking brande befor cupide come reed visage grisely glowyng eyen mouth blubber stode fome lyke boore whettinge tuskes keyn right tulsure lyke temperaunce tene horne blew wt many boustous bragge al world wt warre hath made wagge tha fayre phebus lanterne lape lyght man beest frute florishyng tender norice banysher nyght worlde causyng mouyng influence lyfe al erthly thyng without coforte force nought must go dye yt al world hath wrought kyng royal rode vpon chare phiton sotyme gyded vnright bryghtnesse hys face wha bare non might beholde persing sight golden carte firy beames bright foure yoked stedes ful different hewe bayt tyring speres drew first sord wt mane reed rose called eoye orient seconde stede name hight ethyose whitely pale dele ascendent thyrde perose right hote eke feruent fourth blacke called phelologee rolleth phebus downe see venus present goddes gay sonnes quarel defende make owne complaynt cladde nyce aray one halfe grene thother halfe sable blake white heer golde kembet shed bake face semed great variaunce whyle parfite trouth whyles incostaunce vnder smylyng dissimulate prouocatyue blynkes amorous sodaynly chaunged alterate angry serpent venomous ryght pungityue wordes odious thus variaut lyst take kepe one eye laugh ye wepe tokenyng al flesshly paramour venus hath rule gouernaunce somtyme swete somtyme bytter sour ryght vnstable full variaunce mynged careful ioy false pleasauce hote colde blythe full wo grene lefe widred ago boke hand come mercurious ryght eloquent full rethorye polyte termes delicious penne ynke report readye settyng songes syngen merely hode red hecled attour crown lyke tyll poete olde fassyoun bore bare fyne electuares sugred syropes digestion spyces belongyng potiquares many holsome swete confectioun doctor phisyke cled scarlet gowne furred wele one ought honest good nat worde couth lye next come lady synthia last al swyftest spere colour blacke busked horne twa nyght lysteth best tapere hawe leed colour nothyng clere al light boroweth brother tytan self hath none gyte gray full spottes blak breest churle paynted full euen bearyng bush thornes backe theft miyt clime ner ye heue thus wha gadred wer ye goddes seue mercurius chosed one assent forespeker parlyment ben lykyng facondetonge termes exquisyte rethorike practyke myght lere brefe sermon preignaut sentence write cupide valyng cappe alyte sper cause vacatioun anon shewed ententioun lo cupide wol blaspheme ye name owne god eyther worde dede goddes doth losse shame shulde haue bytter paynes mede say yonder wretche creseyde thrugh sotyme flour loue mother statelye gan reproue saying great infelicitie cause mother venus called blynde goddes myght nat se sclaunder defame iniurious thus lyuyng vnclene lecherous wolde retort mother shewed grace aboue al syth ye al seuen delicate participant deuyne sapience great iniure done hye estate thik wt payn shulde make recopence neuer goddes done violence well selfe saye therfore go helpe reuenge praye mercurius cupide gaue answere sayd syr kyng cousayle ye referre hyest planet take lowest degree payne creseyde modefye god saturne hym take synthia cotent take twa thus proceded saturne moone whan matter rypely degest despyte cupid done venus open manifest al lyfe payne opprest turmet sore syknesse incurable louers abhominable doleful sentece saturne toke hand passed wher careful creseyd lay heed layde frosty wande lawfully wyse say thy great fayrnesse thy beauty gay thy wanton blood eke thy golden exclude fro euermeere chaunge thy myrth melancoly mother pensyuenesse thy moyster thy hete colde drye thy insolence thy play thy wantonesse great disease thy pompe thy rychesse mortal nede great penuritie thou suffre shalt beggar dye cruell saturne frowarde angrye harde thy dome malicyous fayr creseyd hast thou mercye swete gentle amorous withdrawe thy sentence gracyous thou wer neuer sheweth thy dede wrekeful sentence gyuen creseyd tha synthia whan saturne past away seate discended downe belyue red byll creseyde lay conteynyng sentence diffynityue fro heale body depryue thy syknesse shalbe recure dolour thy dayes endure thy christal eyen menged wt blood make thy voyce clere vnplesaunt heer hace thy lusty lere ouerspred wt spottes blake lumpes hawe apering thy face wher thou comest eche man shal flye ye place thus shalt thou go beggyng fro house house cup clapper lyke lazarous dooly dreame vgly visioun brought tyll ende creseyd fro awoke court conuocatioun vanyshed away rose vp toke polished glasse shadowe couth loke wha sawe vysage deformate hert wo ne wyt god wate wepyng full sore lo frowarde langage moue stere crabbed goddes sene blasphemyng haue bought full dere erthly ioye myrth set arere ala day ala woful tyde whan began goddes chyde sayd childe came fro hal warne creseyde supper redy fyrst knocked dore eft couth cal madam father byddeth com hy hath maruayl longe groufe ye lye sayth beedes beth longe sodele goddes wote al entent ful wele quod fayr chylde go father dere pray hym come speke anon dyd sayd doughter chere ala father myrth gone al expone haue told vengeauce weake trespasse cupide couth take loked vgly leper face white lely floute wryngyng handes ofttymes sayd ala hee lyued se woful houre knewe wel ther sucour syknesse yu doubled payne thus ther care ynowe betwyxe hem twayne wha togyther mourned full lange creseyde father wolde kende therfore secrete wyse ye let gange hospitall townes ende thyder som meat charitie sende lyue vpon al myrth earth fro gone suche wicked werth whan mantell beuer hat cuppe clapper wonder priuely opened secrete gate thereat conueyde man shulde espye vylage halfe myle therby delyuered spyttel house dayly sende parte almous knewe wel som knowlege bicause deforma e byles blake ouerspred visage fayre colour faded alterate yet presumed hye regrate styll mournyng noble kyn better wyll toke inne day passed phebus wet vnto rest cloudes blacke euery syde al sky god wote yf cresede sorowfull gest seing vncouth fare herbory meate drynke dressed lye darke corner house alone wyse wepynge made mone phere foloweth complaynt creseyde sop sorowe sonken care caytife creseyd euermare gone thy ioye al thy myrth erth blythenesse nowe art thou blacke bare salue may helpe thy sare fell thy fortune wycked thy werth thy blysse banysshed thy bale vnberde vnder great god yf grauen ware men grece ne yet troye myght herde thy chambre wantonly besene burly bed banker brouded bene spyces wyne thy collatioun cuppes al golde syluer shene thy swete meates serued plate clene sauery sauce good facioun thy gay garmetes wt many goodly goune thy plesaut laune pynned wt golden pene al arere thy great royall renoune thy gardeyne thy greces gay freshe floures yu quene floraye paynted plesauntly euery pane thou wont ful merily may walke take dewe day merie mauyse many one ladyes fayre carollyng gone se royall renkes raye leper loge take thy goodly bour thy bed take nowe bonche stro wayled wyne meetes thou tho take mouled breed pyrat syder soure cuppe clapper al ago clere voyce courtly carollynge ranke roke ful hidous heer hace deformed fygure face loke people hath lykyng sosped syght say sore syghinge lying amonge leper folke ala ladyes fayre troy grece attende freyle fortune myne infelicitie great myschef noma amend mynde myrrour make peraduenture ye al might may come ye end el worse yf worse may beware therfore aproches nere ende nouyt fayrnesse fading floure nouyt famous laude hye honour wynde inflate men eares rosyng red rotyng shal retour example make memore thiges woful witnes beares welth erth wynd away weares beware therfore aprocheth nere hour thus chydyng drery destiny wepyng woke ye nyght fro ende ende vayne dole careful crye miyt remedy ne yet mourning med leper lady rose wende sayd spurnest thou agayne ye wal slee thy selfe mend nothynge sith thy weping doubleth thy wo counsayle make vertue nede go lerne clap thy clapper fro lerne lawe leper lede ther bote forth wt tha yede fro place place whyle colde hugre sore compelled ranke beggore tyme troy garnysoun cheftayne worthye troylus thrugh ieopardy war stryke knyghtes grece nobre maruaylous great triumph laude victorious agayne troy ryght royally rode way wher creseyde wt leper stode seing company come steue gaue crye shoke cup good spede worthy lordes goddes loue heauen v leper parte almesse dede crye noble troylus toke hede hauyng pytie nere place gan passe wher creseyd sat nat wetig vpon hym kest vp eyen wt blynke come intyl thought sometyme face seyn plite knew hernouyt yet loke mynde brouyt swete vysage amorous blenkynge fayre creseyd sotyme owne derling wonder suppose mynde toke fygure soone lo ydoll thynge case may depe emprynted fantasy defendeth wyttes outwardly appereth forme lyke estate within mynde figurate spark loue tyl hert couth sprig kyndeled body fyre hote feuer swet trymblynge toke whyle redy expyre beare shylde breest begon tyre within whyle chaunged manye hewe neuerthelesse nat one another knewe knyghtly pytie memoriel fayr creseyd gyrdle gan take purse golde many gay iewel ye skyrt creseyd downe shake tha rode awaye nat worde spake pensife hert whyle came ye towne great care oftsith almost fel downe lepre folke creseyde couth drawe se equall distributioun ye almous whan golde saw eche one priuely rowne sayd lorde hath affectioun euer vnto lazarous v knowe almous lorde haue ye fele doth v great humanitie yes lepre man knowe wele syr troylus knyght gentle free whan creseyde vnderstode styffer tha stele stert bytter stound thrughout hert fyl ye groud whan ouercom syghyng sore sad many carefull crye colde atone brest stormy stoudes stad wrapped wo wretch fulwyl one fel swoun ful oft wolde f ne euer swouning cryed chus false creseyd true knyght troylus thy loue thy laude thy gentylnesse compted smal prosperitie effated wantonnesse clambe vpon fykel whele hye fayth loue promoted thy selfe fekle furyous false creseyde true knyght troylus loue thou kept countenaunce honest chaste conuersatioun woman protectour defence thou helped theyr opynioun mynde fleshly foule affectioun enclyned lustes lecherous fye false creseyde true knyght troylus louers beware take good hede yt ye loue whan ye suffre payne let wyt ther right fewe thrughout ye may trust haue true loue agayne proue wha ye wol labour vayne therfore rede ye take ye fynde sad wethercock wynd bycause knowe great vnstablenesse bryttell glasse vnto selfe say trustyng great brutelnesse inconstaunt vntrue faye thouy som true wot riyt fewe ar fyndeth truthe let hym lady se none selfe woll accuse whan sayd wt paper sat doun maner made testament bequeth corse caryoun wormes toodes rent cup clapper myne ornament al gold leper folke shal haue whan deed bury graue royal rynge set rubye red troylus dowry sende hym agayne leaue wha deed make careful deth vnto kende thus conclude shortly make ende sprit leue diane dwels walke wt waste wodes welles diomede thou hast broche belt troylus gaue tokenyng true loue wt word swelt soone leper man toke rynge buryed withouten tarying troylus forth rynge bare creseyde deth declare whan herde great infirmitie legacy lamentatioun ended suche pouertie swelt wo fell downe swoun sorowe hert brast boun syghyng full sadly sayde nomore vntrue wo therfore som saith made tomb marble gray wrote name superscription layde graue laye golden letter cotaynynge reasoun lo fayre ladyes creseyde troy ye toune somtyme copted floure womanhed vnder stone late leper lyeth deed worthy woman balade short made worshyp instruction charitie monysh exhorte mynge nat loue false disception beare mynde sore conclusion fayre creseyde haue sayde syth deed speke nomore pthus endeth piteful dolorous testament fayre creseyde hereafter foloweth legende good woman pthe legende good woman thousande tymes haue herde men tel ioye heuen payne hel accorde wel nathelesse yet wot wele also ny none dwelling countrie eyther hath heuen hel ybe ne may none wayes wytten herde sayd founde wrytten assaye maye man preue god forbede men shulde leue well thynge han sene wt eye men shall nat wenen euery thynge lye yf hym selfe seeth el doth god wot thyng neuer lesse soth though euery wyght ne maye nat yse bernarde monke ne saugh al parde mote bokes fynde thrugh ye old thinges ben minde doctryne olde wyse yeue credence euery skylfull wyse tellen olde appreued story holynesse reygnes victory loue hate sondry thynges may nat make rehersynges yf olde bokes awaye ylorne remembraunce kay wel ought v honouren beleue bokes han non preue though yt lyte bokes rede delyte hem yeue fayth ful credence myne hert haue ben reuerence hertely game none fro bokes maketh gone seldom holy day saue certaynly wha yt moneth may comen yt foules synge floures gynnen sprynge farewell boke deuotioun haue eke conditioun floures mede loue floures white red yt men callen dayesies toune hem haue great affectioun sayd erst whan comen may bed daweth day nam vp walkyng mede seen floure ayenst sunne sprede whan vp ryseth early morowe blysful syght softneth al sorowe glad whan haue presence done reuerence floures floure fulfylled al vertue honour euer ylyke fayre fresh hewe euer loue euer ylke newe euer shal tyl myne hert dye swere nat wol nat lye loued wyght hoter lyue whan eue renne blythe assoone euer sunne gynneth west sene flour woll go rest feare nyght hateth darknesse chere plainly spred brightnesse sunne woll vnclose ala ne englyshe ryme prose suffisaunt floure preyse aryght helpeth ye han connynge myght ye louers make sentement case ought ye diligent forthren somwhat labour whether ye ben wt lese floure wel wot ye han beforne makyng ropen lad away corne come glenyng ful glad yf may fynde ere goodly worde ye han lefte though happen rehersen efte ye han fresh songes sayde forbereth beth nat euyll apayde syth ye se honoure loue eke seruyce floure yt serue haue wyt myght clerenesse lyght darke world wint ledeth hert within sorowful brest dredeth loueth sore yt ye ben verely mastres wyt nothyng word workes knytte bond harpe obeyeth ye hond make sowne fyngerynge ryght mowe ye hert brynge voyce ryght lyst laugh payn ye guyde lady souerayne myne erthly god call thys werke sorowes wherfore spake yeue credence olde storyes done hem reuerence men musten thynge beleue men may sene eye el preue shall seyne se tyme maye one speake ryme besy goost thursteth alway newe sene hys floure yoge fresh hewe constrayned wyth gredy desyre myne herte fele yet fyre made ryse er daye thys nowe ye fyrst morow may wyth dredfull herte glad deuocion ben resurrection floure shulde vnclose agayne sunne rose reed rose brest beest daye angenores doughter ladde away downe knee anone ryght set coulde thys freshe floure gret knelynge alwaye tyll vnclosed vpon small softe swete gras wt floures swete embrouded suche swetnesse suche adour ouer speke gume herbe tre comparyson may none ymaked surmounteth playnly odoures ryche beautye floures forgotten earth hys poore estate wynter hym naked made mate wyth hys sworde cold sore greued nowe hath atepre sunne releued naked clad newe agayne smale foules ceason fayne panter nette ben seaped vpon fouler hem made awhaped wynter destroyed brood dispite hem thought dyd hem good synge hym songe dyspyse foule chorle hys couetyse hem betrayed wyth hys sophistrye thys songe fouler defye hys crafte songen clere layes loue ioye worshyppyng praysynge make newe blysfull somers sake vpon braunches full blosmes softe delyte turned hem full ofte songen blessed saynt valentyne hys daye chese myne wythouten repentynge myne herte swete therwythall beckes gonnen mete yeldynge honoure humble obeysaunce loue dydden obseruaunce longeth vnto loue nature constrewe lyst cure tho done vnkyndnesse doth tidyfe newe fangelnesse besought mercy trespasynge humbly songe repentynge sworen blosomes trewe make wolde vpon hem rewe last maden accorde al foude dauger tyme lorde yet pyte hys stroge gentyl myght forgaue made mercy passen ryght innocence ruled curtesye ne cleape innocence folye ne false pyte vertue meane etycke sayeth suche maner meane thus foules voyde malyce acordeden loue laften vyce hate songe one accorde welcome sommer gouernour lorde zephirus flora gentelly yaue floures softe tenderly swote brethe made hem sprede god goddesse floury mede whych thought myght day day dwellen alway ioly monthe may wythouten slepe wythoute meate drynke adowne full softly gan synke leanynge elbowe syde longe day shope abyde nothynge el shall lye loke vpon deysye well reason men call maye dayesy el eye daye empryce floure floures praye god fayre mote fall louen floures sake nathelesse ne wene make praysynge floure agayne leefe nomore corne agayne sheefe ny leuer none ne lother nam wyth holden yet wyth neuer nother ne serueth leefe ne ye floure well brouken seruyce laboure thys thynge another tonne olde storye er thynge begonne yt sunne south gan west thys floure gan close gan rest derknes ye nyght ye whiche dredde home myn house ful swyftly spedde gon reste erly ryse sene flour sprede deuyse lytell herber haue benched turues freshe ygraue bade men shulde couche make deyntie newe sommers sake bade hem strawen floures bedde whan layde myn eyen hedde fell slepe slepte houre two mette howe lay medowe tho sene floure loue drede ferre came walkyng mede god loue hys hande quene cladde royall habyte grene fret golde next heere vpon whyte crowne beere wyth florouns small shall nat lye worlde ryght dayesye ycrowned wyth whyte leaues lyte florouns corown whyte perle fyne orientall whyte corowne ymaked white corowne aboue ye grene made lyke dayesye seme consydred eke fret golde aboue iclothed mighty god loue sylke embrouded full grene greues whiche fret reed rose leues freshest sen ye worlde fyrst begone gylte heere corowned sonne stede golde heuynesse weight therwith thouyt face shone bright well vnnethes might beholde hade thouyt saw holde two firy dartes gledes rede angelyke wynges sawe sprede men sayne blynde algate thought myght se sternely gan beholde lokyng dothe myn herte colde hande helde noble quene crowned wyth whyte clothed al grene womanly benygne meke world though yt men wold seke halfe beautie shulde nat fynde creature formed kynde therfore may sayne thynketh songe praysyng lady fre hyde absolon thy gylte tress clere hester lay thou thy mekenesse al adoun hyde ionathas al thy frendely manere penelopee marcia catoun make wyfehode comparysoun hyde ye beauty soude heleyne lady cometh al may distayne thy fayre body let nat apere lauyne thou lucrece rome toun polixene boughten loue dere cleopatra thy passyoun hyde ye trouthe loue renoun thou tisbe hast loue payne lady cometh may distayne hero dido laodomia yfere phillis hangyng demophoun canace espyed thy chere hipsyphile betrayed iasoun maketh trouth neytherboste ne soun hypermistre ariadne ye twayne lady cometh thys may distayne pthis balade may full well ysongen haue sayd erst lady fre certaynly mowe nat suffyse apperen wyth lady wyse sunne woll fyre distayne passeth lady souerayne good fayre debonayre pray god euer fall fayre nad comforte ben presence ben deed wythouten defence drede loues wordes chere whan tyme herafter ye shall behynde god loue vpon grene sawe comyng ladyes nynetene royall habyt full easy pace hem came woman suche trace sen god adam made erthe thyrde parte mankynde ferthe ne wende nat possibylyte euer thys wyde worlde ybe trewe loue woman echon whether yt woder thing non right anon gonne espye floure whych clepe dayesye full sodaynly stynten one kneled downe none songen voyce heale honour trouthe womanhede flour beareth alder prise fyguryng whyte corowne beareth wytnessyng worde acompas enuyroun sytten hem full softely adown first sate god loue sythe hys quene whyte corowne clad greue sythen remenaunt estate full curtesly ne nat worde spoken place moutenauce furlong way space knelyng floure good entente abode knowen people mente styll stone tyll laste god loue eyen caste said kneleth answerde vnto hys askyng whan herde sayd syr come hym nere salued hym doest thou nygh myne owne floure boldely better worthy trewly worme nighen nere floure tha thou sir lyke thou arte therto nothyng able relyke digne delytable thou foe folke werreyest myne olde seruauntes thou missayest hyndrest hem wyth thy translation lettest folke deuocion serue holdest folye serue loue thou mayest nat denye playne text wythouten nede glose thou hast translated romaut ye rose heresye ayenst lawe makest wyse folke fro withdrawe creseyde thou hast sayd lyste maketh men woman lesse tryste ben trewe euer stele thyn answere auyse ryght wele though thou renyed haste lay wretch haue done many day seynt venus mother thou lyue thou shalt repenten cruelly shall wel sene tho spake lady clothed al grene sayd god ryght curtesye ye mote herken yf replye agaynst thys ye haue meued god ne shulde nat thus agreued hys deyte shall stable therto gracious merciable yf ye nere god knowen might tellen shall thys man may falsely ben accused ryght hym ought ben excused court many losengeour many queynt toteler accusour tabouren eares many soun ryght ymaginatioun haue daliaunce enuy ben cause shall lye enuy lauender court alwaye ne parteth neyther nyght ne daye house cesar thus sayeth dant goeth algate wol want eke perauenter thys man nyce myght done gessynge malyce vseth thynges make recketh nought mater take hym boden make thylke twey persone durst wythsey hym repenteth vtterly thys ne hath done greuously amys translaten olde clerkes wrytten though malyce wold endytten dyspyte loue hym selfe wrought shuld riytwise lord haue thought lyke tyrauntes lombardy haue rewarde tyranny kynge lorde naturell hym ought tyraunt ne cruell fermour done harme must thynke hys liege man hys treasour hys golde cofre thys sentence philosophre kynge kepe hys liege iustyce wythouten doute hys offyce wol kepe hys lordes degre ryght skyll enhaunced honoured moste dere ben half goddes world yet mote done ryght pore ryche estate ylyche haue poore folke compassyon lo gentell kynde lyon flye offendeth hym byteth wyth hys tayle awaye flye smyteth easely hys gentrye hym deyneth wreke hym flye doth curre el another beest noble corage ought ben areest wayen euery thynge equite euer haue regarde vnto owne degre syr maystrye lorde dampne without answere word lorde full foule vse may nat excuse asketh mercy dredefull herte profereth hym right hys bare sherte ben ryght owne iugement ought god shorte auysement consydre owne honour trespace sythe cause dethe lyeth thys cace ought ben lightlyer mercyable leteth ire bethe somwhat tretable man hath serued hys connynges forthred wel law makinges nat well endyte yet hath made leude folke delyte serue preysyng name made boke yt hight house fame eke dethe blaunche duchesse parlyment foules gesse loue palamon arcyte thebe though storie knowe lyte many hympne holydaies hyghten balades roundel virelayes speke holynesse hath prose translated boece made lyfe also saynt cecyle made also gone great whyle origenes vpon maudelayne hym ought nowe haue lesse payne hath made many ley many thyng nowe ye god eke kyng alceste whylom quene trace aske man right grace ye hym neuer hurte hys lyue shall swearen blyue shall neuer agylten thys wyse shall maken ye woll deuyse woman trewe louyng lyfe ye woll mayden wyfe forthren moche misseyde rose el creseyde god loue answerd thus anon madame longe agon knewe charitable trew neuer yet sen worlde new ne founde better none ye woll saue degree may wol nat werne request lyth dothe wyth hym lest foryeue withouten lenger space yeueth yefte dothe grace tyme hys thanke shall demeth ye shall therfore go thanke nowe lady rose sette kne sayd thus madame god aboue yelde god loue haue maked hys wrathe foryeue grace longe lyue may knowe sothly ye haue holpen put degre trewly wende caas nought haue agylte ne done loue trespas trewe man withouten drede hath nat parten wyth theues dede ne trewe louer ought nat blame though speke false louer soe shame ought rather holde creseyde wrote tolde rose myne authour ment al gate god wotte myne entent forthren trouth loue cheryce ben ware fro falsnesse fro vyce whiche ensample menyng answerd let thyne arguyng loue ne woll nat countrepleted right ne wronge lerne thou haste thy grace holde ye right therto wol sayn penaunce yu shalt thy trespace vnderstonde thou shalt yt thou lyuest yereby yere moste partie thy tyme spende makyng gloriouse legende good woman maydens wyues trewe louyng lyues tell false men hem betrayen lyfe ne nat assayen howe many woman may done shame worlde hold game though lyke nat louer speke wel loue penaunce yeue god loue shall praye shal charge seruates way fortheren well thy labour quyte go nowe thy way penaunce lyte wha boke made yeue ye quene behalfe eltham shene god loue gan smyle sayd wost thou wher wyfe mayde quene countesse degre hath lytell penaunce yeuen haste deserued sore smerte pyte renneth sone gentyll herte mayst yu sene kytheth answerde nay syr haue blys se well good trewe tale myne hoode loue thou knowest well parde thou auyse haste thou nat booke thy cheste great goodnesse quene alceste turned dayesye husbonde chese dye eke gone hell rather hercules rescued parde brought hell agayne blys answerde agayne sayd yes nowe knowe thys good alceste dayesye myne owne hertes reste nowe fele wel goodnesse wyfe bothe dethe lyfe great bountie doubleth renoun well hath quyt myne affectioun haue floure dayesye wonder though ioue stellyfye telleth agaton great goodnesse whyte corowne beareth wytnesse also many vertues small florouns corowne remembraunce honour cibylla made dayesy flour crowned wyth white men may se mar yaue corown reed parde stede ruby set amonge white therwith quene wox red shae lyte whan praysed presence sayd loue full great neglygence ylke tyme thou made hyde absolon thy tress balade thou forgete thy songe sette sythe thou arte greatly dette wost well kalender woman wol louer taught crafte trewe louyng namely wyfehode lyueng boundes ought kepe thy lytell wytte thylke tyme slepe nowe charge vpon thy lyfe thy legend thou make wyfe whan thou haste smale ymade fare nowe well charge er go thus moche wol tell ne shall trewe louer come hell ladyes syttynge rowe ben balade yf thou const hem knowe thy bokes thou shalt hem fynde haue hem nowe thy legende mynde meane hem ben thy knowyng ben twenty thousande mo syttyng thou knowest good woman trewe loue aught may befall make metre hem lest mote gon home sunne draweth west paradys wyth companye serue alway freshe dayesye cleopatra woll thou begynne forthe loue shalt thou wynne let se nowe man louer wol done stronge payne loue wote wel thou mayste nat al ryme suche louers dyd tyme longe reden suffyseth thou make thys manere thou reherce lyfe great olde authours lysten treate shall many storye tel sey shortely shall longe dwel worde bokes gan take ryght thus legende gan make pthus endeth prologue phere begynneth legende cleopatra quene egypt dethe ptholome kyng al egipt gouernyng reigned hys quene cleopatra tyl tyme byfell suche caas rome sent senatour conqueren realmes honour vnto towne rome vsaunce haue worlde obeysaunce sothe say antonius name fyl fortune hym ought shame whan fallen prosperyte rebell vnto towne rome ouer thys suster cesare lefte falsly er ware wolde algates han another wyfe toke rome cesar stryfe nathelesse sothe ylke senatour ful worthy gentyll werryour hys dethe full great domage loue brought rage narowe bounden hys laas loue cleopatra worlde sette value hym thouyt ther nothyng due cleopatra loue serue hym thought armes sterue defence right noble quene eke loued knight deserte chyualrye certaynly yf bookes lye person gentylnesse discretion hardynesse worthy wight lyuen may fayre rose may maken shorte beste woxe wyfe leste weddyng feest deuyse haue ytake suche emprise many storye make longe leste shulde slake thyng beareth effecte charge men may ouerlade shyp barge thy effecte woll skyppe remenaunt woll let slyppe octauian woode dede shope hooste antony lede vtterly hys distruction wyth stoute romaynes cruell lyon shyp went thus let hem sayle antonius ware woll nat fayle meten romaynes yf may toke eke hys rede bothe vpon day hys wyfe hoste forth wente shyp anon lenger ne stente see happed hem mete vp goth trumpe shoute shete paynen hem sette sonne wyth grisly sowne goth great gonne hertely hurtlen al one fro ye toppe cometh ye gret stone gothe grapenell full crokes amonge rope ran sheryng hokes wyth polaxe preaseth behynde maste begynneth flye agayne driueth hem ouer borde stycketh hym vpon hys speares orde rente sayle hokes lyke sythe bringeth ye cuppe byddeth hem blyth poureth peesen vpon hatch slyder wyth pottes full lyme gone gyder thus longe day fyght spende tyll laste euery thyng hath ende antony shent put hym flyght folke go best go myght fleeth eke quene withal purpre sayle stroke yt went thicke hayle wonder might nat endure whan antony sawe ye auenture ala day borne worshyp thys day thus haue lorne dispayre hys wytte sterte xofe hym selfe anon throughout ye herte er ferther went place wyfe coulde cesar haue grace egypte fled drede distresse herkeneth ye speken kyndenesse ye men falsly swearen many othe ye wol dye yf loue wroth may ye sene woman suche trouth woful cleopatre hath made routh ny tonge none may tell morowe wol lenger dwel made subtyll werkme make shrine rubyes stone fyne egypte coulde espye put ful shrine spycerie let ye corse enbaume forthe fette deed corse shrine shette next shrine pyt doth graue serpentes might haue put hem graue thus seyde loue sorouful hert obeyde ferforthly fro blysfull houre swore ben frely meane antonius knyght neuer wakyng day nyght ye nere myn hertes remembraunce well wo carole daunce selfe couenaunt made tho ryght suche ye felten wele wo ferforthe power laye vnreprouable vnto wyfehod aye wolde felen lyfe dethe thilke couenaut whyle lasteth breth woll fulfyl shall well sene neuer vnto loue trewer quene ye word naked ful good herte amonge serpentes pytte sterte chese haue buryeng anon nedders gonne stynge dethe receyueth good chere loue antony dere storyall sothe fable er fynde thus trewe stable woll loue hys death frely take praye god let heades neuer ake phere endeth legende cleopatra foloweth legende tisbe babilon babylon whylom fell thus whych towne quene simyramus let dytchen aboute walles make full hye harde tyles well ybake dwellynge thys noble towne two lordes yt great renown woneden nygh vpon grene ther na stone wal hem betwene ofte great townes wonne soth sayne yt one man sonne lande one lustyest doughter fayrest eastward ye world tho dwellig name eueryche gan spryng woman neyghbours aboute countrey yet wythouten doute maydens ben ykept ielousye full streyte leste dydden folye thys yonge man cleped piramus tysbe hyght mayde naso sayeth thus thus reporte name yshoue woxe age woxe loue certayne reason age might haue ben bitwixt hem mariage father nolde assente loue ylyke sore brente none frendes myght lette priuely somtyme yet mette sleyght spaken desyre wrye glede hotter fyre forbyd loue ten tymes wode wal yt betwixt hem stode clouen two right fro toppe adoun olde tyme hys foundacion yet clyfte narowe lyte sene dere ynough myte loue espye ye louers two yf shall lye ye founden fyrst thys lytell narowe clyfte wyth sounde softe shryfte let wordes clyfte pace tolden whyle yt stoden place complaynt loue wo euery tyme durst one syde wall stode syde stode tysbe swete sowne receyue thus wardeyns wold dysceyue euery daye thys wall wolde threte wyshe god downe ybete thus wold sayne ala yu wycked wall thyne enuye thou v lettest nyit thou cleaue fallen two leest thou woldest yet woldest thou one let v mete one myght kyssen swete cured care colde nathelesse yet holde moche thou suffrest gone wordes thrugh thy lime eke thy stone yet ought wyth ben well apayde ydell wordes sayd colde wall wollen kysse stone take leaue forth wolde gone thys gladly euentyde wonder early lest men espyde loge tyme wrought manere tyl daye phebus gan clere aurora wyth stremes hete dryed vp dewe herbes wete vnto thys clyfte wonte come piramus come tisbe plyghten trouth fully fay ylke nyght steale away begyle wardeyns euerychone forth cytie gone feldes ben brode wyde mete place tyde set markes metynges shulde kynge ninus graue vnder tre olde paynems ydolles heryed vseden tho feldes ben buryed fast thys graue well shortly thys tale tell thys couenaunt affyrmed wonder fast longe hem thought sunne last nere gone vnder see adoun thys tisbe hath great affectioun great lykynge piramus se sawe tyme myght nyght stale awaye full priuely wyth face ywympled subtelly frendes saue trouth hath forsake ala routhe euer woman wolde trewe trusten man bet hym knewe tree goeth full good pace loue made hardy thys case well adowne gan dresse ala cometh wylde lyonesse wodde wythouten areest wyth bloody mouth stranglyng beest drynken well sat tisby espyed ryst vp wyth full drery herte caue wyth dredfull foote sterte moone sawe well wythall ran wymple let fall toke hede sore whaped eke glad escaped thus sate lurketh wonder styll thys lyonesse hath dronke fyll aboute well gan wynde ryght anone wymple gan fynde wyth blody mouth rente thys done lenger ne stente ye wodde way hath nome last thys piramus come longe ala home moone shone men myght well yse hys way come full faste hys eyen grounde adowne caste sonde behelde adoun sawe steppe brode lyoun hys herte sodeynly agrose pale wexte therwyth hys herte arose nere came foude wymple torne ala quod daye borne thys nyght wyll v louers slee howe shulde asken mercy tisbee haue slayne ala byddynge hath slayne thys caas ala bydde woman gone nyght place peryll fallen myght slowe ala ne thys place furlonge way crye nowe lyoun thys foreste body mote rente beste wylde gnawen mote myne herte worde ye wymple sterte kyst ofte wept full sore sayd wymple ala ny nomore thou shalt fele well bloode thou haste felte bledynge tisbe wyth yt worde smote hym ye herte bloode woude brode sterte water conduyt broken nowe tisbe whych wyst thys syttynge drede thought thus yf fall piramus comen hether may yfynde may holden false eke vnkynde cometh hym gan espyen wyth herte wyth eyen thought woll hym tellen drede lyonesse dede laste loue hath foude beatynge wyth hys heeles groude blody therwythall abacke sterte lyke wawes quappe gan herte pale boxe woxe throwe auysed gan hym well knowe piramus herte dere coulde wryte whych deedly chere hath tisbe nowe heere rente howe gan selfe turmente lyeth swouneth ye groude wept teeres full woude medleth bloode wt coplaint wt bloode seluen gan paynt howe clyppeth deed corse ala howe doth thys wofull tisbe thys caas howe kysseth hys frosty mouthe colde hath hath ben bold sleen lefe speake piramus thy tisbe calleth thus therwythall lyfteth vp hys heed thys wofull fully deed herde name tisbe cryen cast hys heuy deedly eyen downe agayne yeldeth vp goost tisbe ryst vp wythout noyse boost sawe wymple hys empty sheth eke hys swerde yt hym hath deth spake thus thy woful hade stronge ynough werke loue shall yeue strength hardynesse make wounde large ynough gesse woll folowen deed woll felowe cause eke thy dethe though yt nothynge saue deth myght fro departe truely thou shalt departe nowe fro fro deth woll go wyth nowe ye wretched ielouse father whylom chyldren prayen wythouten enuye graue moten lye sen loue hath brought v pitous end ryghtwyse god euery louer send loueth truly prosperite euer piramus tisbe let gentyll woman assure putten suche auenture god forbyd woman ben trewe louynge man parte shall anone kyth wyth ye word swerd toke swyth warme loues blode hote herte seluen smote thus tisbe piramus ygo trewe men fynde fewe mo bokes saue thys piramus therfore haue spoken hym thus deynte v men fynde man loue trewe kynde maye ye sene louer woman dare well phere endeth legende tysbe babilon foloweth legende dido quene cartage glorie honoure virgyle mantuan thy name shall folowe thy lanterne thou goest byforne howe eneas dido forsworne thyne eneyde naso woll take tenour great effectes make troye brought dystruction grekes sleyght namely synon faynynge horse offred vnto minerue yt many troya must sterue hector hys death apered fyre wode myght ben stered noble toure ilion cytie chefe dongeon countre lowe ybrought priamus kynge fordone nought eneas charged venus flyen awaye toke ascanius son right hade fledde hys backe bare wyth hym ledde olde father cleped anchyses way hys wyfe creusa lee mokell sorowe hys mynde er coulde felawshyp fynde laste whan hem founde made hym redy certayne stounde see ful faste gan hym hye sayleth forthe hys companye towarde itayle wolde destynee auentures see ny nat purpose speke acordeth nat matere sayd hym dido shall tale tyll haue longe sayled salte see tyll libye vnneth arryued wyth tempest shake whan hauen ytake knight called achatees hym hys felawshyp thees gone wyth hym countrey tespye toke wyth hym nomore companye forth gone lefte shyppes ryde feere wythouten gyde longe walketh wyldernesse tyll laste mette hunteresse bowe honde arowes clothes cutted vnto knee yet fayrest creature euer yformed nature eneas achates grette thus hem spake wha mette sawe ye ye han walked wyde sustren walke besyde wyth wylde bore beest haue hunted forest tucked vp wyth arowes caas nay sothly lady eneas thy beautie thynketh thou myghtest neuer erthely woman phebus suster art thou gesse yf thou goddesse haue mercy labour wo nam goddesse sothly tho maydens walken countre wyth arowes bowe manere realme libye ye bene whiche dido lady quene shortly tolde occasyon dido came regyon whyche nowe lysteth nat ryme nedeth nere losse tyme thys venus hys owne mother yt spake wyth hym thus cartage bad shulde dyght vanyshed anone hys syght coulde folowe worde worde vergyle wolde lasten longe whyle thys noble quene clypped dido whylom wyfe sitheo fayrer bryght sonne noble towne cartage hath begonne whych raygneth great honour holde quenes flour gentyllesse fredome beautee well hym myght one see kynges lordes desyred ye worlde beauty yfyred stode well euery wyghtes grace eneas come vnto place vnto mayster temple toun dido deuocioun full priuely hys waye hath nome large temple come sayne yf possyble venus hym maked inuisible thus sayeth boke wythouten lee thys eneas achates hadden thys temple ben ouer founde depaynted wall howe troye al lade dystroyed ala borne quod eneas ye world shame kyd wyde nowe paynted euery syde prosperite ben nowe dysclaundred suche degre lenger lyuen ne kepe wyth yt worde brast wepe tenderly routhe sene thys freshe lady cyte quene stode temple estate royall rychely eke fayre wyth yonge lusty wyth eyen glade yf god heuen earth made wolde haue loue beauty goodnesse womanheed troth semelynesse shulde louen thys lady swete ny woman hym halfe mete fortune hath world gouernauce hath sodaynly brought newe chaunce neuer yet frened caas company eneas whych wende haue lorne see armed nought ferre fro cyte whych greatest hys lordes auenture ben cyte come vnto temple seke quene socour beseke renoe ther sproge goodnesse tolde dystresse tempest harde caas vnto quene appered eneas openly beknewe ioye thys meyne hadde foude lorde gouernour quene sawe dyd honour herden ofte eneas er tho herte routh wo euer suche noble man shall ben dysherited suche degre sawe ye man yt lyke knyght suffysaunt persone myght lyke ben gentylman well hys wordes besette noble vysage none formed well brawne bone venus suche fayrnesse myght halfe fayre gesse well lorde hym semed straunger somwhat lyked hym bette god boote folke often newe thynge swote anone herte hath pyte hys wo wyth pyte loue came also thus pyte gentylnesse refreshed must ben hys dystresse sayde certes sory hath peryl caas frendly speche thys manere hym spake sayd ye may ye venus sonne anchyses good fayth worshyp encrees maye goodly done ye shall haue shyppes meyne shall saue many gentyll worde spake hym commaunded messangers go daye wythouten fayle hys shyppes seke hem vytayle full many beest shyppes sent wyth wyne gan hem present royall paleys spedde eneas alwaye wyth ledde nedeth feestes dyscryue neuer better ease hys lyue full feest deynties rychesse instrumentes songe gladnesse many amorous lokynge deuyse thys eneas come paradyse swolowe hell thus ioye remembreth hym hys estate troye dauncynge chabres ful paramentes ryche beddes pauementes thys eneas ledde meete wyth quene seete spyces parted wyne agone vnto hys chambre ladde anone take hys ease haue hys reste wyth hys folke done hem leste na courser well ybrydled none ne stede iustynge well gone ne large palfrey easy none ne iowell fret full ryche stone ne sackes full golde large wyght ne ruby none shyneth nyght ne gentyll hauten faukon heronere ne hounde herte wylde bore deere ne cuppe golde wyth floreyns newe ybet lande libye may ben gette dido ne hath eneas ysent payed hath spent thus ca honorable quene gestes cal fredome passen al eneas sothely eke wythout lee hath sent hys shyppe achates hys sonne ryche thynges sceptre clothes broches eke rynges weare presente al noble thinges sent bad sonne howe shuld make presentynge quene take repayred thys achates agayne eneas full blysfull fayne sene hys yonge sonne ascanyus hym reported thus cupido god loue prayer hys mother hye aboue lykenesse chylde ytake thys noble quene enamoured make eneas scripture maye make cure soth thys ye quene hath made suche chere vnto child woder presente hys father sent thanked hym ofte good entent thus thys quene pleasaunce ioye wyth newe lusty folke troye dedes hath enquyred eneas storye lered troye longe day twey entendeden speke pley whych gan breden suche fyre sely dido hath nowe suche desyre wyth eneas newe geste deale loste hewe eke heale nowe theffecte nowe frute haue tolde thys storye telle shall thus begynne fell vpon nyght moone vpreysed lyght thys noble quene vnto reste wente sygheth sore gon selfe turmente waketh waloweth made many braid done louers haue herde sayd laste vnto suster anne made mone riyt thus spak tha nowe dere suster myne may agasteth dreme quod thys ylke newe troyan thought thynketh wel ywrought eke lykely ben man therwyth mykell good al loue lyfe lyeth hys cure haue ye herde hym tell hys auenture nowe certes anne yf ye rede woll fayne hym ywedded thys ye effecte shulde seyne hym lyeth lyue deyne suster anne yt coulde good said thought somdele withstode longe sermonynge longe make rehersynge fynally maye wythstonde loue woll loue wyght wol wonde dawnynge vp ryst see thys amerous quene chargeth meyne nettes dresse speares brode kene huntynge woll thys lusty freshe quene prycketh thys newe ioly wo horse lusty folke ygo vnto court houndes ben ybrought vp courser swyfte thought yonge knyghtes heuen aboute woman eke huge route vpon thycke palfraye paper whyte wyth sadell reed enbrouded wyth delyte golde barres vp enbossed hygh sate dido golde perrey wrygh fayre bryght morowe healeth sycke folkes nyghtes sorow vpon courser startlynge fyre men myght turne hym wyth lytell wyre eneas lyke phebus deuyse freshe arayed hys wyse fomy brydell wyth bytte golde gouerneth ryght hym self hath wolde forth thys noble quene thys lady ryde huntynge wyth thys troyan syde heerde harte founden anone hey gobet prycke thou let gon let gone nyll lyon comen beare might one mete wt speare thus sayne yonge folke vp kyll wylde harte haue hem wyll amonge al thys romblen gan heuen thonder rored wyth grysly steuen downe come ye rayne wt hayle slet faste wyth heuens fyre made sore agaste thys noble quene also meyne eche hem glad awaye flye shortly fro tempest saue fled selfe lytell caue wyth went thys eneas also wyth hem yf went mo auctoure maketh mencion began depe affection bytwixt hem two ye fyrst morowe gladnesse gynnyng sorowe hath eneas ykneled tolde hys hurte hys wo sworne depe trewe well wo chaunge newe false louer well playne sely dido rewed hys payne toke husbode became wife euer whyle hem laste lyfe thys yt tempest stente myrth came home wet wycked fame vp rose anone howe eneas hath wyth quene ygone caue demed hem leste ye kyng yt yarbas hyght wyst loued euer hys lyfe wowed haue hys wyse sorow hath maked suche chere ruthe pyte loue aldaye happeth one shall laughen anothers wo nowe laugheth eneas ioye richesse euer troye sely woman full innocence full pyte truthe contynence maked men trusten haue ye routh vpon fayned wo haue suche olde ensamples beforne se ye howe ben forsworne se ye one ne hath lafte lefe ben vnkynde done myschefe pylled bosted hys dede ye maye well sene ye may rede take hede nowe thys great gentylman thys troyan well please fayneth hym trewe obeysynge gentyll preuy hys doynge well done hys obeysaunce feestes daunce whe goeth temple home ageine fasten tyll hath hys lady seyne bearen hys deuyses sake songes wolde make iusten done armes many thynges sende letter token broches rynges herkneth shal lady serue peryll sterue honger myschefe see desolate fledde fro hys countree hys folke wyth tempest al dryuen hath body eke realme yeuen hys honde myght haue bene lande cartage quene lyued ioy ynough wold ye thys eneas hath thus depe yswore wery hys crafte wythin throwe hote ernest ouerblowe priuely doth hys shyppes dyght shapeth hym steale awaye nyght thys dido hath suspection thys thought well amys hys bedde lyeth nyght syketh asketh anone mislyketh dere herte whych loue moste certes thys nyght father gost hath slepe sore turmented eke marcury message hath presented nedes conquest itayle destyne soone sayle thinketh broste myne herte therwyth hys false teeres sterte taketh wythin hys armes two ernest woll ye haue ye sworne wyfe take ala woman woll ye make gentyl woman quene ye woll fro wyfe thus foule flene borne ala shall tellen short noble quene dido seketh halowes doth sacrifyce kneleth cryeth yt routhe deuyse coniureth hym proffreth hym thral seruaut best degree falleth hym foote swouneth discheuyle bryght gylt heer sayth haue mercy let wt ryde lordes ye wonnen besyde woll destroyen sake ye woll wyf take ye haue sworn tha wol yeue leue sleen wt swerd sone eue yet shall dyen wyfe chylde yeue chylde lyfe mercy lorde haue pytie thought al thing auayleth ryght nouyt traytour forth gan sayle towarde large countre itayle thus hath left dido wo pyne wedded lady hyght rauyne cloth laft eke swerde stodynge whan fro dido stale slepyng ryght beddes heed gan hye whan stale awaye nauye cloth wha sely dido gan awake hath kyst full oft sake sayd swete cloth iupiter lest take soule vnbynde vnrest haue fulfylled fortune course thus ala withouten socourse twenty tyme yf wouned hath whan vnto suster anne coplayned may wryte great routh haue endyte bad norice sustren gon fetchen fyre thynges anon sayd wolde sacrifye whan myght tyme wel aspy vpon fyre sacrifyce sterte wt swerde rofe hert myn auctor sayth yet thus seyd hurt beforne deyed wrote letter anon tus began ryght whyte swan ayenst deth begynneth synge ryght make coplaynyng trowe getten agayne wel wot vayne syns yt goddes ben cotrarions syn name lost thrugh may well lese worde letter shalbe neuer better thilke wynde yt blew shyp away winde hath blowaway fay whoso wol al letter haue minde rede ouyde hym shal fynde phere endeth legende dido quene cartage foloweth legend hypsiphile medea thou rote false louers duke iason thou sleer deuourer confusion gentle woman gentle creature thou madest thy reclaymyng thy lure ladyes thy scathlyche apparaunce thy wordes farsed pleasaunce thy fayned trouth thy manere thyne obeysaunce humble chere wt thy counterfayted payne wo falsen one thou falsed two oft swore thou thou woldest dye loue whan thou ne feltest malady saue foule delyte whiche thou callest loue yf lyue thy name shalbe shoue englysh thy disceyte shalbe knowe haue iason thyne honoure blowe certes routh wo loue false louers worketh shal haue well better loue chere hath bought loue ful dere armes many blody boxe euer tender capon eateth foxe though false hath ye foule betrayde shall good man yt therfore payde although haue ye capon skil right false foxe wol haue parte nyght iason example wel ysene hypsiphyle medea quene thessalye ouyde telleth v knyght hyght pelleus brother hyght eso wha age myght vnethes gon yaue pelleus gouernyng al reygne made hym lord kynge eson iason getten tyme al ye land na suche famous knyght gentlenesse fredome strength lustynesse father death bare hym none lyst ben dyd hym al honour company pelleus hath great enuy imaginyng iason myght enhaunced put suche degree loue lordes regyoun fro reigne may put adoun wyt nyght compassed iason myght best destroyed withouten sclaunder compasment last toke aduysement sende ferre countrie iason may destroyed wyt al made iason great chere loke affectioun drede lest lordes espyde fyll fame ronneth wyde ther suche tydyng ouer al loo yle called colcos beyonde troy estwarde see ther ram men myght se flees golde yt shone bryght ther another syght kept alwaye drogoun many maruayles vp doune two bulles maked al bra spytte fyre moche thyng eke tale nathelees whoso wolde wynnen thilke flees must wynne myght bulles dragon fyght kynge otes lorde yle pelleus bethought vpon wyle neuewe iason wolde exhort saylen londe disport sayd neuewe yf myght suche worshyp myght fal thou famous tresure might win bringe region within great plesaunce honour holde quyte thy labour costes woll selfe make chose folke thou wolt wt thetake let se darst thou taken voyage iason yonge lusty corage vndertoke done ylke emprise anon argus shyppes deuyse iason went stronge hercules many hym ches whoso asketh hym gone let hym rede argonautycon woll tell tale longe ynough philoctetes anon sayle vp drough whan wynde good gan hye countrie called thessalye longe sayled salt see tyll yle lemnon arryued al rehersed guydo yet sayth ouyde epystles yle lady quene fayre yonge hypsiphile shene whylom thoas doughter kyng hypsiphile gone playing romyng cleuys see vnder banke anon espyed lay shyp iason gan aryue goodnesse adowne sendeth blyue weten yf straunge wyght tempest thyder wer yblowe anyght hym sucour vsaunce furthren euery wyght plesaunce bountie curtesye messenger adowne hym gan hye founde iason hercules also cogge londe ygo hein refreshen take ayre mornyng attempre fayre way messenger hem met ful conyngly lordes two gret dyd message askyng hem anon yf yt broken ought wo begon nede lodesmen vytayle socour shulde nothyng fayle vtterly quenes wyl iason answered mekely styll lady thanke hertely goodnesse v nedeth truly nothyng wery come playe see tyl wynde better way lady rometh clyffe play meyne endlonge stronde fyndeth iason stond spekyng thyng tolde hercules iason gan beholde yt quene fayre gret anon ryght lady met toke hede knewe manere arraye wordes chere gentleman great degree castel ledeth strauge folk doth hem great honor asketh hem trauayle laboure haue suffred salte see within daye two thre knewe folke yt shyppes iason full ronomee hercules great loo soughten auentures colcos dyd hem honour hem dealed euer longer ben worthy folke wtouten lee namely moost spake wt hercules hym hert bare shulde sad wyse true wordes auysee withouten affection loue ymagynacion hercules hath iason praysed sun hath vp raysed half true man na loue vnder cope heuen aboue wyse hardy secret ryche iii pointes ther na non lyche fredome passed lustyhede tho lyuen ben deed therto great gentleman thessalye lykely kynge na let agast loue speake shamefast hym leuer selfe murdre dye men shulde louer hym espye wolde god iyeue blood flesh yt myght lyue yu none yt ought wyfe estate suche lusty lyfe shulden lede lusty knyght al copassed nyght betwixt iason hercules two shrende lee come house vpon innocent bedote quene entent iason coye mayde loketh pytously nought sayd frely yaue counsaylers yeftes great offycers wolde god leyser tyme processe woing ryme house yf false louer right self doth right faynyng wt euery subtyl dede ye get nomore ye wol rede thoriginall telleth caas soth yt iason wedded vnto quene toke substaunce whatso lyst vnto purueyaunce vpon begat chyldren two drough sayle saw neuer mo letter sent hym certayne longe wryten sayne hym reproueth great vntrouth prayeth hym haue som routh chyldren two sayd lyke thyng ywys iason saue couth nat begyle prayed god longe whyle hert yreft fro must fynden hym vntrue also must chyldren spyll tho suffreth hym wyll true iason al lyfe euer kept chaste wyfe ne neuer ioy hert dyed loue sorowes smerte colcos come duke iason loue deuourer dragon matyre appeteth forme alway forme forme passen maye well botomlesse ryght iason haue pee desyren appetyte done gentyl woman delyte lust felicitie iason roomed forth cytie whylom cleped iasonicos master towne al colcos hath ytolde ye cause comyng vnto otes countrey kynge praying yt must done assaye get fleese golde yf may kynge assenteth boone doth hym honour doone ferforth yt doughter heyre medea wyse fayre fayrer saugh neuer man wt eye made done iason company meate syt hym hall nowe iason semely man withall lyke lorde great renoun hi loke royall lyoun goodly speche familiere coude loue al craft arte plenere withouten boke wt eueryche obseruaunce fortune ought foul mischauce woxe enamored vpon man iason ough se thyng ye ye ben yea selfe put moche dout whoso woll auenture atcheue may nat wele asterten leue withouten deth helpe nathelesse wyll forthren ye shall nat dye tournen sound home thessaly ryght lady iason tho ye haue deth wo regarde done honour wote wel myght ne labour may nat deserue lyues daye god thanke ne ne may man lowly beseche ben helpe withouten speche certes deth shall nat spare tho gan medea hym declare peril case fro poynt poynt battayle disioynt mote stande creature saue ne myght lyfe assure shortly ryght poynt go ben accorded fully betwixe hem two iason shal wed true knyght terme yset come soone nyght vnto chambre make othe vpon goddes lefe loth ne shulde neuer falsen nyght ne day ben husbond whyle lyue may deth hym saued herevpon nyght met yfere doth oth goth bed morowe vpwarde hym sped hath tauyt shal fayl fleese wyn stynten battayle saued hym lyfe honour gat hym name conquerour right thrugh sleight enchautmet hath iaso fleese home wet medea treasoures ful great vnwyst father gone thessaly duke iason lefe afterward hath brouyt mischef traytour go left yonge chyldren two falsely hath betrayed ala euer loue chefe traytour wedded yet thyrde wyfe anon doughter kynge creon mede louynge guerdon medea receyued duke iason right trouth kyndnesse loued hym better tha self gesse left father heritage iason vassalage dayes na neuer none yfounde false louer going grounde therfore letter thus sayde first wha falsenesse hym vnbraid lyked thy yelowe heer se boundes myne honestie lyked thy youth thy fayrnesse thy tonge ye infinite graciousnesse haddest thou thy conquest deed ybe ful mykel vntrouth dyed wt wel ouyde letter verse endyte longe wryte phere endeth legende hipsyphile medea foloweth legende lucresse rome mote sayne thexilyng kynges rome horrible doinges last king tarquinivs sayth ouyde tytus liuius cause tell nat story praysen drawen memory wyfe lucresse wyfehode stedfastnesse nat paynyms comende cleped legende great austyn hath compassioun lucrece starfe rome toun wyse wol shortly treat thyng touche great whan ardea besieged romaynes ye full sterne stout full longe lay siege lytle wroughten yt wer half ydle hem thoughte play tarquinius yonge gan iape lyght tonge sayd ydle lyfe noman dyd wyfe let v speake wyues best prayse euery man owne lest speche let v ease hert knyght hyght colatyn vp stert sayd thus nay syr nede trowen worde dede haue wyfe trowe holden good euer knowe go rome nyght shul se tarquinius answerd lyketh rome come fast hem dight colatyns house downe lyght tarquinius eke colatyne husbond knewe ye efters well fyne full priuely house gone gate porter none chambre dore abyde noble wyfe sat beddes syde discheueled malyce ne thought soft woll sayth liui wrought kepen fro slouth ydlenesse bad seruautes done besynesse asketh hem tydynges heren ye sayth men siege shal god wold walles fallen adowne myn husbod longe towne drede doth smerte ryght swerd styngeth myne hert whan thynke place god saue lord pray grace therwithall ful tenderly gan wepe werke toke nomore kepe mekely let eyen fall thylke semblaunt sate wel withall eke teares ful heuynesse embelesed wyfelye chastnesse countenaunce herte digne accordeden dede signe worde husbod colatin hym ware came stertlyng sayd drede nat anon vprose blysful chere kyssed hym wyues tarquinius proude kynges sonne conceyued hath beautye chere yelewe heer bountie manere hewe wordes yt hath coplayned craft beauty nat fayned caught lady suche desyre hert brent fyre woodly wyt al forgoten wel thought shulde nat goten aye dispayre coueyteth thought fayre blynde lust couetyng morowe wha byrde began synge vnto siege cometh full priuely hym selfe walketh sobrely ymage recordyng alway newe thus lay heer thus fresh hew thus sate thus span chere thus fayr manere conceyte herte hath newe ytake see tempest al shake whan storme al ago yet wol water quap day two right though yt forme absent plesaunce forme present nathelesse nat plesaunce delyte vnryghtfull talent despyte maugre shal lemman hap helpeth hardy man alway ende make shalbe gyrt hym wt swerde gan go forth ryght tyl rome come al alone way hath nome vnto house colatyne ful ryght ye sun day hath lost light come vnto priuy halke nyght full theuelye stalke whan euery wight rest brought ne wight treaso suche thought whether windowe bo gyn swerde ydrawe shortly cometh lay noble wife lucresse woke bed felt presse beest wayeth thus kynges sonne tarquinius thou crye noyse make yf thou creature awake thilke god formed man lyue swerd thyne hert shal riue therwithall vnto throte sterte set sworde sharpe hert word spake hath myght therto shal sayne wyt al ago ryght wolfe yt fayneth lambe alone shall coplayne make mone shal fyght hardy knyght wele wot men woman hath myght shal crye shal atterte hath ye throte wt swerde hert asketh grace sayd al yt wolt thou nat cruel man wysely iupiter soule saue shall stable slee thy knaue laye hym thy bed loude crye fande suche auoutry thus thou shalt deed also lese thy name thou shalt nat chese romaynes wyues louede name thilke tyme dredden shame fere slauder dred deth lost one wyt breth swough say woxe deed men myghten smyte arme heed feleth nothing neither foule ne fayre tarquinius art kynges heyre shuldest lynage ryght done lorde knyght hast thou done despyte cheualrye hast thou done thy lady vylanye ala ye vylaynous dede ye purpose story rede whan gone mischauce fall lady sent frendes father mother husbond yfere discheueled heer clere habyt suche woman vsed tho vnto burying frendes go sat hall sorowfull syght frendes asken aylen myght deed sat aye wepynge word shame ne may forth brig ne vpon hem durst nat beholde last tarquiny hem tolde ruful case al thyng horryble wo tel impossible frendes make one folkes hertes ben stone myght haue maked hem vpon rewe hert wysely trewe sayd gilt ne blame husbad shuld haue soule name wolde nat suffren waye answerde vnto faye foryaue ryght gylt laye myght sayden sample many one nought thus sayde anon may forgyuyng wyll haue forgyft nothynge priuely caught forth knyfe therwithall raft selfe lyfe fell adowe cast loke clothes yet hede toke fallyng yet care lest fete suche thynges lay bare wel loued clennesse eke trouth towne rome routh brutus hath chast bloud swore tarquin shuld ybanished therfore kyn let people call openly tale tolde hem openly let cary bere al town yt men maye se horryble dede oppressioun ne neuer ther kyng rome towne syns thilke day holden saynt euer day yhalowed dere lawe thus endeth lucresse noble wyse tytus bereth wytnesse tell loue trewe ne wyl chaunged newe stable hert sad kynde woman men may al day fynd cast hert ther dwelleth wel wot chryst self telleth israel wyde londe great fayth al ye londe ne fond woman lye men loke ye suche tyrannye done day assay whoso lyst trewest full brotell tryst phere endeth legende lucrece rome foloweth legende ariadne athene ivdge infernall mynes crete kynge cometh thy lot thou comest rynge nat thy sake onlye wrytten storye cleape ayen vnto memorye thesius great vntrouth loue goddes heuen aboue ben wroth wrath hath take thy syn red shame thy lyfe begyn mynos yt myghty kyng crete hundred cyties strong great schole hath sent son androgeus athene happed thus slayne lerning
