philosophye ryght citie nat enuye great mynos speke sonnes deth come wreke alcathoe besieged harde longe nathelesse walles stronge nisus kynge cytie chyualrous lytel dredeth mynos hoste toke cure tyl daye befel auenture nisus doughter stode vpon wall siege sawe maner happed scarmishyng cast herte vpon mynos kinge beautie chiualrye sore wende dye shortly thys processe pace made mynos wynnen thylke place cite al wyll sauen hym lyste el spyll wyekedly quyt kyndnesse let drenche sorowe distesse nere goddes pyte tale longe athene wan thys kyng mynos also alcathoe townes mo effecte ye mynos hath driue hem athene mote hym yeuen fro yere yere owne chyldren dere slayne ye shal mynos hath moster wicked beest cruel wythout areest wha yt brought presence nolde eate helpeth defence euery thyrde yere wythouten doute casten lotte came aboute ryche poore must sonne take hys chylde must present make mynos saue hym spyll let beeste deuoure wyll hath mynos done right dispyte wreke sonne set al hys delyte make hem athene hys thral fro yere yere whyle lyuen shal sayleth whan toun wycked custome longe yronne tyl athene kyng egeus mote senden hys owne sonne theseus sen lotte fallen vpon ben deuoured grace non forth ladde woful yonge knight vnto coutre king mynos ful might prison fettred fast tyl tyme shulde yfreten wel maist thou wepe woful theseus art kynges sonne dampned thus thynketh thou art depe yhold saued fro care colde nowe yf woman helpe wel oughtest thou seruaunt ben trewe louer yere yere nowe come ayen matere toure theseus throwe downe bottome derke wonder low ioynyng wal foreyne longyng vnto doughtren tweyne mynos chambres grete dwelten aboue maystre strete towne ioye solas nat howe happed par caas theseus complayned hym nyght kynges doughter ariadne hyght eke suster phedra herden al hys complaynte stode wal loked vpon bryght moone hem lyste go bedde soone hys wo compassion kynges sonne prison ben deuoured thought hem great pyte ariadne spake suster fre sayd phedra leue suster dere woful lordes sonne may ye pitously complayneth hys kynne eke hys poore estate inne gyltlesse certayne nowe routh yf ye wol assent trouth shal ben holpen howe phedra answerde ywys wo hym euer man hys helpe beste rede done gayler priuely come speake wyth v hastely thys woful wyth hym come yf may monster ouercome tha quyte ther non boote let v wel taste hym hys herte roote yf weapen haue lyfe dare kepe saue fyghten wyth thys fende hym defende prison shal discende ye wote wel beest place derke hath rome eke space welde axe swerde staffe knyfe thynketh shulde saue life man shal shal make hym balles eke also wexe towe whan gapeth faste beestes throte shal hem caste sleke honger encomber teth ryght anon whan theseus seth beest acheked shall hym leepe sleen comen heepe thys weapen shal gayler tyde ful priuely within prison hyde house crencled fro hath queynte wayes go shapen mase wrought therto haue remedye thought clewe twyne hath gone way may returne anone folowyng alway ye threde hath come whan thys beest ouercome may flyen away stede eke gayler may wyth lede hym auaunce home hys countre sen great lordes sonne thys rede yf ye dare take shulde lenger sermon make gayler cometh theseus whan thynges ben accorded thus downe sate theseus vpon hys kne ryght lady lyfe sorouful man ydampned deth fro whyles lasteth breth wol twynne thys auenture seruyce thus wol endure wretch vnknow woll serue euermore tyl myne herte sterue forsake wol home myne heritage sayd bene courte page ye vouchsafe thys place ye graunt haue grace may haue nat meate drinke sustynaunce yet wol swinke right lyste yt mynos ne wyght sen saw neuer euen sight ne man el shal espye slyly wel shal gye wel disfygure lowe worlde shal man know haue lyfe haue presence none thys excellence father shal sende thys worthy man gaylere hym guerdon shal wel one greatest men countre yf durst sayne lady bryght kynges sonne eke knyght wolde god yf myght ye countre al thre wyth beare companye shulde ye sene yf therof lye yf profer lowe manere ben page seruen ryght serue lowly place praye mar yeue grace shame deth mote fal dethe pouerte frendes al spirite nyght mote go deth walke fro mote traytoure haue name spirite mote go shame yf clayme euer degre ye vouchsafe yeue haue sayde shame death dey mercy lady naught el sey semly knyght thys theseus se yonge twenty yere thre ysene hys countenaunce wold haue wept routh penauce ariadne thys manere answerde hys profer hys chere kynges sonne eke knyght bene seruaunt lowe degree god shylde shame woman al lene neuer case befal sende grace sleyght herte also defende knyghtly sleen foe leene may fynde suster kynde ne repente nat yeue lyfe yet better wyfe syth ye ben gentyl borne haue realme nat faste yt suffred youre gentyllesse sterue let page sterue profyte vnto kyurede yt woll nat drede suster syth mote gone yf go el suffre dethe well ye vnto sonne trewely done wedded home coming thys final ende al thys thyng ye swere vpo al may sworne ye lady myne el torne mote wt mynotaur morow haueth myn hert blod borow ye wol yf knyfe speare wolde letten theron sweare erste wotte ye wolde leue mar chefe beleue myght lyuen nat fayle morowe taken batayle nolde neuer fro thys place flye tyl ye shulde profe se nowe yf soth shal say haue loued ful many day though ye ne wyst countre aldermoste desyred se erthly lyuynge creature vpon trouth sweare assure thys seuen yere haue seruaunt nowe haue also haue ye dere herte athene duchesse thys lady smyleth hys stedfastnesse hys hertely wordes chere suster sayd thys manere sothly suster myne quod nowe duchess ye sykerde regals athene hereafter lykely quenes saued fro hys deth kynges sonne euer gentyl woman wonne saue gentyl man enforth myght honest cause namely right thiketh wyght ought v herof blame ne bearen v therfore yuel name shortly thys mater make thys theseus hath leaue ytake euery poynte perfourmed dede ye haue couenaunt herde rede wepe clew thing yt haue sayd gayler house ylayd ther mynotaur hath dwellyng ryght faste dore hys entryng theseus ladde vnto hys deth forth vnto thys mynota geth teachyng adriane ouercame thys beest hys bane cometh clewe agayne ful priuely whan thys beest hath slayne gayler gotten hath barge hys wyues treasure gan charge toke hys wyfe eke suster fre gayler wyth hem al thre stole away lande nyght countre enupye hym dyght frende hys knowyng feesten dausen sing hys armes hath thys adriane ye beest hath kepte fro bane get hym noble barge anone hys countrey folke ful great wone taketh leaue homward sayleth yle amydde wylde see dwelte creature none saue wylde beestes ful many one made hys shyppe londe sette yle halfe daye lette sayd lande must rest maryners haue done ryght leste tel shortly thys case whan ariadne hys wyfe slepe suster fayrer taketh hand forth goth shyppe traytour stale away whyle thys ariadne slepe lay hys countreywarde sayleth blyue twenty dyuelway wynde hym dryue founde hys father drenched see lyst speake hym parde false louers poyson bane wol turne agayne adriane wyth slepe werynesse ytake ful soroufully herte may awake ala myne herte hath pyte ryght dawnyng awaketh gropeth bed fonde ryght nouyt ala euer wrought betrayed heere rente stronde bare fote fast went cryed theseus myne herte swete ye may mete myght thus wyth beestes bene yslayne holow rockes answerde agayne man sawe yet shone moone hye vpon rocke went soone sawe barge saylyng see colde woxe herte ryght thus sayd meker ye fynde beestes wyld hath nat synne thus begylde cryed turne agayne routh synne thy barge hath al hys meyne inne kerchefe pole stycked ascaunce shulde wele yse remembre behynde turne agayne stronde finde al naught way gone downe fel swowne stone vp ryst kyssed al care steppe fete hath fare bedde ryght thus speketh tho thou bedde yt hast receyued two thou shalt answere two one greater parte away gone ala wher shal wretched wight become though bote none come home countrey dare drede selfe thys case nat rede shulde tel coplaynyng longe heauy thyng epistle naso telleth shortly ende tell shall goddes haue holpen pyte signe taurus men may se stone crowne shyne clere wyl speake matere thus thys false louer begyle trew loue dyuel quyte wyle phere endeth legende ariadne foloweth legende phylomene thou yeuer formes hast wrought fayre world bare thy thought eternallye er thou thy werke began madest thou vnto slaunder man al thy doyng fende make thyng suffredest yu tereus bore loue false forswore fro worlde vp fyrste heuen corrumpeth whan ye folke name neuen grislye hys dede whan thys foule storye rede myne eyen wexen foule sore also yet lasteth venyme longe ago infecteth hym wolde beholde storye tereus whyche tolde trace lorde kynne marte cruel god stante wyth blody darte wedded wyth blysful chere kynge pandyonis fayre doughter dere hyght progue floure countre though iuno lyste nat feest ne hymeneus god weddyng feest redy bene ywys fury thre al mortal bronde oule al night aboute balkes wonde prophete wo mischaunce thys reuel ful songe ful daunce laste fourtenyght lytel lasse shortly thys storye passe wery hym tel fyue yere hys wyfe togyther dwel tyl day gan sore longe sene suster sawe longe desyre nyst say husbonde gan pray goddes loue mote one gone suster sene come ayen anone el mote wende prayed hym yt wold sende thys day day al prayere wyth al hublesse wisehode worde chere tereus let make hys shyppes yare grece hym selfe forth yfare vnto hys father law gan praye vouchsafe moneth twaye phylomene hys wyues suster myght progne wife one haue sight shal come agayne anone selfe wyl come gone hertes lyfe wyl kepe olde pandion king gan wepe tendernesse herte leue doughter gon yeue leue al thys worlde loued nothyng laste leaue hath go phylomene wyth salte teares eke gan father grace beseke sene suster longeth enbraceth wyth armes two al yonge fayre whan tereus sawe beaute array none lyche yet beaute ryche cast iry herte vpon wolde haue howe go wyth hys wyles kneled prayde tyl last pandion thus sayde nowe sonne art dere betake yonge doughter dere beareth key al myne hertes lyfe grete wel doughter thy wyfe yeue leaue somtyme pley maye se one dey sothly hath made hym ryche feest hys folke moste eke leest came yafe giftes grete hym coueyeth yt maister strete athene see hym brought turneth home malyce ne thought ore pulleth forth vessell faste trace arryueth laste vp forest ledde caue priuely hym spedde thys derke caue yf lyste nought badde rest herte agrose sayde thus suster brother tereus wythal wepte tenderly quoke feare pale pytously ryght labe wolfe bitte culuer yt egle smytten hys clawes escaped yet ferde waped leste hente eftsones sate vtterly may none force hath thys traytour done dede hath refte maydenhede maugre heed strength myyt lo dede men ryght cryed suster wyth ful loude steuen father dere helpe god heuen al helpeth yet thys false thefe hath done thys lady yet mischefe feare leste shulde hys shame crye done hym openly vyllany wyth hys swerde tonge kerfe castel made ful priuely prison euermore kept hys vsage hys store ne myght neuer astarte sely phylomene wo thyne herte huge bene thy sorowes wonder smert god wreke sende thy bone nowe tyme make ende sone thys tereus hys wyfe ycome hys armes hath wyfe ynome pytously wepte shoke hys heed swore foude syster deed thys sely progne hath wo nygh sorouful hert brake two thus teeres lette progne dwell suster forth woll tell thys woful lady ylerned youth worken enbrauden couth weauen stole radeuore woman hath woued yore sothly sayne hath fyl mete drynke clothyng wyl couth eke rede wel ynough endyte wyth penne coulde nat write letter weaue fro yere al go wouen stames large brouyt fro athene barge caue howe brought thynge ye tereus hath wrought waue well wrote storye aboue howe serued susters loue man rynge yaue anone prayed hym signes gone vnto quene bearen cloth signe swore many othe sholde yeue getten myyt man anone vnto quene dight toke al maner tolde wha yt progne hath thing beholde word spake sorow eke rage fayned gone pylgrymage baccus temple lytle stounde dombe suster syttyng hath founde wepyng castel selfe alone ala wo constraynte mone progne vpo dombe suster maketh armes eueryche hem taketh thus let hem sorowe dwell remenaunt charge tel thys al thus serued neuer agylte ne deserued vnto thys crewel man wyste ye may beware men yf lyste al wolde shame done tereus lese hys name ne serue murtherer knaue ful lytle whyle shul ye trewe hym haue wol sayn al brother yt may haue another phere endeth legende phylomene foloweth legende phillis proue wel auctorite wycked fruite commeth wycked tre may ye finde lyketh thys ende speke thys nowe tel false demophon loue falser herde neuer non hys father theseus god hys grace fro one kepe v thus woman prayen nowe effecte turne matere dystroyed troye cite thys demophon came saylyng see towarde athene hys paleys large came many ship many barge ful folke whych ful many one wounded sore sicke wo begone haue seige longe ylayne behynde came wynd eke raine shofe sore hys sayle myght nat stode leuer al worlde alonde hunteth hym tempest fro derke coulde go wyth waue brusten hys stere hys ship rente lowe manere carpenter coulde amende see nyght torche brende woode posseth hym vp downe tyl neptune hath compassioun thetis chorus tryton al maden hym vp londe fal wherof phillis lady quene lycurgus doughter fayrer vnto sene floure agayne bright sonne vnneth demophon londe ywonne weake eke wery hys folke forpyned werynesse also enfamyned deth almost ydryuen wyse folke counsayle haue yeuen seken helpe socour quene loken hys grace myght bene maken lande cheuesaunce kepen hym fro wo fro mischaunce sycke almost dethe vnneth myght speke drawe brethe lythe rodopeya rest wha may walke hym thouyt best vnto countre seken socour men knewe hym well dyd honour athene duke lorde theseus hys father hath ybe hys tyme great renoun man great al hys regioun lyke hys father face stature false loue came hym nature doth foxe renarde fox sonne kynd coulde olde father wonne wythout lore drake swymme whan caught caryed brymme honorable quene phillis doth chere lyketh wel hys sporte hys manere agroted beforne write hem yt loue bene forsworne eke hast legende performe god grace sende therfore passe shortly thys wyse ye haue wel herde theseus gyse betrayeng fayre adriane pyte kept hym fro hys bane shorte wordes ryght demophon way pathe hath gone dyd hys false father theseus vnto phillis hath sworne thus wedden hys trouth plyght pyked al good myght wha hole sounde rest doth wyth phillis yt hym lest wel coulde yf lyst tellen al hys doyng fro sayd hys countrey mote sayle wolde weddyng apparayle fyl honoure hys also openly toke hys leaue tho swore wolde soiourne moneth agayne wolde retourne lande let make hys ordynaunce lorde toke obeysaunce wel humbly hys shyppes dyght home goth next way myght vnto philles yet came nought hath hard sore ybought ala storye doth v recorde owne deth wyth corde whan sawe demophon trayed fyrst wrote fast prayed wolde come delyuer payne reherce shal worde twayne lyst nat vouchsafe hym swynke dispenden hym penne ful ynke false loue ryght syre dyuel sette soules fyre letter phylles wol write word twayne althouy lyte thyn hostesse demophon thy phillis wo begon rhodopeye vpon mote complayne ouer terme sette betwyxt v twayne ye ne holden forwarde ye sayde ancre whych ye hauen layde hyght v ye wolde comen dout moone one went tymes foure ye mone hath hyde face sen thylke daye ye wente fro thys place foure tymes lyght worlde agayne yet shall sothly sayne yet hath streme scython brought athene shyp yet came nought yf ye terme reken wolde trewe louers sholde playne god wote beforne day letter wrytten ne may order charge letter ryght longe therto large ryme haue layde thought hath wel sayd sayd sayles cometh agayne ne worde ny fey certayne wote ye come quod loue fre goddes ye haue swore vengeaunce fall therfore ye suffysaunt beare payne moche trusted well may sayne vpon lynage fayre tonge teeres falsly wronge howe coude ye wepe crafte quod maye suche teeres fayned nowe certes yf ye wold haue memorie ought lytell glorie ta haue sely mayde thus betrayde god pray ofte haue prayde nowe greatest pryce moste honour euer shal befall thyne olde aunceters paynted whych men may worthynesse se praye god thou paynted also folke may reden forth go lo thys wyth hys flatterye betrayed hath done villanye hys trew loue thought dede sothly poynt yet maye rede ye ben lyke father thys begyled ariadne ywys wyth arte suche subtelte thou thy seluen haste begyled poynt though feyre thou folowest certayne arte heyre sen thus synfulfy ye begyle body mote ye sene wythin whyle ryght hauen athene fletynge wythouten sepulture buryenge though ye ben harder stone whe thys letter forth sent anone knewe brotel false dyspayre fordyd selfe ala sorowe hath beset beware ye woman subtyll foe sen yet thys daye men maye ensample se trusteth nowe loue man endeth legende phillis foloweth legende hipermester grece whylom brother two whych one called danao many sonne hath hys body wonne fals louers oft co amonge hys sonnes one aldermoste loued euerychone whe chyld borne danao shope hym name called hym lyno brother called egiste loue false euer hym lyste many doughter got hys lyfe whych got vpon hys ryght wyfe doughter dere dyd call hypermestra yongest hem whych chylde natiuite good thewes borne lyked goddes borne shefe shulde corne werdes clepen destyne hath shapen muste nedes pytous sadde wyse trewe stele thys woman accordeth wele though yt venus yaue great beaute wyth iupiter compowned conscience trouth drede shame wyfehode kepe name thys thought felicyte reed mar tyme yere feble hys malyce hym rafte repressed hath venus hys crafte wyth venus oppression house mar hys venym hypermester dare handle knyfe malyce though shulde lese lyfe nathelesse heuen gan tho turne two badde aspectes hath saturne made dye pryson shall make mencion danao egystes also though yt brother two thylke tyme na spared lynage lyked hem maken mariage betwyxte hypermestre hym lino casten suche daye shalbe full accorded vtterly aray wrought tyme fast thus lyno hath hys father brother doghter wedded ech hath torch brennen lampes bryght sacrifyce ben full redy dyght thensence fyre reketh soote floure leefe rent vp roote maken garlandes crownes hye full place sounde mynstralcye songes amourous mariage thylke tyme playne vsage thys paleys egyste house lord right lyst thus daye dryuen ende frendes taken leue home wende nyght comen ye bryd shal go bedde egyste hys chambre fast hym spedde pryuely let hys doughter call yt house voyded hem loketh hys doughter glad chere spake ye shall ryght doughter tresour myne herte sen fyrst yt day shape sherte fatall suster dome nye myne herte neuer thynge ne come thou hypermestre doughter dere take hede thy father sayeth werke wyser euermo alderfyrst doughter loue worlde ny halfe lefe ne nolde rede thy myschefe good vnder colde moone mene shalbe sayd right soone wyth protestacion sayne wyse thou shall deuyse thou shalt deed yt al hath wrouyt short wordes thou ne scapest nought paleys thou deed thou consent werke reed take thys fearfull conclusyon thys hypermister caste eyen doun quoke doth leefe aspe grene deed wext hewe lyke asshen sene sayd lorde father wyll myght god wote shall fulfyll confusyon nyll quod haue none excepcion caught knyfe rasour kene hyde thys ysene thyne husbande bedde go whyle slepeth cutte hys throte two dremes warned howe neuewe shall bane whych wherfore woll syker yf thou say nay two shall haue byker haue sayd haue sworne hipermister hath nigh wyt forlorn passen harmlesse yt place grauted hi ther none grace wythal costrel taketh tho sayd herof draught two yeue hym drynke goeth reste shall slepe longe euer leste narcottikes pie ben stronge go thy way lest yt hym thynke longe cometh ye bryd ful sobre chere maydens ofte manere chabre brought reuel songe shortly lest thys tale longe thys lino beth brought bedde euery wyght dore spedde nyght wasted fell slept full tenderly begynneth wepe ryst vp dredfully quaketh doth brauche zephirus shaketh hushte argone cyte colde frost nowe wexeth pyte herte strayned drede deth doth moche wo thryse downe fyll suche ryste vp stakereth handes fast loketh ala shall myne handes bloody mayde nature semblaunt vesture myne handes ben shapen knyfe reue man fro hys lyfe dyuell haue wyth knyfe shall haue throte corue two shall blede ala shende nedes thys thynge mote haue ende mote nedes lese lyfe nowe certes quod sen hys wyfe hath fayth yet bette deed wysely honeste traytour lyuynge shame may ernest game shall awake ryse go hys way thys gutter er day wept full tenderly vpon hys face armes gan hym embrace hym roggeth awaketh softe wyndowe lepe fro lofte whe hath warned hym hym boote thys lino swyfte lyght foote ran full good paas thys sely woman weake ala helpelesse er ferre wente cruell father dyd hente ala lyno arte thou vnkynde ne haste thou remembred thy mynde taken ledde forth wyth sawe gone away myght faste go ne folowen hym sate downe ryght tho tyll caught fettred prison thys tale sayd thys conclusyon pthus ende legendes good woman pa goodly balade chaucer mother norture best loued freshest floure good thrift god sede chylde yf lust call vnable selfe pretende dyscrecion recomende myne herte wyth euery circustauce hooly vnder gouernaunce moste desyre haue euer shall thing might herts ease amede haue excused power small nathelesse ryght ye ought comende good wyll whych fayne wolde entende seruyce suffysaunce holy vnder gouernaunce meulx vn herte whych neuer shall apall aye freshe newe ryght glad dyspende tyme seruyce befal besechynge excellence defende symplenesse yf ignoraunce offende wyse syth myne affyaunce holy ben vnder gouernaunce daysy lyght grounde comforte sunnes doughter ye hyght rede whe westreth farwel dysporte nature anone ryght pure drede ye rude nyght yt wyth boystous wede darkenesse shadoweth emyspere closen ye lyues lady dere dawynge daye hys kynde resorte pheb father wt stremes rede adorneth morowe consumynge sorte mysty cloudes wolden ouerlede trewe humble hertes wyth mystyhede nere comforte dayes eyen clere dysclose sprede lyues lady dere ie vouldray great god dysposeth maketh casuell hys prouidence suche thinge ma frele wytte purposeth best yf conscience grutche humble pacience receyue god sayeth wythout fable faythfull herte euer acceptable cautels vseth gladly gloseth eschewe suche ryght hygh prudence ye sayd one herte opposeth wrytynge iapes absence pleased moche better presence yet ye excusable faythfull herte euer acceptable quaketh penne spyrit supposeth writing ye fynd wol offece myn hert welkneth thus sone anon riseth hotte colde efte feruence mysse caused negligence malyce therfore beth mercyable faythfull herte euer acceptable plenuoye pforth coplaynt forth lackynge eloquence forth lytell lettre endytynge lame haue besought ladyes sapience thy behalfe accepte game thyne inabilite thou abyde haue yet ie serue iouesse forth close holy venus name shall vnclose hertes gouerneresse pfinis pthus endeth thys balade foloweth boke boecius de consolatione philosophie pboetius de consolatione philosophie fyrst boke boecius carmina qui quondam studio florente peregi flebilis heu mestos cogor inire modos ala wepynge constrayned begyn vers soroufull mater whylom flourisshynge studye made delitable dytees lo rendynge mus poetes endyten thynges written drery teeres last drede ne myght ouercome tho mus ne felowes folouden way say whan exiled youthe whylom weleful grene comforten nowe soroufull wyerdes olde man elde comen vnwarely vpon hasted ye harmes haue sorowe hath comaunded hys age heeres hore arne shadde ouertymelyche vpon heed slacke skynne trembleth myn empted body thylke dethe men weleful ne cometh nat yeres beswete cometh wretch often ycleped ala ala howe deefe eere dethe cruel turneth awaye fro wretch nayeth close wepynge eyen whyle fortune vnfaythfull fauoured wyth lyght goodes soroufull houre saye dethe almoste dreynt myn heed nowe fortune cloudy hathe chaunged deceyuable chere mewarde myne vnpytous lyfe draweth alonge vnagreable dwellynges ye frendes wherto auaunted ye ben welefull hath fallen stode stedfast degre hec dum mecum tacitus ipse reputarem queremoniam que lachrimabilem stili officio designarem astitisse mihi supra verticem visa est mulier reuerendi admodum vultus oculis ardentibus vltra communem c meane whyle styl recorded thynges selfe marked wepely complaynt wyth offyce poyntell saugh stondynge abouen hyght myne heed woman full great reuerence semblaunte eyen brennynge clere seyng ouer commen myght men wyth lyuely colour wyth suche vigour strength ne myght nat ben nempned full great age men ne wolden nat trowe maner elde stature doutous iugemet somtyme constrayned shronke seluen lyke commen mesure men somtyme semed touched heuen wyth height heed wha houe heed hyer perced selfe heuen syght men lokynge ydell clothes maked ryght delye thredes subtyll crafte perdurable matiere whiche clothes wouen wyth owne handes knewe well selfe declaryng shewyng beaute clothes derknesse forleten dispysed elde dusked derked wonte derke smoked ymages ye netherest heme bordure clothes men redde ywouen therin grekishe signifieth lyfe actyue aboue letter hyest bordoure grekysshe c signyfyeth lyfe contemplatyfe bytwene two letter sene degree nobly wrought maner ladder degree men might clymben netherest lettre vpperest nathelesse handes men hadden kerue clothe violence strength euerych man hem borne awaye suche peces myght geten forsothe thys foresayde woman bare smale bookes right hande lyfte hande bare sceptre whan sawe poetycall mus approchyng aboute bed enditynge wordes wepynges lytell amoued glowed wyth cruell eyen hath suffred approchen thys sycke man comen trompettes whych place men callen theatre whiche onelye ne aswagen nat hys sorowes remedy wold feden nourishe hym wyth swete venym forsothe ben tho thornes prickynges taletes affection ben nothing fructuous profytable distroyen corne plentuous fruites reason holden hertes men vsage ne delyuer folke fro maladye yf mus wythdrawen fro wyth youre flatteryes anye vnconnynge vnprofytable man ben wonte fynde comenly among people wolde well suffre lasse greuously suche vnprofytable man myne entente nothyng endamaged ye wythdrawen fro man hathe ben nourysshed studyes scholes eleaticis achademicis grece goth nowe rather awaye ye mermaydens whyche ben swete tyll laste suffreth thys man cured heled mus saye notefull science thus thys companye mus yblamed tasten wrothly chere downwarde erthe shewynge reednesse shame passed n soroufully thressholde whome syght plounged teeres derked ne might nat knowe woman imperyall auctorite woxe abasshed stonyed cast syght downe erthe began styll abyde wolde done afterwarde came nere set downe vpon vtterest corner bedde beholdynge chere caste erthe heauy greuous wepyng coplayned wyth wordes shall sayne perturbacion thought heu quam precipiti mersa profundo men hebet propria luce relicta tendit ad externas ire tenebras terrenis quoties flatibus acta crescit immensum noxia cura hic quondam celo liber aperto c ala thought man dreynt ouerthrowyng depnesse dulleth forletteth propre clerenesse mynting gone forayne derkenesse ofte hys anoyous busynes wexeth without mesure driuen wyth worldely wyndes man whylom free heuen open knowen wonte gone heuenly pathes sawe lightnesse reed sunne behelde sterres colde moone whiche sterre heauen vseth wandrynge recourse yflytte dyuers sphere thys man ouercomer comprehended thynge nombre acomptyng astronomye ouer wont seken cause whence ye sownyng wyndes mouen besyen smothe water see spyrite tourneth stable heuen sterre ryseth reed este fallen westren wawes attempreth lusty houres fyrst sommer ceason hyghteth apparayleth erth wyth rosy floures maketh plentuous autumpne full yeres fleten wyth heuy grape eke thys man wonte tell dyuers cause nature hydde ala howe lightly empted lyght hys thought hys necke pressed wyth heuy cheynes beareth hys chere enclyned downe great weight constrayned loken fole erthe sed magi medicine inquit tempus est quam querele boe tu vero totis intenta luminibus philo tune ille e qui nostro quondam lacte nutritus nostriseducaius alime ti virilis animi robur cuaseras c bvt tyme nowe medicine tha complaynte forsothe entendyng warde wyth lokyng eyen sayde ar e thou whylom nourished mylke fostred wyth mete escaped comen corage parfayte man certes yaue suche armures yf thou thy selfe ne haddest fyrste caste hem awaye shulden haue defended sykernesse may nat ouercomen knowest thou art thou stil shame astonyeng leuer shame semeth astonyenge hathe oppressed whan sawe onely styll rather wythout offyce tonge dombe layde hande softely vpon breste sayde peryll fallen lytarge whiche comune sycknesse hertes ben disceyued hath lytell foryeten selfe certes shall lightly remembren hym selfe yf hath knowen nowe maye doone wyll wype hys eyen lytell derked cloude mortall thynges wordes sayd wyth lappe garneme yplited frouce dried myne eyen full wawes wepynges tunc discussa liquerunt nocte tenebre luminibus que prior redit vigor vt cum precipiti glomerantur sidera choro nimbosis que polus stetit imbribus sol latet ac non dum celo venientibus astris c thus whan nyght discussed away derkenesse lete myne eyen repayred agayn first stregth right ensample sonne hydde whan sterres ben couerde cloudes swyfte wynde hyght chorus firmament stante derked wete plungy cloudes sterres aperen vpon heuen nyght semeth sprad vpon erthe wynde hight boreas ysent caue coutrey trace beateth thys nyght sayne chaseth awaye discouereth closed daye shyneth phebus yshaken sodayne lyght smyteth hys beames marueylyng eyen haud aliter tristicie nebulis dissolutis hausi celum ad cognoscenda medicantis faciem mentem recepi ita que vbi ea deduxi oculos intuitum que defixi respicio nutricem meam cuius ab adolescentia c right wyse ye cloudes sorowe dissolued done away toke heuen receyued mynde knowen face phisycien sette myne eyen vpon fastned lokyng behelde norice philosophie whose house conuersed fro youthe sayde thus thou maystresse al vertues discended souerayne sete art thou comen solitary place myne exile arte thou comen thou arte made coulpable wyth false blame quod norice shulde forsake nowe shulde parten comen trauayle ye charge thou haste suffred enuy name certes lefull ne syttyng philosophie leten wythout company way yt innocent shuld redoute blame agrise though befallen new thyng trowest thou philosophie nowe alder fyrste assayled peryls folke wycked maner haue stryuen wyth full great stryfe olde tyme age plato ayenst foolehardynesse folye eke plato lyuyng hys mayster socrates deserued victorie vnryghtfull dethe presence herytage whyche socrates heritage sayne doctryne whyche socrates hys opinyon felycite cleape welefulnesse whan people epycuriens stoiciens many enforced go rauishe euery man hys parte sayne eueryche hem wolde drawen defence hys opinyon wordes socrates partye praye drawen cryenge debatynge therayenst coruen renten clothes wouen wyth myne owne handes wyth tho clothes araced clothes wenten awaye wenynge gone wyth hem euerye dele whyche epicuryens stoiciens moche semed trace steppe habyte folye wenyng tho epicuryens stoiciens famyliers peruerted erroure wycked multytude hem thys sayne semed philosopher pursued dethe slayne yf thou hast knowen exilynge anaxagoras ne enpoysonynge socrates ne turmentes zeno straungers yet myghtest thou haue knowen sen ca canios soranos whyche folke renomme neyther ouer olde ne vnsolempne whyche men nothynge el ne brought dethe onely enformed maners semeden moste vnlyke studyes wycked folke thy thou oughtest wondren though bytter see dryuen wyth tempestes blowynge aboute whych moste purpose sayn displesen wicked men shrewes hooste neuer great dispyse gouerned leader reason rauyshed onely fletynge errour fol ly lightly yf somtyme make hooste ayenste v assayle v strenger oure leder draweth togyther hys riches hys tour ben ententyfe aboute sarpleris sachelles vnprofytable taken ben hygh abouen syker frome tumulte woode noyse warnestored enclosed paleys whyther claterynge anoyeng foly may attayne scorne suche raueners henters foulest thynges quisquis composito serenus euo factum sub pedibus egit superbum fortunam que tuens vtra que rectus inuictum potuit tenere vultum c clere vertue sad well ordynate lyuyng hath put vnderfoot proude wyerdes loketh vpryght vpon eyther fortune maye holden hys chere vndyscomfyted rage ne manaces see commonynge chasynge vnware heate frome bottome ne shall nat moue man ne vnstable mountayne hyght vesenus writheth hys broken chymeneyes smokynge fyres ne waye thonder leyte wonte smyten hygh toures ne shall nat moue man wherto wretch drede ye tyrauntes ben wood felonous wyth strength hope nothynge ne drede thou shalte thou disarmen ire thylke vnmyghty tyraunte quakynge dredeth desyreth thynge stable hys right man doth hathe caste awaye shilde remoued fro place enlaseth chayne wyth whyche may drawen sentis ne inquit hec que animo illabuntur tuo expers ne e lyre quid fles quid lachrimis manas si opera medicantis expectas oportet vt vulnus detegas tuum c felyst thou thynges entren aught thy corage arte thou lyke asse harpe wepest thou spyllest tho teeres thou abydest helpe thy leche ye behoueth discouer thy wounde tho gathered strength corage answerde sayd nedeth rehersynge amonicion sheweth ynough hym selfe sharpnesse wexeth woode ayenst ne moueth se ace maner thys place librarye thou haddest chosen ryght certayne syege myne house thou dysputest oft wyth science thynges touchynge dyuynite touchynge mankynde myne habyte suche nowe face chere suche whan sought wyth secretes nature whan thou enformedest maners reason lyfe thensample ordre heauen thys guerdon referre haue obeysaunt certes thou enformedest mouthe plato thys sentence sayne comen thynges comynaltees blisfull yf studyed fully wysdome gouerneden thylke thynges el yf befell gouernours comynaltees studiden get wysedome thou saydest eke mouthe sayde plato necessarye cause wyse men taken desyren gouernaunce comen thynges gouernemetes cytes yleft handes felonous tourmentours cytezeins ne shulden bryngen pestilence distruction good folke therfore folowynge thylke auctours desyred put forthe execution acte comen administracion thylke thynges lerned among secrete restyng whyles thou god put thoughtes wyse folke ben knowynge wyth nothynge ne brought maistrye dignyte comen studye goodnesse therfore cometh bytwene wyked folke haue ben greuous dyscordes ne myghten released prayer lyberte hath fredom coscience wrathe myghty folke hathe alwaye ben dispysed sauacyon ryght howe ofte haue resysted wythstande man hyght canigast made alway thassaute aienst prosper fortune poore feoble folke howe ofte eke haue put caste hym triguyl prouost kynges house bothe wronges begonne done eke fully perfourmed howe often haue couered defended ye auctorite put ayenst peryls sayne put myne auctorite peryl wretched poore folke couetyse straungers vnpunyshed turmenteden alwaye wyth miseases greuauces nombre neuer man yet drowe fro ryght wronge whan sawe fortune rychesses people prouynces ben harmed amenused eyther priuy rauynes comen trybutes cariages sory suffreden harme glose whan theodorike kynge gothes deed yere hys garner full corne commaunded man shulde bye corne tyll hys corne solde greuous dere price boece wythstode ordynaunce ouercame knowynge thys kyng theodorike hym selfe coempcion say comen achate byenge togyther astablysshed vpon people suche maner imposycion bought busshell corne muste yeuen kynge fyfthe parte textus wha sore hongry tyme establysshed greuous vnprofytable coempcion men sene well shulde greatlye turmenten endomagen al prouynce campayne toke stryfe ayenst prouost pretorie comen profyte knowynge ouercame coempcio asked ne tooke effecte paulyne counsaylour rome rychesses whyche paulyne houndes paleys saye thoffycers wolden haue deuoured hope couetyse yet drawe iawes hem gapeden moche payne accusacion aiuged beforne ne shulde sodaynly henten ne punyshen wrongfully albyne cousaylour rome put ayenst hate indignacions accusour ciprian ynough sen haue purchased great discordes ayenst selfe ought assured ayenst folke loue ryghtwysnesse neuer reserued nothyng selfe hem warde kynges hall whych syker tho accusours accusynge condempned nombre whiche accusours one basilius yt whylom chased ye kynges seruice nowe compelled accusynge name nede forayne money also opilion gaudencius haue accused albe iustyce regall whylom demed bothe gone exyle trecheryes fraudes without nombre iudgement nolden obey defended hem sykernesse holy house sayne stedden seyntwary whan apperceyued kyng comaunded voyded cyte rauenne certayne daye assigned menne shulde marke hem ye forheed hote yron chasen hem town nowe thyng semeth might lykened cruelte certes daye receyued accusyng name thylke accusours may sayd hereto hathe studye connynge deserued thus el foresayde dampnacion made ryghtfull accusours greythed deth al good men algates fortune shamed thys certes nat fortune ben asshamed ye innocence accused yet ought haue shame ye fylthe myne accusours aske thou gylte accused men sayne wolde sauen companye senatours desyrest thou heren maner accused shulde haue distourbed accusoure bearen letter whyche shulde haue made senatours gyltye ayenst kynges royall mayeste maystresse demest thou thys shal forsake thys blame ne shame certes haue wolde saye sauacion senate ne shall neuer lette wylne confesse knowe thentente accusoure ben distourbed shall cease shall cleape felonye synne haue desyred sauacyon ordre senate certes thylke senate doone decretes iugeme te though synne felonye wylne sauacyon folye lyeth alwaye hym selfe maye chaunge meryte thynges ne trowe iugement socrates lefull hyde sothe ne assente leasynges certes howe euer put gessen prysen iugement wyse folke whych thynge ordynaunce sothe moche folke ben comen oure dayes shall knowen haue put scripture remembraunce touchynge letter falsely made whyche letter accused haue hoped fredome rome apertayneth speken therof whyche letter fraude ben shewed apertely yf lybertye haue vsed ben confessyon myne accusours whyche thynge nedes hathe great strength fredom may men hopen certes wold fredome myght hoped wolde haue answerde wordes man hyght camus whan accused canyus cesar germanes sonne knowynge consentynge coniuracion ymade agaynste thys canyus answerde thus yf wyste thou haddest wyste thynge sorowe hath dulled wytte playne onely shreude folke apparaylen felonyes agaynste vertue wo der greatly howe maye perfourme thynges haue hoped doone ne wyll ne shreudenesse cometh perauenture oure defaute lyke monstre meruayle howe presente syght god maye ben acheued perfourmed suche thynges euerye felonous manne hath conceyued hys thought ayenst innocentes whyche thynge one thy famylyers vnskylfully asked thus god whence comen wycked thynges ben lefull felonous folke nowe desyren bloode dethe al good men eke senate haue wylned gone distroyen whome haue sene alwaye batayllen defenden good men eke senate deserued father sayne senatours shulden wyll destruction thou remembrest well gesse whan wolde done sayne thyng thou thy selfe alwaye presente ruledest cytye verone whan kynge gredy comen slaughter caste hym transporten vpon order senate gylte hys royall mayestye whyche gylte albyne accused wyth howe great sykernesse peryll defended senate thou wottest well saye sothe ne ne auaunted neuer praysynge selfe alwaye whan wyght receyueth precyous renome auauntynge hym selfe hys werkes amennseth secree hys conscience nowe thou mayste well sene ende comen myne innocencye receyue payne false felonye gwerdone verye vertue open confessyon felonye euer iudges accordaunte cruelte sayne myne accusynge hathe eyther errour mannes wytte el condicyon fortune vncertayn mortall folke ne submytted hem saye yt ne enclyned iuge haue pyte copassyon though ben accused wold brenne holy house stragle preestes wycked swerde greythed deth al good algates sentence shuld haue punished present confessed conuict remoued cyte rome almost vcm paas wythoute defence dampned proscrepcion deathe studyes bountyes haue doone senate wel bene worthy merite saith nay ther myght yet neuer non hem conuicte suche blame mine whych trespace myne accusours seen full wel dignite wolde derken wyth medlyng felonye baren honde sayde polute defouled coscience wyth sacrilege couetyse dignitie certes thou thy selfe arte planted chacedest siege corage al couetise mortal thinges ne sacrilege ne leaue haue place thyne eyen thou droppedest euerye daye myne eares thought thylke commaundement pythagoras saye men shall seruen god goddes ne conuenient ne none nede take helpe foulest spirites thou hast ordeigned sette suche excellence thou madest lyke god ouer thys ryght cleane secrete chabre myne house saye wyfe company myne honeste frendes wyues father well holy worthy reuerensed dedes defenden al suspection blame oh malice accusen take philosophy feyth great blame trowen haue affynite malefyce enchauntement bycause replenyshed fulfylled wyth thy teachynges enformed thy maners thus suffyceth onelye yt thy reuerence ne aueyle naught yf thou thy frewyll rather blemyshed wyth myne offencion certes harmes haue betydethe yet thys encrease harme gessynge iugement much folke ne loke thyng desertes thinges onely aueture fortune iudgen onely suche thynges bene purueyed god whyche temporall wylfulnesse comaudeth glosa thus yf wyght haue prosperite good worthy haue prosperyte hathe aduersite wycked man god hath forsake hym worthy haue aduersyte thys opinion folke therof cometh good gessyng fyrste thynge forsaked wretch certes greueth thynke ryght nowe dyuers sentence people sayth thus moch saye yt last charge contraryous fortune thys whan anye blame layde vpon catyfe men wenen hathe deserued suffrethe put awaye good men dispoyled dignites defouled name gessynge haue suffred turmentes good dedes certes semeth yt se felonous couynes wicked habouden ioy gladnesse se euery lorel shapeth hym fynde newe fraudes accuse good folke se yt good folke ouerthrowen drede peryll euery luxurious turmetour dare done al felonye vnpunyshed excited therto yeftes innocentes onely dispoyled sykernesse defence therto lyst crien god thys maner stelliferi conditor orbis qui perpetuo nixus solio rapido celum turbine versas legem que pati sydera cogis vt nuc pleno lucida cornu totis fratris obuia flammis condat stella luna minores nuc obscuro pallida cornu phebo proprior lumen pardat c thou maker ye whele beareth sterres whyche arte fastned thy perdurable chayre turneste heuen wyth rauyshing sweyghe constrayneste sterres suffre thy lawe yu mone somtyme shynyng wyth ful horne metynge wyth beames thy sunne brother hydeth sterres yt bene lesse somtime wha mone pale derke horne approcheth sune leseth lyghtes yt euyn sterre hesperus whyche fyrst tyme nyght bryngeth fyrst colde arysynge cometh eft ayen vsed course pale morow rysynge sunne yclyped lucifer thou restrayneste daye shorter dwellynge tyme coulde wynter maketh leaues fall thou deuydest swyft tydes nyght hote sommer comen thy myghte attempreth variaunte season yere zephirus debonayre wynd bryngeth ayen ye fyrst somer season leues yt winde hyght boreas hath refte away antumpne saye last ende sommer seedes yt sterre hyghte arcitures sewe bewoxen high cornes wha sterre sirius enchafeth hem nothynge vnbounden thys olde lawe ne forletteth werke hys propre estate thou gouernour gouernynge al thynges certayne ende refusest thou onely gouerne werkes men dewe maner suffrest thou slyding fortune tourneth great enterchaunges thynges anoyous paine shulde duly punish felon punysheth innocentes folke wycked maners sytten high chayres annoyeng folke treden ye vnryghtfully neckes holy vertue clere shynyng naturelly hyde derke derkenesses rightful man beareth payne blame felon ne forsweryng ne fraud couerde kempt false coloure ne annoyeth shreudenesse whyche shreudnesse whan hem lyst vsen stregth reioysen hem put vnder hem souerayne kynges whiche people wythout nombre dreden thou euer thou knytteste bondes thynges loke wretch erthes men bene foule parte fayre parte great werke bene tourmented see fortune thou gouernoure wythdrawe restreyne rauyshing flodes fasten ferme erths stable wyth thylke bonde wyth whyche thou gouernest heauen large hec vbi cotinuato dolore delatraui illa vultu placido nihil que mei questu b mota phi cum te inquit lacrimantem que vidissem illico miserum exulem que cognoui sed quam id longinquum esset exilium c whan wyth continual sorowe sobbed broken oute thynges wyth chere pesible nothynge amoued complayntes sayde thus whan saye quod soroufull wepynge wyste anone thou wretche exiled wyste neuer howe ferre thyne exyle yf thy tale ne yshewed certes al thou ferre fro thy countrey thou narte put oute thou haste fayled thy way gone amysse thou haste leuer wene thou put oute thy countrey haste thou put thy selfe rather anye wyghte hathe wyghte thou thy selfe ne myght neuer haue doone yf thou remembre countrey thou arte borne ny gouerned emperours ne gouernement multitude countreyes hem athene one lorde one kynge god lorde thy countrey whych reioyseth hym dwellynge hys cytezeyns put hem exyle whyche lorde fredome gouerned brydle hym obeye hys iustice haste thou forgotten thylke olde law thy citye whyche citye ordayned establyshed wyghte hathe leuer founde therin hys seate hys house el maye exiled right place conteyned wythin paleys thylke citye drede may deserue exiled letteth wyll tenhabyte forletteth also deserue citezeyn thylke citye saye face thys place ne mouethe mykell thyne owne face ne ne aske nat rather walles thy lybrarye apparayled wrought wyth yuore glasse seate thy thought put whylome bookes put maketh bookes worthy pryce precyous saye sentence bokes certaynly thy desertes bestowed comen goodes thou haste sayde sothe multitude thy good dedes thou hast sayd fewe honestie falsenesse thynges yt bene opposed ayenst thou haste remembred th nges knowen al folke felonyes fraudes thyne accusours semeth haue touched forsoth ryghtfully shortly al myghten tho thynges vetter plentuously bene couth mouthe people knoweth al thou hast eke blamed greatly complayned wrong ful dede senate thou hast sorowed blame thou hast wopen damage thy renoune apeyred thy last sorowe enchased ayen fortune complaynest guerdon euely yolden desertes folke thy latter ende thy woode muse thou praydeste thylke peace gouerneth heuen shulde gouerne earth many tribulacions affection haue assayled sorowe yre wepyng drawen diuersly yu art feoble thought myghtyer remedyes ne shullen yet touchen wyllen somdele vsen lyghter medicynes thylke passyons bene waxen harde swellynge perturbation flowyng thy thought mowen waxe easy soft receyue strength myghtye egre medicyne easyer touchynge cum phebi radiis graue cancri sidus mestuat tum qui largo negantibus suleis semina credidit elusus cereris fide quarnas pergat ad arbores nun quam purpureu nemus lecturus viola petas c wha heuy sterre cancre enchaseth ye beames phebus sayne whan phebus sonne sygne cancre yeueth largelye hys sedes ye feldes refusen receiue hem lette hym gone begyled trust hys corne akehornes okes thou wylte gather violettes ne go thou nat purple wodde whan felde chyrkynge agriseth colde felnesse wynde hyght aquilone thou desyrest wylte vsen grape ne seke thou gloutons hande strayne presse stalkes vyne fyrst sommer ceason baccus god wyne hathe rather yeue hys yeftes autumpne later ende sommer god tokeneth assigneth tymes ablyng hem proper offyces ne suffreth stoudes hym selfe hathe deuided constrayned bene ymedled togither thy forletteth certayne ordynaunce doyng ouerthrowing way hath glad issue ende hys werkes primum igitur pateris ne pauculis rogationibus statum tue metis attingere que tetare vt quis modus sit tue curacionis intelligam c first woldest thou suffre touch assay estate thy thought demaundes may vnderstande maner thy curacio aske quod thy wyll thou wolte shall answere tho sayde thus whether weneste thou quod thys worlde gouerned folyshly happes fortune el wenest thou gouernement reason b certes quod ne trowe nat maner certayne thynges shulde moued fortunous fortune wote well god maker maysteris gouernour werke ne neuer yet daye myghte put oute sothnesse setence p quod thynge sange thou lytell beforne bewayledst weptest onelye men put cure god thynges thou ne douteste nere gouerned reason ough wonder certes greatly yt thou arte sycke sen thou arte put holsome sentence let v seken deper coniecte lacketh saye thys sen thou ne douteste thys worlde gouerned god wyth gouernayle takeste thou hede yt gouerned vnneth knowe sentence thy questyon ne maye yet answeren thy demaudes disceiued quod ne fayled somwhat whyche malady perturbacion crepte thy thought stregth thy paleis shynyng ope say thys remembrest thou thende thynges whyder thentencion kinde tedeth haue herde tolde somtime drerynesse hath dulled memorye certes thou wotest well whence al thynges comen proceden wote wel answered god beginnynge al howe maye thys sen thou knoweste begynnynge thynges thou ne knowest nat ende thynges suche ben customes perturbation thys power hanne may moue man hys place say stablenesse perfection hys knowyng certes maye nat arace hym ne alien hym wolde thou woldeste answere remembrest thou thou art b shuld remembre phi maist thou tel tha thynge man askest thou whether yt reasonable mortal beaste wote well confesse wyst thou neuer yet yt thou thyng quod quod nowe wel know quod cause thy malady ryght great thou hast left knowen thy selfe thou art thorow whych haue playnly founden cause thy maladye el entre recouerynge thy heale thou arte confounded wyth foryetynge thy selfe thou soroudeste thou arte exiled thy propre goodes yu ne wyste thende thinges thy demeste thou felonous wycked myghty welful thou haste foryeten whyche gouernementes worlde gouerned thy wenest thou mutacions fortune fleten wythout gouernour ben cause onlye maladye certes greate cause deathe thanke auctour maker heale nature hathe al forleten haue great nouryshing thyne heale soth sentence gouernaunce worlde thou byleuest gouernyng subiect ne vnderput foly happes aue turous reasonne god therfore dout nothing lytle sparke thyne heate lyfe shall shyne moch time yet faster remedy nature thoughtes thus disceyued ofte caste away soth opinion clothen hem false opinion whych false opinion darkenesse perturbacion wexeth vp cofoundeth insyght derkenesse shal somwhat assaye make thynne weake lyght meanelyche remedyes darkenesse disceyuyng thinges done away thou may know shynyng lyght nubibus atris codita nullum fundere possunt sydera lumen si mare voluens turbidus auster misceat estu vitrea dudum par que serenis c sterres couered blacke cloudes ne mowe yeten adoun lyght yf trouble wynde hight auster turning walowyng see medleth heate sayne boylynge vp bottome wawes whylom clere glasse lyke fayre bryght dayes withstant anone syghtes men filth ordure resolued fleting streme reyleth downe diuersly hygh mountaygnes arrested resisted oft time thencoutryng stone departed fallen rocke thy thou wylt loken deme sothe wyth clere lyght holden way wyth right path weyue thou ioy driue fro drede fleme thou hope ne let sorowe approche sayne let none foure passion ouercome blende cloudye darke thylke thoughte bounde wyth brydels thynges reignen pexplicit liber primus post hec paulisper obticuit que vbi attentionem meam modesta taciturnitate collegit sic exorsa est si penitus egritudinis tuc causa habitum que c seconde boke boecius thys stynte alytell gadered temper stylnesse myne atte tion myght sayne thus thynges stynt lytle aperceyued temper stylnesse ententyfe heren began speake thys wyse yf quod haue vnderstaden knowen vtterly cause habite thy malady thou languyshest art defected desyre talent thy rathar fortune ylke fortune onely chaunged thou faynest warde hathe peruerted clerenesse estate thy courage vnderstonde fele manyfolde colour disceytes thylke merueylous monstre fortune vseth full flateryng familiaryte wyth hem enforceth begyle longe tyl confounde vnsufferable sorowe hem hath lefte dispayre vnpurueyed thou remembrest wel kynde maners deserte thylke fortune thou shalt well know thou neuer ne haddest ne hast ylost fayre thynge trowe shal greatly trauaylen done reme bren thynges thou wont hurtelen dispysen wyth many wordes whan blandyshynge present pursudeste sentence drawen oute myne entre say myn enformacyon sodayne mutation ne betydeth wythout maner chaugyng corages befal thou art lytyl departed fro peace thy thought nowe time thou drynke ataste softe delytable thinges yt whan entred wythin mowen make waye strenger drynkes medictus come nowe forth therfore suasion swetnesse rethoryen whych goth onelye ryght waye whyle forsakethe myne estatutes wyth rethoryke come forthe musyke damosel house syngeth nowe lyghter mode prolacions nowe heuyer ayleth man hath cast murnyng wepyng trowe thou haste sene newe thynge vncouthe thou wenest fortune chauged ayen thou weneste wronge yf thou wene alway tho ben maners hath rather kepte warde proper stablenesse chaungynge selfe ryght suche flatterde dysceyued wyth vnlefull lykynges false welefulnesse thou haste nowe knowen atteynte doubtous double vysage thylke blynde goddesse fortune yet couerethe wymplethe folke hathe shewed selfe euerye deale thou apporuest thinkest good vse maners playne thou agryfeste false trechexye dispyse caste awaye playeth harmefullye nowe cause muche sorow shulde cause peace ioy hath forsaken forsothe neuer man maye syker ne shall forsaken hym glose nathlesse bokes haue text thus forfoth hathe forsaken ne ny man syker ne hathe forsaken holdeste thou thylke welefulnesse precyous shall passen present deare worthe whyche ny fayethfull dwell whan gothe awaye bryngeth wyght sorow sen maye wyth holden mannes wyll makethe hym wretche whan depertethe fro hym thynge styttyng fortune maner shewynge wretchenesse come ne sufficeth onely loken thyng present eyen man wisdome loketh measureth thende thynges chaungynge one another sayne aduersyte prosperyte makethe manaces fortune ne bene dreden ne flateryng desyred thus last behouethe suffren wyth euen wyll pacience al done wythin floure fortune say worlde syth thou hast one put thy necke vnder ye yoke thou wolt writen lawe wending dwellyng fortune whyche thou haste chosen frely bene thy lady art thou wrongfull makeste fortune wrothe asper thyne impacience yet thou mayst chaungen thou comyttest takeste thy sayles wynde thou shalte shouen nat thyder thou woldeste whyder wynde shoueth thou casteste thy seedes feldes thou shouldeste haue mynd yt eares ben amonges otherwhile plenteous otherwhile bareyn thou hast betaken thy selfe gouernaunce fortune thy behoueth ben abeysaunt maners thy lady enforceste thou aresten wyth holde swyftnesse sweygh turning whele thou fole mortall fooles yf fortune began dwell stable cessed ben fortune hec cum superba verterit vice dextra exestuantis fertur euripi dudu tremendos se proterit reges humilem que victi subleuat fallax vultu illa dura mesiros audit haud curat fletus c wha fortune wyth proud ryght hande turned chaunging stoundes fareth lyke maners boylynge eurype glosa euripe arme see ye ebbeth sloweth somtyme streme syde somtyme text crewel fortune casteth adoun kinges whylom weeren ydrad disceiuable enhaunceth vp humble cheer hym discomfyted ne nether hereth ne recketh wretched wepynges harde laugheth scorneth wepyng hem hath maked wepe frewil thus playeth thus proueth stregthes sheweth great wonder al seruautes yf wyghte seen welefull ouerthrowe hour vellem autem pauca tecum fortune ipsius verbis agitare tu igitur ius postulet animaduerte p quid tu homo ream agis quotidianis querelis c certes wolde pleden wyth fewe thynges vsyng wordes fortune take hede thy selfe yf aske ryght thou man wherfore makeste thou gyltye thine euerye dayes playnynges wronge haue done goodes haue beraft yt thyne striue pleate wyth iudge yu wylt possession rychesses dignites yf thou mayst shewen euer mortall man hathe receyued anye tho thynges bene hys proper wyll graunt frely thylke thynges thyn whyche thou askest whan nature brought forth thy mother wobe receyued naked nedye thynges nourished al rychesses redye ententyfe thorowe fauoure sustayne maketh nowe impacient ayenst enuyronned wyth habondaunce shynyng al goodes bene right lyketh wythdrawe myn honde thou hast grace hathe vsed forayne goodes thou haste ryghte playne though thou haddeste vtterly forlorne al thy thinges playneste thou tha haue done wronge riches honour thinges ben right seruauntes knowen lady come wyth departed whan wende dare wel afferme hardely yt yf tho thinges whiche thou playneste thou hast forlorne ben thyne thou ne haddest lorn hem shal tha defended vse right certes leful ye heuen make clere day ouercome tho dayes wyth derke nyghtes yere hath eke leaue apparayle vysage ye erth wt floures nowe frute cofounde hem somtyme raynes wyth colde see hath eke right bene somtyme calme blandyshynge smoth water somtyme horrible wyth wawes wyth tempestes couetyse men maye staunched shall bynde stedfaste sythen stedfastnesse vncouthe maners strength play play comenly turne whirlyng whele wyth tournyng cerkle glad chaungen loweste hyest hyest lowest worthe vp yf thou wolte thys lawe thou ne holde wronge thoughe thou discende adowne whan reasonne playe asketh wist thou nat cresus king lidiens kynge cyrus ful sore agast lytle beforene cresus caught cyrus led fyre brent rayne discended heauen rescowed minde paulus consull rome whan taken kynge perciens weped pytously captiuitie selfe kynge thynge bewaylen cryinge tragedyes onely dedes fortune wt aukewarde stroke ouertourneth realmes great nobley glose tragedye sayne ditee prosperite tyme endeth wretchednesse learnedst thou grece whan thou yonge entrie seller iupiter ben couched two tonne one full good ful harme ryght haste thou playne yf thou hast taken pleteously good syde sayne rychesse prosperitie eke yf al departed eke thy mutable yeueth ye right full cause hope haue yet better thynges nathelesse dismaye thy thought thou art put comune realm ne desyre lyuen thyne owne propre ryght si quatas rapidis flatibus incitus pontus versat arena aut quot stelliferis edita noctibus celo sydera fulgent tantas fundat opes nec retrahat manum pleno copia cornu humanum miseras ideo genus cesset slere querelas ce thoughe plentye goddesse rychesse hylde downe ful horne withdrawe hande many rychesse see turneth vpwarde sandes whan moued rauyshyng blastes el many rychesses shynen bryght sterres heuen sterry nyghtes yet ye mankynde wold cesse wepe wretched playntes al god receyued prayer yeueth hem foole large moche golde apparayleth coueytous folk noble clere honour yet semeth hym haue gotten nothing alway cruel rauyne deuouryng haue gotte sheweth gapynges say gapen desyren yet rychesses brydles myght witholden certayne ende disordinate couetyse men whan euer rather fleeth large yeftes brenneth hem lust hauyng certes quakyng dredfull weneth hym selfe nedy ne lyueth neuermore ryche igitur si pro se tecu verbis tuna loqueretur quod profecto cotra hisceres non haberes si quid est quo querelam tuam iure tuearis proferas oportet c therfore yf fortune spake wt selfe maner sothe thou ne haddeste thou myghtest answere yf thou hast thing wherwith thou mayst ryghtfully defenden thy coplaynte behoueth shewen wol yeuen ye space tellen boece certaynly quod ben fayr thynges anoynted hony swetnesse rethoryke musycke whyle hearde sowne eares ben delicious wretch deper felyng harme sayne wretch felen harme suffre greuously remedyes ye delytes wordes may gladden co fort hem whan thynges stinten sowne eares ye sorow set greueth thought p right doth ne ben yet remedyes maladye bene maner norysshyng thy sorowes rebell ayenst thy curacion whan tyme shall moue aiust thinges percen hem ful depe nathelesse thou shalt wylne leeten thy selfe wretche haste thou foryeten nombre maner thy welfulnesse speake nat yt soueraigne men cytie toke cure keping whan thou orphesyn father mother chosen affinitie prince cytie thou bega rather belefe dere tha neyghbour thyng mooste precyous kynde propinquite alyaunce may ne sayd tho thou ne wer ryght welefull great nobley thy father lawe chastite thy wyfe thoportunitie noblesse thy masculyne chyldren sayne thy sonnes ouer lyst passen come thynges thou hadst thy youth dignityes warned olde men deliteth comen synguler vpheapyng thy welefulnesse yf frute mortall thynges maye haue wyght pryce welefulnesse myghtest thou euer foryeten anye charge harme myght befall remembrauce thylke daye thou sawe thy two sonnes made counsaylours lad togyther thy house vnder greate assemble senatours vnder blythenesse people whan thou sawe hem set courte hye chayres dignity thou rethorien pronouncer kynges praysynges deseruedst glory wyt eloquece whan thou syttynge betwene thy two sonnes counsaylours place hyghte cyrco fulfylleddest byddyng multitude people sprad aboute large praysynge laude men synge vyctoryes tho yaue thou fortune trowe saye tho feodest thou fortune glorious deceyueddest whan acoyed norysshed owne delyces thou bare awaye fortune yeft saye suche guerdon neuer yafe priuate man wylte thou therfore laye rekenynge wyth fortune hath nowe fyrst twinked vpo wycked eye yf thou consydre nombre maner thy blysses thy sorowes thou mayest nat forsaken narte yet blysfull yf therfore thou wenest thy selfe welefull thou thynges semeden ioyfull bene passed ny yu shuldest seme thy selfe wretche thynges seme sory passed also art thou nowe comen sodayne geste shadow tabernacle lyfe trowest thou stedfastnesse man thynges whan oft swyft houre dissolueth man saye whan soul departed body although selde fayth fortunous thinges wolde dwellen yet nathelesse laste day man life maner deth fortune also thilke hath dwelt therfore wenest thou darre recke yf thou forlette dyinge el fortune forlette flyinge awaye cum polo phebus roseis quadrigis lucem spergere ceperit pallet albentes hebetata vultus flaminis stella prementibus c whan phebus sunne begynneth spred clerenesse rosen charyottes sterre dymmed paleth whyte cheres flambes sunne ouercommeth sterre lyghte sayne whan sunne rysen daye sterre wexeth pale leseth lyght great lyghtnesse sunne whan wodde wexeth rodye rosen floures fyrst somer season breth wynde zepherus wexerh warme cloudye wynde auster blowe fellyche goth awaye fayrenesse thornes ofte see cleare calme mouynge floudes ofte horryble wynde aquilon moueth boylynge tempestes ouerwhelueth see yf fourme worlde selde stable yf turneth many entrechaunges wylte thou trusten tomblynge fortune men wylt thou trowen flyttyng goodes certayne establysshed lawe perdurable nothynge engendred stedfaste ne stable tum ego vera quam comemoras virtutum omnium nutrix nec inficiari possum prosperitatis mec velissimum cursum sed hoc est quid c said thus norice al vertues thou sayst ful soth ne may forsake ye right swift course prosperite sayne prosperitye ne comen wondre swyftlye soone thynge greatly smerteth whan remebreth aduersites fortune vnsely kynd contraryous fortune haue ben weleful p thou abyest thus ye turment thy false opinion yt mayst thou rightfully blamen ne aretten thynges sayth thou hast yet many haboudaunces thynges textus al ydle name aueturous welfulnesse moueth yt nowe leful thou reken many thynges thou hast yet ple tie therfore yf thylke thynge thou haddest precious thy rychesse fortune kepte yet grace god vnwemed vndefouled mayst thou playne ryghtfully vpon myschefe fortune sythe thou hast yet thy best thynges certes yet lyueth good poynte thilke precious honour mankynde symachus thy wyues father man made sapience vertue thou woldest bye yt price thyne owne lyfe bewayleth wroges men doone selfe lyueth sykernesse anye sentence put ayenste hym yet lyueth thy wyfe attempre wyt passynge woman clennesse chastitie wolde closen shortelye bountyes like father tel lyueth loth lyfe kepeth gost al mate ouercomen wepynge sorowe desyre whiche thyng mot grauten thy wil fulnesse amenused shall sayne eke thy two sonnes counsailours child age shyneth lykenesse wytte father elde father sythen souerayne cure mortall folke sauen owne lyues yf thou knowe thy selfe thy goodes make welful yet bene thynges dwelled warde noman douteth ne dereworth tha thyne owne life thy drye thy teeres yet euery fortune hateful thewarde ne ouer great tempest ne hath yet fallen vpo whan thyne ancres cleuen fast neither wol suffren cofort tyme present ne hope tyme commyng passen ne faylen b praye faste mote holden whyles holden howsoeuer thynges ben shal wel fleten forth escape thou mayest well sene great apparayles araye lacketh passed awaye p haue somwhat auaunced farthered quod yf thou anoye forthynke thy fortune sayth haue somwhat comforted thou temptest thus thy fortune sythen thou haste yet thy beste thynges may suffren thy delices playnest wepyng anguyshous lacketh somwhat thy welfulnesse man sad greate perfyte welefulnesse ne stryueth playneth halfe ayen qualitie estate ful anguishious thing condicion man goodes eyther cometh al togyther wyght el ne lasteth perpetuell man hath greate rychesse asshamed vngentyll lynage man renomed noblesse kynred enclosed greate anguysshe nede thynges leauer vnknowe man aboundeth rychesse noblesse yet bewayleth chaste lyfe ne hath wyfe man selily maryed hath chyldren nomisheth rychesses straunge folke man gladded child wepeth ful sore trespasse sonne hys doughter ne accordeth wyght lyghtly condicion h fortune alwaye euerye man somwhat vnassayed ne wote nouyt el dredeth hath assayed adde also euery weleful man hath full delycate felyng yf thynges fallen owne wyll impacient vsed haue none aduersitie anon throwen downe euerye lytell thynge full lytle thynges ben tho withdrawen summe perfection blysfulnesse fro hem ben moost fortunate howe many men trowest thou wolde demen hem selfe almooste heuen yf myghten attayne leest partie ye renaunt thy fortune place thou clepest exyle countreye hem enhabyten thy nothyng wretched wha thou wenest sayth thou thy self ne wyght el ni wretche wha weneth hym selfe wretche reputacyon corage ayenwarde al fortune blysful man agreabylitie egallitie hym suffreth man welefull nolde chaungen estate wha hath lost patience swetnesse man welefulnesses spraynt many bitterness whiche welefulnesse although seme swete ioyfull hym vseth yet maye ben witholden ne goeth awaye whan woll well sene howe wretched blysfulnesse mortall thynges neither dureth perpetuel hem euerye fortune receyuen agreablye egally ne delyteth nat bene anguysshyous ye mortall folke seke ye blysfulnesse owne selfe whyche put selfe erroure follye confoundeth shall shewe shortlye poynt soueraygne blysfulnesse thyng precyous thy lyfe thou wylt answer naye yf thou arte myghtye ouer thy selfe sayne tranquyllitie thy soule haste thou thynge thy power thou noldest neuer lese ne fortune maye bynemme thou mayest know blysfulnesse ne may stande thynges fortunous temporel vnderstande gather togyther thus yf blysfulnesse soueraygne good nature lyueth reason ne thylke thynge soueraynge good maye taken awaye wyse worthye thynge digne thylke thynge maye take away sheweth well vnstablenesse fortune maye attayne receue blysfulnesse yet moreouer man tomblynge welefulnesse leadeth eyther wote chargeable el wote yf wot blysfull fortune maye blyndenesse ignoraunce yf wot chaugeable mote alwaye bene adradde ne lese thynge ne doubteth maye lesen sayeth mote alwaye agast least lese woteth ryght wel may lese continuell drede hath ne suffreth hym welefull el lese weneth despysed forleten certes eke full lytle good borne euen herte whan loste sayne men doo force losse hauynge moch yu thy self art hath shewed preued full manye demonstration wote well soules menne ne mowen dyen wyse eke syns clere certayne fortunous welefulnesse endeth deth body may doubted yf death maye take awaye blysfulnesse kynde mortall thyng ne discendeth wretchednesse ende deth sythen knowe well manye man hath sought frute blysfulnesse onely suffrynge death eke suffrynge paynes tourmentes myght present lyfe make men blisfull syns thylke selfe lyfe ended ne maketh folk wretch qvisquis volet perennem cautus pouere sedem stabilis que nec sonori sterni flatibus euri et fluctibus minantem curat spernere pontum montis cacumen alti bibulas vitet arena c maner folke ware stable wyll founden hem perdurable seate ne wyl caste downe wyth loude blastes wynde eurus wil dispyse see menasyng floudes lette hym eschewe buylden coppe moutaygne moyst sandes yf fell wynde auster tourmenteth coppe mountaygnes wt strengthes lose sandes refusen beare heauy weyghtes thy yf thou wylt flyen peryllous auenture saye worlde haue mynde certaynlye set thyne house mery seate lowe stone although wynde troublynge see thondre ouerthrowyng thou arte putte quyete welefull strength thy paleys shalt leade cleare age scornynge woodnesse yres ayre sed quoniam rationum iam te mearum fomenta descendunt paulo validioribus vtendum puto age enim si iam caduca ac momentaria fortune c bvt moche nourysshynges reason descenden nowe trowe wer tyme vsen lytle strenger medicens vnderstand ye yeftes fortune ne brytle ne transytorye hem maye thyne tyme el ne foule yf loked consydred perfectlye rychesses ben precyous nature selfe elles nature mooste worth rychesse golde myght moneye assembled certes golde money shyneth yeueth better renoume hem dispenden thylke folke mokeren auaryce maketh alwaye muckerers ben hated largesse maketh folke cleare renoume syth suche thynges ben transferred one man ne maye dwell manne certes moneye precyous whan translated folke stynten hadde vsage large yeuynge hym hath yeuen also yf al money ouer worlde gathered towarde one man shoulde make al men neadye certes voyce hole sayne without amenusyng fulfylleth together hearynge moche folke whan bene apassed nedes maken hem poore forgone tho rychesses strayte nedye clepe rychesses syns many folke ne maye haue ne ne comen one man pouertie folke shynynge gemmes call precyous stone draweth eyen folke hem warde sayne beautye certes yf beautie bountie shynynge stone thylke clerenesse stone hem selfe men wonder greatly men maruailen suche thynges thyng yf wanteth mouynge ioynture soule body ryght might semen fayre creature hym hathe soule reason gemmes drawen hem selfe lytle laste beautie worlde thorowe entente creatoure distinction hem selfe yet mykel ben put vnder excellencie ne haue deserued way ye shulde maruelen hem beauty feldes delyteth nat mikell vnto b shulde delyten v sith ryght fayre porcion right fayre werke sayne world ryght ben gladed somtyme face see whan clere also marueylen heauen sterres sonne moone phi aperteyneth thylke thynges darest thou glorifye shynyng suche thynges art thou distyngued embelysed spryngynge floures fyrst sommer season swelleth thy plentye frutes sommer arte thou rauyshed ydell ioyes embracest thou straunge goodes thyne fortune ne shall neuer make thinges ben thyne nature thynges hath maked forayne sothe withouten doute frutes erth owe norysshynge beestes yf thou wylt fulfyll thy nede suffiseth nature nede thou seke superfluitye fortune full fewe thynges full lytle thynges nature hathe apayed yf thou wolt achoken fulfyllyng nature superfluityes certes thylke thynges thou wolt thresten pouren nature shullen vnioyful vnto el anoyous wenest thou eke fayre thynge shyne dyuers clothynges whiche clothynge yf beautye agreable loken vpon woll maruaylen nature mater thylke clothes el workeman wrought hem doth also longe route meynye make blysfull man seruauntes yf ben vycious condicions great charge distruction house great enemye lorde hym selfe yf ben good men shall straunge forayne goodnesse put nombre thy rychesses forsayde thynges clerely shewed neuer one thylke thinges thou accomptedst thy goodes na thy good thynges ther beautye desyred shouldeste thou sory lose shouldeste thou reioyse holden hem yf ben fayre theyr owne kynde appertayneth also well shoulden haue fayre hem selfe thoughe departed thy rychesses fayre ne precyous comen amonge thy rychesses semed fayr precyous therfore thou haddest leuer reken hem amogest thy rychesses desyrest thou fortune greate afare trowe thou sekest dryue away nede abundaunce thynges certes tourneth contrarye certes neadeth full many helpynges kepen dyuersities precious hostilementes sothe many thynges haue nede many thynges haue ayenwarde lytle thynge nedeth hym measureth fyll nede kynde thoutrage couetise ye men haue propre good sette suche ye moten seke outwarde forayne subiect thynges condicion thynges turned vp downe man deuyne beest meryte reason thynketh hym selfe ny neither fayre ne noble yf possessio hostilimetes ne han soules certes thynges ben apayed owne beauty ye men semblable god reasonable thought desyren apparaylen excellent kynde ye loweste thynges ne ye vnderstonden greate wronge done creatoure wolde mankynde worthy noble erthly thing ye thresten downe youre dignityes benethen lowest thynges yf good euerye thynge precyous thylke thynge whose good syth ye demen foulest thynges ben youre goodes submytten ye put selue vnder foulest thynges estimation certes betydeth without youre deserte certes suche condition man kynde onelye whan hath knowynge selfe passeth noblesse thynges whan forletteth knowinge selfe broughte benethen beestes lyuynge beestes han kynde knowen nat hem selfe whan men letten knowynge hem selfe commeth hem vyce brode sheweth erroure follye men wenen thynge maye ben apparayled straunge apparelmentes forsoth maye done yf wyght shyneth thynges ben put hym thus yf thylke thynges shynen whiche man apparelled certes thylke thynges commended praysed whiche apparelled nathelesse thynge couered wrapped vnder dwelleth fylth denye thylke thyng good anoyeth hym hath gab thou wolt saye naye certes ryches haue anoyed full oft hem han tho rychesse sytht euerye wycked shrewe wyckednesse gredye folkes rychesses wheresoeuer place golde precious stone weneth onlye worthy hath hem thou tha besy dredrest swerde speare yf thou haddest entred pathe lyfe auoyde wayfaryng man woldest thou syng beforne thefe saith poore man beareth rychesse waye may boldly syng beforne theues hath nat wherof robbed precyous ryght clere blysfulnesse mortall richesse whan thou hast goten hast thou lorne thy sekernesse felix nimium prioretas contenta fidelib arui nec inerti perdita luxu facili que serum solebat ieiunia soluete glande nec bacchia munera norat liquido confundere melle nec lucida vellera serum c blysfull fyrste age men helden hem apayde wyth mete ye trewe feldes broughten forth ne destroyed disceyued nat hem selfe wyth outrage wonte lyghtlye slaken hunger euyn wyth rhornes okes ne coude nat medel yu yefte bacchus clere hony sayne coulde make piement clarre ne coude nat medell bryght fleece countre seryens wyth venym tiry thys sayn coude nat dyen whyte fle e syrien coutre blode maner shelfyssh men fynden tyrie wyth blode men dyen purple slepten holsome slepes vpon grasse dronken rennyng water lyen vnder shadowes hye pyne tree ne geste straunger ne carfe yet hye see wyth oores wyth shyppes ne ne hadden seyn yet newe strondes leden marchaundyse dyuers countrees tho cruel claryons full hust full styl ne blode yshad egre hate ne deyed yet armures whiche woodnesse enemyes wolde fyrst mouen armes whan sawen cruell woundes ne none meedes blode yshad wolde oure tymes shulde turne ayen tholde maners anguishous loue hauyng folke burneth cruellye mountayn ethna ay breneth ala first dalfe vp gobbettes weyghtes golde couered vnder erthe precious stone wolden haue hydde dalfe vp precious peryls sayne hem fyrst vp dalfe dalfe vp precious peryll preciousnesse suche thyng hath many man ben peryll quid autem de dignitatibus potentia que disseram quas vos vere dignitatis ac potestatis inscii celo exequatis que si improbissimum quem que ceciderint c bvt shall saye dignytees power whiche ye men neyther knowen dignyte ne power areysen hem hyghe heuen whyche dignytes power yf comen wycked done great domages distructions dothe flambe mountayne ethna wha flambe waloweth vp ne deluuy ne dothe cruell harmes certes ye remembre wel trow thylke dignyte men cleape imperye counsaylours whyche whylom begynnyng fredom elder coueyted haue done away dignyte pryde counsaylours ryght youre elder tyme done awaye cyte rome kynges name sayne nolde haue lenger kynge nowe yf dignytees power ben yeuen good men whyche thyng full selde agreable thynges tho dignytees power onely goodnesse folke vsen hem therfore thus honour cometh vertue bycause dignyte ayenwarde honoure cometh dygnyte cause vertue whiche thylke dereworth power clere requyrable ye erthlye beestes consyder ye ouer whyche thynge semeth ye haue power nowe yf thou sawe mouse amonge myce chalenged hym selfwarde right power ouer myce howe greate scorne woldest thou haue glosa fareth men bodye hathe power ouer body yf thou loke well vpon body wight thyng shalt thou fynd freel mankynde whyche men ful ofte slayne bytyng flyes el wyth entryng crepyng wormes priuytees mannes bodye shall men fynden man may exercisen haunten ryght vpon man onely hys bodye el vpon thynges ben lower body whiche clepe fortune possessyons mayste thou haue euer commaundemet ouer free corage mayste thou remeue fro estate hys propre reste thought cleuynge togyder hym selfe stedfast reson whylom tyraut wened confounde free man corage wende constrayn hym tourmentes maken hym discoueren accusen folke wysten coniuracyon whyche cleape confederacye caste ayenst thys tyraunt thys freman bote hys owne tonge caste vysage thylke woode tyraunt turmentes wood tyraut wende haue made mater cruelte thys wyse made mater vertue thynge man maye man ne maye receyuen thyng folke hym selfe thus maye man folke folke ne maye doone hym haue herde tolde busirides wonte sleen hys gestes herbroden hys house slayne hym selfe hercules hys geste regulus taken batayle manye men affryke caste hem fetter sone muste yeuen hys handes bounde wyth cheynes hem whylom ouercomen wenest thou myghty hath power doone thyng ne maye done hym hathe yet ouer yf dignytes power hadden propre naturel goodnes hem neuer nolde comen shrewes contraryous thynges ne ben wont ben yfeloushypped togythers nature refuseth contraryous thynges ben ioyned certayne wicked folke haue dignytees ofte tyme tha sheweth wel dignytees power ne ben good kynde sen suffren hem selfe cleauen ioynen hem self shrewes certayne thyng may moste dignely iugen sayne yeftes fortune moste plenteously comen shrewes whiche yeftes trow ought consydred douteth stronge whome seeth strength swyftnesse sothe swifte also musyke maketh musyciens physike maketh physiciens rethoryke eke rethoriciens nature euery thynge maketh hys propertye ne entremedled wyth theffecte co traryous thynges certes rychesses may restrayne auarice vnstanched ne power ne maketh nat man mighty ouer hym selfe vicious lustes holden distrayned wyth chaynes ne mowe vnbounden dignitees yeuen shreude folke ne maketh hem digne sheweth rather openly ben vnworthy indigne thus certes ye haue ioye cleape thynges false name bearen hem al countraye name ben ful ofte reproued effecte thynges ylke rychesses ne oughte right cleped rychesses ne suche power ne ought cleped power ne suche dignyte ne ought cleaped dignyte laste may co clude thynge yeftes fortune whyche ny nothyng desyred ne hath selfe naturel bountye well ysene neyther ioyne hem alwaye good men ne maken hem alwaye good ben ioyned nouimus quantas dederit ruinas vrbe flammata patribus que cesis fratre qui quonda ferus interempto matris effuso maduit cruore corpus visu gelidum pererrans os non tinxit lachrymis sed esse censor extincti potuit decoris c haue wel knowen howe many great harmes distructions doone themperour nero lete brennen cyte rome made slee senatours cruell whylo slough brother made moyste wyth bloode hys mother saye let sleen slytten wombe hys mother sene conceyued loked euery halue deed colde body ne teere wette hys face herd herted might dome man iuge deed beautye nathelesse yet gouerned
