thys nero sceptre people phebus maye sene commyng fro vttrest arysyng tyl hyde hys beames vnder ye wawes sayne gouerned people sceptre imperyall sonne gothe aboute fro eest west eke thys nero gouerned sceptre people vnder colde sterris hyghten septentrions sayne gouerned al people vnder partye northe eke nero gouerned ye people ye violent wynde nothus skorelyth baketh brennyng sandes hys drie heate saye people southe yet ne might hys power tourne woodnesse thys wycked nero ala greuous fortune ofte wycked swerde ioyned cruel venim say venemous cruelte lordshyppe tum ego scis quam ipsa minimu nobis ambicionem mortalium rerum fuisse dominatam sed materiam gerendis rebus optauimus quo ne virtu tacita consenesceret p et ilium atqui hoc vnum est c tha sayd thus thou wotest wel thy selfe couetyse mortall thynges ne hadden neuer lordshype haue wel desyred mater thi ge doone sayth desyre haue mater gouernaunces ouer comynaltees vertue styll shulde elden sayn leste er wext olde hys vertue laye styll ne shuld perysshe vnexercysed gouernaunce commune whyche men myght speken writen hys good gouernement p forsothe thynge may drawen gouernaunce suche hertes ben worthy noble nature nathelesse maye drawen tellen suche hertes ben ybrought full perfection vertue sayne couetyse glorye renome haue wel administred co mune thynges doone good desertes profyte comune se nowe consyder howe lytell howe voyde pryce thylke glorye cercayne thynge thou haste lerned demonstracion astronomye enuyronnyng erth aboute ne halte reason pricke regarde greatnesse heue sayn yf maked comparison erth gretnesse heuen men wolde iudgen ne helde space whyche lytell regyon worlde fourthe parte erthe inhabyted wyth lyuynge beestes knowen thou haste thy self ylerned ptholome proueth yf thou haddest wythdrawen abated thy thought thylke fourthe partye moche space see mareys conteynen ouergone moch space regyon drought ouerstretcheth sayne sandes desertes well vnneth shulde dwellen ryght strayte place habitacion men ye enuyronned closed wyth leste prycke thylke prycke thynken ye manifesten publyshen renome doone youre name ben borne forthe glorie narowe strayte throngen lytell boundes howe mykell conteyneth large great doynge also sette therto manye nacyon diuers tonge maners eke reason lyuyng ben inhabyted close thylke habytacle whyche nacyons diffyculte wayes diuersyte langage defaulte vnusage entrecomunyng marchaundyse onely name synguler men ne may stretchen eke fame cyties may stretchen laste certes tyme marcus tullius hym selfe writte hys boke renome commune rome ne yet passed ne clomben ouer mountayne hyght caucasus yet rome wel waxen redoubted parthes eke folke enhabytynge aboute seest thou howe strayte howe compressed thylke glorie ye trauaylen aboute shewen multeplye maye glorye synguler romayne stretche thyder fame name rome maye clymben ne passen eke seest thou maners diuers folke lawes ben dyscordante amonges hem selfe thylke thynge men iuge worthy praysing folke iuge worthy tourment herof cometh though man delyteth hym praysynge hys renome maye wyse bryngen forth ne spreden hys name manye maner people therfore euerye man ought apayde hys glorye publyshed among hys owne neyghbours thylke noble renome shall restrayned wythin boundes tho maner folke howe many man ful noble tyme hath wretch nedy foryetyng wryters put mynde done away certes thylke thynges profyten lytell whyche thynges writynges longe derke elde away bothe hem eke auctours ye men semen getten pardurabylite whan ye thynke tyme comynge fyoure ame shall lasten nathelesse yf thou wylte make comparyson endlesse space eternyte thyng haste thou whyche thou mayst reioysen longe lastinge thy name yf made comparyson abydyng moment ten thousande wynter moche bothe tho space ben ended yet hathe momente porcion though lytell nathelesse thylke selfe nombre yeres eke many yeres therto may multyplyed ne may certes coparysoned perdurabylite endelesse thynges haue ende may made comparyson thynges whiche ben withouten ende thinges haue ende may maked comparyson thy yt though renome longe tyme euer lyste thynke thought regarde eternyte vnstauncheable infynite ne shulde seme lytell playnly ryght nought ye semen certes ye nothyng ryght yf audyence people ydle rumour ye forsaken great worthynesse conscience vertue ye seken guerdones small wordes straunge folke haue nowe vnderstand lyghtnesse pryde veyne glorie howe man skorned festynally meryly suche vanyte whylome man assayed stryuynge wordes man whiche vsage verye vertue proude vayne glorie taken vpon hym falsely name philosopher rather spake thought wolde assaye wheder thylke phylosophre saye yf wolde haue suffred lightly pacience wroges done thys fayned philosophre toke pacience lytell whyle whan receyued windes outrage stryuynge ayen reioysynge hym selfe sayde laste thus vnderstandest thou philosophre man answerd agayne betyngly sayd well vnderstande yf thou haddest holden thy tonge styll noble worthy men certes suche folke speke seken glorye wyth vertue atteyneth fame suche folke whan body resolued dethe last yf men dyen say body soule whyche thynge oure reason defendeth v byleue glorie wyse shulde thylke glorye whan whome thylke glorye sayde ny ryght naught wyse yf soule whyche hathe selfe science good werkes vnbounden frome pryson therthe wendeth frely heuen dispyseth erthlye occupacyon beynge heuen reioyseth exempt erthly thynges sayth recketh soul neuer glorie renome thys worlde quicun que solam mente precipiti petit summum que credit gloriam late patentes etheris cernat plagas artum que terrarum situm breuem replere non valentis ambitum c ouerthrowing thought onely seketh glorye fame weneth souerain good let loken vpo brode shewynge countreys ye heue vpo strayt seete erthe shal ashamed thencrease hys name maye fulfyll lytell compas erthe coueyten proude folke lyften vp neckes ydle deedly yoke thys worlde though renome ysprad passyng forne people goth diuers tonges though great house kynredes shynen clere tytles honour yet nathelesse deth dispyseth hygh glorie fame dethe wrappeth togythers hygh heedes lowe maketh egall euen hyeste wyth lowest wonne nowe bone trewe fabricius nowe brutus sterne caton thynne fame yet lastyng ydle name marked wyth fewe letter though haue knowen fayre wordes fame hem yeuen knowe hem ben deed consumpt lyggeth styll vtterly vnknowable ne fame ne maketh knowe ye wene lyue lenger wynde youre mortall name whan one cruell daye shall rauyshe seconde dwellynge close fyrste dethe clepeth departyng body seconde dethe styntynge renome fame sed ne inexorabile contra fortunam gerere bellum putes est aliquando cum de hominibus fallax illa non nihil bene mereatur tum sciliret cum se aperit c bvt moch thou shalt wene beare vntretable batayle ayenst fortune yet somtyme befalleth deceyuable deserueth haue ryght good thanke men whan selfe openeth whan discouereth frote sheweth maners perauenture yet vnderstandest thou shall saye wondre desyre tel therfore vnneth maye vnplyten sentence wyth wordes deme contraryous fortune profyteth men fortune debonayre alwaye whan fortune semeth debonayre lyeth falsly byhetyng hope welfulnesse forsothe contraryous fortune alway sothfaste wha sheweth selfe vnstable chaungyng amiable fortune disceyueth folke contrarye fortune teacheth thamyable fortune blyndeth ye beautie false goodes hertes folkes vsen hem contrary fortune vnbyndeth hem knowynge freele welefulnesse thamyable fortune mayst thou sene alway wyndy flowynge euer mysknowynge selfe contrary fortune attempre restrayned wyse thorowe exercise aduersyte laste amyable fortune wyth flatterynges draweth myswandrynge men fro souerayne good contraryous fortune leadeth ofte folke ayen sothefaste goodes haleth hem ayen wyth hoke wenest thou thou oughtest leten lytell thyng aspre horryble fortune hathe dyscouered thoughtes thy trewe frendes thys ylke fortune hathe departed vncouered bothe certayne vysages eke doutous visage thy felowes whan departed away fro toke away frendes laft thy frendes whan thou ryche weleful semed wyth howe mykel woldest thou haue bought full knowynge sayne knowynge thy verye frendes nowe playne rychesse lorne syth thou haste founde moste precyous kynde rychesse sayne thy frendes quod mundus stabili fide concordes variat vice quod pugnacia semina fedus perpetuum tenent c world stable fayth varyeth accordable chaungynges contraryous qualitees elementes holde amonge hem selfe alyaunce perdurable phebus sonne wyth hys golden charyot bryngeth forth rosy day moone hath commaundement ouer nyghtes whych nyghtes esperus euen sterre hath yu see gredy flowen constrayneth wyth certayne ende hys floodes lefull stretche hys brode termes boundes vpon erthe al ordynaunce thynges bounden wyth loue gouerneth erthe see also hath comaundement heuen yf thys loue slaked bridels thinges nowe louen hem togythers wolden make batayle cotinuelly stryuen fordone facion world whyche nowe leden accordable faith fayre mouynges loue holdeth togyder people ioyned wyth holye bonde knytteth sacrament mariage chaste loues loue endeth lawes true felawes welefull mankynde yf thylke loue gouerneth heue gouerned corages phere endeth seconde boke foloweth thyrde cantum illa finierat cum audiendi auidum stupetem que arrectis adhuc auribus carminis mulcedo defixerat ita que paulo post inquam summum lassorum solame animorum quantum c thys ended songe wha swetnesse dyte perced desyrous herkening astonyed yet streyght myne eeres yt sayne herken bette shulde saye lytell sayde thus thou arte souerayne comforte corages anguishous thou hast remounted norisshed weight thy sentence wyth delyte syngyng trowe vnperegal stroke fortune saythe dare well nowe suffren thassautes fortune well defende tho remedy thou saydest beforn ryght sharpe agrysen hem desyrous herynge aske greatly heren remedyes sayde thus feled well whan thou ententyfe styl rauyshedest wordes abode tyl thou haddest suche habyte thy thought thou haste nowe el tyll selfe maked habyte whiche thynge certes remenante thynges ben yet say ben suche fyrst whan men taste hem ben bytynge whan ben receyued wythin wyght ben swete thou sayest thou art desyrous herken hem wyth howe great brennynge woldest thou glowen yf thou wystes whyder wolde leden b whyder p thylke blysfulnesse thyne herte dremeth moch thy syght occupyed distourbed erthly thinges thou maist yet sene thylke selfe welefulnesse b shewe thylke welfulnesse praye without taryeng p wol gladly cause wol fyrste marken wordes wyl enforcen enforme thylke false cause blysfulnesse whych thou knowest wha thou haste beholden thylke false goodes turned thyne eyen syde thou maye knowen clerenesse blysfulnesse qui serere ingenuum volet agru liberat arna prius fruticibus fal erubos filicem que resecat c wol sowe felde plenteous let hym fyrste delyueren thornes kerue sonder wyth hys hoke bush ferne corne may come heuy eres greyues hony ye swete yf mouthes haue first tasted sauours wycke sterres shinen agreably whan wynde nothus leteth hys plungye blastes lucyfer daye sterre hathe chased awaye darke nyght daye fayrer leadeth rosen horse sonne ryght thou beholdynge fyrste false goodes begyn wythdrawe thy necke fro earthly affection afterwardes verye goodes shullen entren thy corage tum defixo paululum visu et velut angustam sue mentis sedem recepta sic cepit p omnis mortalium cura qua multiplicium studiorum labor exercet c tho fastened lytell syght eyen wyth drewe syght strayte seete thought began speke ryght thus cure mortall folke whych yt trauaylen hem many maner studyes gone certes dyuers wayes nathelesse enforce hem comen onely thende blysfulnesse blysfulnesse suche good hath goten ne maye ouer thynge desyre thys thinge forsoth souerayne good conteyneth hym selfe maner goodes whyche good yf fayled thynge myght ben souerayne good good oute thys souerayne good myght desyred nowe clere certayne blysfu nesse parfyte state congregacion goodes blysfulnesse haue sayd mortall folke enforcen hem get dyuers wayes couetyse euery good naturelly planted hertes men myswandrynge erroure misledeth hem false goodes ye men hem wene souerayne good lyuen without nede thynge men demen ye souerayne good ryght dygne reuerence enforcen hem reuerenced amoge neyghbours honour haue gotte folke ben holden ryghte hye power souerayne good enforcen hem reignen el ioynen hem hem reygne semeth folke noblesse renome souerayne good hasten hem getten hem glorious name artes werre peace many folke mesuren gessen souerayne good ioye gladnesse wenen ryght blysful thyng plugen voluptuous delytes ben folke entrechaungen cause ye endes forsayd goodes desyren rychesses haue power delites el desyre power haue money cause renome thynges suche tourned al entencion desyrynges werkes thus noblesse fauoure people yeueth al men semeth hem maner clerenesse renomme wyfe chyldren desyren cause delyte meriness forsoth frendes ne shullen rekened amoge goodes fortune vertue full holy maner thynge thynges forsoth taken cause power el cause delyte certes nowe ready referren goodes body forsayd thynges abouen semeth strength greatnesse bodye yeuen power worthynesse beaute swyftnesse yeuen glorye renomme helth bodye semeth yeuen delyte thynges semeth onely blysfulnesse desyred thylke thynge euerye man desyreth moste ouer thynges demeth souerayne good haue dysfyned blysfulnesse souerayne good whyche euery wyght demeth thylke estate yt desyreth ouer thynges blysfulnesse hast thou thyne eyen almost al purposed forme welefulnesse mankinde sayne rychesse honour power glorye delytes whych delyte co sydered epicurus iuged establysshed delyte souerayne good moche thynges hym thought byrefte awaye ioye myrth herte returne agayne studyes men whyche men corage alwaye reherseth seketh ye souerayne good wyth dyrked memorye note whych pathe ryghte dronken man note nought whych path may returne home hys house semeth folke forleyen erren enforcen hem haue nede nothing certes none thing maye moche performen blysfulnesse estate plenteous goodes ne hath nede none thynge suffysaunt hym selfe vnto hym selfe folyen suche folke wenen yt thylke thyng ryght good eke ryght worthy honour reuerence certes nay thynge ny neyther foule ne worthy despysed well nygh entencion mortall folke trauaylen get power eke ought rekened amo ge goodes el ny wene thylke thynge moste worthy thynges feble wythout stregth clerenesse renome ought bene dyspysed certes may man forsake thynge right excellent noble ne semeth ryght clere renomed certes nedeth saye blysfulnesse anguyshous ne drery ne subiect greuaunces ne sorowes sen ryght lytell thynges folke seken haue vsen maye delyten hem certes ben thynges men wyllen desyren geten thys cause desyren rychesses dygnytees regnes glorye delytes therby wenen haue suffysaunce honour power renome gladnesse good men seken thus many dyuers studyes whych desyre maye lyghtly shewed howe great strength nature howe men haue diuers sentence dyscordynges algates men accorden al louynge ende good quantas rerum flectit habenas natura potens quibus immensum legibus orbe prouida seruet stringat que ligan irresoluto singula nexu placet arguto fidelibus lentis promere cantu c lyketh shewe subtyl songe slacke delytable sowne strynges nature myghtely enclyneth flytteth gouernemet thinges suche lawes purucyable kepeth great world byndyng restrayneth al thynges bonde yt may vnbounden al yt lyon countrey pene beren fayre chaynes take meates handes folke yeuen hem dreden sturdye maysters whyche wonte suffre beatinges yf horrible mouthes ben bledde faine beestes deuoured corage tyme passed hath bene ydle rested repayreth ayen roren greuously remembren nature slaken neckes fro chaynes vnbounde maistre fyrst torne wyth blody tethe assayeth wood wrathes hem sayne frette mayster ianglynge byrde syngeth hye brauches sayne wodde enclosed strayt cage though plyenge besynesse yeue hem honyed drynkes large meates wyth swete studye yet nathelesse yf thylke byrde skyppynge strayte cage seeth agreable shadowes woddes defouleth wyth fete meate yshadde seketh mornyng wodde twytereth desyrynge wodde wyth swete wyse yerde tre haled adown myghty stregth boweth redyly croppe adowne yf hande bare let gone agayne anone croppe loketh vpryght heauen sonne phebus falleth euen westren wawes returneth ayen eftsones hys carte pryue pathe wonte aryse thynges sek n ayen propre course thynges reioysen retournynge agayne nature ne none ordinaunce betake thynges hath ioyned ende begynnyng hath made course selfe stable yt chaunge fro hys propre kynde vos quo que tertena animalia te nui licet imagine vestrum tame principium somniatis verum que illum atitudinis finem licet minime perspicaci c certes also ye men bene earthly beestes dreame alway begynnynge althoughe wyth thyne ymaginacyon maner thought clerely ne perfytly ye loken ferre thylke verye fyne blysfulnesse therfore naturell entencyon leadeth thylke verye good many maner errours mystourneth therfro cosyder nowe yf thylke thynges weneth get blisfulnes yf maye comen thylke ende weneth come nature yf money honour forsayd thynges bryngen men suche thynge good ne fayle ne semeth fayle certes woll graunt maked blysful thynges haue gotten yf thylke thynges ne mowen performe byheten defaut many goodes sheweth clerelye yt false beute blysfulnesse knowen atteynt thylke thynges fyrst forwarde thou thy selfe haddest haboundaunce rychesse longe agone aske thabundaunce thylke rychesse yf thou neuer anguyshous sorye thy corage wronge greuauce betyde syde b certes ne remembreth euer free thought ne alwaye anguyshe somwhat p lacked somwhat thou noldeste haue lacked el thou haddest yt thou noldest haue b ryght p desyredest thou presence ye one thabsence b graunt well p forsoth nedeth somwhat euery man desyreth b yea nedeth p certes yt hath lacke nede ought ny euery way suffysaunt hym selfe b p thou al plete thy rychesse dest thylke lacke suffysaunce b el p maye ryches maken man ny nedy ne sufficiet selfe yet behete semed eke certes trowe greatly consyder money hathe hys owne kynde ne maye bene bynomed hem haue maugre hem b knowe well p shuldest thou beknowen euery day strenger folke bynomen fro febler maugre hem fro whence come el forayne complayntes quarels pleadynges men asken money hath ben benomed hem strength gile alway maugre hem b ryght p hath nede seken forayn helpe whych maye defende money b maye saye nay p certes hym neded none help yf ne money myght lese b douteles p thys thynge turned contrary ryches men wenen shulde maken suffysaunce maken man rather haue nede forayne helpe whych maner ye gyse rychesse may dryuen away nede ryche folke may neither haue hoger ne thurst ryche men maye fele colde theyr limmes wynter yu wilt answere riche men haue ynough wherwith may stauchen honger slaken thurst done awaye colde thys wyse maye nede ben coforted rychesse certes nede ne maye al vtterly done awaye yf thys nede alwaye gapynge gredy fulfylled wyth rychesse thyng yet dwelleth nede mote fulfylled holde styll tell howe lytell thynge suffyseth nature certes auarice suffiseth notynough nothing synne rychesse ne maye done awaye nede make theyr owne nede maye ye wenen rychesses mowen yeuen suffysaunce quamuis fluente diues auri gurgite non expleturas cogat auarus opes c al noble couetous man ryuer gutter fletynge al gold yet shuld neuer staunche hys couetyse though necke charged wyth precious stone reed see though eere hys feldes plenteous wyth hundred ox neuer ne shal hys bytynge besynes forleten hym whyle lyueth ne lyght rychesses ne shal bearen company deed sed dignitas honorabilem renerendu que cui prouenerint reddunt nu vi ea est magistratibus vt vtetium mentibus virtutes inserant victa depellant c bvt dygnitees whome comen maken hym honourable reuerente haue great strengthe maye putten vertue hertes folkes vsen lordshyp hem elles may done away vyces certes wonte done away wyckednesse wonte rather shewe wyckednesse therof cometh yt haue ryght greate dysdayne dygnitees ben yeuen wycked men whych thynge catullus cleped counsell rome hyght nonius postome boche sayeth cleped congregacion vyces hys brest postome full corrupcion al nonius set chayre dygnitee seest thou howe great vylonies dignitees done wycked men certes vnworthynesse wycked men shulde lasse sene yf nere renomed none honoure certes thou thy selfe ne myghtest brought wyth many peryls thou myghtest suffre thou woldest beare magystrate wyth decorate sayne peryl myght fall ostence kynge theodryke thou noldest felowe gouernaunce decorate thou sawe wicked corage licorous shrew accusour ne maye suche honour iugen hem worthy reuerence deme holde vnworthy haue thylke honour nowe yf thou sawe man fulfylde wysedome certes thou ne myghtest deme vnworthy honoure el wysdome whych fulfylled b p certes dygnytees aperteynen properly vertue vertue transporteth dygnite anone thylke man selfe conioyned moche honour people ne maye make folke dygne honoure well sene clerly ne haue propre beautye dygnitee yet men oughten take hede thys yf wyghte moche outcaste dyspysed moste folke dygnytee ne may maken shrewes worthy reuerece maketh dygnite shrewes rather dispised praised whyche shrewes dygnite sheweth moche folke forsoth vnpunyshed yt sayne shrewes reuengen hem ayen warde vpon dignitees yelden ayen dygnytees great guerdon dyspotten defoulen dygnitees wyth bylonye asmoch thou knowest thylke reuerence ne may comen shadowy transytorye dygniters vnderstande thus yf man vsed many maner dygnitees consul perauenture comen amoge strauge nacions shulde thylke honoure maken hym worshypfull redouted straunge folke certes yf honour people naturell yefte dygnitees ne myghte neuer cessen amonge maner folke done hys offyce ryght fyre euery contrey ne stynteth enchaufen maken hote moche bene honourable reueret ne cometh folke propre strength nature ye false opinion folke sayne w en dygnitees make folke dygne honour anone therfore comen folke ne knowen thylke dygnytes honour vanyshen awaye anone amonge straunge folke mayest thou sayne ne amonges hem borne ne dured thylke dygnitees alwaye certes dygnite prouostry rome whylom great power nowe nothynge ydle name rent senatorie great charge yf wyght whylom thoffyce taken hede tayles people corne thinges holden amonges hem great thinge nowe outcast thylke prouostry haue sayd lytle beforne thylke thynge hath propre beaute selfe receiueth somtyme price shynynge somtyme leseth thopinion vsaunces nowe yf dygnyters ne mowe make folke dygne reuerence yf dygnites foule wyll fylthe shrewes yf dygnytees lesen shynynge chaugynge tymes yf wexen foule estimacyon people yt han hem selfe beaute ought desyred sayeth none ne mowen yeuen beaute dygnite none quamuis se tyrio superbus ostro comeret ei niueis lapillis c al proude nero wyth wode luxure kembe hym apparelled hym wyth fayre purpure tyre wyth whyte peerles algates yet therof hatefull folke thys saye behated folkes yet thys wycked nero great lordshyppe yaf whylom reuerent senatours vnworshypful seates dygnitees vnworshypfull seates cleapeth nero wycked yane dygnitees wolde reasonably wenen blysfulnesse suche honour bene euen bycious shrewes vero regna regum que familia ritas efficere potentem valent quid c bvt reygnes familiaritees kynges maye maken bene myghty howe el hys blysfulnesse dureth perpetually certes olde age oftymes passed eke present tyme nowe full ensamples howe ye kynges haue chaunged wretchednesse welfulnesse noble thing clere thyng power ny founden myghtye kepe selfe yf power realmes authour maker blysfulnesse yf thylke power lacketh syde amenuseth thylke blysfulnes bryngeth wretchednesse yet al realmes mankynde stretchen brode yet mote ede ben moche folke ouer whych euerye kynge ne hath lordshyp ne comaundement certes vpon thylke syde power falleth whych maketh folke blysful ryghte syde power entreth vnderneth maketh hem wretch thys maner moten kynges haue porcion wretchednes welefulnesse tyraunt kynge cecyle assayed yt peryll hys estate shewed similitude dredes realmes gastnesse swearde honge ouer heed samylyer thynge thys power maye done awaye hytynges besynesse ne eschewe pryckes drede certes yet wolden lyuen sykernesse maye yet gloryfyen hem power holdest thou thylke man myghtye thou seest wolde done may done holdest thou hym myghtye man hath enuyronned hys sydes wyth armes sergeautes dreddeth hem maketh agast dreden hym put handes hys seruauntes shulde seme myghtye familyers seruauntes kynges shulde tell thynge syth selfe haue shewed realmes hem selfe bene full great feblesse whych famylyers certes royal power kynges hole estate estate abated full ofte throweth adowne nero constrayned senecke hys famylyer hys mayster chesen death wolde dye antonius commaunded yt knyghtes slowen wyth swordes papinian familyer whych papinyan ben logtyme full myghty amonges hem courte yet certes wolden haue renounced power whych two seneck enforced hym yeuen nero hys rychesse also haue gone solytarye exyle great weyght sayne lordes power fortune draweth hem shullen fall neyther hem ne myght wolde thynge thylke power though men haue yet ben agaste thou woldest haue thou art syker yf thou woldest forleten thou mayest eschewen whether suche men ben frendes nede bene counsayled fortune vertue certes suche folke welefull fortune maketh frendes co trarious fortune maketh hym enemyes pestilence myghtye anoy wyght famylyer enemye qui se volet esse potentem animos domet ille feroces nec victa libi dine colla c woll myghtye mote dauten hys cruel corages ne put hys necke ouercomen vnder foule raynes lecherye ye lordshyp stretch ferre countreye inde quaketh thy comaundemetes thy lawes last yle see hight tyle bethrale yet yf thou mayst putten awaye thy foule derke desyres dryue oute fro wretched coplayntes certes ny power thou haste gloria vero quam fallax sepe quam turpis est vnde non iniuria tragicus exclamat gloria gloria millibus mortalium nihil aliud facta nisi auri um inflatio magna c bvt glorye howe dysceyuable howe foule oft whych thynge skylfully tragedye sayne maker dytees yt hyghten tragedy cryed sayd glorye glorye thou narte thyng el thousand folkes sweller eares many haue ful great renome false opinion people thynge may thought fouler suche praysynge thylke folke ben praysed falsely mooten nedes haue shame praysynges yf folke haue getten hem thanke praysynge desertes thynge hath thylke pryse eched encreased conscyence wyse folke measuren good rumoure people sothfastnesse conscience yf seme fayre thynge man haue encreased sprad hys name foloweth demed bene foule thynge yf ne ysprad encreased sayd lytell sythe mote nedes ben many folkes whych folke renome man ne may comen befalleth thou wenest glorious renomed semeth next parte therthes ben wythout glory wythout renome certes amonges thynges ne trowe pryse grace people ny neyther worthy bene remembred ne cometh wyse iugement ne ferme perdurably nowe thys name gentylesse man ne maye well sene howe vayne howe flyttynge yf name gyntylesse referred renome clerenesse lynage gentell name forayne thynge say hem glorifyen hem lynage semeth gentyles maner praysynge cometh desertes auncesters yf praysyng maketh gentylles moten nedes ben gentyll ben praysed whych thynge foloweth yf thou ne haue gentylnesse thy selfe sayne pryse cometh thy deserte forayne gentyllesse ne maketh gentyll certes yf good gentyllesse trowe onely thys semeth maner necessite imposed gentylmen ne shulde outragen forleauen fro vertues noble kynred omne hominu genus terris simili surgit ab ortu vnus enim rerum pater est vnus cuncta ministrat c al lynage men ben erthe ben semblable byrth one alone father thinges one alone ministreth thynges yafe ye sun hys beames yafe moone horne yafe men earth yafe sterres heuen enclosed wyth membres soules comen frome hys hye seate comen mortall folke noble seed noysen ye bosten elder yf ye loke begynnyng god father authour maker ny forelyued wyght vnge tyll yf nouryshe hys corage vnto vyces forlete hys proper byrth quid autem de corporis voluptatibus loquar quarum appetentia quidem plenum est anxietatis c bvt shall sayne delyces body whych delyces desyrynges ben ful anguyshes fulfyllynges hem ben ful penauce gret sickness gret sorowes vnsuffrable ryght maner fruyte wyckednesse ben thylke delyces wonte bryngen bodyes folkes vsen hem delyces ioy may ben moning wot wel whosoeuer woll remebren hym lurures shall well vnderstand issue delyces ben sorowfull sorye yf thylke delyces nowe maken folke blysful tha ye cause mote beestes ben cleped blysfull beestes entention hasteth fulfyl bodily iolitie gladnesse wyfe chyldre honest thynge hath ben sayd ouer mokel ayenst kynde child haue ben founden tourmenters father many whiche chyldren bytyng euery condicion neadeth telle hast time assayed art yet anguishous tyme approue sentence disciple euripidis sayd hath chyldren welefull infortune habet hoc voluptas omnis stimulis agit fruentes pium que par vola tium vbi gratia mella fuit fugit et nimis teuaci ferit icta corda morsu c every delyte hath guyssheth hem pryckes yt vsen resembleth fliynge flyes clepen bee hath shed hys agreable honyes flyeth awaye styngeth hertes hem bene smytten bytyng ouerlonge holden nihil igitur dubium est quin ad beatitudiuem vie deuia quedam sint nec perducere eo quem quam valeant c dout wayes ne maner misleadynges blysfulnesse ne ne mowen leaden folke thider beheten leeden hem howe greate harmes forsayde wayes ben enlaced shall shewe shortly yf thou enforcest assemble moneye thou must byreuen hym money hath yf thou wolte shynen dignity thou must besechen supplyen hem yeuen tho dygnities yf thou coueytest honour goone beforne folkes thou shalte defoule thy selfe thorowe humblesse askynge yf thou desyrest power thou shalt awaytes thy subiectes anoyusly cast vnder many paryls askest thou glorye thou shalte ben distracte aspre thynges thou shalt forgone sikernesse yf thou woldest leden thy lyfe delytes euery wight shall despisen forlee thou yt art thrall thyng yt ryght foule bryttel yt sayne seruaunt thy bodye nowe well ysene lytle howe bryttel possessyon coueyten putten goodes bodye aboue owne reason mayst thou surmounten olyfauntes greatnesse weyght body mayst thou stre ger bull mayest thou swyfter tygre beholde space stablenesse ye swyfte course heauen stynt somtime wondren foule thinges heauen certes ni rather thynges wondred vpon reason gouerned shynyng thy fourme sayne beautye thy bodye howe swyftly passing howe transitorie certes flyttynge mutabylitie floures sommer season aristotel telleth yf men hadde eyen beaste hyght lynx lokynge folke myght peercen thorowe tho thynges withstonden loked trayles body alcibiades full fabre superfycie without shuld seme ryght foule thy yf thou semest fayre thy nature ne maketh disceiuauce feblenesse eyen looken prayse goodes body moche euer ye lyst yt thou knowe algates yt sayne goodes bodye whyche thou wondreste vpon maye bene destroyed el dissolued heate feuer thre dayes sayd thinges may reducen shortly summe wordly goodes yt ne mowen yeuen yt behighten ne ben parfyte congregation goodes ne wayes ne pathes yt bryngen men blysfulnesse ne maken men blysfull heu heu q miseros tramite deuios abducit ignorantia non aurum viridi queritis arbore c ala follye whiche ignoraunce mysleadeth wandryng wretch path good certes ye seken gold grene tree ne ye gadren precyous stone vynes ne ye ne hyden gynne hye mountaynes catchen fysh ye maye maken ryche feestes yf ye lyke hunt roe ye ne go foordes water hyght thyrene ouer men know wel crekes cauernes see yhid ye sloudes knowen eke water plenteous white perles knowen water aboundeth red purpure sayne maner shelfysh men dyen purpure knowen stro de abounden moost tendre fysshes sharpe fysshes hyght echynes folke suffren hem selfe ben blynde hem ne retchen knowe thylke goodes ben yhid whiche coueten plungen hem earth seken thylke good surmounteth heauen beareth sterres prayer maye maken digne nyce thoughtes men praye coueyten rychesse honoures whan haue gotten tho false goodes wyth greate trauayle therby mowen knowen goodes hactenus mendacis formam felici tati ostendisse sufficerit si perspicaciter intuearis ordo est deinceps c suffyseth haue sayde hytherto fourme false welefulnesse yt yf thou loke clerely ordre myne entention requyreth hece forth shewen welfulnesse b sothe se well suffysaunce maye comen rich ne power realmes ne reuerence dignity ne gentlesse glory ne ioye delyces phi haste thou well knowen cause boece certes semeth se hem ryght though lytle clyfte leauer knowen hem openly p certes reason alreadye thylke thyng symply one thynge without anye deuysyon errour folly mankynde deuydeth departeth mysleadeth transporteth parfyte good goodes false vnparfyte say wenest thou hath nede power hym ne lacketh nothynge b nay p certes yu sayst aryght yf thing parte febler power certes mote nedes nedy forayne helpe bocce ryght phi suffisaunce power ben one kynde b semeth philoso demest thou quod thynge maner say suffysaunt myghtye ought dispysed el ryght digne reuerence aboue thynges b certes dout ryght worthye reuerenced p let v adden reuerence suffysaunce power demen yt thre thynges one thynge b certes quod let v adden yf wyl graut soth p demest thou darke thyng noble suffysaut reuerent myghty el ryght noble ryght clere celebrat renoume cosydre tha haue graunted beforne ne hath nede nothyng moost myghtye digne honour yf hym nedeth clerenesse renoume clerenesse myght graunten hym selfe lack thylke clearenesse myght semen febler syde outcaste glose saye naye suffysaunt myghtye reuerente clearenesse renoume foloweth forsayde thynges hath readye hys suffysaunce b may quod denye mot graunten thynge ryght celebrable clerenesse renoume noblesse phil foloweth quod adden clerenesse renoume foresayde thynges amonges hem dyfferencee boece consequence philoso thinge ne hath nede forayne thynge maye doo thynge hys strengthes noble honourable mery thyng ioyfull boece whence quod anye sorowe myghte come thynge suche certes maye thynke philosop mote graunten thynge full gladnesse yf forsayde thynges sothe certes also mote graunten suffisaunce power noblesse reuerece gladnesse onelye dyuers name substaunce hath diuersitie boece mote nedelye quod philosophia thylke thynge quod one symple hys nature wyckednesse men departeth deuydeth whan enforcen hem getten partye thynge ne hath part ne getten hem neyther thylke partye ny none ne thynge whole desyre boece whiche manere quod philosphia thilke man quod se heth rychesse flyen pouertie ne trauayleth hym get power hath leauer darke vyle eke draweth hym selfe manye naturell delytes nolde leese moneye hath assebled certes maner ne getteth hym suffysaunce yt power letteth molestie prycketh fylthe maketh outcaste darkenesse hydeth certes desyreth onelye power wasteth scattreth rychesse despyseth delyces eke honour wt power ne ne prayseth glory nothyng certes thus seest thou wel many thinges faylen hym hath somtyme default many necessity many anguisshes byten hym whan may tho defautes away forleteth mightye thyng desyreth ryght thus maye make semblable reason honour glory delytes euerye forsayde thynges thynges bene sayne one thynge whosoeuer seketh getten one yt ne getteth desyreth b sayest thou yf man couete getten thynges togyther p certes wolde saye wolde get hym souerayne blysfulnesse shal fynde tho thynges haue shewed mowe yeuen beheten b certes philo quod ne shullen men way seken blysfulnes suche thynges men wenen ne mowe gyuen one thynge syngulerly men seken boece graunt well ne none sother thyng may sayd p hast thou fourme cause false welefulnesse nowe turne flyt agayn thy thought ther shalt thou sene anon thylke blysfulnesse haue behyght b certes quod clere open though blinde man shewedst thou litle beforne whan thou enf rcedest shewe cause false welefulnesse yf begyled thylk blisfulnesse parfyte perfytely maketh man suffysaunt myghty honourable noble full gladnesse thou shalt well knowe haue wel vnderstanden thynges within hert know wel thylke blysfulnesse men verelye yeuen one forsayde thynges syns bene one knowe doutlesse thylke thynge ful blysfulnesse p norice quod opynyon say thou arte blysfull yf thou put therto shall sayne b quod phy trowest thou anye thynge erthly mortall tomblyng thynges maye bryngen estate bo certes quod trowe thou hast shewed well ouer thylke good ther ni nothing ben desyred p thynges tha quod sayne erthly suffysauce power suche thynges erthlye semen likenesse good el semeth yeuen mortall folke maner goodnesse ne parfyte thylke good parfyt may yeuen b accorde well phi moch thou hast knowen thilke verye blysfulnesse eke thylke thynges ben lyen falslye blysfulnesse saye disceyte semen goodes nowe behoueth know whence thou mow seke thylke blysfulnesse b certes desyre greatly haue abyde loge tyme herken p moch quod lyketh disciple plato hys boke thimeo ryght lytle thinges men shulden beseche help god iudgest thou nowe doone may deserue fynde seate thylke soueraygne god b certes deme shullen clepe father al godges withouten hym ny nothyng founded aryght p thou sayest aryght began anon syngen ryght thus qui perpetua mundum ratione gubernas terrarum celi que sator qui tempus ab euo ire iubes stablis que manens da cuncta moueri quem non externe pepulerunt fingere cause c thou father soueraygne creatour heuen erthes gouernest worlde perdurable reason commaundest tymes gone syth age begynnynge thou dwellest thy selfe aye stedfast stable yeuest thynges meued ne foreyne cause ne cesseden yt neuer compoun werke flottring mater forme soueraygne good yset within withoute enuye meued frely thou art alderfayrest bearynge fayre worlde thy thought formedest world thy lykenesse semblable fayre worlde thy thought thou drawest thynge thy soueraygn enampler commaundest worlde perfetlyche ymaked haue frely absolute perfyte partyes thou byndest elementes bres proporcionables colde thynges mowen accorden wyth hoote thynges drye thynges moyste fyre purest ne fle ouerhye ne heuynesse ne drawe notte adowne ouerlow erthes plonged water thou knyttest togyther meane soule treble kynde mouyng al thinges deuidest membres acccording whan thus deuyded hath assembledde amouynge roundes goeth turne agayne hym selfe enuyroneth full depe thought turneth heauen semblable ymage thou euen lyke cause enhauncest soules lesse lyues hablynge hem heyght lyght wayne carte thou sowest hem heuen erth whan conuerted thy benigne lawe thou makest hem retourne ayen ayen leding fyre father yeue thou thought styen vp thy strayte sete graut enuyronne well good ye lyght ysounde graunt hym fyxen clere syghtes corage scatre thou breake weyghtes cloudes erthly heuynesse shyne thou thy brightnesse thou clerensse art thou arte pesyble rest debonayre folke thou thy selfe art begynnynge bearer leader path terme loke ende quoniam igitur q sit imperfecti que etiam perfecti boni forma vidisti nunc demonstrandum reor c moche thou hast sene fourm good ny parfyt forme good parfyte nowe trowe good shewe perfection blysfulnesse set thynge trowe shall fyrst enquyre weten yf suche maner good thylke good thou hast fynyshed lytle beforne sayn soueraygne good may founden nature thinges vayne ymaginacion thought ne disceiue v put v sothfastnesse thilke thynge submytted v maye denyed thylke ne ryght well goodes al thyng cleped imparfyte proued imparfyte amenusynge perfection thynge parfyte herof cometh euerye thyng generall yf men sene thyng vnparfyte certes thilke thyng generall mote thynge perfyte yf perfection done awaye menne maye thynke ne saye whence thylke thynge cleped imperfyte nature ne toke nother beginnyng thynges amenused imperfyte procedeth thynges ben al hole absolute discendeth downe vttrest thynges thynges empty without frute haue shewed lytell beforne yf blysfulnesse freyle vayne imparfyte maye man dout ni somblysfulnesse sadde stedfast parfyte b concluded fermely sothfastly p consydre also whome blisfulnesse inhabyteth comune accorde conceyte courage men proueth graunteth ye god prince thynges good nothynge may houyt better good may douted nothing ni better tha ni good certes reason sheweth god good proueth force parfyte good hym yf god ni suche ne maye ben prince thyng certes somthyng possessynge selfe parfyte good shulde worthy god shulde semen thilk thynge fyrst older god haue shewed apertly thynges yt bene parfyte ben fyrst thinges bene imparfyte thy moch reason processe ne goo awaye without ende owe graunten souerayne good ryghtfull souerayn parfyte good haue establysshed yt souerayne good blysfulnesse tha mote nedes verye blysfulnesse set souerayne good b take well quod ne ne maye withsayde maner p praye quod se thou mayest prouen holily without corruption haue said souerayne god full ryght souerayne good b maner p wenest thou ought father al thinges hath taken thilke souerayn good hym selfe souerayne good men proueth full ryght thou mightest thinke god yt hath blysfulnesse hym selfe thilk blisfulnesse hym dyuers substaunce yf thou wene yt god hath receyued thylke good hym self thou mayst wene yaue thilke good god worthye god beknowe confesse ryght dignly god right worthy aboue al thinges yf yt good nature dyuers hym wenynge reason syns speken god prynce thynges fayne fayne maye conioyned thynges togyther eke last se well thing dyuers fro anye thynge thylke thynge ny thyng vnderstonden ben dyuers foloweth wel thylke thynge yt nature dyuers souerayne good thynge souerayne good certes felonous cursednesse thynken yt hym nothynge ni worth alwaye thynges name hem ne maye ben better begynner maye concluden ryght reason thylke begynnyng al thinges thilke thyng souerayne god substaunce b thou hast sayd ryghtfully quod philoso haue grauted quod souerayne good blysfulnesse boece soth quod philosophye quod moten nedes graunten confessen thilke souerayne good god boece certes quod ne maye denye ne withstande reason purposed se well foloweth strength premiss phylo loke nowe quod yf proued yet fermely thus ne mowe ben souerayne goodes bene dyuers amonge hem selfe certes goodes ben dyuers amonge hem selfe one ne mowen neither hem parfyte eyther hem lacketh ny parfyte men maye sene apertly ny souerayne thynges ben soueraynly good ne mowen waye dyuers haue well concluded blysfulnesse god bene souerayne good whyche mote neades bene souerayne blysfulnesse souerayne dignitie boce nothynge quod sothefast ne ferme reason ne worthye thynge god may concluded philosophy vpon thinges quod ryght geometricies whan haue shewed theyr proposition ben wonte bryngen thynges clepen porrismes declaracions forsaid thynges ryght woll yeue corallarye mede crowne moche gettynge blysfulnesse men bene maked blysfull blysfulnesse dignitie manifest open gettynge dignitie men maked blysfull ryght gettynge iustyce gettyng sapyence maked wyse ryghte nedes semblable reason whan haue gotten dyuinitie made goddes euerye blysfull man god certes nature ny one god participacion diuynitie ne letteth ne dystourbeth nothynge ne manye goddes boece quod fayre thynge precious clepe thou wilt corollarye porrisme mede crowne declarynge philosophy certes quod nothynge ny fayrer thynge reason shoulde added forsayde thynges boece thyng quod phylosoph quod semeth blysfulnesse contayneth manye thynges weten whether thynges maken conioynen maner bodye blysfulnesse diuersite partyes membres el yf anye thynges suche accomplysshe hym selfe substaunce blysfulnesse thinges ben referred brought blysfulnesse say chefe hem boece wolde quod thou madest clerely vnderstande thou sayest thou recordeste forsayde thynge philosophye haue iudged quod blysfulnesse good boece yes forsoth quod soueraigne good philoso adde quod thylke good made blysfulnesse forsayde thynges thylke blysfulnesse demed soueraygne suffysaunce thylke selfe souerayne power souerayne reuerence souerayne clerenesse noblesse souerayne delyte sayest thou al thynges say suffysaunce power thynges ben membres blysfulnesse ben referred brought souerayne good ryght al thynges ben brought chefe hem boece vnderstonde well quod thou purposeste seke desyre herken thou shewe philoso take thus discretion question quod yf thynges quod membres felicitie dyuers one suche nature partyes membres dyuers membres compownen bodye boece certes hath well shewed beforne thynges ben one thinge philo ben mo membres quod el shulde seme blisfulnesse conioyned membre aloone thynge maye done boece thyng quod doutous abyde hearken remnaunt thy questyon philo open clere thynges ben referred brought good therfore suffysauce requyred demed good thy power requyred men trowen also good thynge mowen thynken coniecten reuerence noblesse delyte souerayne good summe cause ought ben desyred thylke thyng withholdeth good sell ne semblaunce good ne maye well maner desyred ne requyred contrarye though thynges nature ne ben good algates yf men wenen ben good yet ben desyred though verelye good therefore sayde men ought wene ryght bountie bene souerayne fyne cause thynges bene requyren certes thilke cause requiren thing semeth thilke thyng desyred thus yf wyghte wolde ryden cause heale ne desyreth moch ye mouinge ryden effecte heale nowe syns al thynges ben requyred grace good ben desyred al folke good haue graunted blysfulnesse thynge whyche thynges bene desyred thus certes blysfulnesse required desyred whych thynge sheweth clerelye good blysfulnesse one substaunce boece se quod wherfore men myghte discorden thys philosoph haue shewed god blysfulnesse one thynge boe soth phi mowe conclude sykerly substaunce god set thylke good none place huc oes pariter venite capti quos fallar ligat improbis catenis terrenas habitans libido mentes hic erit vobis requies laborum c cometh togyther nowe ye bene ycaughte bounde wyth wicked chaynes deceyuable delyte earthlye thynges inhabytinge thought shall rest youre laboure hauen stable quyet pesyble alone open refute wretch sayne ye combred deceyued wyth worldly affectious cometh nowe thys souerayn good god refute hem wyllen comen hym thynges ryuer tagus yeueth wyth hys golden grauels el thynges riuer hennus yeueth wyth hys reed brynke ye indus yeueth nexte hote partye worlde medleth grene stone wyth whyte ne shulde cleren loking thought hyden rather blynd corage within derkenesse lyketh excyteth moueth thoughtes earth hath noryshed within lowe caues ye shynyng heuen gouerned whence strength escheweth derke ouerthrowyng ye soule euer may knowen thylke lyghte blysfulnesse wyll sayne whyte beames sune ne clere assentior iu quam cucta enim firmissi mi nexa rationibus costant tu illa quanti inquit tu estima bi si bonum ipsum quid sit agnoueris c boece assente quod al thinges ben stro gly bounden wyth ryght ferme reason philoso howe muche wylte thou praysen yf thou knowe thylke good boece wol prayse quod price wythout ende yf shall betyde knowe also togyther god good phi certes shal reason thinges haue cocluded lytle beforne dwelle onelye grautyng b dwellen grauted yt sayne sayth graunt thy forsayd conclusyons philoso haue shewed thinges ben required many folke ne bene goodes ne perfite bene diuers one fro ye eche hem lacking ne haue power brynge good full absolute erste bene good wha bene gathered togyder one forme one werkynge thylke thynge suffysaunt thylke power reuerence noblesse myrth forsothe yf thynges one thynge ne haue wherby mowe put nombre thynges ought required desired boece shewed ne hereof maye man douten phi thynges ne bene goodes whan bene diuers whan begynnen al one thyng bene goodes ne cometh tha gettyng vnyte maked goodes boece semeth quod philo al thynge good graunteste thou good participation good boece graunt quod philoso must thou grauted quod semblable reason one good one thynge thynges whyche effecte ny naturelly diuers nedes substaunce must one thyng boece ne maye denye quod philoso haste thou knowen well thynge hath longe hys dwellyng substaunce longe one whan forletteth bene one muste nedes dyen corrumpen togyther b maner philo ryght beestes quod whan soule bodye bene conioyned one dwellen togyther cleped beest whan vnite distroyed dysceuerauce one sheweth wel yt deed thing lenger beast body wight whyle dwelleth one fourme coniunction membres well sene fygure mankynde yf partyes bydye deuyded disceuered one distroye vnite ye body forleteth beforne wold renue maner thynges shulde sene yt without dout euery thynge hys substaunce longe one whan forleteth one dyeth perisheth boece wha consyder quod manye thynges se none philoso thyng muche lyueth naturelly forleteth talent apetyte beynge desyreth come deathe corruption boece consyder quod beastes haue anye maner nature wyllyng nyllyng ne fynde beest yf constrayned fro wythout forthe forleteth dyspyceth entencion lyuen duren wyll hys thankes hasten hym dyen euerye beaste trauayleth hym defende kepe sauacion hys lyfe escheweth death dystruction certes doute herbes tree ne haue felynge soules ne naturell workynges seruynge appetytes beastes haue whether haue appetyte dwelle duren philosoph certes quod therof dare doute nowe loke vpon herbes tree wexen fyrste suche place bene couenable hem whyche place mowe dyen ne dryen longe nature maye defende hem hem wexen feldes wexen mou taignes wexe mareys cleauen rockes wexen ple teous sondes yf wyght enforce hym beare hem place wexen drye nature yeueth euerye thynge conueniente hym trauayleth ne dye longe haue power dwellen lyuen wylte thou sayne thys drawen nouryshynges rootes ryghte hadde mouthes yplouged within earthes sheaden maryes wodde barke wylte thou sayne thys thylke thynge ryghte softe marye alwaye hydde seate within defended wythoute stedfastnesse wodde vttereste barkes put ayenst distemperaunce heauen defendoure myghtye suffr harme thus certes mayste thou well sene howe great dyligence nature thynges renouelen publyshed hem wyth seede ymultyplyed ne ny man ne wote well ne bene ryghte foundemente edefyce duren onely tyme ryghte dure perdurably generatio yt thinges eke men went ne haue soules ne desyre semblable reason kepen hys sayne accordynge nature conseruation beyng enduryng wherfore el beareth lyghtnesse flambes vp weyghte presseth earth adowne muche thylke place thylke mouinges couenable eueryth hem forsothe euery thynge kepeth thylke accordynge propre hym ryght thynges bene contraryous enemy corrumpen hem yet harde thinges stone cleauen holden party togyther right fast harde defenden hem withstadyng ne departen lyghtly yeuen place hem breaken deuyde hem nathlesse retournen ayen soone sam thynges whence araced fyre f eeth refuseth deuysyon ne ne treate nowe wylful mouinges soule knowyng naturell entention thynges thus ryght swalowen meate receyuen ne thynke draw breath slepyng weten whyle slepen certes beestes loue lyuynges ne beynges ne cometh wylnynges soule begynnynges nature certes thoroughe constraynynge cause wyll desyreth embraseth ful oft tymes deth nature dredeth sayn thus man maye constrayned cause wyl desyreth taketh deathe whyche nature hateth dredeth full sore tyme sene contrary thus yt wyll wyght disturbeth constrayneth nature alwaye desyreth requyreth say yt werkes generacion generacion onely dwelleth susteyned longe durabylite mortall thynges thus thys charite loue euery thynge hathe hym selfe ne cometh mouynge soule entencion nature purueyaunce god hathe yeuen thynges bene create hym thys full great cause lyuen duren whyche desyren naturelly lyfe longe euer mowen whych thou mayst dreden maner thynges bene anye ne require naturelly ferme stablenesse perdurable dwellyng eke eschewyng distruction boece cofesse se wel certaynly withouten dout thinges whyle ago semeden vncertaine philoso thylke thynge desyreth dwell perdurablye desyreth bene one yf one distroyed certes beynge shulde none dwellen wyght boece sothe quod philo quod desyren thynges one boece assent phi haue shewed thilke one thilke good boece yea forsoth phi thynges quod requyren good thylke maist thou discriuen thus good thylke thynge euery wyght desyreth boece ne maye thoughte thynge quod eyther thynges referred brought naught floteren wythout gouernoure dispoyled one propre heade el yf thynge whyche thynges tenden hyen thynge muste souerayne good goodes philosoph sayde thus norice haue great gladnesse thou haste fixed thy herte myddell sothfastnesse sayue prycke thys thynge hath discouered thou saydeste thou wystest lytel beforne boece quod philo thou ne wystest quod whych ende thynges certes thynge euery wyght desyreth muche haue gathered comprehended good thylke thynge desyred mote nedes confessen good fyne thynges quisquis profunda mete vestigat verum cupit que nullis elle deuiis falli iu se reuoluat intimi lucem visus c sekethe sothe depe thought coueteth bene disceyued miswayes let hym rollen treaten wyth hym selfe lyght hys inwarde syght let hym gatheren ayen enclynynge compase longe mouynges hys thoughtes let hym teachen hys corage hath enclosed hyde hys treasours hath compassed sought fro without thylke thynge blacke cloudes errour whylome couered shal lyght clerely phebus hym selfe ne shyneth glosa wyl seke depe groundes sothe hys thoughte woll disceyued false proposicions gone mysse trouth let hym wel examine rolle wythin hym selfe nature proprietes thynge lette hym yet eftesones examyne rolle hys thoughtes good deliberacion deme let hym teachen hys soule hath naturel pryncyples kyndlyche yhydde wythin selfe trouth ymagineth bene thynges wythout al darkenesse hys mysknowynge shall seme enydently syght hys vndersta dynge sunne ne semeth sight without forth certes body bringing weyght foryeting ne hath chaced thought clerenesse knowynge certaynlye seede sothe holdeth cleaueth wythin corage awaked excited wyndes blastes doctrine wherfore el demen ye owne wyl yt ryghtes wha ye asked norishing reason ne lyued yplunged depe herte sayne howe shuld men demen sothe thynge asked yf nere roote sothfastnesse yplunged hyd naturel princyples whyche sothfastnesse lyued within depenesse thought yf muse doctrine plato syngeth sothe euerye wyght lerneth ne doth nothynge el recordeth men recorden thynges bene foryeten tum ego platoni quam vehementer assentior nam horum sam secundo commemoras primum quod memoriam corporea contagione c sayde thus acorde gretly plato thou recordest remebreste thynges yet second tyme saye fyrste whan left memory contrarious coiunction body soule eftsones afterwarde whan loste confounded thy charge burdone sorow sayd thus thou loke quod fyrste thynges thou haste graunted ne shall bene ryghte ferre thou ne shalte remembren ylke thynge thou saydest thou nystest nat boece thynge quod p whyche gouermente quod worlde gouerned boece remembre well quod cconfesse well ne wyste naughte se nowe ferre thou purposest algates desyre yet herken playnlye philoso thou ne wendest lytle beforne men shuld dout thys worlde gouerned god boe certes quod ne yet ne doute nat ne nyll neuer wene doute sayeth wote well god gouerneth thys worlde shall answeren reason brought thys thys worlde quod many diuers contraryous partyes ne myght neuer haue bene assembled forme yf one coioyned many diuers thynges ye diuersite nature discorden one fro muste departen vnioynen thynges bene conioyned yf ne one conteyned hath conioyned ybounde ne certaine order nature ne shuld nat brynge forth ordeyne mouynges place time doynges space qualytees ther ne one aye stedfaste dwellinge ordeyned disposed diuersytees mouynges thylke thynge euer whyche al thynges bene ymaked ladde clepe hym god worde vsed al folkes philoso sayd syth thou felyste thus thynges trowe haue lytle done thou myghtye welfulnesse hole sound ne se eftsones thy countrey let v loken thynges haue purposed beforne haue nat nombred sayde quod suffysaunce blysfulnesse haue accorded god thylke blysfulnesse boece yes forsoth quod philoso gouerne thys worlde ne shall neuer haue nede none helpe fro wythout el yf nede helpe ne shulde haue full suffysaunce boe yes thus nedes quod philo ordeined selfe alone al thinges quod boe may denied quod philoso haue shewed thee god good boe remembreth well quod philoso ordeyneth al thynges thylke good quod syth whyche haue accorded good gouerneth thynges hym selfe key steyre whyche edifyce thys worlde kepte stable wythoute corrumpynge boece accorde greatly haue apperceyued alytle beforne yu woldest saye thus yt thynne suspeccyon phi trowe wel quod trowe thou ledest nowe ententyflye thyne eye loken goodes nathlesse ye thing shalll tell yet ne sheweth lasse lo boece quod philoso men trowe quod right fully god gouerneth al thinges key goodnesse al thinges haue taughte hasten hem naturel entecyon come good ther may man doubten ne bene gouerned voluntaryly ne couerten hem owne good wyll ordeynoure bene accordyng inclinyng wher gouernour kynge boece mote nedes quod realme ne shulde seme blysfull yf oke mysdrawynges dyuers partyes sauing obediente thynges ne shuld philo nothynge quod yt kepeth hys nature enforceth hym gone ayenst god boece quod p nd yf yt thinge enforced hym wythstande god myghte auaylen laste ayen hym haue graunted almyghty right blisfulnesse boece certes od vtterlye ne myghte auayle hym philoso nothyng quod eyther maye wyll wythstande hys souerayne god boece trowe philyso quod thylke souerayne god thynges gouernethe strongly ordeyneth hem softly boece sayd thus delyte quod onely thendes summe reason thou haste concluded proued thylke wordes thou vseste delyten much laste fooles yt somtyme renden greate thynges oughten bene ashamed hem selfe sayne fooles repreheden wyckedly ye thinges touchen goddes gouernaunce oughten bene ashamed selfe ard god refuseth onely werkes men ne entermeteth philoso thou haste well herde quod fable poetes gyauntes assayleden heuen wt goddes forsothe debo e force god dysposed hem worthy yt sayn distroyed ye grautes worthy wylt yu reyione togither thylke reason perauenture coiunction may sterten vp fayre sparke soth b lyste p enest thou quod yt god ne almyghty boece man doute certes philoso wyght ne douteth yf hys mynde almyghty ny nothynge ne may boe soth quod philo may god yuel quod boece nay forsoth quod philo yuell nothynge syth ne maye done none yuell maye done thynges boece scornest thou el playest thou deceyuest thou haste wonnen wyth thy reason house dedalus entrelasyng vnable vnlaced yt thou otherwhyle entrest thou issuest otherwhyle issuest thou entrest ne foldest thou togyther replication wordes maner wonderfull cercle enuyronnyng ye simplicite dyuine certes lytle beforn whan thou began blysfulnesse thou saydest souerayne good god blysfulnesse whyche thou yaue couenable yefte saine wyght ny blysful god also ther wyth saydest eke ye forme good substaunce god blysfulnesse saydest thylke one thylke good requyred desyred al kynde thinges thou prouedest disputyng god gouerneth thinges worlde gouernaunce bountye saydest al thinges wold obeyen hym saydest nature yuell nothynge thynges shewdest thou wyth reason taken fro wythout proues cercles homlyche knowynge whyche proues drawen hem selfe fayth accorde eueriche hem philo sayde thus ne scorne ne playe ne dis eyue haue shewed thynge greateste ouer al thynges yefte god whylom prayden thys fourme dyuine substaunce ne slydeth vtterest forayne thynges ne receyueth straunge thynges hym right permenides sayden greke thylke diuine substaunce sayd thus thylke dyuine substaunce turneth world mouable cercle thynges whyle ylke dyuine substaunce kepeth selfe wythout mouynges sayne moneth neuer mo yet moueth al thynges nathlesse yf haue styred reason taken fro wythoute compace thynge whyche treaten reason ben bestowed within compace ny thou shuldest meruaylen syth thou hast lerned sentence plato nedes wordes mote bene cosyns thynges whyche speken felix qui potuit boni fontem vise relucidu felix qui potuit grauis c blyssed man may sene clere welle good blysfull maye vnbynden hym boundes heuy earth poete thrace orpheus yt whylom ryght greate sorowe death hys wyfe maked constrayned hys wepely songes wodes mouable rene maked ryuers stonden styl maked harte hyndes ioynen dredelesse sydes cruell lyon herken hys songe maked hare agaste ye houde whych pleased songe whan moost ardaunt loue hys wyfe brende entrayles hys breste ne songes yt ouercomen thynges ne myghten aswagen lorde orpheus playned hym heauen goddes cruell hym went hym house tempered hys blandyshyng song b resonnynge strynges spake longe wepynge euer receyued laued noble welles mother caliope goddesse sange wyth muche myght wepynge wyth much loue doubled sorowe myght yeuen hym teach hym comoned hell requyred besoughte swete prayer lordes soules hell releasynges saye yelden hys wyfe cerberus porter hell wyth hys thre heades caught abashed new songe ye thre goddess furyes vengeresses felonyes tourmenten agaste soules anoye woxen soroufull sorye teares wepten pyte tho heade ixion tonemented ouerthrowynge whele tantalus distroyed woodnesse longe thurst dispysed floodes drynke foule hyght vultur eateth stomake gyserne tityus fulfylled hys songe nyll eaten ne tyren laste lorde iuge soules moued myserirordies cryed bene ouercome yeue orpheus hys wyfe beare hym company hath well ybought hys songes hys dyties wyll putten law thys couenaunte yefte sayn yt tyl hel yf loke behinde hym hys wyfe shall come agayne vnto v maye yeue law louers loue greater law stronger selfe lawe may yeuen ala whan orpheus hys wyfe almost termes night sayne laste boundes hell orpheus loked backewarde eurydice hy wyfe loste deade thys table apertayneth euer desyreth seketh lede thought souerayne daye saye clerenesse souerayne good euer ouercomen fixe eyen pytte hell sayne euer sette hys thoughtes erthly thynges yt euer hath drawe ye noble good celestiall leseth whan loketh helles thys sayne lowe thynges earth pthus endeth thyrde boke boece foloweth fourth hec cum philosophia dignita te vultus et oris grauitate seruata leniter suauiter que cecinisset tum ego nondum penitus insiti meroris oblitus c philosophie songen softly delectably forsayd thynges kepyng ye dignite chere weyghte wordes ne vtterly foryeten wepyng mournynge set myne herte forbrake entencion entended yet sayne thynges quod thou arte gyderesse verye lyght thinges thou hast sayd hytherto ben clere shewynge dyuyne lokynge hem thy reason ne mowen ben ouercomen thylke thynges thou toldest whylom foryeten hem sorowe wronge hath done yet neuerthelesse ne vtterly vnknowen thys namely ryght greate cause sorowe yt gouernour thynges good yf yuels mowe ben wayes el yf yuels passen wythout punyshyng thyng worthy ben wodred vpon thou consydrest well thy selfe certaynly yet thynge yet thynge ioyned wondred vpon felonye emperesse floureth ful rychesse vertue ny wyth medes cast downe eke fortroden vnder fete felonous folke abyeth tourmentes stede wycked f ion whyche thynges wyght maye maruaylen ynough ne complaynen thynges done reygne god al thynges wote al thynges maye ne wyl good thinges sayd thus certes quod great maruayle abashyng wyth ende well horrible al monster yf thou wenest sayne ryghte ordayne house moch father ordaynour meyne vessel ben foule vyle shuld ben honoured heryed precious vessel shuld ben defouled vyle yf thynges haue concluded lytel beforne ben kept hole vnaraced thou shalte well knowe authorite god whose reygne speke certes good folke alwaye myghty shrewes ben alwaye outcaste feble ne vyces neuer wythout payne ne vertues ne wythout mede blysfulnesse cometh alway good folke infortune cometh alway wicked folke thou shalt well knowen many thynges thys kynde shuld ceasen thy playntes strengthen wyth stedfast sadnesse thou hast sene forme blysfulnesse haue whylom shewed thou haste knowen whome blysfulnesse set althynge treated trow necessary put forth shall shewen waye shall bryngen ayen vnto thyne house shall fyxe fethers thy thought maye arysen heyght tribulation ydone awaye thou gydynge pathe fledes shalte mowen retourne hole sounde thy countrey sunt etenim penne volueres michi que celsa conscendunt polt quas sibi cli velox men induit c thy swyfte fethers yt surmounten heyght heuen swyft thought hath clothed tho feather dyspiseth hatefull erthes surmounteth rou denesse great ayre seeth cloudes behynde hys backe passeth heyghte regyon fyre enchaufeth swyfte mouynge fyrmament tyll aryseth house bearen sterres ioyneth waye wyth sunne phebus felowshyppeth waye olde colde saturnus ymaked knyght clere sterre saye whe thought made goddes knight sekynge clere trouthe comen verye knowlege god thilk soule reneth ye clerke sterrres al place shynynge nyght ypaynted sayne nyght cloudlesse nyghtes cloudlesse semeth heauen paynted wyth dyuers ymages sterres whe hath done ynough shall forleten laste heuen shall presen wenden backe swyft fyrmament shal maked parfyte worshypfull lyght god holdeth lorde thinges sceptre hys might attempreth gouernementes worlde shynynge iuge thynges stable hym selfe gouerneth ye swyft carte wayne sayne cyrculer mouynge sunne yf thy waye ledeth ye ayen thou brought thyder wylt thou saye countrye thou requyrest whych thou ne haddest mynde nowe remembreth well borne wol faste degre wol dwel yf lyketh loken darkenesses earth thou haste forleten shalte thou sene felonous tyrauntes wretched people dredeth nowe shullen ben exyled thylke fayre countrey tu ego pape inqua vt magna promittis nec dubito qui possis efficere tu modo que exitaneris ne moreris sayd thus woder thou behetest great thinges ne ne doute thou ne mayst well performe thou behetest praye thys thou ne tarye tel thylke thynges thou hast moued ph fyrst thou muste nedes knowe good folke ben alway stroge myghtye shrewes ben feble deserte naked strengthes thynges certes eueryche hem declared shewed good euell ben two contrary yf good sted faste sheweth feblesse openly yf thou knowe clerely frelnesse yuel stedfastnesse good knowen moche fayth sentence shal ferme haboundaunt woll gone one way woll conferme thynges ben purposed nowe thys syde nowe syde two thynges ben whyche effecte dedes mankynde standeth sayne wyll power yf one two fayleth ny nothynge maye done yf wyll lacketh ny wyghte vndertaketh wol done yf power fayleth wyll ny ydle stante naught therof cometh yf thou se wight wolde getten maye getten thou mayst doute power ne fayleth hym hauen wolde boece thys open clere quod ne ne maye bene denyed maner philo yf thou se wyght quod hath done wolde done thou nyll doute ne hath power done bo quod p euerye wyght maye holden hem mighty done thinge moche man myghtye done thynge moche men holde hym myghty ne maye men demen hem feble boece confesse well quod phi remembre quod haue gathered shewed forsayde reason entencion wyll mankynde whyche ladde dyuers studyes hasteth comen blysfulnesse boece remembreth wel quod hath bene shewed philoso recordeth nought quod blysfulnesse thylke good men requyren blysfulnesse requyred boece recordeth quod haue alwaye memorie fyxed phi folke quod good eke badde enforcen hem wythout dyfference entencion comen good boece thys consequence quod philoso certayne quod gettynge good men maked good boece certayne quod philo getten good men desyren boece semeth quod p wycked folke quod yf getten good desyren ne mowen wycked boece quod p one quod desyren good good folke getten good wycked folke doute good folke ne myghty wycked folke feble boece euer douteth thys ne maye co syder nature thynges ne cosequece reason philoso ouer thys quod yf ben two thynges haue one sam purpose kynde one hem pursueth perfourmeth thynge naturell offyce ne may thylke offyce naturell foloweth maner couenable nature accomplysheth hys purpose kyndly yet ne accomplysheth hys owne purpose whether two demest thou meghtye boece yf coniecte quod thou woldest saye algates desyre yet herken playnlye p iloso thou nyl e denye quod mouement goynge ny men kynde boece forsoth quod philo ne thou doutest quod thylke naturell offyce goynge ne offyce offere boece ne doute quod philoso quod yf wyghte e myghtye moue goeth vppon hys ete another whome thylke naturel offyce fete lacketh enforseth hym go crepy ge hys hande whyche two oughte holden myghtye ryght boece knytte forth quod remnaunt philosophia wyght ne douteth may gone naturel offyce ete ne myghtye ne maye souerayne good quod euen lyke purposed good badde good folke seken naturell offyce vertues shrewes enforcen hem getten dyuers couetyses earthly thynges whyche ny naturell offyce getten thylke souerayne good trowest thou otherwyse boece naye quod consequence open shewynge thynges haue grau ted nedes good folke moten ben myghtye shrewes moten bene feble vnmyghtye philosophia thou rennest aryght beforne quod thys iudgemente sayne iuge ryghte lech bene wonte hopen sycke folke apperceyuen nature redressed wythstandeth maladye se nowe redy wythstandynge shal shewe thylke continuell reason loke howe greatlye sheweth feblenesse infyrmite wycked folke ne mowen comen naturell entencion leadeth hem yet almoste thylke naturell entencion constrayneth hem demen shrewes yf thylke naturell helpe forlette hem whyche naturell helpe entencion goeth alwaye beforne hem greate vnneth maye ouercomen consyder howe great defaute power howe greate feblesse wycked felonous folke sayeth ye greater thynge coueyted desyre accomplyshed lasse myght coueyteth maye accomplyshe thy philosophie sayeth thus souerayne good ne shrewes ne requyren lyght medes ne vayne game whych ne maye folowen ne holde faylen thylke sume heyght thynges sayne souerayne good ne wretch ne comen theffecte souerayne good enforcen hem onely getten nyghtes dayes gettynge whych good stregth good folke ful wel ysent ryght thou myghtest demen hym myghty goynge yt goeth hys fete tyll myght comen thylke place fro whyche place ne laye waye gone ryghte muste thou nedes demen hym ryght myghty whych getteth attayneth ende thynges whyche bene desyren beyonde whyche ende ny nothynge desyre whych power good folke men maye coclude wycked men semen barayne naked strength forletten vertues folowen vyces ny ne knowen goodes thynge feble caytyfe blyndnesse ignoraunce el knowe wel whych thynges oughte folowen lechery couetyse ouerthroweth hem mysturned certes dothe dystemperaunce feble men mowe wrast len ayen vice ne knowe wel forletten good wylfullye tournen hem wylfully vyces thys wyse ne forlete onely myghty forleten al vtterly wyse ben forlete comune fyne thynges ben forleten also therwythall ben perauenture shuld semen folke thys maruayle sayne shrewes whych conteynen partes men ne bene ne haue beynge natheles thus stante thys thinge shrewes denye shrewes denye symply playnly ne ne haue beynge ryght thou myghtest fayne carayne man deed man graunt wel forsoth vicious folke ben wycked ne may absolutely symplye graunt ben thylke thynge holdeth ordre kepeth nature thylke thynge hath beynge thynge fayleth saye forleteth naturel order forleteth thylke beynge set hys nature thou wolt sayne yt shrewes mowen certes ne denye certes power ne dyscendeth strength feblenesse mowen done wyckednesse whyche ne myght yf myghten dwellen forme doynge good people thylke power sheweth euydently yt mowe ryght naught haue gadred proued lytell beforn euyll shrewes may shreudnesse thys conclusyon al clere shrewes ne mowe ryght naught ne haue power moch thou vnderstandest whych strength power haue defynyshed lytel beforne thynge ny myghty souerayne good boece soth p thylke souerayne good maye done none euell boece certes philo wyght weneth men mowen done al thynges boe man yf hys wyt phi certes shrewes mowen yuels quod boece yea wolde god quod ne myghten done none phi quod myghty done onely good thinges maye done thynges bene myghtye done yuell thynges ne mowen thynges open thynge manyfest mowen done yuell ben lasse power yet proue coclusyon helpeth thys haue shewed beforne power nombred amonge thinges men oughten requyre haue shewed thynges oughten bene desyred referred god ryghte maner heyght nature mowen done yuell felonye ne maye ben referred god yuell nombre thynges oughten bene desyred requyred open clere power ne mouynge shrewes ny power thynges sheweth well go folke ben certaynly myghty shrewes doutlesse vnmyghty clere ope thylke sentence plato soth sayeth onely wysemen maye desyren shrewes mowen h ten hem lyketh desyre sayne come souerayne good ne haue power accomplyshe shrewes done hem lyste b tho thynges whych delyten wenen attayne thylke good desyren ne getten ne attayne thert vyces ne comen blysfulnesse quos vides sedere celsos sol culmine regis purpura claro intente c couertures vayne apparaylles myght strypen proude kynges tho seest sytten hygh chayres glytterynge shynynge purpure enuyronned wyth sorowfull armures manassynge wyth cruell mouth blowynge woodnesse herte shulde sene thylke lordes ren wythin corages full strayte chaynes letherye tourmenteth hem one syde wyth gredye venymes troublable yre arayseth hem floode troublynges tourmenteth syde thoughte sorowe halte hem wery ycaught slydynge dysceyuynge hope tourmenteth hem therfore sythe thou seest one heed sayne one tyraunt bearen many tyrannyes ne dothe thylke tyraunt desyreth syth caste downe wyth many wycked lordes sayne many vyces haue wyckedly lordshyps ouer hym vides ne igitur quado ceno probra voluantur que probitas luce resplendeat quo perspicuum est nun quam bonis premia c seest thou greate fylthe shrewes ben ywrapped wyth whyche clerenesse good folke shynen sheweth well good folk ne lacked neuer mo medes ne shrewes en neuer tourmentes al thinges done thylke thynge whyche thynge done semeth ryghte thylke thynge ye mede thus yf man renneth stadye forlonge crowne lyeth mede crowne whych reneth haue hewed blysfulnesse thylke good whych thynges ben done thylke good purposed werkes mankynde ryght comune mede whych mede ne maye dysceuered good folke wyght ryght thensforth hym lacketh goodnesse ne shall cleped good whyche thynge folke good maners medes ne forsake hem neuer mo al shrewes waxen woode hem lyst ayenst good folke yet neuerthelesse crowne wysemen ne shall fallen ne fade fro forayne shreudnesse ne benym men fro ye corage good people pro honour yf wyght reioysed hym goodnesse taken fro wythout sayeth yf man hys goodnesse hym selfe certes yt aue hym thylke goodnesse el wyght myghte bynome hym moche euery wyght hys propre bounte eueth hym hys mede erst shal fayken mede forleteth good last al medes ben requyred wenen yt good olde deme ryght myghtye good partelesse mede mede shal reguerdoned certes ofright fayre mede ryght great abouen medes remembre thilke noble corallarie yt yaue lytell beforne gather togyther thys maner god hym selfe blysfulnesse clere certayne good people ben maked blysfull ben good thylke people ben blysful accordeth couenable goddes ye mede people suche day ne shall enpayren ne wyckednesse shall dryken ne power wyght ne shall amenuse sayne bene maked goddes syth thus good ne faylen neuer mede certes ne may doute vndepartable payne shrewes sayne yt payne shrewes departeth hem selfe neuer mo good euell payne medes contrarye mote nedes ryght se betyden guerdone good also mote payne yuel answere co trarye partyes shrewes nowe bountye prowes ben mede good folke also shreudnesse selfe tourmet shrewes euer enteched defouled wyth payne ne douteth enteched defouled wyth euell yf shrewes wollen praysen hem selfe may semen hem ben wythoute party tourment syth ben suche vttrest wickednesse yt saye wycked thewes whych vttrest worst kynde shreudnesse ne defouleth ne entecheth hem enfecteth enuenymeth greatly also loke shrewes ben contrarye partye good men howe great payne feloushyppeth fouleth hem thou hast lerned lytel beforne thynge hath beynge one thylke one good thys ye consequence yt semeth well thynge yt hath beynge good yt sayne sayeth beyng vnite goodnesse al one thys maner foloweth yt al thynge fayleth good stynteth haue anye maner beyng wherfore yt shrewes stynten yt thylke forme makinde sayne yt fourme body wythout sheweth shrewes whylom men wherfore bene peruerted tourned malyce certes haue forlorne nature mankynde bountye prowesse maye enhausen euery man ouer men mote nedes shrewes whyche shreudenesse hath caste oute condycyon mankynde bene put vnder meryte deserte men betydeth yf thou seest wyghte whyche transfourmed vyces thou mayest wene man yf ardaunt auaryce rauenour vyolence forayne rychesse thou shalte sayne lyke wolfe yf felonous wythouten reste exercyse hys tonge chydynges thou shalte lyken hym hounde yf pryuy awaytour hydde reioyseth hym rauysh wyles thou shalte sayne hym lyke foxe whelpes yf distempred quaketh yre men shall wenen beareth corage lyon yf dredful flyenge dredeth thynges whych ne oughten dredde men shal hold hym lyke harte yf slowe astonyed lache men shall holde hym lyke asse yf lyghte vnstedfaste corage chaungeth aye studyes shall holde hym lyke byrdes yf plonged foule vncleane luxuryes wythholden foule delyces foule sowe foloweth yt forleteth bounte prowesse forleteth man syth ne maye passen condicion god turned beest vela naricii ducis et vagas pelago rate eurus appulit insule pulchra qua residens dea solis edita semine c evrus wynde aryued sayles vlixes duke coutre narice hys wrandrynge shyppes see ye yle ther circe ye fayre goddes doughter sunne dwelleth medleth newe gestes drynkes ben touched maked wyth enchautemetes hyr hande myghty ouer herbes chau ged hyr gestes dyuers maners one hem couered hys face wyth forme boor chaunged lyon countre marmorike hys nayles hys tethe wexen hem newlyche chaunged wolfe howleth wolde wepe goeth debonayrly house tygre inde godheed mercury cleped byrde archady hath mercy duke vlixes beseged wyth dyuers yuelles hath vnbounden hem fro pestilence hys hostesse algates rower maryners hadden thys ydrawen hyr mouthes dronken wycked drynkes woxen swyne hadden thys ychaunged hyr meate bread eaten akorne ookes none hir lymmes ne dwelleth wyth hem hoole haue lost voyce body thought dwelleth wyth hem stable wepeth bewayleth monstruous chaungynge suffren ouer lyght hande sayeth feble lyght hande circe enchaunteresse chaugeth bodyes folke beestes regarde comparyson mutacyon maked vyces herbes circe ne myghty al may chaungen lymmes body algate yet may chaunge hertes wythin yhyd strength vygoure secretour hyr hertes sayne strength reason thylke venymes vyces drawe hem myghtely ye venym cuces vyces bene cruell persen thorowe passen courage wythin though ne anoye body yet vyces wooden destroyen men wounde thought tu ego fateor quam nec iniuria dici video viciosos tam et si humani corporis speciem seruent c sayd thus confesse aknowe ne ne se men maye saye ryght shrewes ben chaunged beestes qualite soules kepen yet forme bodye mankynde wolde shrewes whych thought cruell woode woodeth alwaye destruccion good men lefull hem done certes quod ne lefull hem shall wel shewe couenable place nathelesse yf thilke men wene ben leful shrewes bynommed ne myght anoyen done harme good men certes great partye payne shrewes shulde ben alleged releued ne seme credyble thynge perauenture folke mote nedes yt shrewes ben wretch sely whan may full doone parfourme coueyten yf myght accomplyste coueyten yf wretchydnesse wylne yuel wretchednesse mowe done yuell without mowyng wretched wyl shulde languyshe without effecte sythe euerye thynges hath wretchydnesse sayne wyl done yuell mowyng doone yuell mote nedes shrewes constrayned vnselynesses wolen mowen parfourmen felonyes shreudnesses boece acorde desyre greatly shrewes losten soone thylke vnselynesse sayn shrewes spoyled mowyng done yuel phi ullen soner perauenture thou woldeste soner hem selfe wene ny nothing late short boundes thys lyfe longe abyde namely courage immortell whyche shrewes great hope hye compassynges shreudnesse ofte destroyed sodeyn ende ware thyng establyshed shrewes ende shreudnesse shreudnesse maketh wretch must nedes wretche longest shrewe whyche wciked shrewes wolde demyn aldermoost caytyfes vnsely yf shrewdnesse ne fynysshed leest way vtterest dethe yf haue concluded sothe vnselynesse shrewdnes sheweth plainly thilke wretchednes wythouten ende whych certayn perdurable boece certes thys conclusyon harde wonderfull graute knowe well accordeth moche thynges haue graunted beforne philo thou haste ryght estymacyon thys euer wene harde thynge accorde hym conclusyon ryght shewe somme yt premiss ben false el mote shewe collacyon proposycyons ny spedeful
