necessarye conclusyon yf ne yt premysses ben ygraunted ny shulde blame argument thys thynge shall tell nowe ne shall seme lasse wonderfull thynges ben taken also necessarye saythe foloweth purposed beforne boe phi certes yt wycked shrewes blysfull el lasse wretch abyen ye tourmentes haue deserued yf payne iustyce ne chastysed hem ne thys ne saye nowe might thynke maners shrewes ben coryged chastysed vengeaunce brought ryght waye drede tourment ne yeuen folkes ensample styen fro vyces vnderstande yet another maner shrewes ben vnsely whan ne punyshed ne reason law correction ne none ensample lokynge boece maner shall ben hathe tolde beforne phi haue graunted good folke ben blysfull shrewes ben wretch boece yes philo yf anye good added wretchednesse wyght ny weleful ne hathe medlyng good hys solitarye wretchednes boece semyth philo sayest thou thylke wretche lacketh al goodes good ny medled wretchednesse yet ouer hys wyckednesse whyche wretche yet another yuell anexed knyt hym shall men demen hym vnsely thylke wretche whyche vnselynesse releued participacyon good boece sholde phi certes han shrewes whan ben punysshed somwhat good anexed hyr shrewdnesse sayne payne suffre good yt reason iustice wha thilke shrewes escapen without tourmet tha haue somwhat yuel yet ouer wyckednesse han done sayn defaute paynes whiche defaute payne thou haste graunted yuell deserte felonye boece ne maye denye phi moche ben shrewes vnselye whan ben wrongfully delyuered fro payne wha ben punished rightfull vengeaunce thys open thynge clere ryght shrewes ben punyshed wyckednesse wronge escapen vnpunyshed boece might denye philo may anye man denye ryght ne good also contrarye wronge wycked boece certes thynges ben clere ynough haue concluded lytell beforne pray thou tel yf thou accordest letten tourment soules body ended deth sayn vnderstandest thou aught soules haue anye tourment dethe bodye phi certes yea ryght great whyche soules trowe ben tourmented asprenesse payne soules trowe ben exercysed pourgynge mekenesse counsayle ny nat determyne thys paynes haue trauayled tolde yet hyderto thou shuldest knowe mowynge shrewes whyche mowynge semeth vnworthy ny mowynge eke shrewes whyche thou playnedest ne nat punyshed thou woldest se ne neuer mo withouten tourmentes wyckednesse lycence mowynge done yuell thou praydest myght sone ended thou woldest fayne lernen ne shulde nat longe endure shrewes ben vnsely yf lenger durynge moost vnsely yf perdurable thys haue shewed vnsely ben shrewes whan escapen without ryghtfull payne whan bene punyshed ryghtfull vengeaunce thys sentence foloweth ben shrewes constrayned laste moost greuous tourment wha men wene ne nat punyshed boece whan consyder thy reason ne trowe nat men sayn thynge verely yf tourne ayen studyes men shulde seme ne shulde nat leuen thynges eke gladly herken hem philo certes men maye nat haue theyr eyen wont derknesse erthly thynges ne maye nat lyfte hem vp lyght clere sothfastnesse lyke byrdes whych night lyghtneth lokynges day blyndeth hem wha men loken nat ordre thynges lustes talentes wene eyther leue mowynge done wyckednesse el scapynge wythout payne weleful consyder iugemet perdurable lawe yf thou conferme thy courage best thynges thou ne hast nede iuge yeuen pryce mede thou hast ioyned thy selfe moost excellent thynges yf thou haue enclined thy study wycked thynges ne seke foreyne wrekery thy selfe thou thy selfe hast thrist thy selfe wycked thynges ryght thou mightest loke diuers tymes foule erth heuen thynges stynten fro without thou neyther ne se nothynge sholde semen reason lokyng thou nowe sterres nowe erth people loketh nat thynges shall aproche v hem haue shewed ben lyke beestes woldest thou sayn thys yf man al forlorne hys sight foryeten euer sawe wened thing fayled perfection mankynde nowe mighte sene thynges wold nat sayne blynde ne also ne accordeth nat people shal sayn thing susteyned strounge foundementes reason sayn vnsely ben wro ge folke wronge suffren boe wolde heren thilke reason philo denyest thou shrewes ne ben worthy haue tourment nay philo certayne many reason shrewes ben vnsely boece accordeth quod phil ne doutest thou thylke folke ben worthy tourment ne wretch boece accordeth well quod philoso thou tha sette iuge knower thynges whether trowest thou men shulde tourmenten hem hathe done wronge el hem suffred wronge boece doute nolde suffycient satisfaction hem haue suffred wronge sorowe hem hath doone wronge philo semeth doer wronge wretche suffred wronge boece foloweth well philo cause cause ben enforced rote fylth synne propre nature maketh men wretch sheweth wel wronges men ny nat wretchednesse hym receyueth wronge wretchednesse hym dothe wrong certes oratours aduocates done contrary enforcen hem commone iuges e pyte hem done greuaunces wronges shrewes couenable thynge accusours aduocates nat wroth pyteous debonayre ledden tho shrewes haue done wronge iugement ryght men leden syke folke leche shulden sekyn maladyes synne tourment thys couenant eyther entente aduocates shulde cessen el yf offyce aduocates wolde better profyten men shuld tourned habyte accusacyo sayn shulden accuse shrewes nat excusen hem eke shrewes hem selfe yf lefull hem sene clyfte vertue haue forletten sawen shuld put ten adowne fylthes vyces tourmentes paynes ne oughten nat ryght ye recompensacyon gete hem bounte prowesse whiche haue loste demen holde ylke paynes tourmentes hem eke wolden refuse attendaunce aduocates taken hem selfe iuges accusours ye betydeth wyse folkes ny place yletten hate yt sayne hate ne hath place amonge wyse men wight nyl haten good men yf ouer moche foole haten shrewes ny reason ryght languysshynge maladye body ryght ben vyces synne maladye courage ne deme nat whych ben syke body ben worthy ben hated rather worthy pyte wel worthy nat ben hated ben pyte ben thoughtes ben constrayned felonous wyckednesse cruell languysshynge body quid tatos iuuat excitare motus et propria fatum sollicitate manu si mortem petitis propinquat ipsa sponte sua volucres nec remoratur equos c delyteth excyten great mouynge hatredes haste busyen fatal disposycyon deth propre handes sayn batayls conteke yf ye axen dethe hasteth hym hys owne wyll ne dethe ne taryeth nat hys swyfte horse men serpentes lyon tygre beere bore seken sleen wyth theyr tethe yet thylke men seken sleen eueryche hem wyth swerde lo maners ben dyuers discordaunt mouen vnryghtful hostes cruel batayles wylnen perysshe entrechaungynge dartes reason cruelte ny nat ynough rightful wylte thou tha yelden couenable guerdon desertes men loue rightfully good folkes haue pyte shrewes hinc ego video quam que sit vel felicitas vel miseria ipsis proborum que improborum meritis constituta sed hac ipsa fortuna populari c thys se well eyther blisfulnesse el vnselynesse establysshed desertes good men shrewes thys ylke fortune people se somwhat good somwhat yuell wyse man leuer exiled poore nedye namelesse dwellen hys cyte stouren rychesse redoutable honour stronge power thys wyse clerelye wytnesfullye offyce wyse men treated blysfulnesse power gouernours shadde amoges people neyghbours subiectes sythe namely pryson lawe tourmentes laufull paynes rather owed felonous cytezyns whyche felonous cytezyns paynes establyshed tha good people boe meruayle greatly thynges mysse entrechaunged tourmentes felonyes pressen confounden good people shrewes rauyshen medes vertue ben honour great estate desyre eke weten semeth reason thys wrongfull conclusyon wolde wonder well lasse yf trowed thynges medled wyth fortunous hap nowe crepeth encreaseth myn astonyenges god gouernour thynges god yeueth oftymes good men goodes myrthes shrewes yuels aspre thynges yeueth ayen good folke hardenesse shrewes grauteth hem wyll desyren dyfference maye bytwene god dothe happe fortune yf men knowe cause philo ne meruayle though men wenen somwhat folysshe confuse whan reason ordre vnknowen although thou ne knowe cause great dysposycion nathelesse moche god good gouernour attempreth gouerneth world ne doute thynges ben aryght si quis areturisidera nescit mergat que seras equore flammas propin quasummo cardine labi cum nimis seleris explicet ortus cur legat tardus plaus ra bootes c knowe sterres arcture turned ye souerayn centre poynte sayne tourned nyghe souerayne pole fyrmament wote sterre bootes passeth gathereth hys wayne dreucheth hys late be ye see bootes ste e vnfoldeth hys ouerswyfte arysynges shall wondre lawe hygh eke yf ne know horne full moone waren pale infecte boundes derke nyght howe moone derke confuse discourreth sterres couered clere vysage comune erroure moueth folkes maketh wery basyns brasse thylke stroke saye maner people hyght coribantes wenen wha moone eclypse enchaunted therfore srue moone beaten bee ba n wyth thylke stroke ne man ne wondreth wh blastes wynde chorus beten strondes see quakyng flodes ne man ne wondreth whan weyght snowe harded colde resolued brennynge heate phebus sonne sene men redily cause cause yhydde sayne heuen brestes men mouable people astonyed thynges comen selde sodaynly oure age troubly erroure oure ignoraunce departeth fro v yf wysten cause suche thynges betyden ceetes shulde cease se wonder ita est quam sed cum tui muneris sit latentium rerum causa euoluere velatas que caligine explicare rationes queso vti hinc decernas c thus thou haste yeuen beheyght vnwrap hydde cause thynges discouer ye reason couered wt derknesse praye thou deuyse iuge thys mater thou vnderstande myracle wondre troubleth right greatly tha lytell smylynge sayde thou cleapest tell greatest thynges mowen ben asked questio vnneth aught ynough lauen saith vnneth thyng answere perfetely thy questyon mater whan doute determyned cutte awaye waxen doutes wythout nombre ryght eedes idre serpent waxen serpent hercules slough ne ne ere ne none ende yf wight costrayned doutes ryght lyuely quycke fyre thought sayne vygoure strength wytte mater men wonte maken questyos symplicite purueyaunce god ordre destyne sodeyne hap knowenge predestynacyon diuyne liberte frewyll whiche thynges thou self apperceyuedest wel weight ben moch knowinges thynges maner porcyon yt haue lytel tyme doone yet neuerthelesse wolde enforcen shewe somwhat al though norysshynges dyte musyke delyteth thou muste suffren forbearen lytell thylke delyte whyle wene resons knytte ordre boe lyketh philo tho spake ryght another begynnyng sayd right thus engendryng thynges progressyons mouable nature moueth maner taketh cause hys ordre hys fourmes stablenesse diuyne thought thylke diuyne thought set put toure sayne heyght symplicyte god stablysheth manye maner gi thynges ben done whyche maner whan men loken pure clennesse dyuyne intellygence cleaped pur yaunce whan thylke maner referred men thynges moueth disponeth olde men cleaped destenye whyche thynges yf anye might loketh wel hys thouyt strength one shall lyghtly mowe sene two thynges ben diuers pourueyaunce thylke dyuyne reason establyshed souerayne prynce thynges whych pourueyaunce dysponeth thynges certes destynye disposycyon ordynaunce cleuynge mouable thynges whyche disposycyon pourueyaunce knytteth thynges ordre pourueyaunce enbraseth thynges heape though dyuers though infynite destenye certayne departeth ordayneth thinges syngulerly deuydeth mouyng place formes tymes thus let vnfoldynge temporall dynaunce assembled oned lokynge diuyne thought cleaped purueyauce thylke assemblynge onynge deuyded vnfolden lette called destenye al thynges ben diuers yet neuerthelesse hanged one ordre destynable procedeth symplycyte pourueyaunce ryght werkeman perceyueth hys thought forme thynge woll make moueth effecte werke leadeth loked beforne thought symply presently corporal dynaunce certes ryght god purueyaunce dysponeth syngulerlye stably thynges done admynistreth maners dyuers tymes destenye thylke thynges hath disponed whether destenye exercised eyther diuyne spirytes seruauntes dyuyne pourueyaunce el soule el nature seruyng god el celestyall mouynges sterres el vertue aungels el dyuers subtyltie dyuels el hem el hem destynable ordynaunce wouen accomplyshed certes open thyng pourueyaunce vnmonable symple fourme thynges doone mouable bonde temporall ordynaunce thynges whych diuyne symplicite pourueyaunce hath ordayned done destenye whiche thynges ben put vnder destenye ben certes subiectes vnto pourueyaunce whiche pourueyaunce destenye selfe subiecte vnder thinges ben put vnder purueyauce surmounten ordynaunce desteny tho ben thylke stablye ben fyxed nyghe fyrst godheed surmounten ordre destinable mouablyte ryght cercles turnen aboute centre aboute poynte thylke cercle innerest moste within ioyneth ye symplesse ye myddle centre poynte cercles tourne thilke vtterest compassed larger enuyronnynge vnfolde larger space somoche fertherest fro myddelest symplycite poynte yf thing knytteth feloushippeth selfe thylke myddle poynte constrayned symplycite saye vnmouablite ceaseth ben shadde flytte dyuersly right semblable reason thylke thynge departeth furtherest fro fyrste thought god vnfolden also submytted greater bondes destyne moche thynge free loce fro dignyte asketh holdeth nerre thylke centre thynges sayne god yf thyng cleaueth stedfastnesse thought god wythout mouynge certes surmounteth necessyte destenye suche comparyson skyllynge vnderstandynge thynge engendred thyng tyme eternyte cercle ce tre ryght ordre mouable destyne stable symplycite pourueyaunce thylke ordynaunce moueth heuen sterres attempreth elementes togyder amonge hem selfe transformeth hem entrechaungeable mutacyon thylke ordre neweth ayen thynges growyng fallyng adowne semblable progressyons sedes sexus sayne male female thys ylke ordre constrayneth fortune dedes men bonde cause able vnbounden whiche destinable cause whan passen fro begynnynges vnmouable purueyaunce mote nedes ne mutable thus thynges wel gouerned yf ye symplicite dwelling diuyne thought sheweth forth ordre cause vnable bowed ordre constrayneth propre stabylite mouable thynges el shulden flete folily whiche thynges semen confuse troublye v men ne mowen consyder thylke ordynaunce neuertheles propre maner euery thing dressyng good disponeth hem ny nothyng done yuell thylke thyng done wycked folke ny yuel shrewes haue shewed ful plenteously seke good wycked errour misturneth hem ne ordre comyng fro poynte souerayne good ne enclynteh fro hys begynnynge thou mayste saye vnrest may ben worse confusyon tha good men haue somtyme aduersyte somtyme prosperyte shrewes haue also thynges desyren nowe thynges haten whether men ly e nowe suche holynesse thought sayth men nowe wyse suche folke demen good folke shrewes mote nedes folke suche wenen maner dome discorden thilke men folke demen worthy mede folke deme hem worthy tourment let v graunt suppose man may well deme knowe good people badde maye th n knowe se thylke innerest attemperaunce corage hath wonte sayde bodyes saythe may man speken complexion attempraunce body ne ne sayth lyke meruayle myracle hem ne knowen swete thynges couenable bodyes ben hole people bytter thynges couenable also people ben holpen wt light medicynes people ben holpen bytter medicine nathelesse tho knowen maner attempraunce heale maladie ne meruayleth nothyng thing semeth helth corages b e thyng semeth maladi corage vice el keper good driuer way yuel god gouernour leder thoughtes whiche god whan hath beholden hygh toure purueyaunce knoweth couenable wight leaneth hem wote wel couenable lo herof cometh herof doone myracle ordre destynable whan god knoweth doth thyng whych thyng vnknowynge folke ben asto nyed constrayne sayeth comprehende tel fewe thynges dyuine depenesse whych mannes reason maye vnderstande thylke man thou wenest bene ryght iuste ryght kepyng equite contrary semeth dyuine purueyaunce wote lucan familyer telleth victorious cause lyked god cause ouercome lyketh caton thanne euer thou maist sene done worlde vnhoped el vnknowen certes right ordre thinges thy wicked opinion confusion suppose ye man wel thewed dyuine iugement iugemet mankynde accorden hem togyther vnstedfast corage aduersite come wol forleten peraueture contynue innocencie whyche ne may withholden fortune wyse dispensacion god spareth hym man aduersite myghte enpayren ye god wyl hym trauayle yt trauayle couenable man perfyte al vertues holy man nygh god purueyaunce god wold deme felony touched anye aduersytees woll suche man wyth bodyly malady moued sayd philosophie yt excellent said great vertues haue edifyed body holyman ofte tyme betydeth ye sume thynges bene done taken gouerne good folke yt malice habou daunt shrewes shulde bene abated god yeueth departeth folke prosperitees aduersitees medled heape qualyte corages remordethe folke aduersitees ne shulde waxen proude longe welefulnes folke suffreth trauayled wyth harde thinges shulde con ermen vertues corage exer tacio vsage pacience folke dreden oughten whyche myghten wel bearen dispyse mowe beare thylke folke god leadeth experience hem selfe aspre soroufull thynges manye folke haue bought honourable renome worlde price gloriouse deth men ne mowe bene ouercomen tourment haue yeuen ensample folke vertue maye bene ouercomen aduersitees thynges ny dout ne ben done rightfully ordaynly parfite good hem sene thynges betyde certes aduersities cometh tyme shrewes somtyme desyren cometh forsayd cause sorouful thinges betiden shrewes certes ne wondreth men wene haue deserued bene wicked merite shrewes turmente agasteth somtyme done felonyes somtyme amendethe hem suffreth tourmentes prosperyte yeueto shrewes sheweth great argumente good peple thynge shulde demen thylke welfulnesse whyche prosperite sene ofte serue shrewes whyche thinge trow god dispenseth parauenture nature ouerthrowyng yuell vncouenable ye nedy pouerte hys housholde myght rather agreue hym done felonyes maladye hym god putteth remedy yeuen hym richesse man beholdeth hys coscience defouled wyth synnes maketh coparyson thys fortune hym selfe dredethe parauenture blysfulnesse whyche vsage ioyfull hym lesynge thylke blysfulnesse ne sorowfull hym therfore wolde chaunge hys maners dredeth lese hys fortune forletethe hys wyckednesse folkes welfulnesse yeuen vnworthylye whyche ouerthroweth hem destructio han deserued folke yeue power punishe shal cause contynuacyon exercysynge good folkes cause turmet shrewes ny none aliaunce bitwene good folkes shrewes ne shrewes ne mowen accorden amonge hem selfe yt shrewes discorden hem selfe vice vice al renden cosciences done oft tyme thinges thynges whan haue doone hem deme tho thynges ne shuld haue page duplicate page duplicate done whyche thynge souerayne purueyaunce hath maked ofte tyme myracle shrewes haue maked shrewes bene good men wha shrewes sene suffre wrogfully felonyes shrewes waxen eschaufed hate hem annoyed hem retourne fruite vertue studyen vnlike hem haue hated certes onely thys dyuyne myght whyche myght yuels bene good whan vseth yuels couenably draweth effecte good sayeth yuell good onely myghte god might god ordeyneth thylke yuel good one ordre enbraceth thynges wyghte departeth reason hylke ordre assygned hym algates yet slydeth another ordre nothyng lefull foly realme dyuyne purueyaunce sayeth nothyng wythout ordynaunce realme dyuyne pourueaunce syth ryght strog god gouerneth thynges thys worlde leful men comprehende wyt ne vnfolden worde subtyl ordynaunce dysposycyon diuine entent ought suffyse haue loked god hym selfe maker al nature ordayneth thynges good whyle hasteth wythholde thinges hath maked semblaunce say wythholden ye thinges good selfe good chaseth al yuels fro bounde hys comynaltyes ye ordre necessyte destynable foloweth yt yf thou loke purueyaunce ordeynynge thinges men wenen outragyous aboundaunt erthes thou shalte sene place nothynge yuell se nowe thou art charged wyth weyght questyon wery length reason thou abydeste swetenes song take tha drauyt whan thou art wel refreshed refect thou shalt stedfast stye high er questyons thynges si vi celsi inra tonantis plura solers cernere mete aspice summi culmina celi thou wyse wolte demen thy pure thought ye rightes lawes hye thonder sayne god loke thou beholde heyghtes souerayne heuen kepen sterres rightful alyauce thinges olde peace sune ymoued roody fyre ne dystourbeth colde circle mone ne sterre ycleped beer enclyneth rauyshing course abouten souerayne heyght thys worlde ne sterre vrsa ny neuer mo wasshen depe westren see ne coueiteth dyen flambes see occian although se sterres yplouged see hesperus sterre boodeth telleth alway late nightes lucifer sterrre bryngeth agayne clere daye thus maketh loue enterchaugeable ye perdurable course thus discordable batayle yput coutrey sterres accordaunce atempreth euynlike maners elementes moyst thynges sleyuyng wyth drye thinges yeuen place stoundes colde thinges ioynen hem fayth hote thynges lyght fyre aryseth heyghte heuy erthes aualen weyghtes cause flourye yere yeldeth swete smelles fyrste somer season warming hote somer dryeth cornes autumpne cometh ayen heuye apple fletyng rayne bedeweth wynter attemperaunce nourisheth bringeth forth al thynges bereth lyfe thys worlde thylke attemperaunce rauyshyng hydeth benymeth drencheth vnder laste deathe thynges yborne amonges thynges sytteth hyghe maker king lorde wele begynnyng law wyse iuge done equyte gouerneth enclyneth brydles thinges tho thinges stereth gone mouynge wythdraweth aresteth affermeth mouable wandrynge thynges yf ne called ayen ryght goynge thinges ne costreyned hem nat eftsones roundness enclyned thynges yt bene nowe cotynued stable ordynaunce shulde departen fro wele sayne begynnynge fallen sayne tournen naught comune loue al thynges thynges asken bene holden fyne good el ne myghten lasten yf ne come eftesones ayen loue retourned cause hath yeue hem beyng sayne god iane igitur vides quid hec omnia q diximus cosequantur quid nam inquit omnem inquit c seest thou thing foloweth al thinges haue sayd boece thynge quod p certes quod vtterly fortune good boe howe maye nowe vnderstande al fortune wheder ioyful fortune aspre fortune yeue eyther bycause guerdonyng el exercisyng good folkes el bycause punyshen el chastisen shrewes fortune good whyche fortune certayn eyther ryghtful el profytable boe forsoth ful reason yf consyder pourueyaunce destyne thou taughteste alytle beforne thys sentence sustayned stedfaste reason yf lyke vnto let v nombren hem among thylke thynges thou saydest litle beforne ne able bene wened people p b co mune worde men misuseth maner speach fortune sayne ofte tymes fortune wyght wicked philoso wylte thou quod approche lytle wordes people seme hem ouer much departed fro vsage makinde boece thou wolte quod philo wenest thou quod thynge profiteth good boece yes quod phi certes thynge exerceth corrigeth profyteth boece confesse wel quod philoso good quod boece quod philoso thys fortune quod hem eyther put vertue bataylen ayenst aspre thynges el hem enclynen declinen fro vyces taken waye vertue boece thys ne may denye quod philo sayest thou merye fortune yeuen good people guerdon demeth ought people wycked b naye forsoth quod demen sothe ryght good philo sayest thou fortune thoughe aspre restrayneth shrewes ryghtfull tourment weneth aught people good boe nay people demeth mooste wretched thynges yt maye thought philoso ware loke wel quod leste folowyng opinion people haue confessed cocluded thing vnable bene wened people boece quod philoso certes quod foloweth cometh thinges bene grauted al fortune euer hem bene eyther possession vertue encrease vertue elles purchasynge vertue ylke fortune good fortune right wicked hem dwellen shrewednesse sayeth thus weneth people boece sothe albe man dare confesse ne knowe philoso quod ryght stronge man ne semeth bashen disdayne oftime heareth noyse baytayle ne also semeth wyse man bearen greuouslye oft ledde stryfe fortune bothe one man eke thylke dyffyculte matter one manne encrease gloryouse renome man conserue hys sapyence saye asprenesse hys estate therfore called vertue sustayneth enforceth hys strengthes ny ouercomen aduersyties ne certes thou art put encrease heyghte vertue ne haste comen fleten wyth delyces walken bodyly luste thou sowest plantest full eygre batayle thy corage ayenst euerye fortune soroufull fortune cofound ne mery fortune ne corrupe occupye meane stedfast stregthes euer vnder meane al ouerpasseth meane dyspyceth welefulnesse sayeth vicious ne hath mede hys trauayle set hande sayth lyeth power fortune leuest saye good yuel al fortune semeth sharpe aspre ne exercise ye good folke ne chastyse wycked folke punysheth bella bi binis operatus annis vltor atrides phrigierumis c werker atrides sayne agamemnon ye wroyt contynued batayle ten yeare recouerd purged wrekynge distruction troye lost chabres maryage hys brother saye agamemnon wan ayen heleyne menelaus wyfe hys brother meane whyle thilke agamemnon desired yeuen sayles grekes nauy broughte ayen wyndes bloude vnclothed hym pyte father sorye preest yeueth sacrifyeng wretched cuttynge throte doughter say agamenon let cutte throte hys doughter preest maken aliaunce wyth goddes haue wynd wyth whiche myght wenden troye itacus saye vlixes bewepte hys felowes ylorne felowes feirs poliphemus lyggynge hys greate caue fretten dreynt empty wombe nathlesse poliphemus woode hys blynde vysage yelde vlixes ioye hys sorouful teeres saye vlixes smote eye poilphemus stode forheed whyche vlixes ioye whan sawe poliphemus wepynge blynde hercules celebrable hys harde traueyle daunted proude ceutaurus halfe horse halfe man berafte dyspoylyng fro cruel lyon yt say slough ye lyon berafte hym hys skynne smote byrdes yt hgiht arpyes certaine arowes rauyshed apple fro wakyng dragon hande heauy golden metal drough cerberus hounde hell triple chaynes ouercomer said hath put vnmeke lorde fodder cruel horse say hercules slough dyomedes made hys horse freten hercules slough dra serpente brente venym achileus floud defouled forheed dreynt shamfast vysage strondes say achileus coulde transfigure hym selfe dyuers lykenesse faught hercules last turned bull hercules brake one horne shame hyd riuer ouer hercules cast adowne antheus gyaunte strondes lybi cacus appeysed wrathes euander say hercules slought monstre cacus appeysed death wrath euander bristled bore marked vomes shulders hercules sholders hye cercle heue shulde thrist ye last labour yt susteyned heauen vpon necke vnbowed deserued eftsones heue last ende trauayle goth nowe ye stronge men great ensample edeth nyce make ye backes saith ye slowe delicate se ye aduersities ne fyght ayenst hem vertue wynne ye mede heue mede ouercome yeueth ye sterres yt sayne whan erthly lust ouercomen man maked worthye heuen phere endeth fourth boke boece foloweth fyfth pdixierat orationis que cursum ad alia quedam tractanda que expedien da vertebat b tum ego rectum quidem quam c sayd turned course reason thinges treated sped b tha sayd certes rightfull thine amonesting ful digne auctorite thou saidest whylo question diuyne purueyauce enlaced wyth manye question vnderstande well proue thyng aske yf thou wenest hap thynge anye wayes yf thou wenest hap thyng p haste yelden assoylen det behest shewe open way way thou mayst come ayen thy countrey al yt thinges whych thou askest bene ryght profytable knowe yet bene dyuers somwhat fro path purpose dout thou ne maked werye mysse wayes thou ne mayste suffyse measure ryght way b ne dout ther nothyng quod knowen thylke thynges togyther whiche thynges delyte greatly yt shall bene stede rest syth ny douten thynges folowynge whan euerye thynge thy desputacyon shall haue bene stedfaste vndoutous fayth phi sayde maner wol done began speaken ryght thus certes yf anye wyght definyshe hap thys maner sayn hap betiding ybrought forth folysh mouynge knyttyng cause conferme hap ny ryght naught wyse deme vtterly hap ny ne dwelleth voyce sayeth ydell worde wythout signification thynge comytted voyce place myght bene lefte dwellyng folye disordinaunce syth god leadeth constrayneth al thynges ordre sentence soth nothynge hath beyng naught sentence none olde folke ne wythsayde neuer al ne vnderstande god prince begynner workynge casten maner foundemente subiecte material sayne nature reason yf thynge waxen come cause tha shal seme yt thylke thing comen woxen naught yf thys ne maye done nat possible hap thing haue definyshed lytle beforne boece shal ny thyng ryght may bene cleped eyther hap el aduenture fortune ought albeit hyd fro people thinge wordes bene couenable phi myne aristotle boke hys phisyke definysheth thys thynge short reason nigh soth b maner p ofte men done thynge grace thynge another thynge thylke thyng men entenden done betideth cause ycleped hap right man dalfe erth bycause tyllynge felde founde gobet golde bedoluen wene folke befal fortunous betydyng forsoth ny nought hath propre cause whych cause ye course vnforeseen vnware semeth haue maken hap tyller felde ne dolue erth yf hyder golde ne hyd golde place golde ne bene founde bene cause abredgynge fortuit hap whiche abredgyng fortuit hap cometh cause encountrynge flowyng togyther hem selfe entencion doer neyther hyder golde ne deluer felde ne vnderstoden golde shulde haue bene founde sayd betyde rane togyther dalfe yt hydde gold nowe may thus definish hap hap vnware betydynge cause assembled thynges ben done thing thilke order procedinge vneschuable betiding togider ye descendeth fro wel purueyaunce yt ordeyneth al thinges place tymes maketh cause rennen assemblen togither rupis achemence scopulis vbi versa sequentum pectoribus fugit spiculum c tigris eufrates resolue springe well ye cragges roch coutrey achemenee fleynge batayls fixen dartes returning ye brestes hem yt folowe sone ryuers tigris eufrates vnioyne departen water yf comen togyther ben assembled cleped togyther course tha mote thilk thinges fleten togyther ye water entrechaungyng flood bryngeth shippes stockes araced floud mote asseblen water ymedled wrappethe implyeth manye fortunell happes maners whyche wandrynge happes nathelesse thylke declinynge lownesse earth flowynge ordre slydyng water gouerneth ryght fortune semeth fleteth wyth slaked vngouerned brydels suffreth brydles yt sayne bene gouerned passeth thylke law sayne dyuine ordinaunce animaduerto iu quam id que vti tu dicis ita esse consencio sed hac hereutium c thys vnderstade wel quod accorde ryghte yu sayst aske yf ther lyberte fre wyl thys ordre cause cleuen thus togyther hem selfe el wolde wyten yf destinal cheyne costrayneth mouynge courage men philo yes lyberte frewyll ne neuer nature reason ne lyberte frewyll euery thinge may naturally vse reason hath dome decerneth demeth euery thyng knoweth selfe thinges ben flyen thynges bene desiren thilke thynge wyght demeth bene desyred askethe desyreth flyeth ylke thynge troweth flyen wherfore thynges reason hym also lyberte wyllynge nylling ne ordeyne nat sayeth ne graunt nat liberte euen lyke al thynges soueraynes deuynes substaunces sayne spirites iugement clere wyll corrumpe myghtye redye speden thynges bene desyred soules men moten nedes ben fre whan loken hem speculacyon lokynge dyuyne thought lasse fre whan slyden bodyes yet lasse fre whan bene gathered togyther coprehended erthly membres laste seruage whan bene yeuen vice haue yfal possession proper reason haue cast awaye eyen fro lyghte souerayne sothfastnesse lowe thinges darke anone darken cloude ignoraunce troubled felonous talentes talentes whan approchen assenten heapen encreasen seruage whyche haue ioyned hem selfe maner ben caytiues fro proper lyberte whych thyng nathlesse lokyng diuyne pourueyauce seeth al thynges beholdeth seeth fro eterne ordeyneth hem euerych merytes ben predestinate sayd greke al thinges seeth al thynges heareth puro clarum lumine phebum melli ui canit oris homerus c homer wyth honye mouthe yt sayn homer swete dities syngeth sunne clere pure lyght natheles yet ne maye ye infirme lyght hys beames breken percen inward entrayles earth el see ne seeth god maker great worlde loketh al thynges high ne vnderstandeth nothinges heuynesse erth ne ye nyght ne withstandeth nat blacke cloudes thylke god seeth stroke thought thynges bene shul come thylke god loketh seeth al thinges alone thou mayst sunne tum ego en quam difficiliore rursus ambiguitate confundor c sayde thus nowe cofounded harde doute philoso doute quod certes coniecte suche thinges thou art troubled b semeth quod repugnen contrarye greatlye god knoweth beforne thynges fredom lyberte yf god loketh al thynges beforne ne god ne may bene deceyued maner tha mote nedes yt thynges purueyaunce god hath sene beforne come whych god knoweth toforne onely yt werkes men also counsayles wylles ne shall ther libertie arbytre ne certes ne maye none dede ne wyll thylke whiche diuyne purueyaunce ne may disceyued hath sealed beforne yf myghten wrythen away maner tha ben purueyed ne shoulde stedfaste prescience thynge comen rather vncertaine opinion thyng trowen god deme felonye vnlefull ne ne proue nat thylke reason sayeth ne alowe ne prayse thylke reason whiche yt men wenen mowe assoylen vnknytten knotte questyon certes seyn thyng ni comen purueyauce god hath seen beforne comen rather ye contrary thynges comen therfore ne maye ben hyd purueyaunce god maner necessitie slideth aye contrarye partye ne ne behoueth nedes thinges betyden bene ypurueyed behoueth nedes thynges bene comen ben ypurueyed ytrauayled sayth ye thilk answer procedeth ryght though men trauayleden busye enquyren thyng cause thinges whether prescience cause necessitie thynges comen el ye necessitie thynges comen cause purueyaunce ne enforce shewen yt betyding thinges ywist beforne necessary maner ordre cause hath selfe although ne seme presciece bryng necessitie betydynge thynges comen certes yf wyght sytteth behoueth necessitie opinio soth coniecteth sytteth ayen warde also cotrary yf opynyo soth wyght sytteth behoueth necessiitie syt necessitie one one necessitie syttynge certes necessitye soth therfore ne sytteth wyght opynyon syttynge soth opynion rather sothe wyght sytteth beforne thus although cause sothe cometh syde sayeth although cause soth commeth syttynge true opynion algates yet commune necessitie one thus seweth may make se blable skylles purueyaunce god thynges comen although thynges bene comen therfore bene purueyed certes bene purueyed therfore ne betyde nathelesse behoueth necessitie eyther thynges comen bene ypurueyed god el thynges bene purueyed god betyden thynges onely suffyseth ynough destroien fredome arbytre saye fre wyll certes nowe sheweth well howe ferre fro soth vp sodowne thing sene betydyng temporal thynges cause eterne prescience wenen god purueyeth thynges comen thynge wene thylke thynges betyde whylom ben cause thylke souerain purueyaunce yt god hereto adde yet thynges ryght whan yt wote thyng behoueth necessitie thylke selfe thyng eke whan haue knowen thyng shal betyde behoueth necessitie thylke thynges betyde foloweth betydyng thynges wyst beforne ne may eschued last wyght wene thyng ben otherwyse ny vnscience disceyuable opynyon full dyuers farre fro soth science wherfore yf thing comen betydyng ne certayne ne necessarye may weten beforne thylke thynge comen ryght science ne may medled falsenesse fayeth yf wote thyng ne may false ne wote ryght thylke thynge conceyued scyence ne maye none otherwyse conceyued cause science wanteth lesynge sayth wetyng ne receyueth lesynge wote behoueth necessitie euery thyng ryght science comprehendeth shall sayne whiche maner knoweth god beforne al ye thynges come yf ne certayne yf yt deame ben comen vneschuably maye possyble yt ne shullen comen god disceyued trowen yt god disceyued speake mouth felonous synne god wot ryght thynges ben comen shulle come wot egally sayth indifferently thi ge maye done el ydone thylke prescience ne comprehendeth certayne thyng ne stable el dyfference betwene presciece thylk iape worthy deuyning tiresie deuynour sayd saye quod eyther shalbe el ne shall elles howe moche worthe deuyne presciene opynion mankynde yf demeth thynges vncertayne men done dome men betyding ni certayne yf non vncertayne thynges ne may ben ryght certayne well thynges betydyng certayne thylke thynges hath wyst forne fyrmely comen whiche foloweth fredome counsayles werkes mankynde ny none syth thouyt god seeth althinges without errour falsenesse byndeth constrayneth hem betydyng necessitie yf thig one ygraunted receyued sayne yt ny fre wyl sheweth well great destructio great domages folowen thynges mankynde ydle ben purposed behyght meedes good folke paynes bad folke syth mouyng free corage voluntarye ne hath deserued hem sayne neither mede ne payne shulde seme thylke thynge alderworst whiche demed aldermoost iust rightful sayn shrewes ben punyshed el good folke yguerdoned folkes sene propre wyl ne sent hem one ne sayne neyther good ne harme costreyneth hem certayne necessitie thynges comen tha ne shullen neuer bene ne neuer vyce ne vertue shullen rather confusyon desertes medled without discretion yet foloweth inconuenience whyche ne maye thought nomore felonous ne wycked thus ordre thinges ydle cometh ye purueyaunce god ne nothyng ny lefull counsayles mankynde sayth haue power nothyng ne wyll nothynge foloweth vyces ben referred maker good sayth foloweth god ought haue blame vyces syth costrayneth v necessitie done vyces tha ny ther reason hopen god ne prayen god shulde wight hopen god shuld praye god sith ordynaunce desteny ye ne maye ben enclyned knytteth streyneth thynges men may desyren tha shulde done away thylke onelye alyaunce bytwene god man sayne hopen prayen pryce ryghtousnesse mekenesse deseruen guerdon diuyne grace whiche yt inestimable say gret ne may ben ful praysed maner saye hope prayer semeth woll speke god reason supplication conioyned thylke clerenesse ny approchen rather men seke impetren yf men ne wene ye hope ne prayer ne haue strengthes necessitie thynges comen receyued thing mowen conioyned cleauen thylke souerayne prince thynges behoueth necessitie lignage mankynde thou songe litle beforne departed vnioyned hys well faylen begynnynge sayne god que nam discors fe dera rerum causa resoluit quis tanta deus dyscordable cause hathe rent vnioyned byndyng alyaunce thinges sayne coniunctions god man god hath establyshed great batayl betwene two sothfast thinges sayne betwene purueyaunce god free wyl ben syngular deuyded ne ne wollen ben medled ne coupled togyther ny discorde thynges cleuen away certayn hem self ye thouyt man confounded ouerthrowe darke membres body ne maye fyre darked lokynge sayne vigour insyght whyle ye soule bodye knowen thyn subtel knyttynges thinges wherfore eschaufeth great loue fynden thylke note soth ycouered sayne wherfore eschaufeth thought man greate desyre knowe thylke notification ben yhid vnder couertures soth wote ought thylke thynhes anguyshous desyreth knowe sath naye noman ne trauayleth weten thynges wot therfore ye text sayth thus trauayleth weten thynges yknowe yf ne knoweth hem seketh thylke blynde thought desyreth thynges whyche wot ryght nought sayeth desyrech thinges nedes somwhat knoweth el ne coude desyren maye folowe thynges yt ne bene ywyste though yt seke thynges shal fynde hem wyght vnconnyng ignoraunt may know forme yfounde whan soule beholdeth seeth hye thought yt sayn god tha knoweth togyther sum singuralities sayne principle euerych hem selfe soule hid cloude darkenesse bres bodye ne hath foryeten selfe wtholdeth sum thynges leseth singularity ye seketh sothenesse ny neyther nother habyte wote ne ne hath nat foryeten yet hym remembreth ye sum thinges withholdeth asketh counsayle retreateth deplyche thynges ysene beforne sayne greate summe mynde mowe adoe partes hathe foryeten thylke partyes hath withholden tum illa vetus inquit hec est de prouidetia qrela marco que tullio c sayd olde question purueyauce god marcus tullius whan deuyded deuynacyons sayne hys bokes wrote deuynacions moued greatly questyon thou thy self hast ysought moche vtterly loge yet ne hath bene determyned ne espyed fermely diligently cause darkenesse thys difficultie mouyng reason mankynde ne may mouen sayne applien ioynen simplicitie deuyne prescience simplicitie deuyne prescience yf mighten thynke maner sayn yf men myghten thynke comprehe den thynges yt god seeth hym selfe dwelled vtterly dout reson cause difficulty shal assay last shewe speden whan haue fyrst yspenden answered thy reason whiche thou art moued aske thou wenest thylk reason hem assoylen question ne nat spedefull ynough ne sufficiet solucyo reaso yt demeth prescience necessitie thynges come sayth way tha thus thylke thynges prescience wot beforne ne maye vnbetyden sayne moten betyde yf prescience ne putteth necessitie thi ge comen thou thy selfe haste confessed knowe lytle beforn cause sayth ther may cause endes voluntary thynges myghten constrayned certayne betydyng grace position thou may better vnderstade foloweth suppose ne prescience aske moche apperteyneth shulden thynges comen free wyll constrayned betyding necessitie boece nay phi ayenwarde suppose yt prescience ne putteth necessitie thinges trow thilk fredome wyll shall dwellen hole absolute vnbounde thou wilt sayne al prescience ni cause necessitie betyding thinges comen algates yet signe thynges bene betyden necessitie maner althoughe prescience neuer yet algates lest way certayne thyng endes betydynges thynges comen shulden necessarye euery thynge sheweth signifyeth onely thinge ne maketh thyng signifyeth behoueth fyrste shewe nothynge ne betydeth ne betydeth necessitie maye appere prescience sygne necessitie el yf nere necessitye certes thylke prescyence ne myght signe thynge ny certes certayne proue ysusteyned stedfast reason ne shall bene lad ne proued sygnes ne argumentes taken fro without cause couenable necessarye thou mayst sayne maye thynges ne betyden bene purueyed comen certes ryght trowe thynges purueyaunce wot beforne come ne betyden ne shulde demen rather although shal betyden yet ne haue necessitye kynde betiden mayst thou lightly apperceiuen shal sayn sene manye thynges whan ben beforne eyen ryght men sene carter workynge tournyng attempryng adressing carte chariot maner sayeth mayest thou vnderstande al workemen tha necessitie sayth lokynge constrayneth compelleth thylke thynges done boece nay quod ydle vayne effect crafte yf al thynges moued constraynynge eyen syght philosoph thynges quod whan men done hem ne haue necessitie men done hem eke tho thynges fyrst done ben comen withoute necessitye thynges betyden endes betydinges hem ben absolute quyte necessitie certes ne trowe anye man wolde sayne thynges men done nowe ne betyden fyrste yer doone thylke thynges although men hadden wyst hem beforne yet haue free betydynges ryght science thinges present ne bryngeth necessitie thynges men done ryght prescience thynges commen ne bryngeth necessitie thynges betiden thou mayest sayne thylke douted whether thylke thinges ne haue non issue betydinges necessaryes therof may ben pres te certes semen discorden thou wenest yf thynges bene sene necessitie foloweth hem yf necessitie fayleth hem ne myght wyst nothyng maye comprehended science certayne yf tho thynges ne haue certayne betydynges purueyed certayne shoulde darkenesse opynyon sothfastnesse scyence thou wenest dyuers holenesse science manne shulde deme thynge otherwyse selfe cause erroure thynges euerye wyghte hath knowe wene tho thynges knowe onylye strength nature thynges ben wyst knowe contrarye euer knowe rather coprehended knowe strengthe nature facultye sayne power nature hem knowen thyng shulde nowe shewe short ensample roundnesse body otherwyse syght eye knoweth otherwyse touchynge lokynge castynge beames wayreth seeth ferre al bodye togyther withoute mouynge selfe touchynge cleueth rounde bodye moueth aboute enuyronnynge comprehendeth partyes roundenesse man selfe otherwyse beholdeth hym otherwayes ymagynacyon otherwyse reason otherwise inteligece wyt comprehendeth withoutforthe fygure body man vnstablyshed matter subiect ymaginacion comprehendeth onely figure wt mater reason surmounteth ymaginacion comprehendeth vniuersal lokyng comune speche eye intelligence hygher surmounteth enuyronyng vniuersite loketh ouer pure subtiltie thought thylke symple fourme man perdurable diuine thought whiche thys ought greatly considred hyest strength comprehenden thynges embraceth contayneth lower strength ye lower stregth ne aryseth maner hyer strength wyt ne may co prehende nothyng mater ne imaginacyon ne loketh vniuersal speces ne reason ne taketh symple fourme intelligence taketh intelligence loketh abouen whan hath comprehended fourme knoweth demeth thynges ben vnder fourme knoweth hem thylke maner comprehendeth thylk simple forme yt ne may neuer ben knowe none yt say non thre forsayd strengthes soule knoweth vniuersitie reason fygure ymaginacion sensyble material co ceyued wyt ne vseth ne reason ne ymaginacion ne wyt withoutforth beholdeth al thynges shal say stroke thought fermely without discours collacion certes reason whan loketh thyng vniuersall ne vseth ymaginacyon ne wyt algates yet co prehendeth thynges ymaginable se syble reason diffinyssheth vniuersall conceyte ryght thus man reasonable two foted beest knowing vniuersal yet ni ther wyght ne wot well man thynge ymaginable sensyble thys consydreth well reason ny ymaginacion wytte loketh reasonable conception also ymaginacyon taketh wytte begynnyng sene fourmen fygures algates although wyt ne present yet enuyroneth comprehe deth thynges sensyble reason sensyble demyng reason ymaginatife seest thou al thynges knowyng vsen facultie power done facultie power thynges ben knowen ne wronge euery iudgement dede hym demeth behoueth euerye wyght perfourme hys werke hys intention forayne power propre power quondam porticus tulit obscuros minium sene c porche saye gate towne athnes philosopher hadden congregacion dispute thilk porche brought somtyme olde men full darke sentence say philosopher hyghten stoiciens ye wende ymages sensibylities say sensyble ymaginacions el ymagynacyons sensible thynges wer emprinted soules fro bodyes withoutforth sayth thylke stoiciens wenden soule naked hym selfe myrrour clene perchemyne al fygures musten fyrst comen fro thynges fro wt soules ben emprinted soules ryght ben wonte sometyme swyft poyntell fyxen letter emprinted smothnesse playnesse table waxe parchemyne hath fygure ne note glose nowe argueth boece agaynst opynion sayth thus yf thryuynge soule ne implyteth nothyng sayne ne doth thyng propre mouynge suffreth lyeth subiecte fygures note bodyes withoutforth yeldeth ymages ydel euyl vayne maner myrrour whence thryueth whence commeth thilke knowynge soule ye discerneth beholdeth thynges whece thilke stregth beholdeth synguler thinges el whece strength dyuydeth thynges yknowe thylke strength gathered togyther thynges deuyded stregth choseth entrechaunged waye somtyme heaueth heed say heaueth vp ententio ryght hyghe thynges somtyme descendeth ryght lowe thynges whan returneth hym selfe reproueth destroyeth false thynges true thynges certes strength cause effycient moche myghty sene knowen thynges thylke cause suffreth receyueth note fygures impressed maner mater algates passyon saye suffraunce wyt quycke body goth exciting monyng strengthes thought ryghte whan clearenesse smyteth eyen moueth hem sene ryghte voyce sowne hourleth eares comoueth hem hearken strength thought moued excyted cleapeth forthe semblable mouynges speces halte within selfe addeth speces note thynges withoutforth meddleth ymages thynges withoutforth thinges hyd hym selfe quod si corporibus senciedis qua ni efficiant instrumenta sensuum c bvt bodyes seled say takyng knowing bodyly thynges yt quality bodyes obiect fro withoutforth mouen entalenten instrumentes wyttes passyon body sayne wyt suffraunce goeth beforne strength worchynge corage passyon suffrauce clepeth forth dede thought selfe moueth excyteth meane whyle fourmes resten withinforth insensyble bodyes haue sayde corages ni taught emprynted passyon knowe thynges demeth knoweth owne stregth passion suffraunce subiect body moche tha tho thynges ben absolute quyte fro talentes affection bodyes god aungels ne folowen decernynge thynges obiect fro wtoutforth acco plysshe speden dedes thought reason comen many maner knowynges dyuers differrynge substaunces wyt body wyt naked dispoyled knowynge thylke wyt cometh beestes whiche ne mowen mouen hem selfe oyster muskels suche shelfysh see cleue ben norysshed rockes ye ymaginacion cometh remuable beestes semen haue talent flyen desire thing reason alonelye lynage mankynde ryght intelligence alonly diuine nature foloweth thilk knowynge worthe eyther syns knoweth propre nature onelye subiecte sayth ne kneweth alonely appertayneth properly knowyng knoweth subiectes al knowynges shal yf wyt ymaginacion stryuen ayen reasonynge sayne thylke vniuersall thynge reason weneth sene yt ni ryght nought wyt ymaginacion sayne sensyble ymagynable ne maye ben vniuersall either iugement reason sothe ne ny thynge sensyble el reason wote well many thynges subiecte wyt ymaginacyon conceptio reason vaine false loketh comprehendeth sensyble synguler vniuersall yf reason wolde answer ayenst two saye wyt ymaginacion saye sothly selfe sayne reason loketh comprehendeth reason vniuersalitie sensible ymaginable thylke two yt sayne wyt ymaginacion ne mowen stretchen hem selfe knowing vniuersalitie knowynge hem ne maye exceaden ne surmounten bodyly fygures certes knowyng thynges men oughten rather yeuen credence stedfast ye perfyte iudgement maner stryuyng haue stregth reasoning ymagynacion wytte say reason ymaginacion wolde rather prayse cause reason sayth cause wytte ymagynacion semblable thyng reson kynde ne weneth diuyne intellygece beholdeth knoweth thynges come right reason makynde knoweth hem thou arguyst thus yf ne seme men thynges haue certayne betydinges ne maye wyste certaynly betyden prescience thylke thynges yf trow prescience thynges nothing betydeth necessyte yf myght haue iugement diuyne thought ben parteners reson right haue demed behoueth ymagynacion wytte beneth reason ryght wolde demen rightfull thing man reason ought submyt selfe beneth diuyne thought whyche yf may sayth yf may counsayle enhaunce v heyght thylke souerayne intellygence shal reason wel sene ne may behold selfe certes thus maner prescience god seeth al thynges diffynysheth though haue certayne betydynges ne none opynyon rather symplicite souerayne science shette wythin maner boundes quam variis terras animalia per meant iguris nam que alia extento sunt corpore c beestes passen ye erthes ful diuers figure haue bodyes strauyt crepen duste drawen hem trace forough contynued saye nedders snayles beestes wandrynge lyghtnesse wynges beaten wyndes ouer swymmen space longe ayre flyeng beestes gladen hem selfe dyggen trace steppe crthe wyth goynge wyth fete gone eyther grene feldes el walken vnder woodes thou seest discorden dyuers fourmes algates face enclyned heauyeth dull wyttes onely lynage man heaueth highest hys hye heed standeth lyght wyth hys vpryght bodye beholdeth erthes vnder hym yf thou erthly man waxest yuell thy wytte thys fygure amonesteth askest heuen thy right vysage hast areysed thy forheed bearen vp hygh thy corage thy thouyt ne heuyed ne put lowe vnder fote syth thy body hygh areysed quoniam igitur vti paulo ante monstratum est omne quod scitur c therfore haue shewed lytell beforn yt thing yt wyst ny knowen thys nature propre ye nature yt coprehenden let v loken nowe moch lefull v saith let v loken nowe may estate diuyne substaunce may well knowe eke science commune iugement creature reasonables god eterne let v consydre eternyte certes shall shewen v togyder diuyne nature diuyne science eternyte perfyte possessyon togyder lyfe intermynable sheweth clerely coparyson collacyon temporall thynges thyng lyueth tyme present procedeth fro preterytees future sayne tyme passed tyme comynge ne ny nothynge establysshed tyme maye enbracen togyther space thys lyfe certes yet ne hathe taken tyme morowe hath lost yesterday certes lyfe thys daye ye ne lyue nomore ryght thys mouable transytorye moment thylke thynge suffreth temporall condycion al though neuer began ne though neuer cease arystoteles demed worlde although life stretched wyth infynite tyme yet algates ny suche thynge men might trowen right eterne thought comprehende enbrace space lyfe infynite yet algates ne embraseth ye space lyfe togyther ne hath future yet ne ne hathe lenger preteritees passed thylke thyng hath comprehendeth togyder al plentie lyfe intermynable whome ne fayleth naught future ny naught preterite escaped passed thylke ywitnessed proued right ben etern behoueth necessyte thylke thynge alway present selfe co petent saythe alway present hym selfe mighty ryght hys pleasaunce haue present infynyte ye mouable tyme wherfore men trowen wrongfully whan heren semed plato thys worlde neuer begynnynge tyme neuer shall haue faylyng wene thylke maner worlde maked eterne wyth hys maker saith wene worlde god maked togyther eterne wrongfull wenynge thyng ladde lyfe interminable plato graunted worlde thyng embrace togyther al ye presence lyfe intermynable thynge clere manyfest diuyne thought ne ne shulde seme v god elder thynges ben maked quantyte tyme rather ye prosperyte hys symple nature thys ylke infynyte mouynges temporall thynges foloweth presentary estate life immouable ne may countrefayten ne fayne ne euenlyke ye immobilyte say eternyte god fayleth falleth mouyng fro symplicite presence god disencreaseth ye infynite quantyte future preterite maye haue togyther al plentie lyfe algates yet moch ceaseth neuer ben maner yet semeth somdele v foloweth resembleth thylke thing ne may attayne ne fulfyllen byndeth selfe maner presence lytel moment presence lytel swift moment beareth maner ymage lykenesse aye dwellyng god graunteth maner thynges betydeth semeth hem thinges haue ben ben presence lytell moment ne may dwell therfore rauyshed toke thinfynite way tyme say successyon maner done shulde cotinue lyfe goyng yt lyfe ne myght enbrace plentye dwellyng thy wollen put worthy name thynges folowen plato let v saye sothlye god eterne worlde perpetuell syth euery iugemet knoweth comprehendeth hys nature thynges ben subiect vnto hym god alwayes eterne presentarye estate scyence hym ouerpasseth temporall moment dwelleth symplycite hys presence enbraseth consydereth infynyte space tymes preterytes tymes future loketh hys symple knowyng thynges preterite right ydon presentlye ryght nowe thou wylte thynken aduyse prescyence knoweth thynges thou ne shalt demen prescience thynges comen thou shalt demen ryghtfully scyence presence instaunce neuer ne fayleth whyche ny ycleped preuidence shulde rather ben cleaped purneyaunce whyche establyshed ful ferre fro ryght lowe thynges beholdeth frome ferre thynges right fro hye heyght thynges askest thou dysputest thou tha thylke thynges ben done necessyte whyche ben ysene yknowen deuyne syght sythe forsoth men ne maken nat thylke thynges necessarye whyche sene ben ydone syght addeth thy beholdynge necessyte thylke thynges thou beholdest present boe naye philo certes yf men myghten maken anye digne coparyson collacyon presence dyuyne presence mankynde right ye sene thynges temporall presence ryght seeth god thynge eterne presence wherfore diuyne prescience ne chaungeth nature propertie thinges beholdeth thinges present ward shulden betyden warde tyme comen ne ne confoundeth iugementes thynges one syght hys thought knoweth thynges comen well necessary necessary right whan ye sene togyther man walke erth ye sunne arysen heuen ye sene togyther one yet neuerthelesse ye demen discernen one voltuary necessary ryght diuyne lokyng beholding al thinges vnder hym ne troubleth nat qualyte thynges ben certaynly present warde condycyon tyme forsoth ben future whiche foloweth ny none opinyon rather sted fast knowynge ystrengthed sothnesse whan god knoweth thynge ne vnwote nat thilke thyng wanteth necessyte thys sayne whan god knoweth thynge betyde wote well yt ne hathe necessyte betyde yf thou seyst thylke thynge god eth betyde ne maye vnbetyde sayth mote betyde thilke thynge ne may nat vnbetyde mote betyden necessyte thou streyn name necessyte certes wyll well confessen knowen thyng full sad trouth vnneth shall wyght mowe sene come therto yf beholder deuyne thought wyll answere thus thylke thyng future whe referred deuyne knowyng necessary certes whan vnderstande hys kynde men sene vtterly fre absolute fro al necessyte certes ben two maners necessytees one necessyte symple thus behoueth necessyte men ben mortall deedly another necessyte condicyonel thus thou wost man walketh behoueth necessyte walke thylke thyng wight hath yknowe ne maye nat none otherwyse knoweth condicion ne draweth nat thilk necessyte simple certes necessite condicionall ye propre nature ne maketh nat adiection condycyon maketh necessyte ne constrayneth gone goth propre wyll al whan goth necessary gothe right maner yf purueyaunce god seeth thyng present tha mote thylke thynge ben necessyte although ne haue necessyte owne nature certes future betyden fredom arbytrie god seeth hem al togyder present thynges tha ben referred deuyne syght ben maked necessary condicyon deuyne knowyng certes yf thylke thynges ben consydered hem selfe ben absolute necessyte ne forleten ne cessen nat lyberte nature tha certes wythout doute thynges shullen ben whyche god woot beforne ben comen betyden free arbytrie frewyll al betyden yet algates ne lese propre nature beynge whyche fyrst done hadden power haue betyde boe thys sayne thynges ne necessarye propre nature comen maners lykenesse necessyte condicyo diuyne science philo difference tho thynges whyche purposed lytell beforne sayn sonne arysyng man walkyng therwhyles thylke thynges ben done ne myght ben vndone nathelesse one hem done behoueth necessyte doone ryght thynges whych god hath present withouten doute shullen ben hem dyscendeth nature thynges ye sunne arysynge discendeth power doer man walkynge boece sayde wrong yf thynges referred diuyne knowyng ben necessarye yf ben consydred hem selfe ben absolute fro bonde necessyte ryght thynges apereth sheweth wyttes yf thou referre hem reason vnyuersal yf thou loke refer selfe synguler nowe yf thou sayest thus yf power chaungen purpose shall voyden pourueyaunce god whan perauenture shall haue chaunged thynges whyche knoweth beforne phi shall answeren thus certes thou mayst wel chauge thy purpose moche present sothnesse diuyne purueyaunce beholdeth thou mayste chaunge thy purpose whether thou chaunge derwarde thou tourne thou ne mayste eschue diuyne prescience right thou ne mayste flye syght present eye though thou tourne thy selfe thy fre wyll dyuers actios thou mayst sayne ayen thys thus howe shall shall diuyne science ben chaunged dysposycion whan wyll one thyng nowe nowe another thyng thylke prescience ne semeth entrechaunge stoundes knowing saith ne shall semen v dyuyne prescience entrechaungeth hys dyuers stou de knowynge knowe somtyme one thynge somtyme knoweth contrarye thynge philo forsothe diuyne syght renneth beforne seeth al future clepeth hem ayen retourneth hem propre prescience hys propre knowynge ne entrechaungeth thou wenest stoundes hys foreknowynge nowe nowe dwellyng aye cometh beforne enbraseth stroke mutacions prescience compreheden sene thynges god ne hath take betydinges thynges comen hys propre symplicite hereby assoyled thylke thynges thou puttest lytell beforne sayn vnworthy thyng sayne yt future yeuen cause presciece god certes strength diuyne science whyche enbraseth thynges presentarie knowynge establyssheth maner thynges ne oweth latter thynges sythe yt thynges ben thus sayne necessyte thynges diuyne prescience fredom arbytrie dwelleth hole vnwemmed mortal ne lawes ne purposen wycked medes paynes wyllynges men ben vnbounde quyte necessyte god beholder foreweter al thinges dwelleth aboue presente eternyte syght renneth alwaye wyth dyuers qualyte dedes dispensynge ordeynyng medes good men tourmentes wycked ne ydell ne vayne ne ben put god hope prayer ne mowen ben vnspedefull ne wythout effecte whan ben ryghtfull withstande eschew thou vice worshyppe loue thou vertues areyse thy corage rightful hope yelde thou humble prayer hyghe great necessyte prowesse vertue encharged commauded yf ye nyll dissimulen syth ye worchen doone sayne dedes werkes beforn eyen iuge seeth also demeth al thynges deo gracias pthus endeth boke boecius consolacion philosophie herafter foloweth dreame chaucer dreame chaucer haue gret woder thys lyght howe lyue daye ne nyght maye slepe welnye nought haue many ydle thought purely defaute slepe trouthe take kepe nothyng howe cometh gothe ne ny nothyng lefe lothe ilyche good ioye sorowe haue felyng thyng mased thyng al day poynte fall adoun sorowfull ymagynacyoun alway holy mynde well ye wote agaynst kynde lyuen thys wyse nature wolde suffyse none erthly creature longe tyme endure without slepe sorowe ne maye ne nyght ne morowe slepe melancolye drede haue dye defaute slepe heuynesse hath slayne spyrite quicknesse haue loste lustyheed suche fantasyes ben myne heed beste men myght aske may slepe nathelesse aske thys leseth hys askyng trewly seluen tell sothe trewly gesse holde sycknesse haue suffred thys eyght yere yet boote neuer nere phisycien one may heale done passe ouer vntyll efte wyll mote nede lefte fyrst mater good kepe whan sawe myght slepe tyll nowe late thys nyght vpon bedde sate vpryght bade one reche booke romaunce toke rede dryue nyght away thought better play play eyther chesse table thys boke written fable clerkes olde tyme poetes put ryme rede mynde whyle men loued lawe kynde thys boke ne spake suche thynges quenes lyues kynges many thynges smale amonge thys fonde tale thought awonder thyng tale kyng hyght seys wyfe beste myght beare lyfe thys quene hyght alcyone befyll therafter sone thys kyng woll wenden ouer see tellen shortly whan see thus thys wyse suche tempest gan ryse brake maste made fall clefte shyp dreynt hem neuer founde telles borde ne man ne nothyng elles right thus thys kyng seys loste hys lyfe nowe speke alcyone hys wyfe lady lefte home hath wonder kyng ne come home longe terme anon herte began yerne thought euer mo wele thought longed kyng certes pytous thyng tell hertely soroufull lyfe thys noble wyfe hym ala loued alderbest anone sent bothe eest west seke hym founde nought ala wrought wher lorde loue deed certes nyll neuer eate breed make vowe god mowe lorde suche sorowe thys lady toke trewly made thys boke suche pyte suche routhe rede sorowe trouthe farde worse morowe thynken sorowe whan thys lady coude worde man myght fynde lorde full ofte swowned sayd ala sorowe full nyghe woode ne coude rede one downe knee sate anone wepte pyte mercy swete lady dere iuno goddesse helpe thys distresse yeue grace lorde se soone wete howe fareth whyse shall make sacrifyse holy become shall wyth good wyll body herte thou wolte lady swete sende grace slepe mete slepe certayne sweuen may knowe euen whether lorde quicke deed word hynge heed fell swoune colde stone woman caught vp anone brought bed naked forweped forwaked wery thus deed slepe fell toke kepe iuno herde boone made slepe soone prayde ryght done dede iuno ryght anone called thus messangere erande come nere whan come bad hym thus gobet iuno morpheus thou knowest hym well god slepe nowe vnderstande well take kepe saye thus halfe go fast great see byd hym thynge take vp seys body kynge lyeth full pale nothynge rody byd hym crepe body gone alcyone quene lyeth alone shewe shortly nay howe dreynt thys day body speke ryght right wonned whyles alyue go nowe fast hye blyue messanger toke leue wente vpon hys way neuer stente tyll came darke valey stante bytwene rockes twey neuer yet grewe corne ne gras ne tree ne naught ought beest ne man ne nought elles saue fewe welles came rennynge fro clyffes adowne made deedly slepynge sowne rennen downe ryght caue vnder rocke ygraue amyd valey wonder depe goddes lay aslepe morpheus eclympasteyre god slepes heyre slepte dyd none werke thys caue also derke hell pytte ouer aboute good leyser route vye might slepe best hynge chynne vpon brest slepte vpryght heed yhed lay naked bed slepte whyles theyr dayes last thys messangere come rennyng fast cryed ho ho awake anone nought herde hym none awake lyeth blewe hys horne ryght eere cryed awaketh wonder hye thys god slepe wyth hys one eye cast vp asked clepeth thys messangere iuno bade thou shuldest gone tolde hym shulde done haue tolde nede reherse wente hys waye whan sayde anone thys god slepe abrayde hys slepe gan go dyd bydde hym toke vp dede body soone bare forthe alcione wyfe quene lay right euen quarter day stode ryght beddes fete called ryght hete name sayd swete wyfe awake let sorowfull lyfe sorowe lyeth rede certes swete loue dede ye shall neuer lyue yse good swete herte ye bury body suche tyde ye mowe fynde see besyde farewell swete worldes blysse praye god sorowe lysse lytell whyle blysse lasteth wyth eyen vp casteth sawe naught ala quod sorowe dyed wythin thyrde morowe sayd swowe maye tell nowe longe dwell fyrst matere wyll tell wherfore haue tolde thys thynge alcione seys kynge thus moche dare saye well doluen euerydel deed ryght defaute slepe yf ne red take kepe thys tale nexte wyll tell wherfore ne myght bote ne bale slepe redde thys tale thys dreynte seys kynge goddes slepynge red thys tale wele ouerloked euerydele thought wonder yf neuer herde speake tho goddes coude make men slepe ne wake ne knewe neuer god one game sayd anone yet lyst ryght euell pley rather shulde dey defaute slepynge thus wolde gyue thylke morpheus goddes dame iuno wyght el ne rought make slepe haue rest wyll gyue hym alther best yeft euer abode hys lyue onwarde ryght nowe blyue yf woll make slepe lyte downe pure downes whyte woll gyue hym fether bed rayed wyth golde ryght well cled fyne blacke sattyn doutremere many pylowe euery bere cloth raynes slepe softe hym thare nede tourne ofte woll yeue hym falles hys chambre hys halle woll paynte wyth pure golde tapyte hem full many folde one sute thys shall haue yf wyst hys caue yf make slepe sone dyd goddesse quene alcione thus thys ylke god morpheus maye wynne mo fee thus euer wanne iuno hys goddesse shall trowe shall holde payde vnneth worde ysayde ryght thus haue tolde sodeynly nyst howe suche lust anone toke slepe ryght vpon boke fell aslepe therwyth euen mette inly suche sweuen wonderfull neuer yet trowe man wyt coone well sweuen rede nought ioseph wythout drede egypte rad kynges metynge pharao coude lest v ne nat scarsly macrobeus wrote auysyon met kynge scipion noble man affrican suche meruayles fortuned trowe rede dremes euen lo thus thys sweuen thought thus maye dawnynge laye met thus bed naked loked forth waked wyth smale foules great hepe afrayed slepe noyse swetnesse songe met sate amonge vpon chambre rofe wythout vpon tyles ouer eueryche songe hys wyse moste solempne seruyse note euer man trowe herde hem songe lowe hygh one accorde tell shortly worde neuer herde swete steuen thynge heuen mery sowne swete entunes certes towne tewnes nolde herde hem synge chambre gan rynge syngynge ermony instrument melody herde yet halfe swete accorde halfe mete none hem fayned synge eche hem hym payned fynde many crafty note ne spared throtes soth sayne chambre full well depaynted wyth glas wyndowes well yglased full clere hole ycrased beholde great ioy holly storye troy glasynge ywrought thus hector kynge priamus achylles kynge laomedon eke medea iason parys heleyne lauyne walles wyth colour fyne paynte texte glose romaunce rose wyndowes shyt echone glasse sunne shone vpon bedde wyth bryght bemes wyth many glad gyldy stremes eke welkyn fayre blewe bryght clere ayre full atempre forsoth neyther colde ne hote na ne welkyn clowde lay thus wonder lowde thought herde hunte blowe tassay hys great horne knowe whether clere horse sowne herde goynge vp downe men horse houndes thynge men speake huntynge howe wolde slee herte stregth howe herte vpon length moche enbosed nowe anone ryght herde howe wolde huntynge gone ryght glad vp anone toke horse forth wente chambre neuer stente tyll come felde wythout ouer toke great route hunter eke forester many relayes lymers hyed hem forest fast wyth hem last asked one ladde lymere say felowe shall hunte quod answered ayen syr emperour octauien quod fast goddes halfe good tyme quod go fast gan ryde come forest syde euery man dyd ryght sone huntynge fell doue mayster hunte anone fote hote wyth horne blewe thre mote vncouplynge hys houndes wythin whyle herte founde ihalowed rechased fast longe tyme last thys herte roused stale awaye fro houndes preuy waye houndes ouershot hym vpon defaulte yfall therwyth hunte wonder faste blewe forloyne laste go walked fro tre wente came whelpe fawned stoode yfolowed coude good came crepte lowe ryght yknowe helde downe hys heede ioyned eeres layde smoth downe hys heeres wolde haue caught anone fledde fro gone hym folowed forth wente downe floury grene wente full thycke grasse full softe swete wyth floures fele fayre vnder fete lytell vsed semed thus flora zepherus two make floures growe made dwellynge trowe beholde though erthe enuye wolde gayer heuen haue mo floures suche seuen welken sterres forget pouerte wynter hys colde morowes made suffre hys sorowes foryeten sene woode woxen grene swetnesse dewe made waxe nede eke axe many grene greues thycke tree full leues euery tree stode hym selue fro well ten foote twelue great tree huge strength fourty fyfty fedome length cleane wythout bowe stycke wyth croppes brode eke thycke ynche sonder shadde ouer vnder many harte many hynde behynde fawnes sower buckes full wodde many roe many squyrels sete full hygh vpon tree ete maner made feestes shortly full beestes though argus noble countour sat reken hys countour reken wyth hys fygures ten tho fygures newe al ken yf crafty reken nombre tell euery thynge nombre yet shulde fayle reken euen wonder met sweuen forth romed ryght wonder faste donwe wodde laste ware man blacke sate yturned hys backe ooke huge tree lorde thought maye eyleth hym sytten anone ryght went nere founde sytte euen vpryght wonder welfarynge knyght maner thought good mokell ryght yonge therto age foure twenty yere vpon hys berde lytell heere clothed blacke stalked euen vnto hys backe stode styll ought sothe say sawe nought hynge heed adowne deedly sorouful sowne made ryme ten verse twelue complaynt selue moste pyte moste routhe euer herde trouthe great wonder nature myght suffre creature haue suche sorowe deed ful pytous pale nothyng reed sayd laye maner songe without note without songe ful wel reherse right thus began haue sorowe great wone ioye gette neuer none nowe se lady bright whiche haue loued withal myght fro deed agone thus sorowe lefte alone ala deth ayleth thou noldest haue taken thou toke lady swete goodnesse none mete fayre freshe fre good men maye well se made thus hys complaynte hys sorowfull herte gan fast faynte hys spirites wexen dede bloode fledde pure drede downe hys herte maken hym warme well feled herte harme wete eke adradde kynde make gladde membre principall body made hys hewe chaunge wexe grene pale bloode sene maner lymme hys anone therwyth sawe thys farde thus yuell sete wente stode ryght hys fete grette hym spake nought argued wyth hys owne thought hys wytte dysputed faste howe hys lyfe myght laste hym thought hys sorowes smerte lay colde vpon hys herte hys sorowe holy thought made hym herde nought welnye loste hys mynde though pan clepeth god kynde hys sorowes neuer wrothe last sayne ryght sothe ware howe stoode hym dyd hoode ygret hym best coude debonayrly nothynge loude sayd praye wrothe herde sayne sothe ne sawe syr truely ah good syr force quod ryght sory yf haue ought dystroubled thought foryeue yf haue mysse take yes thamendes lyght make quod lyeth none therto nothynge myssayde lo howe goodly spake thys knyght another wyght made neyther tough ne queynt sawe gan aqueynt wyth hym founde hym tretable ryght wonder skylfull resonable thought hys bale anone ryght gan fynde tale hym loke myght ought haue knowlegynge hys thought syr quod thys game done holde thys herte gone huntes hym se force therof quod thought theron neuer dele lorde quod trowe wele ryght thynketh chere syr thynge woll ye thynketh great sorowe se certes syr yf ye wolde ought dyscure wo wolde wyse god helpe amende yf may ye mowe proue assay trouth make hole woll power hole telleth sorowes smerte parauenter maye ease herte semeth full sycke vnder syde wyth loked syde sayeth nay wyll graunt mercy good frende quod thanke thou woldest maye neuer rather man may sorowe glade maketh hewe fall fade hath myne vnderstandynge lorne wo borne may nought make sorowes slyde remedyes ouide ne orpheus god melodye ne dedalus wyth hys playes slye ne heale may phisicien naught ipocras ne galien wo lyue houres twelue woll assaye hym selue whether hys herte haue pyte sorowe let hym se wretch death hath made naked blysse euer maked wroth werste wyghtes hate dayes nyghtes lyfe lustes lothe fare wrothe pure death full wolde dye wyll folowe wyll flye wolde haue hym nyl nat thys payne wythout reed alwaye dyenge deed tesyphus lyeth hell maye sorowe tell wyste trouthe sorowe routhe pyte sorowes smerte man hath fendly herte seeth fyrst morowe maye sayne hath mette wyth sorowe sorowe sorowe ala wyll tell sorowe turned playnynge laughter wepynge glad thoughtes heuynesse trauayle myne ydlenesse eke reste wele wo good harme euer wo wrath turned playnyng delyte sorowyng myne heale turned sicknesse drede al sykernesse derke turned al lyght witte foly day nyght loue hate slepe wakyng myrthe melis fastyng countenaunce nycete al abawed peace pleadynge werre ala howe myght fare werre boldnesse turned shame false fortune hath played game chesse wyth ala whyle trayteresse falfe full gyle behoteth nothynge halte goeth vpryght yet halte baggeth foule loketh fayre dyspytous debonayre scorneth many creature ydole false purtrayture woll sone wryen monstres heed ywryen fylthe ouer ystrowed wyth floures moste worshyp floures lyen nature wythout fayth lawe mesure false euer laughynge wyth one eye wepynge brought vp set downe lyken scorpiowne false flatterynge beest wyth hys heed maketh feest amyd hys flaterynge wyth hys tayle wyll stynge enuenym wyll enuyous charite aye false semeth wele turneth false whele aboute nothynge stable nowe fyre nowe table ful many one hath thus yblent playe enchauntement semeth one false thefe hath trowest thou lorde wyll say chesse wyth gan play wyth false draughtes full dyuers stale toke feers sawe feers away ala couth lenger play sayd farewell swete ywys farewell euer therwyth fortune sayd checke mate mydde poynt checkere wyth paune errant full craftyer playe athalus made game fyrst chesse hys name god wolde ons twyse iconde knowe ieoperdyse coude greke pithagores shulde haue playde bet ches kepte feers bet therby though wherto truely holde wyshe worth stre neuer bet fortune many wyle fewe begyle eke lasse blame selfe wolde haue god ben ought excused thys say yet therto god myght haue wyll feers caught wolde haue drawe draught also wyse god yeue rest dare well swere toke best draught haue lorne blysse ala borne euermore trowe truely wyll lust holy tourned ye done lorde dye sone nothynge leaue nought lyue dye ryght thys thought ny planet fyrmament ne ayre ne earth none element ne yeue yefte echone wepynge alone aduyse wele bethynke euery dele howe lyeth rekenynge sorowe nothynge howe lyueth gladnesse may glad dystresse howe haue lost suffysaunce therto haue pleasaunce maye saye haue ryght nought thys falleth thought ala ouercome done come haue sorowe tantale herde hym tell thys tale thus pytously tell vnneth myght lenger dwell dyd myne herte moche wo good syr quod say haue pyte nature formed creature remembreth socrates ne counteth thre strees nought fortune coude quod good syr yes perde quod ne saye truly though ye lost feerses twelue ye sorowe murdred selue ye shulde dampned thys ease good ryght medea slough chyldren iason phyllis also demophon hynge selfe welaway broke hys terme day come another rage dido quene eke cartage slough selfe eneas false whych foole ecquo dyed narcisus nolde loue ryght thus hath many another foly done dalida dyed sampson slough hym selfe wyth pylere man alyue wolde feers make thys wo quod thou wotest full lytell thou menest haue lost thou wenest howe maye quod good syr tell holy wyse howe wherfore ye haue thus blysse lore blythely quod come syt doun tell vpon condicioun thou shalt holly wyth thy wyt thyne entente herken yes syr swere thy trouth therto gladly holde shall ryght blythly god saue holly wyth wyt haue well goddes halfe quod began syr quod syth fyrst couthe haue maner wyt fro youth kyndely vnderstandynge comprehende thynge loue myne owne wyt dredelesse haue euer yet trybutary yeue rente loue holly wyth good entente pleasaunce become hys thrall wyth good wyll body herte thys put hys seruage lorde dyd homage full deuoutly prayde hym shulde beset myne herte pleasaunce hym worshyp lady dere thys longe many yere er myne herte set dyd thus nyste trowe came kyndely paraunter therto moste able whyte wall table redy ketche take men wyll therin make whether men woll portrey paynte werkes neuer quaynte thylke tyme fared ryght able haue lerned tho haue conde well better paraunter eyther arte letter loue came fyrst thought therfore forgate nought chees loue fyrst crafte therfore wyth lafte toke yonge age malyce corage tyme turned thynge mokell knowlegynge tyme youth maystresse gouerned ydelnesse fyrst youthe tho full lytell good couthe al werkes flyttyng tyme al though varyeng al ilyche goode knewe tho thus stode happed came day place sey trewly fayrest companye ladyes euer man eye sene togythers place shal clepe happe eyther grace brought fortune lyen ful comune false trayteresse peruerse god wolde coulde clepe werse nowe worcheth ful wo wol tel sone among ladyes thus echone soth sayne sawe one lyke none route dare swere without doute somers sunne bryght fayrer clerer hath lyght planet heuen moone sterres seuen worlde surmounted hem al beautie maner comlynesse stature wel set gladnesse goodlyhede wel besey shortly shal sey god halowes twelue swete ryght selue stedfast countenaunce noble porte mayntenaunce loue wel herde bone espyed thus sone full sone thought helpe god cought sodaynly ne toke maner counsayle loke myne herte eyen gladly trowe myne hert seyne purely tho myne owne thought sayd better serue nought wele soth euery dele wyll anon ryght tell sawe daunce comely caroll synge swetely laugh playe womanly loke debonayrly goodly speke frendly certes trowe neuermore na sene blysful tresore euery heer heed soth saye reed ne neyther yelowe ne browne na thought moost lyke golde eyen lady debonayre good glad sad symple good mokell wyde therto loke na nat asyde ne ouerthwart beset wele drewe toke vp euery dele gan beholde eyen semed anon wolde haue mercy folly wenden neuer rather na counterfeyted thynge owne pure lokyng goddesse dame nature made hem open measure close neuer glad lokyng folyche sprad ne wyldly though played euer thought eyen sayde god wrath foryeue therwith lyst wel lyue dulnesse adrad na sobre ne glad thynges measure neuer trowe creature many one loke hert sate full lytle herte knewe nothyng thought whether knewe knewe nought algate ne rought hym stre get loue nere na woned home inde formost alway behynde good folke ouer loued man may brother loue wondre large skylful place bere charge vysage therto ala hert wondre wo ne descryuen lacketh englysh wyt vndo full eke spyrites ben dull great thyng deuyse haue wyt suffyse comprehende beauti thus moche dare sayne whyte rodye fresh lyuely hewed euery daye beautie newed nygh face alderbest certes nature suche lest make fayre truly chefe patron beautie chefe ensample werke monstre neuer darke thynketh se euermo yet moreouer though al tho euer lyued alyue ne wolde haue founde discryue al face wicked signe sad symple benigne suche goodly swete speche swete lyues leche frendly well
