ygrounded vpon al reason well yfounded tretable good dare sweare well rood eloquence neuer founde swete sownyng facounde ne trewer tonged ne scorned lasse ne bet coulde heale masse durst sweare though pope songe neuer yet tog man ne woman greatly harmyd harme hyd ne lasse flattryng worde purely symple recorde founde true bonde trouth man honde ne chyde coulde neuer dele knoweth worlde ful wele suche fayrnesse necke swete bone brecke na ther none sene myssat whyte smothe streyght pure flat without hole canell bone semyng none throte haue memoire semed rounde tour yuoire good greatnesse grete fayre whyte hete ladyes name ryght therto fayre bryght name wronge ryght fayre shulders body longe armes euery lyth fattysh flesshy great ther ryght whyte handes nayles red rounde brestes good brede hyppes streyght flat backe knewe none lacke lymmes nere pure sewyng ferre knowyng therto coulde wel playe lyst dare saye lyke torche bryght euery man maye take lyght ynough hath neuer lesse maner comlynesse ryght farde lady dere euery wyght manere myght catche ynough yf wolde yf eyen beholde dare sweare wel yf amonge ten thousande wolde haue best chefe myrrour feest though stonde rowe men eyen coulde haue knowe men played waked thought felowshyp naked without sawe one crowne without stone truly myne eye soleyn fenix arabye lyueth neuer one ne suche ne knowe none speke goodnesse truly moche debonayrtie euer hester byble yf possyble soth sayne therwithall wyt generall hole enclyned good wyt set roode without malyce vpon gladnesse therto sawe neuer yet lesse harmfull say ne knowyng harme el coulde good thynketh truly speke trouth routh therof moche dele dare sayne swete wele trouth hym selfe ouer chose maner principall restyng place therto moost grace haue stedfast perseueraunce easye attempre gouernaunce euer knewe wyst yet pure suffraunt wyt reason gladly vnderstode folowed well coulde good vsed gladly wele maners euery dele therwith loued well ryght wronge wolde wyght wyght myght shame loued wel owne name lust holde wyght honde ne thou syker wolde fonde holde wyght balaunce halfe worde ne countenaunce yf men wolde vpon lye ne sende men walakye pruyse tartarie alisandrie ne turkye byd hym fast anon go hoodlesse drye see come home carrenare syr ryght ware may sayne worshyp ye come agayne ne vsed suche knackes smale therfore tell tale ryght haue sayde hooly loue layde certes swete wyfe suffysaunce lust lyfe myne hope myne heale blesse worldes welfare goodesse holy euerydale lorde trowe wele hardly loue wel beset ye myght haue bet bet ne well quod trowe syr quod parde nay leue wel syr leue well truly thought best beholde alderfayrest whoso loked eyen myne nay al seyen sayde swore though ne wolde tho haue loued best lady fre though beautie euer alcibyades strength hercules therto worthynesse alisaundre rychesse euer babiloyne cartage macedoyne rome niniue therto also hardy hector haue ioye achiles slough troye therfore slayne also temple two wer slayne antigelius sayth dare frigius loue polixena ben wyse mynerua wolde euer without drede haue loued must nede nede nay truly gabbe nowe nought nede woll tellen howe good wyll myne hert wolde eke loue holde fayrest best good haue rest euer penelope grece noble wyfe lucrece best telleth thus romayne titus lyuius good nothyng lyke though story autentyke algate true wherfore tell whan fyrst ladye seye ryght yonge soth say ful great nede lerne whan myne hert wolde yerne loue great emprise wyt wolde best suffyse yonge chyldly wyt without drede beset loue best wyse worshyp seruyse conde tho trouth without faynyng eyther slouth wonder fayne wolde se mokell amended whan sawe morowe waryshed al sorowe alday tyl eue thought nothyng myght greue sorowes neuer smerte yet syt myne herte trouth nolde nought al worlde thought leaue lady truly trouth syr quod thynketh ye haue suche chaunce shryft without repentaunce repentaunce nay fye quod shulde nowe repent loue nay certes well werse achitophel antenor haue ioye traytour betrayed troye false genellon purchased trayson roulande olyuere nay whyle alyue nyll foryet neuer mo good syr quod tho ye haue well tolde nede reherse ye sawe fyrst wolde ye tel manere fyrst speche therof wolde beseche howe knewe fyrst thought whether ye loued nought telleth eke ye haue lore herde tel ye sayd thou notest thou menest haue lost thou wenest losse quod tho nyl loue haue ye aught done amys hath lefte goddes loue tel al god quod shal say right haue sayde al loue layd yet nist neuer dele long tyme leue wele right syker durst nought al worlde tel thought ne wolde haue wrathed truly woste thou lady body herte whoso hath may asterte kepe fro ydlenesse truly dyd busynesse make songes best coude oft tyme songe hem loude made songes great deale although coude make wele songes ne knewe arte coude lamekes sonne tuball founde fyrst arte songe brother hamers ronge vpon anuelt vp downe therof toke fyrst sowne grekes sayne pithagoras fyrst fynder arte aurora telleth therof noforce hem two algates songes made felyng myne hert glade lo alther ferst werst lorde maketh myne hert lyght whan thynke swete wyght semely se wysh god myght wolde holde knyght lady fayre bryght haue tolde soth say fyrst songe vpon daye bethought wo sorowe suffred tho yet wyst nought ne tel durst thought ala thought rede tell deed yf tell say ryght soth adrad woll wroth ala shall debate wo thought myne hert brast arwayne last soth sayne bethought nature ne formed neuer creature moche beautie truly bountie without mercy hope tale tolde sorowe neuer sholde nedes maugre myne heed must haue tolde deed well began full euyll reherse eke helpe god withall trowe dismal ten woundes egypt many worde ouer skypt tale pure fere lest wordes mysse set sorowfull hert woundes deed softe quakyng pure drede shame styntyng tale ferde myne hewe pale full oft wext pale red bowyng hynge heed durst one loke wyt maner gone sayd mercy nomore na game sat sore last soth sayne whan myne hert come agayne tell shortly al speche hole hert gan beseche wolde lady swete swore hertely gan hete euer stedfast trewe loue alway freshly newe neuer lady haue worshyp saue best coude swere euer euermore myne herte swete neuer false mete nyll wyse god helpe whan tale ydo god wot accompted stre tale thought tell shortly ryght truly answer wel countrefete wordes grete answer sayd nay vtterly ala daye sorowe suffred wo truly cassandra bewayled destruction troye illion neuer suche sorwe tho durst nomore say thereto pure feare stale awaye thus lyued full many day truly nede bed heed neuer day seche sorowe founde redy euery morowe loued gere befell yere thought one wolde fonde knowe vnderstonde wo well vnderstoode ne wylled thynge good worshyp kepe name ouer al thynges drede shame busy serue pytie shulde sterue sith willed none harme iwys whan lady knewe lady yaue holy noble yeft mercy sauyng worshyp al wayes dredlesse mene non wayes therwith yaue rynge trowe fyrst thynge yf myne hert ywaxe glad nede axe helpe god blyue raysed fro deth lyue al happes alder best gladdest moost rest truly swete wyght whan wronge ryght wolde alway goodly foryeue debonayrly youth chaunce toke gouernaunce therwith alway trewe ioye euery lyche newe hertes euen payre neuer na one contrayre wo soth ilyche suffred tho blysse eke sorowe ilych glad wroth al v one without thus lyued ful many yere well tell howe sir quod nowe quod stynt anon therwith woxe deed stone sayde ala bore losse tolde lorne bethinke sayd beforne thou wost ful lytle thou menest haue lost thou wenest god wot ala ryght ala syr may deed nay yes trouth losse god routh pand worde ryght anon gan strake forth done tyme hart huntyng thought kynge gan homewarde ryde vnto place besyde v lyte longe castell walles whyte saynt iohn ryche hyll mette thus fyll ryght thus met tell castell bell smyt houres twelue therwith awoke selue founde lying bed boke red alcione seys kynge goddes slepyng founde myne honde full euen thought queynt sweuen wolde processe tyme fonde put sweuen ryme best anon sweuen done pexplicit mayster c whan chryst kynge asked trouth sothfastnesse worde answered askynge sayeth man true gesse therfore though hyght expresse sorowe wo maryage dare wryten wyckednesse lest selfe fall efte suche dotage woll say chayne sathanas whiche gnaweth euer dare sayne payne wyll wolde bounden neuer thylke doted foole eft hath leuer ychayned prison crepe god let hym neuer fro wo disceuer ne man hym bewayle though wepe yet lest thou worse take wyse bet wed bren worse wyse yu shalt haue sorow thy flesh thy lyfe thy wyues thral sayn wise holy wrytte may suffyse experience shall teache may happe take waye leuer take fryse efte fall weddyng trappe lytle wryt prouerbes fygures sende take kepe rede vnwyse wele endure yf thou syker put drede wyfe bathe praye yt ye rede mater haue honde god graunt lyfe frely lede fredome foule bonde pexplicit assemble foules lyfe shorte ye craft longe lerne thassaye harde sharpe coquering dredful ioy alway flyt yerne mene loue felynge astonyeth wondrefull werkynge sore iwys whan thynke nought wet wel whether flete sink al knowe loue dede ne wot quyteth folke hyre yet happeth full oft bokes rede myracles cruell yre rede well wol lorde syre dare sayne stroke sore god saue suche lorde nomore vsage lust lore bokes rede oft tolde wherfore speke nought yore agone happed beholde vpon boke ywrytten wt letter olde thervpon certayne thynge lerne longe day ful fast rad yerne olde feldes men sayth cometh al newe corne fro yere yere olde bokes good fayth cometh newe science men lere purpose matere rede forth gan delyte al day thought lyre boke make mencyon entytled ryght thus shall tell tullius dreame scipion chapiter seuen heauen hell erth soules therin dwel shortly treate sentence woll sayne great fyrst telleth whan scipion come affryke meteth massynysse hym ioye armes hath ynome telleth speche blysse betwixe hem tyll ye day gan mysse howe hys auncestre affrykan dere gan slepe nyght tyll apere telleth sterry place howe affrikan hath hym cartage shewed warned beforne al hys grace sayd man lered eyther leude loueth comune profyte wel ytheude shulde blysfull place wende ioye wythouten ende asked yf folke bene dede haue lyfe dwellyng another place affrikan sayd yee without drede howe present lyues space ment maner deth way trace rightful folke shul gone dye heauen shewed hym galaxie shewed lytle erth ye regarde heuens quantyte shewed nyne speris melodye herde cometh thylke speres thrise thre welles musyke bene melodye thys worlde cause armonye sayd sen erth lyte ful turment harde grace ne shulde worlde delyte tolde hym certayne yeres space euery sterre shuld come place ther first al shuld minde thys worlde done al makinde prayed hym scipion tel hym al waye come heuen blysse sayd fyrst know thy selfe immortal loke aye besely thou werch wisse comune profite thou shalt misse come swyftly vnto place dere full blysse soules clere brekers lawe sothe sayne lykerous folke ben dede shul whirle ye world alway paine tyl many worlde passed drede foryeuen al wycked dede shullen come blysful place whych comen god sende grace day gan faylen derke nyght reueth beestes besynesse berafte boke lacke lyght bedde gan dresse fulfylled thought besy heuynesse thing nolde eke ne thyng wolde fynally spyrite laste wery labour al daye toke reste made slepe faste slepe mette laye howe affrikan ryght selfe araye scipion hym sawe tyde come stode ryght beddes syde wery hunter slepyng hys bedde wodde ayen hys mynde goth anone iuge dremeth hys plees spedde carter dremeth howe carte gone rych golde ye knight fyght wt fone sycke mette drynketh tonne louer met hath hys lady wonne sayne yf cause radde affrikan beforne made mete stode thus sayd thou hast wel borne lokynge myne olde boke al torne whych macrobie rought lyte somdele thy labour wolde quyte citherea thou blysful lady swete wt thy fyre brode dauntest wha ye lest madest thys sweuen mete thou helpe thou maist best wysely seygh north north west whan began sweuen write yeue myght ryme endyte foresayde affrikan hente anone forth gate brought ryght parke walled wyth grene stone ouer ye gate letter large ywroyt verse ywritten thought eyther halfe full great difference shal say playne sentence men gone ye blysful place hertes heale deedly woundes cure men gon wel grace grene lusty may shall euer endure thys waye good auenture glad thou reder thy sorowe cast al open passe spede fast gon tha spake ye syde vnto mortal stroke speere disdayne daunger gyde neuer tree shall frute ne leaues beere streme ledeth sorouful weere fyshe prison drye eschewyng onely remedye verse gold asure ywritten whych gan astouyed beholde one encreased al feare gan herte bolde one hette dyd colde wytte errour chese entre slye saue lese ryght betwene adamantes two euyn weyght pece yron set ne hath myght moue ne fro one may hale let fared nyst bet entre leaue tyl affrikan gyde hente shoue gate wyde sayd standeth writen thy face thyne errour though thou tell drede come thys place thys writtyng nothinge ment ne none loues seruaunte thou loue hast lost thy tast gesse sycke man hath swete bytternesse nathlesse although thou dul thou caust yet mayst thou se many man may stande pul yet lyketh hym wrestlyng demeth yet whether bet yf thou haddest connyng tendyte shal shewe matter wryte wyth yt hande hys toke anone whych comfort caught went fast lorde glad wel begon ouer al myne eyen cast tree clad wyth leues yt aye shall last eche hys kynde wt colour fresh grene emeraude ioye sene bylder oke eke hardy ashe pyller elme coffer vnto carayne boxe pype tre holme whyppes lashe saylynge fyrre ye cypre deth playne shoter ewe aspe shaftes playne oliue peace eke yt dronken vine victor palme laurer dyuyne gardeyne saw full blosomed bowis vpon ryuer grene mede swetnesse euermore ynough wyth floures whyte blew yelow rede colde wel stremes nothynge dede swomen ful smal fyshes lyght synnes rede scale syluer bryght euery bough byrdes herde synge voyce aungel armony busyed hem byrdes forth brynge lytle prety conyes playe gan hy al aboute gan espy dredeful roe ye bucke hart hynde squyrels beestes small gentyl kynde instrumentes strynges accorde herde playe rauyshynge swetnesse god maker al lorde ne herde neuer better gesse therwyth winde vnneth might lesse made leaues grene noyse softe accordaunt foules songe lost ayre place attepre neuer greuaunce hote ne colde eke euery holsome spyce grace ne man may waxe sycke ne olde yet ioy thousande folde tell euer coude myght euer clere day neuer nyght vnder tree besyde well sey cupyde lorde arowes forge fyle hys fete hys bowe al redy ley wel doughter tepred al whyle heedes wel wyle couched hem shuld serue slee wounde carue tho ware pleasauce anone right aray lust beaute curtesy crafte hath myght done beforce wyght done foly disfygured wyl lye hym selfe vnder oke gesse saw delyte stode wyth gentylnesse sawe beaute wyth nyce atyre youth ful game iolyte folehardenesse flatery desyre messagery mede thre name shal tolde vpon pyllers great iasper longe saw temple brasse yfounded stronge aboute temple daunced alway woman ynowe whych fayre hem selfe hem gay kyrtyls al disheueled went theyr offyce euer fro yere yere temple sawe whyte fayre downes sitting many thousand payre temple dore ful soberly dame peace satte curteyne honde besyde wonder dyscretly dame pacience syttynge founde wyth face pale vpon hyl sonde alther nexte wythin wythout behest arte folke rout wythin temple syghes hote fyre herde swough gan aboute ren whych syghes engendred wyth desyre made euery herte bren newe flambe wel espyed al cause sorowes yt drye come bytter goddes ialousye god pyriapus sawe went wythin temple soueraine place stonde arraye whan asse hym shent crye nigt sceptre honde ful busely men gan assay sonde vpon hys heed sette sondry hewe garlandes ful freshe floures newe preuy corner disporte founde venus porter rychesse ful noble hauten port derke place lyghtnesse sawe lyte vnnethes myght lesse bed golde lay rest tyll hote sunne gan west gylte heeres wyth golde threde ybounde vntressed lay naked brest vnto hede men myght se sothly say remenaunt couered wel pay ryght wyth lytle kerchefe valence thycker cloth defence place gaue thousande sauours sote bacchus god wyne sate besyde cere nexte doth hunger bote sayd myddes lay cupyde knee yonge folkes cryed theyr helpe thus let lye farther temple gan espys dispyte dyane chaste ful many bowe ybroke hynge wal maydens gon tymes waste seruyce paynted ouer al many storye whyche touche shall fewe calixte athalante many maide ye name wat semyramus caudace hercules byblys dydo tysbe piramus tristram isoude parys achilles heseyne cleopatre troylus sylla eke mother romulus paynted syde al loue plyte dide whan comen ayen place spake sote grene forth walked tho seluen solace tho ware sate quene lyght somer sunne shene passeth sterre ryght ouer measure fayrer creature launde vpon hyl floures sette noble goddesse nature brauches halle boures wrought crafte mesure ne na foule yt cometh engendrure ne preest presence take dome yeue audience thys saynt valentynes daye whan euery foule cometh chese make euery kynde men thynke may huge noyse gan make erth see tree euery lake ful vnneth space stande ful al place right alayne playnt kynde deuyseth nature aray face aray men myght fynde thys noble empresse ful al grace bad euery foule take owne place wonte alway fro yere yere saynt valentynes day standen say foules rauyne hyghest set foules smale eaten nature wolde enclyne worme thynge tel tale water foule sat lowest dale foules yt liueth sede sate grene many woder sene myght men royal egle fynde wyth sharpe loke perseth son egles lower kynde clerkes wel deuysen con tyrant fethers grene mene yt goshauke yt doth pyne byrdes hys outragyous rauyne getyl fauco yt fete distreyneth kynges hande hardy sperhauke eke quales foe merlyon peyneth hym selfe ful ofte larke seke doue eyen meke ielous swan ayenst deth yt syngeth oule eke deth bode bryngeth crane geant wt trompes sowne thefe choughe chateryng pye scorning iaye ye eles foe herowne false lapwyng ful trechery stare counsayle bewry tame ruddocke cowarde kyte cocke horiloge thorpe lyte sparow venus son nyghtyngale clepeth forth fresh leaues newe swalowe murdrer flyes smale maken hony floures freshe hewe wedded turtel herte trewe pecocke wyth augel fethers bright fesaunt scorner cocke nyght waker gose cuckowe euer vnkinde popyngey ful delycasy drake stroyer hys owne kynde storke wreker auoutry hote cormeraunt ful glotony rauyn crow voice care throstle olde frosty feldefare shulde say foules euery kynde thys worlde haue fethers stature men myght place assembled fynde noble goddes nature eche dyd hys busy cure benignely chese take accorde formell make point nature helde honde formal egle shap gentyllest euer amonge workes fonde moost benigne eke goodlyest euery vertue rest farforth nature self blisse loke ofte becke kysse nature vycar almyghty lorde hote colde heuy lyght moyst drey hath knytte euen nombre accorde easy voyce began speke say foules take hede sentence pray owne ease fordrig nede fast may speke wyl spede ye know wel saint valentine day statute throughe gouernaunce ye chese make flye away hem pricke wyth pleasaunce nathlesse ryghtful ordinaunce may let al worlde wyn worthyest shal begyn tercel egle ye knowe ful wele foule royal aboue al degre wyse worthy secrete true stele whych haue formed ye may se euery parte best lyketh nedeth hys shappe deuyse shal fyrst chese speken hys gyse hym ordre shal ye chese kynde eueryche lyketh hap shal ye wynne lese loue moost entrikith god sende hym yt sorest hym siketh withal tercel gan cal sayd sonne choyse fal nathlesse thys condicion must choyse euerych agree hys election shulde bene fere thys vsage alway fro yere yere may tyme haue grace blysful tyme came thys place wyth heed enclined ful humble chere thys royal tercell spake taryed nought vnto souerayne lady fere chose chese wyl herte thought formel hande well ywrouyt whose al euer wyl serue lust lyue sterue besechyng mercy grace lady souerayne let dye present thys place certes longe may lyue payne herte coruen euery vayne hauyng regarde onely trouth dere herte haue wo routh yf founde vntrewe dysobeysaunt wylful negligent vauntour processe loue newe pray thys iugement wyth foules al rent ylke daye euer fynde vnto vntrue gylte vnkynde syth none loueth wel although neuer loue behet tha ought myne mercy bonde none knet wele wo neuer shall let serue howe farre wende say lyst tale ende ryght freshe reed rose newe agaynst sommer sunne coloured ryght shame al waxen gan hewe thys formel whan herde al neyther answerde well ne sayd amys sore abashed tyl nature said doughter drede assure another tercel egle spake anone lower kynde sayd shulde nat loue better ye saynt ihon leest loue wel ye lenger haue serued degre yf shulde haue loued longe louing alone guerdonyng dare eke say yf fynde false vnkynde iangler rebel wyse iolous hange halse beare seruyse wel wyt suffyce fro poynt poynt honour saue take lyfe al good haue thyrde tercel egle answerde tho nowe syrs ye se lytle leyser euery soule cryeth ago forth wyth hys make lady dere eke nature selfe ne wyl taryeng halfe wolde sey speke muste sorowe dey longe seruyce auaunt nothyng possible dye daye wo hath languyshyng thys twenty wynter wel happen may man may serue better pay halfe yere although tha man doth yt hath serued ful yore ne say nat thys ne seruyce may lady please dare say trewest man dome faynest wolde please shorte wordes tyl deth cease wyl whether wake wynke trewe al herte may bethynke al lyfe syth day borne gentyl plee loue thyng ne herde neuer man beforne leyser connyng reherce theyr chere theyr spekyng morowe gan thys spech last tyl downwarde went sune woder fast noyse foules delyuerde loude range haue done let v wende wel wende yt wod al shiuerd come cryed ala ye wyl v shende wha shal cursed pledinge haue ende howe shulde iudge eyther partye leue yee nay without preue gose ducke cuckowe also cryed keke keke cuckow queke queke hy mine eares ye noyse went tho gose said al ny worth ye shape herof remedy wyl say verdyte fayre swythe water foule wroth blythe wormfoule sayd ye fole cuckow wyll myne owne authorite comon spede take charge delyuer v great charyte ye may abyde whyle yet parde quod turtel yf wyl wyght may speke good styl sede foule one vnworthyest wote wel leest connyng better wyghtes tonge rest entremete hym doynge neyther rede synge doth ful foule self acloyeth ice vncomitted ofte anoyeth nature whych alway eare murmur leudnesse behinde faconde voice sayd holde tonges shall sone hope counsayle fynde delyuer fro thys noyse vnbinde charge euery flocke ye shal one cal say verdyte foules al assented thys conclusyon byrdes al foules rauyne haue chosen fyrst playne eleccyon tercelet faucon dyffyne sentence lust termyne nature dyd present accepteth glad entent tercelet sayd manere ful herde preue reason loueth best gentyl formel euerych hath replication skylles may none brought adoun se argumentes auayle semeth must batayle al redy quod egles tarcelles tho naye syrs quod yf durst say ye wronge tale ydo syrs taketh nat agrefe pray may ye wolde way ye voice yt hath charge hande iuges dome ye must stande therfore peace saye wyt wolde thynke howe worthyest knyghthode lengest vsed moost estate blode gentyllest syttyng yf lest thre wote selfe trow lyght know water foules haue theyr heedes layd togyther shorte auysement whan eueryche hys verdyte sayd sayd sothly al one assent howe goo faconde gent desyreth pronounce nede shal tel tale prayed god spede water foules tho began goose speke cakelynge sayd peace nowe take kepe euery man herken reason shall forth bryng wytte sharpe loue rarying say rede tho brother wyll loue let hym loue another lo parfyte reason gose quod sperhauke neuer mote lo thyng haue tonge lose nowe parde foole yet better haue holde thy peace shewe thy nicete lyeth wyt wyl soth sayd foole styl laughter arose gentyl foules al right anone sede foules chosen turtel trewe gan hem cal prayed say soth sad mater asked rad answered playnly entent wolde shewe sothly ment nay god forbede louer shulde chaunge turtel sayd wexte shame reed though hys lady euermore strauge yet let hym serue alwaye tyll deed forsoth prayse go reed tho dyed wolde none make wyll tyll death take well ybourded ducke hat men shulde loue alway causelesse reason fynde wyt daunceth mery myrthlesse shulde recke rechelesse ye qucke yet ducke ful wel fayre mo sterres skye payre fye churle gentyl tercelet donghyl came worde aryght thou canst se whych thyng wel beset thou farest loue oules lyght day blindeth ful wel se night thy kynde lowe wretchednesse loue thou cast se gesse tho gan ye cuckowe put forth preace foule eateth worme sayd blyue may haue make peace retche nought howe longe ye stryue let eche hem soleyn lyue thys rede sen may accorde thys short lesson nedeth recorde yea haue glutton fylde hys paunche well sayd emerlon thou murdrer ye heisugge brauche brought forth thou rufull glotton lyue thou soleyn wormes corruption force lacke thy nature go leude thou whyle ye world may dure peace nature comaunde haue herde opinion effecte yet neuer nere fynally thys conclusion selfe shall haue election lyst wroth blyth h yt cheseth shal haue swyth syth may dyscussed loueth beste sayd tercelet wol done fauour shal haue right hert set hys herte hath knet thys iuge nature may lye none estate haue none eye counsayle chose make yf reason wolde counsayle royall tercell take sayd tercelet full skylfully gentyllest moste worthy whych haue wrought wel plesace ought ben suffysaunce wyth dredful voyce ye formel answerde ryghfull lady goddesse nature soth euer vnder yerde eueryche creature must whyle lyfe may dure therfore graunt fyrst boone myne entet woll say ryght soone graunt ryght anone thys formel egle spake thys degre almyghty quene vnto thys yere done aske respyte auysen haue choyce fre thys wolde speke sey ye get nomore al though ye dey woll seruen venus ne cupide forsoth yet maner way nowe sen may none wayes betyde quod nature say wolde thys foules away eche wyth hys make taryeng leger sayd hem thus ye shall speke ye tercelet nature beth good herte serueth thre yere longe endure eche payne hym hys degree well god wote quyte thys yere befall thys entremes dressed fro whe werke brought end euery foule nature yaue hys make euen acorde way wende lorde blysse ioye make ech hem gan wynges take wyth neckes eche gan wynde thakyng alway ye noble goddesse kynde fyrst chosen foules synge yere yere alway vsaunce synge roundell departynge nature honoure pleasaunce note trowe maked fraunce wordes ye may fynd next vers nowe haue mynde qui bien ayme tarde oublie welcom somer wt thy sunnes softe haste thys wynter wether ouershake saynt valentyne thou arte ful hye lofte whych dryuest away loge nyghtes blake thus syngen smale foules thy sake well haue cause gladen ofte sen eche hem recouered hath hys make ful blysful may syng whe awake wt shoutynge whe songe foules made flyght away woke bokes toke rede vpon yet rede alway hope ywys rede day shall mete somthynge fare bet thus rede nyll spare pexplicit floure curtesy feuerier yt froslye moone horned full phebus fyry lyght gan reyse streames sone saynt valentyne vpon thy blysfull nyght dutye gladis euery wyght foules chese voyde olde sorowe eueryche hys make vpon next morowe tyme herde lerke synge full lustely agayne morowe gray awake ye louers slombrynge thys glad morowe haste ye may obseruaunce doth vnto thys day choyse ayen herte renewe confyrmynge euer trewe ye chosynge large thys lusty day custome nature take vpon blysfull holy charge serue loue whyle lyfe may dure wyth herte body besy cure euermore venus cipride dysposeth god cupyde ioye owe playnly obey vnto thys lordes myghty ordinaunce mercylesse rather dye euer founden variaunce though lyfe medled wt greuauce herte closet wounde beth alwaye one ye bounde herde lysted longe wyth deuoute herte lusty melody thys heuenly comfortable songe agreable ermonye rose anone faste gan hye towarde groue waye take foules sene eueryche chose hys make yet full thursty languyshyng myne ague feruent hys hete aurora drery complaynyng dystyll chrystall teeres wete vpon soyle wyth syluer dewe swete durste shame apere vnder lyght phebus beames clere anguyshe paynes kene constraynte syghes sore set downe vnder laurer grene full pytously alway behelde holtes hore gan coplayne myne inward deedly smerte aye sore crampeth myne herte whyle drery payne sate behelde aboute euery tre foules sytte alway twayne twayne thought thus ala may euery foule hath hys lyberte frely chose hys desyre eueryche make thus fro yere yere sely wrenne tytemose also lytell redbrest haue free election flyen yfere together go hem lyst aboute enuyron kynde haue inclinacion nature empresse gyde euery thynge lyst prouyde man alone ala harde stounde full cruelly kyndes ordynaunce constrayned statute bounde debarred suche plesaunce meneth purueyauce god aboue agayne ryght kynde wythout cause narow man bynde thus maye sene playne ala wofull houre dysauenture doulfully stonde caas ferre behynde health cure wounde abydeth lyke sursanure fortune felly lyst dyspose harme hyd dare dysclose herte haue set suche place neuer lykely spede ferre hyndred grace saue daunger haue none mede thus ala shall rede ne myne helpe shape remedye male bouche false enuye whiche twayne aye stodeth wey malyciously false suspection cause also dey gynnyng rote distruction fele conclusyon traynes wol shende labour deth mote make ende yet dye herte wyl thought god loue auowe make best howe dere bought slepe wake whyle boreas dothe leaues slake haue heyght plainly tyl sterue wel wo shal serue sake nowe holy tyme saynt valentyne somwhat shal write al though ryme curyously crafte endyte yet leuer haue put wyte vnconnynge negligence euer saye excellence euer saye dute sothfastnesse presumpcion thys ensure shall se vnder correction reherce comendacion shall blyue vertues dyscryue pryght example somer sonne passeth sterre wyth hys beames shene lucyfer amonge skyes donne morowe sheweth voyde nyghtes tene verely wythouten wene lady passeth taketh hede tho alyue speake womanhede ruby hath soueraynte ryche stone regalye rose swetenesse beaute freshe floures wythout lye ryght sothe wyth goodly eye passeth bounty fayrenesse maner eke gentylnesse fayrest beste reken sothfastnesse euery vertue reste furthermore speake stedfastnesse rote semelynesse myrrour gouernaunce example wythouten variaunce porte benygne wonder glad chere hauynge euermore trewe aduertence alwaye reason desyre brydeled aye wytte prouydence wytte hye prudence welle aye deuoyde pryde vnto vertue seluen gyde ouer thys daliaunce lowly dyscrete wyse goodly gladde attemperaunce euery wyght hygh lowe degre glad herte wyth shortly yf shall lye named floure curtesye speake femynyte leste mannyshe comparison goodly abashed hauynge aye pyte hem ben tribulacion alone consolacion arne myschefe nede comforte hem womanhede aye vertue besy charge sadde demure wordes fewe dredefull also tonges ben large eschewynge aye hem lysten hewe aboue heed wordes shewe dyshonestly speke wyght deedly hateth hem haue syght herte honest clene entent faythfull entere ne may worlde sustene suffre eeres worde frende foe neyther ferre ne nere amysse resonynge yt hinder shulde name yf wexeth reed shame trewly menynge sette wythout chaungynge doublenesse bountie beautie together knette persone vnder faythfulnesse voyde newfanglenesse herte aye one euer perseuer sette neuer dysseuer rude vertues euerychone connyngly dyscryue wryte well ye wote colour haue none lyke dyscrecion craftely endyte saye lyte wherfore thus excuse aqueynted wyth muse rethoryke style gouerne prayse comendacyon blynde hylye dyscerne goodnesse make dyscripcion saue thus saye conclusion yf shall shortly commende naught nature amende good lyke polycene fayrenesse quene helayne stedfast herte dorigene wyfely trouth yf shall fayne constaunce eke fayth may attayne cleopatre therto setrone troye whyte antygone hester meke lyke iudith prudence kynde alcest marcia catoun grisylde lyke pacience arladne dyscrecioun lucrece rome toun may lykened honeste fayth vnto penelope fayre phyllis hipsiphiles innocence womanhede semelynesse vnto canace ouer thys speke goodlyhede passeth rede worde dede nought ne fall acorde vertue werkes though dido wyth wytte sage tyme stedfast enee hastynesse yet dyd outrage iason dyd also medee lady auysee bouty beautye demeyne maketh bountye alwaye souerayne meane bountye goeth afore lad prudence hath souerainte beautye foloweth ruled lore ne sende degre one thys goodly freshe fre surmountynge al wythouten good fayre one persone yfere though ignoraunce ne maye dyscryue vertues yet thys daye remembraunce onely supported vnder mercy wyth quakynge honde shall full humbly hynesse rudenesse quyte lytell balade byneth endyte euer suppryse myne herte alwaye wyth feare betwyxte drede shame leste lose worde asterte thys metre make seme lame chaucer deed suche name fayre makynge wythout wene fayrest tonge laurer grene maye assaye countrefete hys gaye style wyll welle drye wyth lycoure swete clye caliope fyrst woll excuse grounde goodlyhede thus saye vntyll womanhede pbalade symple wyth myght beste entente wyth fayth myghtye god kynde yaue syth soule knowynge sent chese thys bonde euer bynde loue best whyle haue lyfe mynd thus herde foules daunynge vpon daye saynt valentyne synge yet chese begynnyng thys entent loue though mercy fynde yf lyste dyed wolde assent euer twynne quycke thys lyne suffyseth sene fethers ynde thus herde soules mornynge vpon daye saynt valentyne synge ouer thys myne hertes luste bente honour onely wodde bynde holy yeue neuer repente ioye wo wynde sore cupide wyth hys eyen blynde foules tytan dyd sprynge wyth deuout hert thought herd synge plenuoye ppryncesse beauty represent thys symple dyte rude makynge herte wyll faythfull myne entent lyke thys daye foules herde synge phere endeth floure curtesy foloweth howe pyte deed buryed gentle herte pyte yt haue sought yore ago wyth herte sore full besy payne yt world neuer wyght wo wythout deth yf shall fayne purpose pyte complayne vpon teh crueltye tyraunye loue trouth doth dye length certayne yeres euer one sought tyme speke pyte ran spreynt wyth teeres prayen cruelte awreke myght wyth worde breke tell paynes smerte founde deed buryed herte adowne fell sawe herse deed stone whyle yt sowne laste vp rose wyth colour full dyuerse pytously myne eyen caste nerer corse gan preasen faste soule shope pray lorne say thus slayne syth pyte deed ala daye euer shulde fall maner man dare hold vp heed whome shal nowe sorowful hert cal nowe cruelte hath caste stee v ydle hope folke redelesse payne syth deed shal coplayne yet encreaseth thys wonder newe wyght wote deed many men tyme knewe yet deyde sodeynly haue sought euer full besely syth fyrst wytte mynde deed er coude fynde aboute herse stoden lustely wythouten mo thought bountie perfytly well armed rychely freshe beaute lust iolyte assured maner youthe honeste wysedome estate drede gouernaunce confedred bonde alyaunce complaynt wrytten honde haue put pyte byll thys company fonde rather wolde cause spyll helpe helde playnt styll folke wythouten fayle wythout pyte maye byll auayle leaue vertues saue onely pyte kepynge corse ye haue herde sayne confedred bonde vnto cruelte assented shalbe slayne haue put complaynte vp agayne foe byll dare shewe effecte whych sayeth thus wordes fewe phumblest herte hyest reuerence benigne sloure crowne vertues sheweth vnto royall excellence seruaunt yf durst call hys mortall harme whych yfall nought onely hys wofull fare renome shall declare stodeth thus cotrary cruelte alyed ayenst regalye vnder colour womanly beaute men shulde knowe tyrannye wyth bountie gentyllesse curtesye hath depryued place hygh beaute apertenaunt youre grace kyndly heritage ryght ye annexed euer vnto bounte verely ye ought myght helpe trouth hys aduersite ye also corowne beaute certes yf ye wante twayne world lore sayne eke auayleth maner gentyllesse wythout benigne creature shall cruelte gouerneresse ala herte may longe endure wherfore ye rather take cure breke peryllous alyaunce ye fleen hem ben obeysaunce yf ye suffre thus renome fordo throwe shall man wete pyte ala euer renome fall lowe ye also fro herytage ythrowe cruelte occupyeth place dyspayred seken grace haue mercy thou herenus quene haue sought tenderly sore let streme lyght sene loue drede euer lenger ye sothly sayne beare sore though connyng playne goddes loue haue mercy payne payne thys desyre haue ne nothynge lyke therto euer setteth desyre myne herte fyre eke syde go maner thyng may encrease wo haue redy vnsought euery lacketh dethe bete nedeth shewe percell payne syth euery wo herte may bethynke suffre yet dare playne well wote though wake wynke ye recke whether flete synke nathelesse yet trouth shall sustene vnto death shall well sene thys sayne wyll euer though ye slee cruelte fo algate spirite shall neuer dysceuer fro seruyce payne wo syth ye yet deed ala thus death may wepe playne wyth herte sore full besy payne pexplicit p la belle dame sans mercy halfe dreame fully well awaked golde slepe wrapped vnder hys wyng yet nat thy rose well nygh naked sodaynlye selfe remembryng mater leuynge thynge whyche muste wythouten delay hem whiche durst nat dysobey charge translate thynge forgyue parte penaunce boke called la belle dame sauns mercy whiche mayster aleyne made remebrauce chefe secretarie wyth kyng fraunce vpon whyle stode musynge selfe greatly ymagenynge wyse shuld perform ye sayd processe consyderynge good aduysement vnconnynge great symplenesse ayen warde strayte comaundement whiche thus myne entent vexed tourned vp downe yet last conclusyon cast clothes went way foresaid charge hauyng remebrauce tyll came lusty grene valey full floures se great pleasaunce boldly theyr benigne suffraunce whych rede boke touchyng thys matere thus began yf please nat longe ago rydynge easy paas fell thought ioye full desperate gret dysease payne louers vnfortunate syth darte cruell full hate dethe hath take lady maystresse lefte sole thus dyscomfyte mate sore languysshynge way distresse sayd thus falleth cesse eyther ryme dytees make surely make full promesse laugh wepe clothesblake ioyfull tyme ala nowe doth slake selfe fele maner ease let wrytten suche fortune take neyther non doth please wyll myne entent constrayned ioyfull thyng wryte penne coude neuer knowe ment speke therof tonge hath delyte tho mouthe laugh moch lyte myne eyen sholde make coutenauce vntrue herte also wolde haue therof dyspyte wepynge teares haue large yssue sicke louers leue hem loge whiche lede theyr lyfe hope alegeaunce saye make balades songes euery hem fele theyr greuaunce ioye plesaunce whose soule pray god hys mercy saue hath wyll myne hertes ordynaunce whiche lyeth within tombe ygraue fro tyme forth tyme hold pee weryeth mater trete let louers put hem selfe prees theyr season tyme nowe forgete fortune strength forcer hath vnshete wheryn sperde worldly rychesse goodes whyche haue gete best tyme youthe lustynesse loue hath kepte vnder hys gouernaunce mysdyd god graunt forgyuenesse yf dyd well yet felte pleasaunce caused neyther ioye heuynesse whan dyed maystres welfare made purchase dethe hath shette bondes wytnes nothyng myn herte shal neuer pase gret thought sore troubled minde alone thus rode morowe tyde tyll last happed fynde place wherin cast abyde whan ryde went lodgynge puruey ryght soone herde lytell besyde garden mynstrels gan play wyth anone went backer selfe thought ynowe twayne yt frendes espyed yet wote nat howe came awaywarde drowe somwhat force somwhat request wyse coude selfe rescowe nedes must come se feest comynge ladyes euerchone bad welcome god wote right gentylly made chere euery one one great dele better worthy theyr grace shewed grete curtesy wt good disport bycause shuld nat mourne day bode styll theyr company whyche gracyous soiourne bordes spred ryght lytell space ladyes sat eche hem semed best deedly seruautes place chosen men ryght goodlyest parauenture freshest sawe theyr iuges full demure wythout semblaunt eyther lest natwithstandyng hem vnder cure amonge one gan espy grete thought ful ofte came went one ben rauyshed vtterly hys language nat greatly dylygent countenaunce kept wt great tourment desyre farre passed hys reason euer hys eye went hys entent full many tyme whan season make chere sore himselfe payned outwardly fayned great gladnesse synge also byforce constrayned pleasaunce shamfastnesse complaynte hys moste heuynesse came hys voyce alway without request lyke sowne byrdes dothe expresse whan synge loude frythe forest serued hall none lyke hym myne aduyse pale somwhat leane withal hys speche also trymbled fereful wyse euer alone whan dyd seruyse blacke ware deuyse playne thouyt hym wyt coude suffyse herte nothing demeyne feest hem dyd dylygence well coude ryght semed euermore whan presence hys chere done wolde none hys schole mayster suche authorite whyle bode styll place speke coude nat vpon beaute loked styll ryght pytous face wyth hys heed tourned last beholde ladyes euerychone euer one set eye stedfast whiche thought vpon hys eyen shot knewe anone ferefull wt right huble requestes selfe sayd god alone one sawe iestes prese wente full easely make stable heuy countenaunce wote ye well syghed wonderly hys sorowes wofull remembraunce hym selfe made ordynaunce forthwithall came bryng messe iuge hys wofull penaunce god wote pytous entremesse dyner anone hem auaunced daunce aboue folkes euerychone forthwithal thys heuy man daunced somtyme twayne somtyme wt one vnto hem hys chere one nowe nowe fell auenture euer amonge drewe alone whyche dred lyuynge creature myne aduyse good purueyauce whan chase hys maystres alone herte set hys pleasaunce moche beauteous persone euer setteth hys trust vpon reporte eyen wythouten might deed grauen vnder stone euer shulde hertes ease restore fayled nothynge coude gesse one wyse preuy perte garyson al goodlynesse make frounter louers herte right yonge fresshe woman ful couerte assured wele porte eke chere wele ease withouten wo smerte al vnderneth standerde daungere se feest weryed ful sore heuy ioye doth sore herte trauayle prese withdrawe therfore set downe alone behynde trayle ful leues se great meruayle grene wrethes ybounden wonderly leues thycke withouten fayle throughout man might espy lady came ful curtesly wha thought tyme dauce wt trace set herber made fule plesauntly rested hem fro then lytel space nygh hem none certayne compace onely farre coude se saue trayle chose place bytwene hem two harde louer syghyng wonder sore aye sorer sought inwarde paine coude kepe store speke hardy nought leche nere ye gretter thouyt mused sore conquere desyre may penauce brought heate bring fyre herte began swel within cheste sore strayned anguisshe payne al peces almoste brest whan one sore dyd constrayne desyre bold shame gan refrayne one large ful close lytel charge layde certayne kepe suche werre haue many fose ful ofte tymes speke selfe payned shamfastnesse drede sayd euer nay yet last sore constrayned whan full longe put delay lady ryght thus gan say dredeful voyce wepyng halfe rage purueyed vnhappy day whan fyrst syght vysage suffre payne god wote ful hote brennynge cause dethe true seruyse se well ye recke therof nothyng take hede kynde wyse whan speke best aduyse ye set nought make therof game thoughe sewe great entrepryse yet peyreth worship fame ala shulde preiudyce man loue faythfully worshyp eschewynge euery vyce wyll veryly chalenge nought ryght reason hole submyt vnto seruyce ryght ye lyst ryght wyll bynde self frauchise lamant though nat deserue haue grace alway lyue drede yet suffre loue serue withouten maugre goodlyhede faith trouth gyue womahede seruyce wythout callynge loue hath boud withoute wage mede man leue thynge la dame whan thys lady herde al language gaue answere full softe demurely wythout chaungynge colour courage nothynge haste mesurably thinketh syr thought great foly purpose ye nought labour cese thynketh whyles ye lyue thys mater set herte pea lamant may none make peace ye grounde cause al war wyth eyen letter written whyche defyed put far plesaunt loke lode star made herande thilke defyaunce whiche vtterly behyght barre fayhtfull trust myne affyaunce la dame lyue wo hath great fantasy hys herte also slypper holde onely beholdynge eye nat abyde peace reason wolde yf ye lyst ye may beholde eye made loke whi shuld spare take kepe neyther yonge ne olde feleth smerte counsayle hym beware lamant one hurte another sore hys defaute feleth greuaunce ryght man may yet reason wolde remembraunce syth fortune onely chaunce hath caused suffre thys payne beaute wyth cyrcumstaunce lyste ye haue great dysdayne la dame persone ne haue dysdayne neuer trewly ne nought wyll haue ryght great loue hatred certayne counsayle know god saue yf suche loue mynde ygraue lytell thynge may dyspleasauce begyle make raue wyll nat cause suche encomberaunce lamant euer yt hath thus purchased wenynge hath nat dysceyued certayne feruent loue sore hath ychased vnware casten chayne syth fortune lyst ordayne welfare haundes fall eschewynge myscheuous payne sonest dyeth hys care leest la dame syckenesse ryght easy endure fewe people causeth dye meane knowe sure comforte drawe remedy suche nowe playnyng ful pytously fele god wote nat alther grettest paine yf loue hurte greuously lesse harm one sorowful tha twayn lamant ala madame yf myght please moche better way gentylnesse one sory make twayne wel ease hym destroye lyueth distresse desyre neyther lesse seruyce pleasaunce eschewynge maner doublenesse make two ioyes stede one greuauce la dame loue seke neyther pleasaunce ease haue therin great affyaunce though ye sick doth nothing please also take hede pleasaunce chese wyll hertes auaunce fre nowe free wyll endure ruled mannes gouernaunce erthely good nay ensure lamant loue ioy sorowe doth departe hath set ladyes seruage largely dothe graunt hem parte lordshyp rule euery maner age poore seruaut nought hath auantage may gete onely purchesse one loue doth hys homage full often tymes dere bought rychesse la dame ladyes nat symple thus mene dull wyt sotted foly wordes whiche sayd ye splene fayre langage paynted full plesauntly whiche ye mo holde scholes dayly make hem great wonder suppose sone away theyr heedes wrye fayre speche lyghtly theyr eres close lamant man tangleth busyly setteth hys herte mynde therfore reason may playne pytously hath moche heuynesse store whose heed hole sayth sore hys fayned chere harde kepe mewe thought whyche vnfayned euermore wordes preueth workes shewe la dame loue subtell hath great awayte sharpe working gabbing gret plesauce hem venge suche dysceyte wolde fele knowe secret gouernauce maketh hem obey hys ordynaunce cherefull wayes hem supposed whan fall repentaunce rage counsayle disclosed lamant syth moche god eke nature hath auaunced loue hye degre moche sharpe poynt thus sure yet greueth faute euer hath colde heate hath deynte one asked expresse plesaunce knoweth none certeyne one thought heuynesse la dame pleasaunce nat alway one think swete thinke bitter pain ye may nat costrayne yet right none lust loue vayn chalenge loue ryght neuer seyne herte assent bonde promyse strength force may nat attayne wyll standeth enfeffed fraunchyse lamant ryght fayre lady god mote neuer please yf seke ryght thys case shewe playnly dysease mercy abyde eke grace purpose honour deface euer dyd god fortune shende neuer vnrightfully purchace one onely ioy vnto lyues ende la dame ye swere suche othes faste condempne cursen fro full sykerly ye wene othes laste lenger wordes ben ago god eke sayntes laughe also suche sweryng stedfastnesse wretch haue ful trust therto wepe waylen distresse lamant hath corage man trewly secheth plesaunce worshyp dispyse called forthe worthy erthe touche ye ayre kyns wyse trusty herte mouth without feyntyse thus strength euery maner name layeth fayth lytel pryse leseth bothe hys worshyp hys fame la dame cursed herte mouth curteyse ful well ye wote accordynge yet fayned chere right soone may apeyse malyce set workynge full false semblaunt bere true semyng name fame tonges fayned worshyp hem put forgettynge nought repented wyse coplayned lamant thynketh yll good may hym befall god hys grace graunt eche man desert hys loue amonge thoughtes thynke vpon wofull sorowes smert payne wheder tender herte swete pyte therwyth agreued grace discouerte mean sone shulde releued la dame lightsome herte folly pleasaunce moche better lesse whyle abyde make think bring atrauce sycknesse wyll sone remedyde respyte thought put al thys asyde full good disporte werieth day helpe hurte wyll aplyde troweth let hem passe away lamant hath byrde faucon hounde foloweth hym loue euery place cherisheth hym kepeth hym full sounde hys syght wyl hym enchace set wyttes cace alone wythouten chaunge put vnder moche farther grace lesse set straunge la dame though make chere euery man aboute worship myne owne frauchyse nyl wythouten doute eschewynge maner preiudyse wote ye well loue lytell wyse byleue lyghtly wyll brought taketh hys owne deuyse thyng god wote yt serueth nought lamant yf loue true seruyce lese ye good chere yt straungers haue alway wherof shall serue trouth wyse lesse cometh goth day whiche holdeth nothynge yt nay also lost semynge curtesy whyche reason wyll say loue loue lawfull desyrynge la dame curtesy alyed wonder nere worshyp whyche hym loueth tenderly wyll nat bounde prayere gyftes say verely hys good chere departe full largely hym lyketh conceyte wyll fall guerdon costrayned gifte done thankfully twayn ca neuer accorde neuer shal lamant guerdon seke none cace desert hye wherfore aske pardon grace sythe behoueth dethe mercy gyue good wanteth truely reason curtyse manere owne moch better worthy tha straungers shew hem louely chere la dame call ye good fayne wolde yt wyst pleaseth one another smerteth sore hys owne large lyst gyue moch lese hys good name therfore one shulde nat make graunt lytel ne request ryght well accordynge yf worshyp kepte set lefte lytell thynge lamant worlde founded neuer none vnder heuen creature ybore neuer shall saue onely persone worshyp toucheth halfe sore whiche haue season lesse ne youthe ne age styll seruyce haue eyen wit mouth store gyuen offyce la dame full great charge hath wythouten fayle hys worshyp kepeth sykernesse daunger setteth hys trauayle fesseth wyth others busynesse hym longeth honour noblesse vpon none shulde nat awayte hys owne moche hath lesse moche folowet hthe conceyte lamant eyen hath set ye prynt fele wythin herte euer go yf thynge sowneth vnto wele nedes must come fro mo fortune wyll thys wele wo lyfe endure mercy abydynge ryght wyll thynke also worshyp aboue thynge la dame worshyp se well nede ye spende nat season vayne touchynge myne rede take hede folly put selfe payne ouercome good restrayne herte whyche disceyued follyly worse breke bowe certayne better bowe fall sodaynly lamant nowe fayre lady thynke syth fyrst began loue hath set myn herte vnder cure neuer myght ne truely ne none serue whyle shall endure fre wyse therof make sure may withdrawe nay must abyde maner aduenture may neyther put take away la dame holde gyfte sothfastnesse one offreth forsake suche gyfte abandonynge expresse wyth worship ayen may take hath herte full fell lyst make gyfte lyghtly put refuse wyse suche conceyte wyl slake hym nede neyther study ne muse lamant shulde nat muse yt hath hys seruyce spent whyche lady honourable yf spende tyme entent yet lest reprouable fayned herte thynke vnable mystoke whan made thys request whiche loue hath entreprise notable many hertes gotten conquest la dame ye lyste counsayle seche fayrer hygher fame whych seruyce loue wyll preuayle thought accordynge hurteth hys worshyp hys name follyly twayne hi selfe wyl trouble also leseth game surely set hys poyntes double lamant counsayle ought se better sayd done myne aduyse though byleue forgyue myne herte hole without feyntyse ne may gyue credence wyse thyng sowning vnto truth counsayle se fantasyse saue grace shewe pyte ruth la dame holde hym wyse worketh foly whan hym lyst leue parte therfro connynge lerne truely wolde hym selfe conduyte wyll counsayle sute putteth dysperaunce good shulde fall hym lost deed clene remembraunce lamant yet wyl sewe thys matter faythfully whyles lyue euer chaunce yf hap truth dye deth shal displeasaunce whan harde suffraunce shall dye true great payne yet shal much lesse greuauce lyue false louer certayne la dame get ye ryght nought thys fable wyl neyther harde strayte ryght wyl man customable thynke ye shulde sure conceyte secheth sorowe receyte counsayle fele se lerne cast awayte wyll therof let hym assaye lamant one must assayde nay wyth suche reputacyon true loue ryght honour pay free hertes gotten dewe raunsome frewyl holdeth thys opinion great duresse discomforte kepe herte strayte prison hath one body disporte la dame knowe many cause meruaylous must nede reason thynke certaine auenture wonder peryllous yet wel coming backe againe good worshyp therof seldome sene ne wyll make suche araye fynde pleasaunce barayne whan shal cost dere fyrst assaye lamant ye haue cause dout mater mene fantasyse put farre al straunger goodnesse thinke wel aduyse haue made pryse euery wyse whiche truth sheweth open euidence longe abydyng trewe seruyce maye well knowen playne experience la dame ryght may called trewe must take euery place discerne set ne knewe kepe good yf may purchace yt prayeth swereth case right wel ye wote yt trouth preued hath bene gete grace lese sone whan haue acheued lamant truth cause vertue souerayne shewe good loue alway fynde cotrary cherish yt sleeth ye paine louely aduersary whan ye pyte longe slepe doth tary hath set fyne al heuynesse yet comforte moost necessary shal set wyll sure stablenesse la dame wofull wight maye thynke say contrary al ioy gladnesse sicke bodye thought alway hem felen sore sickenesse thus hurtes bene diuers busynesse loue hath put great hyndraunce truth also put forgetfulnesse whan ful sore begyn sigh askaunce lamant god defende harmelesse al worship good may befall werst tourneth lewdnesse gyfte grace thinge ladie vouchsafe vpon call cherisheth honorable wise defaute euer fall deserueth deth suffre twyse la dame iuge yset suche trespace whych right loue may recouered one curseth fast another doth manace yet dyeth none farre se kepe course alway one degre euermore theyr labour doth encrease brynge lady theyr great subtelte others gylte sorowe disease lamant albeit one doth great offence deed put iustyce right well wote gayneth defence must ende ful mischeuous wyse euer sayd god wyl dispyse falshed euer ful cursedenesse worshyp may neuer haue interprise reygneth hath wylfulnesse la dame haue great fere daise wyl say maynteyne therto stedfast truth nothing prayse hem kepe longe wele wo theyr busye hertes passen two fro wel reclaymed lure wel lerned hem wythholde also al chaug wha loue shuld best endure lamant whan one hath set hert stable wyse place good trewe shulde flyt forth seruice alway withouten chaunge newe sone loue begynneth remewe al plesaunce goth anone lytle space partye shal eschewe whyle soule abydeth hys place la dame loue truely ought right ye may mystaken doutlesse ye foule dysceyued syght lyght vnderstandyng gesse yet may ye wel repele busynesse reason haue attendaunce moch better tha abyde foly simplenes feble socour disperaunce lamant reason cousayle wysedome good aduise bene vnder loue arested euerychone accorde euery wyse rebel styl stone theyr wyl myne medled al one therwyth bouden wt strong cheyne hem departyng shal none pyte breke myghty bonde atwayne la dame ye loue selfe euer ye loue stande forgete euery place wo yf ye haue pyte others pite beleue ye purchace fully assured thys case alway vnder one ordynaunce haue better trust grace al leueth take plesaunce lamant haue hope sure stedfast lady shulde lacke pyte nowe ala shyt vp fast daunger sheweth hys cruelte yf se vertue fayle true seruice though fayle also wonder thys surete must suffre whych way euer go la dame leue chys purpose rede best lenger ye kepe vayne lesse ye gete hertes rest reioyce shal neuer attayne wha ye abyde good hope make fayne ye shal founde asotted dotage ende ye shal knowe cartayne hope shal pay wretch wage lamant ye say falleth moost plesaunce power great al thys se hope shal neuer remebraunce whych fele great aduersite whan nature hath set plente al goodnesse vertue grace neuer assembled hem semed put pyte hys dwellynge place la dame pyte ryght ought resonable wight great disauauntage nede shulde profytable pytous shewynge damage lady wyl great outrage shewe pyte cause owne debate pyte cometh dispitous rage loue also ryght deedly hate lamant comforte hem lyue al comfortlesse harme coforte name ye haue herte duresse fayre lady must affirme dust say ye wynne thys defame cruelte whych sytteth full yl yf pyte whych may al thys attaine hygh herte may rest tary styll la dame euer sayth loueth perauenture leue wel ought wroth shulde blamed though wolde haue medled wyth mo myght called pyte mercylesse afterwarde yf shulde lyue wo repent late gesse lamant marble hert yet harde parde whych mercy may perce labour strong bowe myghty tre auayleth shew great rygour pleaseth se dye thys hour eyen disport play shewe coforte socour respyte death whych chaseth alway la dame disease ye may haue allegeaunce myne let ouer slake also ye shal dye pleasaunce heale surety make wyl hurt selfe others sake wepe laugh synge warant mater wyl vndertake none hem shal make therof auaunt lamant skyl loue god alone haue cause wepe presence wel ye wote auauntour none certaynly loue better scilence one shulde loue hertes credence sure kepe secretly vauntour reuerence whan tonge moost enemy la dame male bouch court hath great comaundement eche man studyeth say worst may false louers time present serue best iangle iay moost secrete ywys yet men say howe mistrusted partyse wherfore ladyes wha men speke say shulde byleued wyse lamant good yl shal alway worlde erth al plaine yt good ye profe sheweth euerye day otherwyse great villony certayne reason though one tonge distayne cursed spech hym selfe shame refuse shuld wrogfully remayne vpon good renomed theyr fame la dame suche nought whan tidynges newe eche trespas shal lightly haue pardon pursuen good trewe wyl set none yl disposition contynewe euery good condicion first fallen damage ful frely hertes habandon lytle fayth wyth soft fayre langage lamant nowe knowe wel certaynte one truely yet shal shente syth al maner iustice pyte banished ladyes entente se al one stente good yl vice eke vertue good haue ye punyshment trespas hem lyue vntrue la dame haue power greuaunce punyshe none creature eschewe encomberaunce kepe v al holde sure false semblaunce hath face ful demure lyghtly catche ladyes wayte wherfore must yf wyl endure make ryght good watche lo co ceyte lamant syth grace goodly worde one may alwaye kepte store appele god may mone duresse whych greueth sore pyte complayne furthermore forgate al hys ordinaunce el lyfe haue ended sone put remembraunce la dame herte haue done forfeyte ye shulde complayne kynd nothing hurteth owne coceite beyng selfe ye shal fynde thus alwaye let thys synke mynde desyre shall neuer recouered ye noy sore wastyng al thys wynde haue sayd ynough semeth lamant thys woful man rose vp al hys payne departed wyth weping countenauce woful herte almoost brast twayne ful lyke dye walking forth traunce sayd deth come forth thy selfe auaunce myne herte forgete properte make shorter al thys woful penaunce pore lyfe ful aduersyte fro thes went whither wist nouyt parte drewe sothfastnesse hys ladyes thought daunce anone gan dresse afterwarde one tolde thus expresse rent heer anguyshe paine selfe toke great heuynesse deed wythin day twayne plenuoy true louers thus besech auentures flye hem euery wyse people defamed ye hem call truely great preiudyse castelles stronge stuffed ordinauce haue long tyme theyr offyce hole countrey loue obeysaunce ye ladyes estate ye worship hath chose dwelling place goddes loue cruelte wyse ne foule trace named ryghtwysly reason semeth thys cace maye called la belle dame sans mercy go lytle boke god sende good passage chese wel thy way simple manere loke thy clothyng lyke thy pylgrimage specially let thys thy prayere vnto hem wyll rede thou art wronge help cal correcte parte al pray hem also thine humble seruice thy boldnesse pardon thys cace el thou arte able wyse make thy selfe appere place furthermore beseche hem grace fauour supportacion take gre rude translation whych god wote standeth ful destitute eloquence meter colour lyke beest naked without refute vpon playne abyde maner showres aske hem socours whose request yu made wyse commaundyng wyth body seruyse right thus make ende thys pro besechyng hym hath balaunce trewe man vexed causelesse remembrauce done faythful obseruaunce trouth purpose hem endure pray god sende hem better auenture pexplicit quene annelida false arcite thou feyrs god armes mar rede thy frosty countre called trace wythin thy gryslye temple ful drede honoured art patron place wyth bellona pallas full grace present song continew gye begynnyng thus crye ful depe sonken mynde wyth pytous herte englyshe endyte thys olde story latyn whych fynde quene annelyda false arcyte elde whych frete byte hath freten many noble story hath nygh deuoured memorye fauourable eke thou polymnia pernaso hath thy susters glade elycon farre cirsa syngest wyth voice memorial shade vnder laurer may fade shyp hauen wynne fyrst folowe stace corinne iam que domos patrias cithic post aspera gentis prelia laurigero suburente thesea curru le tifici plausus missus que ad sidera vulgi whan theseus wyth warres longe great aspre folke cithe hath ouercome laurer crowned chayre gold bete home hys countre house ycome whych people blysful cryden sterres wente hym honouren dyd al entente thys duke signe victory trompes come baner large ymage mar token glorie men myght se tresour many charge many bright helme many spere targe many fresh knight many blysfull rout horse foote felde ipolyta wyfe hardy quene cithya conquered wyth emelye yong suster shene fayre chare golde lad groude chare sprad brightnesse beautie face fulfylled largesse grace hys triumphe laurer corowned thus al floure fortune yeuyng lete noble prince theseus towarde athene hys way rydyng fonde wol shortly bryng slye waye gan write quene annelyda false arcyte mar yt furious course yre olde wrath iuno fulfyll hath sette people hertes fyre thebe grece eueryche kyl blody speares neuer rested styl throng amog hem euerich slew wroth whan amphiorax tydeus ipomedon partynope also deed slayne proude campaneus wha ye wretched theban brethre two slayne kynge adrastus home ago desolate stode thebe bare wyght coude remedye care whan olde creon gan espye yt blode royal brought adoun helde citie tyrannye dyd gentyls regyoun bene frendes dwel toun loue awe noble folke towne ydrawe amonge al annelyda quene ermonye towne dwellyng fayrer sunne shene throuyout ye world gan name spring se euery wyght lykyng trouth none lyche al woman thys worlde ryche yonge quene twentye yere olde myddle stature fayrenesse nature ioye beholde speken stedfastnesse passed hath penelope lucresse shortly yf shal bene comprehended myght nothyng bene amended theban knyght eke soth sayne yonge therto wythal lusty knyght double loue nothing plaine subtyl crafte ouer wyght conyng wan lady bright ferforth gan trouth assure trusteth ouer creature shulde sayne loueth arcyte whan absent throwe anone thought herte brast two syght bare lowe wende haue al hert yknow false na fayned chere nedeth suche craft men lere neuerthelesse ful mykel busynesse er myght hys lady wynne swore wolde dyen distresse witte sayd wold twynne ala whyle routh synne vpon sorowes wolde rewe nothinge thinketh false doth trewe fredom founde arcyte manere al hath much lite ne creature made chere lyked arcyte lacke wyth myght wyte ferforth yeuen hym please al lyked dyd ease na maner letter sent touched loue maner wyght ne shewed hym brent playn dyd ful myght nyl hyde nothyng knight lest vntrouth vpbreyde wythout bode herte obeyed eke made hym ialous ouer man sayde anone wolde prayen swere ye word make yuel apayd tha wende wytte haue brayd al sleyght flaterye wythout loue fayned ielousy al toke debonairly al wyl though skylful thing euer lenger loued tenderly dyd honour kyng herte wedded wyth ryng ferforth vpon trouth entent goth hert wet wha shall eate hym thought wel vnneth meate toke kepe whan rest brought thought alway tyl slepe whan absent priuely doth wepe thus lyueth fayre annelyda quene false arcyte dyd al tene false arcyte newfanglenesse lowly trewe toke lesse deynte stedfastnesse sawe another lady proude newe ryght anone clad hewe wote whether white reed grene falsed fayre annelyda quene neuerthelesse great woder none though false ye kynd syth lameth longe agone loue false euer fyrst father began louen two bigamye founde tentes fyrst yf men lye false arcyte somwhat must fayne whan false coueren traytorye ryght horse ye byte playne bare honde trecherye swore coude doublenesse espye al falsenesse hym ment thus swort thefe forthe waye went ala hert myght endure routh wo sorowe tell man hath connyng wyt might within chabre dwel rehersen shal hell suffreth fayre annelyda quene false arcyte dyd al thys tene wepeth wayleth swouneth pitously grounde deed falleth stone crampysheth lymmes crokedly speaketh wytte al agone colour ashen hath none ne none word speketh moch lite mercy cruel hert myne arcyte endureth tyl mate yt ne hath foote may sustene forth languyshyng euer estate arcyte hath neyther roth ne tene herte el newe grene wo ne deyneth nat thinke recketh neuer whether flete sinke thys newe lady holdeth hym narowe vp brydel staues ende euery worde dred arowe daunger made bowe bende lust made turne wende ne graunted lyuyng grace hath syng droue hym forth vnneth lyst knowe seruaunt vnto ladyshyp leste proude helde low thus serueth wythout meate syp sent nowe lande shyp yaue daunger al fyl therfore owne wyl ensample ye thrifty woman take hede annelyda false arcyte lyst dere herte call meke therfore loued lyte kynde mannes herte delyte thyng straung also god saue may get yt wold haue nowe turne annelyda ayen pyneth day day languyshyng whan saw ne gate geyn vpon day full soroufully wepyng cast make complaynyng wyth owne hand gan write sent theban knyght arcyte pthe complaynt annelyda false arcyte thyrled wyth ye poynt remembraunce swerde sorowe whet wt false plesauce myne hert bare blysse blacke hewe turned quakyng daunce suretie waped countenaunce syns auayleth nought ben trewe true shal rewe serueth loue doth obseruaunce alwaye one chaungeth newe wote selfe wel wyght loued one wt al myne hert myght selfe hundred syth called hertes lyfe knyght ferre ryght wha yt glad blyth disease deth swythe ayen trouth hath plyght euermore lady kythe nowe false ala causelesse wo routhlesse wt worde hym lyst one dayne brynge ayen sorowful hert pee caught vp lee ryght lyst laugheth payn ne myne hert restrayne loue hym yet alway neuerthelesse al playne shulde playne ala harde stound vnto fo yaue myne hert wound yet desyreth myne harme certes ferther wol neuer founde none helpe sore sounde desteny hath shaped full yore woll none medicine ne lore woll ben aye one bounde haue sayde sayde euermore ala become gentlenesse wordes full pleasaunce humblesse obseruaunce lowe manere awaytyng besynesse ye called maystresse souerayne lady worlde ala neyther worde ne chere ye vouchsafe vpon myne heuynesse ala loue bye dere certes swete though ye thus causelesse cause deedly aduersitie manly reason ought respyte slee frende namely neuer yet degree offended wisly wot wo soule quyte playne arcyte workes moche lyte besy delyte myne honour saue meke kynde free therfore ye put wyte ala ye retche myte though swerde sorowe byte wofull hert crueltie swete fo ye shame thynke ye ye furthred name loue anewe ben vntrue aye put slaundre blame aduersitie grame loue moost god thou wost alway yet turne ayen yet playne somedaye shal yt mys ben game foryeue whyle lyue maye lo hert myne al sayne whether shall praye el playne way done trewe eyther mote haue chayne deth ye mote depart v twayn beth none meane wayes newe god wysely soule rewe verely ye sleen payne mow ye sene vnfayned myne hew thus ferforth haue deth sought selfe murdre priuy thought sorowe routh vnkyndnesse wepe wayle fast al helpeth nought voyde ioye speke ought voyde company flye gladnesse may auaunt better heuynesse tha plyte haue ye brouyt without gylte nedeth wytnesse shulde pray weyuen womanhed nay rather deth foule dede aske mercy gyltlesse nede yf playne lyfe lede recketh yt knowe drede yf vnto myne othes bede myne excuse scorne shalbe mede chere floureth wyll sede ful longe agone myght haue take hede though morowe agayne myght well holde apryll rayne holde maken stedfast almyghty god trouth souerayne wher ye trouth man hath slayne yt hem loueth shal hem fynde fast tempest rotten mast tame beest aye fayne renne away whan lest agast mercy swete yf missay haue ought sayde way wyt away fare doth ye songe chaunteplure playne pley mased dey arcyte hath borne away key al worlde good auenture worlde ni creature walkyng discomfyture ne sorowe endure yf slepe furlonge way twey thynketh fygure stant clad asure efte profre newe assure ben true mercy prey longe nyght wondre syght ydrye day suche fraye dye al right nought twys ye retche ne neuermore myne eyen two ben drye routh trouth crye welaway ferre ben fetche thus holdeth destenie wretche rede drede gye ne may wyt weke stretche ende thus syth maye nomore yeue vp euermore shall neuer efte putten balaunce sykernesse ne lerne loue lore ye swan haue herde saye full yore ayenst deth woll synge penauce synge desteny chaunce arcyte annelyda sore hath thrilled wt poynt remembrauce whan anneleda wofull quene hath hande wrytten wyse face deed betwixt pale grene fell swoune sythe gan ryse vnto mar avoweth sacrifyce within temple sorowful chere shapen ye may playnly pexplicit pthe assemble ladyes septembre fallyng lefe fresh season togyther done corne gathered shefe garden ii none ther wer ladyes walking foure nobre mynde doth fall fyfth symplest hem gentlewoman fayre also disportyng hem eueryche gyse crosse alleyes walkyng two two alone fantasyese thus occupyed dyuers wyse yet trouth alone ther knightes squyres many one wherof serued one hem asked sayd ayen fell thought walke mase certayntie woman nothyng rought asked ayen sought colour pale forsoth therby lyth tale must wete anon tel let se make taryinge abyde ye ben hasty one let wete lytle thynge bycause ye haue great longyng desyre processe shal tell playne matere happed thus noone feloushyp one assent whan besynesses done passe tyme mase went toke wayes eche entent som wet inward wet gon stode ye mid loked soth say som wer full ferre behynde ryght anon ferforth best mased mynde alwaies wer good hem eest west thus went forth lytle rest corage dyd hem sore assayle wrath dyd step ouer ye rayle sought hem selfe fro gate selfe lytle auauntage forweryed myght ferther go thouy right great viage came forth strayte passage brouyt herber fayre grene made bench full crafty clene thought ther myght creature deuyse better due proporcioun safe closed well ensure masonry compasse enuyroun ful secretly stayres going doun myddes ye place wt turnyng whele certayne vpon pot margelayne margaretes growing ordinaunce shew hem self folke went fro beholde great pleasaunce accopanyed mo ne momblysnesse souenesse also poure pen disloged ne god wot place euery flore bench paued fayre smoth stone square many dyuers hewe well ioyned say soth al semed one none knewe vnderneth streames newe newe syluer bryght springyn wyse whece came ye coude deuyse lytle whyle alone beholdyng well delectable place felowship coming euerychone must abyde space remembryng many dyuers case tyme passed syghes depe set downe fell aslepe slept thought thercame gentlewoman metely stature great worshyp semed attyred well hygh measure countenaunce ful sad demure colour blewe vpon came mo selfe alone gowne wel enbraudred certaynly stone owne deuyse purfyl worde bien et loyalment coude deuyse prayde maner wyse name miyt haue remebrauce sayd called perseueraunce furthermore speake bolde wher dwelled prayed saye agayne full curtesly rolde dwellyng hath many day lady lady pray great estate thus warne call ye name loyaltie offyce stande ye degre wold wete right fayne vnworthye though chambre husher certayne rod beare token playne lyke ye knowe rule suche seruyce appertaynyng offyce charged comaundement warne felowes euerychone ye shuld come present counsayle shalbe anon seuen dayes comen gone furthermore bad shulde say excuse myght none delay thyng forget behynde wyse wolde ye knewe remebre well beare mynde felowes ye must come blewe euery lyche able matter sue pray thynke vpon wordes sleues euerychone abasshed maner wyse many ben suche hygh presence make request ye best deuyse gladly wyll gyue audience grefe maner offence wherin ye fele hert displeased wt helpe right sone ye shalbe eased right glad ye tell non v knoweth ye way way ye shal mys ye shal haue gyde day day felowes better say one shal tel ye way ful ryght dyligence gentlewoman hyght woman ryght famous gouernaunce well cheryshed tel certayne felowshyp shal great pleasaunce port suche maner true playne glad chere wyl besy payne bring farewel haue done abyde sayd ye may go sone haue ferre go yeue warnyng many dyuers place felowes mo wel ye wot haue lytle space yet ye must tel case yf shall men vnto v call one may come amonges one sayd eygh benedicite haue done pray tel lyfe trowe wel euer beleue somwhat say trouth questyons may nothyng large medle charge thus quod vnderstande place lady dwellynge forsoth one sought al lande fayrer none though kynge deuysed well euery thing toures hye full pleasaunt shal ye fynde phanes fresh turning wt euery wynde chambres parlers sorte wt bay windowes goodly may bethouyt daunsyng wyse disport galeryes ryght wel ywrought wel wot yf ye wer thyder brought take goodhede therof euery wyse ye wol thynke paradyse hight ye place say plesaunt regarde tel playne trouth quod wot ye may right well called certayne forthermore wold wyt riyt fayn shulde sone come may best enquere gentlewoman porter yate ther shal ye fynde name coutenauce yf ye hap ye come early late wer good haue som acquaintauce tel ye shal auaunce come ladyes presence wordes rede gyue credence tyme parte fro good fayth haue great busynesse wot ryght wel thanke great gentlenesse cofort hath yeuen hardynesse shal bolde withouten fayle aduyse good counsayle thus parted left alone sawe behelde asyde woman come goodly one forth withall espyde thought anon shulde gyde name anon dyd enquere ful womanly yaue answere symple creature sent fro court name diligence sone myght come ensure taryed lycence nowe come presence loke seruyce may comaunde say thanked prayed come nere bycause wolde se arayed gown blew dressed good maner deuyse worde also sayde tant que puis wel apayed wyst withouten full true herde though toke lytle space full good coude gesse farre haue vnto place dayes iourney quod lytle lesse wherfore rede outwarde dresse suppose felowshyp past nothing wold ye last tha departed ye springyng ye daye forth went soft easy pace tyl last iourney far outwarde yt myght se place let v rest lytle space saye deuoutly pater noster saynct iulyan herte assent good wyll moche better shal spede wha haue done tha taryed sayd euery dyl whan day past far none sawe place thyder came soone rounde closed wt wall semyng ful lyke hospitall ther foud one brought al myn aray gentlewoman myne acquayntaunce haue meruayle maner way ye knowlege al ordenaunce yes yes herde perseueraunce warned felowes euerychone aray ye shulde haue vpon loue praye syth ye haue take vpon payne ye wold helpe myne aray wit ye well wolde gone right fayn al prayer nedeth certayne agayne come hye sone ye shall se anon shalbe done dout greatly wot ye felowes passed gone warne nat shal assemble euerychone notwithstanding counsayl anone make redy tary nomore ytis harme though ye dressed myne araye asked whether wer well ryght well vnto paye ye nede care place euer ye go whyles debated came diligence sawe al bl sister ryght wel broke ye discretion purueyour went forth met auenture yonge woman offycer semyng name good creature discretion quod without lesynge abydynge haue quod office purchace chefe purueyour longeth place acquayntaunce herbyger fayre loue ordenaunce name herbyger forsoth name acquayntauce woman ryght gracious manere tha thus straugers haue ye fewe quod hygh degree ne lowe ye fyrst ferforth knowe countenaunce porter thus wt tale came streyght ye yate yonge woman departed gone came diligence knocked fast therate without countenaunce anone truly quod fayre syster one one therwithal lough diligence ye knowe wel ynough opened gate go wordes fayre sayd full gently ye welcome ywis ye mo one quod saue woman quod pray hertly take chambre whyle rest tyl felowes come holde best thanked forth go euerychon tyl chambre without wordes mo came diligence toke leue anon euer ye lyst quod may ye go thanke ryght hertely also labour god mede nomore iesu spede countenaunce asked anon felowship ben quod forsoth coming euerychone knowe certayntie without may hem wyndowe se wyl stande awayting euer amonge well wote wyll longe thus stode musyng full busily thought take good hede aray gowne blewe wot verely good fasion furred wel gray vpon sleue worde nay sayd thus penne endyte moy que ie voy written wt letter white forthwithal came streight wordes fayn wold yt knew forsoth quod ye shal wel knowe se word haue none trew ynough clothing blewe comaundement ryght wel content largesse stewarde tel pray hertely stuarde say name hyght largesse saye surely fayre lady ryght noble fame whan ye se ye wyl report vnder byd welcome belchier marshal hall whyle ye tary styl mater ye may wel haue mind tel haue ye brought byll yea yea quod el wer behynde one tel may fynde yt may shew mater playne surely vnto chambrelayne remembraunce chambrelayne chabrelayne quod saye ye trewe yea verely quod myne aduyse aferde vnto lowly sewe yt shalbe done quod ye deuyse ye must know name wyse truly shewe substaunce wtouten fayning name remebrauce secretarye may yet forget doth ryght moche euery thynge wherfore rede whan ye haue wt ymet mater hole tell without fayninge ye shall fynde ful good ful louyng tel name gentlenesse good soth quod auysenesse quod passyng good euery byll sedule must se good come stad ther stode felowes comyng yonder iape saye ye sothe quod iape nay nay say certayne se come togyder twayne twayne ye saye ful soth quod naye se commyng goodly company ben folke quod dare saye lyst loue thynke verely loue pray faythfully tyme whan vpon call ye woll good frende hem frendshyp shall mysse theyr ease put therto payne god yelde take shal know chabrelayne yt shal ye well knowe worde certayne word sister pray saye plus ne purroy thus wryteth alwaye thus stode togyther euen yate felowes eche one met hem thouyt goodly bade hem welcome one one came forth countenaunce anon full hertely fayre systers ye ryght welcome countrie counsayle take lytle rest chambre yf pleasaunce whan ye thynke best go call perseueraunce bycause acquayntaunce also wyll tell euery thynge ye shal ruled comyng felowes al one aduyse wel agreed lyke sayde began dresse v gyse folk shuld say wer vnpurueyd good wager amog v layde v attyred moost goodlyest v al shulde praysed best porter came brought perseueraunce welcomed v curtyse manere thynke ye longe youre attendaunce wol go speke vnto harbigere puruey lodging wyll go vnto chambrelayne speke yon come anone
