hem goodnesse trouthe syth fynd hem getilnesse trouth worshyp bounte kyndenesse euermore let neuer getilesse slouth kynde trouthe aught forlore woman hath ben ful yore reuerence heuens quene ought worshyp woman bene creature yt euer get borne wote ye well woman best recouered ye blysse yt lorn yt woman shal come rest ben ysaued yf selfe lest wherfore thynketh yf grace oughten honour woman euery place therfore rede lyues ende fro thys tyme forth whyle yt haue space haue trespaced pursue amende prayenge lady well grace brynge v vnto blysfull place good wome shal fere heuen aboue amonge angel clere pexplicit house fame god tourne v euerye dreme good woder thyng rood wytte causeth sweuenes morowe euenes effecte foloweth shall neuer come auysion thys reuelacyon thys dreme sweuen nat euery man lyche euen fantome oracle myracles cause knowe bette defyne certaynly ne hem nat ne neuer thynke busy wytte swynke knowe signifycations gendres ne distynctions tymes hem ne cause yeue folkes complexion make hem dreme reflexion el thus sayne great feblenesse brayne abstynence sycknesse pryson stryfe great distresse el dysordynaunce naturall accustomaunce men curyous studye melancolyous thus inly full drede man may hym bote rede el deuocion contemplacyon causen suche dremes ofte cruell lyfe vnsofte hem loues leden ofte hopen moche dreden purely impressyons causen hem haue visyons yf spyrites han myght make folke dreame nyght yf soule proper kynde perfyte men fynde wote come warneth eueryche auentures auysyons fygures flesshe hath myght vnderstande ryght warned derkely cause wote well worthe thys thynge clerkes treaten werkes none opynyon nyll nowe make mencyon holye rood tourne v euery dreame good neuer sythe borne ne man el beforne mette trowe stedfastly wonderfull dreame tenthe day nowe decembre whyche remembre woll tellen euery dele begynnyng trusteth wele woll make inuocation wyth deuoute specyall deuocyon vnto god slepe anone dwelleth caue stone vpon streme cometh fro lete fludde hell vnswete besyde fulke men clepe cymery slepeth aye god vnmery wyth hys slepy thousande sonnis alway slepe thys god rede praye woll spede sweuen tell ryght euery dreme stande hys myght mouer euer shall gyue hem ioye dreme yere stande al grace loues place hem leuest stonde shelde hem frome pouerte shonde frome euery vnhappe disease sende hem may hem please taketh well scorneth nought ne misdeme thought malycious entencion presumpcion hate scorne enuy dispyte ape felony mysdeme pray iesus good dreme barefote dreme shood euery harme man hath sythe worlde began befall hym therof sterne graunt may deserue lo wyth ryght suche conclusyon hys auisyon cresus kyng lyde hygh vpon gybet dyde prayer shall haue bette charyte nowe herken haue sayde mette abrayde decembre tenthe day whan nyght slepe lay right wonte doone fyll slepe wonder soone wery forgo pylgrimage myles two corp saynt leonarde maken lythe erst harde slepte mette wythin temple ymade glas whyche mo ymages golde standyng sondrie stage mo ryche tabernacle wyth perre mo pynnacles mo curyous portratures queynt maner fygures golde worke sawe euer certaynly nyst neuer well wyst venus redely temple purtreture sawe anone ryght fygure naked fletyng see also heed parde rose garlande whyte rede combe kembe hede dounes dan cupido blynde sonne vulcano hys face full browne romed vp downe founde wall thus written table bra woll nowe synge yf armes also man fyrst came hys destyne fugityfe fro troye countre itayle wyth full moche pyne vnto strondes lauyne tho began storie anone shall tellen echone fyrst sawe distruction troye greke synon wyth hys false vntrewe forswerynges wyth hys chere hys lesynges made horse brought troy whyche troyans loste ioy thys graued ala howe ilyons castell assayled wone kyng priamus slayne polytes hys sonne certayne dispytously dan pyrrus next sawe howe venus whan sawe castell brende downe frome heuen gan discende bade sonne eneas flye howe fledde howe escaped frome prees toke hys father olde anchyses bare hym hys backe away cryeng ala welaway whyche anchyses hys hande bare tho goddes lande thylke vnbrenned sawe next fere howe crusa dan eneas wyfe loued hys lyfe yonge sonne iulo eke askanyus also fledden eke wyth drery chere pyte forest went tournyng went howe crusa yloste ala rede nat howe howe sought howe goste bade hym slye grekes hoste sayd muste itayle hys destyne sauns fayle pyte whan spyrite gan appere wordes hym sayde kepe sonne hym prayde sawe grauen eke howe hys father eke hys meyne wyth hys shyppes gan sayle towarde countre itayle streyght myghten go sawe eke cruell iuno arte dan iupyters wyfe haste yhated thy lyfe troyan bloode ren crye thou woode eolus god wyndes blowen kyndes loude shulde drenche lorde lady grome wenche troyans nacyon wythout sauacion sawe suche tempest aryst euery herte myght agryse se paynted wall sawe eke grauen wyth venus howe ye lady dere wepynge wyth full wofull chere prayenge iupyter hye saue kepe nauye trogian eneas sythe sonne sawe ioues venus kysse graunted tempest lysse sawe howe tempest stente howe wyth pyne wente pryuely toke ryuage countre cartage morowe howe knyght hyght achate metten wyth venus day goyng queynte aray hunteresse wyth wynde blowyng vpon tresse howe eneas began playne whan knewe hys payne howe hys shyppes dreynt el ylost nyst howe gan hym comforte tho bade hym cartage go shulde hys folke fynde see lefte behynde shortly thys thyng pace made eneas grace dydo quene countre shortly tellen became hys loue let hym weddyng longeth shulde speke quaynte payne wordes paynte speke loue well nat nat faculte eke tellen manere howe fyrst acquaynted longe processe tell ouer longe dwell sawe graue howe eneas tolde dydo euery caas hym tyde vpon see efte grauen howe made hym shortly worde lyfe loue lust lorde dyd hym reuerence layde hym dispence woman myght wenyng swore hereby demed good suche semed ala harme dothe apparence whan false existence traytour wherfore slowe selfe ala lo howe woman dothe amys loue hym vnknowen christ lo thus fareth nat golde glareth also brouke well myne heed may vnder goodlyheed couered many shreude vyce therfore wyght nyce take loue onely chere speche frendly manere shall euery woman fynde man pure kynde wol shewen outwarde fayrest tyl haue caught lest woll cause fynde swere howe vnkynde false priuy double al thys saye eneas dydo nyce lest loued al soone gest wherfore wol saye prouerbe fully knoweth herbe maye safely laye hys eye wythoutyn drede thys lye let v speke eneas nowe betrayed ala lefte full vnkyndely whan sawe al vtterly wolde trouth fayle wenden itayle gan wrynge handes two ala quod wo ala euery man thus trewe euery yere wol haue newe longe tyme endure el parauenture thus one woll haue fame magnifyeng hys owne name another frenshyp sayth yet shal thyrde taken delyte lo el synguler profyte wordes gan complayne dydo great payne mette dremyng redyly none authour allege wol ala quod swete herte haue pyte sorowes smerte slee go away woful dydo welaway quod vnto selfe tho eneas wol ye loue ne bonde ye swore ryght honde ne cruel deth quod maye holde styl wyth haue ye deth pite iwys myne owne dere herte ye knowe full wel neuer yet farre euer wyt agylte thought ne dede haue ye men goodlyhede speche neuer dele trouth ala euer routh woman false man nowe se wel tel wretched woman arte certayne parte thus bene serued euerychone howe sore ye men grone anone haue receyued certaynly bene disceyued though loue lest season wayte vpon conclusyon eke howe ye determyne parte defyne welawaye borne name lorne myne actes redde songe ouer al thys lande euery tonge wycked fame ny nothynge swyfte lo soth euery thynge wyst though couerde myst eke though myght duren euer haue done recouer neuer ne shall sayd ala shamed eneas shal thus iuged lo ryght hath done nowe wol done eftesones hardely thus saye people priuely done ny done complaynt ne mone certayne auayled stre whan wyst sothly forth shyp agone chambre went anone called suster anue gan complayne thanne sayde cause fyrst loued ala fyrst counsayled therto whan thys sayd rofte seluen herte dyed woundes smerte al maner howe deyde al wordes howe seyde knowe hath purpose rede virgyle eneydos pystles ouyde wrote dyde nere longe endyte god wolde wryte welawaye harme routh hath betydde vntrouth men maye ofte bokes rede aldaye sene yet dede thynken tene lo demophon duke athenys howe forswore falsely trayed phyllis wyckedly kynges doughter thrace falsely gan terme pace whan wyst false honge selfe ryght halfe done suche vntrouth lo thys wo routh eke loke howe false recheles briseyda achilles parys oenone iason hipsyphile efte iason medea hercules dyanira lefte iolee made take deth parde howe false eke theseus storye telleth v howe betrayed adriane dyuel soules bane laughed yloured must haue bene al denoured adriane ne pyte made hym fro deth escape made full false iape thys wythin whyle lefte slepynge yle deserte alone ryght see stale awaye let toke suster phedra tho wyth gan shyp go yet sworne al euer coulde swere saued lyfe wolde taken wyfe desyred nothynge elles certayne boke v telles excuse thys eneas fullyche al greate trespas boke sayth sauns fayle goddes bade go itayle leauen affriques regioun fayre dydo towne tho sawe graue howe itayle dan eneas gan fayle howe tempest al began howe lost steresman whiche sterne kepe smote ouer borde slepe also saugh howe sybyle eneas besyde yle hel wente se father anchises fre howe founde palymurus also dido deiphebus eueryche tourment eke hel sawe whych longe tel whych paynes lyste knowe must rede many rowe virgyle claudian daunt tellen tho sawe eke al aryuayle eneas made itayle wyth kinge latyn trete batayls hym selfe knyghtes al ywon hys ryghtes howe turnus reste hys lyfe wan lauyna hys wyfe al merueylous sygnals goddes celestials howe maugre iuno eneas al sleyght compas atcheued hys auenture iupiter toke cure prayer venus whiche praye alwaye saue v v aye sorowes lyght whan sene al thys syght thys noble temple thus hey lorde thought madest v yet sawe neuer suche noblesse ymages suche rychesse se grauen church naught wote hem worche ne ne countre nowe wyll gone se ryght wyket yf sene ought steryng man maye tellen whan dore cam fast behelde sawe large felde farre euer myght se wythout towne house tre bushe grasse eared lande felde sande small men may se eye deserte lyby ne maner creature yformed nature ne sawe rede wysse christ thought art blysse fanton illusyoun saue deuocioun myne eyen heauen cast tho ware lo last falt sunne hye kenne myght wyth myne eye thought sawe egle sore semed muche egle yseyne thys soth deth certeyne golde shone bryght neuer sawe men suche syght yf heuen ywonne newe god another sunne shone egles fethers bryght somwhat downwarde gan lyght pexplicit liber primus nowe herken euerye maner man englyshe vnderstand lysteth dreame erst shal ye lere sely dredefull visyon saye neyther scipion ne kynge nabugodonosore pharao turnus ne alcanore ne metten dreame thys nowe fayre blysfull cipris fauour tyme ye tendyte ryme helpeth pernaso dwell besyde elycon clere well thought wrote met treasorye set brayne nowe shall men se vertue tell dreme ryght nowe kyth thy engyn thy myght thys egle haue tolde fethers shone al golde whiche hye gan sore gan beholde sene beaute wonder neuer dynte thonder ne thynge men call foudre smyte somtyme towre poudre hys swyfte commyng brende swyfte gan downwarde discende thys foule whan behelde rowme felde wyth grym pawes stronge wythin sharpe nayles longe flyeng swappe hente wyth sour agayne vp wente caryeng clawes starke lyghtly bene larke howe hye tellen yowe came vp nyst neuer howe astonyed asweued euery vertue heued wyth sour dreed felynge gan deed great affray thus longe clawes lay tyl last spake mannes voyce sayd awake agast shame callen tho name shulde better abrayde awake thus sayde right voice steuyn vseth one neuyn voice soth sayne mynde came agayne goodly sayd na neuer wonte withall gan stere fete bere tyl felt heate felte eke tho myne herte beate tho gan disporte wyth gentyll wordes comforte sayd twyse saynt mary thou arte noyous thynge cary nothynge nedeth perde also wyse god helpe thou harme shalte haue thys case betydde thy lore thy prowe lette se arst thou loke yet nowe ful ensured boldely thy frende therwith gan wonder mynde god quod madest al kynde shal none otherwyse dye whether ioue wyll stellyfye thynge may signifye neyther enocke ne helye ne romulus ne ganemede bore vp men rede heuen dan iupiter made goddes boteler lo tho fantasye bare gan espy thought sayde thou demest thy selfe amys ioue aboute dare put ful doute make yet sterre er bere moche ferre wyl tel whyther thou shalte cam thou take good herte fere quake gladly quod nowe wel quod first fete haue thou hast feare wonder dwellyng wyth god thonder whych men callen iupiter doth styen ful ofte fer al thys commaundement thys cause hathe sent herke nowe thy trouth certayne hath routh thou hast truely longe serued ententyfely hys blynde neuewe cupido fayre venus also wythout guerdon euer yet netheles hast set thy wyt although thy heed full lytle make bokes songes ditees ryme el cadence thou best canst reuerence loue hys seruauntes eke haue seruyce sought seke paynest prayse arte although thou haddest neuer parte wherfore also god blesse iouis halte great humblesse vertue eke thou wylt make nyght full ofte thyne heed ake thy studye thou wrytest euermore loue endytest honour praysynges hys folkes furtherynges matter al deuysest hym ne folke dispisest although thou mayst go daunce hem hym lyst auaunce wherfore sayd ywys iupiter consydereth wel thys also beausyre thynges thou hast tydynges loues folke yf glade ne nothynge el god made onely fro farre countre tydynges comen thy neyghbours dwellen almoost thy dores thou herest neyther ne thys whan thy labour al done hast made thy rekenynges stede rest newe thynges thou goest home thyne house anone also dombe stone thou syttest another boke tyl fully dased thy loke lyuyst thus hermyte although thyne abstinence lyte therfore iouis hys grace wyl bere place whiche hyght house fame sporte game recompensatioun thy labour deuotioun thou hast lo causeles god cupido recheles thus thys god hys meryte wyl wyth maner thynge quyte thou wylte good chere trust well thou shalt whan comen saye mo wonder thynges dare laye loues folke mo tydynges sothsawes leasynges mo loues newe begon longe serued tyl loue mo louers casuelly bene betydde man wote blynde man starteth hare iolyte welfare whyle fynde loue stele thynke men ouer wele mo discordes mo ialousyes mo murmures mo nouelryes also mo dissimulacions eke feyned reperations mo berdes two houres wythout rasour sysoures ymade graynes sandes eke mo holdyng mo handes also mo renouelaunces olde forleten acqueyntaunces mo louedayes mo accordes instumentes bene cordes eke loue mo exchaunges euer corne graunges vnneth mayst thou trowen thys quod helpe god wy quod quod impossible wyt though fame pyes al realme al espyes howe yet shulde al thys espyen yes yes quod preue reason worthy leue thou gyue thyne aduertence vnderstande sentence fyrst shal thou dwelleth ryght thyne owne boke telleth palays standeth shall say ryght euen amyddes way bytwene heuen erth see euer thre spoken pryue apperte way therto ouerte stante eke iuste place euery sowne mote pace cometh tonge rowned redde songe spoken surete drede certayne mote thyther nede nowe herken wel wyl tellen proper skyl worthy demonstration myne ymaginacyon geffray thou wottest wel thys euery kyndly thynge hath kyndly stede maye best conserued vnto whiche place euery thynge kyndly enclynynge meueth come whan awaye therfro thus lo howe thou mayst al day se take thynge heuy stone leed thyng weyght bere neuer hye heyght let go thyne hande falleth downe ryght say fyre sowne smoke thynges lyght alwaye seke vpwarde heyght lyght thyngs vp downwarde charge whyle eueryche hem large thys cause thou mayst well se euery ryuer vnto see enclyned go kynde skylles fynde haue fyshes dwellyng flode see tree eke erth thus euery thynge hys reason hath owne proper mansion whiche seketh repeyre shulde appeyre lo thys sentence knowen couth euery philosopher mouth aristotle dan platone clerkes many one confirme reasoun thou wost wel speche sowne el man might nowe herke wyl lere sowne eyre ybroken euery speche spoken loude pryue foule fayre hys substaunce eyre flame lyghted smoke ryght sowne eyre ybroke thys maye many wyse whych wyl deuyse sowne cometh pype harpe whan pype blowen sharpe eyre twyst wyth violence rent lo thys sentence eke whan men harpe strynges smyte whether muche lyte lo wyth stroke eyre breketh ryght breketh whan men speketh thus wost thou well thing speche nowe hensforth wyl teche howe euery speche voyce sowne throughe multiplycacyowne thoughe pyped mouse mote nedes come fame house proue thus take hede nowe experience yf thou threwe water nowe stone well wost thou wyl make anone lytle roundle cercle parauenture brode couercle ryght anone thou shalte se well whele cercle wyl cause another whele thyrde forthe brother euery cercle causynge broder hym selfe thus fro roundel compas eche aboute goynge causeth others sterynge multeplyeng euermo tyl farre go bothe brynkes al thoughe thou may se aboue yet gothe alway vnder though thou thynke greate wonder saythe trouthe vary bydde hym proue contrary right thus euery worde ywys loud pryue yspoken moueth first eyre aboute mouynge doute another eyre anone moued haue water proued euery cercle causeth right eyre leue brother eueryche eyre stereth speche vp bereth voyce noyse worde sowne aye multiplicatiowne tyl house fame take ernest game nowe haue tolde yf thou haue mynde howe speche sowne pure kynde enclyned vpwarde meue thys mayst thou fele well preue stede ywys euery thynge enclyned hath hys kyndlyche stede seweth wythout drede kyndly mancyoun euery speche euery soun eyther foule fayre hath hys kynde place eyre syth euery thynge ywys hys kynde place ywys moueth thyder go awaye therfro haue proued seweth euery soune perde moueth kyndly pace vp kynde place thys place tell fame lyst dwell sette myddes thre heuen erth eke see moost conseruatyfe soun thys conclusyoun euery speche euery man tell fyrst began meueth vp heyght pace kyndly fame place tel nowe faythfully haue proued thus symply wythout subtylte speche great prolixite termes philosophie fygures poetrie colour rethoryke perde ought lyke harde langage harde matere encombrous one wost thou well thys answered sayd yes ha ha quod lo leudly vnto leude man speke shewe hym suche skyylles maye shake hem bylles palpable shulden tell thys nowe praye howe thynketh conclusyon good persuasyon quod lyke ryght thou hast proued god quod leue thou shalte haue yet eue euery worde thys sentence profe experience wyth thyne eares heren well toppe tayle euery dell euery worde spoken cometh fame house ywys haue sayde wylte thou wyth thys worde vpper sore began sayde saynt iame nowe wyll speke game howe farest thou nowe quod well quod nowe se quod thy trouth yonde adowne thou knowest towne house thynge whan thou hast aught knowynge loke thou warne anone shall tel howe farre thou arte nowe therfro adowne gan loken tho behelde feldes playns nowe hylles nowe mountayns nowe valeys nowe forestes nowe vnneth great beestes nowe ryuers nowe citees nowe townes nowe great tree nowe shippes saylyng see thus soone whyle flowen fro grounde hye al worlde myne eye semed pricke el eyre thycke might deserne spake yerne sayde seest thou token aught worlde spoken sayde nay wonder quod neuer halfe hye na alexander macedon kyng ne rome dan scipion sawe dreme poynt deuyse heuen erth hel paradyse ne eke wretche dedalus ne chylde nyce icharus flewe hye hete wynges molte fel wete mydde see dreynte made great complaynte nowe tourne vpwarde quod thy face beholde large space eyre loke thou ne adrad hem thou shalt se region certeyne dwelleth many cytezeyne whiche speketh dan plato ben eyrysshe beestes lo tho sawe al menye bothe gone also flye lo quod caste vp thyne eye seyonder lo galaxye whiche men clepe mylky way whyte perfay callen watlynge strete one brente hete whan sonnes sonne reade hyte pheton wolde leade gate father carte gye carte horse gan well espye coude gouernaunce gan lepe praunce beare hym vp downe tyll sawe scorpiowne heuen sygne yet feare lost wyt let reynes gone horse anone sone vp mount downe discende tyll eyre erth brende tyll iupiter lo last hym slewe fro carte cast lo great myschaunce let foole haue gouernaunce thynges demayne worde soth sayne gan alway vpper sore gladed faythfully spake tho gan loke vnder behelde eyrysh beestes cloudes mystes tempestes snowes hayles raynes wyndes gendryng kyndes waye came god quod made adam moche thy myght noble tho thought vpon boece wryteth thought may flye hye fethers philosophye passen eueryche element whan hath farre ywent may sene behynde bake cloude erth spake tho gan wexe sayde wot wel whether body ghost ywys god thou woost clere entendement na neuer yet ysent thought marcyan eke anteclaudian soth description heauens regyon farre sawe preue therfore hem leue egle gan crye let quod thy fantasye wylt thou lere sterres ought nay certaynly quod ryght nought quod olde el wolde haue tolde quod starres name lo heuens sygnes force yes parde quod wost thou whan thou redest poetrye goddes stellyfy byrde fysh hym rauyn ariones harpe fyne castor polexe delphyne athalantes doughters seuen set heuen though thou haue hem oft hande yet nost thou nat stande force quod nede well leue god spede hem wryten matere though knewe place eke thy seluen bryght shoulde shenden syght loke hem maye wel quod forthe bare whyle tho began crye neuer herde thynge hye holde vp thyne heed well saynct iulyan lo bonne hostel se house fame lo mayest thou quod great sowne quod rombleth vp downe fame house full tydynges fayre speche chydynges false soth compowned herken well rowned hearest thou great swough yes perde quod well ynough sowne lyke quod peter lyke beatyng see quod agaynst roches holowe whan tempestes done shyppes swalow man stande dout myle thence route el lyke humblyng clappe thundrynge whan iouis hath eyre ybete doth feare swete nay drede therof quod nothyng wyll byten thou shalt haue harme truly worde nygh place aryued men myght cast spere nyst strete set fayre fete sayde walke forth pace tell thyne aduenture case thou shalt fynde fame place quod whyle haue space speke go fro loue god tell soth wyll lere yf noyse haue herde tell folke downe erth dwell cometh wyse herde deuyse lyues body ny house yonder maketh loude fare quod saynct clare also wysse god rede thynge wyl warne thou wylt haue wonder lo house fame yonder thou wost cometh euery speche nedeth efte teche vnderstande ryght well whan speche ycomen vp palays anon ryght wexeth lyke wyght worde erth spake clothed red blake hath lykenesse spake worde thou wylt gesse body man womon wonder thynge yes quod tho heuen kynge worde farewel wyll abyde god heuen sende grace good lerne place hym toke leaue anone gan forth palayes gone pexplicit liber secundus god scyence lyght apollo throughe thy great myght thys lytle last booke thou gye wyll maystrye art potentiall shewde ryme lyght lewde yet make somwhat agreable though verse fayle syllable diligence shewe craft sentence yf deuyne vertue thou wylt helpe shewe nowe heed ymarked lo meanen house fame discryue thou shalt se go blyue vnto next laurer se kysse thy tree entre brest anone whan egle gone gan beholde vpon place certayne forther pace woll shappe deuyse house cytie wyse gan place approche stode vpon hye roche hyer standeth none spayne vp clambe moche payne though clymbe greued yet ententyfe se pooren wondre lowe yf coude anywyse yknowe maner stone roche lyke lymed glas shone full clere congeled matere nyst redely last espyed fonde euery dele roche yse stele thought saynt thomas kent feble foundement buylden place hye ought hym lytle glorifye heron buylte god saue tho sawe hall ygraue famous folkes name fele bene moche wele fame wyde yblowe well vnneth myght knowe letter rede name drede almoost thawed letter one two molte away euery name vnfamous wexe fame men say maye euer last tho gan myne hert cast molte away hete away stormes bete syde sey hyll northwarde ley wrytten ful name folke afore great fame olde tyme yet fresh men wrytten hem selfe day houre hem gan poure well wyst made conserued shade wrytyng sye castell stode hye stode eke colde place heate myght deface tho gan hyll gone founde coppe wone men ben lyue ne han connyng discryue beautie ylke place ne coude cast compace suche make myght beautie make ne wondrely ywrought astonyeth yet thought maketh wyt swynke castell thynke great beautie cast craft curiositie ne deuyse wyt ne may suffyse nathelesse substaunce haue yet remembraunce thought saynct gyle al stone beryle castell toure eke hall euery boure without peces ioynynges many subtell compassynges babeuries pynnacles ymageries tabernacle sawe full eke wyndowes flake fallen great snowes eke eche pynacles sondrye habytacles stoden withouten full castell abouten maner mynstrales iestours tellen tale wepyng game longeth vnto fame herde play harpe sowned well sharpe hym orpheus full craftely syde fast satte harper orion gacides chirion harper many one briton glaskyrione smal harper glee sat vnder dyuers see gon hem vpwarde gape countrefayted hem ape crafte countrefayte kynde tho sawe standen hem behynde afarre hem hem selue many thousande tymes twelue made loude mynstralsyes cormuse shalmyes many pype craftely began pype dou ed rede bene feestes brede many floyte lytlynge horne pypes made grene corne haue lytle herde gromes kepen beestes brome ther sawe dan cytherus athene dan proserus mercia lost skynne face body chynne wolde enuyen pypen bette apollo sawe eke famous olde yonge pypers dutche tonge lerne loue daunces sprynges keyes straunge thynges tho sawe place standyng large space hem maken blody soun trumpe beme claryoun fyght blood sheddynges vsed gladly clarionynges herde trumpe messenus speketh virgilius herde ioab trumpe also theodomas mo vsed clarion casteloygne aragon tymes famous lernen sawe trumpen sawe syt see playing vpon sondry glee neuen mo starres ben heuen nyl ryme ease losse tyme tyme ylost knowe ye way maye recouered sawe playing iuggelours magyciens tragitours phetonysses charmeresses olde wytches sorceress vsen exorsisacions eke subfumigacions clerkes eke conne well magyke naturell craftely entente maken certayne ascendentes ymages lo magyke maken man ben hole seke sawe quene medea cyrces eke caliophia sawe hermes ballenus lymote eke symon magus sawe knewe name suche arte done men haue fame sawe coll tragetour vpon table sycamour playe vncouth thyng tell sawe hym cary wynde mell vnder walnote shale shulde make lenger tale al people sey coude tell tyll domisdey whan folke beholde founde lose holde amused longe whyle vpon wall beryle shone lyghter glas made well kynde thyng fame anon gan forth comen tyll fonde castell yate ryght honde wel coruen neuer suche another na yet auenture ywrought great subtyll cure nedeth tellen make longe dwellen yates floryshynges ne compaces ne karuynges ne hackyng masonryes corbettes ymageryes lorde fayre shewe golde behewe went anone met cry many one large large holde vp well god saue lady pell owne gentle lady fame hem wyllen haue name v thus herde cryen fast comen hall shoke noble starlynges crowned kynges crownes wrought full losynges many rybans many frynges clothes truly tho last espyed purseuauntes heraudes cryen ryche folkes laudes euery man hem tell hym throwe vesture men clepe cote armure embroudred wonderly ryche though ylyche nought wyl mote thryue discryue armes thus cote impossyble men myght make hem byble twenty fote thycke trowe certayne whoso coulde knowe myght armes sene famous folke affrike europe asye syth fyrst began cheualrye lo shulde tell ne hall eke nede tellen euery wall e rofe flore withall plated halfe fote thycke golde na wycke proue wyse fyne ducket venyse lyte pouche set thycke ouches fyne fynest stone fayre men reden lapidayre grass growen mede longe rede name therfore pace lustye ryche place fame hall called full moche prees folke na ne croudyng moche prees hye aboue dees satte see imperial made ruby royall carbuncle ycalled sawe perpetually ystalled femynine creature neuer formed nature suche thyng say altherfyrst soth say thought lyte length cubyte lenger semed thus soone whyle selfe tho wondderly streyght fete therth reyght heed touched heuen shyneth sterres seuen therto yet wyt sawe great wonder yet vpon eyen beholde certaynly hem neuer tolde fele eyen fethers vpon foules beestes foure god trone honour wryteth iohn apocalyps heere owndy cryps burned golde shone se soth tellen also also fele vp standyng eares tonges beest ben heeres sete woxen sawe partriche wynges redely lorde perry rychesse sawe syttynge goddesse heuenly melody songes full armony herde trone ysonge pallayes wall tonge songe myghty muse cleped caliope seuen systerne eke face semen meke euermore eternally songe fame tho herde heryed thou thy name goddes renoun fame tho ware last myne eyen gan vp cast ylke noble quene shulders gan sustene armes name tho large fame alysandre hercules sherte lyfe dyd lese founde syttyng goddesse noble honour rychesse stynt whyle nowe thyng tellen tho sawe stande thother syde streyght downe dores wyde dees many pyllere metall shone full clere though rychesse yet made great noblesse hem great sentence olke hye digne reuerence tell wyll sonde vpon pyller sawe stonde alderfyrst sye vpon pyller stonde hye lede yron fyne hym secte saturnyne ebrayke iosephus olde iewes gestes tolde bare shulders hye fame vp iurye hym stoden seuen wyse worthy neuen helpen hym bere vp charge heuy large wryten batayles well maruayles therfore lo pyllere tell leed yron ywys yron marces metall god battayle leed withouten fayle lo metall saturne hath full large whele turne stande forth eyther rowe hem coude knowe though ordre hem tell make longe dwell thes gan rede sawe stande drede vpon yron pyller stronge paynted al endlonge tygres bloud euery place tholason hyght stace bare thebe vp name vpon shulders fame also cruell achylles hym stode withouten lee full wonder hygh vpon pyller yron great omer hym dare titus eke lollius guydo eke de colempnis englysh galfride eke ywys eche haue ioy busy beare vp troy heuy therof fame beare game yet gan full well espye betwene hem lytle enuy one sayde omer made lye feynyng poetryes grekes fauourable therfore helde fable tho sawe stande pyllere tynned yron clere latyn poete virgyle hath bore vp longe whyle fame pius eneas next hym pyller copper venus clerke ouyde hath sowen wonder wyde great god loues fame bare vp well name vpon pyller al hye myght se myne eye hall whereof rede woxe heyght length brede wel thousande de e erst sawe wele tho sawe pyller yron wrought full sternely great poete dan lucan shulders bare vp hye myght se fame iulyus pompee hym stoden clerkes wryte rome mighty werkes yf wolde name tell longe must dwell nexte hym pyller stode sulphure lyche wode dan claudian sothe tell bare vp fame hell pluto proserpyne quene derke pyne shulde tell thys hall full ywis hem wryten olde iestes ben e toke nestes full confuse matere iestes wryte hewe hyght whyle behelde thys syght herde noyse approchen blyue fareth bee done hyue agaynst tyme flyenge ryght suche maner murmurynge worlde semed tho gan loke aboute se come entrynge hall ryght great company wythall sondry regyons kyns condicyons dwell erthe vnder moone poore ryche also soone come hall gan knee downe fall thys ylke noble quene sayd graunt v lady shene eche v thy grace aboue hem graunted soone warned well fayre graunted contrayre askynge vtterly thys say trewly grace nyst folke full well wyst good fame eche deserued though dyuersly serued ryght syster dame fortune wonte serue commune nowe herken howe gan paye hem gan grace praye yet lo thys company seyden sothe lye madame sayde folke besechen thou graunt v nowe good fame let workes haue good name full recompensacioun good worke gyue v good renoun warne anone ye gete good fame none god therfore go way ala welaway tell v cause may lyste wyght shall speke ywis good ne harme ne ne wyth worde gan cal messenger hal bad shulde fast gone vpon payne blynde anone eolus god wynde trace ye shall hym fynde byd hym brynge clarioun full dyuers hys sowne cleped clere laude wyth whiche wont heraude hem lyst ypraysed also byd hym howe brynge eke hys claryoun hyght sclaundre euery towne wyth whyche wont diffame hem lyst hem shame messenger gan fast gone founde caue stone countre heght trace thys eolus wyth harde grace helde wyndes distresse gan hem vnder hym presse gone beres rore bounde pressed hem sore thys messenger gan fast crye ryse vp fast hye tyll thou lady take thy clarion eke wyth spede fast anone toke one hyght tritone hys clarion beren tho let certayne wynde go blewe hydously hye ne lefte skye welken longe brode thys eolus abode tyll come fame fete eke man triton hete stode styll stone wythall came anone another huge company good folke gan crye lady graunt v nowe good fame let workes haue name nowe honour gentylnesse also god soule blesse han well deserued therfore ryght quyt thryue ye shall fayle good workes shall auayle haue good fame nowe wote ye graunt yowe ye shall haue shrewde name wycked loo worse fame thoughe ye good loo haue well deserued nowe gothe way ye ben serued thou dan eolus take forthe thy trumpe anone let se ycleped sclaundre lyght blowe loo euery wyght speke hem harme shrewdnesse stede good worthynesse thou shalte trumpe contrayre haue done well fayre ala thought auentures haue sory creature amonge prees shulde thus shamed gyltles must nedes dyd eolus toke hys blacke trumpe bra fouler deuyll gan trumpe blowe worlde sholde ouerthrowe throughout euery regioun wente foule trumpes soun yfte pellet gonne whan fyre pouder ronne suche smoke gan wende foule trumpes ende blacke blo grenysshe swartyshe rede dothe men melte lede lo hye tewell therto one thynge sawe well ferther ranne greter wexen began dothe ryuer frome well stanke pyt hell ala thus shame yr nge gyltlesse euery tonge tho came thyrde company gone vp dees hye downe knee fell anon sayden ben euerychon folke han full trewly deserued fame ryghtfully prayde myght knowe ryght forthe blowe graunt nowe lyste good workes shall wyst yet ye shall haue better loo ryght dispyte foos worthy anone lette nowe thy trumpe gone thou eolus blake thyne trumpe take hyght laude blowe wolde fame go easely nat fast knowen last full gladly lady myne sayde hys trumpe golde brayde anone sette hys mouthe blewe eest west southe northe loude thonder euery wyght hath wonder brode ran stene certes brethe went hys trumpes mouthe smelde men potte full baume helde amonge basket full rose fauour dyd loses ryght wyth gan espy came fourth company certayne wonder fewe gonne standen rewe sayden certes lady bright haue done well wyth oure myght ne kepe haue fame hyde workes name goddes loue certes haue surely done bounte maner thyng graunt askyng let workes deed wyth aboute tourned heed sawe anon fyfte route thys lady gan loute downe knee anone fall tho besoughten hyden good werkes eke sayd yeue nat leke fame ne suche renoun contemplacioun goddes loue wrought ne fame wolde nought ye woode wene ye good haue fame haue ye dispyte haue name nay ye shall lyen euerychone blowe thy trumpe anone thou eolus hote rynge folkes workes note worlde may gan blowe loo clere hys golden clartoun worlde went soun kyndly eke softe theyr fame blowe lofte tho came syxt companye gan fast fame crye ryght verily thys manere sayden mercy lady dere tell certayne haue done neyther ne thys ydell lyfe hath nathelesse yet pray may haue good fame great renome knowen name haue noble iestes acheued questes well loue thyng v neuer broche ne ryng ne el fro woman sent ne one herte yment maken v onely frendly chere mought temen v bere yet let v people seme suche worlde may v deme woman louen v woode shall v moche good herte moche auayle counterpeyse ease trauayle wone wyth labour dere bought honoure regarde great ease yet ye muste v please let v holde eke therto worthy wyse good also ryche happy vnto loue goddes loue sytteth aboue though may nat body haue woman yet god saue lette men glewe v name suffyseth haue fame graunt trouthe nowe eolus wythouten slouthe take thy trumpe golde blowe haue asked euery man wene hem ease though go full badde lease thys eolus gan blowe worlde yknowe tho came seuenth route anone fyll knee euerychone sayd lady graunt v soone thyng boone next folke haue done fye euerychone ye masty swyne ye ydel wretch full roten slowe tet ches false theues ye wolde ben famed good nothyng nolde deserue ne neuer thought men rather hangen ought ye lyke slepy catte wolde haue fysh wost thou woll nothyng wete hys clawes yuell thrifte come iawes myne yf graunt fauour auaunt thou eolus thou kyng trace go blowe folke sory grace anone wost thou howe shall tell ryght nowe say ben wolde honour haue kyns labour ne good yet haue laude men wende beelle isaude ne coude hem nat loue werne yet grynt querne al good ease herte eolus anon vp sterte blacke clarion gan blasen soun lounde belleth wynde hel eke therwith sothe tel sowne ful iapes euer mowes ape went al worlde aboute euery wight gan hem shoute laugh wode suche game founde hode tho came another company ydone trechery harme great wickednesse herte couden gesse prayed haue good fame nolde hem shame gyue hem loo good renoun blowe claryoun nay wy quod vyce al iustyce lyst nat nowe ne nyl graunt tho came leapyng route gan clappen al aboute euery man vpon crowne al hall gan sowne sayd lady lete dere ben suche folkys ye may tel al tale ryght ben shrewes euery wyght haue delyte wickednesse good folke haue goodnesse ioye knowen shrewes ful vyce wicked thewes wherfore praye rowe fame suche yknowe al thing ryght graunt quod ywys arte thou sayest tale wearest thy hose pale thy typpet suche bell madame sothe tell ylke shrewe ywis brent temple isydis henes lo cyte wherfore dyddest thou trouthe madame wolde sayne haue name folke towne although great renowne vertue thewes thought great fame haue shrewes though naught shreudnesse good folke haue goodnesse sythen may nat haue one nyll nat forgone get fame temple sette fyre nowe loo blowe swythe wysly thou euer blythe gladly thou eolus herest thou prayen v madame yes full well wyll trumpen parde toke hys blacke trumpe fast gan puffen blaste tyll worldes ende wyth gan aboute wende one stode ryght bake thought full goodly spake sayd frende thy name arte thou come hyder haue fame nay sothe frende come nat hyther grant mercy suche cause heed suffyseth deed wyght haue name honde wote selfe best howe stonde drie thynke woll selfe drynke certayne parte ferforthe myne arte doest thou woll tell cause stande newe tydynges lere newe thyng tydinges eyther thys loue suche thynges glade certaynly made come hyder sayd shulde bothe se place wonder thynges suche tidynges ment answerde parde well wote euer yet sythe fyrst wyt folke han desyred fame diuersly loo name certaynly nyst howe ne fame dwelled nowe ne eke discripcion ne also condycion ne order dome knewe nat tyll hyder come lo tydynges thou nowe hyther brynges thou haste herde nowe force well se thou desyrest lere come forthe stande lenger woll wythout drede suche another place lede thou shalt many one tho gan forthe wyth hym gone castell sothe sey tho sawe stande valey vnder castell faste house domus dedaly laborintus ycleped na made wonderly iwys ne halfe queyntly ywrought euermo swyfte thought thys queynt house aboute went neuermo styll stent came great noyse stonde vpon oyse men myght haue herde easely rome trowe sikerly noyse whyche herde worlde ryght ferde dothe routyng stone fro thengyn letyn gone thys house whyche rede made twygges falowe rede grene eke whyte suche men cage twhyte maken panyers el hutch dosser swough twygges thys house also full gygges also full eke chyrkynges many workynges eke house hath entree many leues ben tree sommer whan ben grene rofe yet men may sene thousande hole well mo letten sowne go day euery tyde ben dores open wyde nyght eche one vnshette ne porte none lette maner tidynges pace ne neuer rest place ny fylled full tidynges eyther loude whysperynges euer house angle full rownynges iangles werres peace maryages restes labour vyages abode dethe lyfe loue hate accorde stryfe losse lore wynnynges heale sycknesse lesynges fayre wether eke tempestes qualme folke beestes dyuers transmutacions estate eke regyons trust dred ialousy wytte wennyng foly plentie great famyne chepe derthe ruyne good misgouernment fyre dyuers accydent lo house whiche write syker ye na nat lyte sixtie myle length al tymbre strength yet founded endure whyle lyst auenture mother tydinges see welles springes shapen lyke cage certes quod al myn age ne sawe suche house wondred ywis vpon house tho ware howe myne egle faste perched hye vpon stone gan streight hym gone sayd thus pray thou whyle abyde goddes loue let sene wonder place bene yet peraunter may lere good therin somwhat lefe went peter nowe myn entent quod therfore dwel certayne one thyng tel bringe therin ne shal thou neuer conne gyn come doute faste whyrieth lo aboute sythe ioues grace haue sayd wyl solace finally thynges vncouthe syghtes tidynges passe thyne heuynesse suche routhe hath thy distresse thou suffredest debonairly woste thy seluen vtterly desperate al blysse sythe fortune hath made mysse swote al thyn hertes rest languysshe eke poynte brest myghtie meryte wyl ease al lyte aue expresse conmaundement whyche obedyent forther wyth myght wysse teche ryght thou mayste moste tidynges thou shalte many one lere wyth thys worde ryght anone hent vp bytwene hys tone wyndowe brought thys house thought wythall thought stent nothyng aboute went sette floore adoun suche great congregacioun folke sawe rome aboute wythin wythout na neuer sene ne shall efte certes thys worlde ny lefte many formed nature ne deed many creature well vnneth place foote brede space euery wyght sawe rowned eueryche others cere newe tydynge pryuely el tolde openly ryght thus sayde nost nat thou tydde lo ryght nowe tel tolde hym thys swore therto sothe thus hath sayde thus dothe thys shall thus herde say shall founde dare laye folke lyue ne haue connyng discryue tho thynges herde loude eere wonder moste thys whan one herde thyng ywis came streyght another wyght gan hym tellen anon ryght hym tolde furlonge way olde gan somwhat eche thys tydyng thys speche euer spoken nat sone departed na tho fro hym ne mette wyth thyrde er lette stounde tolde hym alse tydynges sothe false yet wolde tell natheles euer mo wyth encrees erst thus northe southe went euery tydyng fro mouthe mouthe encreasyng euermo fyre wonte quycken go frome sparcle sprongen amys tyll cyte brent vp whan full vp spronge waxen euerye tonge euer went anone vp wydowe gone myght passe gan crepe creuasse flewe forthe faste none somtyme sawe one leasynge sadde sothe sawe gonnen auenture drawe wyndowe pace whan metten place checked bothe two neyther hem myght go eche gonne croude tyll eche hem gan cryen loude let gon fyrst nay let woll ensuren wyth none thou wolte shall neuer fro go thyne owne sworne brother woll meddle v eche man neuer wrothe shall haue one two bothe one besyde hys leue come amorowe eue cryde styll yrowned thus sawe false sothe compowned togyder flye tydynge thus hole gonne wrynge euerye tydynge streyght fame gan yeue eche hys name dysposycion yeue hem eke duracion wexe wane soone dothe fayre whyte moone let hem gone myght seen wynged wonder faste flyen twenty thousande route eolus hem blewe aboute lorde thys house tymes full shypmen pylgrymes wyth scryppes brette full leasynges entremelled wyth tidynges eke alone hem selue many thousande tymes twelue sawe eke pardoner currours eke messangers wyth box crommed full lye euer vessell wyth lye alther fastest wente aboute dyd myne entent playen lere eke tydynge herde countre shall nowe tolde nede redely folke synge bet mote late rathe sheues rathe herde great noyse wythall corner hall men loue tydynges tolde gan thyderwarde beholde sawe rennynge euery wyght faste hadden myght eueryche cryde thynge sayd neuer hepe tho behynde gonne vp lepe clamben vp faste vp noyse hyghen caste treden faste others heles stampe men done eles laste sawe man whych naught ne semed man great authorite therwythall abrayde slepe halfe afrayde remembrynge well sene howe hye ferre bene goost great wonder god thonder let knowen began wryte lyke ye haue herde endyte wherfore studye rede alwaye purpose daye daye thus dreamynge game endeth thys lytell boke fame phere foloweth testament loue testament loue many men bene wyth eeres openly sprad moche swalowen deliciousnesse iestes ryme queynte knyttynge coloures goodnesse badnesse sentence take lytell hede el none sothelye dull wytte thoughtfull soule sore haue myned grassed spirites suche crafte endytynge woll ben myne acquayntaunce rude wordes boystous percen herte herer inrest poynte planten sentence thynges wyth lytell helpe able sprynge thys boke nothynge hath greate floode wyt ne semelych colour doluen wyth rude wordes boystous drawe togyther maken catcher herof ben redy hent sentence men ben peynten wyth colour ryche wyth vers wyth red ynke wyth cole chalke yet good matere leude people thilke chalky purtreiture hem thinketh tyme afterwarde syght better colour yeuen hem ioy fyrst leudnesse sothly thys leude cloudye occupacion prayse leude comenly leude leudnesse comendeth eke shal yeue sight precious thinges shalbe reuerence latyn french hath many soueraine wyttes gret delyte endyte haue many noble thynges fulfylde certes ben yt speken theyr poysy mater frenche whyche speche frenche men haue good fantasye haue hearyng french mennes englyshe many termes ben englyshe whych vnneth englyshmen connen declare knowlegynge howe shulde frenche man borne termes conne iumpere hys mater iaye chatereth englyshe ryght truly vnderstandynge englyshmen woll stretche priuy termes frenche euer bosten straunge langage let clerkes endyten latyn haue propertye sciece knowynge facultye lette frenchman theyr frenche also endyte theyr queynt termes kyndly theyr mouthes let v shewe fantasyes suche wordes lerneden dame tonge although thys boke lytel thanke worthy leudnesse trauayle yet wrytynges exciten men thylke thynges yt bene necessarie euery therby maye perpetual myrrour sene vyces vertues thynge lyghtly may co ceyued eschewe peryls necessary catche auetures haue fallen people person certes ye soueraynst thing desyre moste creature reasonable haue el shulde haue ful appetyte theyr perfection vnresonable beestes mowen syth reason hath hem werkynge reasonable wol comparysoned vnresonable made lyke hem forsothe moste souerayne fynall perfection knowynge soth wythouten entent dysceyuable loue one god inchaungeable knowe loue hys creatour pnowe principally meane brynge knowlegyng louyng hys creatour consyderacion thinges made creatour wherthrough thylke thynges bene made vnderstadynge wyttes arne vnsene priuytees god made v sightful knowing co templacion vnderstandyng thinges forsoth moch bryngen v ye ful knowlegynge sothe parfyte loue maker heauenly thynges lo dauid sayeth thou haste delyted makynge sayeth haue delite ye tune god hath lent cosyderation thy makynge wherof aristotle boke de animalibus sayeth naturel philosopher great lykynge loue knowynge theyr creatour also knowynge cause kyndelye thynges consydred forsothe formes kyndly thynges ye shap great kyndly loue shulde haue werkman yt hem made crafte werkman shewed werke herefore truly philosopher lyuely studye many noble thynges ryghte precious worthy memory wrytten great swet ande trauayle v leften cause property nature thynges whyche therfore phylosophers ioye lykynge herty lust kyndly vertues mater reason ye perfection busy study knowe haue al treasure al rychesse al ye vaynglory yt passed emperours prynces kynges hadden therfore ye name hem ye boke perpetual memory vertue peace arne wrytten contrary sayne stixe ye foule pytte helle arne thilke pressed suche goodnesse hated bycause thys boke shall loue pryme cause sterynge doynge passyons dyseases wantynge desyre wyll boke cleped ye testamet loue thou reder thylke ye wyl scorne laughe dwerfe el halfe man say wyll rende swerd hercules handes also shulde set hercules gades myle yet ferther ouer power strength pul vp spere alisander ye noble myght neuer wegge passyng al thynge ben master fraunce myght noble gracious edwarde thyrde hys greate prowes vyctories ne myght al yet coquere certes wote wel ther shalbe made scorne iape vnworthely clothed altogether cloudy cloude vnco nynge wyl putte prees speke loue el cause mater sythen ye greatest clerkes han ynough done sayth gathered vp clene toforne hem wyth theyr sharpe sythes connynge mowen made therof great rekes noble full plentyes fede many another enuye forsothe comendeth nought hys reason yt hath hayne neuer trusty although noble repers good workman worthy theyr hyer haue al drawe bounde vp ye sheues made many shockes yet haue ensample gather smale cromes fulle walet tho fallen borde among smale houndes notwythstandynge trauayle almoygner yt hath drawe vp cloth al remyssayles trenchours relyfe bere almesse yet also haue leue ye noble husbonde boece although straunger connynge come doctrine great workme glene handful shedynge theyr handes fayle ought ful encrease porcion shal drawe priuytyes shocke slye seruaunt hys owne helpe often moche comeded knowyng trouth cause thiges hardyer fyrst sechers sayth aristotle lyghter v yt hath folowed theyr passyng study han freshed wyttes vnderstandynge han excyted cosyderacion trouth sharpnesse theyr reason vtterly thinges dremes ne iapes throwe hogges lyfelyche meate chyldren trouth betyden whe pylgrimaged kyth wynter wether measure boystous wylde wynde borias hys kynde asketh wyth dryenge coldes maked wawes occian see aryse vnkyndely ouer comune bankes poynte spyl al earth pthus endeth prologue foloweth fyrst boke testament loue page duplicate page duplicate ala fortune ala somtyme delycious houres wont enioy blysful stoundes nowe dryue vnhappy heuynes bewayle sondry yuels tene trewlye leaue myne herte wryte perdurable letter al entencions lamentacion ben ynempned maner dysease outwarde sobbynge maner sheweth sorowfull yexynge wythin thus comforte gynne spylle syth shulde solace ferre fro presence certes absence hell sternyng deth thus wo myneth yt endelesse care throughe myne herte cleched blysse ioye ofte murthed turned galle thynke thynge maye wyll armes hent myrth chaunged tene swynke continually reste wonte soiourne haue dwellynge place thus wytlesse thoughtfull syghtlesse lokinge endure penaunce derke prysone caytisned fro frendshyp acquaintaunce forsaken ye worde dare speke straunge hath waye intrucyon made hys home shuld yf reason herde shulde neuerthelater yet hertely lady precious margarit haue mynd thy seruaunt thynke hys dysease howe lyghtles lyueth sythe beames brenende loue thyne eyen arne wet worldes cloudes atwene v tweye woll suffre thoughtes hem enlumyned thynke one vertue margarite precious amonges many sorowful cofort yet well sorowfull comforte luste haue nought el thys tyme dede ne dethe ne maner trauayle hath power myne herte moche fade shulde twynckelynge dysease ah god forbyde yet lette dey lette sterue wythouten measure penaunce rather myne hertely thynkynge comforte ought dyseased maye seruyce aueyle absence seruyce shuld accepte thys endlesse sorowe thynke yes yes god wote myne hert breaketh nygh sonder howe shulde groude wythout kyndly noriture bryngen forth frutes shulde shyppe withouten sterne greate see gouerned howe shulde withouten blysse herte desyre ioye goodnesse endure thys contrarious prison thynke euery houre ye day hudred wynter wel may nowe eue sayne adam sorowe fallen welth dryue art thou paradyse wyth sweate thy sustenauce swynke depe thys pynynge pytte wo lygge ystocked chaynes lynked care tene hye then lye ye comune erth ne cable lande maked myght stretche drawe blysse ne steyers stey none wythout recouer endlesse endure wote wel purueyd arte thou nowe fredshyp somtyme laughande chere madest face countenaunce wardes truely art thou went towne euer thynketh weareth hys old clothes ye soule whych lyfe frendshyppe drawen hys spirites nowe farewell frendship farewel felawes thynketh ye al han taken leaue force one lady loue ye wote mene yet thinke thy seruaut thy loue spylleth thynges haue forsake folowen thyne hestes rewarde wt thought though ye nought el remembraunce loue lyeth sore vnder breste thought cometh mynde gladnesse thynke youre goodnesse youre merye chere frendes sorowe thynke youre wr che daunger whych chryst saue great ioye haue meditacion bounty vertues nobley yon prynted sorowe hell comen one suppose beyned thus wyth care sorowe tene shapte myne ende wt dethe make good goodlye thynke thys wretched foole fallen lowe heate brenyng tene hath al defased howe shulde ye lady sette pryse foule fylthe connynge thynne wytte exiled lyke foole naturel comparysoned trewly lady mercy wote well al labour ydel mercy passeth ryght god graunt proposycyon verifyed truste good hope mowe come hauen ease sythe impossyble colour qualyties chaunge forsoth wote well wemme ne spotte maye abyde noble vertue haboudeth defasynge verely ymagynable countenaunce goodnesse wyth encreasynge vertue knytte abyde necessary maner yet yf ryuers myght fal whych ayenst kynde wol wel myn hert ne shulde therfore naught flytte leste poynt gemetrye sadlye sonded away seruyce loue maye departe loue shall ben pleased charite shall ben eased good goodly shall dyce turne full vertue chaunce comforte vpwarde fal loue wolt thou thynke thy seruaunt nomore caste al welfare abyde daye dethe el se syght myght wellyng sorowes voyde floode make ebbe dyseases mowen wel duresse sorowe make lyfe vnbodye dye certes ye ladye full perfection loue ben knytte wyth soule dethe may thylke knotte vnbynde ne departe ye soule together endelesse blysse shulde dwel shal soule full ben eased may haue presence shewe thentet desyres ah dere god shall great ioye nowe erthely goddesse take regarde thy seruaut though feble thou arte wont prayse better wold conne serue loue al full mener kynges prince woll haue vertue mynde nowe precyous margaryte wyth thy noble vertue haste drawen loue fyrst wenyng therof haue blisse galle aloe moch spronge sauour swetnesse may attaste ala benigne eyen whych mercy semeth haue al hys noriture nyll waye tourne clerenesse mercy wardes ala youre brennande vertues shynynge amonges folke enlumynynge people habundauce encreasing sheweth smok lyght thynges thinke myne hert maketh euery day weping myne eyen renne lyggen backe sore importable burthen semeth backe charged maketh backwarde meue steppe comune course euen forth pretende thynges also ryghtsyde lyfte haue enuolued wyth care wahope helpe throughout ronne trewly leue gracelesse fortune whych euer sheweth mewardes cloudy dysease already make stormes tene blysfull syde halte styl awayward woll suffre mewardes turne force yet wol ben coquered ala nobley moch amonge creature comended folowynge streme al maner vertues ther ben wo derful let flode come soule wherfore purely mated wyth sorowe thorough sought selfe crye goodnesse haue pyte thys caytyfe inrest degre sorowe dysease lefte wythout goodly wyll fro helpe recouery sorowes maye sustene yf sorowe shulde tolde wardes shewed although moche space bytwene v twaine yet thynketh suche ioleynynge wordes dysease gyuueth ebbe trewly thynketh sowne lamentacious wepyng right flowe presence cryeth mercy grace whyche thyng semeth lyst none answere yeue deynous chere ye comaunden auoyde god forbyd worde shulde sprynge haue lytel routh parde pyte mercy euery margarite closed kynde amoges many vertues qualites comforte comfort ryght naught worth wythouten mercy pyte alone whych thynges hastely god graut mercye rehersynge thinges many wythout tyme moment rest semed anguyshe dysease altogether rauished tell howe holy passyons felynges loste semed tyme sodaynly maner drede lyght one nought feare folke haue enemy myghty wolde hem greue done hem dysease trowe thys wel knowe many persones otherwhyle yf man hys soueraynes presence maner ferdnesse crepeth hys herte harme goodly subiection namely men reden aungels ben aferde sauyour heuen pardy ne ne may passyo disease meane angel ben adrade frendes drede sythe ben perfytly blyssed affection woderfulnesse seruice obedience ferde also han louers presence theyr loues subiectes aforne theyr soueraynes ryght wyth ferdenesse myne herte caught sodaynly astonyed entred place lodged ladye semelyest moost goodly syght euer forne apered creature truly blustryng loke yaue gladnesse comforte sodaynlye wyttes ryghte dothe euery wyght cometh presence goodlye thought myne herte beganne somdele enbolded wexte lytel hardy speake yet wyth quakynge voyce durste salued enquyred worthy syghte dayned entre foule dougeon namelye pryson wythout leaue kepers certes althoughe vertue dedes mercye stretchen vysyten poore prisoner hem faculty ben comfort semed ferre falle myserye wretched hyd caytyfnesse shulde precious thynge nyghe also sorowe euery wyght shulde ben heauy wyshe recouery thys lady somdele aperceyued wel wordes chere thought yed wythin wyth good womanly cou tenaunce sayd wordes nory wenyst thou maner foryet frendes seruauntes naye quod full entente vysyte comforte al frendshyppes alyes well tyme perturbation moost propertye blysse shall vnkyndnesse neuer founden also sythen haue fewe especyal trewe nowe dayes wherfore maye well leysar come hem deseruen yf comynge maye thynge auayle wete wel woll come often good lady quod art fayre loke reynynge honny thy wordes blysse paradyse arne thy lokynges ioy comforte thy mouynges thy name mokel werkynge vertues enpyght semeth none creature euer sawe wyth myne eyen dyscyple wodreth thy wordes yt lytel disease haste foryeten name woste thou well loue first brought thy seruyce good lady quod thys worshyp thyne excellence come foule place parde somtyme tho prosperite wyth foreyne goodes enuolued mokel done drawe myne hostel yet many wernynges thou madest er thou lyste fullye graunt thyne home make dwellyng place nowe thou comest goodly thyne owne vyse comforte wyth wordes thoroughe gynne remembre passed gladnesse trewly ladye ne wotte whether shal say welcome none sythen thy comyng wol moch tene sorowe gladnesse myrthe se comforteth thinke passed gladnesse anoyeth efte doynge thus thy comynge bothe gladdeth teneth cause moche sorowe lo ladye howe comforted commyng gan teeres dystylle tenderlye wepe nowe certes quod loue se well ouerthynketh wytte fayleth arte poynte dote trewly quod haue ye maked euer woll rue wottest thou nat wel quod euery shepeherde ought reson seke hys sperkelande shepe arne ronne wyldernesse amonge bush peryls hem theyr pasture ayen bringe take hem priuy besy cure kepynge tho vnconnyng shepe scattred wolde ben loste rennyng wyldernesse desertes drawe el wolden put hem selfe swalowynge wolfe yet shal shepherd busynesse trauayle put hym forth shall nat let hem loste waye good shepeherd putteth rather hys lyfe ben loste hys shepe thou shalte wene beynge werse condicyon truly euerych folke tho warde knyt condicion wil rather dye suffre hem erroure ben spylt lyst lyketh myne sheperdesse cleped wottest thou well fayled neuer wyght refused wolde neglygently go vnkyndnesse yet parde hau manye holp releued haue oft begyled euer ende discendeth theyr owne neckes hast thou radde kynde parys priamus son troye iason falsed hys false behest sesars sonke left tene tyll troned blysse seruyce maked louedaye betwene god mankynde chese mayde nompere put quarell ende lo haue trauayled haue thanke sydes yet lyst rest myght fynde shulde werche truly myne owne dysciple bycause haue founde assayes thy wyll ben readye mye hestes haue folowed hast ben true margaryte peerle one shewed alway ayenwarde hath made daungerous cheare come propre person put errours make glad wayes reason sorowe ne dysease shall nomore hereafter amaystrye wherethrough hope thou shalte lyghtlye come grace thou longe hast desyred thilke iewel hast thou herde many ensamples howe haue comforted releued scholers lore hathe worthyed kynges felde hath honoured ladyes boure perpetual myrroure theyr trouthe seruyce hath caused worthye folke voyde vyce shame hath holde cyties realmes prosperitie yf lyste cleape ayen thyne olde remebraunce thou coudest euery poynt declare especyall saye thy maystresse haue cause causyng thynges many mo nowe ywys madame quod al thinges know well selfe thyne excellence passeth vnderstandynge v beestes nomans wyt erthly may comprehende thy vertues well se disease sorow wote wel thou art one myne nories maye suffre make sorow thyne owne selfe shende selfe come thy fere thyne heauye charge make seme lesse woo hym alone sory moned sorowfull wyght greate gladnesse right sycke frendes sycke sorye el sorowe make tyll whan haue hem releued suche wyse gladnesse maner countrepaysyng shal restore mokel ioy passed heuynesse beforne dyd tene also whan anye seruauntes ben alone solitary place haue yet euer busyed hem comfort theyr hertes taught hem make songes playnte blysse endyten letter rethorycke queynt vnderstadynges bethynke hem wyse mygt best theyr ladyes good seruice plese also lerne maner countenaunce wordes bearynge ben meke lowlye euery wyght name fame encrease yeue great yeftes large renome may spryngen therof haue excused thy losse thy great costages wherthrough thou art nedy arne nothynge vnknowen hope god somtyme shall ben amended thus sayde nortuoure haue taught al myne curtesie made hem expert ladyes hertes wyn yf wolde endeynous proude enuious wretch acquayntaunce hasteliche haue voyded schole vyces trulye hate vertues worthynesse power auaunce ah worthye creature iuste cause name goddesse dignely ye mowe beare lyth ye grace creature worlde hath goodnesse truly maner blysse precyousnesse vertue springen wellen brokes ryuers proceden theyr sprynges lyke water kynde drawen see kyndly thynges thresten full appetyte desyre draw thy steppe thy presence approche theyr kyndely perfectio dare beestes world ought forfayte ayenste thy deuyne purueyaunce also ladye ye knowen pryuye thoughtes hertes counsayle may ben hydde knowynge wherfore wot well lady ye knowe youre selfe conscyence haue ben wyllyng seruyce al coulde neuer shulde yet forsothe fayned neuer loue otherwise tha myne herte yf coulde haue made cheare one ythought many done daye afore myne eyen trowe wolde haue vayled certes quod haddest thou done wold haue vysited ye wete wel lady eke quod haue played racket nettyll docke wethercock waued truly ye sette accorde conscience wolde flye tyll ye reason aperte strength made myne herte tourne good faythe quod haue knowe euer tho condicions sythe thou woldest moche made pryuy thy counsayle iuge thy conscience though forsoke tho dayes tyl sawe better tyme wold neuer god shulde fayle euer wyll ready wytnessynge thy soth place euer shall ayenste tho wol contrary susteyne moch nought vnknowen ne hydde thy pryuy hert al hast thou tho thinges made open full hath caused commynge prison voyde webbes thyne eyen make clerly se erroures thou hast bene bycause men bene dyuers condicyons adradde saye soth sothe anon readye fyght also maye selfe bene place withsaye thylke men speaken otherwyse sothe woll charge vertue obedyence thou owest wryten wordes set hem wrytynges mowe wytnessyng ben noted amonge people bookes wrytten neyther dreden ne shame ne stryue conne shewen entent writer yeue remembraunce hearer yf anye woll thy presence saye anye thynge tho wryters loke boldlye truste mar answer full certes shall hym enfourme trouthe thy loue thy conscience help thou shalt varye thy nede trowe strongeste best may founde woll transuers thy wordes whereof woldest thou drede greatlye tho gladed wordes saith wexen somdele lyght hert auctoritie wytnesse also syckernesse helpe forsayd hest sayd trulye ladye well gladded co fort wordes lykynge vnto nobleye shewe whiche folke defame seruauntes syth seruyce ought aboue thynges bene commended yet quod se well thy soule amased cloude better thynge yt myght lyght thyne heuy charge knowynge thyne owne heelpe styrr swete wordes suche reason thoughtfull soule namelye suche one thou arte woll yet suche thynges synken come therfore let sene thyne heuye charge maye lyghtlyer thy comforte purueye certes ladye quod moost co fort myght haue vtterly wete sure herte margaryte serue thynke done wyth myghtes whyle lyfe dureth tha quod mayest thou thereafter suche wyse myspleasaunce ne entre good fayth quod shall myspleasaunce caused trespasse syde wete set neuer yet perso serue place yf caused contrary defaultes trespass ne spedde hys seruyce myne owne earthlye ladye quod tho yet remembre worthynesse longe sythen many reuoluynge yeres tyme whan octobre hys leue gynneth take nouembre sheweth sight wha berne ben full goodes nut euery halke good lande tyllers gynne shape erth great trauayle bryng forth corne mannes sustenaunce ayenst nexte yeres folowynge tyme plentie hath home wyse lyst wander maruayles seche constrayned excited oft loth thynge done excitacyon mennes opinion wolden fayne haue myne abydynge take hert lust trauayle se wynding erth tyme wynter woodes large stretes werne smal pathes swyne hogges haden made lane ladle theyr maste seche walked thynkynge aloone wonder greate whyle greate beestes wood haunten adorneth maner forestes heerdes gone wylde er ware neyghed see banke ferde beestes shypcraft cryed lady trowe ye wete well selfe nothynge werse beestes shulden tame yf catche wyldenesse gyn ayen waxe ramage thus forsothe aferde shyppe hyed ynowe latch myne handes drawe shyppe many knewe well name syght fyrst lust another thought thyrde wyll eke mayster broughten wt boorde shyppe trauayle whan sayle sprad shyppe gan moue wynde water gan ryse ouerthwartly turne ye welken wawes semeden kyst togyther often vnder colour kyssyng mokell olde hate priuily closed kept storm straungely deuouryng maner gan fast v assayle supposed date deth shulde haue made gynnyng vp downe nowe vnder wawe nowe abouen shyppe great whyle mokel duresse wether stormes greate auowynge pylgremages dryuen yle vtterly wende fyrste haue rescowed truly fyrst gynnynge semed peryllous hauen catche thorowe grace hadde bene comforted lyfe full dispayred truly ladye yf ye remembred aryght maner thynges selfe came hastely sene v see driuen weten fyrste ye deynous cheare whyche ye goone better alyght euer thought ye lyued greate drede disease semed chere whan certifyed name lenger looked goddly dradde euer myne herte opened lytle tyme shyppe mynde ladye ye lad ware beestes fysshes great nobre throngynge togyther among muskell blewe shel enclosed margaryte perle moost precyous best euer toforne came syght ye tolden youre selfe ylke iewell kynde good vertuous better shulde neuer fynde sought therafter worldes ende wyth helde peace greate whyle euer sythe haue bethought man sought precious margarytes whan founden one lykyng solde good bye iewell ywys thought yet thynke haue founden iewelle myne hert desyreth wherto shulde sech ferther truly woll stynte margaryte et euer nowe also sythen wyll well wyl shoulde suche seruyce take desyre thynge whiche neuer haue blysse lyueth none hath disease myght brought suche seruyce cause sorowe ioye wondre worde ye sayne bryngen men ioye parde ye wet well defaulte ne trespasse maye reasonably bene put mewardes farre conscience knoweth disease lyste nowe whyle speake enforme maner blysse ye haue thronge truly wene al gladnesse ioye myrth beshet vnder locke keye throwen suche place yt may founde brennyng wo hath altred hewe whan shoulde slepe walowe thynke disporte thus cobred seme folke mased also ladye myne desyre hath longe dured spekynge haue el ye leest haue ben enmoysed syght wanting thinges mouth wolde durst pleyne right sore sythen euyls goodnesse arne manyfolde yolden wonder lady truly saue euermore reuerece ye mowe shame thinges suffre youre seruaunte multyplyed wherfore knelyng lowe hert praye rue caytyfe nothynge may serue good ladye yf ye lyst nowe helpe shewe priuyest seruauntes al assayes tyme vnder wynges protection helpe mewardes shapen shal tha straungers wyse succour loke whan pryuy yet helpe fayle may thus prison abyde bondes chaynes holden lady ye se wel selfe renyant foringed hath halfe care thus syghyng sobbynge wayle alone nere cofort presence ryght wold sterne yet alytle gladed yt goodly suche grace none happe haue hent gracyouslye fynde precyous margarete leste menne shulde bye yf shulde therfore sel substaunce wo manye let game purpose brekers bene maked wayters suche prysoners euermore ouerloke hyndre suche lettoures harde suche iewell wyn lady honour thy deytie thynketh ryght suche people shoulde haue maystry ne ben ouerlokers ouer none thy seruauntes truly leful vnto goddes wolde playne ye rule youre deuyne purueyaunce amonges youre seruauntes nothyng ye shulde also lady moeble insu ysaunt countreuayle pryce iewell el make theschaunge eke wyght worthy suche perles weare kynges prince elles theyr peres iewel vertue wolde adorne make fayre al realme ley vertue moche goodnesse ouer comended yt wold wayle myght suche rychesse haue wyl vertue therof prison may delyuer nought el yf throw holpen se selfe withouten recouery althoughe myght hence voyde yet wolde wold abyde day desteny hath ordained suppose without amendement sore myne herte bounden may thynken none thus strayte lady hath syr daunger laced stockes leue wyl se taken lytle hede thynketh woll maken myght vertue mercy margaret stretch ye mow wel case lyst blysse myrth felde syknesse sorowe ben alway redy ye cope oftene wounde bodye stondyng best vneth may lygge pure myseasy sorowe yet lytel ynough ernest siluer forward bargayne treble folde mockell must suffre er tyme come myne ease worthy welth may wo suffre certes heuye thynke thynges shall yeue water ynough drynke lest myne eyen drye nynge streames teares shall wayle myne owne happy heuynesse shall counsayle nowe lykyng tene goodly harse euer brenne couete sorowe thrist gladnes shal yeue contrarious drink stanch thyrst blysful bytternes lo thus brenne drenche shyuer swet reuersed euyl neuer yet ordeyned salue soth lyches ben vnconnyng saue margaryte aloone anye suche remedye purueye wt wordes brast wepe euery tere myne eyen greatnesse semed boren oute ye ball syght water ben run tha thought loue gan lytle heauye miscomfort chere gan sobrely easye maner speake well aduysynge sayde comenly wyse speaken easelye softe manye skylles one theyr wordes better beleued also easye speakyng auysement men maye catche put forth holden also auctoritie easye wordes eke yeuen vnderstandyng intention mater ryght lady easely softe maner gan saye wordes pmeruayle great maner semblaunt farre espy thou lyste haue anye recoure euer thou playnest sorowest wayes remedye foolysh wylfulnesse lyst seche enquyre thy next fredes thyne wyt haue ben thy maystresse recoure fyne thy disease disease gladnesse ioye ful vessel helded quencheth felyng fyrst tenes thou wonte onely thinges remembre thyne herte also fooles thereof enfourmen adnullynge theyr errours distroying theyr darke opinion comforte theyr seare thoughtes nowe canst thou bene comforte thyne owne soul thynkyng thinges hast thou ben longe commensal hast mykell eeten pottage foryetfulnesse dronken ignoraunce olde soukyng thou hadest arne maystred lorne fro maner knowynge worthy parson helpe counsayle hym selfe wordes pure stronge shame woxe reed seing astonyed dyuers stoundes sodaynly thyng kynd hateth gan delyciouslye comforte wyth sugred wordes puttyng ful hope shulde margarete getten yf folowed heestes gan fayre cloth wypen teares hyngen chekes sayde wyse nowe well wysdome welth withouten may nothyng lerned thou bearest keyes pryuye thynges vayne trauayle men catche stedshyp yf ye lady fyrst locke vnshet ye lady learne v wayes pathes heauen ye lady maken al heuenly bodyes goodly benigly course gouernen v beestes erth ye armen youre seruauntes ayenst debate impercyable harneys ye setten hertes insuperable bloud hardynesse ye leden hem parfyte good yet thynge desyreth ye werne man helpe wele done lore graunt lytle grace al sorowes cease myne owne seruaunte truly thou syttest nye myne herte thy bad chere gan soryly greue amonge thy playnyng wordes thought thou allegest thynges lettyng thyne helpyng thy grace hyndre wherthorowe thynketh wanhoope crope thyne herte god forbyd nyse vnthryfty thought shulde come thy mynd thy wyttes trouble sythen euery thing comyng contingente wherefore make nomore thy proposition impossyble nowe praye reherse ayen tho thynges thy mistrust causen thilke thinges thynke reason destroyen put full hope thyne hert vnderstandest thou ther thou saydest many lette game thyne ouerlokers also thy moeble insuffysaunte thou therof meanest truly quod fyrste saye iangelers euermore arne speakynge rather euyll good euerye age man rather enclyneth wyckednesse anye goodnesse auaunce also false wordes spryngen wyde steryng false lyinge tonges fame al swyftly flyeth eares sayeth many wycked tale soone shall falsenesse ben leued truthe great sothnesse nowe ye quod thynketh thylke iewel precious suche wretch wold vertue thereof extende also feble worldly ioyes suche iewell cou treuayle suche people worldlye ioyes han wyl ben set hyghest degree moost reuerence bene accepted false wenynge maketh felicitie therein supposed suche caytyues euermore ben hyndred certes quod take good hede shall reason shewen thynges mowe let thy purpose leeste poynte anye wyght coude prycke remembrest quod ensample one strogest maner preue man purpose ensample enduce propositio proued strength yes soth wel quod raddest thou neuer parys troy heleyne loued togyther yet entrecomuned speche also acrisyus shette dane hys doughter tour surete wight shulde haue mastry seruyce yet iupiter sygnes withoute anye spech purpose ayenst father wyll many suche mo haue ben knytte trouth yet spake neuer togyder thynge enclosed vnder secretnesse priuitie twe personnes entremellen hertes syght power knowynge suche thynges preuen shall vtterlye yeuen beestes manye thynges suche precyous mater ben reserued iudgement deuine purueyaunce amonge lyuynge people man consyderation moune determyned wherefore saye enuye ianglynge welny people vpon seruauntes maken efte rather cause esployte hyndrynge suffre ye suche wronge moune whan ye lyst lyghtlye suche euyls abate semyth greate vnworshyp holde nowe thy peace haue founden manye han bene vnkynde truly wol suffre euery wyght wise haue disease contynueth ende well truly hem woll helpen one myne blysse wende marcial grece ycrowned god strongest rathest come longest abode contynued iourneye spared trauayle longe play lest thylke person profred hym seruyce therin whyle anon voydeth redy one thynketh water entreth anon respyreth one list parfyte blysse seruyce brynge tree ofte set dyuers place woll kynde endure brynge forth frutes loke praye howe myne olde seruauntes tyme passed continued seruyce folowe thou theyr steppe myght thou fayle case thou worch wise certes quod nothing lich worlde tyme passed eke countre hath one maner coutrie hath another may alway put eye salue healed hele soth betwex two thynges lyche oft dyuersitie requyred soth diuersitie nacion diuersitie law maked manye reason diuersitie cometh contrarious malyce wicked people yt han enuyous hertes ayenst trulye lawe seruauntes euer hath ben generall whyche maye fayle ryght man lawes yt ordeyned many determinacions may know good bad tyl assay people han proued end draweth sheweth necessitie therof el impossibilitie ryght ye lawe seruauntes wel hath ben proued generall hytherto hath fayled wyste thou well lawe kynde lawe god ordeyned stablysshed dure kynde reasoun wherfore lawe man wyt purueyed ought vnderput lawe kynde whiche yet hath comune euery kyndly creature yt statute lawes ben kyndly generall people olde doinges many turnynges yeres vsed people maner proued mowen lyghtly ben defased newe doinges contrariaunces olde often causen disease breaken many purpose yet saye therefore ayen newe myschefe menne shulde ordaynen newe remedy alway loke contrary olde ferther malyce stretcheth foloweth olde doinges loue han bene vniuersall moost exployte forth vsed wherfore woll yet lawes nothynge adnulled purpose suche iangelers lokers wayters game yf thynke ought mowe dere yet loue well alwaye set hem nought let thy porte ben lowe euery wyghtes presence redy thyne herte mayntayne thou hast begonne lytle fayne mekenesse wordes thus wyth sleyght shalt thou surmout dequace euyll theyr hertes wysdome yet seme flye otherwhyle man wol fight thus suche thynges tonges euyll shall ben stylled el fully graunt thy full meanynge sothe euer euer shall myne enemyes ben aferde trust anye fyghtynge therfore haue thou cowardes herte seruyce nomore somtyme thou haddest contrary yf thou drede suche ianglers thy viage make vnderstad wel yt yt dredeth rayn sow cornes shal haue tha thynne berne also yt aferde clothes let hym dauce naked nothing vndertaketh namely seruyce nothyng acheueth great stormes wether often mery smoth much clatering mokyll rownynge thus ianglynge wordes cometh huyshte peace styl good lady quod se seuen yere passed haue graffed groubed vyne wayes coude soughte fed grape fruite haue none founde also haue thys seuen yere serued laban wedded rachell doughter blereryed lya brought bedde whiche alway engendreth tene ful child tribulacion care although clepinges kyssynges rachell shulde seme swete yet barayn gladnesse ne ioye way wol sprynge maye wepe rachel may ben counsayled wyth solace sythen issue myne hertely desyre fayled nowe praye sone fredome grace eyght yere eyghteth mowe kinrest masseday seuen werkedayes trauayle folowe christen lawe euer ye el thylke margaryte holden lady priuye chabre thys case none person committed loke quod thou perseuer seruice haue grouded thylke skorne thyne enemyes mowe thy person sothed lo man beganne edefye hys foundemente badde ende maye bringe mekenesse coutenaunce wyth manly hert dedes longe countynaunce conysaunce lyuerye al retynue deliuered wenyst thou lyste auaunce suche personnes louen fyrste syttynges feestes hyghest stole church hal loutinges people markettes fayres vnstedfaste byde one place anye whyle togyther wenynge hys owne wytte excellent scornynge maner deuyse hys owne naye naye god wotte shul nothyng pertteyne blysse truly maner toforne hathe ben wyrshyppe wyth blysse lyon felde lambes chambre egles assaute maydens halle fox counsayle styl theyr dedes theyr protection grauted redy ben brydge theyr baner arered like wolues felde thus wayes shull men ben auaunced ensample dauid kepynge shepe drawen vp order kyngly gouernaunce iupiter fro bole bene europe fere iulius cesar lowest degre rome mayster erthly prince eneas hel kinge countre rome nowe stondynge saye thy grace bearynge therafter maye sette suche plyghte ianglynge maye greue lest tucke thy heme theyr ianghes noughte counte cresse thy disauauntage ever quod hath people thys worlde desyred haue great name worthynesse hated foule bere anye fame one ye obiections thou alegest ayen thyn hertely desyre ye forsothe quod comenly people wol lye brynge enfame yf men wyth leasynges put enfame wenest thy selfe therby ben enpeyred wenyng wronge se asmuch lyen thy merite encreaseth make bene worthy hem knowen soth thing thou art apeyred mokyl thou arte encreased thy beloued frendes sothly wounde thy frend lasse harme ye syr better false kyssyng disceyuable glosynge af thyne enemye aboue wel thy frende maketh enfame ergo thou art encreased apeyred lady quod somtyme yet yf disease thestymacyon enuyouse people ne loketh nothyng desertes men ne merites theyr doynges aueture fortune therafter yeuen theyr sentence loken voluntarye
