wyll herte therafter telleth hys iugement takynge hede reason ne qualyte doynge thus riche fulfylled worldly welefulnesse commenden saine lente iuste cause hath aduersyte sayne weaked hathe deserued thylke anoye cotrary thynges men holden also sayne rych prosperyte puruayed confusyon vpon thys mater manye authorites many greate wytted clerkes alegen men sayne thoughe good estimacyon forsaken folke han aduersyte yet meryte encrease hys blysse purpose arne wonderfull vnderstandynge trewlye myne aduersytie nowe howe sentence indifferent people wylingen fame therfore quod yf anye wyghte shulde yeue trew sentence mater cause disease mayste thou se well vnderstade thervpon ende draweth yt sayne good badde ought haue fame goodnesse enfame badnesse euery reasonable person namely wyse man wytte ought wtout reason toforne herde sodainly mater iuge sawes wise thou shalt iuge ne deme toforne thou knowe lady ye remembre wel moost laude praysynge certayne sayntes holy churche rehersen conuercyon badde good rehersed perpetuall myrroure remembraunce worshypping tho sayntes good ensample misdoers amedement howe turned romayne zedeoreys fro romaynes wyth hanyball ayenst hys kynde nacyon afterwardes hym semyng romaynes next degree cofusyon turned hys olde alyes whose witte hanibal discomfyted wherfore enfourme lady maner meane se nowe youth drawe bene assentaunt myghtes helpinge certayne coniuracions greate matter rulynge citezins thylke thynges ben drawer exitours tho mater werne paynted coloured prime face semed noble gloryous people wenynge mykel meryte haue deserued furtherynge mayntenaunce tho thynges besyed laboured wyth diligence werkynge thylke mater ende trewlye lady tell sothe roughte lytell anye hate myghty senatours thylke citie ne comunes malyce two skyllles one comforte bene suche plyte profyte frendes another comen profite cominaltye peace tranquilytie wyth iust gouernaunce proceden thylke profyte sythen counsayl myne witte thought fyrste paynted thynges malyce euell meanynge wythouten anye good auaylynge people tyrannye purposed pure sorow medlynge bad infame ronne tho teeres lashed oute myne eyen thus awaye washe vnder hyd malyce rancoure purposynge enuye fornecaste ymagined distruction mokyl people shewed openly bene blynde wyth myne hondes circumstaunce myght well haue feled tho personnes thynges haue caste redresse wrathe fyrste medlynge shopen dwell pynande prison tyll lachases threde leger wolde twine euer sought yf lyst haue grace lyfe frenesse prison shulde openly confesse peace myght ben endused ende al fyrste rancour fully supposed knowynge ful tho mater lady thoughte euery man anye waye ryght ryghtfully done maye helpe comune help ben saued thyng kepe aboue thynges holde mayntayne namely distroyenge wronge shulde therthroughe enpeche myne owne fere yf gylty mysdede assentaunt mayster ne frende may nought auayle soule hym falsnesse dyeth also nere desyred wrathe people ne indignacyon worthy nothynge euer wrought dyd doynge selfe el mayntenaunce foresayd erroures hydinge priuytees therof people hertes holdynge erroures syde blynde elde ferforthe begyled debate stryfe maynteyned distruction othersyde whyche cause peace moost cominaltie shuld desyred point broken adnulled also citie london dere swete forth growen kyndly loue haue peace tha earthe euery kyndely creature hathe full appetyte place hys kyndly engendrure wylne reste peace stede abide thylke peace shulde thus haue bene broken wyse commended desyred knowe thynge men desyren comen perfyte peace euerlastynge muste peace god commended maintayn kepe thys peace aungelles voice confirmed oure god entrynge thys worlde thys hys testamente lefte hys frendes whan retourned place whence came thys hys apostle amonesteth holden wythout whyche man perfytely maye haue none insyght also god hys commynge made peace alone betwene heuenly erthly body also amonge v earth peace confirmed one heade loue one bodie shulde perfourme also remembre wel name athene rather god peace batayle shewynge peace mooste necessarye comunalties city styred wayes forne nempned declared certeyne pointes thys wyse fyrste yt thylke persones yt hadden drawen purpose wetyng priuy entent meaning drawe also feable witted people yt haue none insyght gubernatyfe prudece clamur crie mater yt styred vnder poyntes comune auauntage enbolded passyfe take actyues doynge also styred innocentes connynge crye thynges whyche quod may stande bene executours tho matter auctorite excecucion comen electio v delyuered must entre strength mayntenaunce suche degree put oppression olde hyndrers shall agayne surmounten putten subiection endelesse wo ye shull complaine gouernementes quod citie left handes torcencious citezins shall brynge pestilence distruction good men therfore let v haue thecomune administration abate yuels also quod worthy good co mende gyltye desertes chastice bene citezins many ferde execucyon shall doone extorcyons hem committed bene euer ayenst purpose good meanynges neuer latter ladye trewelye meanynge vnder wordes fullye haue apeched myghty senatours hadden heauy herte misgouernaunce seen lady whan fell free election great clamour much people greate disease mysgouernaunce feruently stoden electio hem submitted euerye maner face rather haue suffred maner rule hated gouernours wythstandinge contrary helden much comune meyny haue consideration onely voluntary lustes withouten reason thylke gouernoure forsaken faynynge forne hys vndoynge misrule time shope haue letted thylk election haue made newe hym selfe haue bene chosen vnder mokyll rore haue arered thynges ladie knowen amonge prince made open people draweth amendement euery degree shal bene ordayned stande shulde errours coming herafter men may lightly forne hande puruaye remedye thys wyse peace rest furthered holde whiche thinges lady thylke person broughten answere forne theyr mooste souerayne iuge coarted hy paynyng dures openlye knowlegeden asked therof grace apertly preueth wordes bene sothe without forgyng leasynges nowe greueth remebre dyuers sentence ianglyng shepy people certes thynketh oughten maken ioye sothe maye knowe trouth conscience bene wytnesse bothe thys knowyng sothe haue sayde harme ne malyce tho personnes onely trouth sacramet leigiaunce whych charged kynges behalfe se ye nowe ladye howe felonous thoughtes thys people couyns wycked men conspyren page missing myghte thou haue doone thou dydeste yf thou woldeste false quarell haue bene stynkynge martyr wene thou fleddest longe thou might theyr priuytie consayle whyche thynge thou heleste lenger thou shuldest thilke ought money penny wold paye wende thy retourne bene impossible howe myghte thou better haue hem proued thus thy nedye disease nowe haste thou ensample thou shalte meddle trewely thys lore worthe many goodes ofte ganne loue sterne wordes thynke speche trewly woll lyking howe euer thou se fortune shape wheele tourne thys meditation waye reuolue certes fortune sheweth fayrest whan thynketh begyle thoughte forne thou saydeste thy loo loue thy ryght wesenesse oughte raysed shulde lowed tyme comynge thou myghte loue haue loo fame shull bene raysed thy frendes comforte sorowe thyne enemyes endelesse shul endure yf thou one shepe amoges hundred loste deserte waye erred nowe flocke arte restored shepeherde hathe ioy thou ayen forrest tourne ryght sorowe anguysh greate tyme thyne way goyng ryght ioye gladnesse shall doubled sene conuerted lothes wyfe ayen lokynge hoole counsayle wyth shepe folowyng wyth grasse herbes gadre neuer later quod saye thinge wantrust haue supposynge otherwise shulde trewly watte well nowe thou arte set purpose lyste parte saye many men bene knowing mennes doynges setten theyr cure lyghtlye desyren badde clatter rather good haue wyl theyr owne maner amende also hate olde ra coure lyghtly hauen thyng abideth sodainly theyr mothes procedeth abundaunce herte wordes stone stone throw wherfore cou sayle euer openlye apertelye place thou syt countreplete therrours meaninges farre thou hem wystyst false leaue wyghte make hem knowe euery bodyes eare alwaye paciente vse iacobes wordes euer menne clappen shall sustayne ladyes wrathe whyche haue deserued longe margaryte hathe rightwysed cause certes quod wytnesse selfe yf thou thus conuerted soroweste good meanynge thyne herte wolte vanytie parfytelye departe consolatioun al good plesaunce margaryte whiche thou desyreste wyl thyne herte maner mother pytie shull fully accepte grace ryghte thou rentest clothes open syght openlye sowe hem hys worshyppe wythouten reprofe commended also ryght thou ensample muche folde erroure ryghte thou muste ensample manyfolde correction good sauoure forgoynge erroure distroyeng causeth dilygent loue many playted praysinges folowe shal fyrst errours make folowynge worshyppes seme hugely encreased blacke whyte sette togyder euerye semeth dothe euery thynges contrary kynde infame gothe alwaye fore praysynge worshyppe cause folowing maketh ryse thylke honoure double welth quecheth spotte fyrst enfame wenist saye thynges hyndrynge thy name naye naye god wo te pure encreasing worship thy ryghtwysnesse comende thy trouth seme wost wel thy selfe thou fourme makynge passeth ada ete apple thou passeth stedstastnesse noe ye eatynge grape become dronke thou passeth chastyte lothe laye hys doughter eke nobley abraham god reproued hys pryde also dauides mekenesse whyche woman made vrye slawe also hector troye whome defaute myght founde yet reproued ne hadde wyth manhode suffered warre begonne ne parys haue wente grece whome ganne sorowe trewly hym lacketh venyme pryue consentynge whyche openlye leaueth wronge wythsaye lo eke olde prouerbe amoges many styll semeth graunted ensamples thou myght fully vnderstonde thynges ben wryte lernynge ryghtwysenesse tho persones thus euery wyght hys defaute comitted made goodnesse afterwardes done reuerece open wynge ensample songe holye church lo howe necessary ada synne dauyd kynge gat salomo kynge vries wyfe truly reprofe none thinges wrytte right tho reherce thy dede repreue yt neuer ne vyllany rehersed worshyppe u contynue well profyte thy selfe rede thou hem thynke sayd ryght thus lady vnyte accorde enuye wrathe lurken thou comest place ye wete well selue done many whyle adminystred offyce comen doynge rulynge stablyshmentes amoges people defouled neuer conscience maner dede euer wytte counsayle wysest mater drawen theyr ryght endes thus trewlye ladye haue desyred suche cure certes youre seruyce ydell ferre suche doynge cure stretcheth thynge quod may drawe many hertes noble voyce comune glorye fame wretched fyckle ala mankynde coueyteth leude wyse rewarded good dede sith glorye fame worlde hyndrynge glorye tyme comynge certes quod yet hardest fame heauen erthe centre cercle heuen prycke woder lytell respecte al ye cercle yet al prycke may name borne maner peersyng many obstacle water wyldernesse straunge langages onely name men ben stylled holden oute knowlegynge obstacle also cyties realmes prosperite ben letted know theyr reason hyndred mow ben parfytly mennes proper vnderstandynge howe shulde name synguler londenoys passe gloryous name london whyche many commended many lacked many mo place erthe knowen knowen many countrees lytel london knowyng speche yet among one maner people may suche fame goodnesse come many praysen comenly many lacken fye suche maner fame slepe suffre hym knoweth preuyte hertes dele suche fame thylke place nothynge ayenst sothe shal neyther speake ne dare appere atturney ne maner howe many great named many greate worthynesse losed han tofore thys tyme memorie slydden clenely forgetten defaute wrytynges yet scripture great elde ben defased yt perpetualte maye hem ben iuged yf thou wolte make comparison euer ioy mayst thou haue erthlye name fayre lykenesse pee one grayne wheate thousand shyppes ful corne charged nombre betwene one thother yet mowe nombred ende rekenyng haue trewly maye nombred nothyng recken thylke maye nombred ofte thynges ended made comparyson one lytel another great thinges haue ende another ende suche comparyson maye founden wherfore heauen ben losed wyth god hath none ende endlesse endureth thou canste nothynge done aryght thou desyre rumoure therof healed euerye wyghtes eare dureth prycke respect thou sekest rewarde folkes smale wordes vayne praysynges trewly therin thou lesest guerdon vertue lesest greatest valoure conscience vphap renome euerlastyng therfore boldely renome fame erthe shuld hated fame deth shulde desyred werkes vertue asketh guerdoning soule causeth al vertue soule delyuered prisone erthe worthy suche guerdone amonge haue euerlastynge fame body causeth mannes yuels tweye thynges arte thou answered thynketh quod loue yf thynge doute thy soule shewe forth thyne ignorauce clere leaue shame certes quod ne bodye thys worlde ought coude saye reason ayenst skylles leue wytte nowe fele wel euell spekers bearer enfame may lytel greue lette purpose rather suche thynge quarell forthered yea proued also ylke iewell kepynge shal thorowe steered ye lest moment yt myght ymagined soth well leueth declare yt thy insuffisauce maner letting thus worthye thou shuldest clymbe hygh thy moebles thyne estate arne voyded thou thynkest falle suche myserye gladnesse thy pursute woll thy dyscende certes quod sothe ryghte suche thought myne herte comenly spoken olde prouerbe leged heweth hye wyth chyppes maye lese syght wherfore haue ben al euer myghte studye wayes remedye one syde another nowe quod god forbede ere thou seke doynges haue lerned yt restinge whyles suche herbes ben planted oure gardyns thou shalt well vnderstande aboue man one god alone quod hau forne thys tyme trusted writtes chauntementes helpes spirites dwelle ayre therby han gette theyr desyres fyrst hys manly power daunced behynde quod fye mater trewly sacrilege shal haue sort seruautes myne eyen shall suche thynge loked howe often comaunded passed wyse one god shal men serue goddes lyst haue myne helpes shal aske none helpe foule spirites ala man maked semblable god wost thou wel al vertue lyuelych werkynge goddes purueyaunce vnderputte resonable creature erth euery thynge thishalfe god made buxome mannes co templacyon vnderstandynge heuen erthe helle hath manne beynge stone soule wexyng tree herbes hathe soule felynge wyth beestes fyshes foules hath soule reason vnderstandyng aungels hym knyt maner lyuynges reasonable proporcion also made foure elementes vniuersytee rekened alone hath vnder god princypalite aboue al thynges soule thousand myle hence ferre nowe nygh nowe hye lowe ferre momente mountenaunce often wynter al thys mannes gouernaunce dysposition sheweth yt men ben lych vnto goddes chyldren moste heyghte sythen al thynges vnderputte ye wyll reasonable creature god forbede man wynne lordshyp aske helpe thynge lower hym selfe namely foule thynges innominable nowe shuldest thou wene loue high sythen nothynge aboue god alone trewly wote well yt thylke iewell maner eue lyne degre thou art thy selfe nought aboue saue thus angel vpon angell man vpon man deuell vpon deuell han maner soueraygnitie shall cease daye dome saye thoughe thou putte serue ylke iewel durynge thy lyfe yet seruage vnderputtynge maner trauaylynge pleasaunce conquere gette thou haste sette nowe hardest seruyce nowe thou deidest sorowe wa tynge thy desyres trewlye heauenlye bodyes wyth one voyce shul come make lody thy comynge saye welcome oure fere worthy entre iupyters ioye thou wyth myght haste ouercome dethe thou woldest neuer flytte thy seruyce shul pray goddes row rowe make thilk margarite yt routh persone vnkyndely wythout comforte let deye shall besette selfe suche wyse erthe parte vengeaunce shal ioye haue loues seruyce deed shal soule ben brought vp thy presence whyther thou wylte chese thylke soule shall ben commytted el thy dethe anone foresayd heuenly bodyes one accorde shall benomen thylke perle vertues fyrste taken hathe hem forfeyted seruaunte thy lyue wolde suffre worche vertues withdrawen myght hygh bodyes shuldest thou wene yf thy lyste loke vpon lawe kynde wyth order whyche ordayned sothely none age none ouertournynge tyme hytherto tyme ne power chaunge weddinge ne ye knotte vnbynde two hertes thorow one assent presence together accorden enduren tyll dethe hem departe trowest thou euery ydeot w tte menyng priuy entente thynges wene forsothe suche accorde may rose maydenhede plucked waye waye knowe nothyng thys consente two hertes alone maketh fastenynge knotte neyther law kynde ne mannes lawe determyneth neyther age ne ye qualyte persones onely accorde betwene thylke twaye trewlye tyme suche accorde theyr consent hert ensealed put treasory amonges priuy thynges gynneth name sponsayle althoughe breaken forwarde yet suche mater ensealed kept reme braunce euer se nowe spouse haue name anone accorde thoughe rose take aungell badde ioseph take marye hys spouse egypte wende lo cleped spouse yet forne ne neyther hem bothe mente fleshly luste knowe wherfore wordes trouthe accorden seruautes shulden forsake father mother adherande hys spouse two vnite one fleshe shulden accorde thys wyse two werne fyrste lytell maner dysacordaunt hygher one lower bene made euenlyche gree stonde nowe enfourme ye ben lyche goddes clerkes sayne determynacion shewen thre thinges hauen ye name goddes ben cleped saine man dyuell ymages yet one god al goodnesse grace al vertue cometh louyng trewe euerlastynge pryme cause al beynge thynges men bene goddes louynge trewe euerlastyng adopcion euerlastynge god dyuels ben goddes styrrynge maner lyuynge neyther bene trewe ne euerlastyng theyr name godlyheed han vsurpacion prophete sayeth al goddes gentyles saye paynim dyuels ymages bene goddes nuncupacion ben neyther lyuynge ne trewe ne euerlastynge wordes celape goddes ymages wrought mennes handes nowe reasonable creature adopcion alone arte greate god euerlastynge therby thou arte god cleaped let thy father maners entre thy wyttes thou myght folowe moche longeth thy father worshyppe nothynge thy kynde hys wyll declyne ne hys nobley peruerte thys wyse yf thou werche thou arte aboue thynges saue god alone say thyne herte serue hye place fully haue nowe declared thyne estate good thou folowe therafter abiection fyrste aleged worthines thy margarite shal lette shal forther ye encrease nowe declare ye last abiection nothyng may greue yes certes greue let muste nedes contrary maye ben proued se whyle glorious worldly welfunesse goodes welth maken men ryche tho dra companyes loo pryse name yeuen tho louteden blasours tho curreyden glosours tho welcomede flatterer tho worshypped thilke nowe deynen loke euery wight erthly wele habaudant hold noble precious benigne wyse shall degre men hym set al sothe contrary tho thynges ne neuer well hym behaue hath vertue haboudaunt manyfolde maners welthed suche erthly goodes holde foole sayd hys wyt sotted lo howe false auer holde trewe lo howe trewe cleaped false wantynge goodes also lady dygnities offyce maken men mykel comended thus good oute hys pere shuld men fynde truely trowe suche praysed one another shulde make hym knowe shulde wyse ben loked onely fooles well wotte desyren suche new thinges wherfore woder thilke gouernoure whome alone cause proceden gouerne thynges whych hath ordeyned thys world werkes kyndely bodyes gouerned vnstedfast happyous thynge rule reason whych shewen course certayne thynges suffreth slydyng chaunges mysturnen suche noble thynges ben men arne fayre parsell erthe holde vpperest degre vnder god benigne thinges ye saide right nowe selfe shulde neuer man haue bene set worthy place degre ordeyned noble ala thou knyttest purueyaunce al thynges lokest thou amenden defautes se shrewes han wicked maners sytten chayres ne lambes punyshen wolues shulden punyshed lo vertue shynende naturallly pouertie lurketh hydde vnder cloude moone false forsworne knowe selfe aue yeftes hath vsurped shyne daye lyght wt peynture men praysynges truely thylke forged lyyt fouly shuld fade trouth away colour fayned thus night turned daye daye nyght wynter sommer sommer wynter dede mysclepyng folyshe people quod wenest thou thynges howe felest thou thyne herte gouernaunce yt thys cometh aboute certes wotte neuer yf fortune hath graunt aboue lede ende men lyketh ah nowe se quod thentent thy meanyng lo bycause thy worldly goodes ben fullych dyspente thou berafte dygnite offyce whych thou madest gatheryng thylke goodes yet dyddest office cou sayle wyse thynge ended true vnto hem whose profyte thou shuldest loke seest nowe many thylke heruest made mokel glosing deineth nought forther enhaunsen false shrewes wytnessynge trouthe thynges greueth thyne herte sene thy selfe thus abated fraylte mankynde ne setteth lytel lesers suche rychesse haue neuer moche vertue thou wenest thy iewell renne dyspyte ben accepted grace thys shal nothyng hynder nowe fyrst thou wost wel thou lostest nothing euer thou myghtest chalege thyne owne nature brought forthe come thou naked thy mother wombe thou haddest rychesse thou shalt entre ende euery fleshly body shalt thou haue wyth euery rychesse thou haste tyme thy lyuynge ny lente thou myght therin chalenge propertie se euery thyng ne owne may therwyth hym lyketh yeue kepe ryches thou playnest lost yf thy myght stretched ferforth fayne thou woldst haue hem kept multiplied mo ayenst thy wyl ben departed fro wherfore neuer thyn thou laudest ioyest wyght stuffed maner rychesse yu arte yt beleue begyled thou wenest thylke ioy selynesse el ease hath loste suche happes ben vnsely yea forsoth wel woll proue vnsely wyse prayse ye tother ye cotrary lacked howe vnsely begyleth sheweth thentent workyng et ecotra selynesse begyleth prosperite maketh iape blyndnesse wyndeth hym make sorowe withdraweth wolt thou prayse hym better sheweth yu hys herte tho bytade wordes dispytous ye gloseth thinketh theyr absence many harmes certes one comende lacke dyspyce ha ryght ease whyle lasteth gloseth flatereth lyghtly voydeth whe moste plesautly sheweth euer absence tene sorowe herte vnsely wyth bytande chere sheweth doth wherfore vnsely dothe begyle selynesse dysceyueth vnsely put awaye doute one maketh men blynde openeth theyr eyen shewyng wretchednesse one ful drede lese owne sobre maketh men dyscharged mokell heuynesse burthen one draweth man good ye haleth hym vertue hooke thoughtes wenyst thou thy dysease hath done mokel wynne euer yet thou lostest euer contrary made wynne greate good thy thynkynge knowe hertes thy sothfast fredes pardy ben proued ye ful trewe haue dysceuered false trewly goynge ylke brotel ioy ther yede awaye ylke thyne proper neuer lyghtly departed thyne owne good therfore leaueth styl wyth nowe good quod howe moche woldest thou somtyme haue boughte thys knowyng thy frendes flatterynge flyes glosed thou thought thy self sely thou playnest losse rychesse hast founden dere worthy thynge thou clepest vnsely hath made moche thynge wynnen also conclusion frende nowe leaueth hys herte fro thyne helpes yf margarite denyeth nowe suffre vertues shyne wardes wyth spreadynge beames farre farther yf thou sely worldly ioye trewely saye el somdele blame ah peace quod speake nomore thys myne hert breaketh thou touchest suche wordes well quod let v syngen thou hearest thynges thys tyme pthus endeth fyrste boke testament loue foloweth seconde welthe maye founden al thys world well sene lo howe moost comforte wende moste supposed haue hadde ful answere contrary thoughtes sodaynly vanysshed workes man faren wyse folke wenen beste entente haue wylles perfourme anone chaungynge lyft syde ye ryght halue tourneth clene another kynde neuer shall come fyrste plyte doynge thys wrongful sterynge soone wysed knowynge purpose begynnynge dureth yet yf god hys grace tyme woll graunt thynke perfourme thys worke haue begonne loue thynne wytte inspiracion hildeth al grace woll suffre greuously god wotte haue suffred great throwe romayne emperour whyche vnite loue shulde accorde euery wyth cause auaunce namely sythe thys empyre corrected many sectes heresie faith seruyce rule loues religion trewlye al shende errontous opinion maye lenger suffre many menne ben sayne loue ben grauel sande wyth see ebbynge flowynge woweth ryches sodaynly vanysheth sayne loue shuld wyndy blastes stoundmele turneth phane glorye renome whyche lustes varyaunt people areysed stylled many also wenen sonne moone sterres loue shulde ben fou den amonge planettes moste soueraynly shynen dygnityes reuerence estate rather good han occupyen ful many also ben okes huge postes supposen loue grou ded strength might mowen helpen theyr owne wretchednesse gynne fall suche dyuersyte sectes ayenst ryghtfull byleue loue errours ben forth spredde loues seruau te trewe rule stedfaste faythe place darne apere thus irrecuperable ioy went anoy endlesse entred man aryght reproueth suche errours confyrmen theyr wordes sayne bad noble good goodnes badde whyche folke prophet byddeth wo without ende also many tonges great false techinges gylynge maner principally tymes wyth wordes also wyth armes loues seruauntes professe hys religyo trewe rule pursewen confouden dystroyen moche holy father oure christen faythe aproued strengthed iewes resonable dyuinite lerned proued thilke fayth resones wyth authority olde testament newe pertinacye distroy paynyms beestes houndes holde put hem theyr errour myracles god shewed thynges fygured comynge thagel shepeherdes sterre paynyms kynges sayeth angel reasonable resonable creature sterre myracle people bestial lerned werne sent enforme louers clerke connyng al mightes truly haue grace vertue myracles ne dyscomfyte falsheedes suffyseth authorites alone sythen suche heretykes mayntenours falsytes wherfore wote wel sythen ben men reason approued hem clowde erroure hath reason bewonde probable resons whych catchende wyt rightfully may sytte trauaylynge studye haue ordeyned hem wyth ye authorite mysglosed mannes reason graunt shall enduced gynneth penne quake thynken sentence enuyous people whych alwaye ben redy ryder goer skorne iape thys leude boke rancoure hate theyr hertes shullen dyspyse althoughe booke leude yet shall ben leude holden wycked wordes many maner apayred certes thynketh sowne theyr bad speche ryght nowe full myne eares good precious margarite myne herte shulde wepe yf wyste ye token hede suche maner speche trewly wotte wel wysedom shal asterte god maker kynde wytnesse toke none enuy ne yuell haue drawe thys matter together onely goodnesse maintayne errours falsytees destroye wherfore sayde wyth reason thynke thylke forsayd errours distroye dequace reason suche yf enduce men loues seruyce trewe beleue parfyte blysse yet full fayth credence deserte fully mowe suffise sythen faythe hath meryte mede mannes reason sheweth experience doynge vtterlye reason parfyte blysse loue waye may make comprehended lo parcell louers ioye parfyte scyence good seruyce theyr desyre comprehende bodely doynge lykyng soule glasse haue contemplacyon tyme comynge thylke fyrste ymagyned thought face face beholdynge herte reason vnderstandynge make hys heuen feled knowe wythout assaye doynge certes none sythen loue cometh suche fruyte blysse loue selfe moste amonge vertues clerkes sayne sede suche spryngynge place countreys al worldes shulde ben sowe welawaye thylke sede forsake mowen ben suffred lade tyllers see werke wythout medlynge cockle badde wedes whych somtyme stonken hath caught name loue amonge ydiotes badde meanynge people neuer later yet men cleape thylke kynge precyousest kynde wyth many eke name thynges foule yeuen ylke noble name sheweth well maner men haue great lykynge worshyppynge thilke name wherfore thys worke haue wryt tytled loues name haue auowed maner sacrifice euer radde mowe merite excellence thylke name wexe authorite worshyppe takynge hede entente ordayned infeeres mowen moued euery thynge whome owande occasyon done hys ende aristotle supposeth actes euery thynge ben maner hys fynall cause fynal cause noblerer el euen noble thylke thynge fynally thilke ende wherfore accion thyng euerlastyng demed eternal temporal sythen fynal cause ryght actes boke loue loue noble wherfore though boke leude cause wt stered ought done noble forsothe ben bothe bycause connynge yonge canne yet crepe leude b c haue sette lernyng passen tellyng thre yet yf god wyl shorte tyme shall amende leudnesse ioynyng syllable whyche thyng dulnesse wytte maye thre letter declare trewly saye goodnesse margaryte perle wolde yeue mater endityng many clerkes certes mercy swetter lyuynges wherfore lyppes mowen suffyse spekyng full laude worshyppe shulde knowynge order heuen putteth resones erthe sothe may wt blere eyen shynyng sonne vertue bright whele margaryte behold therfore yet maye discryue vertue wolde tyme comyng another tretyse thorowe goddes grace sonne clerenesse vertue knowe howe enlumyneth al day thynke declare meane whyle cofortable lady ganne syng woder mater endityng latyn trewly noble colour rethorykwyse knytte craftely yt connyng wol stretche reme bre sentence trow somdele haue mynde certes woder swete sowne touched al lamentacyon wyse werbles myrthe lo thus ganne synge latyn may co strewe englyshe tonge ala heuenly bodyes light course shewen nature yaue hem co maundement gynnyng first age thynges free choyce reson han none vnderstondynge man ought passe thynge doynge ryght course kynde ouer whelmed sothnesse wrongfull tytle hath drawe sterre enuye gon syde clyps shulde shynande sonne ofte seyl wened thilke errour thorowe come shulde ben myne owne defaute trewely therfore haue withdrawe made dwellynge lande yle selfe occian closed yet sayn many haue harberowed god wote faylen thynges greuen thynke namely passed gladnesse thys worlde wonte dysporte hygh lowe nowe fayled wolde maystries haue thylke stoundes heuen hyghe aboue saturnes sphere seasonable tyme lodged nowe come queynte consaylours house woll suffre soiourne wherof pyte yet sayne haue celler wyth wyne shede gernere corne layde couered wyth whete sacke sowed wolle purse money fast knytte amonge pannes mouled wyche presse amonge clothes layde wyth ryche pelure arayed stable among horse beestes hogges shepe nete manye wyse thou maker lyght wynkynge thyne eye sonne queynt wost ryght well trewe name neuer thus herberowed somtyme forne sonne seuenth partye smyten bare bothe crosse mytre yeue wolde pope went fote tho worshypped holye churche kynges baden crownes holde lawe set shulde tofore iuge well poore durste shewe hys grefe ryche hys money defended tho taylages redy poore pay made gret feestes tyme noble soges maryed damoselles getyl feture withouten golde rychesse poore clerkes wytte schole sette church made persones preache tho seruyce holy churche honest deuoute pleasaunce bothe god people nowe leude symonye auaunced shendeth holy churche nowe stewarde achates nowe courtyour hys debate nowe eschetoure hys wronges nowe losell hys songes personer prouendre alone wyth whych manye thriftye shulde encrease yet thys shrewe behynde free herte forsake losengeour take lo accordeth suche ben voluntarye lustes haunten courte rybaudye tyl midnight woll playe wake churche matyns behynde yuell disposycion hys stomake therfore shulde eate beane breed dyd hys syre estate therwith strenghthen hys auter broke lowe lythe poynte gone erth hys horse muste ben easy hye beare hym ouer great water hys chalyce poore hath ryche cuppes towayle shete god shal ben handled meate borde shal ben borde clothes towelles many payre masse serued clergyon fyue squiers hall poore chaunsell open hole euery syde beddes sylke wyth tapytes goyng aboute chambre poore masse boke leude chapelayne broken surplyce wyth manye hole good houndes many hounte harte hare fede theyr feestes poore men haue great care euer craue nothynge offren wolden haue hem doluen amonge legystres dare come doynge sayne maken hem nedy ne wolde nothynge haue towne tort forthe nought worthe hawe aboute pleasen men thylke greuous torcious ben myght doynge thynges forne sayde mowe well yf men lyste ryme trewly acorde nothynge moche al thynges shulden ryght ben gouerned sorye se gouernaunce fayleth thus sene smale lowe gouerne hye bodyes aboue certes polesye naught forbode gouernaunce treaten enformen right beestly wytte shulde ben subiect reason erthly power selfe lower shulde ben subiect hygher worth thy bodye gouerned wyth thy soule ryght lytell naught worthe erthely power reignatyfe prudence heedes gouerne smale whyche heedes smale owen obey suffre gouernaunce soueraynnesse ayenwarde shulde thynke thys wyse seruaunt creature delyuered lorde defendour mayster enfourmer possessoure possessyon hem lyche tree whiche sparowes shullen stelen byrdes noryshe forthe brynge vnder suretye ayenst raueynous foules beestes tyraunt selfe smale reste quyete heedes well disposed owen soueraynes helth prosperyte pray doynges mayntenaunce therof performe wythouten admynistracion rule maner gouernauce wyt haue hem grace come thinges yet shulde cease tyll theyr heedes cleped although profyte pleasaunce shulde folowe trewlye gouernaunce ne medlynge ought clayme ne heedes hem put trewly amonges cosynage dare come yf rychesse meane sothly bodily goodes maketh nygh cosynage ther neuer propynquite ne alyauce lyue ne shulde haue nere medling maners wherfore kyndly ther leged pouert kynred behynde rychesse suffreth hym passe truly saith come neuer iaphetes chyldre wherof sory iaphetes chyldren pouert linage ben rekened caynes chyldren ryches maked iaphetes heires ala thys wonder chaunge bytwene tho two no chyldren sythen iaphetes ofspryng comeden knightes cayn discended ye lyne seruage brother chyldre lo howe gentyllesse seruage cosyns bothe discended two bretherne one body wherfore saye sothnesse gentylesse kynrede maken gentyll lynage succession without deserte man selfe nowe lyne alysanndre noble el hector troye discended ryght bloode lyne fro king artour parde syr perdicas kyng alisandre made heire grece kynges bloode hys dame tombystere kynred ben getyles dayes trow therfore good gentylesse semeth maner necessyte input gentylmen shulden varyen fro vertues auncestres certes al maner lynage men ben euen liche byrth one father maker al goodnes enformed hem al mortal folke one sede arne greyned wherto auaut men lynage cosynage elde father loke nowe gynnyng god maker man person clerke ne worthy gentylesse norysheth hys corare wyth vyces vnresonable lustes leaueth kynde course whych ende hym brought forthe hys byrthe trewly vngentyll amonge clerkes may ben nepned therfore woll ben gentyl mote dauten hys fleshe fro vyces causen vngentylnesse leaue also reignes wicked lustes drawe hym vertue place gentylnesse gentylmen maketh speke feminyne gendre generall tho persones reuerence one euery wyght honoureth bou tie noblesse ymade god dere hys moder became hath great worshyp nyll nothynge open declare thynge ayenst secte maye wene vertue al worthynesse pleasaunce hem haboundeth although wold thyng speke trewly may fynde yuel hem maner mater right wyth wordes stynte lamentable melodye ganne wyth lyuely herte praye yf lykynge vnto noble grace wold deyne declare mater fyrste begonne whiche lefte stynte speke beforne gan synge thys newe thyng sene menne desyren mater whyche selfe caused voyde ah good lady victorie strength proued aboue al thynge iugement esoram whose lordshyp ligne right emperour comaundeth whether thilke ben wome whose lykenesse ye aperen right man halte principalte thyng vnder beynge masculyne gender mo gender ben masculyne femenyne remenaunt ben gendres grace facultie grammer ryght femenyne woman holden vpperest degree thynges vnder thilke gendre conteyned bryngeth forth kynges whyche ben lordes see earthe al people wome ben borne norysshe hem graffen vynes maken men comforte gladde cheres sorowe dethe mannes herte without woman beyng impossible conne swetnesse crewel herte rauyshe make meke buxome benigne wythout violence meuynge beautie theyr eyen el maner fetures me desyres yea tha golde precious stone eyther rychesse thys degree lady selfe manye hertes men haue bounden parfyte blysse womankynde ben men wenen nothynge el also lady goodnesse vertue woman properte discrecyon well knowen lytelnesse malyce desyre good asker waye conne warne ye thanne woll passe kynde werchynge sectes generall discrecyon wotte wel ye wol enclyne prayere grace requeste shall fully ben graunted certes thus parte fareth al mankynde praye crye woman grace fayne manye fantasyes make hertes enclyne desyres whan sely wome freelte theyr kynde beleuen wordes wenen al gospell promyse behestes graunt hertes fulfyllen lustes wherthrough theyr lyberte maystreship toforn thralled maked souerayn prayed fyrste seruaunte voyce prayer vsed anone fylled luste manye trewe lytell hede take ye suche kyndenesse wyth traysoun anon ye thynke hem begyle let lyght thynge whyche fyrste ye maked wonder dere thyng woman loue wight er hym well knowe haue proued many halfe euery glyttryng thynge nat golde vnder colour fayre speche many vice may hid conseled therfore rede wyght trust rath men chere speche right gylefull full ofte wherfore without good assay nat worthe many truste trewly right kyndely euery man thynketh woman betraye shewe outward al goodnesse til haue wil performed lo byrde begyled mery voice foulers whistel whan woman closed nette wol ye cause fynden beare vnkyndenesse vnhande falsete vpon putte youre owne malycious trayson wyth suche thynge excuse lo han woman none wrech vengeaunce bloder wepe tyl hem lyst stynte sorily mishap complayne put wenynge men ben vntrewe howe often haue men chaunged loues lytell whyle el faylyng theyr wyll theyr place hem sette frenshyp shal one fame another lyste haue thirde delyte el loste bothe packe clothes fayre nay god wot maye nat tell thousande partes wronges trechery suche false people make neuer good bonde sette ye myte whan hert tourneth wenen sorow dey pyte false herte slowe towne ala therfore yt euer anye woman wolde take anye wyght grace tyll knowe full whome myght assayes trust woman cone crafte queynte knowynge vnderstande false disceyuable coniectementes mannes begilynges lo howe fareth though ye men gronen cryen certes disceyt preueth well thendes werkynge howe many woman haue ben lorne wyth shame foule shent long lastyng tyme thorowe menes gyle haue ben disceyued euer fame shal dure theyr dedes radde songe many londes han done recoueren shal neuer alwaye ben demed lightly suche plyte ayen shulde fall whyche slaunders tenes ye false men wicked ben verey cause ryght ought shame reproues holy discende thus arne ye nyghe vntrewe youre fayre speche youre herte full fyckell cause han ye woman dispyse better fruyte ben ne swetter spyces youre behoue mowe ye fynde farre worldely bodyes stretchen loke theyr formynge makynge theyr persones god ioye paradyce goodnesse man propre bodye maked sawes byble rehersynge goddes wordes thys wyse good mankynde make hym helper lo paradyse helpe tree graffed whyche lynage man discendeth yf man noble frute noble frute sprongen blysse paradyse mennes sory hertes yet thys tree abydeth noble helpes ben tree gentyll iewell ben worshypped euery good creature hem anoyeth dothe hys owne shame comfortable perle ayenst tenes euerye companye myrthed theyr present beyng trewely wyste neuer vertue woma therof rote heauen worse though sarazins lyen faythe vntrewe though rennogates maken theron leasynges fyre dothe anye wyght brenne blame hys owne wytte put selfe farre heate fyre gentyllest moste element comfortable amonges fyre chefe werker fortherynge sustenaunce mankynde shall fyre ben blamed brende foole naturelly hys owne stulty wytte sterynge ah wycked folkes youre propre malyce shreudnesse selfe ye blame dispyse precioust thyng youre kynde whyche thynges amonge moste ye desyren trewely nero hys chyldren ben shrewes dispysen theyr e wyckednesse gylyng disclaundryng thylke moste hathe hem gladed pleased impossyble write nempne neuer ye later yet say knoweth way may lightly passe eke herbe proued may safely smertande sore ben layde say proued nothyng yuels gesse thynges haue rehersed warne woman al one lyghtly without good assaye ye assenten mannes speche sonne day light knowen moone shyneth nyght nowe thy self quod haue ofte sayd knowe wel thyne herte thou arte none al tofore nempned people knowe wel contynaunce thy seruyce neuer sythen set werke myght thy margaryte plesaunce frendshyp ne fayrehede none poynte moued frome thyne herte wherfore myne housholde hastely wol thou entre ye parfyte priuyte werkynge make knowe thy vnderstondynge one pryuy famyliers thou desyrest fayne tho thynges lefte yea forsothe great blysse nowe thou shalt wene woman condycyons fayre speche suche thynge belongeth thou shalt vnderstond fyrste amonge al thynges cure seruyce parfyte blysse doynge desyred euery mannes herte neuer moche wretche euerye man trauayleth dyuers studye seke thylke blysse dyuers wayes al endes knyt selynesse desyre perfyte blisse suche ioye whan men haue gotten lyueth nothynge ben coueyted howe desyre suche perfectyon seruyce kyndely sette louers hertes yet erronyous opinyons mysturne falsenesse wenyng although mennes vnderstandynge mysturned knowe whyche shulde ben way vnto person whyther abydeth yet wote loue euery wyght weneth yt thyng coueyted moste shulde come thylke loue parfyte blysse seruauntes fulle blysse may lacke anye thynge blysse anye syde eke foloweth must haue full blysse lacke blysse loue syde therfore ladye tho thylke blysse haue desyred sothe toforne selfe wayes rich dignite power renome wenynge tho thrages ben thylke blysse ayenst heere turneth whan supposed beste thylke blysse haue get come ful purpose seruyce sodaynly hyndred throwen fer abacke thynketh impossyble come lefte woll well therfore hast thou fayled thou wentest hye way lytel misgoyng gynnynge causeth mykyll erroure ende wherfore thylke blysse thou fayledest hauynge rychesse ne none thynges thou nempnedest mowen nat make suche parfyte blysse loue shall shew therfore nat worthy thylke blysse yet somwhat muste ben cause waye thylke blysse ergo suche thyng way lytell vsage nat openlye yknowe felest thyne herte seruyce whyche thou art entred wenest aught thy selfe yet hye waye blysse shall shewe thou shalte nat consaye contrary good lady altho suppose herte yet wolde thyne wordes howe ye meanen mater quod shall wyth good wyl thylke blysse desyred deale ye knowe altho nat parfytly kyndely entention ledeth therto thre maner lyuenges suche way shewed euery wight world haue thys blysse one thylke thre wayes lyues muste procede whyche opynions great clerkes arn name cleaped bestiallich resonablich vertuous manliche worldelich bestialliche lustes delytable nothynge restrayned brydell reason ioyeth yeueth gladnesse hert ayenst reason lykened bestyall lyueng whyche thynge foloweth lustes delytes wherfore suche thynge maye nat precious blysse mayster al vertues abyde youre father forne haue cleaped suche lusty lyuenges flesshe passyons desyre whyche innominable fore god man bothe determination suche wyse accorden suche passyons desyre shull nat nempned holden absolute frome lyuenges prouynges lyueth lyuenges manlyche resonable declare mater begonne make fullye haue vnderstandynge manlich lyuenges whiche holden worldlich thynges ignoraunce made letter woll nepne forsayd wayes name coclusions first rich dignyte renome power shull thys worke cleped bodily goodes hath ben gret throwe mane trust selynesse loue rich suffysance haue mayntayned begon worldly catel dignite honour reuerece hem werne vnderput maistry therby obey renome glorie people praysyng lustes hert hede takyng qualite maner power trouth lordshyps mayntenaunce thynk procede forth doynge whyche thynges longe tyme man coueytise commune hath ben greatly grou ded come blysse seruyce trewely begyled princypall muste nedes fayle helpynge mowe nat auaile se holdest hym poore nedy yes parde hym dishonored moche folke deyne nat reuerence soth hym mightes faylen mowe nat helpen certes semeth al men shuld holden wretch wenest nat lytell renome rather praysynges mo men tha fewe nat shame soth shame villany hym coueyteth renome folke nat praise name tha preyse sothe thou sayst soth thynges folowed suche maner doynge wenden ryches suffysaunce power might dignyte worshyp renome glorie wherfore disceded disceyuable wening seruice disceyte folowed thus general thou al worche faylen blysse ye longe han desyred wherfore truly lyfe reason hye way thys blysse thynke openly declare herafter neuer later yet lytell comforte thy herte shewyng way thou arte entred thy selfe thy margaryte maye know set hye way wol enforme wise thou hast fayled thy first purpose bycause thou wentest wronge leftest hye way thy ryght syde thus thou lokedest worldly lyueng thyng ye begyled lightly therfore lytel assay thou songedest whan turned thy purpose shewed parte hye waye tho thou abode therin dethe ne ferdnesse none enemy miyt ye thilke way reue euer one thyn hert come ylke blysse whan thou arested fyrst tyme enprisoned yu loth chaunge thy way thy hert thou wendest haue thou shuldest routh sene miscaried wyst wel thyne ablenesse seruyce forther encrease come selfe wythout mean visyt thy person comforte thy hert perdy coming thou greatly gladed whiche tyme disease care tene myght moue thy herte yet gladde greatly enpited howe continually thou haddest mynde wyth good auysement thy conscience whan thy kyng prince huge wordes gret loked variaunce thy speche euer thou redye sake plesaunce margarite peerle many mo thy bodye oblyge marces doynge yf anye contraryed thy sawes stedfast way maketh stedfast herte wyth good hope ende trewely woll thou well knowe se set chaungyng hert haddest seruyce made thou haddest grace thy kynge foryeuenesse mykell misdede gracious kyng arte thou mykell holden whose grace goodnesse somtyme herafter thynke enforme wha shew grounde morall vertue groweth brouyt ye werke brouyt thys grace aboute made thy herte hardy trewly haddest thou fayled purpose neuer taken wyse therfore say thou might well truste come thy blysse sythen thy gynnyng hath ben harde euer graciously thy hertes desyre hath proceded syluer fyned wyth manye heates men knowen trewe safely men may trust alay werkynge disease hath proued waye hence forwarde thou thynkest holde nowe good fayth ladye quod tho nowe semeth hye waye ryght yea forsoth quod nowe wol dysproue thy fyrste wayes whyche many men wenen gette thylke blysse moche euery herte hath caught full loue tyed wyth queynte knyttynges thou shalt vnderstande loue thylke forsayd blysse toforne declared prouinges shal hote knot hert well inpossession wol wel vnderstande nowe also knotte herte muste ben one another knowe thy desyre woll thou vnderstande mater ben sayd thy selfe dysprouing thy fyrst seruyce strenghthynge thylke thou hast vndertake thy margaryte perle goddes halfe ryght well fele al thys case possible trewe therfore admitted al togither vnderstaden well termes loke contradiction thou graunt god woll thynges wol fayle yf graunt contradiccyon shulde graunte impossible foule inconuenience whych thinges ladye ywys herafter thynke kepe well quod thou knoweste hat euerye thynge cause wherthrough thyng hath beynge cleped caused yf rychesse causen knotte herte thylke rychesse arne cause thylke precious thyng beyng sentence aristotle euerye cause dignitie hys thynge caused wherthrough foloweth rychesse bene dignitie tha thilke knot rychesses arne kindly naughty badde nedy thylke knotte thyng kyndely good mooste praysed desyred ergo thinge naughtye badde nedye kyndelye vnderstandynge worthye thyng kyndely good desyred praysed consequence false nedes antecedent mote bene condition rychesses ben badde naughty nedy yt woll proue wherfore mowe cause thyng glorious good rychesse thou hast nede haste thou helpe hem kepe ergo thou nedeste rychesse whyche nede thou shuldest haue yf thou hem wantest must rychesse bene nedy theyr hauinge maken nedy helpes suretie thy rychesse kepe wherthrough foloweth rychesse bene nedy euery thynge causyng yuels badde naughty rychesse one causen misease another mowen euenly stretche al wherof cometh plee debate thefte begylynges rychesse wynne whych thynges bene bad richesse arne caused ergo thylke ryches bene badde whych badnesse nede bene knytte rychesse maner kyndely propertie euery cause caused accorden foloweth thylke rychesse haue accordaunce badnesse nede cause asketh also euery thyng hath hys beyng cause tha yf ye cause distroyed beyng caused vanyshed rychesse causen loue richesse distroyed loue shulde vanyshe thylke knot trewe maye vanyshe goynge richesse ergo richesse cause knotte many men sayd setten cause knotte rychesse thilke knytten rychesse nothynge yuell thylke person euer ben wenen rychesse worthy make cause wene thylke rychesse better tha person comenly aske rather quantyte qualyte wenen well hem selfe coniunction hys lyfe hys soule precious mykel hath rich ala howe maye holden thynges precious noble neyther han lyfe ne soule ne ordynaunce werchynge lymmes richesse bene worthy whan ben gatherynge departing ginneth loue men praysyng auerice gatheryng maketh hated nedy many helpes whan leueth possession suche goodes gynne vanysh entreth sorow tene theyr hertes badde strayte ben thylke theyr departing maketh men teneful sory gatheryng hem make men nedy moche folke one mowen togyder moch therof haue good gest gladdeth hoste al hys meyny badde gest maketh host nedy aferde hys gestes goyng certes wondreth therfore comune opinion thus worth yt hath catell loke thou opinion yf gold money maner richesse shinen thy sight whose thyne tho haue lytle beautye thyng coparison kynd therfore ye shulde set worthinesse thyng lower tha self ryches fayrenes worthines thylke goodes yf ther preciousnesse hem thine thou madest hem neuer come shul yt wherfore enbrasest yu wightes goodes tho thine kind hath draw hem hem self soth goodes erth bene ordayned fode noryshynge yf thou wolte holde apayed wyth ye suffyseth thy kynde thou shalte daunger ryches kinde sufficeth lytle thynge taketh hede yf thou wolte algates wyth superfluite rychesse throted thou shalt hastelych anoyed elles yuell ease fayrnesse feldes ne habitation ne multytude meyne maye rekened rychesse thyne owne bad great sclaunder vylany occupyer good fayre ye mater workeman hem made praise shuld otherwyse bountie copted thine thilke goodnesse fayrnesse proper tho thynges hem selfe tha yf thine sorow wha wend ne glad pope pryde whan thou hem haste bountie beauty cometh owne kynde thyne owne person fayre bene theyr hauynge whan thou haste hem fayre thou haste hem thou hast geten hem fayrnesse selfe ther vaylance men demed rychesse outforthe wenen men haue proper good selfe seche straunge thynges trewly condition good wenyng ye mystourned wene noblenesse selfe goodes beautie thynges pardy beastes han felynge soules haue suffysaunce owne selfe ye bene lyke god seken encrease suffysaunce excellent kind low thynges ye great wroge hym made lordes ouer erthly thynges ye put worthinesse vnder nombre fete lower thynges foule wha ye iuge thylke rychesse worthynesse put ye self estimacyon vnder thylke foule thynges leue ye knowyng yourselfe ye vyler tha dombe beest ye cometh shreude vice ryghte thylke person yt louen none yuel dere worthynesse person straunge goodes sayth adornement knotte lyth thing hys errour perylous shreude wrieth muche venym moch welth knot moy good wha hath getten certes thus hath ryches wyth flyckeryng syght anoyed many often whan ther throw shrew coyneth al golde al precious stone mowen founde haue bandon weneth wight worthy haue thynges alone many hast thou knowe nowe late tyme yt rich supposed suffisaunce haue folowed nowe al fayled ye lady mysse medlynge otherwyse gouerned thylke rychesse shulde yee tho floode greatlye areysed throwe hemwarde grauel sande made medlyng ryght see yeueth flood draweth see ebbe pulleth ayen vnder wawe fyrste throwe yf good pyle noble gouernauce loue wel meanynge maner bene sadly grounded holde thylke gravel ye ayen lightly mow turne yf pyle bene trewe grauell sande wol abyde certes full warnyng loue shalte thou neuer thorowe hem gette ne couer yt lightly ebbe er thou ware wol ayen meue rychesse many haue tenes disease shuld haue therof fayled thorowe whiche nowe declared partly shewed rychesse shulde knotte herte neyther ben caused one ne trewly knott maye ben knytte trowe stedfast loue though rychesse fayled el rychesse knotte hert knotte false whan see ebbeth withdraweth grauel rychesse voydeth thilke knotte wol vnknytte wherfore trust way cause parfyte beyng rychesse suche knotte therfore another way must haue honoure dignitie wened yeuen ful knot yee certes opinion bene manye dignitie wyth honour reuerence causen hertes encheynen abled knytte togyther excellence soueraynte degree nowe yf dignitie honour reuerence causen thilke knot herte knot good profitable euery cause cause cause thinge caused thus good thynges profitable ben dignite honour reuerence caused ergo accorden dignity bene good wyth reuerences honoure contraryes mowen accorden wherfore reason ther shuld dignitie reuerece none honour accord wyth shrewes yt false haue bene cause shrewes many shreudnesse wt hem accorden ergo fro begynnyng argue ayenwarde tyl come last conclusyon cause knot lo day eye arne shrewes reuerence honoure dignitie yes forsoth rather tha good tha foloweth shrewes rather tha good shull ben cause knot contrary al louers bileued soth openly determyned holde nowe quod fayne wolde suche dignity accorden wyth shrewes quod woll shewe manyfolde wise ye wene quod dignites office ciite ye sune shyneth bryghte wythouten cloude whiche thynge whan comen handes malycyouse tyrauntes cometh muche harme greuaunce therof wylde fyre though brende strete certes dignite office werkes occupyer shewen malice badnes personne wyth shrewes maken manyfolde harmes muche people shaman often han rancour malyce gouernoure shulde bene maynteyned hath dignity caused debate rumour yuels yes god wote thynges haue bene trusted make mennes vnderstadyng encline many queynt thynges thou woteste well meane ye quod therfore dignitie suche thyng tene ywrought ayenwarde substauce dignitie chaunged relyed brynge ayen good plyte doyng doway doway quod betyde selde dignitie betake good mannes gouernaunce thynge recken dignity goodnesse parde bountie goodnes vse good gouernauce therfore cometh honoure reuerence shulde bene done dignitie bicause encreasynge vertue occupyer ruler bicause souerayntie dignitie sythen dignitie may vertue cause worthy worship goodnesse dignitie person yt maketh goodnesse dignitie shyne thys wonder thyng quod thynketh person dignitie worthye honoure goodnesse tho person badnesse magre hath deserued yet dignite leneth commended let quod thou errest right foule dignite badnes helper perfourme felonous doynge pardy kyndly good propertie kyndly vertue hadden hem selfe shrewes shulde hem neuer haue wyth hem shulde neuer accorde water fyre ben cotrarious mowen togyther bene assembled kynde wol suff e suche contraryes ioyne sythen eye experiece doyng sene shrewes haue hem often tha good menne syker mayste thou ye kyndly good suche thynges appropred pardy kyndly good wel one shulden euenliche vertue gouernauce ben worth one faileth goodnes another doth contrary sheweth kyndly goodnes dignitie grounded thys reason quod maye made generall bodily goodes comen ofte throw shrewes strog hath myght haue great burthyns lyght swyfte hathe souerante runnynge passe ryghte shrewe shreude thynges badde han wyrchyng ryght philosophy maketh philosopher seruice maketh louers ryghte dignity good vertuous shulde maken shrewes good turne malyce make hem vertuous proued cause rancour debate ergo good vtterly badde nero neuer bene emperoure shulde neuer hys dame haue slayn maken open priuitie engendrure herodes dignitie slewe many chyldre dignite king pompey wolde haue distroyed al italy therfore mokyl wisedome goodnes nedeth person malyce dignitie slyly bridel good bytte arest withdrawe case wolde praunce otherwise shulde trewly ye yeue dignity wrongful name cleping shulde hete dignitie moustre badnes mayntenour shrewes pardy shyne sune neuer bryght brynge forth heate ne sesonably herbes brynge erth suffre frostes colde erth baraine lygge time compas circute aboute ye wolde wonder dispreyse sunne mone full sheweth lyghte derke dymme syghte appereth make distruction ye water wol ye suppose vnder cloude clip priuy thing vnknowen wyttes cause suche contrarious doyng tha yf clerkes han ful insight knowyng impedime te enforme sothe idiotes ye bene yf ye yeuen credence thylke clerkes wordes yet doth tene sene many wretch reioycen maner planet trewly lytle con phylosophy el lore desyre hauen lightyng planettes yt wyse shew good ladye tell ye ye meane thynges lo quod dignity citie sunne mone nothyng kynd shewe theyr shynyng shulde sunne made brenyng hete loue fresed enuye mennes hertes feblenesse shynynge hete mone vnder olde cloude lyuenges water distroye lady supposed shined shulde yee quod nowe proued full beaute kyndly shynynge fayled wherfore dignitye hym seluen hath beautie fayrnesse ne dryueth nat awaye vice encreaseth cause knot se good trouth holde ye sonnes worthy reuerence dignity worthy worshyp maketh men harmes quod thou se wyse good man hys goodnesse wysenesse wolte thou hym worship therof worthy good skyl quod dewe suche reuerence worshyp haue quod shrewe hys shreudnesse tho put forth forne ferd yet worthy shreudnes vnworshypped reuerence part worthy haue cotrarious doyng belongeth good skyl righte besmyteth dignity thylke thinge aycuwarde hym smyteth el shulde smite ouer thou wost wel quod fyre euery place heateth water maketh wete kyndely werking yput hem thinges euery kyndly werkynge sheweth kynde though wight ben mayre citie manye wynter togyther come straunge place ther knowen shuld dignite haue reuerence tha neyther worshyppe ne reuerence kyndelye propre dignitie sythen shulde theyr kynde doyng yf yf reuerence ne worshyppe kyndly set dignity therin bene shewed tha goodnesse dignitie shewed proueth goodnesse kyndly hem grounded wy neyther worshyppe ne reuerence ne goodnesse dignitie doone none offyce kynde haue none propertie nature doenge false opinion people lo somtyme thilk citie werne dignitie noble yf thou lyst hem nempne bene nowe ouerturned bothe worshyppe name reuerence wherfore suche dignity haue kyndely werchynge worshyppe reuerence hathe worthynesse selfe ryseth nowe vanysheth varyaunt opynyon false hertes vnstable people wherfore yf thou desyre knotte thys iewell el yf thou woldest suppose shuld sette knotte maner dignitie thou weneste beautye goodnesse thylke somwhat encreaseth goodnesse vertue body dignitye hem selfe bene good ne yeuen reuerence ne worshippe owne kynde howe shulde yeue thynge waye mowe haue hem selfe sene dignitie emperour many mo mowe hem selue kepe theyr worshyp ne theyr reuerence lytle whyle vp downe vnstedfast hertes people boutie mow yeue wyth cloude lyghtlye leaueth hys shyning certes occupier mokyl appeyred sythen doynge dothe vylany hym maye mayntayne wherfore thylke waye knotte croked yf anye desyre come knotte muste leane thys waye lefte syde el shal neuer come avayleth ought power myght mayntenaunce worthy come thys knot parde yee hertes bene rauyshed maner thynges certes though fooles hert thing rauished yet therefore generall cause power ne syker parfyte herte loked nero moost shrewe one thylke men rede yet power make senatours iustices prince many landes great power yes certes quod wel quod yet myght help selfe disease wha gan fal many ensamples canst thou reme bre kynges great noble huge power holden yet myghte kepe hem selue wretchednesse howe wretched kyng henry curtmantyll er deyed moch couer wt hys membres yet one greatest kinges al normandes sprynge possession noble thinge clere power founden myghty kepe hym selfe nowe trewly greate fole thyng wolde sette knotte thyne herte also power realmes thylk greatest power amonges worldly power rekened yf suche power han wretchednesse hem selfe foloweth power febler condicion ben wretched wretchednesse shulde cause knotte euery wyght hath reason wote well wretchednesse waye maye bene cause none suche knotte wherfore power cause power haue wretchednesse hem selfe maye ryght lyghtly bene preued power lacke side side power power wretchednesse al power emperours kynges el theyr realmes whych power prynce stretchen wyde brode yet besyde ther mokell folke whyche hath comaundement ne lordshyp ther lacketh power hys nonepower entreth vnder spryngeth maketh hem wretch power wretchednesse nothynge el maner hath kinges porcion wretchednesse tha power trewly power bene vnmighty euer ben drede howe thylke power fro lesinge may keped sorowe drede sorily prickes euer hertes litle ye power careth ferdeth selfe maintayn vnmyghty ye wretchednes whych entred ferdful wenyng wretch selfe knotte ymaked wretchednesse betwene wretch wretch thyng bewaylen wherfore knotte shulde bewayled ther perfyte blysse supposed gynning ergo power nothing shulde cause knottes wretchednesse kyndly propertie suche power waye drede whiche mowe eschewe ne way lyne sikernesse thou wost wel nought mighty wold done yt may doone ne perfourme therfore quod kynges lordes han suffysaunce ful men thinges mowen well bene holden myghty comaudemetes ben done neuermore denied foole wot selfe mighty wotte nought myghty blynde might wote sothe quod yf wet must nedes ben drad lesen wot might dout yt mote nedes lese leadeth hym drede ben vnmyghtye yf retche lese lytle worth yt ye lesyng reson retcheth nothing myghty power strengthe lesyng shulde bene wythset whan cometh lesyng may wyth yt ergo thylke myght leude naughty mightes arne ylike postes pyllers vpright stonden greate might han beare many charge yf croke syde lytell thynge maketh hem ouerthrow thys good ensaple pyllers postes yt haue seneouerthrowed selfe hadden bene vnderput wyth helpes lyghtly fal tha holdeste thou hym mighty hath manye men armed many seruauntes euer adradde hem herte gasteth hem somtyme mote ye feare haue comenly agasteth hym ayenwarde werchen thus warnyshed mote warnish houre drede lytel myght right leude taketh hede semethe famulers kinges greate lordes shulde great myght haue although sypher augrym haue myght signifycation selfe yet yeueth power significacion clepe helpes post kepe hym fallynge certes quod thylke skylles bene leude yf ye shorers ben wel grounded helpes shullen slyden suffre charge fal myght lytle auayleth thynketh quod poste alone stondynge vpright vpon basse may lenger great burthen endure croken pillers theyr helpes grounde syker soth blynde bearynge lame gynne stomble shulde fal right pyllers enuyroned wyth helpes fallynge grounde fayleth altogyther ofte suche famulers theyr moost pryde prosperyte bene sodaynly ouerthrowen thou haste knowe many moment ferre ouerthrow couer might neuer whan heuynesse suche faylynge cometh case fortune mowe eschewe myghte power yf shulde strength thynges voyde weyue lo whiche thynge power tho men han bene agast tyme full hauyng syker yf wolde weyue drede mowe lytle worthynesse fye therfore naughtye thynge knot cause lo aduersitie thylke bene foe glosed semed frendes welthe thus arne hys famylyers foe enemyes nothynge werse ne myghty anoy familier enemye thynges maye weyue trewelye theyr myghte worth cresse ouer thing yt maye wythdrawe bridell hys fleshly lustes hys wretched complayntes nowe thinke thy selfe trewly mighty se waye yu lyeth knot thylke people tha setten hertes vpo suche myghtes power often bene begyled parde myghty maye anye thing another may done selue haue great power ouer hym ouer iustice demeth men ayenward hath bene often demed buserus slewe gestes slaine hercules geste hugest betrayshed many men collo betrayed swerde smytteth swerde shall smitten gan studyen thinges made countenaunce hande maner bene huyshte nowe lette sene quod thynketh somwhat wythin thy soule troubleth thy vnderstandynge saye quod tho thynketh although power haue suche myghte ouer haue ouer disproueth myght person yet may haue power myght neuer later se nowe thine owne leudnesse myghty may wythout wretchednes vnmyghty may sitte might ouer woll put wretchednesse thou might wythsytte ergo thou seest thy selfe foloweth nowe quod woldest thou skorne thou se flye han power done harme another flye thilk haue myght ne ayenturninge selfe defende yes certes quod frayler thyng quod fleshly bodye man ouer whyche haue oftentyme flyes yet lasse thyng flye mokel might greuaunce anoyenge withouten withsytting al thylke mannes mightes sythen thou frest thy fleshlye bodye kyndely power fayle shulde tha accident thing ben surete beyng substancial wherfore thylke thinges yt clepe power accident fleshly body may haue suretie might wanteth substanciall body waye knot loketh aright hye way shulde verily proued richesse dignite power ben trew way knot rath thynges knotte vnbounde wherfore thynges rede wight trust gette anye good knotte shul saye renome people mouthes shulde yt ben cause supposest yu thine hert certes quod yes trow fly resons dare sac ly say wol preue yt shrewes rath shul ben ye knot good yu ayenst kynde fayne quod wolde thynketh wondre howe renoume shoulde wel knyt shrewe good person renoume euery degree hathe auaunced yet wist neuer contrary shuld tha renoume accorde shrewe may synke stomacke tyll heare nowe quod haue sayd alwayes shrewes shull haue knot nedeth quod reherse anye wote well euery wyght kyndely reason shrewes knyttyng wol eschewe good ought thylke knotte haue howe el quod greate harme quod good weyued put espoire knot yf desired ala suche thynge thynke wene heuen wepeth se suche wroges bene suffred erth good ought haue wyght el goodnesse person may ben knowe outforth renome knower wherfore must renoumed goodnesse come knot must el lost carpen sothly great harme yf good might haue desyres seruyce thylke knot shrewe veyned ben knowen general lackyng pray sing renome cosequece foloweth shrewe ben praysed knyt good forsake vnknyt ah tho haue ye ladye bene abouten yet wolde se grace argumentes better declared good bad accorde lackyng praysyng thynketh ayest kynde nay shalt thou se yerne elementes han cotrarious quality kynde whiche mowe accorde nomore good bad quality accorde contraryes qualitie accorden qualitie erth drye water nexte bytwene therth wete drye ben contrary mowen accorde yet discordaunce boud accorde cloudes bothe elementes ben colde ryght eyre next water wete eke hote eyre hete contraryeth water colde thylke contraryoustye oned moysture moyst also fyre yt next eyre encloseth al drye wherthrough contraryeth eyre hete accorde ben hote thus accordauces discordautes ben ioyned maner accordaunce accorden connection knyttyng togyther accorde cometh maner melody yt ryght noble ryght good bad contrarye doinges lackyng praysyng good lacked praysed bad lacked praysed wherfore theyr contrarioustie accorde lackynge praysyng foloweth though good neuer mokel praysed oweth knit bad el bad renome hath must take wel ye good oweth forsoth wel renome way knot lo fole howe clerkes writen suche glorye renome glorie glorie thou arte none thynge thousandes folke great sweller eares many one hath full greate renoume false opynion varyaunt people fouler tha folke wrongfully ben praysed malyce people gyltelesse lacked nedes shame foloweth therof hem yt wronge prayseth also desertes praysed vilanye reprofe hym disclaudreth good chylde quod echeth suche renome conscience wyse man loketh measureth goodnesse sleuelesse wordes people sothe fastnesse conscience god nothyng fayre man name eched moch folkes praysyng fouler thynge mo folke praysen sayde lytle beforne folke straunge country nought praysen suche renoume may comen theyr eares bycause vnknowyng obstacle sayde wherfore folke praysen ryghte foule hym renome desyreth wetelesse folke praysen renoume enhaunce trowe thanke people nought worth remembraunce take ne procedeth wyse iudgement neuer stedfast perdurable veyne flying wynde wasteth encreaseth trulye glorye ought hated yf gentyllesse clere thyng renome glory enhauce rekenyng thy lynage gentyllesse thy kynne semeth gentylesse thy kynne praysynge renoume come thyne auncestres desertes yf praysynge renoume theyr desertes make theyr clere gentylesse mote nedes ben gentyl theyr gentil dedes yu thy selfe commeth suche maner gentylesse praysynge thy desertes gentylesse thyne auncesters forayne maketh gentyl vngetyl reproued yf thou contynuest theyr gentyllesse therfore wyse man one sayde better thy kynne bene gentyled thou glorify thy kynnes gentylesse haste deserte thereof thy selfe passyng beautie fleshly bodyes flyttyng mouable floures sommer yf thyne eyen good lynx may sene thorowe many stone walles fayre foule theyr entrayles maner hewe shoulde appere thy syght foule syght fayrenesse feblesse eyen kynde wherfore thylke shoulde waye knot whan thylke went knotte wendeth lo nowe proues none thinges mowe perfectlye ben vnderstandyng ben way duryng blysse knot nowe conclusyon matter herkeneth wordes sommer knowe wynter shorter cours draweth dayes decebre moneth iune sprynges may faden folowen october thinges ben vnbounden theyr olde kynde haue lost werke propre estate men volutarious wyll withsyt ye henens gouerneth thynges suffren thynges pacyently werche man estate yet wolde bene chaunged thus queynt thynges blysse desyred frute cometh springes ny anguysh bytter although whyle swete may withholde hastely departe thus al daye fayleth thinges fooles wende ryght thus haste thou fayled thy fyrste wenynge thinketh sayle drawe course starre de polo antartico shall neuer come northwarde contrary starre polus articus whiche thinges yf thou take kepe thy fyrst waye goinge pryson exyle maye cleped grounde falsed vnderneth haste thou fayled wyght wene blameth hym stynteth misgoing secheth redye waye hys blysse nowe thynketh quod suffyseth shewynge wayes dignitie rychesse renoume power thou loke clerely arne wayes knotte everye argument ladye tho ye han maked fore nempned mater thynketh hem full wytte conceyued shall nomore yf god wil contrary begyled fayne wolde e wyll blysse knotte declared myght fele better myne hert myght assente pursue ende seruyce hath gone quod melody heuen clerkes clepen armonye breakynge voyce maner swete thynge kyndly werchynge causeth ioye nombre recken ioyned reason wysedome quantitie proporcyon knyttyng god made thynge reason wytte proporcyon melodye mowe suffyse shewe wrytten great clerkes wyse earthlye thynges lyghtly studye trauayle knowynge maye getten suche heuenly melodye mokell trauayle wol brynge knowyng ryght lytle swetnesse paradyse hath rauyshed semeth ye slepten rested disease kyndly hertes therin ygrounded blysse two hertes full loue knyt may aright ben ymagyned euer theyr contemplacion full thoughty study pleasaunce mater bryngyng comforte eueryche therfore erthly thynges mokell mater lyghtly commeth lernynge knowledge vnderstondynge nygh eye nygh couetyse knyttynge hertes soueraygne desyre hath euerye wyght lytle hearynge heuenly connyng mokell materyall purpose earth ryght propertie seruauntes ben affyched sterynge lytle thynge desyre mokell mater lasse conscience blysse maner sowne delicious queynt voyce touched dynne note none impressyon breakynge laboure otherwyse nempne wantynge pryuye wordes paradyse terrestrye full delicyous melodye withouten trauayle sowne perpetual seruice full ioy coueyted endure onely kynde maketh hertes vnderstandyng slepe otherwyse may nempned ne maner name lykyng swetnesse declare al sugre hony mynstralsye melodye ben soote galle compariso maner proporcyon recken respecte thys blysfull ioye armonye melodye perdurable ioye may doinge betwene heuens elementes twey kyndly hertes ful knyt trouth naturall vnderstondyng withouten wenyng disceyte heuens planettes thinges contynually kyndely accordaunces foryeteth contraryous meanynges passyue disease may sowne euermore thyrsteth werkyng thinges proporcyon well ioyned vndoth thyng badnesse waye maye accompted certes thynge precious noble ala falsenesse euer wantruste shoulde mayntayned ioye voyde ala euer wretche shulde thorowe wrath enuy anglyng dare make shoue melody farre abacke openly dare ben vsed truly wretch ben fulfylled auy wrath wight el flebring tale suche wretch shall appeare openly euery wyghtes ere ful mouth charged mokell malyce moued many ininnocentes shende god wold theyr soule therwith st angled lo trouth blysse hyd ouer vnder couert hym hydeth dare come place waytyng shrewes comenly badnesse goodnesse amastryeth selfe soule ioye wolde bye yf goodnesse moche nobley melody goodnesse maye accompted materyall worlde truly none shalt thou vnderstonde euery thyng good contrariant destroying euyll howe el enuy wrath falsenesse ben generall wote euery man beinge ryght mynde knotte whiche haue blysse contraryaunt distroyeth maner euils ergo good hath caused wyght good dede fynde anye good yf knotte chefe cause nedes mote good causeth many good dedes euery cause worthyer thyng caused more possessyon thynges lesse ben compted kynge people hath possessyon realme ryght knot goodes thou myght recken thynges lasse hym lo geth oweth hys more cause worshyppe wyll tourne el rebell more defendynge voyde ryght euery goodnesse knotte cause worshyp oweth turne truly euerye thyng hath beinge profytably good nothynge hath ben profytably knot kynges mayntayneth hem theyr power mayntayne maketh mysse ben ame ded good gouernaunce doinge closeth hertes togyther ye rancour thresten lengest kepeth lengest gladded trowe heretyckes mysmeanynge people hence forwarde woll mayntayne knotte throughe shall ben mayntayned vtterly wol turne leaue theyr olde euyll vnderstondyng knytte goodnesse profer farre seruyce name seruauntes myght haue theyr iangles shal cease thynketh lacketh mater alege certes loue yf good wyll thus tourned thou sayest wolen truly perfourme yet shul abled partye blysse haue woll yet shull seruauntes werre well susteyne myne helpe mayntinauce ende theyr good trauayl shullen rewarde ben meded end lesse ioye bodye soule togyther shullen abyden euer action blysse withouten possible corruption action perpetuell werke withoute trauayle euerlastyng passyfe withouten labour continuel plyte without seasynge coueted endure tonge may tel ne hert maye thynke leest poynte blysse god brynge thyder contynueth well ende yu myght fayle thoughe thou spede yet shal passyon thy martred life ben wrytten rad toforne greate iupyter god routh hygh holownesse heuen syt trone euer thou shalt forwarde ben holden amoge heuens knyght myghtest penaunce bene discomfyted martyr lyuynglye goinge gnawen bone certes bene good wordes comfort lytle myne herte reioysed mery wyse ye heuen feleth ioye wha first herde therof speke quod wyst sothe disease comfort wolde folowe blysse ye haue often declared wolde well suffre passyon better chere thoughtfull sorowe endlesse thynke cast welfare yet dayneth euyll none herte none hede mewarde thorowe thynges wolde greatly wayes comfort disporte weten selfe lytle ni ben ymoued sorowes peysen balaunce weyght peese slynges daunger heuyly peysen drawe cause hyghe eyen semen lyght ryght lytle heuen skyes foule cloudes maken darke wether wyth great tempestes huge maketh mery dayes soft shynynge sunnes also yere withdraweth floures beautye herbes earth yeres maketh sprynges iolitie vere renouell paynted colour erth semeth gaye heuen see blasteth wawes throweth shyppes lyuyng creature great peryll hem dreden ryght see maken smothe water golden saylynge coforteth hem wt noble hauen first ferde hast thou lerned thy youth ye iupyter hath warderobe bothe garmentes ioye sorowe woste thou howe soone woll tourne garment care cloth blysse parde farre fro lo olde prouerbe aleged manye wyse whan bale greatest bote nye bore whereof wylte thou dismaye hope well serue well shall saue thy good beleue ye ye quod yet se reason blysse comyng wot cotingent may fal haue mokell done clere thyne vnderstandynge voyde erroures thy mynde woll proue reason thy wo maye alway enduren euery thynge kyndely quod gouerned ruled heauenly bodyes hauen full werchyng earth course bodyes course youre doinges bene gouerned ruled kynde thou wost wel course planettes proceden euerych synguler houres enterchaunged stondmele aboute submytted worchyng naturally suff e chaunges commeth transitory tymes maketh reuoluing yeres thus stondmele euerye hath full myght worchyng tyl al seuen han course worchinges possessyon houres dayes weke haue take name denominacyon seuen planettes lo sondaye gynneth fyrst houre noone saturdaye houre sunne ful myght worchynge sonday taketh hys name nexte hym foloweth venus mercurius mone saturnus iouis mar ayen sunne forth xxiiii houres togyther houre gynnynge second day stant mone master tyme rule mondaye taketh name course foloweth dayes generally cours nature bodyes chaungynge stynten certayne terme lymytted theyr fyrst kynde hem gouernementes elemented worlde proceaden sprynges constellacions engendrures folowen kynde reason wherefore course foloweth sorowe ioye kyndly moten entrechaungen theyr tymes alway wele alwaye woo may endure thus seest thou apertly thy sorowe wele mote bene chaunged wherefore suche case better syde euermore enclyne thou shuldest truly nexte ende sorowe anon entreth ioye maner necessitie wol ne may none betide thy contigence disproued yf thou holde opinyon anye thy wytte ryght leude wherfore full conclusyon thylke margaryte thou desyreste hath ben dere thy herte hast thou suffred many thoughtful disease hereafter shall cause mokell myrth ioye loke glad canst thou ben cease al thy passed heuynesse manifold ioyes woll blythlye speken thy myrthes ioye nowe haue yherde thy sorowes thy complayntes yf mowe ought thy ioye encrease trouth syde shal leaued maner trauayle myghtes ryght blythly woll helpe euer ben redy plese thanked lady al goodly maner worthely coude truly greatly reioysed myne hert fayre behestes profred slawe al wolde ordayne whyle lyfe lested thynketh ye haue ryght wel declared way ye knot shuld ben non disprouing thinges nowe ordre purpose asketh ye shulde shewe yf waye thyther whyche thylke waye shulde ben openly may sey hye waye full confusyoun thynges thou shalt vnderstande one thre lyues first sayd euery creature mankinde sprongen forth procedeth lyues bene thorowe name departed thre maner kyndes bestyallyche manlyche resonablyche two bene vsed fleshlye bodye thyrde soule bestyall amonge reas nables forboden euery lawe euery sect chrysten euerye wyght dispyseth hem lyueth lustes delyttes hym thrall bounden seruaunt thynges ryght foule suche ben counted werse men shall theyr degre ben rekened ne one alowed heretykes sayne chosen lyfe bestial voluptuouslye lyuen fyrst sayde manly reasonable lyuynges mater declare manly lyfe lyuyng flesh el fleshly wayes chese maye blysse knot conquered reason proued wherfore resonable lyfe must nedes haue syth away knotte fyrste tway lyues wherefore neades mote ben thyrde lyue flesh flesh resonablyeh manliche rekened clerkes therfore way commeth wol blithly declare se quod bodyly goodes manlyche lyuynges yelden sorowful stoundes smeretande houres wele remembre hym theyr endes worchynges ben thoughtfull sory ryght bee hath hadde honye anon flyght begynneth stynge thylke bodyly goodes last mot away stynge goinge entreth clene voydeth al blysse knotte forsoth quod thynketh wel serued shewig wordes although lytle respect amonge greate worthye yet fayre parcell thought tyme fortherynge sustenaunce whiche whyle dured thought hauyng mokell hony myne estate rychesse suffyciauntly weyue nede dignitie reuerenced worship power thought kepe fro myne enemyes semed shyne glory renoume manhode asketh meane wyght myne administration coude none euyls ne trecherye sothe cause put lady selfe weten wel tho confedecacyes maked soueraynes na seruaunt yet mokell meane folke woll fullye ayenste reason thilke mater mayntayne mayntenaunce glorye selfe often ye hauen sayde therof ought nothyng euyll layde mewardes sythen repentaunt tourned nomore thynke neyther tho thynges ne none suche susteyne vtterly
