destroy without medlynge maner myghtes howe nowe caste oute swetnesse blysse myscheuously stongen passed ioye sorowfullye muste wayle lyue wretche euery tho ioyes turned contrary rychesse nowe haue pouertye dignitie emprysoned stede power wretchednesse suffer glory renoume dispysed soulyche hated thus hath farne fortune sodaynly ouerthrowen wealth dispoyled trulye thynketh way entre ryght harde god graunt better grace er al passed ye way lady thought ryght swete certes loue lyst chyde ayleth thy darke dulnesse woll clerenesse ben sharped haue many reason shewed suche bodily goodes faylen yeue blis might ferforth wol stretche shame say thou lyest thy wordes thou ne hast wyst ryght fewe bodyly goodes al one commenly dwellen togyther plentie hath richesse kynne ashamed another lynage ryght noble well knowe pouerte hadleth leuer vnknow hath renome people praysyng maye haue ouer al hated defamed thynges ryght foule fayre semely dignite hym fayleth hath dignite croked lame el mishappen fouly dispysed thus pertable goodes dwellen comenlye one houshold ben selde lo reetched trust thynge yt wol accorde thynketh thou clepest thylke plyte thou selynes fortune thou sayest ye selynesse departed thou art wretche foloweth vpon thy wordes euerye soule resonable man may dye yf death endeth selynesse maketh wretch nedes fortune maketh ende soules deth ye body wretchednesse shuld lyuen know many han getten blysse heuen theyr deth howe may lyfe maken men blysful wha passeth yeueth wretchednesse manye tymes blysse yf lyfe con lyue shulde wolt thou accompt fortune fyrst hath done tene sorow yf thou looke maner al glad thynges sorowful yu mayest naye yet namely nowe thou standest noble plyt good gynnyng wt good forth goinge hereafter yf thou wene wretch welth passed tha art thou wel fortunate bad thynges anguys wretchednesse passed art thou come first hostrye lyfe el booth world art thou sodayne gest wretched exyle wenest thing erth stable thy fyrst arest passed ye brouyt mortal sorowe ben mortal thinges agone ignoraunce bestiall wyt hast receyued reason knowynge vertue cofort thy hert knowynge sykerly seruyce grounded wost thou wel sayde yt death maketh ende al fortune tha stadest thou noble plyte lytle hede rekenynge take yf thou let fortune passe dyng el flye whan lyst thy lyue pardy hath nothyng lefe life holde doth al cure dyligent trauayle saye thou arte blisfull fortunate selye yf thou knowe thy goodes thou hast yet beloued whiche nothinge maye dout ne bene worthy thy lyfe good conteplacion well doinge vertue tyme coming plesaunce thy margaryte perle haestly thyne hert ful blysse shalbe eased therfore dismay fortune hate greuously ayest thy bodily perso ne yet gret tempest hath set ye sithen ye holding cable ankres thy life holden knytting fast thou discomforte nought tyme yt nowe ne dispayre tyme come yeuen cofort hope well gettyng agayne double thy lesynge wt encreasyng loue thy margarite perle therto hytherto yu hast al ful dauger thou myght amende mysse defautes somtyme thou dyddest nowe thy tyme ylke margaryte full seruyce lore thyne herte hath contynued wherfore ought moch rather enclyne fro h daungerous sete thynges ben yet yt holdynge anker thy lyue holden mote god praye thynges full ben performed whyle thys anker holdeth hope thou shalte safely escape whyle thy trew meanyng seruice aboute brynge dispyte false meaners newe haten trew seruyce thou arte nowe entred certayne amonge thynges asked question ye way knot trewly lady howe tept wyth question answer spekyng fyrst seruyce full purpose pricke hert yt thilke seruice enprisonmet alway bad naughty maner desyred ne yt gettyng knot may nothyng auayle wyse gentyll hert loketh vertue non bodily ioyes alone bycause toforne tho wayes sette wote wel selfe haue erred blysse fayled waye hugely haue ron certes yt sothe thou hast myswent eschew path fro hen forwarde rede wonder trewly mortal folke worlde seche wayes outforth preued youre selfe lo howe ye ben cofounded errour folly knowyng cause waye goodnesse vertue thyng precious thy selfe thou shalt haue thy power yt thou woldest neuer lese way may taken fro thilk thyng cause knot yf dethe mow nat reue tha erthly creature thilke thing abydeth thy selfe soule conclusion make suche knot thus getten abydeth thyng soule long last soule dieth neuer vertue goodnesse euermore wt ye soule endureth knot perfite blysse tha soule blysse endlesse shal enduren thus shul hertes trewe knot ben eased thus shul soules pleased thus perpetually ioye shul synge good trouth good begynnyng yeue v way quod sayd ye nat longe sythen resonable lyfe one thre thynges proued soule euerye soule reason hath two thynges steryng lyfe one vertue another bodily workynge whan soule maister ouer body man maister hym selfe maister ouer selfe lyueth vertue goodnesse reson vertue techeth soule body worchyng vertue togider lyuen resonable lyfe clerkes clepen felycite lyueng theryn hye way knot olde philosopher hadden knowyng diuyne grace kyndly reason alone wenden pure nature wythoute helpe grace might haue yshoued thother lyuenges resonablye haue lyued thynke herafter yf god woll haue space thylk grace leude knowyng declare leaue thys tyme sayd outforth loketh ye wayes knotte connyng shulde know way inforth slepeth tyme wherfore wol way knowe must leaue lokyng false wayes outforth ope eyen hys conscience vnclose hys herte seest nat hath trust bodily lyfe besy bodily woudes anoynt kepynge frome smert may nat healed woundes hys true vnderstandynge taketh hede knowynge euenforth slepeth harde anone knowyng wake gynneth ye preuy medicine healyng trewe entet inwardes lightly healeth conscience yf wel handled must nedes wayes come soule ste yng lyfe body el maye man come perfyte blysse knotte thus waye shal come knot perfyte selynesse wende haue bodilye goodes outforthe yea shall haue bot e knotte rich power dignite renome maner waye ye yt shall shewe nat riche hath suffisaunce hath power man may amaistrie nat gret dignite haue worshyp reuerece hath nat glorie renome whose name perpetuall duryng nombre comparation thynges men wenen getten forth ye loken thyng nouyt therof al ne partie longe mowe gapen soth therfore sechen gold grene tree wene gader precyous stone amonge vynes layne nettes mountaynes fysh thynke hunt depe see hart hynde sechen erth thylke thynges surmouteth heuen may hem say folyshe ignoraunce mysledeth wandryng wretch vncouth wayes shulden forleten maketh hem blynde fro ryght pathe trewe way shuld ben vsed therfore generall erroure mankynde departeth thylke goodes mysse sechynge whyche shulde haue hole sought reason thus gothe begyled sought hys hode men haue blowe iape nowe yf man vertuous vertue lyueth howe hathe thynges shall prouen power hathe anye man let another lyueg vertue prisonmet disese taketh paciently discofyteth nat tyraunt ouer hys soule power maye haue hathe man tourmented suche power nyll discofit ne ouercome may nat ben sythen pacience hys soule ouercometh nat ouercomen suche thyng may nat maistred hath nede nothyng hath suffisaunce ynowe helpe selfe thylke thyng thus hath power suffysaunce tyrant may reue hath dignyte sette nought thynges great dignite deth may maistry wherfore thilk power suffisaunce enclosed wyth dignyte reson renome must haue thys thylke ryches wt suffisance ye shulde loke thys thilke worshipful dignite ye shulde coueyt thylke power myght whyche ye shulde truste ilke renome glorie endlesse endureth ny substaunce vertuous lyueng certes thys sothe se well vertue ful gripe encloseth al thiges wherfore sothe may saye trouth vertue margarite brouyt first seruice haue knytting iewel nat sodayn longinges ne folkes smale wordes onely couersation togider tha seinge thentent trewe menyng wt florishyng vertue pacience vsed nothynge yuel quyte wicked leasynges false tonges ofte haue layde haue sey selfe goodlye foryeuenesse hathe spronge herte vnite accorde aboue thynges desyreth good meke maner suffereth many wicked tale trewly lady gret worship thynges due chastysment amended yea haue excused al suche thynges yet mowe nat redressed thy margarytes vertue commende well paciently anoyes suffreth dauid kynge meke suffred mokell hate manye yuell speches dispyte ne shame enemis deden might nat moue pacience hys herte euer one plyte mercy vsed wherfore god hym selfe toke rewarde thynges thero suche punyshement let fall trewely reason ought ensample drede maner people myrthe man vengeable wrathe gouernauce punishment ought haue plato cause hys seruaunt scoure yet cleaped hys neyghbour perfourme doynge hym selfe wolde nat lest wrath hym maistred might haue layde moche euermore grounded vertue sheweth thentent fro within trewly wott well goodnesse vertue thou hast desyred seruyce pleasance well thy selfe therto fully haste profered good lady vertue hye waye thys knot long haue yhandled ye sothe wythout vertue goodlye thys knotte maye nat goten ah nowe se quod howe vertue fayleth seer tre wythout burionyng frute alwaye welke stonde dyspeyre thys noble knotte vertue hathe maner workynge wyde aboute haue trauayled peace thy fyrst way thy traueyle ydel touchynge seconde way se well thy meanyng thou woldest coclude yf thou coudest bycause brought seruyce euery seruates helpe come blysse sayd beforne thou saydest thy selfe thou myghtest nat holpe thou wenyst bycause vertue fayleth thys blysse perfytly without vertue may nat goten thou wenest wordes contradiction folowe parde hardest haue seruaunt vertuous dede thoughe brought seruyce yet arte thou nat seruant say thou myght werche vertue herafter tha shalt thou seruante seruaunt acompted habyt maketh moke ne wearynge gylte spurres maketh knyght neuer later conforte thyne herte yet wol otherwyse answere certes lady tho ye must nedes el nyghe caught suche cordiacle sorowe wotte well shulde neuer haue recouered therfore nowe praye enforme el holde wythout recouerye maye nat longe endure tyll thys lesson lerned myschefe remedy knowen nowe nat wrothe man lyue maye come precious thynge longe coueyted somtyme suffre tenefull disease wenyst thy selfe ben vnlyche may nat ben sorowe thyng getten hath ioye ylke thynge afterwardes kepe fareth chyldren schole lernynge arne beaten whan theyr lesson foryetten commely good disciplynyng yerde kepe ryght wel doctryne theyr schole right wyth wordes thys lady threwe vp myne eyen se countenaunce chere aperceyuynge thys fantasye myne herte gan semblaut goodly caste sayde wyse well knowe bothe reason experience doyng euery actyue worcheth hys passyue whan ben togider actyue passyue ben ycleaped philosopher yf fyre place chafynge thynge able chafed hete thylke thynges ben sette suche distauce one may werche shall suffre thylke margarite thou desyrest ful vertue able actyue goodnesse euery herbe weth vertue outforthe within sonne yeueth lyght thynges may sey euery fyre heteth thylke thyng yt neyghed able hete vertue margarite outforth wrethe nothyng able suffre worching worke catch actyfe passyfe actyfe passyfe vertues thys margaryte yt donet fynde vertue must nedes werche place euer thou within distauce worthynesse passyfe thou arte closed vertue may nothyng profyte thy desyre perfourmed thy sorowes ceased ergo werchynge vertue thou shalte easely ben holpen driuen care welcome ionge desyred lady thys good lesson gynnyng ioye wete ye wel forsothe though suppose haue moche vertue wolde spousayle proued maye lyue doute reioyce gretly thynkyng tho vertues shewed herde say quod begynnyng whan receyued fyrste serue thy iewel thylke margaryte thou desyrest closed muskle blew ye forsothe sayd euery thyng kyndely sheweth thys iewell closed blewe shel excelle coloures sheweth vertue frome wyt euery wight shulde rather loke propre vertue thynges tha hys forum goodes thynge engendred g mater comenly parte loweth congelement vertue fyrste mater corrupt vyces procede encrease good vertues eke right fareth badde trewly great excellence vertue lynage parte discendeth kynde successyon vertues folowe wherfore saye colour euery margarite sheweth fro within fynesse vertue kyndely heuen whan mery wether lofte apereth mane eye coloure blewe stedfastnesse peace betokenyng within without margaryt engendred heuenly dewe sheweth selfe fynenesse coloure whether engendrure maked morowe eue thus sayth kynd perle precious margaryte thou seruest sheweth self dyscended nobley vertue thys heuenlych dewe norished congeled mekenesse mother vertues werkes men sene withouten signyfication coloures ben shewed mercy pytie herte wyth peace al thys yclosed muskle redily vertues loke thyng hath soule reduced good meane thynges thus god man reduced soules resonable forthe beestes bodyes mowe mouen place ben reduced manne beestes meue mouyn place place thylke bodyes han felynge soules moue frome place holde lowest degree soulynge thynges felynge suche ben reduced man meanes foloweth muskle mother al vertues halte place mekenesse hys lowest degree discendeth downe heuen maner virgyne engendrure arne margaretes engendred afterwarde congeled made mekenesse low hye heuen enclose catche therof noble dewe cogelement margaryte wyth endelesse vertue euerlastyng ioy wyth full vessell grace yeuen euery creature goodlye wolde receyue certes thynges ben ryght noble haue er thys herde sawes thou woste well thynges ben sothe yea forsothe full nowe thys margaryte full vertue well proued wherfore grace mercye amonge vertues wotte ryght wel shall discende ye yet wolde haue better declared vertues thys margaryte kyndely ben grounded shal shewe thou woldest lerne lerne nedeth suche wordes wete ye nat well lady youre selfe cure dyligence might haue turned counsayle plesaunce perle thought studye helpe desyreth worshyppe thylke iewel encrease trauayle al besynesse youre seruyce thys margaryte gladde somehalue leauer honoure pleasaunce good chere thorowe mayntayned kepte suche thynge lykynge cause al ye welthe bodyly goodes ye coude recke wolde neuer god put selfe great ieoperdye wolde nowe lyfe alone rather shulde suffre thylke iewell anye poynt ben blemyshed ferre may suffre wyth myghtes stretche suche thynge maye mokel thy grace seruyce auaunce nowe quod loue wylte thou graunte thylke margaryte ben good good good tempte ye tene wyth suche maner speche wolde graunte though shulde anone dye trouthe fyght quarell yf wyght wolde countreplede moche lighter loue proue entent ye yet wolde howe ye wolde proue good reasonable skyl mowe ben denyed althoughe knowe dothe many manyfolde goodnesse vertue margaryte ben prynted yet men ben goodnesse speke wher euer wordes ben herde reason ben shewed suche yuell spekers lady auctorite excellence shullen ben stopped ashamed han none acquayntaunce persone yet mowe knowe vertues ben enformed wyse mowe sette theyr hertes whan hem lyste seruyce entre make trewly al thys begynne wote well selfe thylke iewel precious perle womanly woman kynde whome goodnesse vertue also answerynge shappe lymmes fetures well poyntes acordyng nothyng fayleth leue kynde made wyth great studye kynde person nothyng hath foryet well sene euery good wyghtes herte hath grace commendynge vertuous praysyng ala euer kynde made deedely saue onely wot well nature fourmyng thynge hathe erred certes loue thou hast well begonne aske thys questyon generall euerye thynge good sawe god euerye thynge made werne ryght good wonder howe yuell thynges comen place sythen al thynges right good thus woll declare eueryche qualyte euery action euery thyng hath maner beynge god god made goodnesse beyng badnesse badde naught good somwhat therfore good beyng one vnderstandyng howe may often han shrewes assayled mokell badnesse therin haue founden semeth bad somwhat kynde thou shalt vnderstande suche maner badnesse whyche vsed purifye wronge doer somwhat god made beyng hath good badnesse beyng hath vtterly negatyue somwhat naught thyng beyng party essenciall beyng arne sayde double wyse party ben founde euerye creature thynge halfe fyrste beyng beyng partycipacion takyng partye beyng euerye eature dyfference bytwene beynge hym hys owne beyng ryght euery good maner beynge good thorowe beynge naught euery thynge though good hym selfe good good ordinable great goodnesse dualite clerkes determission founden euery creature neuer syngle onhed ye ysayd god sawe euery thynge makyng right good youre selfe sayde longe tyme sythen aske whether euery creature ysayd good throughe goodnesse vnfourmed eyther el fourmed afterwarde yf accepte vtterly good shall saye great passed clerkes han deuyded good good beyng alone nothynge good nothynge good wyse god also good partycipacion ycleped good farre fette representatyue goodly goodnesse thys manyfolde good sayd saye good kynde good gendre good grace good ioye good kynde austen saythe ben ben good peraunter thou woldest wete whether hem selfe good el anothers goodnesse naturel goodnesse euery substaunce nothyng el substanciall beyng whiche ycleaped goodnesse comparyson hath fyrste goodnesse inductatyfe meanes fyrste goodnesse boece sheweth thys thynge full name good general name kynde comparysoned generally princypal ende whyche god knotte al goodnesse euery creature cryeth god v made han full apered thylke god affection suche hem longeth thys wyse thynges ben good great god whyche good alone thys wonder thyng howe ye haue manye reason proued fyrst way errour misgoyng cause baddesse feble meuynge grounde ye aleged roted whence suche badnesse hathe sprynges sythen thynges thus generall ben good badnesse hathe beynge ye haue declared wene al thinges ben good might wyth fyrst waye good haue ended goodnesse haue comen blysse seruyce desyred thynge good beyng partycipacion fyrst goodnesse whyche goodnesse corrupte badnesse badde meanyng maners god hathe good thynges ben good beyng yuel absence ryghtfull loue badnesse nothynge onelye yuell wyll vser gyltes doer wherfore gynnyng worlde euery thynge hym selfe good vnyuersall werne ryght good eye hande fayrer betterer body sette kyndely place body disceuered euerye thing kyndly place kyndly good dothe werche place voyded dissolueth defouled selue oure noble god glyterade wyse armony worlde ordeyned purtreytures storyed wyth colour medled whyche blacke derke coloures comenden golden asured paynture euerye putte kyndely place one besyde another glytereth right lytle fayre maketh right fayre glorious right goodnesse thynges vertue wherfore badde good perles thys margaryte han matter yeuen ayre lytell goodnesse lytell vertue ryght mokell goodnesse vertue thy margaryte ben proued shynynge wyse founde shewed howe shulde euer goodnesse peace haue ben knowe yf vnpeace somtyme reygne mokell yuell wrothe howe shulde mercy ben proued trespeace due iustifycacion bepunysshed therfore grace goodnesse wyght founde soroufull hertes good meanynge endure ben comforted vnyte accorde bytwene hertes knytte ioye abyde wenest thou reioyce el accompte hym amonge seruautes pleaseth pallas vndoynge mercurye pallas knytte tytle lawe accordyng reasonable co science mercurye doynge haue grace ben suffered el hym weneth moone fayrenesse eue sterre lo otherwhyle nyghtes lyght moone greatlye comforteth derke thoughtes blynde vnderstandyng loue yeueth great gladnesse lyste byleue whan sothe tale shewed adewe deblys name entred wyse folke worthy gentyllesse bothe vertue lyuyng yeuen full credence sothnesse loue wyth good hert good euydence experyence doynge sheweth contrarye thus myghtest thou haue full prefe thy margarytes goodnesse commendement iewels badnesse yuelnesse doynge stoundemele disease yeueth seuerall houres ioye nowe trouthe thys well declared margaryte good sythen ben good passeth manye goodnesse vertue wherthrough maner necessarye muste good goodnesse thys margaryte thynge el vertue wherfore vertuous yf fayled vertue syde lacke vertue badde nothynge el ne maye lacke wante good goodnesse shulde haue lacke saye badde maye good good methynketh good consequence semeth vertuous lacke vertue haue sonne knowe shyne ne vertuous herbes haue het kynde werchynge ne vertue stretche goodnesse profyte another vertue wayes reason sythen mercye pytie ben moste commended amonge vertues myght neuer ben shewed refreshement helpe comforte nowe moste nede kynde werkynge vertues trewely wene shall varye frome helpes fyre yf yeue non heate fyre demed sonne shyne sonne accompted water wete name shall ben chaunged vertue werche goodnesse dothe fayle contrarye name shall ben reuersed impossyble wherfore contradictorie necessarye nedes muste leue certes thy person thy mouthe wordes lyen well ben sayd thyne vnderstandyng leued entent thys margaryte alone speche coclusyon wordes thynges lyst shew openly shal founde mater thy sycknesse shal ben ye medicyn may thy sorowes lysse comfort well al amysse haue erred way walked drope good wyll amendement ben dwelled theyr hertes prouerbes salomon openly teacheth howe somtyme innocent walkyd waye blyndnesse derke nyght mette woman yf lefely saye strumpet arayed redily purueyed turnynge thoughtes veyne ianglynges rest inpacient dissymulacion termes sayeng thys wyse come dronken swete pappes vse coueytous collynges thus drawen innocent oxe larder ladye queynte thynge vnderstonde praye parable declare entent innocent scholer lernynge lore seckyng blysse whyche thynge daye hys thought turnyng enelyneth eue sonne verye lyght faylinge maketh derke nyght hys connynge thus derkenesse many doutes walketh blyndenesse vnderstandynge ne wote waye forsothe suche one may lightly ben begyled whome came loue fayned clothed lyuery vnlefull iustye habyte wyth softe spech mery fayre honyed wordes heretykes mysse menynge people skleren wymplen theyr errours austen wytnesseth heretyke hys fyrst begynnynge man right expert resones swete hys wordes werkes myscorden thus fareth fayned loue fyrst werchynges thou knowest thynges trewe thou haste hem proued experience somtyme doyng thyn owne person thyng thou hast founde mater mokel dysease fayned loue redely purueyed thy wyttes catch tourne thy good thoughtes trewlye hath wounded conscience many wyth floryshynge mokel ianglynge wordes good worthe thanked glose gladde prudence thou haste manlye veyned arte thou moche holden thy kynde course good meanyng returne thy mynde trow ne shewed thy margarite thou haddest neuer returned fyrste good parfyte ioye euer fayned loue impaciet water siloe whyche euermore floweth wyth stylnesse priuy noyse tyll come nyghe brynke gynneth measure bolne nouelleries chaugynge stormes course euery rennynge poynte spyll al circuite cankes thus fayned loue priuelye fullest hys flowynge newe stormes debate arayse mercurius often wyth hole vnderstandynge knowen suche peryllous matter yet venetiens lusty ben leude theyr wyttes suche thynges ryght lytell nought done fele wrytte cryen theyr felawes blysse ioy thus one erroure mokel folke drawen come sayne dronken pappes ben falla lyenge glose whych mowe souke mylke helthe deedlye venym poyson corrupcyon sorowe mylke falla venym dyscryte mylke lyeng glose venym corrupcion lo thynge cometh pappes vse coueyted collynges desyre meddle false wordes wyth sote sote wyth false trewly sorynesse fayned loue nedes surfettes sycknesse must folowe thus oxe thy langoryng deth thou drawe sote smoke hath ye defased euer deper thou somtyme wadest ye soner thou founde yf kylled lytell wonder syde trewe seruaut faynen ne dysceyue conne sothly theyr doynge open foundement endureth burthe neuer great euer one lasteth yeueth lyfe blysful goodnesse last endes though gynnynges ben sharpe thus two contraryes contrarye ben effectes thylke margaryte thou seruest shall sene seruyce oute peryllous trybulacyon delyuered bycause seruyce newe dysease fallen hope amendement laste ende wyth ioye gladded wherfore kynde pure mercy wyth grace good helpe shall graut el shal straine pyte shall ben amaystred remembre thyne herte horrybly somtyme thyne margaryte thou trespasest greate wyse ayenst thou forfeytest clepe aye thy mynde know thyne owne gyltes goodnesse bountye wyth mokell folowynge pyte founde thou tyme thou goodlye accepted grace pluckynge foryeuenesse enclyned styred drawe house yet wendest thou vtterlye euer haue ben refused well thou wost sythen suche sharpe dysease might greatly auayle thynkest thy wyt howe ferre maye wytte stretche thou lache thy syde wol make knotte certes thy good beryng wol acorde psauter haue foude dauid seruice trewe holy oyle peace rest longe hymdesyred vtterly shalbe anoynted truste well woll fayle leuynge ye fyrst waye good hert continuaunce se grounded thys purpose perfourme draweth maner costraining nedes must ben thyne helper although myrth whyle taryed shall come suche season thy thought shall ben ioyed wolde neuer god sythe thyne herte reason arne assented openlye haste confessed thyne amysse goynge nowe cryest mercye yf mercy folowed thy blisse shal ben redy ywys thou ne wost howe sone nowe good chylde rede kynde vertues thy margarite rehersed strength thy person shul werche comforte thou mayst myscary wordes sayde streyght lengthe rested whyle pthus endeth seconde booke foloweth thyrde boke nobre sayne clerkes yt naturell sume discrete thinges tellynge one two thre forth amonge nombres thre determined moste certayne wherfore nombre certayne werke besy leudnesse thynke ende parfourme ensample thys world thre tymes deuyded whych fyrst cleped demacion say goyng trewe way al tho deyden hel punyshed man synne tyll grace mercy fette hem thence ended fyrste tyme seconde tyme lasteth co mynge merciable grace vntyll ende transytory tyme whyche shewed ye true way fordoyng badde ycleped tyme grace thynge yeuen deserte yeldynge one benefyte another onely goodnesse yeuer grace thilke tyme ca well vnderstande shapen saued souled blysse thyrd tyme shal gyn trasytory thynges worldes han made end shal ben ioye glory rest body soule well han deserued tyme grace thus heuen togyther shul dwel perpetuelly without ymaginatyfe yuel halue tymes fygured tho thre dayes oure god closed erthe thyrde arose shewynge resurrection ioye blysse tho deserue merciable grace leud boke thre mater accordaut tho tymes lyghtly good inseer maye ben vnderstande fyrste erroure mysse goynge shewed sorowful pyne punyshed cryed mercye secode grace good waye proued whyche faylynge wythout deserte thylke fyrst mysse amendynge correction tho erroures euen waye brynge wyth comforte welfare amendement wexynge thyrde ioye blysse graunted hym well canne deserue hath sauour vnderstandynge tyme grace thus ioye thyrd boke shal mater tyl ende speciall cause haue hert make processe margarit peerle precious geme clere lytel stone iewel ye toges v english people turneth ye right name clepeth hem margery perles thus varieth speche fro many langages trewly latyn frenche many mo langages cleapeth hem margery perles name margarites margaryte perles wherfore denominacion wol acorde me tonges name clepyng clerkes treaten kyndes studyen propertye thynges sayne margarit lytel whyte perle throughout holowe rounde vertuous see sydes britayne muskel shelles ye heauenly dewe best ben engendred experience ben founde thre fayre vertues one yeueth comforte felyng spirites bodely persones reason another good profytable helth ayenst passyons sorye me hertes thyrd nedeful noble staunchyng bloode el moche wolde ren whych perle vertues lyst lyken tyme philosophie wyth thre speces naturel moral resonable whych thynges hereth sayne great clerkes philosophye knowyng deuynly manly thinges ioyned wyth studye good lyuyng thys stante two thynges connyng opinion connynge thynge certaine reson coceyued wretch fooles leude men many wyll conceyue thynge maynteyne forsoth though reson contrarye wherfore connyng strauger opinion whyle thynge none certayne hydde men knowlegynge parfyte reson fully declared thus yf sonne moke men wenen el yf erth sothnesse certayne quantyte planet vnknowen erthly dweller yet opinion men holden mydle erthe fyrst spece philosophye naturel whych kyndely thynges treten sheweth cause heuen strength kyndely course arsmetryke geometry musyke astronomye teacheth wayes course heuens planetes sterres aboute heuen erthe clemetes seconde spece morall order lyuyng maners techeth reson proueth vertues soule worthy lyuyng whych ben prudence iustyce temperaunce strength prudence goodlye wysedome knowyng thinges stregth voydeth al aduersitees alyche euen temperaunce destroyeth beestial lyuyng wyth easy bearyng iustyce ryghtfully iugeth iugyng departeth euery wyght owne thyrde spece turneth reason vnderstandynge al thynges said soth dyscussed two thynges deuyded one art another rethorike two al lawes man reason ben grounded el mayntayned thys booke loue therafter beareth hys name phylosophie lawe muste acorden theyr clergiall dyscripcios philosophie loue wysedome declared lawe maynteynaunce peace holden loue must nedes acorde therfore hem place haue touched ordre homly thynges honest maner lyuyng vertue rightful iugemet cause profitable administracion cominaltyes realmes cite euenhed profitably raigne synguler auautage ne priue enuy ne soleyn purpose couetise worship goodes ben dysposed ope rule shewed loue philosophy law yet loue toforne al wherfore susterne vnite acorde one ende peace rest causen noryshynge ioye maynteynen endure haue declared boke acordeth discripcio thre thynges margarit vertue lykned philosophie wyth thre speces whych mater euer twey ben acordaut bodely reason thyrde soule coclusion boke thys margarit peerle knyttyng together lawe thre sondry maners shalbe lykened yt saye lawe ryght custome whych wold declare yt lawe cometh goddes ordynauce kyndly worchyng thylke thynges ordayned mane wyttes arne ycleped ryght ordained many maners constitucion wrytten custome thynge accepted ryghte lawe lawe ryght faylen dyfferece whether come scrypture reason wherfore sheweth lawe kyndly gouernaunce ryght cometh mannes probable reason custome comen vsage length tyme vsed custome wrytte vsage yf wrytte constitucion ywrytten ycleped lawe kynde comen euery nation coniunction man woma loue succession chyldren heritaunce restitucyon thynge strength taken lent lawe amoge al halte soueraynest gree worshyp whych lawe began begynnynge reasonable creature varyed yet neuer chaungyng tyme cause forfothe ordaynynge law constrayne men hardynesse peace wythdrawyng euell wyl turnynge malyce goodnesse innocence sykerly withouten tenefull anoye amoge shrewes safely myght inhabyte protection safeconducte ye shrewes harme harme brydle ferdenesse shulden restrayne forsothe kyndely lawe nothynge comended suche goddes wil hath cofyrmed ne nothyng denyed cotrarioustye goddes wyl heauen eke lawes custome el costitucion vsage wryting cotraryen lawe kynde vtterly ben repugnaunt aduersary goddes wyl heuen trewly lawe kynde goddes owne lusty wil verely mainteine vnder lawe vnworthye professe reguler arne obediencer bounden margarite perle knotte loues statute stablyshment kynde whyche goodlye may ben wythsetten lo vnder bonde constrayned abyde man vnder lyuyng lawe ruled lawe oweth desertes rewarded payn mede yf mercy weyue payne parte reasonfully maye sey mercy ryght lawe passeth thentent al mater lest clere vnderstandynge wete thende thyrde boke ful knowyng thorow goddes grace thinke make neuerthelater yet yf thynges haue good sleight inseer souke hony harde stone oyle drye rocke may lightly fele nobley mater leude ymaginacion closed boke shalbe ioye sayde ferre set fro thylke place fro whece gladnesse shuld come corde shorte let boket oughte catch water fewe men ben corde eche many ful purpose redy shorter make enclose thetre boket ioy nothing shuld catch empty returne careful sorowes encrese yf dye payne yt gladnesse theyr hertes good lord sende water ye cop moutaynes shall drynke therof thurstes stach sey cofortable welles helth goodnesse sauiour holpen yet say house ioye opened dare sorowful goost mater gladnesse thynken trete euer sobbynges complaintes redy refrete meditacios werbles manyfold stoudes comyng therfore maner ioye coud endite yet dore shal knocke yf key dauid wold locke vnshyt bryng chyldres toges opneth closeth whose spirite wyl worcheth departing goodly hi liketh goddes laude reuerece profit reders amedemet maners ye herers encresyng worship amoge loues seruauts releuyng hert grace iewel frenshyp plesauce thys peerle stered thys makynge nothynge el yf good thynge menes lykynge scripture founde thanketh mayster grace whych good authour pryncypall doer yf thynge insuffycyent el myslykynge wt leudnesse myne vnable connynge body dysease anoyeth vnderstandynge soule dyseasely habitacyon letteth wyttes many thynges namely sorowe custome neuer later loue longe tyme seruyce termes thynke pursue whiche ben lyuely yeue vnderstandyng thynges nowe enform thys margarites goodnesse may nat half preyse wherfore nat boke boke worthy comended tho boke leude ryght thynges nat place place thinges oughten desyred praysed loue trewly thy wortes haue wel vnderstad cettes thinketh right good wo dreth thou lightlye passest lawe sothly wyt leude right blynd mater depe shulde haue waded lightly myght haue drenched spylte ther selfe ye shall helpe swym ryght lawe punisheth brekers preceptes contrary doer written constitution ryght ayenward lawe rewardeth yeueth mede hem lawe strengthen one lawe thys rebel punished innocent meded shrewe enprisoned thys ryghtfull corowned lawe ioyneth wedlocke without forsaking lawe yeueth lybel deperticion cause deuorse demed declared ye ye fynde lawe mede reward goodnes gyltie desertes fole gyltie couerted lawe mykell merite deserueth also paulin rome crowned hym maynteyners pompeus knowe distroyed yet forn paulyn chefe popeus cou sayle law rome hath yet name mesuryng mede ye bewrayeng co spiracy ordayned tho senatours dethe iulius cesar acopted catons right witnesse euer trouth florisheth name among knower reason perdicas crowned ye heritage alexader great tellynge preuy hate kinge porrus alexander hadde wherfore euery wyght reason law rightwysenesse apertly mede maychalege thou maynteynest lawe kynde therfore disease hast suffred ye law reward worthy rewarded ordayned apartly thy mede might thou chalege certes thys haue wel lerned euer hesforward shal drawe therafter onehed wyl abyd lawe mayntene kepe hope best entre grace wel deseruynge worship wight without nedful copulsyon ought medfully rewarded truly loue sothe tho constitution good seruyce profyt auautage stretch vtterly many deme haue desert mede good wyl copelled se may men holden thys contrary good seruice wold thys question declared shall say fewe wordes reasonable workinges plesaunce profyte thy souerayne shuld performe riyt wel nowe lytel hardely vnderstande ye ryghte mater due ouerchaugynges foloweth perfectio forme ryght euery ryghtfull werkynges ought folowe leful desyres hys herte se toforne end deserueth many tymes loketh thedes vtterly therof vnknowen befalleth ofte many yuels wher er ware shamefully confounded thende therof neden loked euery desyrer suche forsyght good seruyce thre thynges specially nedeth ruler hys workes fyrste good nexte election hys hert thyrde godlye wythouten surquedry thoughtes werkes shulden good seruice actes authorites many may aleged neuer later reason thus maye shewed werkes cleped seconde mouen vertue fyrst wercher whych good workes wrought procede ryghte werkes mouen vertue last ende right fyrst workyng man shulde secode werche right ye feled ende sene theyr goodnes closed ye shulde nomore retche ye wrought gynnynge gan wyth good shall cease last ende yf well consydred wherfore myddle yf wayes drawe accordaunt endes stynteth course good another maner course entreth partye hym selue euery part accordaunt hys foule ought eschewed wherfore euery thynge yt wrought good accordaut e hys hole foule ought withdrawe thus person neyther good ne harme shaman foule theyr makyng wherfore wythout workynge good actes good seruyce may man ben accepted trewly ylke han myght good done crowne worshyp shall take hem wyth shame shull anulled make one werke accordaunt wyth hys endes euery good seruaunt reason cosequece muste good nedes certes suffyseth alone good goodly wythall folowe thanke goodnesse el nought deserueth ryghte al beyng come fro greatest good goodnesse closed ryght endes ben directe good aristotel determineth ye end good ben one co uertible vnderstandynge wyll doth away good loketh thed loketh good doth good doth goodly draweth away dyrectio thende goodly must nedes bad lo badde nothyng el absence negatyf good derknesse absence negatyue lyght doth goodly dyrecteth thylke good thende badde must thyng good folowe eke badnesse suche folke ofte foloweth thus contrariant worker thende good ben worthy contrary thede yt good haue may good dede done yf goodly helpe yes loue deuell doth many good dedes goodly leueth behynd euen badly disceyuable wyse worketh wherfore cotrary thende foloweth neuer many good dedes bicause goodly away goodnes rekened lo tho good goodly thende goodnesse wol folowe thus good seruice good dede goodly musten ioyne together wyth free choise hert el deserueth yt merite goodnesse ye woll proue yf thou thyng good chauce happe thyng art thou therof worthy co mended nothynge reason ye turneth thy praysyng ne lackyng lo thilke thig done hap thy wyl caused therby shulde thanke lacke deserue sythen fayleth thende whych wel shuld rewarde must nedes faile clerkes sayn wyllyng blessed good dede yt hath done done fre choyse willyng blyssednesse may folowe ergo neither thake goodnesse ne seruice yt cotrary good ende good seruice loged good dede goodly thorow fre choice hert truely haue wel vnderstande wel euery thynge thus done sufficietly lawe cleped iustice reward clayme lawe iustice ordained wyse suche desertes goodnesse quantite doynge mede rewarde necessite iustice yt say ryghtwisenesse fre choice deseruynge wel yuel grauted resonable creature euery man hath fre arbitremet chose good yuel performe tho yf good wyl deserue margarite perle therto copelled haue free choice lyketh holden thinketh rewarde thentet good wyl goddes forbode el loue wiyt meaneth otherwyse trowe fre wyl good hert mede deserueth hath euerye man free choice necessarye maner wyl euery doynges yt lyketh goddes proper purueyance wolde se ye wel declared leude vnderstadynge necessary necessyte ben wordes mokel entencion closyng saye mote nedes otherwyse maye betyde thys shalt thou lerne thou take hede speche yf mane owne lyberte fre wyl good bad one tyed bonde goddes preordinaunce neuer well nedefull copulcion thilke bonde fre choice wherby nothyng deserueth neuer yuel man wyte onelyche hym thynge ordayned hym done wherfore ne ought bad punyshed ne good dede rewarded necessite ryghtwysnesse therfore free choice arbitremente put man proper dispositio truely yf otherwise cotraryed goddes charite ye badnes goodnesse rewardeth deserte payne mede thynketh woder god necessite forwote al thynges comyng mote nedes thylke thynges yt bene done fre choice comen nothynge necessite onely wyll howe maye thys stande togyther thynketh truely fre choice fully repugneth goddes wetynge truly lady semeth mowe stande together gan loue nygh nere noble coutenauce vysage lymmes dressed nygh sytting place take forth thy pen redely wryt wordes god wol shal hem enforme yt thy leudnesse haue vnderstad mater shal openly clered thy sight ful loking therin ameded fyrst thou thinke goddes prescience repugne lyberte arbytrye arbitrement impossible yt shuld accorde onheed soth vnderstadyng yea forsoth coceyue well yf thylke impossible away repugnace semeth therin vtterlye remoued shewe ye absence impossibilite shall nowe suppose yt mowe stade together presciece god foloweth necessite thiges coming lyberte arbitremet thorow whych thou beleuest many thiges without necessite proporcions sothe wel mowe stade together wherfore thys case possible admyt truly case impossible howe herof foloweth wexeth another ipossible proue shal sothyng comyng without necessite god wot toforne althig comyng wote beforne wot necessite coming beforne wot ye case necessary maner el thorow necessite sothyng without necessite wetherto euery wyght yt hath good vnderstading sene thiges repugnat presciece god foloweth necessite lyberte arbytrement fro remoued necessitie trulye necessary yt god haue foreweting thyng withouten necessitie comynge ye yet remeue ye away fro myne vnder standyng necessitie folowynge god beforewetyng thus god beforne wote seruice loue bouden margaryte perle therfore necessitie thus loue bounde yf loued tho rowe necessitie bene kept al loue dedes certes loue bicause mater good necessary declare thynke herein wel abyde lightly passe thou shalt say al god beforne wot louer louer thus god forne wot louer without necessite foloweth whether thou loue loue euery hem shalbe nowe thou seest impossibilitie case ye possibilitie thylke thou wendest ben impossyble wherfore repugnaunce adnulled ye yet ye awaye strengthe necessitie whan sayde though necessitie loue abyde loue without necessitie god beforn wot maner necessitie forsothe semeth men coaction sayne constraynyng el prohibicion defendynge wherfore necessitye loue wyll vnderstande constrayned priuy strength wyll louynge loue defended fro wyll louyng thorow necessitie semeth loue loue elles loue loue wherthrugh neither thak ne maugre tho thynges may deserue thou shalt wel vnderstande often sayne thyng thorow necessitie strength neyther coacted ne constrayned necessitie defendynge remoued sayne thorowe necessite god immortall nought deedlyche necessitie god ryghtfull strength vyolente maner constrayneth hym immortall defendeth vnryghtfull nothynge maye make hym deedly vnryghtful ryght say thorowe necessite louer el none onelye thorowe wyll god beforne wete vnderstande thyng defendeth forbyt thy wyll whiche shall el costrayneth shalbe thyng forsoth god wot beforne seeth thynge comende wyll wyl neyther costrayned ne defended thorowe thynge thorowe lybertie arbytrement yt done wyll trulye good chylde yf thynges wel vnderstond wene none inconuenient shalt thou fynde betwene god forwetyng lybertie arbytre met wherfore wot wel may stand togyder also ferthermore yt vnderstandyng presciece proprelyche cosydreth thorow wyse thyng afore wyst sayd comyng pronou ced nothing forn wyst thyng comyng forewetinge trouth doute may wyst wherfore wha sey yt god toforne wot thyng thorow necessitie thilke thyng comyng al one sey shalbe necessitie neither costrayneth ne defedeth thing therfore sothly yf loue put said necessitie el put affirmed necessite ye necessite costraineth defedeth loue wha say loue shalbe necessitie shalbe foloweth necessitie thyng toforn put moche sey yf thus pronouced ye thing shalbe none thynge signifyeth necessitye onely thus yt shall maye togyder euenlyche also sothe loue shalbe necessitie nede haue nedeful al comyng shalbe saye loue passed loue passed passed loue present present loue present el loue commynge loue commynge commynge dyuersitye settynge wordes maketh diuersitie vnderstonding altho sentece accorde significatio ryght one loue sweete swete loue swete moche loue bitter sorowful er hertes ben eased yet gladeth thilke sorouful hert suche loue thynke forsothe otherwhyle haue mokell blys hert loue ye stou mele hath sorily anoyed certes lady se selfe knit margarit perle bonde seruyce lybertie wyl hert wil accorde seruice loue demen selfe none otherwyse thorowe necessitie constrayned seruyce abyde ala yf thorowe nedefull copultion magre withholde lytle thanke great trauayle haue deserued lady saye sayde lyketh mater declare full many men haue dyuers fantasyes reason one syde thereof whiche ryght sone trowe thou wolt vnderstod thou shalt con yeue sentence partye probable reaso soth knowyng yt haue mater maked ende certes thi ge long haue great lust lerned yet wene god wyl prescience accordeth seruyce louyng thys precious margaryte petle euer hert thurstyng desyre wete brenne vnwastyng langour fade yt day desteny deth ioy vnbide yet thende comforted supposayle blysse ioye determyne desyres thyng loue hastely neygh god graut grace mercy shalbe prayer tyl thou lykende hert thyne owne wyll enfourme mater lady thou woste lefte loue swete loue swete swete one saye tree alway necessitie whyte sometyme er whyte myght haue whyte tyme whyte maye whyte whyte tree euermore nedeful whyte neither toforne ne whyte myght togyther whyte whyte also loue necessitie present nowe ye er present myght haue shulde haue yet may shal presente thy loue present margarite hath bond nedefull present truly seme action necessitie comyge ferre forne maye shal commyng thing forsoth comynge nedefull comynge may comynge shall comynge ryght haue sayde present future tymes ye sentence sothnesse preterit yt say tyme passed thig passed must nedes passed yet wer myght haue wherfore shuld haue passed ryght wha loue coming said loue yt comnedeful yt sayd thyng comyng neuer comyng oft thing sayn wha sayn euery man man euerye louer louer must nedes way may man togyther yf necessitie say nedeful al thyng comynge comyng som thyng commyng coming impossible right termes nedefull necessitie necessary betoken signify thyng nedes may otherwyse ryght termes impossyble signifyeth thynge way may thorow parfyte necessitie al thyng comyng comyng necessitie foloweth nothyng costrayned lo whan commyng sayd thyng alwaye thynge thorowe necessitie altho commynge saye tomorowe loue comynge margarites hert therfore thorow necessitie shal thilke loue yet maye yt may although commynge neuerthelater sotyme soth somethyng necessitie sayde come yf say tomorow comyng rising sun yf therfore necessitie pronounce comynge thynge come maner loue morne comynge thy margaryte warde necessitie comyng el rysyng sunne morne commyng necessitie comynge loue sothly may necessitie aloone folowyng thorowe necessitie comynge made certayne futur future sayde sayne comyng cominge saide tomorow comyng thorowe necessite coming arysyng sun thorowe ii necessitis coming vnderstad ye one forgoig necessite maketh thing therfore shalbe nedefull another folowyng necessitie nothing costrayneth necessite come come whan sayne ye god beforne wote thing comyng nedeful commyng yet therfore make certayne euermore thyng thorow necessitie comyng sothly thynge commynge may comynge waye sentence vnderstandyng yf saye thus yf god beforne wot thynge nedefull commynge yet therfore foloweth prescience god thynge thorowe necessitie comyng tho god toforne wote thynges comynge yet therfore beforne wote euery thynge commyng thorowe necessetie som thynges beforne wot commynge frewyll resonable creature certes termes nede necessitie haue queynte maner vnderstandynge wolde dullen manye men wyttes therfore woll hem openly declare clerely tha haue toforne er departe hence mater quod thou shalt vnderstande ryght nedefull god wylne wyll nomore manye thynges nedeful man wylne woll euer ryght nedeful god woll ryght nedefull man woll tho thynges whiche god hath put man subiection wyllynge yf man woll loue loue yf ne wol loue loue suche thynges man dispositio nowe god woll maye wha woll wyll man thorowe necessitie constrayned el defended wylne woll theffecte folowe wyll nedefull wyll man free also woll maner soth thorowe necessitie ne werke louyng wol althouy woll necessitie quod tha stant loue thylke wyl sythen loue wyllyng free choyce inhert wherfore yf thorowe necessitie pray ladye answer questyon assoyle wil quod answere blyuely ryght men wyll thorowe necessitie ryght loue wyll thorowe necessitie ne thorowe necessitie wrought thylke wyll yf wold good wyl shuld haue ben wrought although yt doeth nedefull done yf man synne nothyng elles wyll shulde ryght syn wyl maner necessary done wyll necessary neuerthelater soth yf man woll synne necessary hym synne though thylke necessitie nothyng constrayned ne defended wyll ryght thylke thyng frewyll woll may may wylne nedefull wylne may wylne thilke wylne nedefull impossyble hym onethyng wylne may wilne thilke wilne nedefull impossyble hym one thynge wylne notte wylne werke forsoth wyl whome yeue hath wyll wol voluntary spontany spontany wyll saye good wyll constrayned wyl constrayned constrayned may togyther yf thys necessitie maketh lybertye wyll whiche ye aforne myght haue bene eschewed shonned god knoweth al truthe nothyng truthe al thynges spontany necessarye syght seeth ben thynges well consydered open full withoute maner repugnaunce god beforne wot maner thinges ben done frewyll aforen myght haue ben neuer shulde yet ben thorowe maner necessitie frewyll discended hereby maye quod lightly ben knowe thynges necessytye though god haue hem prescience thynges lybertye wyll make haue full knowynge goddes beforne wetynge heare quod shall saye blythlye ladye lyst mater entyrely vnderstad thou shalt vnderstande heauen goddes although ouer al power yet abydynge deuyne person heuen euerlastynge presence wthoute mouable tyme sole haue sayd toforne tyme hurteth ryght ayenwarde tyme healeth rewardeth tre oft fayled hold deyntye whan frute forth bryngeth marchaunt one lesyng see nomore auenture thynketh shal neuer auenture come rychesse oft must men oke smyte tyll happye dente haue entred ye okes owne sway maketh come one ofte falleth lethy water harde rocke tyll haue thorow persed euen draught wyre drawer maketh wyre ben euen supple werchyng stynted draught wyre breaketh sonder euery tre wel springeth wha wel grou ded often remoued shall frute nowe gynnethe rype grace quod parfyte ioye endure ther hou begon grace thiketh shulde haue rewarde long trauayle shal tell quod retrybution thy good wylles haue thy margaryte perle beareth name mede good grace cometh thy deserte thy margarytes goodnesse vertue alone quod shulde al longe trauayle haue reward thorow grace somtyme seluen sayde ryghtwisnesse euenlyche rewardeth quyte one benefite soth quod loue euer sayd hym doeth good done neyther holde ne yet constrayned soth quod truly quod euer thou dost thy margaryte peerle wyll loue reason thou owest done yet nothyng el yeldynge thy det quytyng thy grace lent wha ye fyrst met wene quod ryght lytle grace delyuered certes harde grace hath nigh astrangled good grace wot wel thou wylt graunt er thou depart hence yf anye man yeue wyght ought hym selfe nothyng maye haue garmet cote though weare cote elles thylke clothynge put hym yt naked cause clothyng onely yeuer garnement wherfore saye thou naked loue thy selfe none haue myghtest put thyne owne perso sythen thy loue came thorowe thy margaryte perle ergo yeuer loue although thou vse lent grace thy seruyce begynne worthye thanke grace yeuer thoughtes besy doinges plesauce thy might thy wordes thou canste deuyse ben ryght lytle quytynge thy dette ben suche thyng ben studyed mater kyndly drawen homewarde margaryte peerle thence borowed holy wyte loue thou hauest thus quytest thou thy dette thou stedfastly seruest kepe well loue rede thou hast borowed vse seruyce thy dette quyte art thou able right sone haue grace wherfore mede none halue mayest thou loke thus thy gynnyng endyng grace alone thy good deseruyng thy det thou aquytest without grace nothing worth euer thou werche thanke thy margaryte great grace hytherto hath gyded praye contynuaunce forthe thy werkes hereafter myshappe thy grace ouerthwartly tourne grace glorye ioye commynge thorowe good folkes desertes gettynge grace therin shulde ende glorye ioye wysdome loue parfite charitie god hath graunted tho well deserue lady al one start myne hert woll onbyde euer neuer woll gone hence woll kepe medlynge whyle lyst onbyde thyne intremetyng maners stedfastnesse shullen chaunged sobrelyche tho threwe vp myne eyen hugelye tho astonyed thys sodayne aduenture fayne wolde haue learned howe vertues shulden ben knowe whyche thynges hoope god hereafter shall enfourmen namelye sythen restynge place nowe nyghe wyll anon thynges thys lady sayde remembred selfe reuolued lyues myne vnderstandyng wyttes tho founde fully mater parfitly wrytten howe mysse rule fayned loue realmes cyties hathe gouerned great throwe lyghtly might fautes espye howe rule loue shoulde ben vsed howe sometyme fayned loue foule begyled howe shoulde loue haue knowe shall loue wyth seruyce procede also furthermore founde perdurable letter wonderly ther grauen mater shal nempne certes none age ne thynge earthe maye leest syllable poynte deface clerelye sunne myne vnderstandyng soule shynen maye neuer mynde may loue kepe thorowe wyllynge herte wylne loue maye louynge haue loue haue none thorowe grace margaryte peerle maner dout wyl woll loue louyng wyl woll ryghtfully ryghtful selue also wyll louyng woll loue woll loue louynge one wyll louynge louynges possessyon haue ryght wyll wol loue loue hath partye yet deny louynge wyl wylne loue haue hath whan wolde hath saye maye loue wylne yf loue haue throughe whiche thylke loue shulde wylne haue louynge wyll may man hym selfe onely grace toforne going ryght maye noman kepe grace folowynge consydre nowe euery man aryght let sene wyght hym selfe mowe louynge wyl get therof fyrste nothynge haue yf shulde hym selfe sprynge eyther must wyllyng wyllynge wyllynge hym selfe maye haue sythen fayleth mater shulde forth bryng mater hym fayleth may thereof haue knowyng tyll whan grace put herte thus wyllyng hym selfe may haue wyllynge maye haue parde euery conceyt euery reasonable creature otherwyse wyl graunt wyll affyrmatyfe wyllynge waye mowe accorde although louynge woll come myne hert frenesse arbytrement boke fully shewed yet owe therfore moche alow free wyll grace margaryte leaned neyther myght without grace fornegoinge afterwarde folowyng thylke grace get ne kepe lese shal neuer yf frewyll make wyllyng otherwyse grace hath graunted ryght whan person taketh wyllynge sobre throweth awaye wyllynge dronke el taketh wyll drynkynge oute measure whiche thyng anon doone maketh thorowe owne gylte free wyll leseth hys grace thyng therfore vpon nobley grace mote trusten busye cure set thylke grace kepe frewyl otherwyse reason shulde werche cause grace voyde thus must loke frewyll grace right naturall vsage engendrynge chyldren maye bene withoute father ne also mother neyther father ne mother begettynge maye lacke ryght grace frewyll accorden without hem maye louynge wyll partye ben getten yet frewyl gettynge thyng mokell thanke worthy grace ne kepynge thereof moche thanke deserueth yet gettyng kepynge done accorde trulye oftentyme grace frewyll helpeth foredoinge contrarye thynges wyllynge loue accorden strengthe wyll aduersities withsytte wherfore togyther grace oweth bene accepted wyllynge deserueth frewyll louynge wyse accorded remembre well howe boke hede taketh consydreth thynges werchynges mankynde euenlye accordeth tournynge thys worde loue trouth el ryghtwisnesse whether lyke thynge falleth man helpynge free arbytremet thylke ryghtwysnesse take el kepe thorowe whiche man shall saued whiche thyng booke mencyon hath maked euery poynt thereof grace oweth thanked wherfore saye euerye wyght hauynge ryghtfulnes ryghtfull yet therfore sey concyence ryghtfull behoten blysse euerlastynge hem ben ryghtfull withouten vnryghtousnesse man som degree maye ryghtfully ben accompted chaste men lyuynge yet ben ianglers full enuye pressed hem shal blysse neuer bene delyuered ryght verye blysse withoute maner nede ryght noman shal yeuen ryghtful voyde maner vnryghtfulnesse founde noman blysse shal ben folowed ryghtfull wyth vnryghtfulnesse bounde degre fully knowe ryghtfulnesse moche hym selfe none euyll cause maner goodnesse truly mother helpeth spyrite withsyt leude lustes fleshly lykyng stre gtheth mayntayneth lawe kynde yf otherwhyle weneth harme precyous thyng folowe therethorowe nothynge cause somwhat el commeth aboute taketh hede rightfulnesse forsoth werne many holy sayntes good sauour swetnesse god almightye folkes sauour deth deedly ende come saynctes ryghtwysnesse wycked men badnesse hath proceded truly ilke wyl whiche ladye loue lerned affectio wyl nempne wyllyng profytable thynges euel whan fleshly lustes cosenteth ayenst reason soule thyng clerely vnderstand know whence thylke wyll vycious readye euyll dedes perfourme grace gynnyng ordeyned thylke wyl ingoodnesse euer haue endured neuer badnesse haue assented men shoulde beleue god thylke wyll made vycious fyrst father adam eue vycyous appetytes vycious wyll appetytes consentyng ben one thig kynde thyng done howe wyll fyrst man fyrst assented holde profytable shewe fyrste condicyon reasonable ceeature wol consydred apertly loked lyghtly cause suche wyll maye ben shewed intention god ryghtfully blyssed shulde reasonable nature ben maked hym selfe kepe neyther blysfull ne ryghtfull myght withouten wyl bothe wyll ryghtfulnesse thylke rightfulnesse heretoforne shewed wyll blysse thylke blysse euery man hath thylke blysse whome wyll therof abydynge blysse euery vnderstandyng suffysaunce couenable commodityes without anye maner nede whether blysse aungelles el thylke grace fyrst paradyse suffered adam haue although aungelles blysse adam paradyse yet may denyed adam paradyse ne hadde suffysaunce blysse ryght great herte without al maner coldnesse yet maye herte heate haue ryght nothyng defruded ada paradyse bene blessed without al maner nede although aungels blysse moche forsothe foloweth lasse haue therefore hym nedeth wante thynge whiche behoueth ben may nede ben cleped adam fyrst gynnynge god margaryte weten meane forsothe nede wretchednesse good withoute cause fornegoinge made resonable creature wretched hym vnderstand loue fyrst maked god made therfore blyssed al maner indigece togyther one toke reasonable creature blysse wyll blyssednesse wyl rightfulnesse ryghtfulnesse selfe lybertye arbitrement free wyl thilke ryghtfulnesse may kepe lese wyse ordayned thylke two wyl instrument cleped forne mencyon maked shoulde vse thylke ryghtfulnesse teachynge hys soule good maner gouernaunce thought wordes shulde vse blysse obedyent maner withouten incommoditie blysse forsothe mannes profyte ryghtwysnesse worshyppe god delyuered one ryghtfulnes yeuen man myght lese whiche yf loste hadde continuallye haue kepte shulde haue deserued auauncement felowshyp angel thinge yf loste neuer hym selfe forwarde shuld mowe ayenward recouer well blysse angel blysse himwardes coming shulde nome one depriued thus fyl man vnto likenesse vnreasonable beestes hem corrupcyon vnlustye appetytes vnder throwen yet wyl blysse dwelleth indigence goodes whiche loste great wretchednesse ryght shuld bene punyshed thus weyued ryghtfulnes lost hath hys blysse faile hys desyre owne comoditie may comodities hys resonable nature whych hath lost may haue false lustes ben vestial appetite turned foly vnconning hath begyled wening thylke bene comodities owen bene desyred affection wyll libertie arbitriment enduced wylne thys thing shuld wyl maked yuyll vnryghtful absence rightfulnesse whych thing reason euer shulde haue freenesse arbitriment maye wylne whan haueth whyle hadde thylke halpe kepe yt wythout grace may bene recouered wyll comoditie much vnryghtful maked wyllynge yuell lustes wyllynge goodnesse may wylne wyll instrument affection wyl thralled sithen thyng maye wylne wyll instrument affection desyreth yet bene wyl cleped ye instrumet woll throuy affection wylneth affection desyreth thylke thynge wherto instrumente hym ledeth frewil vnlusty affectio ful seruaunt maked vnryghtfulnesse may releue wythout ryghtfulnes full fredo may neuer haue kyndly libertie arbytriment without veyne ydell sothe wherfore yet saye often haue sayd whan instrument wyl lost hath rightfulnesse maner grace may ayen returne ryghtfulnesse wylne sythen nothyng ryghtfulnesse alone shulde wylne yt euer wylneth wt oute ryghtfulnesse vnryghtfullye wylneth vnryghtfull appetite vnthryfty lustes flyes desyreth mokell bene kynde bene bad ben vnryghtful badde ben resonable creature beyng waye shulde bene suffred vnreasonable beastes neyther bene yuell ne vnryghtfull theyr kynde beyng knowen maye wel bene nowe thynges forne declared man hathe alwaye thylke ryghtfulnesse whyche dutie ryghte euermore hauen shulde way selfe may get ne kepe hath lese recouer shal neuer without especial grace wherfore comune setence people opinion yt euery thing destiny ruled false wicked bileue though predestinacyon wel good badde sithen sayde god hadnest made whych neuer ne wrought suffreth hem maked hardeth wha naught missayth ledde temptation whan delyuereth wherfore none incouenient yf maner sayd god forne haue destenyed bothe badde badde werkes whan hem ne theyr yuel dedes neyther ame deth ne therto hem grace leueth speciallyche predestinacion goodnesse alone sayde great clerkes god doth bene goodnesse werchen negatyfe herof badnesse holde lady loue hath lerned aryght thys boke loketh vtterly weten predestinacyon properly god maye bene demed beforne wetinge chapiter god beforne wetynge loue rehersed al mater apertly may ben founde thinges god ben togither presence trewly presence predestinacyon nothyng disacorden wherfore lerned god wetyng free choyce wyll mowe stonden togyther thinketh reason leadeth destenye frewyll accorden neyther hem nothing contrarieth resonablelyche maye ben demed often thynge fayleth frewyl werchyng yf man another man wrongfully anoyeth wherfore sleyth constrayned ende mokel folke cryeth sayeth lo destenyed god forne knowe thorowe necessytie fall otherwise myght betyde trewly neyther yt wronge wroughte ne hym selfe venged none thylke thynges thorowe necessitie wrought yf wyth freewyll wylled neyther wrought perfourmed vtterly grace ye frewyll goodnesse bryngeth kepeth fro badnesse turneth thynge moost thanke deserneth thys grace maketh setece vertue abide wherfore body soule full plentie conyng theyr good deseruyng euer lastyng ioy daye dome shul endelesse dwell shul bene learned kyngdome wyth mokel affect loue grace leste ioy shall greatest glorye reioyce bene gladded ioye wonder syth god greatest loue ye ne ought loke thynges wyth resonnynge proue instrumet wyll wyll yet varyeth effecte vsynge affection wyll also wyll cleped varyeth f instrument thys maner wyse name lyche whan commeth minde anone ryght wyllyng desyred negatyfe therof wyllyng nyl acord closed hart thoughe vsage instrument slepe slepeth wha instrumet v waken suche maner affection trewly man hath man lesse certes trew louers wenen euer therof lytle haue false louers lytle wenen haue ryght mokel lo instrument wyl false trewe euen liche proporcianed affection place bycause goodnesse foloweth thinke herafter declare vse thys instrument wyl taketh hys name whan wylned thyng doyng vtterly grace catche thy blysse desired ben rewarded thou must haue affection wyl ful vse whan tyme asketh wisely ben gouerned sothly disciple wythout feruente affection wyll may man bene saued thys affection good seruyce good loue maye bene grouded without feruent desire thing wyll coueyted neuer retcheth haue haue affection wyll yt hath restyng place whan thyng cometh mynde taken hede comyn come therfore place affection fayleth thylke affection lytle throwe goodnesse shulde come grace lytelnesse wyl suffre auaile way helpes certes grace reason thylke affection foloweth thys affection withe reason knytte dureth eueryche trewe herte euermore encreasyng ferdnesse strength maye remoue whyle truthe hert abydeth sothly whan falshed gynneth entre truth draweth away grace ioye thilke falsheed trouth hath thus voyded hath vnknyt bonde vnderstondyng reason bytwene wyl hert bonde vndoth vnknytteth wyl purpose tha ye first accorde knitteth hym wyth cotrary reason vnreason lo wyl vnreason bringeth man blysse grace whych thing pure kynde euery man ought shonne eschewe knot wyll rea confyrme thynketh thy stud ent lokes thou wenest woordes contraryen sayenges forne place wha thou somtyme affection wyl thynges yt nowe han brought disease whiche haue ye counsayled voyde thyne herte discouer made thy wyl ben chaunged whyche nowe thou wenest arg e wythholde kepe shortly say reuers wordes may ben founde thoughe dronkennesse forboden men shul alway ben drinklesse trowe right thou thy wil reaso shuld turne thy wyll one reason shulde vnbyde saye thy wyll thy fyrst purpose wyth vnreason closed constrewe forthe remenante good lyketh trewly wyll reason shulde knitte togyther fre wyl reaso tyme thyne hert assentaunt thou myghte chaunge yf thou rule reason varye whyche varyaunce come thylke blysse desyred cotrariously thou werchest thyng may knowe wyl reason loue alone yf thou voyd loue weuest bonde knytteth nedes el ryght lyghtly yt gone sondre wherfore thou seest apertly loue holdeth knot maystreth hem bounde thynges rynge circuite wrethe ben knytte thy soule wythout departynge let let nedeth rehersayle make soule yet parfyte blysse thynkynge knotte trewly lady haue groude well vnderstand thyng ye thylke spire tree shulde wexe expowne ye thynge ye therof meane shall blithly take good hede wordes rede cotinuaunce thy good seruice longe processe time ful hope abiding wythout chaung wylne thyne hert spire whych yf wel kepte gouerned shall hugely spryng tyl fruite grace plentuously sprongen although thy wyl good yet may therfore thilke blisse desyred hastely discende must abyde hys sesonable tyme processe growyng wyth thy good traueyle shall wexe tyll founde myghty windes yuel spech ne stormes enuy make traueyle ouerthrow ne frostes mystruste ne hayles ielousy ryght lytle myght haue harmyng suche sprynges euery younge setlynge lyghtly wyth smale stormes peyred whan woxen somdele gretnesse han great blastes wether lytle myght disauauntage werch mine owne souerayne lady welth myne herte lykynge vnto noble grace therthrouy displeased suppose ye erren ye make ielousy enuy disturbour hem ben seruauntes haue lerned ofte forne tyme euery loner hert greate plentie ielousyes greues ben sowe wherfore thinketh ye ne ought maner accompte thylke thyng among welked wyners venomous serpentes enuy mistrust yuel speche foole mistrust foly yuel wyl medled engendreth welked padde trewly yf distroyed ielousye vndone euer yet maner ielousy wote wel euer redy hertes trew seruauntes thus ielous ouer hym selfe leste cause hys owne disease thys ielousy full thoughte euer shulde kepte ferdnesse lese hys loue miskeping thorow owne doyng leudenesse el thus lest thou serueste feruently beset better lyketh al thy good seruyce compteth cresse ielousyes herte acceptable quality ben demed oughten euery trew louer kindly euermore hauen minde tyll fully grace blysse seruice hym discended wyll ielousy catcheth el wenyng hys owne folysh wylfulnesse mistrusteth truely wyth fantasy venyme foule begyled yuelwyll hathe grounded thylke mater sorowe hys leude soule yet tha euery wight shulde truste ne euery wyghte fully misbeleue meane thynges owen vsed sothly wythouten cause euidence mystruste ielousye shulde wened wyse person comenly leude wickednes shulde synde wyse yuell wyll acomered abyde well hys tyme tyl grace blysse seruice folowyng haue hym mokel eased abyding forehande hath diseased certes lady tho thyng wondreth sythen thylke blysse precious kyndly good wel worthy kynde wha medled lo e reaso ye forne haue declared anone hye one spronge springeth anone one cometh receyueth euery thyng kyndly place full appetite euer commeth thytherwarde kyndly draw kyndly therto costrayneth kindly stede blysse suche wyl medled vnbyde nedes shulde haue hys kyndly beyng wherfore thynketh anone wyll shewed kydde hym profreth thylke blysse shulde hye thylke wil receyue el kynde goodnesse worche hem shulde lo sunne neuer ferre euer hathe hys kynde werching erth great weyght hye onloft caryed stynteth neuer tyll come thys restyng place water see ward euer ben drawyng thynge lyght blythly wyl synke euer ascendeth vpward draweth thus kynde euery thynge hys kyndely course hys beyng place sheweth wherfore kynde thys good wyl anone spronge blysse shulde theron discend kynde wolde dwelleden togyther haue ye sayd selfe certes thyne herte sytteth wonder sore blysse haue thyne hert sore agreued taryeth longe yf thou durstest thynketh thyne wordes blysse woldest thou blame yet saye thylke blysse kyndly good hys kyndly place wyl vnbyde neuer later comyng togyther kyndes ordynaunce sodaynly may betyde must abide time kynde yeueth hym leaue yf man thys wyl medled gonne hym shew thylke blysse hast folowed lyghtly commyng shulde lyghtlye cause goynge longe tyme thurstyng causeth drynke delycious whan atasted howe tha many blysses se al day mine eye fyrst moment syght wyl accorde yee yet whyle wyth wyll assenteth syngulerly hym selfe reason fayleth traueyle none seruyce tyme thys queynt maner thing howe suche cometh aboute thus earth kyndely season tymes yere bryngeth sorth innumerable herbes tree profytable men myght leaue though naught noryshynge mannes kynde seruen el turnen soone vnto mennes confusion ease therof atast comen forthe earthe theyr owne kinde wythouten mannes cure busynesse traueyle thylke herbes mennes lyuelode necessaryly seruen wythout whyche goodlye thys lyfe creature mowen enduren mooste bene nouryshen mankinde wythout great traueyle great tylth longe abydyng tyme comen earth seede forne ordeyned herbes make sprig forth growe ryght perfite blisse haue meanyng duryng time abyde maye come lyghtlye wyth great traueyle ryght besytylth yet good feed sowe ofte croppe fayleth bad seed neuer wel traueyled thylke blysse thou spoke lyghtly coming truely necessary abiding better stamped venomous ieuse wrongen likely enpoysonen tho therof tasten certes ryght bytter bene herbes yt shewen fyrste yere owne kynde well haruest yeldeth many graynes tho longe sore hath ben traueiled woldest thou deme wold yeue thre quarter noble gold precious gyfte yee certes thre quarter full peerles certes yt rych gift mokel azure quod precious gyfte ful noble gyfte one good fayth wantynge englysh namynge noble worde preciousnesse yeue name ryghtfully haste thou demed yet loue knytte vertue passeth al golde thys erth good wil accordant reason maner properte maye countreuayled azure worlde accompt respecte reason loue wyth good wyll reason accordeth wyth earthly ryche se may ben amenden thys yefte hast thou yeuen know self thy magaryte thilke gyft hath receiued thing reward hath selfe bounde thy gyfte sayd maner rychesse maye amended wherfore wyth thynge yt maye amended thou shalt thy margarytes rightwisenesse rewardede right suffred yet neuer euery good dede sotime yolde al wold thy margarite rewarde quite ryght neuer dieth thy mede meryte woll puruey certes sodaine blysse thou first nepnest ryy wyl hem reward well worthy though thyne eye semeth rewarde yt desert passe right sende bytternes euely reward ye sodayne blisse alwaies reason great goodnes may ben accompted blisse long long abydeth endlesse wol last se thy wyl endelesse thou louedest euer thy wyll euer tabyde neuer chaunge euenhed rewarde must ben done ryght muste nedes thy grace thys blisse endeles ioy vnbide euelich disese asketh euelych ioy hastely thou shalt haue suffiseth tha long good wyll neuer wel reason medled yf good seruice longe trauayled throuy seruice shul men come ye ioy thynketh shulde wexing tree whiche ye first meued trouth hast thou co ceyued thinges thyne hert hastely shalt thou able ioye parfite blysse receyue nowe wote wel thou desyrest know ye maner brau ches tree shulde spring therof lady hertely pray tha leue woll right soone shall ataste fruite longe haue desyred thou haste herde quod wyse tree forne haue declared grounde stocke wexinge firste grounde shuld thy frewyl ful thine hert stocke said shuld continuauce good seruice longe time traueyle tyl greatnesse right wel woxen whan tree greatnesse hath caught haue rehersed braunches frute shulde forth bring spech must nedes voice prayer complayning wise vsed ala tho soroufully wounded hydeth speche spareth complayntes make shall speke ye care payne euen lyke hell sore hath assayled ferforthe payne thronge leue tree seer neuer shal frute forth bringe certes greatly eased dare pryuy mone discouer trewe felowe coninge hath myyt wherthrough playnt thyng maye ameded mokel ioyed herte hardynesse dare complayne lady care yt suffreth hope mercy grace auaunced trewly saye syth came margaryte serue durst neuer discouer maner disease wel later hathe myne hert hardied thinges done ye gret bounty worthy refreshmentes grace goodly without deserte halue ofte hath rekened nere goodnesse wyth grace wyth mercy medled whiche passen al desertes traueyls seruinges degree mighte endyte wolde wene shulde wythout recouer gettynge thys blysse euer thus haue stylled disease thus haue couered care brenne sorowfull anoy gledes cole wasten fyre vnder deed ashen well hoter fyre wyth ashen ouerleyn ryght longe wo haue suffred lo loue howe thou farest thynketh ye palasy yuel hathe acomered thy wittes faste thou hyest forwarde anone sodaynly backwarde thou mouest shall yet al thy leudnesse thy braynes dull bene thy skylfull vnderstadynges thy wyll hath thy wyt maystred woste thou well euerye tree hys sesonable tyme burionynge shewe blomes fro wtin sygne frute shulde sprynge el frute yt yere men halte delyuered ye grounde neuer good thouy stock mighty full braunches seer burions shewe farwell gadiner may pipe wt yue leafe frute failed wherfore thy braunches must burionen presece thy lady yf thou desyre fruite thy ladyes grace beware thy lyfe yt thou wodelaye vse askynge thynges stretchen shame myghte thou spede waye espy vertue woll suffre vyllanye hym selfe sprynge thy woordes maye queynt ne subtell maner vnderstandynge free wytted people supposen suche poesyes begyled open vnderstandynge muste euery worde vsed voyce wythout clere vnderstandynge sentence sayeth aristotle ryght naught printeth herte thy wordes byde herte clene ful sentence trew meaning plattly must thou shewe euer obedient hestes wyls perfourme thou set wytte wete loke euer meaneth lyste speke stilly disease suffre woder tho come neuer blisse yt traueileth vnwyst coueyteth thing vnknowe vnwetinge shal quyted wyth vnknowe thynge rewarded good lady hath oft ben sene wether stormes hugely haue fal burionynge tyme parte duresse han beaten sprynges clene wherthroughe fruite thylke yere hath fayled great grace whan burions ha good wether frutes forth brynge ala stormes howe harde auoyde tyll efte wedrynge yeres han maked circute cours al er fruite able tasted shente shame yt foule rebuked hys speche fyre brenning sore smarteth disease thynketh ful longe er water come shulde fyre quenche whyle men gone leche body buryed lo howe semely frute wexeth thinketh tho frutes maye man ataste pure bytternesse sauour thys wyse bothe frute tree wasten away togyther though mokel besy occupacion haue spent brynge ferforth able spring lyte speche hath maked al thys labour ydel wherof serueth thy question assoyle thinketh nowe duller wittes wha first mette although leude comenly foole demen good wol lerne sottes fooles le lightly mynd yt good men teacheth hem sayde therfore thy stocke muste stronge greatnesse well herted tree full eble fyrste dente falleth although frute faileth one yere two yet shal suche seasen come one tyme shall brynge frute nothynge preterit ne passed nothyng future ne co myng thinges togyther place bene present euerlastynge wythout menyng wherfore god al thing thoughe thynge nat kyndely nature thinges yet yf shuld yet euermore shulde say god maketh time present nowe future ne preterit hym maye founde wherfore hys wetynge hys wetynge al one vnderstandyng tha yf wetyng wetyng god putteth necessite al thinges whiche wotte wotte ne thyng eternitie el time woll dothe libertie necessitie thing thou wene ayenst reason thorowe necessitie thynge god wot wot yet nothyng defendeth thing wyst wyst hym wylles oure doinges done el co mynge fre arbitriment whan thou hast declaration wel vnderstand tha shalt thou fynde resonable proue many thinges thorowe necessitie thorowe libertie wyll saue necessitie fre wyl forne sayd thynketh al vtterly declared thynketh lady shulde displease euermore reuerence kepe thynges cotrarien vnderstanding ye sayne somtyme thorowe libertie wyll also thorow necessitie haue yet sauour without better declaration woder thynges sythen al daye thou shalte se thyne eye many thynges receyuen hem selfe reuers thorow diuers reason thus praye whych thinges bene reuers commen gone yf bydde come thou come whan bydde go thou go thou reuersest fro thy fyrst commynge soth yet thy fyrste alone diuers reason full reuersynge vnderstande howe shall shewe ensample thynges haue kyndely mouynge anye thinge meueth kyndely doth heuens eye whyche clepe sunne sothly semeth moost kyndly moue thou sayest soth tha thou loke sunne parte vnder heuen euermore heigheth mouing fro thylke place heygheth meuynge towarde thylke place thylke place fro whyche goth heigheth commyng wythout ceasynge place neigheth fro chaunged withdraw thynges diuersitie reason reuers one thyng may sey repugnaunce wherfore wise wythout anye repugnaunce reason fore maked al one beleue somthinge thorowe necessitie commynge cominge yet wyth necessitie costrayned commyng wyth necessitie cometh fre wyll haue sayd tho lyst lytle speke gan stynt penne writyng sayd wyse trewly lady thinketh allege authorites great ye contrary sayenges iob sayeth mannes person thou hast put hys terme whych thou myght passe saye man may shorte ne length day ordayned hys doyng altho somtyme v semeth man thynge free wyl wherthorow hys deth henteth naye forsoth nothynge ayenst sayenge god begyled ne seeth nothynge whether shal come lyberte el necessite yet said ordeyned god immouable done may chau ged thyng also paule apostel sayth hem tofore purpossed sayntes thus whych god wyst hath predestined conformes ymages hys sonne shulde fyrste begotten say amonges many brethre hath predestyned hem hath cleped hath cleped hem hath iustifyed hath iustified hem hath magnifyed purpose whiche ben cleped sayntes holy ye euerlastyng preset wheris neither tyme passed ne tyme comynge euer presente nowe mokel momet seuen thousande wynter ayenwarde wythouten meuyng nothynge lych temporel presence thige yt euer present yet amoges er presence mouable thorowe lyberte arbytremet ryght euerlastyng present maner thing ne shalbe nowe te porel tyme somthyng shalbe mouynge stoundes thys maner repugnaunce right euerlastynge presence nothynge may chauged te porel tyme proued mouable lyberte wil wythoute incouenience therof folowe teporel tyme presence tother present done passed come gynne entre whych tymes amoges euerych easely foloweth ye presence euerlastyng dureth onehed wythout ymaginable chaugyng euer present nowe truely course planetes ouerwhelmynges sonne dayes nightes new gynnyng circute ended sayne one yere folow another maken trasitory tymes wyth chaugyng lyues mutation people right teporel presence coueyteth euery place al thinges euery tymes coteyned sey wyst goddes knowynge wodreth paule spake wordes byvoice significatio tyme passed god saites wyst hath predestined hath cleped hath iustifyed hath magnifyed thynketh shulde haue sayde tho wordes tyme present accordaunt euerlastynge present haue spoke preterit voice passed vnderstandynge loue wordes se well thou hast lytel vnderstadyng ye euerlastyng presence el spoken wordes neuer thing tho thou hast nepned fore one euenlych ye god al together ye euerlastig present nowe vnderstadyng eternal presence sayd hath enclose together one al tymes close one al thinges yt ben dyuers tymes dyuers place te porel wythout posteriorite priorite closed therin perpetuel maked dwel present sight thou sayest yt paule shulde haue spoke thilke forsaid sentece tyme present shulde haue ben accordaunt euerlastyng presence gabbest thou thy wordes sothly say paul moued ye wordes significatio tyme passed shewe fully yt thylke wordes put teporel signification al thilk tyme thilk sentece teporallich borne whiche paule pronounced god haue tofore knowe haue cleped magnifyed wherthorow may wel know paule vsed tho wordes passed significacio nede lacke word mane bodely spech betokenyng euerlastynge presence therfore worde moste semelyche lykenesse euerlastynge presence toke sentece thynges beforne ben passed vtterly immouable ylyke ye euerlasting presece
