thylke ben neuer mowe present thinges time passed ne mowe wyse passed al thinges temporal presence passen lytel shullen ben present similitude euerlastyng presence sygnifycacion tyme passed tyme temporal present accordaunce maner thyng ben thorow fre arbytremet el necessary holy wrytte pronouceth eternite speketh presence euerlasting soth nothyng sothe immouable tyme nought alway ben wylles act right nat nedeful hem oft nedfull somtyme shulde yet must lerned ensample loue quod woll nowe ensample make sythen know heed knotte yelke lo somtyme thou wrytest arte ne arte wyll wryte ryght whyle thou wrytest el wol write nedeful wryte el wylne wryte make ye knowe vtterly th thynges ben otherwyse ye euerlastyng presence temporall tyme se good chylde somthynge euerlastynge presence temporel tyme eternite tyme eterne presence shal reason defedeth somthyng ne maye tyme temporall mouynge eterne immouable forsothe nomore contrary ne reuers mouable tyme temporal mouable eternite tyme alway eternite haue el come tyme temporel haue ne nought comyng eternite yet neuer later saye somthynge neuer tyme teporel euer eternite al onely somtyme saye thy loue morne tyme day alone deny ne yet neuer later alwaye eternite quod semeth comyng thing el passed teporal tyme eternite euer nowe presente oweth demed yet foloweth nat thylke thynge el shalbe maner therto ben passed el comyng vtterly shul deny wythout ceasyng hys present maner quod myne disciple gynnest thou able haue name seruaunt thy wytte clered away errour cloude vnconnyng awaye blyndnesse loue awaye thoughtfull study medlyng maners hastly shalte thou entre ioye thyne owne maystres thou haste quod fewe wordes wel clerely concluded mokel mater ryght ther reuers ne contrarioustie tho thynges ryght wythoute repugnauce sayd somthyng mouable tyme temporel eternite dwelleth immouable wythout cessyng right nought tyme euerlastynge teporallyche somtyme ny toforne maye haue sayd nowe sothlye haue wel vnderstade nowe thynketh prescience god fre arbytremet wythouten repugnauce acorden yt maketh strength eternite encloseth presence duryng al tymes al thynges ben han ben shull ben tyme wolde nowe lytel vnderstad sythen thyng thus beforne wot whether thylke wetynge tho thinges el thylke thynges ben ben goddes wetyng god nothynge yf euery thing thorowe goddes w tynge therof take hys beynge shuld god maker author badde werkes shuld rightfully punyshe yuell doynges mankynde quod loue shal tel thys lesson lerne myne owne tene seruaut noble philosophicall poete englyshe whyche euermore hym besyeth trauayleth ryght sore name encrese wherfore al wyllen good owe worship reuerence truely better ne pete schole rule conde neuer fynde treatyse yt made seruaut troylus hath mater touched full thys questyon assoyled certaynly hys noble sayenges amende goodnes ge tyll manlyche speche wythout maner nycite starteres ymaginacion wytte good reason sentence passeth al maker ye boke troylus answere thy questyon mayste thou lerne neuer later yet may lyghtly thyne vnderstandynge somdele ben lerned thou haue knowyng fornsayd thiges thou haue vnderstandynge two last chapiter thys seconde boke yt say good somthyng bad want al maner beynge badde nothynge el absence good god good maketh good dedes good yuel maketh yt ben nauyt ben bad nothyng badnesse haue tho ynough knowig theri nedeth thinges ye say shall come blysse loge desired thys mater toforne declared loue haue well shewed yt euery man hath fre arbytremet thynges hys power vndo hym lyketh thys grounde must come spire processe tyme shall greatnesse sprede haue braunches blosmes warynge frute grace whych caste sauoure endlesse blysse ioy euer onbyde lady tree set wold lerne thou shalt er thou departe hence fyrst thynge thou must set thy werke grounde syker good accordaunte thy sprynges yf yu desyre grape thou goest hasell ne fetchen rose thou sekest okes yf thou shalt haue hony soukles thou leauest frute soure docke wherfore yf thou desyre blysse parfyte oye thou must set thy purpose vertue foloweth loke bodely goodes sayd thou wryt ng thy seconde booke thou hast set thy selfe noble place vtterly lowed thyne herte mysgoyng thy fyrst purpose thys se teles esyer sprynge lyghter thy soule grace bl ssed trewly thy desyre saye thy wyll algates mote ben stedfaste thys mater wythout chaungynge yf stedfast man maye voyde yes parde ny wyll maye ben turned frendes dysease manace thretnyng lesynge lyfe lymmes many wyse nowe cometh mynde also mote ofte ben thought remembraunce may holde one thynge continually herte neuer lusty desyred nowe se thy wyl shal folowe thy frewyl grouded cotinuelly abyde thy fre wil thou louest hast loued yet shal loue thys margaryte perle thy wyl thou thinkest holde thy wyl knyt loue chauge newe lust besyde thys wyll teacheth thyne hert fro al maner varyeng although thou thretened deth el otherwyse yet thyne arbitremet chose thy loue voyde el holde thylke arbytrement maner iugement bytwene desyre thy herte yf thou deme loue thy good wyl fayleth arte thou worthy blysse good wyl shulde deserue thou chose contynuaunce thy good seruyce thy good wyll abydeth nedes blysse folowig thy good wil must come stregth thylke iugement thy fyrst wyl yt taught thyn hert abyde halte theschauge wyth reson accorded trewly maner wyl thus shal abyd impossible turne yf thy herte trewe yf euery man dyligently menynges hys wyl cosider shall wel vnderstande good wyl knyt wyth reason false herte neuer voyded power myght kepyng thys good wyl thorow lyberte arbytremet hert goodwil kepe may fayle eke yf fayle sheweth selfe goodwyl kepyng thus false wyll putteth good anone constrayneth herte accorde louynge thy goodwyll thys accordauce bytwene false wyl thyne herte falsyte ben lykened together yet lytel wol say good wyll thy goodwylles rayse strength take hede thy wylles thou shalt vnderstande right ye han body dyuers membres fyue sondrye wyttes euerych apart hys owne doyng thinges instrumetes ye vsen hades aparte handle fete go tonge speke eye se ryght ye soule hath hym certayne sterynges strengthes whych vseth instrumetes certayne doynges reason soule vseth thiges know proue wil vseth wilne yet neither wyl ne reason al ye soule eueryche hem thing self ye soule right euerich hath thus singuler istrumetes selfe han well diuers aptes dyuers maner usynges thilke aptes mowe wyll ben cleped affectios affectio instrumet wyllyng apetites wherfore mokel folke sayne resonable creature soule thing feruetly wylneth affectuously wylneth thus may wyl terme equiuocas thre wayes vnderstad one instrmet wyllyng another affectio thys instrument thyrd vse yt setteth werke instrumet willyng thilke stregth soule ye costraineth wylne ryght reson instrumet reason ye vsen ye loken affection thys instrument thyng ye drawe desyrouslye thyng wylne coueytous maner tyme mynde yf come thought thylke thyng reme bre anone ye wylling thilke done el haue thus instrument wyl affection wyl also wylne thynge sayd wylne helth whe wyl nothing theron thiketh anon cometh memorie wyl affection wylne slepe whe mynde anone remembred wyl wylneth slepe tyme cometh yt doynge affection wyll neuer accordeth sycknesse ne alway wake right true louers affectio willyng instrument wylne truth hys seruyce affection alway abydeth although sleping thret ed el theron thinkyng anon cometh minde anone stedfast wil abyde vse instrument forsoth another thyng hym selfe haue ye whe ye doynge wylled thyng affect instrumet wil purposed desyred maner vsage seruice wisely nedeth ruled fro wayters wt enuy closed fro spekers ful iagelig wordes proude folke hautayne labes innocentes scornen dyspysen thus doyng varieth actes willing euerich yet ben cleped wil name wyl vtterly owen haue instrument wyll wyl ye turne purpose thynge syt stande suche thynge el instrument maye ben although affecte vsage lefte doynge right ye haue syght reason yet alway vse ye greatest wysedome hem shall god nowe false folke ashamed wenen al bestialte erthly thing swetter better body heuely soule thys grace frute yt longe haue desyred doth good sauoure smel christ nowe crye mercy grace graunt thy goodnes euery maner reder full vnderstadynge thys leude pamflet haue let man wene cause thys werke verely soth enuy euer redy innoce te shende wherfore wolde good speche enuye euermore hynder man wene thys werke sufficiently maked goddes werke passeth man ma wyt perfit werke may way puruay thende shuld leude ought wene perfectio ende get neuer later grace glorie laude yeld put wt worshypful reuereces yt sothfast god thre vnite closed yt heuy lagour sycknesse hath turned mirth helth forecouer right sorowed thorow gloton cloude manyfolde syckly sorowe myrth ayen comyng helth hath gladed greatly coforted besech pray therfore crye goddes gret pyte hys mokel mercy thys present scorges fleshe mow make medecyn lech craft inner man helth yt passed trespas tenes throughe wepyng myne eyen ben wash boyded fro al maner dysese nomore wepe herafter kept thorow goddes grace th goddes hade whych mercyably ha scorged herafter good plyte fro then mercyably kepe defede thys boke many preuy thynges wympled folde vnneth shul leude plytes vnwynde wherfore pray holy goost lene hys oynt mete men wyttes clere goddes loue man wonder howe thys question come mynde great lustye desyre thys lady enfourmed leudnesse amende certes knowe mennes wyttes shuld aske answere shulde saye leude selfe mokel lernynge yet behoueth haue made therfore coud sufficiently wolde mater yaue sentence dull wytte hyndered stepmother foryetynge wyth cloud vnconnynge stoppeth lyghte margarite perle wherfore may shyne shulde desyre onely good reder also coueyte praye good boke amender correction wordes sentence onely thys mede coueyte trauayle euery inseer herer thys leude fantasye deuoute orison prayer god great iudge yelden prayen wyse hys dome synnes mowe ben released foryeuen prayeth selfe trauayleth also pray euery man parfytly mowe knowe thorowe intencion herte tretyse haue drawe yt syghtfull na deserte chyldre israel spirituall meate bodely also mennes body norisheth yet neuer ye later christ sygnifyed ryght iewell betokeneth gemme stone vertuous el perle margarite woma betokeneth grace lernyng wysedo god el holy church yf breed thorow vertue made holy fleshe god sayth spirete yeueth lyfe fleshe nothynge profyteth fleshe fleshly vnderstandyng flesh wythout grace loue nought worth letter sleeth ye spirite yeueth lyfelich vnderstadyng charite loue loue charyte god graunt v therin frended thus testament loue ended pthus endeth testament loue foloweth lamentatyon mary magdaleyne plonged wawe mortall dystresse ala wo shall compleyne shall deuoyde thys great heuynesse fro wofull mary wofull magdaleyne lord gon ala wrouyt treine sodeine chauce perseth hert depe nothing wayle wepe lorde gone yt graue layde hys great passion deth cruell hath hym thus agayne betrayde man tell become prynce israell iesus nazareth gostly socour parfyte loue hope honour creature hath hym hence caryed howe myght thys sodeynly befall wolde wyth hym taryed shulde haue purpose bought oyntmentes full precious royall wherwyth hoped corp anoynted thus gone mynde dyspoynted whyle therfore aduertyse beholde pytous chaunce presence ful lytel maruayle though herte colde consydrynge lo lordes absence ala full negligence shulde founde bycause come late men may faye infortunate cause sorowe maye vnderstande quia tulerunt dominum meum another ne maye fonde wotnere vbi posuerunt eum thus muste bewayle dolorem meum wyth herty wepyng better deserue tyl deth approche herte kerue herte opprest wyth sodeyne auenture feruent anguyshe wrapped longe thys lyfe may endure payne suche mortall wo neuerthelesse partye shall go hope fynde myne owne turtyll true lyues ioye souerayne lorde iesu syth ioye call hys presence thus remoued nowe ful mone ala whyle made prouidence thys myshap wherfore sygh grone socour find place might gone fayne wolde man herte breke note may complayne speke alone stande ful sory ful sadde hoped haue sene lorde kynge small cause haue mery gladde remembrynge thys bytterfull departynge thys worlde creature lyuynge good gracious hys loue also golde precious ful sore sygh wythout comforte agayne cure saluation hys brenyng loue herte doth costraine ala wofull permutacion wherof fynde ioye consolacion therfore payne onely confesse wyth dethe feare woll ende heuynesse thys wo anguyshe intollerable yf byde lyfe sustayne yf go hence paynes vncurable wher hi fynde knowe place certayne thus thynges twayne whych maye take whych may refuse hert wouded heron thynke muse whyle shall stande thys mournyng hope yf vysyon wol appere loue might tel good tiding whych ioy myght chauge wepynge trust grace hys mercy dere leest though therwyth kyll shal spare wayle wepe fyll yf dye suche auenture nomore welcome chaunce bone shall rest thys sepulture lyfe dethe hys ordinaunce shalbe tolde euerlastyng remembrauce thus departe shame also therof nothynge blame hope agaynst hath course ytake nomore thus shall dye se ryght wel lorde hath forsake coceyte cause knowe none though farre hence nothyng nye yet wofull herte hym doth seke causeth teeres ren cheke thynkyng ala haue lost hys presence whych worlde al sustenauce crye cal wyth herty dyligence wyght gyueth attendaunce certifye myne enquyraunce wherfore wyll al thys worlde bewraye howe lorde slayne borne awaye though mourne great wonder syth al ioye speciall nowe thynke farre sonder hym se feare neuer shall helpeth hym call ne hym enquyre coste ala howe thus gone loste iewes thynke full mysery sette malyce theyr besy cure wyth force myght gylefull trechery hath entermyned lordes sepulture borne awaye precious fygure leuynge nothynge yf haue done marred ala shall wyth theyr vengeaunce insaciable nowe haue hym entreated reporte lamentable bete hys body toppe neuer man borne felte suche wo wounded hym ala wyth al greuauce blode downe reyled habudauce blody rowes stremed downe ouer hym assayled malycyously wyth theyr scourge stroke beestyall spared smote incessauntly satisfye theyr malyce full besy spit face smote groned ful sore swette many tere crowned wt thornes sharpe kene vaynes rent blode ran downe apace wyth bloode ouercome hys eyen bolne stroke blessed face hym entreated men without grace kneled hym made many scorne lyke helhoundes haue hym al corne vpon myghty crosse length brede turmetours shewed theyr cursydnesse nayled hym wythout pyte brede hys precious bloode brast largenesse strayned alonge mercylesse ioyntes myne apparence ryued asonder theyr great vyolence thys beholdyng wt myne eyen twayne stode besyde wyth rufull attendauce euer thought beyng paine loked wyth deedly councenaunce sayd hys speciall remembrauce farewell magdalen departe must nedes hen herte taqua cera liquescens whych rufull syght gan beholde wytte almost dystraught tare heere handes wrange solde ye sight herte drake draught many fal swounyng caught brused body fallyng grounde wherof fele many greuous woude wretch full al frowardnesse gaue drynke eysell tempred gal ala poyson full bytternesse loues chere caused appall yet therof might nat drinke spake wordes thought best father heuen consummatum est kneled downe paynes outrage clipping ye crosse within myn armes twayn bloode distylled downe vysage clothes eke droppes dyd distayne haue dyed wolde full fayne shulde auayle yf dyd sythe suspensus patibulo thus lorde full dere disgysed bloode payne woundes many one veynes brast hys ioyntes ryued partyng sonder fleshe fro bone sawe hynge nat alone cum iniquis deputatus est nat lyke man lyke leprous beest blynde knyght men called longias wyth speare aproched vnto souerayne launsyng syde full pytously ala precious herte claue twayne purple bloode eke fro hertes vayne rayled right fast moste ruful wyse wyth christal water brought paradyse whan behelde thys wofull passyon wote nat howe sodayne auenture herte peersed compassyo remayned lyfe nature stroke dethe felte wythout measure dethes woude caught wt wo opprest brought poynt hert shuld brest woude hert blood darlyng shall neuer slyde fro remoriall bytter paynes also tourmentyng wythin soule grauen principall speare ala sharpe withall thrilled herte felyng body soule departyng sone might releued vp agayne brethe coude nat well restore felyng selfe drowned great payne body soul thought al tore vyolent falles greued right sore wepte bledde selfe fared one lyfe nothyng cared lokyng vp rufull roode sawe first vysage pale fygure pytous syght spotted wyth bloode sawe neuer yet lyueng creature exceded boundes measure mane mynd al wyttes fyue nothynge able payne diseryue gan myne armes vnbrace vp lyftyng handes full mournyngly syghed sore sobbed place heuen erth might haue herde crye wepyng sayd ala incessauntly ah swete herte gostly paramour ala may nat thy body socour blessed lorde howe feirse howe cruell cursed wightes nowe hath slayne kernyng ala thy body euerydell woude within woud ful bytter thy payne nowe wolde might attayne nayle body fast vnto thy tree payne thou might go free nat reporte ne make rehersayle demenyng wyth cyrcumstaunce wel wote speare euery nayle thirled soule inwarde resemblaunce whiche neuer shall remembraunce duryng lyfe woll cause wayle ofte remembre batayle ah ye iewes worse dogges rabyate moued thus cruelly aray neuer displeased caused debate loue true hertes coueyted aye preched teched shewed ye right way wherfore ye lyke tyrantes wode wayward haue thus slayne rewarde ye ought haue remebred one thing special fauour grace magnifycence prince borne lorde ouer howe ye toke small reuerence full meke suffryng offence neuertheles ye deuoured wt one assent hungry wolues dothe lambe innocet pyte people mercylesse armyng self falsheed treason lord ye haue shewed woodnesse lyke men beestes without reason malyce suffred season payne wol come thynke nat slacke man without mercy mercy shall lacke ye traytours mayntayners madnesse vnto folly ascribe payne ye haue depriued ioye gladnesse dealyng lorde souerayne nothyng shulde nede thus complayne lyued peace tranquillyte ye haue slayne iniquite farwel noblenesse yt sotyme dyd rayne farewel worshyp glorie fame lyue hate disdayne maruayle ye nat trespas blame vnto shame turned good name vpon nowe woll wonder euery nacion people vyle reputacion wycked wretch houdes hel haue tolde playne sentence nat content dere loue thus quell yet muste embesyle presence perceyue couert vyolence haue conueyed displesure lafte naked sepulture wherfore truthe rightfull iugement malyce agayne may acquyted verdyte auysement false murder shall endyted thefte also whiche shall nat respyted haste shal hanged drawe woll selfe plede cause lawe ala yf true attendaunce styll abydden lordes corse kept styll wyth trewe perceueraunce nat befall thys wofull deuorse payne welcome force shall songe euer go departyng grounde wo se right wel nowe paynes smerte wounde greuous dolour wounde carefull herte sythe haue loste thus paramour swetnesse tourned sour myrthe herte nothyng may conuey beareth therof bothe locke key ioye excellent blyssed paradyse maye ala wyse recomforte songe angell nothyng may suffyse myne herte nowe make disporte refuse might resorte vnto loue well goodlyheed whose longyng trowe shalbe deed paynfull labour tourment corporall make therof none exceptioun paynes hell woll passe ouer loue fynde myne affectioun great dilectatioun thousande tymes martred wolde blyssed body one yf might se worlde large compace shall nat spare renne lyfe duryng fete also shall nat rest one place tyll loue may tidyng whose absence hades wryng thinke cease shal neuer mynd gentyll iesu shall fynde ierusalem wol sertche place fro place syon vale iosophath also yf fynde hym nat space mount olyuet bethany woll go wayes woll wander many mo nazareth bethleem mountana iude traueyle shall payne hym se blyssed face yf might se fynde sertche wolde euery coste countrey fardest parte egipt hote inde shulde lytell iourney howe thus gone taken away yf knewe full trouthe certente yet care released might wyldernesse thynke best go sith tidynges may lyfe lede fro may dwell man appere towne ne vyllage woll come nere alone woodes rockes caues depe may myne wil wayle wepe myne eyen twayne withouten varyaunce shall neuer cease promyse faithfully wepe wyth great abundaunce bytter teares rennyng incessauntly whiche teares medled ful pitously wyth blode euer shall renne also expressyng myne herte greuous wo worldly fode sustenaunce desyre none suche lyueng fynde woll take rote growen craggy stone shall suffyse wyth water lake thus may say lordes sake fuerunt mihi lachrime mee deserto pane die ac nocte body clothe maketh force mournyng mantell shalbe suffycient greuous woundes hys pytous corse shalbe full royall garnement departed thus best content crosse nayles scourge withal shalbe thought payne speciall thus woll lyue haue tolde yf may longe tyme endure feare dethe ouer bolde purpose nat sure paynes encrease wythout measure longe lyfe lay reason thyng mortall hath season syghe full sore ferre yfet myne herte fele nowe bledeth inwardly blody teares may wyse let sythe payne fynde remedy thanke god yf nowe dye wyl perfourmed holde content soule let hym take hath lent lenger endure intollerable wofull herte enflamed huge sorowe myne comparable sythe mynde fynde refuge yet hym requyre ryghtfull iuge deuoyde fro inwarde sorowe lest lyue nat nexte morowe wythin myne herte impressed full sore royall forme shappe semelynesse porte chere goodnesse euermore hys noble persone wyth gentylnesse welle parfytnesse redemer mankynde loue best hert soule mynde absence paynes full bytter rightwell maye fele nowe inwardly wonder though hurte slee cause crye rewefully myne herte oppressed wonderfully onely hym whiche bright blee ala trowe shall hym neuer se ioye traslate full farre exile myrthe chaunged paynes colde lyfe thynke endureth whyle anguyshe payne beholde wherfore handes thus wrynge folde graue loke call pray dethe remayneth lyfe borne away nowe must walke wander god wote partes shall dresse wyth quakyng herte wepyng many tere seke loue swetnesse wolde wyst mortall heuynesse myne herte reneweth wolde nat kepe pyte long store wythout hym may nat long endure hys loue sore worketh wythin brest euer wepe thys sepulture sighyng ful sore myne hert shulde brest duryng lyfe shall optayne rest mourne wepe euer go makyng complaynt mortall wo fast crye audyence commyng hider please soule opprest absence ala lyst nat sette myne hert ease wherfore payne selfe withall disease shall nat spare tyll take grace el shall sterue place one yf myght wyth speke ioye parfyte plesaunce myght myne hert breke shulde anone deuoyde greuaunce blysse recreaunce nowe ala nothyng stede ioye naught haue wo noble corse within myne herfes rote depe graued whiche shall neuer slake nowe gone place ne wote mourne wepe sake sythe paste vowe make wyth hertely promyse therto bynde neuer cease tyll may hym fynde vnto hys mother thynke go haply comforte may take one thyng yet feareth mo yf mention hym make wordes wold trymble quake coude blame hauig one son borne away mother woll mone sorowes many hath suffred trewly syth fyrst conceyued hym bare seuyn thynges specially drowneth hert sorowe care yet lo wyse may compare wyth one nowe yf knewe wolde paynes euerichone renewe great sorowe mennes sayeng temple symeon iustus shewyng wordes prophesieng cuam anumam pertransidit glaoius also whan herode tyrant urious chylde pursued euery place lyfe went neyther mercy ne grace mourned whan knewe hym gone ful long sought founde ayene whan went dethe hys crosse vpon syght rewefull payne wha hong theron betwene theues twayn speare vnto hert thrust ryght swouned grounde pight whan deed blody lappe lay hys blessed body handes fete tore cryed sayd nowe welaway thus arayde neuer man whan haste made body bore vnto hys sepulture remayne vnnethes wo coude sustayne sorowes seuyn lyke swerds eueryone hys mother hert wounded fro syde syde yf knewe sonne thus gone worlde shuld deth ryde care coude lenger abyde hauyng ioye consolatioun standyng statioun wherfore se dare nat presume fro presence woll selfe refrayne yet leuer dye consume tha mother shuld haue payne neuerthelesse sonne wold se ful fayne presence ioye swetnesse hys absence sorowe heuynesse syth may nat mete desyre aboue thyng nedes must take soure swete hys noble corse tydyng full ofte crye handes wryng myne herte ala relenteth payne whyche wol brast bothe senewe vayne ala howe vnhappy wofull houre wherin thus myspended seruyce myne entente eke trewe labour none effecte may come wyse ala thynke yf dyspise lyst nat take symple obseruaunce deth fynaunce haue called sed non respondit mihi wherfore myrth tourned mourning dere lorde quid mali feci tibi coforte fynde non erthly thing ala haue compassyon cryeng fro faciem tuam abscondis comsumere vi wythin myne hert grounded thy fygure worldes horryble tourment may nat aswage without measure brennyng feruent remembre lorde haue ben dilygent euer please onely mo myne herte soeuer go therfore dere darling trahe post te let nat stande thus desolate quia non est qui consoletur myne herte disconsolate paynes also nothyng moderate nowe yf lyste speke lyue come hast hert sonder wyll ryue profer lo poore seruyce please myne owne entent offre deuout sacrifyce boxe replete precious oyntment myne eyen twayne wepyng suffycient myne herte anguyshe fulfylled ala soule eke redy loue pa naught el haue please pay myne hert gold precious stone shulde thyne without delay wyth hertely chere yu shuldest haue anone suffrest thou stande alone thou hast trowe wepyng disdayne el thou knowest nat payne yf thou withdrawe thy noble dalyaunce ought euer displeased thou knowest ryghtwel ignorauce knowlege certaynte haue offended lorde forgyue gladde make full repentaunce thyng hath ben thy greuaunce myne herte ala swelleth wythin brest sore opprest anguishe payne peces forsothe woll brest yf se thy blessed corse agayne lyfe ne dethe nat refrayne thou make delay thou mayst sure myne herte wol leape sepulture ala lord farest thou thus tribulation yet haue mynde thy mercy thy pyte whiche euer trusted fynde sotyme thou good kynde lette please prayer accept whiche teares haue bewept thou oughtest haue routh syth thys mournyng sythe aplyghted fyrst trouth neuer varyed discordyng knowest thou best myne owne darling constraynest thou thus wayle wo forsoth nothyng auayle haue endured wythout variaunce right thou knowest thy louer iust trew hert thought aye thyne ordynauce lyke saphire alwaye one hewe neuer chaunged newe withdrawest thou presence sith thought thyne absence wyth herte entier swete lorde crye enclyne thyne eares petycioun come velociter exaudi remembre myne hertes dispositioun maye nat endure conditioun therfore paynes libera thou arte pone iuxta te lette beholde iesu thy blyssed face thy faire glorious angelyke visage bowe thyne eares complaynt ala conuey rage ala lorde take fro domage desyre mercy condiscende non thou may greuauce amende nowe yet good lorde beseche pray thou raysed brother lazarous frome dethe lyfe fourth day come ayen body soule precious great thyng mayst thou shewe vnto v thy selfe power thy goodheed thou dyd hym lyenge graue deed myne hert wounded thy charite brenneth flameth incessauntly come dere lorde ad adiuuandum nowe nat longe payne mulpiply lest meane tyme departe dye thy grace put bothe hope cofidence pleaseth thy hye magnifycence floodes dethe tribulatyon soule fele entred full depe ala consolatioun euer wayle euer mourne wepe sorow hath wouded myne hert ful depe dere loue marueyle though dye sagitte tue infixe sunt mihi wandryng place wyldernesse comforte haue ne yet assuraunce desolate ioye replete fayntnesse answere receyuyng myne enquirauce myne herte also graued wyth displesaunce wherfore may saye deus deus non est dolor sicut dolor meus myne hert expresseth quod dilexi multum may nat endure though wolde fayne solum superest sepulchrum knowe right well huge payne thus loue may nat lyfe sustayne god muse ayleth quod sic repente precipitas ala se wyll none otherwyse nowe must take leaue euermore bytter payne hath almost discofyte loues corse wyse restore ala wo euer bore tombe muste dye starue dethe aboute herte carue testament wolde begyn make god father soule commende iesu loue dyed sake herte bothe gyue sende whose loue lyfe maketh ende body also monument bequeth bothe boxe oyntment wylles lo nowe make last right place within sepulture wol buryed whan deed past vpon graue woll haue scripture within resteth goostly creature christes trewe louer mary magdalayne whose hert loue brake peces twayne ye vertuous woman tender nature full pyte compassyoun resorte pray vnto sepulture synge di ige great deuotioun shewe charyte condicioun syng pyte let hertes wepe remembring deed layde slepe whan ye begyn parte fro ended haue mournyng obseruauce remembre euer ye go alway sertche make due enqueraunce loue myne hertes sustenaunce euery towne euery vyllage yf ye maye noble ymage yf happe grace laste ye treweloue fynde cost say magdaleyne deed past pure loue hath yelded vp gost say thyng loued might nat dethe eschewe paynes sore dyde euer renewe token loue perpetuall whan buryed place present take myne hert rote close within boxe oyntment dere loue make therof present knelyng downe wordes lamentable message speke fayre tretable say selfe commende thousande tymes herte free poore token say hym sende pleaseth goodnesse take gree hys owne ryght hys see whyche asked whan sayd longe gyue thy herte desyre due lorde loue fayre face due turtel doue freshe hue due myrthe due al solace due ala sauyour lorde iesu due gentyllest euer knewe due excellent paramour fayrer rose sweter lylly flour due hope plesure eternall lyfe welth prosperite myne herte golde peerle orientall myne adamant parfyte charite chefe refuge felycite comforte recreatioun farwell perpetuall saluatioun farewell myne emperour celestyall beautyful prince al mankynde due lorde herte lyberall farwell swetest bothe soule mynde louyng spouse shall neuer fynde due souerayne gentylman farewell dere herte hertely thy wordes eloquent flowing swetnesse shall ala mynde reconforte wherfore lyfe must ende bytternesse worlde shall neuer resorte whiche myne heuenly disporte se ala woll none nowe farwell grounde dignite due fayrest euer bore ala may se blessed face nowe welaway shal se thy blessed vysage replete wyth grace wherin printed parfyte solace due myne hertes roote al euer nowe farewel must disceuer soule anguysh nowe full thursty faynt ryght sore heuynesse lorde spouse cur dereliquisti syth suffre al thys distresse causeth seme thus mercylesse sith pleaseth make ende manus tuas spirite comende pfinis remedy loue seyng manyfolde inconuenience fallynge vnbridled prosperite tempred moral prudence nothyng welthy tha youthes frelte moued ryght equyte youthes wele somwhat write wherby may hym selfe safecondyte fyrst note thyng moost noyous vnto youth greuous malady amonge v called loue encombrous veryng yonge people straungely ofte force causeth hem dye age eke turmented loue byneth gyrdle aboue wherfore thys werke ryght laborous age nede hande take youth oweth obsequious nowe begyn thus worke hys sake whych may feruence loue slake louer mitigatyue hym none preseruatyue myghty lorde whych gouerneth youth meane measure yf pace euery mater whiche hym concerneth fyrst behoueful woll aske grace forth wythal thys place er begyn wol knele saye fewe wordes hym helpe pray flourynge youth whych hast auauntage strength body lust beaute also precellyng haste aboue age many singuler commodite howe one thyng hath beyonde thy moost profyte greatest auayle shlud ye coduit meane sad cousayle yet good lorde presumption nyl depraue thy myght deite lyue vnder thy protection thy subiecte weare thy lyuerie thou arte grounde prosperite freshest floure al garlonde singuler ayde wel vnderstonde oweth hys lorde beste seruice entyre fayth honour supporte ryght speke none wyse knowlege selfe one leste sorte thy seruauntes elder comforte drawe sadde counsayle yf thou lyst thy power may resyst fye age vnder wordes fewe erconyous opinyon spekest whyche sayth vntrew al youth yl disposition dampneth v al wythout exception colerable auauntage sayth resteth counsayle sage wel may sadde counsayle hym rest yet hys dedes bene ferre therfro may say wyth paryshe preest say selfe knowe one two wel stryken age neyghbourhedde wol theyr neyghbours wyues bedde wyl presence yonge man clyppe kysse yee downe laye bleare hys eye thus sayth suffre yet olde morel playe nowe haue done may thus saeth husbonde queme man shulde misdeme worde dede nedeth hym coye impossible amysse yonge speke anone sayeth boye rebuke age besemeth ywys thus hys olde face aye hys warant al hym sleyght subtylte ferre reason tel shortly age aboue age impotent resistence age vnweldy may fyght flye age wythout defence sad counsayle sayst gyueth hym assistence reason freshest ame wherfore thy sayeng thou art blame syth reason rather acompanyed vnto age whyche opinyon euery wyse man denyed syth sad counsayle procedeth reason sad cousaile hath chefe mancion thys naye ende thys thy suasion doest entende age compare vnto thyne excellence nyl presume hym dignifye ye egal howe experience auauntageth certaynly teacheth thyng cotrary oft fore se warely eschewe thou neuer assaydest yet knewe experience maketh man moost certayne thyng erthly necessite sad counsayle requyreth certaynte playne ferre moue thus wherto nede purpose thou comaundest shortly myne entente thus none vnder thy licence counsayle brother howe shuldest gyue counsayle yonge lacking experience vnto thyne owne speche reporte wote wel thy tonge wyl serue right wel teche dout lest thy wytte wol reche youth experience thou sayest couert howe shuldest teach wel vnexpert scripture wytnesseth god wyl oft shyt fro hye witted man shew ye childe hym meane hys owne wyt presumeth debonayre mylde counsayle entende vertue bylde myne elder part haue borowed part experience haue sorowed wel yf thou lettest fare shewe forth thy doctrine agast wol supporte loke thou spare maugre age though frete gnast aske age counsayle herin wast boldely begyn go forth thy processe feare syth thou arte surenesse graunt mercy lorde syth doth lyke licence nowe wol dare boldly assayle purpose wt scripture autentike werke wol groud vnderset fortify aspire begynnyng thou woode fury allecto wyth thy susters espicial mother ielousye iuno call pexplicit prologus werke shall se rede incongruite impeche ordinatly behoueth fyrst procede deduction thereof maner leche pacietes syckenes oweth first sech knowe medicyne shulde aply shortly shape remedy ryght cousayle wyllyng exhort yong prosperous doth aboude thy floures lust belongeth sorte fyrst cosider roote grounde thy mischefe whiche playnly founde woman farced wyth fraude disceyte thy confusyon moost allectyue bayte flye miswoman lest disceyue thus sayth salomo tauyt fully falsheed wome day coceyue lippes strupet ben sweter tha hony throte saith suppled wt oyle flatery howe ende effecte al byttrer wormwode gall flye miswoman louyng thy lyfe ware straungers blande eloquence straunge cal thy wyfe beautie haue concupiscence countenaunce pretendyng beneuolence beware signes eye amiable holde ferme bene disceyuable lo ensample woman theyr signes countenaunce shortly wol shewe howe louers thre loued one woman ryght entierly eche knewe others malady wherfore al theyr dayly labour coude appproche next fauour sondrye season fortune requyreth seuerally came se welfare one hapened loue fyreth se theyr lady al wolde spare others comyng none ware tyl al mette place lady sawe desyred face supper sette ful smally ete full sobre demure countenaunce taryed none hem mete hys lady gyue attendaunce secrete wyse signifyaunce loue haue whych parceyuyng fetely executed thus properte due season alway espyed euery thyng execute conueniently owne louer fyrst frendly eyed seconde offred cuppe curtesly thyrde gaue token secretly vnderneth borde trade hys fote entrayles tikled herte rote leue myght aske question maystres fewe louers trace lykely belongeth solucion whych thre stode nowe grace clerely answere ye wold aske long space mater doutful opinable acertayne woll selfe enable foresayd thre selfe one man answere better hertely v beloued none wattes packe bare al whych last selfe gan aspye time thouyt tha left dauce thoughtful hert great thy greuaunce hence fro hence endyte halpe aye afore ye mus nyne whylo ye wont mine ayde light penne directe brayne illumyne lenger ala may sewe doctrine freshe lusty meter yt wont make haue bene afore vtterly forsake come hyther thou hermes ye fury al fer ben vnder v nigh nether pole pluto reigneth kyng infernal send thine arpies send anguysh dole misery wo leaue ye sole right present must paine eke turmet pale deth besemeth absent nowe cal al thys lothsome sorte paine tencrese sorowes augmet worthy bare al comforte thus syth haue consumed mispent day fiuefolde talent yt lorde comitted recopence may derely abye negligence path penaunce yet wol reuert welle grace mercy fetche dispisest god meke contrite hert cocke crow ala yt wolde retch yet late seconde wetche mercy shal purchace incessaunt crieng mercyes lorde euer shal syng well mayst thou wayle wicked woman thou shuldest disceyue thus innocet recompence synne al wol make leue monumet shewing part thy falsheed myn entet al much wel wote cause sheweth playnly yt thus wrote al erth parchement scribable spedy hande al maner wode hewed proporcioned penne able al water ynke damme flode euery man beyng perfyte scribe good cursednesse yet disceyte woman coude shewed meane penne flye odyous resemblaunces dyuels bronde cal woman myght wherby man encensed mischaunce stynkyng rose fayre syght deedly empoyson lyke suger whyte whych hys swetnesse causeth man tast sodaynly sleeth brigeth last maner vse langage thys doctrine may laufully wol holy grounde wyth auctoritie sage wyllynge wysdom vertue edify wyne woman apostasy cause wyse men fall say wysdome cause forget way wherfore wyse man dothe aduyse whose wordes founde leasyng wyth straunger sytte wyse thy wyfe fal clyppyng wyth beware eke kyssyng kepe wyth wyne altercacion lest thyne hert fal enclination may man thynkest hyde safe lay fyre bosom wythout enpayrement brenynge clothes wheder may walke hotte cole fete brent sayth nay wherby ment thys foresayd prouerbe similitude thou rydde playnly denude flatterer forgettynge gyde gyde youth meane shafastnes shulde cause maydenheed abide goddes behest eke ful rechelesse retchyng comitteth forgetfulnesse neyther god ne shame hauynge place nedes must woman lacke grace al neygh way syn turne grace shal lacke influence pathes lyfe come wherfore fyrst frende wyth sapience remembring god prudence thyne owne wele kepe vnto thyne herte leste wordes crepe boke take grounde hys prouerbes sage solomon telleth tale whych playnly founde fyfth chapiter wheder dede mekely feyned instruction let clerkes determyne thus sure much lyke thyng haue vre wyndowe sayth loked fayre yonge people sawe many amonge hem loked yonge man fortuned lent myne eye estraunged mynde lykely ye strete corner nygh owne hous went wyth eye ryght curyous wha day lyght gan wythdrawe nyght approched twynlyght howe woman came met sawe talkyng vnder shade night nowe blyssed god myght whych hath fulfylled myne hertes desyre aslaked paine hote fire yet myne auctour skyl folowe must tel arayment ful nyce soules lyke spyl nyce countenaunce yet garment ianglyng rest impacient wandryng styl place stode restlesse nowe nowe yode nowe house nowe strete nowe corner stondeth awayte incessauntly besy praye gete brynge lure dothe layte left vnto mater strayte wol turne agayne howe hym mette swetely kyssed frendly hym grette wordes curtesy many diuerse ryght parte haue tolde nowe purpose reherse flateryng sayd wyth vysage bolde haue made vowes offringes manifolde thy sake myne hert loue dere day thake god al perfourmed therfore came made thus astert desyrous welfare se haue sene pleased myne hert fayth shall none haue loue ye trewe praye hertely dere herte come home man shulde welcome good fayth soth say comynge ranne thought harke care bed freshe gay haue behanged wt tapettes newe bought fro egypt ferre countrees brought steyned wyth many lusty freshe hue excedyng golde iasper value chabre strowed myrre ensence sote sauoring aloe synamome breathyng aromatyke redolence surmountyng olybane man dome ye shall betwene brestes rest yf ye come let v haue desyred halsyng maye safe tyl mornyng myne husbonde home went forth hys iourney ferre way hence bagge money hath wt hent hym thought nedeful hys expence vnto worde gyue fayth credence nowe mone yonge syght dulle er come home woll fulle thus craftely hath hym besette wyth lyme roddes panter snare sely soule caught nette sugeed mouth ala nothyng ware thus lefte gracelesse bare helpe comforte goostly socour furthermore sayth myne auctour beest ledde hys deth doth pant thys yonge man foloweth ye stoude wanton lambe ful ignorant howe pulled drawen boude vnto tyme hath dethes wounde lyke byrde hasteth grynne knowyng peryll lyfe therin gentle sone saith salomon take hede wordes thy brest kepe make fast let thy minde wayes mislede disceyued lese thy tast many hath wouded many downe cast many stronge hath lost theyr breth wayes wayes hel leadyng deth thys lytle naration precident woman manyfolde gylt attende yonge man ala howe hath shent disceyued husbade owne next frede god doth offende breke spousayle weiyt furdermore shew woman craft sleight woman dore sate stal se folkes passe stretes cite wyth eye countenaunce eke gan cal prety one come nere come hyther ye pygges nye ye lytlel abe last sayd yonge man hertel sse disceyte vnware defencelesse much swetter sayth acceptable drynke whan stolen priuely wha taken fourme auowable breed hyd gotten ieoperdously must nedes swete semblably venyson stolne aye swetter ferther narower fette better thys woma sayth solomo festes yong woteth doth fede derke depenesse hel bene gestes beware yonge man therfore rede howe chefely thy good spede werke copile haue take charge must pyte charyte enlarge wyth sely man thus begyled husband meane wol wepe wayle payneful infortune wherby reuyled causelesse neuer conuayle euery man yonge olde wyl hym assayle wordes occasyon ye loth name ala good soule nothynge blame coude yl wolde blame demeryte leaue opprobrous name cokolde apropre hym dispyte ransake yet wolde yf myght thys worde trewe ortography discent ethymology wel grounde fyrst enuention knowe ortography must deryue whych coke colde composicion reason nyghe contryue howe written knowe belyue yet lo reason grounde two wordes compounde one cause gyue iugement themylogy let v fyrst beholde eche letter hole worde doth represent c put colde olde k knaue thus diuers men holde fyrst part thys name haue foude let v ethymologyse secounde fyrst fynder mente sure c calot haue l leude demeanure crafte inuentour ye may se lo howe one name signifyeth person two colde olde knaue cokolde selfe wening eke calot leude demeanyng seconde cause thymposycion thys forsayde name ielousye ielouse greatest occasyon cokolde men aspye though passyon fyrye coutynuel feruence hete pacient aye suffreth colde hys fete ielous aye drede ful melancoly gally yre hys wyues nose yf misse trede wolde cutte ye conspyre death wol desyre whych perceyuyng brasteth hys gal anone hys great wodenesse doth fal sone hath knytte knot nowe tame ramagious mekely sytteth downe taketh lot layd bene nowe hys lokes furyous late cocke bataylous hote hys quarel auenge hym bolde nowe called coke colde thys sayeng al curtesy dissonant whych semeth malyce grewe rude treatyse wol plant parcel therof onely shewe opinion talcatyfe shrewe whych yl sayeng euer mery man therof wery parcel thys boke woll graffe sadde counsayle wherby wedded man yf daigne loke better shal mowe gye proued hys sayd infortunye whyche haue sayd hym coplayne wol partener hys great payne moost expedient hys wele wolde al ielousy abiecte ielous concele labour circumspecte knowe wayes yf seme suspecte breke one worde broken wol mysse wol wroken forbyd thou noldest haue done loke thinge forbood al thynges moost prone namely yf yl good tyll executed nygh wood woman feate crafte crafte labour defeate thou herafter nowe syngle man shuldest ielous yf thou haddest wyfe wedde yf thou trust woman el shuldest lede carefull lyfe thou moost lothest shulde full ryfe yet nyl gaynsay matrimony melius est nubert quam vri saye better wedlocke wyfe take church doth kenne vnder flesh yoke fleshly lust alwaye brenne sayd ielous men lyue chaste holde lasse yll wedde selfe spyll syngle man whych yet wedde wedded man thus rede warne nowe farre spedde late forbede let take owne nede counsayle hym tolde wordes folowyng eke beholde thy water kepe wyse man doth teche thou wyse let haue issue narowe ryfte way wol seche semblably woman vntrewe gyue frewalke wyse eschewe large thyne hande walke wol shame thou shalt balke wedded syngle thus sayth wyse man day nyght euermore lyth thy bosome wyfe yet lemman loue hote lest thou repent sore lest bryng yll lore thy wyfe loue yet nyll supporte thou dote thus exhort lo thou loue loue eke thyne honestie ydle woll betyde yf syt ydle necessitie mynde woll serche ferre eke wyde namely yf accompanyde accopanyed yonge men maydens meane woman mayden seruauntes ryght conuenient house helpe seruyce maye vse comaundement season owne deuyse teache hem good yeue thyne aduyce make huswyues thus besynesse may yet refrayne ydlenesse byd thou wolt haue thyne entent myght lettyng craftely encourage therto meanes comendyng moche duly mengyng prayse blame thy reason fyrst prayse wysely place season faythfull wyll herte full tendre one thynge call remembraunce agayne though wyt slendre power suffysaunce purpose make purueyaunce syth woman nature ben chaungeable frayle ware also disceyuable thy wyfe excellently good none better disposicion proces tyme might turn mode myslyuers instigation dyuers men thylke occupacion applyen dayly mynde eke herte goodnesse woman peruerte yf thou espye suspect person drawe thy wyfe beware wyse hym thy suspection breke one word thouy thy herte agryse kyndle fyre smoke woll aryse though corrupt entent paraduenture assent pexplicit complaynt mar venus gladdeth ye louers morowe graye lo venus risse amog rowes rede floures fresh honour ye daye whan ye sunne vp rist tha wil spred ye louers ly drede flyeth lest wycked tonges espye lo yonde sunne candle ielousye teres blewe wouded hert taketh leue wt saint iohn toborow apeseth somwhat sorowes smert tyme cometh eft yt cessen shal sorowe glad nyght worth heuy morowe saynt valentyne foule thus herd sing vpon thy day sunne gan vp sprynge yet sange foule rede awake ye haue chosen humble wise without repentyng cheseth make ye leest renoueleth seruyce ye haue full chosen deuyse confermeth perpetually dure pacyently taketh auenture worshyp hye feest yet wol bryddes wyse synge sentence complaynt leest wofull mar made departing fro fresh venus morownyng whan phebus fyry torch rede ransaked hath euery louer drede whylom thre heuens lorde aboue well heuenlyche reuolution desert hath venus loue hath take hym subiection maystresse taught hym lesson comaundynge hym neuer seruyce bolde louer dispyse forbade hym ielousye crueltie boste tyrannye made hym lust humble tall wha dayned cast eye toke pacience lyue dye thus brydleth hym manere nothing wt scornyng chere raygneth blysse venus yt hath worthy knyght gouernaunce singeth mar yt serueth thus fayre venus causer pleasaunce bynt hym perpetual obeysaunce bynt loue hym euer trespasse disceuer thus knyt reignen heuen lokyng fel tyde assent set steuen mar shall entre fast maye glyde next paleys abyde walkyng course tyl hym atake prayed haste sake sayd thus hertes lady swete ye knowe wel myschefe place sykerly tyl mete lyfe stant auenture grace whan se beautye face drede deth may smerte lust ease myne hert hath great copassyon knyght dwelleth solytude tyl come stode thylke tyme wyght counsayled hym ne sayd hym welcome nygh wyt sorowe ouerco wherfore sped fast way almost one day dyd twaye great ioye betwyxt hem wo whan met may tonge ell nomore vnto bed go thus ioye blysse let hem dwel worthy mar yt knyghthod wel flour fairnesse happeth armes venus kysseth mar ye god armes soiorned hath mar rede chambre amydde palays priuely certayne tyme tyl hym fel drede phebus comen hastely within palays yates sturdely torch hand ye stremes briyt venus chambre knockeden ful lyght chambre lay fresshe quene depaynted whyte bole grete ye lyght knewe shon shene phebus came bren hem wt hete selly venus dreynt teares wete embraceth mar sayd ala dye torch com yt al world wyl wrye vp stert mar hym lyst slepe whan lady herde complayne nature wepe stede teares eyen twayne fyry sparcles sprongen payne hent hauberke yt lay hym besyde flye wold nouyt ne might self hyde throweth helme huge weyght gyrt hym wt swerde hond mighty spere wot fyght shaketh almost wonde full heuy walken ouer loude may holde venus company bad flyen lest phebus espye woful mar ala mayst yu sayne palays thy disturbaunce art left behynde peryl slayne yet therto double thy penaunce yt hath thyne hert gouernaunce passed halfe stremes thyne eyen yu nere swyft wel mayest thou wep cr en flyeth venus ciclinius tour voyde corse feare phebus lyght ala hath socour ne foude ne sey maner wyght eke lytle myght wherfore seluen hyde saue within gate fled caue darke caue smokig ye hell nat two paas within yate stode naturel day darke let dwell wol speke mar furious wode sorow wolde haue sene hert blod syth yt might haue done copanye ne rought myte dye feble wert hete wo nigh swelt might vneth endure passeth ster dayes two neuerthelesse al heuy armure foloweth lyues cure whose departyng toke greater yre brennyng fyre walketh softely apace complaynyng pytie sayd lady bryght venus ala euer wyde copas sphere ala whan shall mete hert dere twelue dayes apryll endure ielous phebus mysaueture god helpe sely venus alone god wolde happed whil ye weping venus made mone c elimus rydyng chyuauche fro venus valanus might paleys se venus salueth maketh chere receyueth frende ful dere mar dwelleth forth aduersitie complaynyng euer departyng coplaynt remebreth therfore lusty morownyng best wol sayne synge woll leaue take god yeue euery wyght ioy make pthe complaynt mar ordre complaynt requyreth skylfully yf wyght shall playne pytouslye mote cause wherfore yt playne men may deme playneth folyly causeles ala wherfore ye grounde cause al payne troubled wyt may attayne wol reherse haue redresse declare grounde heuynesse fyrst tyme ala wrought certayne effectes hyder brought hym lordeth eche intelligence yaue true seruyce thought euermo dere haue bought great excellence wight yt sheweth first offece whan wroth taketh cure may longe ioye loue endure fayned mater tell lady sour well beautie lust fredome gentyllesse ryche araye dere men sell disport men frely dwel loue play benigne hublesse sowne instrumentes al swetnesse therto well fortuned thewed yt ye worlde goodnes shewed wonder though beset seruyce one may k et wele wo sith lyth myght therfore myne hert euer vnto het ne truly deth shal let ben truest seruaunt knyght flatter may wete euery wyght day seruyce shall dye grace se neuer eye shal playne distresse may help may hert redres shall complayne vnto lady free nay certes hath suche heuynesse feare eke wo gesse lytle tyme wolde bane safe force ala euer louers mote endure loue many perylous auenture though louers trewe metall forged newe many case hem tydeth oft sorowe somtyme ladyes wol hem rew somtyme yf ielousye knewe myght lyghtly lay heed borow somtyme enuyous folke wt tange horow deprauen hem ala may plese false louer hath ease auayleth suche longe sermoun auentures loue vp downe woll retourne speken payne poynt destructioun ryght lady saluacioun fray playne hert swete lady souerayne disese ought wel swoun swelt though none harme ne drede felt fyne made god syt hye beneth hym loue company strayneth folke loue maugre heed ioye ought espye ne lasteth twynklyng eye haue neuer ioye tyll deed meaneth mystihed wherto constrayneth folke fast thynge desyre shulde last though made louer loue thyng maketh seme stedfast duryng yet putteth suche misauenture rest ny yeuyng wondre iust kynge doth suche hardnesse creature thus whether loue breke el dure algates hath loue done hath ofter wo chaunged mone semeth hath louers enmitie lyke fyssher men maye daye se bayteth angle hoke plesauce tyl many fysh wode c ased therwith erst hath al desyre therwith al mischaunce though ylyne breke hath penaunce hoke wounded sore wage hath euermore broche thebe suche kynde full ruby stone inde euery wyght set eye wende anon worth mynde sore beautie wolde hert bynde tyl thought must dye whan shulde dry wo dred ay yt welnygh feare shuld mad whan fro possessyon double wo passyon fayre iewel hath forgo yet broche conclusyon cause confusyon wrought enfortuned euery wyght yt shulde haue wo therfore worcher vyce coueyture nyce fareth louers though lady haue great beautie made get grace cause myne aduersitye wrought mote put suche beautye face made coueyten purchace myne owne deth hym wyte dye myne vnwyt yt euer clambe hye hardy knyghtes renowne syth ye deuysyoun al nat worthy great name yet sayne clerkes patrone therfore ye ought haue compassioun disease take nat game proudest may made full tame wherfore pray youre gentylesse ye complayne myne heuynesse ye ladyes ben true stable way kynde ye ought ben able haue pytye folke ben payne haue ye cause cloth sable syth empres honorable desolate wel ought ye playne shulde holy teares fal rayne ala honour emprice nygh deed drede ne cheuyce complayneth eke ye louers al fere vnfayned humble chere euer redy socour coplayneth euer hath dere coplayneth beautye fredome manere coplayneth endeth labour coplayneth thylke ensample al honour neuer dyd gentlenesse kytheth therfore kyndnesse pthe complaynt venus ny hygh comfort pleasaunce whan anye heuynesse haue layser remembraunce vpon manhode worthynesse vpon trouth stedfastnesse hym whose whyle may dure ought blame creature euery wight prayseth gentylesse hym bountie wysdome gouernauce wel man wyt gesse grace hath wolde farforth auau ce knyghthode parfyt ryches honour honoureth hym noblesse therto wel hath fourmed nature euer hym ensure euery wyght prayseth gentylesse notwithstandyng suffysaunce gentle hert great humblesse worde werke countenauce serue besynesse set sykernesse thus ought blysse wel myne auenture syth hym lyst seruen honoure euery wyght prayseth gentylesse certes loue ryght couenable men full dere abye thy noble thynges wake bed fasten table weping laugh syng complayninges downe cast visage lokynges often chaunge vysage countenaunce playe slepyng dremen daunce reuers glad felynge ielousye hanged cable wolde al knowe espyinge doth wyght nothyng resonable ny harme ymaginyng thus dere abought loue yenyng oft yeueth without ordinaunce sorowe ynough lytle plesaunce reuers glad felynge lytle tyme yefte agreable full accombrouse vsyng subtel ielousye disceyuable ful often tyme causeth distourbyng thus ben euer drede suffryng certayne languyshen penaunce haue wel oft many harde mischauce reuers glad felyng certes loue saye suche wyse scape lace ment longe haue ben seruyce lete wyll neuer assent force though ielousye tourment suffyseth se hym whan may therfore certes myne endyng day loue hym best shal neuer repent certes loue whan wel auyse estate men may represent haue ye made frau chyse chese best euer erth went loue wel hert loke thou neuer stet let ielous put assaye payne woll say nay loue hym best shal neuer repent herte ought ynough suffyse loue hye grace sent chose worthyest wyse moost agreable vnto myne entent seke ferther neyther way ne went syth ye haue suffisaunce vnto paye thus wol ende coplayninge laye loue hym best shal neuer repent plenuoye prynces receyueth complaynyng gree vnto excellet benignite dyrecte lytle sustysaunce elde spirit dulleth hath indytyng al subtiltie welnygh beraft remebraunce eke great penaunce sith ryme englysh hath suche scarcitie folowe worde worde curiositie gransonstoure hem make fraunce pexplicit phereafter foloweth letter cupyde cupyde vnto whose commaundement gentyl kynred goddes hye people infernall bene obeddyent al mortall folke serue busylye goddesse sone cythera onely tho deitie ben subiectes hertely gretyng sende generall wolde ye knowe ladyes honour reuerence gentylwomen hauen sowe suche seed coplaynt audyence men hem outrage offence eares greueth pytous theffect matere passyng al londes lytle yle cleped albyon coplayne say crop rote gyle con tho men dissymule fayne standyng dropes eyen twayne whan hertes feleth distresse blynden woman doublenesse wordes spoken syghingly pytous chere countenaunce euery wyght meneth truly demeth hert haue suche greuaunce say importable penaunce lady lust shewe hem grace ryght anon must steruen place ah lady myne saye ensure doth grace shall euer whyle lyfe may last endure humble lowe eche degree possyble kepe al thinges secre ryght selfe lyst el myne hert mote brast two ful harde knowe man hert outwarde may trouth deme whan worde mouth may none sterte reso semed euery wyght queme sayde hert wolde seme faythful woman ful innocence thou art disceued false apparence proces moueth oft woman pytie wenyng thyng men say graunt hem grace benignitie men shulde sake dey good hert set hem wey blysful loue kepe yf con thus otherwhyle woman beth ywon whan man ye pan hath stele fully possessyoun woman kepeth nomore dele yf may fynde toun woman blynde affectioun vnto bestowe euyl mote preue man al othes harde beleue euery falseman hath make vnto euery wight lyght knowe wha traitour woma hath forsake faste spedeth vnto felowe tyl herte lowe false deserte may nat susfyse trayson telleth al wyse afayre auaunt honour man hym selfe accuse thus diffame good confesse hym selfe traytour brynge woman sclaundros name tell howe body hath shame worshyp may thus hym conquer great disclaundre vnto hym nay yet reprefe al vertue wrought brewed hath al myschefe yt spake fayre falsly inward thought sclaundre reason ought vnto thanke perpetuel suche nede helpe well although men fleyght subteltie sely symple innocent woman betrayde wondre syth cytie troye story tell betrayde disceyte man set fyre al downe ouerthrowe finally destroyed men knowe betray nat men cytes great kynges wight shape remedy ayenst falsely purposed thynges crafte suche craftes tespy man whose wytte euer redy taply thyng sownyng falsehede woman bethe ware false men rede furthermore haue men vsage nat lykely ben spede suche ben double visage procuren pursewe nede prayeth cause procede largely guerdoneth trauayle lytell wote woman howe men hem assayle another wretche vnto felowe sayth thou fysshest faire hath fyred false inconstaunt hath fayth rode folke desyred horse fro day day hyred whan thou twynnest fro company cometh another blered thyne eye nowe pricke fast ryde thy iourney thou art behynd thy backe lyberall woll nothyng withsey smartly another take smacke thus fare woman packe hem trusteth hanged mote euer desyre chaunge nouelte wherof procedeth enuy hun selfe ne wynne may speketh reprefe vyllany maunes blabbyng tong wont alway thus dyuers men full ofte make assay distourbe folke sondrye wyse may nat eschewe empryse many one eke wolde good hath loue hys tyme spent vsed men wyst yt lady hys askyng withstode er playnly refused waste vayne mused wherfore none remedy lady shapeth hym lye euery woman saythe lyght gete none say nay yf well ysought may leyser haue wyth trete hys purpose shall fayle nought madnesse depe brought shende wyth open homlynesse louen woman doten gesse sclauder woman thus may profyte gentyllesse namely hem arme shulde defence woman hem delyte ordre gentyllesse wolde man lyst gentyll holde muste eschewe therto contrary sclaundrous tonge hys great aduersary foule vyce tonge lyght moche clappeth gabbeth ofte tonge man swyfte wight whan reysed vp lofte reason shewed slowly softe hym neuer ouertake may lorde men ben trusty assay men fynde one woman nyce inconstaunt rechelesse varyable deignous proude fulfylled malyce wythout faythe loue disceyuable slye queynt false vntrust coulpable wycked feirse full cruelte yet foloweth suche woman whan hyghe god aungels fourmed amonge hem none founden malicious bad yes men wote many one pryde fyll fro heuen anone shuld thy yeue al angel proude name nay ye susteyneth blame twelue apostels one traytour remenante yet good trewe yf happe men fynde perca woman false suche good eschewe deme yt al therfore vntrewe se well mennes owne falsenesse hem causeth woman trust lesse euery man ought haue herte tendre vnto woman deme honourable hys shape thycke slendre good badde fable euery wight wote yt wytte hath resonable woman discended shame speke amysse wicked tre good frute may non forthbring suche frute tre take hede thou toke thy begynning let thy mother myrrour vnto honour yf thou wolte honoured dispyse manere lest therby thy wyckednesse apere olde prouerbe sayd englyshe byrde foule full dishonest holde full churlyshe vseth defoule hys owne nest men say well woman best naught dispyse hem ne depraue woll honour kepe saue ladyes euer complayne hem clerkes haue made bokes diffame dispyse woman werkes speke hem great reprofe shame causelesse yeue hem wicked name thus dispysed euery syde disclaundred blowen full wyde tho sory bokes maken mencion howe woman betrayde especiall adam dauid sampson salomon many one mo may reherce hem al treyson haue shall worlde malyce may coprehende clerkes sayne hath none ende ouyde hys boke called remedye loue great reprofe woman writeth wherin trowe dyd great folye euery wight yt case delyteth clerkes custome whan endyteth woman prose ryme vers say wycked know reuers ye boke scholers lerned chyldhede woman beware shulde age loue hem euer drede sythe disceyue set corage say perel shuld cast thauautage namely suche men haue bewrapped many man woman hath mishapped charge clerkes sayne writyng cure labour trauayle vayne bytwene lady nature shall suffred ye world may dure thus clerkes cruell tyrannye sely woman kythen maystrye whylom many cheyne tyed nowe vnweldy age vnlust may loue atteyne sayne loue dotage thus hem selfe lacken corage folke excyce wicked sawes rebell ayenst lawes maugre hem blame woman moste suche force myne impressyon sodaynly fell boste wronge ymaginacion shall election foulest slutte towne refuse luste al conne mu herte brennyngly desyre though duchesse quene folkes hertes set fyre lyst sende hem ioye tene woman whet kene sharpe persyng stroke smyte shul sele know howe kerne e parde clerke subtyll ouyde many disceyued haue woman knowe full wyde men great deynte excellent clerke mo couden full well preche betrapped aught yt coude tech trusteth well meruayle woman knowen playnly entent wyste howe softly coude assayle hem falsheed herte mente thus clerkes daunger hente wyth venym distroyed thus clerkes ofte anoyed ladyes ne gentyls neuerthelesse none tho wrought wyse suche vertulesse quytten thus olde clerkes wyse clerkes lesse ought suffyse dispraue woman generally worshyp shull none get therby men louers hem pretende woman faythfull good trewe dredde hem disceyue offende woman loue hem wolde eschewe euery day hath man herte newe one abyde whyle force suche wight begyle men beare eke woman vpon honde lightly without payne wome wight wtstonde disease lyst hem complayne freele may refrayne lyketh hem may lightly haue hertes easy graue mayster iohan de moone suppose leude occupacioun makyng romance rose many slyghe ymagynacioun perylles rollen vp doun longe processe many slyght cautell disceyue sely damosell naught say ne wytte comprehede arte payne subtylte shulde sayle conquere sone make ende whan men feble place shall assayle sone also venquishe batayle whiche wight may make resystence ne herte hath none make defence mote folowe necessyte sythe arte asketh great engyn payne woman disceyue costaunce barayne clerkes sayne woman ought sadde constante fulfylled pyte howe frendly medea iason conqueryng f ece golde howe falsely quyt trewe affection vyctorie gate wolde howe may man shame bolde falsen fro dethe shame kept gate great prise name troy also traytour eneas faithlesse wretch forswore dydo quene cartage releued hys smertes sore gentyllesse might haue herte vnfayned kydde mischefe therof betydde legende nature may men fynde lyketh therin rede othe ne behest may man bynde reprouable shame haue drede mannes herte trouth hath stede soyle nauyt may trouth growe woman namely vnknowe clerkes sayne also malyce vnto woman wycked crabbydnesse woman shalt thou thy selfe cheuyce sythe men suche harme wytnesse beth ware woman fykelnesse kepe thyne owne men clappe crake hem shal smerte vndertake malyce woman drede slee man distroye cytees ne oppresse folke ne ouerlede betray empire realmes duchees ne byreuen men londes ne mees enpoyson folke ne house set fyre ne false contractes make hyre trust parfyte loue entyre charyte feruent wyll entalented corage thewes good sytteth well haue woman euer custome vsage wel conne mane yre aswage soft wordes discrete benigne inward shew outward signe woman herte vnto cruelte enclyned charytable pytous denoute full humylite shamefaste debonayre amyable dredefull wordes measurable woman haue parauenture foloweth way nature men sayne fyrst mother nathelesse made mankynde lese lyberte naked ioye doutlesse goddes heste disobeyed whan presumed taste tre god forbade eate therof sholde ne dyuell nomore wolde enuyous swellynge yt fende foe vnto man herte hys welth sent serpent made go disceyue eue thus man welthe byrafte hym fende stelthe woman knowyng disceyte god wote ful ferre conceyte wherfore say good woman eue father adam disceyued nought may man disceyte preue properly herte thought compassed fyrst wrought suche impressyon men may call disceyte reason ne wight disceyueth purpose fende disceyte caste nothynge wronge deme suppose hys harme shulde cause wyte fende hys maugre excused haue innocence saue onely brake obedyence touchyng full fewe men vnnethes dare safely say fro day day men may day se heste god disobay haue mynde syrs pray ye discrete resonable ye woll holde excusable men say man stedfastnesse woman corage vnstable may adam beare suche wytnesse telleth chaungeable bothe case semblable saue wyllyng fende disceyued eue dyd adam leue yet synne happy mankynde feude disceyued hys sleyght yt coude sleyghtes wynde hys trespace came fro heuen heyght god discharge man hys weyght fleshe bloode toke virgyne suffred dethe hym delyuer pyne god may nothyng hyd woman knowen suche malyce men recorde hem generalte lady lyfe reperatryce nolde haue borne vyce voyde full vertue well wyste endawed borne hym lyste heaped vertue hath suche excellence leane mannes faculte declare therfore suspence dewe praysyng put nedes must thus say verely next god best frende man longeth key mercy gyrdle hongeth mercy hath euery man suche nede resyng farwell ioy man power taketh riyt good hede mercy may wel purchace displeseth honoureth woman woman sake ye sorowe shall awake boke also ye fynde werkes dethe lyfe iesu spelleth maketh mynde woman hym forsoke wo stryfe wight ententyfe aboute hym woman proued none apostels hym forsoken euerychone woman forsoke hym faythe holy churche woman lefte onely lee thus holy writte saythe loke ye shall fynde hardely therfore may well preue therby woman reigneth stable constaunce men chaunge varyaunce thou precious geme martyr margarete thy bloode dredest none effusyon thou louer trewe thou mayden mansuete thou constante woman thy passyon ouercame fendes temptacion many wight conuerted thy doctryne vnto faythe holy god thou vyrgyne vnderstadeth onely comende nought encheson virgynyte trusteth came neuer thought euer werre ayenst chastyte euer shall lo meueth louyng herte constante lay driue remembraunce ne may nowe holdeth ferme lye trewe iuste commendation woman tell flatterye ne bycause pryde elation onely lo entention yeue hem corage perseueraunce vertue honour auaunce vertue lasse pride vertue digne noble kynde vyce woll infere abyde putteth vyces clene hys mynde flyeth fro hem leaueth hem behynde woman vertue arte hostresse great thy honour thy worthynesse woll thus conclude defyne commaunde mynistres echone redy ye hestes enclyne false men rebel fone ye punishment anone voyde hem court banysh hem euer therin come neuer fulfylled ceasyng delaye loke none excusacion wrytten lusty monthe maye paleys many millyon louers trewe haue habytacion yere grace ioyfull ioconde thousande foure hundred seconde pexplicit pthus endeth letter cupyde foloweth balade commendation oure lady thousande storyes coude mo reherce olde poetes touchyng thys matere howe cupyde yt hertes gan perce seruauntes settyng hem fere lo fyne therrour fere lo loue guerdon greuaunce euer wo seruautes auauce wherfore playnly wol style dresse one speke nede woll fayle ala dole ne ne may expresse passyng prise meruayle wynde grace blow vnto sayle auryate lycour cleo write penne enspyre woll endyte ala vnworthy vnable loue suche one woman surmountyng benigne merciable pyte welle eke spryng wherfore laude praysyng supported grace ryght thus say knelyng tofore face sterre sterres thy stremes clere sterre see shypmen lyght gyde lusty lyuyng moste plesaunt apere whose briyt beames ye cloudes may hyde way lyfe hem go ryde hauen tempest surest vp ryue haue mercy thy ioyes fyue rightfull rule bote holynesse lyghtsome lyne pyte playne original begynnyng grace al goodnesse clenest coduyt vertue souerayne mother mercy trouble restrayne chambre closet clennest chastyte named herbrough deyte closed garden voyde wedes wycke crystallyn welle clerenesse clere cosigned fructyfyed olyue foyles fayre thycke redolet cedre dereworthly digned remembre synners yt assigned wicked fendes wrath hem wreche lanterne lyght thou lyues leche paradyse plesaunce gladsome good benigne braunchelet pyne tre vynarie enuermayled refresher bote lycour ayen al langour yt palled may blysfull blomy blosome bydyng bounte thy mantell mercy myserie sprede er wo awake wrappe v vnder thy wed rody rosyer flouryng without spyne foutayne al fylthlesse byrel currant clere soe drop thy graceful dew v propyne light without nebule shining thy sphere medecyne mischeues pucelle wtout pere flambe downe dolefull lyght thyne influence remebring thy seruates thy magnifycece al christen protectryce tutele returne exiled put prescripcion hem erren pathe sequele wery forwandred tent pauylion faynte freshe pausacion vnto vnresty bothe rest remedye frutefull tho allye hem rennen thou arte itenerarie blysfull brauie knightes thy werre wery werkmen diourne denarie mede vnto maryners haue sayled ferre laureate crowne stremyng slerre hem put hem palastre thy sake cours coquest thou white lake myrthe martyr swetter sytole confessours also rychest donatyfe vnto virgynes eternall lauriole afore woman hauyng prerogatyse mother mayde bothe wydowe wyfe worlde none thou alone nowe syth thou may socour mone trusty turtle truefastest trewe curteyse columbe replete mekenesse nyghtyngale thy note newe popyniay pured wyth clennesse laueroke loue syngyng swetnesse phebus awaytyng tyll thy brest lyght vnder thy wynge domesday v dyght rubye rubifyed passyon thy sonne v haue amonge mynde stedfast dyametre duracion fewe feres tyme might thou fynde none founde halfe kynde hardy herte louyng creature loue made yt endure semely saphre depe loupe blew ewage stable loupe ewage pyte say freshest vysage thou louest vnchaunged hem serue yf offence varyeng hem thou arte aye redy vpon wo rewe hem receyuest wyth hert full trewe goodly gladed whan gabriell wyth ioye grette may nubred halfe blysse coude write tell whan holy goste obumbred wherthrough fendes bytterly encubred wemlesse mayde embelyshed byrth man aungel therof hadden myrth lo blosme budde glorie whiche ye prophete longe spake beforn lo memorie ysaye longe borne lo dauid delycious corne lo grounde lyfe bylde becomyng man raunsom yelde glorious vyole vyte inuyolate firy tytan persyng thy bemes whose vertuous briytues brest vrbrate ye world embelyshed ye lemes coseruatryce kynges duke realmes ysayes fede swete sunamyte mesure mourning myn margaryte soueraignest sought syon cockle wt golde dewe aboue berayned dewe bushe vnbrent fyrelesse fyre set flabyng feruete hete payned duryng daysye wether stayned fleece vndefouled gentylest iedeon fructifyeng fayrest yerde aaron mighty arche probatyfe pi yne laughyng aurore peace olyue columpne base vp bearyng abyme nere connyng discryue chosen ioseph toke wyue vnknowyng hym chyldyng myracle manly fygure tabernacle haue none englyshe conuenient dygne myne hertes heale lady wyth honour iuorie cleane therfore wol resygne thyne hande tyl thou lyst socour helpe makynge floryshe flour shulde shewe loue brende songes makynge thy name comende yf coude thyne excellence syngen loue wolde fele euer standen lady thy presence shewe open howe loue wele syth although hert made stele wythouten dysceueraunce iay en vous tout fiance myght loue euer better beset thys lylye lykyng beholde lace loue bonde wel thou knyt maye se myne herte colde passe dayes olde tofore syngyng euermore vtterly eyen two woll slee sodaynly loue langour blyssed sycknesse syth hertely suffysaunce el say dystresse fayre one hath myne hert gouernauce begynne esperaunce feble entune though thyne hert perce yet thy sake thys letter reherce god wote musyke gesse ala myght saye synge loue myne owne souerayne maistres euer shal wythout departyng myrrour beute shuld ryng remembraunce eke eyen clere thus ferre fro souerayne lady dere wolde god loue wolde slo syth sake synge day day herte nylte thou breake two syth wyth lady dwell ne may thus many roundel many virelay freshe englyshe layser fynde recorde haue mynde nowe lady myne syth loue drede vnchaunged euer fynde degre whose grace ne may flye fro womahede dysdayneth remembre myne herte bledeth may se syth ye wotte meanyng desyrous plures pur moy si vous playst amorous maruayle though payne departed souerayne fortune ala dont vient la destenie wyse ne may attayne se beaute eyen twayne wherfore say trystesse doth grame tant fait male departyr de dame nere wyshyng brouyt esploit myght say ioye presence ore mon cuer ce quil veuilloit ore mon cuer hyghest excellence euer wight syth myne aduertece reweth paynes smerte sore wounded herte lyue wel mery two louers yfere may saye wythouten blame yf man wylde coude hym teche tame lette hym go loue se game brydled vnto sobernesse woman chefe princesse euer whe thouyt herte shuld enbrace vnto best remedy loke goodly freshe face mery myrrour coude neuer espye yf coude wolde magnifye neuer none fayre yfounde reken hem also rosamounde fynally wyth mouthe wyl present double eye wythout repentaunce myne herte yeue lady thys entent ye shall holy therof haue gouernauce takynge leaue wyth hertes obeysaunce salue regina syngynge last al helpe cal loue ydelnesse saue loue alone might therto attayne wol haue name gentylnesse counsayle hym loue fayne thou swete lady refute euery payne whose mercy moste auayleth gye grace fortune fayleth nought may tolde wythouten fable hygh renome womanly beaute gouernaunce al worshyp able putteth euery herte ease hys degree violet floure desyree syth amerous estreynes moy de cuer ioyous feruet herte brest hath brost fyre lardant espoir que mo cuer poynt est mort dauoir lamour de celle que ie desyre meane swete moste plesaunt porte et ie say bien que ceo nest pa mon tort synge maye mone departynge alone lyue alone though myght woll none chese seruyce wolde founden sadde therfore loue labour ye lese longyng sorest ye stadde loke vp ye louers ryght gladde ayenst saynt valentynes daye haue chese neuer forsake may pexplicit piohan gower vnto worthy noble kynge henry fourth noble worthy kyng henry ferthe whome glad fortune befall people gouerne vpon erthe god hath chosen comforte v worship lade doun fal stant vpryyt thrugh grace thy goodnesse euery man holde blesse hygh god iustice alone ryght whych longeth thy regaly declared hath stande thy persone god may man iustifye thy tytel knowe vpon thyne auncestrye landes folke hath eke thy right affirmed stante thy reygne god cofyrmed man may saye otherwyse god hymselfe ne hath ye ryght declared wherof lande bounde thy seruyce whych defaute helpe hath longe cared nowe mannes herte spared loue serue worthe thy plesaunce thys goddes purueyauce thynge whych god begonne foloweth grace yf wel gouerned thus tellen whych olde bokes conne wherof lord wote well thou art lerned aske thy god shalt thou warned request whych reasonable god vnto good fauourable kyng salomon whiche hys askynge god thyng leuest craue chase wysedom vnto gouernynge goddes folke whiche wolde saue chase fyll haue wyt yt reigne last gate peace rest last alexander telleth hys storie vnto god besought wey worlde wynne vyctorie vnder hys swerde myght obey warre al wolde prey mighty god behight behest worlde wanne conquest though fyll thylke tyme alexander askyng hath atcheued synfull worlde paynem tho none hath highe god beleued woder though thilk world greued though tyrat purpose miyt wyn vengeaunce fortune syn nowe faith christ come place among prince erthe sytte hem well pyte grace yet must tempred manere fynden cause matere vpon poynt afterwarde betyde lawe right shall nat layde syde may kynge warre voyage ordayne take therto holde clayme aske hys ryghtfull heritage place wyth holde otherwyse yf god hym selfe wolde affyrme loue peace betwene kynges peace best aboue al erthly thynges good eschewe warre nathelees kynge may make warre vpon hys ryght batayle fynall ende pee thus stant lawe worthy knyght vpon hys trouth may go fyght yf myght chese better peace whych may lese stere peace ought euerych lyue fyrst set hys liege lorde rest eke men ne stryue thys lande maye stande best kynge wolde worthyest myght deedly warre cease shuld worthynesse encrease peace chefe al worldes welth heuen ledeth eke waye peace soule lyfe mannes helth pestilence doth warre awaye liege lorde take hede saye yf warre may lefte take peace hande whych may wythout goddes sande wyth peace stante euery creature rest wythout peace may lyfe gladde aboue good peace best peace hath hym selfe whe werre al bestad peace safe warre euer adrad peace al charite kay whych hath lyfe soule way liege lorde yf thy lyst seche soth ensaples ye war hath wrouyt thou shalt wel wyse menes speche deedly warre tourneth nought yf olde bokes wel ysought myght yu se thing ye war hath conquest conquerour also vayne honoure worldes good whylom stroge warres made wher bethinke wel thy mood day gone nyght derke fade hir cruelte whych made hem glade sorowe yet haue nauyt ye blode shad whych may restore warre mother wronges sleeth preest holy church masse forlyth mayde doth flour fall warre maketh great cyte lasse doth lawe hys rule ouerpasse ther nothig wherof myschefe may grow whych caused warre trowe warre bringeth pouerte hys heles wherof comen people sore greued warre hath set cart thylk wheles fortune may beleued men wene best haue acheued full ofte newe begyn warre hath nothyng syker tho wyn thy worthy prince christes halue aparte whose faith thou hast gyde ley olde sore newe salue warre away betyde purchace peace set thy syde suffre thy people deuoured shal thy name euer stade honoured yf man nowe euer ayen peace thy preuy counsaylour let god thy counsayle thys caas put away cruel warryour god whych man creatour wolde men slough hys creature wythout cause deedly forfayture nedeth behoueth lok lorde howe thy warres wythout tyme passed hede toke good home se ryght wel euermore worst doute yf thou myghtest parfyte peace attayne shulde cause playne kyng good counsayle preyse aboue al thynges
