moste vaylable yet kynge wythin hym selfe shal peyse sene thynges resonable thervpon shall hys wyttes stable amonge men sette peace euen loue hym whych kyng heuen well hym shedde neuer blode yf cause ryghtwysenesse yf kyng peryl vnderstode slee people gesse deedly warres heuynesse wherof peace dystourbed full ofte shulde tyme cesse wexe softe kyng fulfylled grace knyghthode remembre vpo poynt christes sake yf peace profered vnto thy manhode thyne honour saue let forsake though yu warres darste wel vndertake reason yet temper thy courage lyke peace none auauntage worthy lorde thynke well befall thylke lore holy bokes sayne christ heed membres well subiecte souerayne syt wel charite playne whych vnto god hym selfe moste accordeth lore christes worde recordeth tholde lawe christ selfe bore amonge x comaundementes rede howe manslaughter shulde forbore suche wyl tyme ye godhede afterward whe christ toke hys mahede peace fyrst thynge let crye ayenst worldes rancour enuy christ went thys erth slyghed heuen made hys testamet bequath hys dyscyples yaue hys peace foudemet charite wythout whose assent worldes peace may neuer wel tryed ne loue kepte ne lawe iustifyed iewes wyth ye paynyms hadden werre amoge hem self stode euer peace shulde peace stande erre christ hath owne encrese christ moses christ hath set parfyte lawe whych shuld wyse wythdrawe yeue v peace cause christ dyde wythout peace may nothynge stade auayled nowe man may se euery syde howe christes fayth euery daye assayled wyth paynems destroyed batayled defaute helpe defence vnneth hath christ hys due reuerence ryght fayth kepe holy churche fyrst poynt named knyghthode euery man holde wurche vpon poynt stante hys manhode nowe ala fame spred brode euery man thys thynge complayneth yet helpe ordayneth worldes cause wayted ouer warres redy full christes owne cause speciall ben swerdes speres dull wyth sentence pope bul done folke payne obey churche turned another wey wonder aboue mannes wyt wout warre howe christes fayth vpon thys erth yet ne kepe fyrst begon euery creature vnder sonne christ badde hym selfe shulde preche folke hys euangely teche lyght kepe make founden made fore honde kepe lette lyghtly slake peace christ hath broke bode rest selfe suffren euery londe slee eche thyng vndefended stant warre peace amended though heed holy church aboue ne al hys hole busynesse amonge people set peace loue kynges oughten rightwysnesse owne cause amonge hem selfe redresse tho peter shyp hath loste stere lyeth hem barge stere yf holy churche dewte christes worde ne auysed make peace accorde vnite amonge kynges nowe deuysed yet natheles lawe stante assysed mannes wytte resonable wythout stande hym selfe stable holy church ben chyldren euery chylde holde bowe vnto mother howe euer fall el muste reason dysalowe cause knyght shal first auowe ryght holy church defende man shal priuylege offende thus good sette al euen worldes prince prelate loue hym kynge heuen yf men shuld algate waxen wrothe sarazins whych vnto christ ben loth let men armed ayenst hem fyght may knyght hys dede armes right vpo thre pointes stat christes peace oppressed fyrst holy church selfe deuyded whych ought reason fyrst redressed yet hygh cause desyded thus humble pacience pryded remnaunt whych shulde rule wonder though stande rule heed syck lymmes aken reignes christes peace beloge worldes good deedly warres make whych helplesse balaunce hongen heed aboue hem hath vnderfongen sette peace euery man sleeth thys wyse hath charite brother two defautes bryngen thyrde myscreauntes sene howe debate betwene two fallen amydde nowe al daye fynde open gate lo thus deedly werre slante algate euer hope kynge henry grace whych shal peace embrace worthy noble prynce kynge anoynt whome god hath hys grace preserued beholde se worlde vpon poynt thy part christes peace serued shal thy hygh mede deserued hym whych shall quyte laste thys lyfe may whyle laste se alexander hector iulius se machabeus dauid iosue se charlemayne godfray arthus fulfylled warre mortalite fame abytte vanite deth whych hath warres vnder fote hath made ende whych ther bote many soth wete knowe peace good euery kynge haue fortune warre euer vnknowe peace ther march saue nowe vp morow vnder graue myghtye god hath grace hande wythout hym men may longe stande tennes wynne lese chace may lyfe wete bal ronne al stant god thing shal purchace thende hym begonne men sayne wolle well sponne doth cloth stronge profytable el maye neuer durable worldes chaunces vpon auenture ben euer sette thylke chaunce pee behouely creature aboue al peerles may beget natheles amonge men laste whyle herte playne without gyle peace sacrament tofore god shall wyth wordes playne wythout double entendement treated trouth fayne yf men wythin hem selfe ben vayne substauce peace may rew euery day chaungeth vpon newe charite parfyte voydeth al sleyghtes ferre awaye sette hys worde vpon plyte hert hath foude syker waye thus conscience trewly waye ben handled wyth wy e shall abyde stande wyfe apostle sayth ther may lyfe good whych grounded vpon charite charite ne shedde neuer blood hath warre properte thylke vertue whych sayd pyte wyth charite ferforth acquaynted may false seblant paynted cassodore whose wrytynge authorised sayth pyte reygneth grace thrugh whych ye peace hath al welth assysed yt warre dredeth manace pyte dwelleth place maye deedly cruelte soiourne wherof mercy shulde hys way tourne se pyte forth wyth mercy doth cronique rome thylke empyre constantyne whych tale sothe hym lyuer hys owne deth desyre yonge chyldren martyre crueltie lefte quarele pyte wrought pyte hys hele thylke mannes pyte whych dede god pytous made hym hole syluester came stede yaue hym baptyme fyrst special whych dyd awaye synne origynall hys lepre hath purifyed hys pyte euer magnifyed pyte cause thys emperour hole body soule bothe rome also sette thylke honour christes fayth leue loth whych hadden wyth christ tofore wroth receyued vnto christes lore thus shall pyte praysed euermore worthy liege lorde henry name whych englande haste gouerne ryght men ought well thy pyte proclame whych openlyche worldes syght shewed wyth helpe god almyght yeue v peace log hath debated wherof thy pryse shal neuer abated lorde hath euer yet founde pyte wythout spotte violence kepe thylke peace alwaye wythin bounde whych god hath planted thy conscience shall cronyque thy pacience amonge sayntes taken memorye legende perdurable glorye thyne ert hely pryse whych euery man holde comende gower whych thy liege man thys letter vnto thyne excellence sende whych euer vnto lyues ende woll pray state thy persone worshyppe thy sceptre thy throne onely kynge peace wryte prynces christen eche hem hys owne herte endyte sese warre myschefe fall sette eke ryghtful puppe vpon hys stall kepe charite drawe pyte hande mainteyn lawe penny shal stande explicit carme de pacis comedatione quod ad laudem et memoria serenissimi principis domini regis henrici quarti sun humilis orator iohannes gower composuit electus christi pie rex henrice fuisti qui bene venisti cum propria regna petisti tu mala vicisti que bonis bona restituisti et populo tristi noua gaudia contribuisti est mihi spes lata qd adhuc per te renouata succedent fata veteri probitate beata est tibi nam grata gratia sponte data henrici quarti primus regni fuit annus quo mihi defecit bisus ad acta mea oia tepus habent finem natura ministrat quem virtute sua frangere nemo potest vltra posse nihil quauis mihi velle remansit amplius vt seribam non mihi posse manet du potui scripsi sed nuc quia curua senectus turbauit sensus scripta relinquo scolis scribat qui veniet post discretior alter ammodo nam que manus er mea penna silent hoc tamen fine verborum queso meorum prospera quod statuat regna futura deus explicit cuckow nightyngale god loue ah benedicite myghty howe great lorde make lowe hertes hye hye lowe lyke dye harde hertes maken free make within lytle stounde desycke lke hole fresh sounde hole make seke bynd vnbynden eke wo haue bounden vnbounde tel myght wyt may suffyse make wyse folke ful nyce may al wol deuyce lythy folke destroyen vyce proude hertes make agryse shortly euer wol may agaynst hym dare wyght say naye glad greue hym lyketh wol loweth syketh might shedeth euer may euery true gentle hert free hym thynketh agayne may shal haue sterynge ioye el mournyng season moche thynketh whan may byrdes synge se floures leues sprynge bryngeth remembraunce maner ease medled greuaunce lusty thoughtes full great longyng longyng cometh heuynesse therof groweth oft great sycknesse lacke desyre thus may ben hertes set fyre brennen forth gret distresse speke thys felyng trewly olde vnlusty yet haue felt sicknes may hote colde ax euery day sore ywys wote wight shaken feuers whyte al thys may slepe lyte also lyke hert shulde slepy loue firy dart wol smyte laye thys nyght wakyng thought howe louers tokenyng amonge hem comune tale good nyghtyngale rather leude cocko syng thought anone daye wolde go somwhere assay myght nyghtyngale yet none herde al yere tho thyrde nyght may anone day aspyde lenger wolde bedde abyde vnto woode fast went forth alone boldely helde way downe broke syde tyl came launde whyte grene fayre one neuer bene groud grene ypoudred wt dayfye floures greues lyke hye al grene whyte nothyng el sene sate downe among ye fayre floures saw ye byrdes trippe bowres rested hem al nyght ioyful dayes lyght began maye done houres coude seruice al rote many louely note songe loude playned maner voice yfayned al wyth ful throte proyned hem made hem ryght gay daunseden lepten spray euermore two two fere ryght chosen hem yere feuerere vpon saynct valentynes daye ryuer sat vpon made suche noyse ron accordaunt byrdes armony thought best melody myght ben yherde mon delyte wot neuer fel suche slombre swowe nat aslepe ne fully wakyng ye swowe thought herde synge sory byrde leude cuckowe tree ryght fast euyl apayde god dyed croys yeue sorowe thy leude voys full lytle ioye haue thy crye wt cuckowe thus gan chyde herde next bush besyde nyghtyngale lustely synge clere voyce made rynge grene wood wyde ah good nyghtyngale lytle hast thou ben longe hen hath ben leude cuckowe sogen songes rather hast thou pray god euyll fyre bren wol tel wondre thyng longe laye swownyng thought wyst byrdes ment sayd entet speche good knowynge herde nyghtyngale say good cuckowe go awaye let u syngen dwellen euery wyght eschueth thy songes elenge good say may aylen nowe thynketh synge wel thou songe true playne thaugh crakel vayne thou dost thy throte wot neuer howe euery wyght may vnderstand nyghtyngale may done thou hast many nyce queynt crye haue herde sayne ocy ocy might knowe shulde ah foole wost thou whan say ocy ocy ywys meane wolde wondre fayne shamefully yslayne meanen ought agayne loue amys also wolde al tho dede thynke loue lyfe lede yt woll god loue serue dare wel say worthy sterue skyll ocy ocy grede eye cuckowe queynt lawe euery wight shal loue drawe forsake al suche company myne entent dye ne neuer whyle lyue loues yoke drawe louers ben folke ben lyue moost disease haue moost vnthryue endure sorowe wo care lest f len welfare nedeth ayenst trouth stryue thou art thy mynde myght thou thy churlenesse fynde speke loues seruauntes wyse worlde none good seruyce euery wyght gentle kynde therof truly cometh goodnesse honour al gentlenesse worshyp ease al hertes lust parfyte ioye ful assured trust iolytie pleasaunce freshnesse lowlyhed largesse curtesye semelyhed trewe company drede shame done amys truly loues seruaunt lother shamed dye soth sey beleue wyll lyue dey cuckow rede thou ywys let neuer haue blysse yf euer vnto counsayle obey nyghtyngale thou spekest wondre fayre al soth contrayre loue yonge folke rage olde folke great dotage vseth shal enpayre thereof cometh disease heuynesse sorowe care many great syknesse despyte debate angre enuy deprauyng shame vntrust ielousye pryde mischefe pouertie wodnesse louyng offyce dispayre one thyng therin fayre getteth loue lytle blysse yf alway therwith ywys may ful sone age haue heyre nyghtyngale therfore holde nye leue wel al thy queynt crye yf thou farre longe fro thy make thou shalt ben forsake thou shalt hoten fye thy name god loue ne let neuer ythe yu art worse thousandfolde tha wood many one ful worthy ful good nought ne loue ybe euermore loue seruauntes amedeth yuyl tach hem defendeth maketh hem bren ryght fyre trouth worshypful desyre wha hem lyketh ioye ynough hem sendeth thou nyghtyngale sayd styll loue hath reason wyll oft tyme vntrue folke easeth trewe folke bytterly displeaseth default corage let hym spyll toke nyghtingale kepe cast sygh depe sayd ala euer bore tene say one worde ryght worde brast wepe ala hert woll breke heren thus leude byrde speke loue worshypful seruyce god loue thou helpe somwise may cuckowe ben awreke thought sterte vp anon glad agon euermore cuckowe flaye sayd farewel farewel popyngaye though scorned alone came nyghtyngale sayd frende forsoth thanke thou hast lyked rescowe one auowe loue make nowe may woll thy synger thanked ryght well apayde ye thou dismayde tho thou haue herde ye cukowe erst yf lyue shal amended next may yf afrayde one thyng wyll rede also ne leue thou cukow ne loues hath sayd stronge lesyng nay therto shal nothyng brynge loue hath moche wo ye vse medicyne euery day may thou dyne go loke vpon fresh daysye though thou wo poynt dye shal full greatly lessen thy pyne loke alwaye thou good trewe woll synge one songes newe loue loude may crye began songe full hye shrewe hem ben loue vntrewe whan songe ende farewel mote wende god loue yt ryght wel maye moche ioye sende day yet louer euer sende thus taketh ye nyghtingale leaue praye god alwaye ioye loue sende euermore shylde v fro cuckowe lore false byrde forthe flewe gentle nyghtyngale byrdes dale gate hem place fere besoughten hem wold disease thus began tale cuckowe well hyde cuckowe fast haue chyde euer sythen day lyght praye al ye ryght foule false vnkynde bride spake byrde al one assent mater asketh good auysement ben byrdes fere soth cuckowe therfore wol haue parlyment therat shal egle lorde peres ben recorde cuckowe shalbe sent shalbe yeue iugement el shal fynally make accorde shalbe without nay morow saynt valentynes day vnder maple fayre grene chambre wyndowe quene wodstocke vpon grene laye thanked hem leaue toke hauthorne broke sat songe vpon tree terme lyfe loue hath withholde loude songe awoke pexplicit leude booke wyth thy foule rudenesse syth thou hast neither beautie ne eloquence hath caused yeue hardynesse appeare ladyes presence ful syker thou knowest beneuolece ful agreable al abeying good best lyuyng ala thou ne haddest worthynesse shewe pleasaunt sentence syth hath gentylesse accepted ye seruaut digne reuerence repenteth ne science leyser al make florishinge al good best lyuyng beseche mekely lowlynesse though ferre absence thinke trouth stedfastnes abrege sorowes violence caused wherof knoweth sapience lyke amog notify lykinge good best lyuyng plenuoye avrore gladnesse daye lustynesse lucerne nyght heue ly influence illumined rote beutie goodnesse suspyres effunde scilence grace beseche alege let wrytyng good syth ye best lyuynge pexplicit scogan vnto lordes gentleman kynges house noble sonnes eke lordes dere father called vnworthely sende vnto lytyll treatyse wrytten myne hande full rudely although reuerently haue wrytten estate pray myne vncounyng taketh benignely god sake herken say coplayne sore whan remembre sodayne age vpon fall coplayne mispent inuetute impossyble ayen call certaynly coplaynt thynke haue nyce ne wolde vertues call al youth vyces aye cheryce aske mercy lorde art almyghty god maiestie besekyng make euen accorde betwyxe soule vanitie worldly lust ne blynde prosperitie haue lordshyp ouer flesh frele thou lorde rest parfyte vnitie put fro vyce kepe soule hele yeue myght whyle haue lyfe space cofyrme fully thy pleasauce shewe aboundaunce thy grace good werkes graut perseuerauce youth forget ignoraunce yeue good wyl serue ye aye queme set lyfe thyne ordinaunce able mercy thou deme lordes dere coplaint wryte loue moost enterely warne endyte tyme lost youth folyly greueth wyght bodily ghostly meane hem luste vyce entende wherfore lordes praye specially youth vertue shapeth dyspende plante rote youthe wyse vertue growynge alway loke alwaye goodnesse exercyse shall myghty make eche assay fende wythstande eche affray passeth wysely thys peryllous pylgrymage thynke thys worde werke euery day shall yeue parfyte floured age taketh also hede howe yt noble clerkes wrytten bokes great sapience sayeng ye fayth deed wythouten werkes ryght estate wyth negligence vertue therfore wyth diligence shapeth vertue plante rote ye therof haue full experience worshyp lyfe soules bote taketh also hede lordshyp ne estate wythout vertue may longe endure thynketh eke howe vyces vertue debate haue ben shall whyle worlde may dure euer vycious auenture ouerthrowe thynketh euermore god lorde al vertue fygure goodnesse therfore folowe lore mayster chaucer god hys soule saue hys langage curious sayd ye father whych deed graue byqueth nothynge hys vertue wt house vnto hys chyldren therfore laborouse ought ye besekynge god grace yeue myght vertuous whych ye might haue parte place may se vertuous noblesse cometh way auncestrye cometh leful besynesse honest lyfe slogardrie wherfore youth rede ye edifye house vertue suche manere age may kepe gye fro tempest worldes wawes thynketh howe betwyxe vertue estate parfyte blessed mariage vertue cause peace vyce debate man soule full corage cherysheth vertue vyces outrage driueth away let hem haue woning soules leseth heritage god hath yeue vertuous lyuyng taketh hede also men pore degree vertue haue set great honour euer haue lyued great prosperitie cheryshyng vertuous labour thynketh also many gouernour called estate hath set full lowe misvsyng ryght errour therfore cousel vertue knowe thus aucestres ye may nothig claim yt master chaucer sayth expresse teporal thig yt men may hurt maym god stocke vertues noblesse syth lorde blyssednesse made v al v deyde foloweth hym vertue full besynesse thing herk master seyd fyrst stocke father gentylnesse man claymeth gentle must folow trace al wyttes dres vertue loke vyces flye vnto vertue longeth dignitie reuers safely dare deme weare mytre crowne dyademe fyrst stocke full ryghtwysnesse true worde sobre pytous free clene ghost loued besynesse ayenst vyce slouth honestie heyre loue vertue dyd gentle though ryche seme al weare mytre crowne dyademe vyce may heyre olde rychesse may man al men may se byqueth heyre vertuous noblesse appropred vnto degree fyrst father maiestie maketh heyres hem yt ca hi que e al weare mytre crowne dyademe lo noble poete bretayne lyghtly vertuous sentence losse youth vertue coplayne therfore pray diligece profyte god reuerence tempreth fully vertue mynde wha ye come iuges presence ye vertulesse behynde many lordes haue maner adayes though one shewe hem vertuous matere feruent youth false alayes arte haue ioy shyp without stere dryueth vp downe without gouernauce wenyng calme wolde laste yere yere ryght fare ygnoraunce shame knowe reason yt ebbe cometh floud ful rage ye wyse wha youth passeth seso cometh croked vnweldy palled age sone comen ye kalendes dotage yt youth haue vertue prouided men wol say fye vassalage thus hath slouth fro worshyp hem deuyded boetius clerke men may rede se sayth boke consolation man desyreth vyne tree plenteous frute reapyng season must euer eschue oppressyon vnto rote whyle yonge grene thus may ye se wel inclusyon youth vertulesse doth moche tene seeth ayenst howe vertuous noblesse roted youth wt good perseuerauce dryueth away al vyces wretchednesse slogardrye ryote distaunce seeth eke vertue causeth su saunce seeth eke vertue voydeth al vyse hath vertu hath al abudaunce wele ferre reason deuyse taketh hede tullius hostylius fro pouerte came hygh degree vertue redeth eke iulius conquerour howe poore man yet vertue humilitie many countrie gouernaunce thus vertue bringeth man great degre eche wyght lust entedaunce rede ayenst nero vertulees taketh hede also proude baithasare hated vertue equyte pee loke howe antyochus fyl fro chare skyn bone al tare loke mischauce vice wol signes beware dare wel say infortunate nyce ca nowe say herby may ye se nowe vertue causeth perfyte sykernesse vice exilen al prosperite best eche man chose gesse doth lyst excuse expresse wolde ryght sory yf ye mischefe god confirme vertuous noblesse negligence ye lese pexplicit somtyme worlde stedfast stable mannes worde obligation nowe false disceyuable worde dede conclusion nothyng lyke turned vp downe al worlde mede fykelnesse al lost lacke stedfastnesse maketh worlde variable lust men haue discention amonge v man holde vnable yf collusion neighbour wronge oppression causeth wylful wretchednesse al lost lacke stedfastnesse trouth put downe reason holde fable vertue hath nowe domination pite exiled man merciable couetyse blente discretion worlde hath made permutation fro ryght wrong fro trouth fykelnesse al lost lacke stedastnesse plenuoye prince desyre honourable cherysh thy folke hate extorcion suffre nothyng may reprouable thyne estate done thy region shewe forth yerde castigation drede god law loue trouth worthines wedde thy folke ayen stedfastnesse pexplicit pgood counsayle chaucer flye ye fro prease dwell wyth sothfastnesse suffice vnto thy good yf smal horde hathe hate clymbynge tykelnesse prease hath enuye wele blent ouer al sauour behoue shall rede wel thy selfe folke shal rede trouth shal delyuer drede payne eche croked redresse trust turneth balle great rest stondeth lytle besynesse beware also spurne agayne nalle stryue doth crocke wyth walle deme thy selfe demest others dede trouth shal delyuer drede sent receyue buxomnesse wrastlyng worlde asketh fal home wyldernesse forth pylgrym forth beest thy stal loke vpon heygh thanke god al weyue thy lust let thy goost lede trouth shal delyuer drede pexplicit pbalade vyllage wythout payntynge pplayntyfe fortune thys wretched worldes transmutation wele wo pore nowe honour wythout order dew discretion gouerned fortune errour nathlesse lacke fauour ne may singe though dye iay tout pardu mon temp et labour finally fortune defye yet lefte syght reasoun knowe frende fro foe thy myrrour much hath yet thy turnyng vp doun taught knowen hour trewly force thy reddour hym ouer hym selfe hath maystry suffisaunce shalbe socour finally fortune defye socrates thou stedfast champion myght neuer thy turmentour thou neuer dreddest opression ne chere founde thou fauour thou knewe disceyte colour moost worshyp lye knowe eke false dissimulour finally fortune defye pthe answere fortune man wretched hym selfe wene hath hym selfe hath suffisaunce sayst thou kene hast thy selfe gouernaunce say thus graut mercy thyne abundaunce thou hast lent yu shalt striue wost yu yet howe wyl auaunce eke thou hast thy best frende lyue haue taught diuisyon betwene frende effecte frende coutenaunce nedeth nat galle hyne cureth eyen derke penaunce nowe seest thou clere yt ignoraunce yet holt thyne anker yet thou maist ariue bounte bereth key substauce eke thou hast thy best frende alyue howe many haue refused sustene syth haue fostred thy pleasaunce wolt thou make statute thy quene shalbe aye thyne ordynaunce thou borne arte reigne varyaunce aboute ye whele must thou dryue lore bette tha thy greuauce eke thou hast thy best frende lyue pthe answere fortune thy lore dampne aduersite frende mayst yu reue blynd goddesse thy frendes knowe thanke take hem agayne let hem go lye presse nygardes kepyng rychesse prouostyke thou wolt toure assayle wicke appetyte cometh aye syckenesse general thys rule may fayle pfortune thou pynchest mutabilyte lent droppe rychesse nowe lyketh wythdrawe shuldest thou royalte oppresse see may ebbe flowe lesse welke hath mixt shyne rayne hayle ryght must kyth brotylnesse general thys rule may fayle pthe playntyfe lo execution maieste al purueyeth hys ryghtwysenesse thyng fortune clepen ye ye blynde beestes ful leudnesse heuen hath properte sykernesse thys worlde hath euer restlesse trauayle laste day ende myne entresse general thys rule may fayle pthenuoye fortune prince pray gentylnesse let thys man thus crye playne shal quyte thys besynesse yf ye lyst releue hym hys payne pray ye hys best frende noblesse better estate maye attayne plenuoye broken ben statute hye heuen create eternally tendure syth yt se bryght goddes seuen mowe wepe waile passion endure maye earth mortal creature ala fro whence may thys thynge procede errour dye almost drede worde eterne whilom shape fro fyfth cercle manere ne myght teares downe escape nowe wepeth venus sphere wyth teares wol drench v ala skogan thys thyne offence thou causest thys deluge pestilence hast yu sayd blaspheme goddis pride thy gret rekilnesse thinges ye lawe loue forbode thy lady sawe thy distresse therfore thou yaue vp myghelinesse ala skogon olde folke ne yonge neuer erst skoga blamed tong thou drewe scorne cupide eke recorde thilke rebel worde thou hast spoken wol lenger thy lorde skogan though hys bow broke wol wyth arowes ben ywroken ne ne none figure shal haue neyther hurte ne cure certes frend drede thine vnhappe lest thy gylt wretche loue procede al hem yt bene hore rounde shappe bene lykely folke spede shal labour haue mede wel wotte thou wolte answere say lo olde grysel lyst renne play nay skogan say excuse god helpe ryme doutles ne thynke neuer slepe wake muse rusteth sheth styl pee whyle yong put forth prees al shal passe men prose ryme take euery man tourne tyme skogan thou knelest stremes heed grace al honour worthynesse thende whych dul deed forgoten solatary wyldernesse yet skogan thinke tullius kindenesse mynde thy frende may fructify farewel loke thou neuer efte loue defye pexplicit go forthe kynge rule sapience byshoppe able ministre doctrine lorde trewe counsayle yeue audience womanheade chastyte euer enclyne knyght let thy dedes worshyp determyne ryghtous iuge sauyng thy name rych almesse lest thou lese blysse wt shame people obey kyng lawe age thou ruled good reugion trew seruaut dredeful kepe ye vnder awe thou poor fye presumption inobedience youth vtter destruction remembre howe god hath set lo parte ye ordayned pchaucer vnto hys empty purse purse none wight complayne ye lady dere sory nowe ye lyght certes ye nowe make heuy chere lefe layde vpon bere vnto mercy thus crye heuy agayne el mote dye nowe vouchsafe thys daye nygt blysful sowne may se colour lyke sunne bryght yelownesse neuer pere ye lyfe ye hertes stere quene comforte good company heuy agayne el mote dye nowe purse arte lyues lyght sauiour downe thys worlde thys towne helpe myght syth ye wol treasourere shaue nygh frere pray vnto curtesye heuy agayne el mote dye pexplicit pchaucer vnto kynge conquerour brute albyon whych lyne free election bene kynge thys sende ye maye al harmes amende haue mynde vpon supplycation pexplicit consyder wel euery circustaunce estate euer thou rych stronge myghtye puissaunce prudent wyse discrete besy dome folke soth thou maye flye euer thou dost trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thy porte thyne apparayle thou cladde honestly seyne anone people malice wol fayle wythout aduyce reason sayne thyn array made wrouyt vaine suffre hem speke trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thou wolde kynges equiuolent wyth great lordes euyn peregal yf thou torne al rent wol say iangle ouer al thou art slogarde yt neuer thriue shal yet suffre hem speke trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys befal thou take wyfe wol falsly say theyr entent thou art lykely euer lyue stryfe voyde al rest wythout alegement wyues hem maystren thys iugemet yet suffren theyr speche trust well thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thou fayre excellent beaute yet wol say thou arte amerous thou foule vglye se woll affirme thou art vicious people langage dispytous suffre al theyr speche trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thou parfyrenesse haue auowed lyue chastite wol folke thy person expresse thou art impotet tengedre thy degre thus whether thou chast delauie suffre hem speke truste wel thys wycked tonge wol alwaye say amys thou fatte corpulent woll say thou art gloton denouret el vynolent thou megre leane fashyon cal nygarde theyr opinyon yet suffre speke truste wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thou ryche wol yeue laude saye cometh prudent gouernaunce wol say cometh fraude sleyght false cheuysaunce say worst folke haue gret plesauce suffre hem say trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys thou sadde sobre countenaunce men wol say thou thynkest treason yf thou glad dalyaunce men wol deme dissolution callyng fayre speche adulation yet let hem speke trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys holy perfection men malyce wol cal hym ypocrite mery clene entencion say ryot doth delyte mourne black lauye clothes white suffre hem say trust wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys speketh much holden prudent debateth saye hardy yt sayth lytle wyth great sentemet men yet wol wyte hym foly trouth put downe nowe goth flattery yt lyst playnly know ye trouth thys wycked tong yt alway sayth amys though man pacient dauid thorowe humilitie salomon wisdome prudent knyghthode egal iosue manly proued iudas machabe yet al trust ryght wel thys wycked tonge wol alway say amys though hygh prowesse worthy hector troyes champion loue troylus kyndnesse cesar famous hygh renoun wyth al alysaunders domination yet al trust ryght wel thys wycked tonge hym wol say amys though man hyghe lowe degre tullius sugred eloquence seneca great moralite caton oresyght prouidence coquest charles artures magnificece yet al trust ryght well thys wycked tonge wol say hym amys wysely trouth penelope though possession holynesse beautie kyndenesse medee lyfe vnfeyned mertia caton alcest trewe affection yet dare say trust ryght well thys wycked tonge wol say amys sythen man may eschewe swerde tonge kerue byte ful harde man remewe theyr daunger aquyte wo tonges hem delyte hynder sclaunder set theyr studye thys theyr pleasaunce say amys moost noble prince cheryshers vertue remembreth hygh discrecyon fyrst vertue pleasyng iesu wrytyng sentence caton good tonge hys opinyon chastyse reuerse wysdome thys withdraw hering fro al ye amys pet sic est finis pthus endeth workes geffray chaucer prynted london yere lorde p epitaphtu galfridi chaucer per poet lauriatum stephanum surigonum mediolanensem decretis licentiatum pyerides muse si possint numen fletus fundere diuinas que riga genas galfridi vatis chaucer crudelia fata plagite sit lachrymis abstinuisse nephas vos coluit viues vos celebrate sepul u reddatur merito gratia digna viro grade decus vobis e docti musa maronis qua didicit melius lingua latma loqui grade nouu que dec chaucer fama que anit hen quantu fuerat prisca britanna rudis reddidit insigne maternis uersibus aurea splendescat ferrea facta prius huc latuisse viru nil si tot opuscula vertes direris egregiis que decorata modis socratis ingenium vel fotes philosophie quicquid et archani dogma sacrum et quascu que velis tenuit dignissimus hic vates paruo conditus hoe tumulo ah laudis quam tu preclara britannia perdis dum rapuit tantum mors odiola vi crudeles parce crudelia ila sorores non tamen extineta co lama p viuet meternum viuent dum scripta po viuant eterno rot monumenta die si qua bonos tagit pieta si carmie dign carmia qui cecinit tot cumulata mo hec sibi marmoreo scribat verba sepul h hec maneat laudis sarcina summa galfridus chaucer vates et fama poe materne hac sacrum sum tumulat hum ppost obitum caxton voluit te viuere cura willelmi chaucer clare poeta tui nam tua solu copressit opuscula formis quo que sed laudes iussit hic esse tuas
